abstract: Startup unveils self-driving race car with 320kmph top speed
article: Britain-based race series for driverless electric cars Roborace has unveiled its first self-driving race car 'Robocar' which has a top speed of 320 kmph. The Robocar is bigger than a standard Formula 1 car and measures 4.5 metres long and 2 metres wide. It has two radars, five LiDARs, 18 ultrasonic sensors, two optical speed sensors and six AI-driven cameras.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SIDBI sanctions to startups crosses ₹1,112 crore this fiscal
article: The SIDBI has sanctioned ₹300 crore to fund managers for investing in startups, taking the total sanctions this fiscal to over ₹1,112 crore. During fiscal years 2014-15 and 2015-16, sanctions made were ₹314 crore and ₹607 crore respectively. In 2016, the Cabinet approved setting up of a ‘Fund of Funds for Startups’ with a corpus of ₹10,000 crore at SIDBI.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: What is the technology over which Google has sued Uber?
article: Google spinoff Waymo has sued Uber for stealing its 'LiDAR' technology used by self-driving cars. LiDAR is a radar-like system that uses rotating lasers instead of radio waves to build 3D images of the surrounding landscape. Waymo claims it discovered the theft after it received an email from LiDAR components supplier meant for Uber with similar circuit board designs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal's employee cost more than doubled to ₹911cr in 2016
article: Snapdeal, which is firing 600 employees, saw its employee expenses more than double to ₹911 crore in 2015-16 from ₹367 crore the year before. Earlier reports suggested Snapdeal wants its monthly salary bill to fall to around ₹20 crore. In the wake of layoffs, Snapdeal founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal are taking a 100% pay cut.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup Citrus Pay's peon earned ₹50 lakh after acquisition
article: Shyam Kumar, a peon who joined Mumbai-based payment gateway startup Citrus Pay in 2010 for ₹8,000 a month, earned around ₹50 lakh after Citrus Pay was acquired for ₹860 crore in 2016 by rival PayU. Kumar was awarded ESOPs which were valued at around ₹50 lakh. Fifteen other Citrus Pay employees became crorepatis with the acquisition of the startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: India can have Hyperloop in 38 months, says Co-founder
article: Hyperloop Transportation Technologies' Co-founder Bibop Gresta has said India can have a hyperloop in 38 months if the government is serious. "We're ready with the technology and we can bring money. We just need land and a commitment from the government," he added. Hyperloop refers to a technology which transports people in pods at high speeds along specially built tubes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Homestay startup Stayzilla shuts; Founder admits failure
article: Chennai-based homestay startup Stayzilla announced its shutdown on Thursday after 11 years of operation. Admitting to the failure, Co-founder Yogendra Vasupal said, "We could not even recoup what we put in" and added, "We're looking to reboot it with a different business model". Founded in 2005, Stayzilla raised over $35 million from investors including Nexus and Matrix partners.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Freedom 251 maker's Director Mohit Goel detained for fraud
article: Mohit Goel, Director of Noida-based Ringing Bells, which claimed to make world's cheapest smartphone Freedom 251, was detained on Thursday over allegations of fraud. Goel was detained after Freedom 251 distributor Ayam Enterprises filed an FIR alleging it had been "defrauded" of ₹16 lakh. In December 2016, Ringing Bells officials were summoned in a cheque bounce case worth ₹2 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm, Blume Ventures offer jobs to fired Snapdeal employees
article: Many startups and VC firms including Paytm, Blume Ventures and EVC ventures have offered recently fired Snapdeal employees to join their ventures. "To all ex-Snapdeal employees - Blume portfolio is hiring (as always)," tweeted Arpit Agarwal, a Principal at Blume Ventures. While Snapdeal has confirmed layoffs of 600 employees, its founders have announced to take a 100% pay cut.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google's self-driving car firm sues Uber
article: Google parent Alphabet's self-driving car developing company Waymo on Friday sued Uber and its self-driving truck company Otto for theft of technology. It claims that Otto head Anthony Levandowski, a former Waymo employee, downloaded over 14,000 confidential and proprietary design files before he quit Waymo. He wiped and reformatted the company laptop to erase forensic fingerprints, Waymo added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber employees anonymously talking about sexism on an app
article: The employees of ride-hailing app Uber are anonymously talking about sexism and sexual harassment allegations against their company on an app called Blind, that lets verified employees chat anonymously. One of the Uber employees even claimed that 118 employees have resigned or serving notice period since allegations. Uber is currently investigating the allegations levelled by a former employee.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: People are seeking intimate info about me: Ex-Uber engineer
article: Former Uber engineer Susan Fowler, who published a blog post claiming sexual harassment while at Uber, on Friday tweeted that someone was contacting people known to her to get "personal and intimate" information to run a "smear campaign" against her. However, an Uber spokesperson said, "This behaviour is wrong and Uber is absolutely not involved in it."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: I'll get at the people who are making Uber a bad place: CEO
article: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick in a meeting with over 100 of the startup's female engineers said, "I want to get at the people who are making this place a bad place." Uber is investigating claims of sexism and sexual harassment at the startup. "We have the data...we have it happening in our own backyard," said an employee at the meeting.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber responds to sexism allegations on account deletion
article: Uber, which is facing backlash over sexism and sexual harassment allegations by a former female employee, has started showing its response on the account deletion page within Uber's app. "What the ex-employee describes is abhorrent and against everything Uber stands for and believes in," the response says. This comes after users started deleting their Uber accounts and tweeted #deleteUber.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla, Ford only US car startups that aren't bankrupt: Musk
article: In an email to employees, electric carmaker Tesla's CEO Elon Musk said, "We should never forget the history of car startups originating in the United States: dozens have gone bankrupt and only two, Tesla and Ford, have not." Addressing claims of poor compensation and safety conditions at Tesla, Musk added, "The forces arrayed against us are many and incredibly powerful."

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Who's the man accused of stealing Alphabet secrets for Uber?
article: Former Google engineer Anthony Levandowski has been accused in Google parent Alphabet's lawsuit against Uber for theft of technology. Alphabet's self-driving car firm Waymo has claimed Levandowski took incredibly valuable intellectual property from Alphabet before he quit the firm. Levandowski quit in 2016 to start a new self-driving startup called Otto Trucking, which was bought by Uber.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Google's suit baseless attempt to slow down competitor: Uber
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber has called allegations by Google spinoff Waymo that Uber stole its self-driving car technology a "baseless attempt to slow down a competitor". Waymo's lawsuit claims that a former Google engineer stole 14,000 confidential documents, which he used to build cars for Uber's autonomous truck subsidiary Otto. Waymo is seeking the return of the allegedly stolen materials.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: E-sellers claim ₹300 cr at risk over Snapdeal's unpaid dues
article: The All India Online Vendor Association has claimed that it is facing a risk of losing ₹200 crore to ₹300 crore as e-commerce startup Snapdeal "may not make payments which were collected by them in the past month." The association has reportedly complained to Commerce Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, asking her to help safeguard the money.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bengaluru-based logistics startup BlackBuck raises ₹200 cr
article: Bengaluru-based online logistics startup BlackBuck has raised ₹200 crore ($30 million) in Series C funding round from a clutch of new and existing investors. US-based venture capital firm Sands Capital and World Bank arm International Finance Corporation have committed about $10 million each. Existing investors Accel Partners and Flipkart, and angel investor ITC also participated in the round.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Business supplies startup Tolexo to fire 300 employees
article: Noida-based business goods and supplies startup Tolexo is reportedly firing 85% of its workforce affecting nearly 300 employees. The move is part of the company’s plans to wind up its online business to launch a completely new offline initiative. An online retail platform for IndiaMART, Tolexo's losses widened to ₹72.9 crore in 2016 from ₹12.9 crore a year earlier.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra to foray into offline retail with Mango brand stores
article: Flipkart-owned Myntra has partnered with Spanish fashion brand Mango to foray into offline retail and manage up to 30 Mango stores in India over the next five years. Myntra is also planning to launch an offline store for its private fashion label Roadster. Earlier, Myntra tried buying Forever 21 in India, which was later bought by the Aditya Birla Group.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Job cuts at Snapdeal could rise up to 2,500: Report
article: After Snapdeal confirmed firing of 600 employees two days ago, reports claim that the job cuts at Snapdeal might touch 2,500. Snapdeal wants its monthly salary bill to fall from ₹48 crore to ₹20 crore, reports added. Notably, Snapdeal Founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal have announced to take a 100% pay cut following the job cuts.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber drivers pelt stones at Bengaluru office during strike
article: Ride-hailing app Uber's drivers on Wednesday pelted stones at the company's Bengaluru office and broke its windows during a strike demanding larger incentives. Uber had to evacuate its employees and deploy additional security at its office. Uber and Ola drivers across the country have been protesting the decreased incentives which they claim has hurt their incomes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber action on sexism frustrating: Investors in open letter
article: Two Uber investors have written an open letter calling the ride-hailing startup's response to sexual harassment and sexism allegations at workplace "disappointing and frustrating". They said, "We're disappointed to see that Uber has selected a team of insiders to investigate its destructive culture". They added, "This is another example of Uber’s unwillingness to be open, transparent, and direct".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MobiKwik to invest ₹300 cr for its business growth this year
article: MobiKwik on Thursday announced that it will be investing ₹300 crore in its business this year to increase its merchant and user base. Nearly ₹50 crore will be invested to set up 13 offices and hire over 1,000 employees. MobiKwik was founded in 2009 by husband-wife duo Bipin Preet Singh and Upasana Taku.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Australia to launch 1st-ever digital market for solar energy
article: A group of energy tech startups in cooperation with electricity providers in Australia has launched a pilot program of the world's first digital marketplace for rooftop solar energy. The Decentralised Energy Exchange (deX) will let homeowners monetise their solar panels and batteries by "essentially renting them to the grid when they're most needed," said deX partner startup GreenSync's CEO.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: International Space Station captures SpaceX's Dragon craft
article: International Space Station on Thursday successfully captured SpaceX's Dragon cargo spacecraft that was launched from NASA's Kennedy Space Center on Sunday. Dragon is expected to be unpacked in around four weeks, after which it will be sent on a five and a half hour return mission to Earth. The original docking attempt was aborted on Wednesday after a navigational error.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla announces plan to build 3 new Gigafactories
article: Elon Musk-led electric carmaker Tesla has announced plans to build three more 'Gigafactories' in addition to the ones being built in Nevada and New York. The upcoming 6 million-square-foot Gigafactory in Nevada is touted to be the world's biggest building by footprint. The lithium-ion battery factory will reportedly also have the world's largest rooftop solar array once it is operational.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal to fire 600 employees; Founders take 100% pay cut
article: Homegrown e-commerce major Snapdeal on Wednesday said it is laying off up to 600 employees in the next few days across levels. The layoffs will affect employees at Snapdeal's e-commerce unit, logistics subsidiary Vulcan Express and Snapdeal-owned recharge platform FreeCharge. Furthermore, Snapdeal founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal have pledged not to take any salary for an unspecified period.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Another female Founder accuses Mahesh Murthy of misconduct
article: Chennai-based startup FrshDay.in's Founder Wamika Iyer, has accused investor and Seedfund Co-founder Mahesh Murthy of misconduct and shared screenshots of a conversation between them. Iyer claims that media houses did not help her "expose" Murthy earlier as he is a powerful man. This comes a few days after Vayuz Co-founder Pooja Chauhan accused Murthy of similar misconduct.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: No doubt we made errors in our execution: Snapdeal Founders
article: The Snapdeal Founders have written an email to employees explaining the layoffs of around 600 people. "Did we make errors in our execution? No doubt about that. Over the last 2-3 years, with all the capital coming..., our entire industry, including ourselves, started making mistakes." "All of us starting with myself and Rohit, are to blame for it," it added.

author: Ankush Verma
abstract: Hater app projects image of pregnant Trump with Putin in US
article: An image of a pregnant US President Donald Trump being hugged by Russian President Vladimir Putin from behind was projected on buildings in New York along with #LoveThroughHate. The image was a part of an ad campaign by the dating app Hater. "We're just trying to make people laugh. Through humour, hate can turn into love," the app's representatives said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart in talks to raise $1.5 billion from eBay, Microsoft
article: Flipkart is reportedly in talks to raise up to $1.5 billion from investors including Microsoft, eBay, PayPal and Tencent Holdings at a valuation of $10-12 billion. It has increased the size of its funding round under the new CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy, who has earlier worked at eBay for nearly seven years. Flipkart last raised $700 million at $15 billion valuation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: FreeCharge CEO Govind Rajan quits within 9 months of joining
article: Snapdeal-owned online recharge platform FreeCharge's CEO Govind Rajan has resigned from the company within nine months of his appointment. Snapdeal's newly appointed Chief Strategy and Investment Officer Jason Kothari will be overseeing the business operations of FreeCharge. The past three months have seen a number of high-level exits at Snapdeal.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ola, Uber drivers go on indefinite strike in Bengaluru
article: Over one lakh drivers of Uber and Ola on Wednesday started an indefinite strike in Bengaluru to demand better incentives. Uber, TaxiForSure and Ola Drivers and Owners Association President Tanveer Pasha said the drivers are paid ₹4-₹5 per km, while rates for AC and non-AC taxis are ₹19.50 and ₹14.50 per km respectively according to Karnataka's cab aggregation rules.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mahesh Murthy writes 'The Confessions of a Serial Offender'
article: Investor Mahesh Murthy has published a post titled "The confessions of a serial offender," clarifying recent accusations of misconduct against him by female founders. Murthy refutes each claim made by Vayuz Co-founder Pooja Chauhan, FrshDay.in Founder Wamika Iyer, and A2Zee employee Supriya Sahoo. Murthy also claims that he was blackmailed by a lawyer named Seema.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Is this the beginning of startup tragedy? Tweets user
article: Reacting to Snapdeal firing 600 employees and its founders taking a 100% pay cut, a user tweeted, "#Snapdeal is this the beginning of Startup Tragedy?" Another user tweeted, "Commiserations to all the people being laid off from Snapdeal - sad how the folks paying the price are not the ones who made the bad calls". "#Snapdeal snapped," tweeted a user.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart to slash Bengaluru office size by half to cut costs
article: Flipkart is reportedly negotiating a deal to reduce the space occupied by its Bengaluru office to about half its current size to cut costs. The company, which had agreed to lease two million square feet in 2015, will reportedly lease only about 9,00,000 square feet now. Flipkart's valuation was marked down to $5.5 billion by Fidelity Investments in January.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SpaceX's Dragon spacecraft aborts NASA cargo delivery to ISS
article: Elon Musk-led space exploration startup SpaceX's Dragon spacecraft on Wednesday aborted its planned rendezvous with the International Space Station to deliver nearly 2,500 kg of cargo to NASA astronauts. Dragon's onboard computers triggered the abort after recognising an incorrect value in GPS data about the station's location when it was only 1,200 metres away from the ISS.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: I'll hold Uber leadership's feet to fire on this: Huffington
article: Uber board member and Huffington Post Co-founder Arianna Huffington has issued a statement saying that she'll "hold the leadership team's feet to the fire" over recent claims of sexual harassment at the startup. Earlier, Uber CEO Travis Kalanick launched an urgent investigation into the matter and tweeted, "Anyone who behaves this way or thinks this is OK will be fired."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We've gone through near-death experiences: Nutanix Founder
article: Dheeraj Pandey, the Co-founder and CEO of seven-year-old cloud computing firm Nutanix, has said that his company has gone through near-death experiences two or three times along the way. Founded in Silicon Valley, Nutanix went for IPO in September last year and hit a $5 billion valuation. "Infrastructure computing is half a trillion-dollar market...We've barely scratched the surface," he added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: US company sells beer with image of Lord Ganesha
article: Delhi police has received complaints against US online retailer Lost Coast selling beer with images of Lord Ganesha, a week after officials asked a Czech Republic brewery to remove similar images from its products. The police has also received complaints against US-based apparel maker Yes We Vibe for selling shoes with the Om symbol on them.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber CEO makes two factual errors in a memo to employees
article: After a former female employee accused Uber of sexism and sexual harassment at workplace, CEO Travis Kalanick wrote a memo to employees which had two factual errors. While discussing percentage of female engineers at companies, Kalanick wrote Twitter and Google have 10% and 18% women employees respectively. However, Twitter and Google have 15% and 19% female employees in technical roles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber appoints ex-US Attorney General to check sexism claim
article: After a former female employee accused Uber of sexism and sexual harassment at workplace by a manager, CEO Travis Kalanick appointed former US Attorney General Eric Holder to investigate the charges. Uber board member Arianna Huffington and HR head Liane Hornsey are also a part of the investigating team. Uber is holding one-on-one sessions with its staff on the issue.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fitbit reveals it paid ₹154 cr to buy wearables maker Pebble
article: American wearables maker Fitbit has revealed that it paid nearly ₹154 crore to buy smaller rival Pebble last year. The amount is only a few crores higher than Pebble's ₹135 crore raised in 2015 through a crowdfunding campaign. Recently, Fitbit announced to cut 6% of its staff affecting 100 employees after disappointing fourth-quarter earnings.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Yepme to let go of 90% staff amid cash crunch: Report
article: Gurugram-based online shopping startup Yepme has reportedly asked about 90% of its staff to resign because of cash crunch without issuing any formal communication. However, Yepme employees are reportedly demanding that the HR department lay them off so that they are eligible for a severance package. Yepme, which has close to 170 employees, has also been accused of delaying salaries.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: This is disgusting & appalling, says Uber employee on sexism
article: Reacting to a former female Uber engineer's post on sexism and sexual harassment at workplace, a current female engineer at Uber has published a blog saying, "I think this is disgusting and appalling and horrifying and yet I am not surprised at all". "This incident is not isolated to Uber...Sexism is a problem everywhere," she wrote.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: South Korean startup to start shipping Braille smartwatch
article: South Korean startup Dot will start shipping its assistive Braille smartwatch for the blind next month, nearly three years after it was first announced. The round face of the Dot watch has four cells of six balls each to display text messages and social media notifications. Users can take action through the two side buttons on the watch.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla CFO quits months before new car Model 3's launch
article: Tesla's Chief Financial Officer Jason Wheeler has quit the company months before the electric vehicle maker is set to launch its new car 'Model 3'. Tesla's former CFO, Deepak Ahuja, will return to the company next month to replace Wheeler. Set to launch in July, Model 3 will be the cheapest car launched by Tesla to date.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Apple buys Israel firm amid reports of iPhone 8 face scanner
article: Technology major Apple has reportedly acquired Israel-based facial recognition startup RealFace for "several million dollars". This comes after reports suggested that the upcoming iPhone 8 will have a front-facing 3D laser scanner for facial or iris recognition. The latest model of Apple's flagship handset will also reportedly have wireless charging and an OLED screen.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes machine to offer rewards for recycling waste
article: Delhi-based startup 'We-Convert' has made a 'vending machine' that lets users recycle plastic bottles, aluminium cans and glass scraps in exchange for rewards like shopping vouchers. "The machine recognises scrap and segregates it into a dedicated cavity. After that, the machine generates a five-digit code that can be redeemed against vouchers," explained We-Convert Co-founder Ashutosh Srivastava.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rapper Jay Z to launch VC fund to invest in startups
article: Singer Beyoncé's husband and American rapper Jay Z is launching his own venture capital firm with long-time partner Jay Brown to provide seed funding to young startups. Besides rapping, Jay Z has been an active investor and invested in many startups including Uber, private jet startup JetSmarter and cosmetics startup Julep.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla's stock surges by 48% in 3 months to rival Ford, GM
article: According to a Bloomberg report, electric car maker Tesla's stock has surged by 48% in the past three months, despite analysts considering it overvalued. The Elon Musk-led startup has become one of America's 'Big Three' automobile companies in terms of market value, joining General Motors and Ford. Tesla delivered around 80,000 cars in 2016.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Pharmacy startup Reap gets funding from FreeCharge Founders
article: B2B pharmacy startup Reap has raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding from FreeCharge Founders Kunal Shah and Sandeep Tandon, Chaayos CEO Nitin Saluja and ThinkLabs Founder Gagan Goyal. Reap was founded by IIT Bombay alumnus Siddharth Gadia and works on supply-chain management problems in the pharmacy industry.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: eBay India's Product Development head quits: Report
article: eBay India's General Manager of Product Development Centre Ramkumar Narayanan has reportedly resigned from the e-commerce company after four years at the position. Before joining eBay, Ramkumar Narayanan was the Vice President of Global Product Management at Yahoo, and has also worked with Microsoft. eBay India reported an increase of about 50% in losses for FY16 to ₹262 crore.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SpaceX successfully launches Dragon spacecraft for NASA
article: Elon Musk-led space exploration startup SpaceX on Sunday successfully launched its Dragon spacecraft which will deliver nearly 2,500 kg of cargo to International Space Station for NASA. Dragon spacecraft is also carrying strains of the MRSA superbug to study its behaviour in microgravity. The launch was conducted from the same pad used for NASA's first manned mission to the moon.

author: Sultan Mirza
abstract: Govt to set up 7 Research parks at IITs, IISc for startups
article: The government is planning to set up 7 Research parks at IITs, IISc for startups to propel innovation. IIT Kharagpur already has a functional Park and the remaining will be created by Ministry of Human Resource Development at IIT Guwahati, IIT Hyderabad, IIT Kanpur, IIT Delhi and IISc Bangalore. IIT Gandhinagar’s Research park is being set up by DST.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SpaceX aborts rocket launch 10 sec before planned liftoff
article: Elon Musk's startup SpaceX on Saturday aborted the launch of its Falcon 9 rocket 10 seconds before the scheduled liftoff due to odd movement of the rocket's engine steering. The launch has been rescheduled for today. The launch, aimed at sending supplies to NASA's International Space Station, is taking place from the same launch pad used for first Moon mission.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ex-Uber engineer reveals sexism, sexual harassment at work
article: Former Uber engineer Susan Fowler has published a blog claiming sexism and sexual harassment at workplace and called her stint at Uber a "strange, fascinating, and horrifying story". Fowler said on her first day at work, her manager sent a string of messages and sought sex from her. Uber CEO Travis Kalanick has ordered an investigation into the matter.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup builds hovering bike for ₹1 crore
article: Russian startup Hoversurf has built the 'Hoverbike Scorpion-3', a ₹1 crore manned hovering bike that can go up to 33 feet high in the air and hit speeds of 48 kmph. The electric bike can remain airborne for up to 27 minutes on a single charge. The bike's creators claim that the bike can be driven without any prior experience.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Anyone who behaves this way will be fired, says Uber CEO
article: Reacting to former Uber engineer Susan Fowler's blog claiming sexism and sexual harassment at the workplace by a manager, Uber CEO Travis Kalanick tweeted, "Anyone who behaves this way or thinks this is OK will be fired". Kalanick, who launched an urgent investigation into the matter, said, "There can be absolutely no place for this kind of behavior at Uber".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: India has amazing entrepreneurial energy, says Microsoft CEO
article: Microsoft's India-born CEO Satya Nadella on Monday at an event in Bengaluru said that India has an amazing entrepreneurial energy. Nadella also said that he is excited about the potential of Artificial Intelligence as it will aid innovative startups in health and education. This is the first time Nadella has visited Bengaluru after being named Microsoft's CEO.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat planning to launch an Android smartphone: Report
article: Photo-sharing mobile app Snapchat is reportedly planning to launch an Android smartphone focused on new camera features. The startup has reportedly built a smartphone prototype with a 360° camera and buttons that let users scroll through filters, and a one-touch capture function for easy sharing. It might also include a lock screen allowing users to access Snapchat notifications and updates.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Woman Founder accuses investor Mahesh Murthy of misconduct
article: The Co-founder of Noida-based IT startup Vayuz, Pooja Chauhan has accused investor and Seedfund's Co-founder Mahesh Murthy of misconduct and shared a WhatsApp conversation between the two. "I wished Mahesh Murthy Merry Christmas n a new year I got a response something like that," she said. "Next time when you talk to investors you should mentally prepare yourself," she added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Anil Ambani's Reliance may sell its 1% Paytm stake: Report
article: Anil Ambani-controlled Reliance Capital is reportedly in talks to sell its 1% stake in digital payments startup Paytm. The company is planning to raise up to ₹400 crore by selling its stake in One97 Communications, Paytm's parent company. In December 2016, Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma raised ₹325 crore by selling his 1% stake in One97 Communications.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Video: SpaceX rocket lands on ground after successful launch
article: Elon Musk-led space exploration startup SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket on Sunday successfully landed on the ground after launching to space. It’s the third time that SpaceX has landed its rocket on solid ground post launch, but the first time a ground landing has been done during the daytime. SpaceX now has eight landed Falcon 9 rockets in its possession.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hair dye that changes colour according to surroundings made
article: London-based innovation startup The Unseen, founded by Lauren Bowker, has created a hair dye called 'Fire' that changes the colour of the hair according to the surroundings. The dye changes hair colour based on the temperature fluctuations in the surroundings - black when cold and red when hot. The semi-permanent dye lasts over a few washes.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Former Obama aide fined ₹60 lakh for illegal Uber lobbying
article: Former US President Barack Obama's campaign strategist and Uber's ex-Chief Policy Adviser David Plouffe has been fined ₹60 lakh for illegally lobbying for the cab-hailing startup. According to Chicago's Ethics Board, Plouffe contacted Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel when Uber was blocked from picking up passengers at Chicago airports. However, Plouffe failed to officially register as a lobbyist.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: #deleteUber trends on Twitter after ex-worker's sexism claim
article: After former Uber engineer Susan Fowler published a blog claiming sexism and sexual harassment at the workplace by her manager, #deleteUber started trending on Twitter. People started deleting the ride-hailing app and sharing the woman's blog with #deleteUber. The same hashtag went viral about a month ago when Uber drivers didn't join strike against US President Donald Trump's immigration ban.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Week-long strike by Ola, Uber drivers in Delhi NCR ends
article: The drivers of ride-hailing startups Ola and Uber have ended a week-long strike over lowered incentives in Delhi NCR. The cab aggregators have promised to look into the drivers' grievances next week. The drivers are demanding for better perks, relaxed hours for targets, accident insurance and a negotiation on the ₹6 per kilometre fare.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mahesh Murthy clarifies on woman Founder's accusation
article: Investor and Seedfund Co-founder Mahesh Murthy has clarified on Noida-based startup Vayuz's Co-founder Pooja Chauhan's accusation of misconduct. Murthy said that the conversation in question took place two months ago for which he apologised to Chauhan. "I just hope we respect people around us and dissuade ourselves and others from objectifying women," Chauhan had replied to Murthy's apology.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm Payments Bank to launch next week, says Paytm Founder
article: Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma has said that the Paytm Payments Bank will become operative from the next week. "I think 2017 will be the year for us to expand into banking. We have to build distribution, reach and customer base," Sharma added. Paytm Payments Bank is 51% owned by Sharma and 49% by Paytm's parent company, One97 Communications.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Top Snapchat executive Sriram Krishnan quits days before IPO
article:
One of Snapchat's top advertising executives, Sriram Krishnan has quit the startup less than a month before its expected IPO. Krishnan had joined Snapchat from Facebook a year ago. In a tweet, Krishnan said, "After a great year at Snap, I've decided to leave and move back to SF
to be closer to @aarthir (wife), family and friends".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes caterpillar chips, cake to tackle malnutrition
article: FasoPro, a startup based in African nation Burkina Faso creates products like salted cakes and pepper chips with protein-rich caterpillar powder to tackle malnutrition. The caterpillars, which feed on the leaves of shea trees, are made up of more than 60% protein. The startup was founded by Kahitouo Hien, a graduate of the University of California, Berkeley in 2011.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm to invest ₹600 cr to expand QR code payment system
article: Digital wallet startup Paytm will invest ₹600 crore over the next 10 months to expand its QR code-based payment network. QR code, or Quick Response code, is a machine-readable label that contains information such as account details of the merchants. Paytm introduced QR codes in October 2015 and 65% payments on its platform are made via these codes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup offers unlimited leave, sets no work hours for staff
article: New Zealand-based gaming startup Rocketwerkz is offering its employees unlimited paid annual leave and a share in the company's profits. Rocketwerkz has no set work hours and Founder Dean Hall's salary is capped at 10% above the startup's highest-paid employee. Hall has claimed to receive over 300 Facebook messages enquiring about work opportunities after a local newspaper covered his startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ethnic apparel startup Craftsvilla fires over 100 employees
article: Mumbai-headquartered ethnic apparel startup Craftsvilla has fired more than 100 employees, about 50 of which belonged to the engineering team. Reportedly, the entire product and design team has been asked to leave. Founded in 2011 and backed by investors like Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Venture Partners and Nexus Venture Partners, Craftsvilla has raised more than $50 million to date.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mobile balance checking app True Balance raises ₹100 crore
article: Gurugram-based startup True Balance, an app that allows users to check their mobile phone balance, has raised ₹100 crore in Series B funding. The funding was led by existing investor SoftBank Ventures Korea, part of Japanese internet conglomerate SoftBank Group, and IMM Investment Group. Founded in 2014 by Cheolwon Lee, the app allows prepaid users to check their phone's balance.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: SpaceX postpones Red Dragon mission to Mars to 2020
article: American aerospace manufacturer SpaceX President Gwynne Shotwell has revealed that its robotic Martian lander Red Dragon won't be ready in 2018 as the company had planned. Shotwell added that they're now "looking more in the 2020 timeframe" for the mission to the Red Planet. The company's original plan was to send a mission to Mars by 2022.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat starts selling Spectacles online for ₹8,700 in US
article: Snapchat's first hardware product 'Spectacles' have been made available for sale online for ₹8,700 in the US. Announced in September 2016, the 10-second video recording device was available only via Snapbot vending machines in surprise locations and Snapchat's NYC pop-up store until now. In its IPO filing, Snapchat stated that the launch of Spectacles hasn't generated significant revenue for it.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes 'liquid glass' to protect screens from cracks
article: A German startup has created a 'liquid glass' formula called ProtectPax to make touchscreens scratch- and crack-resistant. The coating, which claims to last for a full year, also repels water. Using nanotechnology, ProtectPax is said to be as hard as Ruby or Sapphire as it uses titanium dioxide nanoparticles, which close the microscopic wells on the glass.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ISRO helps US startup get 50-trillion-pixel image of Earth
article: The record-breaking launch of 104 satellites from one rocket by ISRO has helped US-based imaging startup Planet to begin releasing 50-trillion-pixel image of Earth's landmass every day. ISRO's launch included 88 satellites of the startup, which now has a total of 149 satellites in space, making it the largest fleet in space operated by a commercial entity.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Elon Musk's new startup to dig tunnels to avoid traffic
article: SpaceX and Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who recently joked about digging tunnels to avoid traffic, has set up a startup named 'The Boring Company’ to dig tunnels for transportation. The company is digging a tunnel 50 feet below the ground for transportation of cars. Musk is planning a network of 30 levels of tunnels to accommodate both cars and trains.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Paytm cannot copy Alibaba, says HDFC Bank MD Aditya Puri
article: HDFC Bank Managing Director Aditya Puri, speaking at Nasscom's conference on Friday, said digital payments startup Paytm cannot copy its Chinese investor Alibaba's model. "Come up with something else...If you want to copy Alibaba, you can't, because Indian regulators are better." Puri also raised doubts over the business model of e-wallets, adding that Paytm had current losses of ₹1,600 crore.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapdeal had ₹1,200 crore cash left in bank by end of 2016
article: E-commerce platform Snapdeal had ₹1,100-1,200 crore cash left in the bank at the end of 2016, according to a Livemint report. Talks to raise fresh funding from existing investor SoftBank have reportedly been deferred because of differences over valuation. Snapdeal's losses rose by 150% to ₹3,316 crore in FY16, forcing the startup to stop its incentive programs for affiliate partners.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: HDFC Bank MD takes dig at Paytm, says wallets have no future
article: Speaking at a Nasscom conference on Friday, HDFC Bank Managing Director Aditya Puri cited digital wallet Paytm's example to say, "There is no money in the payments business... the wallets' proposition as a valid economic model is doubtful." Claiming that the wallets business has "no future", Puri said that Paytm has a current loss of over ₹1,600 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Musk accidentally tweets Muslim immigration ban is not right
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who is also a member of US President Donald Trump's advisory board, on Wednesday accidentally posted a series of tweets opposing the immigration ban. "The Muslim immigration ban is not right", read one of the tweets. After minutes of posting the tweets, Musk deleted the tweets and said, "They were earlier drafts that I accidentally published".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapdeal to merge with Paytm's e-commerce site: Reports
article: E-commerce platform Snapdeal is reportedly in talks to merge with Paytm's e-commerce website, called Paytm Mall. According to the report, the deal was initiated by the companies' common investor, China's Alibaba. Japan's SoftBank is also expected to be a major beneficiary of the possible merger, as it reported a loss of ₹2,300 crore mainly from its Indian investments including Snapdeal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SAIF Partners earn 16 times its investment in MakeMyTrip
article: Venture capital firm SAIF Partners has made an exit from online travel platform MakeMyTrip after generating 16 times more money than what it invested in it. SAIF Partners generated more than ₹2,680 crore from the sale of its stake in MakeMyTrip at different times. The exit comes as shares of MakeMyTrip have risen 66% since it acquired rival ibibo Group.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Elon Musk calls ISRO's achievement awesome & very impressive
article: American space exploration startup SpaceX's Founder Elon Musk on Thursday tweeted that ISRO's achievement is awesome and very impressive. "They (ISRO) are doing India proud," he wrote in another tweet. ISRO on Wednesday launched 104 satellites in one go, breaking the world record for the most number of satellites launched from a single rocket.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapchat values its IPO at $14 to $16 per share
article: According to a filing, disappearing-photo application Snapchat will offer 200 million Class A shares for $14-$16, with an aim to raise $3.2 billion in its IPO. A possible valuation between $19.5 billion and $22.2 billion would make Snapchat's IPO the third-biggest technology offering of the past decade. Snap is the first US social media company to go public since Twitter.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Moto Z cover turns phones into walkie-talkies with 8km range
article: A US-based startup has created a modular back cover for Moto Z smartphones that adds walkie-talkie capabilities with a range of 8 km. The cover also supports SMS, GPS location sharing, and an emergency alert button to transmit SOS signal. The accessory claims to have a battery life of 20 hours on standby.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk rewards Tesla owner who damaged own car to save a life
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has announced that the carmaker will provide free repairs to a Tesla Model S owner who damaged his car to save another driver's life. The driver swerved his car in front of a Volkswagen after noticing that the driver appeared to be unconscious. The collision that halted both the cars caused damages worth about ₹7 lakh.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: RailYatri starts milk delivery service for babies in trains
article: Train travel marketplace RailYatri has launched a service to deliver warm milk in specially designed spill-proof thermos-like packaging for babies travelling in trains. The milk can be ordered through the RailYatri application at designated railway stations. It will be delivered to the berth so that passengers do not have to get off the train to collect it.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Digging tunnels less crazy than flying cars, says Elon Musk
article: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk, who set up new startup 'The Boring Company' to dig tunnels to avoid traffic, said that digging tunnels is less crazy than flying cars. "It’s difficult to imagine the flying car becoming a scalable solution," Musk said. "If somebody doesn’t maintain their flying car, it could drop a hubcap and guillotine you," he added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapdeal incurs average monthly expense of over ₹160 crore
article: According to a Livemint report, e-commerce platform Snapdeal has an average burn rate of about ₹160 crore per month. In comparison, Snapdeal has only raised about ₹140 crore in the current fiscal, down from nearly ₹9,400 crore it had raised in 2014 and 2015. Amid the ongoing crash crunch, Snapdeal Co-founders recently asked employees to "take tough decisions...to curtail expenses."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon to open physical food outlets in India: Reports
article: E-commerce major Amazon has reportedly sought the government's permission to open food-only physical outlets in India along with an online platform to sell locally produced food items. The unit will sell third-party or own private labels of locally produced and packaged products. According to reports, Amazon will invest ₹3,500 crore in the outlets over the next five years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola, Uber drivers strike in Bengaluru, one attempts suicide
article: Ola and Uber drivers on Thursday went on strike in Bengaluru after a round of talks between the driver representatives and cab aggregators failed. One of the protesters attempted suicide outside Ola office by consuming poison, who was rushed to the hospital and is under treatment. Drivers are demanding that Ola and Uber should adhere to Karnataka's cab aggregation rules.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat founders to sell ₹1,700 crore of stock each in IPO
article: Snapchat is offering 200 million shares for subscription in its IPO, amongst which 145 million belong to the company and the remaining shares will be given by the Co-founders and the investors. Snapchat Co-founders Evan Spiegel and Bobby Murphy are expected to get over  ₹1,700 crore each from the sale of their 16 million Class A shares.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Elon Musk denies report of delay in SpaceX's launch for NASA
article: Elon Musk on Saturday denied a report suggesting SpaceX will "probably" not meet its 2018 deadline to carry NASA astronauts to space. "Provided Dragon 2 demo missions go well, SpaceX is highly confident of being able to fly US astronauts in 2018," Musk tweeted. The US Government Accountability Office has recommended that NASA should come up with a backup plan.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Food startup Faasos losses grew four times in 2016
article: Sequoia Capital-backed food startup Faasos losses widened four-fold in the financial year ended March 2016, mainly over higher expenses, according to startup's filings. Losses during the year stood at ₹111 crore compared to ₹24 crore loss registered a year earlier. Founded in 2011, Faasos runs food outlets as well as provides on-demand food delivery.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Flipkart has no plans to cut jobs, says COO Nitin Seth
article: Flipkart's COO Nitin Seth has said the company has no plans to downsize its workforce. "We had to go through that phase last year but with the growth we saw last quarter... and with February shaping up well, our growth cycle is back," said Seth. This comes amid reports of rival Snapdeal planning to lay off 30% of its workforce.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Furniture startup Urban Ladder raises ₹102 crore
article: Furniture startup Urban Ladder has raised ₹102 crore in funding from existing investors including Kalaari, SAIF Partners, Steadview Capital and Sequoia Capital. Founded in 2012 by IIM Bangalore alumni Ashish Goel and Rajiv Srivatsa, Urban Ladder counts Ratan Tata among its investors. It competes with Goldman Sachs-backed Pepperfry and Bessemer Venture Partners and Jungle Ventures-backed Livspace.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Never expected India and Bharat coming together: Paytm CEO
article: Digital wallet Paytm's Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma on Wednesday said that he never expected India and Bharat coming together so soon. Sharma said demonetisation was the inflection point for the company, where Paytm saw adoption by people and in places he never expected. "Paytm now has 190 million accounts, while SBI has 202 million," he added.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Blood-testing company Theranos had no revenue in 2015, 2016
article: Blood testing technology startup Theranos did not make any material revenue in both 2015 and 2016, according to reports. The company is reportedly running out of cash as it had $200 million left at the end of 2016, a quarter of its $800 million in total funding. Notably, the startup was valued at $9 billion in 2014.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Office space provider Innov8 raises angel funding
article: Delhi-based coworking office space provider Innov8 has raised an undisclosed amount of angel funding led by LetsVenture, Venture Catalysts and independent investors including Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma. Founded in 2015 by Silicon Valley entrepreneurs Ritesh Malik and Shailesh Gupta, Innov8 focuses on targeting accessible locations in the city to ensure a comfortable atmosphere for its members.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Indian virtual reality startup Imaginate raises ₹3.3 crore
article: Hyderabad-based augmented and virtual reality startup, Imaginate has secured about ₹3.3 crore in a seed round of funding from US-based early stage VC fund, SRI Capital. Imaginate's products include Dres.sy, a platform that lets fashion shoppers virtually try out clothes and FirstShow, an application-based AR platform to show movie trailers on printed posters or digital posters.

author: Sultan Mirza
abstract: Govt creates ‘INSPIRE Awards-MANAK’ to take startups to school
article: Aimed to foster  culture of entrepreneurship among school children, the government has set up the ‘INSPIRE Awards-MANAK’. 10 lakh ideas will be targeted from 5 lakh schools every year and one lakh ideas will be shortlisted for an INSPIRE Award of ₹5,000 each. The top 60 projects will be shortlisted for National Awards and showcased at Rashtrapati Bhavan.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Almost all cars will be self-driving in 10 years, says Musk
article: While launching Tesla in Dubai on Monday, the electric vehicle startup's Co-founder Elon Musk said in 10 years it will be very unusual for cars to be built that are not fully self-driving. "Getting in a car will be just like getting in an elevator...You just tell it where you want to go and it takes you there," he added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber driver commits suicide over inability to pay car's EMIs
article: A 34-year-old Uber driver, Praveen Kumar committed suicide in Hyderabad after he failed to pay his car EMIs for four straight months. The deceased joined Uber seven months ago and could earn only ₹21,000, while his monthly EMI was ₹27,000, said a relative. Finance company officials used to visit his house for money and harass his family, the relative claimed.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber mapping roads in 5 continents to take on Google Maps
article: Ride-sharing service Uber announced that it has deployed its mapping technology in Singapore, making Asia the fifth continent in which the billion-dollar startup is mapping roads to take on Google Maps. The move will help Uber develop more precise traffic patterns and pick-up and drop-off locations. The road data will be collected using additional technology on existing Uber taxis.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Humans need to evolve to communicate with machines: Musk
article: Tesla and SpaceX Founder Elon Musk on Monday said human beings are in danger of being eclipsed by artificial intelligence and need to evolve the ability to communicate directly with machines or risk irrelevance. "Over time I think we will probably see a closer merger of biological intelligence and digital intelligence," Musk added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Reading only FB news like eating only chips: Flipboard CEO
article: Social network aggregation startup Flipboard's CEO Mike McCue in a recent interview compared getting news solely from Facebook to eating "potato chips all day long." He added, "I think of news feeds as the 'mystery meat' of your information diet."  He said that some platforms believe a piece is a "great story because the most people are clicking on it."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: India's 1st listed e-comm site to merge CCAvenue with itself
article: Infibeam, the first e-commerce company in India listed with SEBI, has announced plans to merge operations with online payment gateway CCAvenue. The deal is expected to value CCAvenue at ₹2,000 crore. Founded in 2010 by former Amazon executive Vishal Mehta, Infibeam will also invest ₹150 crore for a 7.5% stake in CCAvenue, in addition to the 3.85% it currently owns.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla stock hits record high as it debuts in Dubai
article: The stock of Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla on Monday hit a record high after a 4% rise, the same day it launched the online booking of its cars in UAE. Tesla stock witnessed its last all-time closing high in July 2015. Tesla is currently gearing up for its third car launch, the Model 3.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Manohar Parrikar pledges fund to encourage defence startups
article: Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar while inaugurating the 11th Aero India show on Tuesday, said that the government will create a new technology innovation fund to encourage startups in the defence sector. The initial contribution will come from Hindustan Aeronautics Limited and the Bharat Electronics Limited, he added. The fund will also be open to both Indian and foreign firms.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Where have Uber drivers gone on strike besides India?
article: Uber drivers went on strike not only in Delhi, but they also went on strike in Qatar, Paris, London and more than a dozen of US cities earlier. Delhi drivers are protesting reduced incomes after Uber slashed their incentives. In Qatar, drivers are protesting against reduced fares for consumers. In other cities, drivers protested against inability to make minimum wages.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Early-stage startups seek to raise $800 mn in 2017: InnoVen
article: Early-stage Indian start-ups will seek to raise $800 million in 2017 in order to chase growth and start looking for profitability, according to venture debt firm InnoVen Capital. Venture capital funding in startups in 2016 plummeted by almost one-third compared to 2015 and 2014, it added. In another report, Tracxn said India saw 212 startup shutdowns in 2016.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes jacket to hold 15 kg weight, fold into a bag
article: An Australian startup has created the 'Airport Jacket' which can hold up to 15 kg weight and be folded into a bag. The coat, which has 14 pockets, can hold a laptop, an iPad, two pairs of shoes, and clothes among items. The company claims the jacket will let users avoid paying extra baggage fees at airports.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Have to take tough decisions: Snapdeal Founders to employees
article: After reports of Snapdeal firing 1,000 employees, its founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal in an e-mail to employees said the company has to take tough decisions to become profitable. Snapdeal also dissolved its SD Instant team, a service launched in 2015 that allowed users to purchase daily essentials. Snapdeal's premium fashion platform Exclusively's CEO Amit Maheshwari has also quit.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Magic Leap sued by former executive for sex discrimination
article: AR startup Magic Leap, which is valued at $4.5 billion, has been sued by former Marketing VP Tannen Campbell for sexual discrimination. Campbell alleges the startup's corporate culture is one of "macho bullying where women's ideas...are ridiculed openly." The lawsuit alleges that the company's IT support lead once said, "We stay away from Three Os: Orientals, Old People, and Ovaries."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon patents method to drop packages via parachutes
article: E-commerce major Amazon has been granted a patent to drop packages being delivered by drones using parachutes. The patent claims using parachutes will reduce the time and energy that is usually spent in landing and relaunching the drone from each drop-off location. In December 2016, Amazon had filed a patent for a flying warehouse for drone deliveries.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola hires two new executives to lead engineering
article: Ola has hired two new executives, Pranav Tiwari and Sanjay Kharb, to lead the ride-hailing app's technology team. Tiwari, a former Google employee, has joined Ola as Vice President of Engineering, and Kharb, the former VP for Production Engineering at InMobi, has joined Ola as VP of Engineering Infrastructure. In January, Ola appointed former PepsiCo executive Vishal Kaul as COO.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart shuts Ekart's courier, hyperlocal delivery services
article: Homegrown e-commerce major Flipkart has shut down its logistics arm Ekart's customer-to-customer courier as well as hyperlocal delivery services launched less than a year ago. The move is reportedly aimed at consolidating the service offerings of Ekart to sharpen its focus on its core business model. Ekart's head Saikiran Krishnamurthy had quit the company two weeks ago.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: CEO posts on Twitter that leaked product photos aren't real
article: Augmented Reality startup Magic Leap's CEO Rony Abovitz on Sunday took to Twitter to clarify that the leaked photos do not show their first product prototype. "The photo shows Magic Leap R&D test rig where we collect room/space data for our machine vision/machine learning work," Abovitz said. The startup is backed by investors like Alibaba and Google.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber witnesses murder of over 6 drivers for cash in Brazil
article: Uber has tightened security in Brazil following the murders of at least six drivers since the option for cash payments was launched in July 2016. Attacks on drivers have risen from 13 to 141 per month as riders opting to pay through cash cannot be tracked. Uber's new policy requires cash users to register with a social security number.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Jugnoo forays into cab service amid Uber, Ola drivers strike
article: Chandigarh-based auto-hailing startup Jugnoo has announced its foray into taxi aggregation business amid the ongoing strike by drivers of Uber and Ola in Delhi. The service, which is expected to be pricier than current operators, will begin in Gurugram and soon expand to other cities. Jugnoo Co-founder Chinmay Agarwal said the startup's model ensures fair pay to the drivers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Health startup SigTuple raises ₹39 cr from Accel, others
article: Bengaluru-based health technology startup SigTuple on Monday raised about ₹39 crore ($5.8 million) in Series A round of funding led by existing investor Accel Partners. VC funds, including IDG Ventures, Pi Ventures, also participated in the round, along with Flipkart founders Sachin and Binny Bansal. Founded in 2015, SigTuple has built technology to digitise pathological tests.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Another top-level executive quits Ola after CFO, CMO's exit
article: Apart from recent exits of CFO Rajiv Bansal and CMO Raghuvesh Sarup, Ola's Chief Operating Officer of offline initiatives, Anuj Bhargava, has also quit from the ride-hailing startup. Bhargava was one of the company's key architects behind recent initiatives such as in-car entertainment service Ola Play. Several other senior directors have quit Ola in the last two weeks.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ola, Uber drivers strike partially called off in Delhi NCR
article: The indefinite strike by drivers of Ola and Uber in Delhi NCR was called off partially on Sunday. Five drivers' unions out of six called off the strike after Delhi Transport Minister Satyendar Jain reportedly assured them of fulfilling their demand for better incentives. The drivers claim their incomes have reduced as the companies continue to acquire more cabs.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber taxi set on fire amidst ongoing cab drivers' strike
article: An Uber taxi was set on fire by protesters on Tuesday in Ghaziabad amidst the ongoing strike by drivers of app-based cab aggregators in Delhi NCR demanding better pay. The protesters allegedly hurled stones at the car to stop it and poured some inflammable substance before setting it afire. Earlier, Delhi High Court restrained drivers' unions from blocking the cabs.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Payment gateway Razorpay posts profit as sales rise 10-fold
article: Jaipur-registered online payment gateway startup Razorpay reported a profit of ₹28.7 lakh for the year ended March 2016, up from a loss of ₹4.1 lakh a year ago. The company's net sales stood at ₹79 lakh, almost ten times more than the previous fiscal. Razorpay has raised over ₹73.6 crore from founders of FreeCharge and Snapdeal among other investors.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon to launch its own bra line in US starting from ₹670
article: American e-commerce major Amazon is planning to launch its own line of bras in the US starting from ₹670 a piece. The bras would be available in the country within the next few weeks. Amazon has already launched its own line of bras at similar prices in Europe under the brand name 'Iris & Lilly'.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Monthly housing sales fell 40% on demonetisation: PropTiger
article: Realty portal PropTiger has said that its monthly average housing sales fell 40% during November-December 2016 in top nine cities because of the government's demonetisation move. New home launches fell 49% in the period, the company added. News Corp-backed PropTiger, which recently merged with real estate search portal Housing, laid off 200 employees this week in a restructuring exercise.

author: Azhar Iqubal
abstract: NestAway launches Sanskari Nari Kit to help you find a home
article: Home-rental startup NestAway, which introduced products like Sanskari Nari Kit and Sacha Paneer Spray as jokes in its ads to fight discrimination in home renting, has actually put them up for sale on Amazon and Flipkart. “These cheeky alternates are for the ones who still haven’t logged onto NestAway and continue to face discrimination while house hunting,” says the company.

author: Azhar Iqubal
abstract: Fashion rental startup Flyrobe rents $1mn worth of apparel in Jan
article: Flyrobe, a 15-month old fashion rental startup, witnessed a huge surge in demand this wedding season and rented $1 million worth of apparel in January. Flyrobe offers designer wear on rent for both men and women with over 100 designer brands on its platform. Convenience, practicality and access to designer brands are the major reasons driving growth in this industry.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Can't stand Facebook copying fiance's Snapchat: Miranda Kerr
article: Snapchat's Co-founder Evan Spiegel's fiance and former Victoria's Secret model Miranda Kerr has said that she can't stand Facebook copying the features of Snapchat. "Can they not be innovative? Do they have to steal all of my partner’s ideas? I’m so appalled by that," said Kerr. "It’s a disgrace. How do they sleep at night?” she added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: PropTiger fires 200 employees following Housing merger
article: News Corp-backed realty portal PropTiger has fired about 200 employees as part of a restructuring exercise following its merger with Housing last month. PropTiger's CEO Dhruv Agarwala, who will lead the combined entity, said that the layoffs will ensure "optimal utilisation" of resources. Agarwala attributed the staff cut to the overlapping support functions of the two organisations.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Dating app matches people based on intelligence level
article: A US-based startup has created a dating app that matches people based on their intelligence, called 'Sapio'. The app requires users to answer 300 open-ended questions like, "If you were the supreme ruler of the world what laws would you pass?" Sapio then matches the users based on similar interests, intellect, and personality types.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes ₹1,700 case to turn phone into camera for kids
article: US-based startup Pixl Toys has created a ₹1,700 smartphone case that can turn a smartphone into a 35 mm camera for kids. Once the device is put into the case, photos can be taken and effects can be included with a dedicated app developed by the startup. The drop protective case features dual child-resistant locks and rubber handles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ₹1,900 pen with universal phone charger, 16 GB memory made
article: A Canadian startup has created a ₹1,900 ballpoint pen called 'ChargeWrite' which comes with a universal phone charging tip and 1,000 mAh battery enough to provide up to five hours of talk time. The pen also comes with 16 GB inbuilt memory and a smartphone cleaner to remove dirt from the screen. It also acts a stylus for smartphones.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ford puts $1 billion in startup by ex-Uber, Google engineers
article: American automaker Ford has announced an investment of $1 billion in tech startup Argo AI, founded by former Google and Uber engineers. Ford will acquire a majority stake in the startup, which will focus on developing software platform for Ford's self-driving car. In August, Ford said it will mass-produce fully self-driving cars without brake pedals and steering wheels by 2021.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes two-legged robot aimed at making deliveries
article: US-based startup Agility Robotics, funded by the experimental research arm of the country's Department of Defense, has created a two-legged robot named 'Cassie' aimed at making home deliveries. The motors of the walking robot make it more steerable and give it a larger range of motion. Cassie also has motored ankles to help make it even sturdier.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra founder Ashutosh Lawania quits to start new venture
article: Flipkart-owned Myntra's Co-founder Ashutosh Lawania has quit the fashion startup to launch a new venture. Myntra has named its Chief Marketing Officer Gunjan Soni as the new head of Jabong, a rival it acquired in July last year. Ashutosh Lawania, Mukesh Bansal and Vineet Saxena founded Myntra in 2007. All three Myntra Co-founders are now working on their new ventures.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: FreeCharge Chairman Kunal Shah joins Sequoia as advisor
article: Snapdeal-owned online recharge platform FreeCharge's Chairman Kunal Shah on Saturday said that continuing with his current roles, he will also be joining VC firm Sequoia India as an advisor. "Look forward to learning/working with portfolio founders and excited for accelerated learning across different sectors," Shah said. In 2014, FreeCharge had received $33 million funding from Sequoia Capital.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart execs overpaid underperforming crybabies: M Murthy
article: Investor and Seedfund Co-founder Mahesh Murthy on Friday tweeted a comparison between the pay of top executives at Flipkart and Amazon India, captioned, "So Flipkart wants level playing field with Amazon? Start by cutting top exec salaries by 80%. Overpaid underperforming crybabies." Murthy was reacting to Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal's statement on government protection for Indian companies.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm app allows users to book an Uber
article: Digital wallet Paytm has added an option to its app that lets users book a taxi through Uber. The option to book an Uber is available under the Book on Paytm section of the app. The option leads users to Uber's native app and suggests on downloading the Uber app if it does not exist in the user's phone.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart re-hires two executives to launch grocery business
article: Homegrown e-commerce major Flipkart's newly-appointed CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy has re-hired two former executives, Manish Kumar and Nitin Rajput, to launch a grocery category. After leaving Flipkart separately, Kumar and Rajput had teamed up last year to launch a hyperlocal startup but they have shut their venture. Flipkart is reportedly planning to launch its brand of pulses and other groceries.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal planning to fire 1,000 employees to reduce losses
article: E-commerce startup Snapdeal is reportedly planning to fire 1,000 employees affecting 30% of its workforce in a bid to reduce losses.  About 5,000 contractual and 3,000 on-roll employees from Snapdeal’s logistics subsidiary Vulcan Express are also expected to be fired. The layoffs come after Snapdeal witnessed a number of top-level exits.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup's shares rise 164% on being confused with Snapchat
article: Shares of New York-based startup 'SNAP Interactive', surged by 164% in four days since Snapchat parent 'Snap' filed for a $3 billion initial public offering. Over 10,000 shares of the dating app maker traded on Wednesday, almost 10 times the average daily volume in January. SNAP Interactive's stock started rising in late January amid reports of Snap’s IPO filing.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Billion-dollar startup Zenefits fires 45% of its staff
article: In order to cut costs, US-based billion-dollar startup that makes human resource software, Zenefits is firing 45% of its staff, affecting 430 employees. The job cuts are the third round of staff reductions for Zenefits in the past year. Zenefits hired too many employees in 2015 to sustain our revenue projections, said CEO Jay Fulcher in a memo to employees.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SpaceX to launch rocket from pad used for first Moon mission
article: Space exploration startup SpaceX's next rocket launch will take place from Launch Complex 39A — the same launch pad used for the first Moon mission. In 1969,  the launch pad was used by the Saturn V rocket that first took people to the Moon. "We are honored to be allowed to use it," said SpaceX Founder and CEO Elon Musk.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk slammed for claiming Tesla worker was paid to agitate
article: America's United Automobile Workers union has rejected a charge by Tesla CEO Elon Musk that a factory worker who publicly criticised the company was paid by the organisation. "We hope Tesla would apologise to their employee for spreading fake news about him," said the union organisation. The worker had complained of injuries, unfair promotions and low pay at Tesla.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber, Ola drivers go on strike in Delhi over incentives
article: The drivers of Uber and Ola on Friday started an indefinite strike in Delhi to protest against the current policies of employers and demand better incentives. The drivers are demanding unrestricted hours to meet targets, accident insurance and increase in the minimum charge of ₹6/km. They claim their incomes have reduced as the companies continue to acquire more cabs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: India world's fastest growing e-commerce market: Study
article: India is world's fastest growing e-commerce market expected to reach $64 billion by 2021 with a compound annual growth rate of 31.2%, according to a Forrester Research study. India will take over 10 years to reach the level of the US and China markets, the report said. China remains the largest market for e-commerce globally, it added.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: NDTV's Jay Chauhan joins Arnab Goswami's Republic TV
article: NDTV's former Chief Innovation Officer Jay Chauhan has been appointed as the Chief Operating Officer-Digital and Chief Technology Officer for broadcast news at Arnab Goswami’s media venture Republic TV. Chauhan's appointment is a strong statement that Republic will become a true media tech company, Goswami stated. Notably, Rajya Sabha member Rajeev Chandrasekhar is a Director in the venture.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat updates its IPO filing to remove gender pay gap
article: Snapchat on Thursday updated its IPO filing to show that its only woman Director, Joanna Coles, received equal pay compared to the other four male Directors in 2016. In the initial filing, Coles was the least paid among the company's Directors. Snapchat updated the filing and said it previously didn't include a four-year contract that she signed last month.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk calls claims of low wages at Tesla 'morally outrageous'
article: Tesla's Elon Musk has called a factory worker's claims that pay at Tesla is among the lowest in automotive industry "morally outrageous". Musk added that the man "doesn't really work" for Tesla, but has been paid by a union organisation to agitate for a union. The worker called Tesla "a company of the future with working conditions of the past".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup allows companies to rent inventors
article: A US-based startup called Xinova allows companies like PepsiCo to rent inventors and technical experts to help with their need for innovation. Xinova has a global network of over 10,000 inventors which are picked for specific request for invention placed by the companies. The startup also takes care of inventors' patent application expenses and making lab work possible.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla rival Lucid Motors tests its electric car in -18°F
article: Electric vehicle startup Tesla's rival Lucid Motors has released a video which shows its first car 'Air' being tested in snow, ice and mixed road conditions, and temperatures below -18°F. Unveiled in December, Air churns out 1,000 horsepower and claims to travel up to 640 kilometres per charge. It is expected to launch in 2018 at around ₹66.84 lakh.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon reports Iran transactions that may violate sanctions
article: American e-commerce company Amazon in a regulatory filing on Friday disclosed Iranian transactions that may have violated US sanctions, and warned that it may be penalised after a review. Amazon said it "delivered orders of consumer products for certain individuals" covered by the Iran Threat Reduction Act priced from $50 to about $2,400 between 2012 and 2016.

author: Azhar Iqubal
abstract: Startup India’s online learning program gets 25,000+ registrations
article: Startup India’s interactive online learning and development module to educate startups and aspiring entrepreneurs about various stages of entrepreneurship has clocked over 25,000 registrations. The 4-week program gives deep insights on idea identification, legal and fundraising through video and audio content. Aspiring entrepreneurs can also hear from leading entrepreneurs on their experiences.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola's CFO Rajiv Bansal and CMO Raghuvesh Sarup quit
article: Ola's Chief Financial Officer Rajiv Bansal and Chief Marketing Officer Raghuvesh Sarup have quit the startup. Ola has named operations head Pallav Singh as its interim CFO. Bansal, an Infosys veteran, is also amid the controversy where Infosys founders and shareholders have questioned more than ₹17 crore of severance pay offered to him.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SoftBank says loss of ₹2,300 crore mainly from Ola, Snapdeal
article: Japan's SoftBank has reported a loss of over ₹2,300 crore (¥39.3 billion) mainly from its two biggest investments in India, Ola and Snapdeal. The loss, posted for the nine-month period ended December 2016, was due to a decline in the valuations of these startups. SoftBank had written down about ₹3,700 crore in Ola and Snapdeal in November 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New fund raise to value MobiKwik at $1 billion, says CEO
article: MobiKwik is in talks to raise fresh funding in the next two to three months which will value the startup at $1 billion, CEO Bipin Preet Singh said on Wednesday. Founded in 2009, MobiKwik has raised about $80 million in funding from investors including Sequoia Capital and Taiwan’s MediaTek. MobiKwik's rival Paytm hit $1 billion valuation mark in 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Govt received most e-commerce complaints against Bookmyoffer
article: The government received over 1,386 complaints against e-commerce companies till December 2016, amongst which maximum 449 complaints were against Gurugram-based Bookmyoffer. E-commerce retailers eBay and Snapdeal accounted for the second and third most complaints respectively. The complaints were dealt with as per consumer grievance redressal procedure, the government said.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla beats own record for fastest electric car acceleration
article: In a new track test, Tesla's Model S car accelerated from 0-100 kmph in 2.275 seconds using the recently-updated 'Ludicrous+' mode. Tesla's fastest production electric car beat its own record time of 2.389 seconds. The car was previously recorded as being quicker than Faraday Future's FF 91 by just a thousandth of a second.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla, SpaceX join legal brief against immigration ban
article: Elon Musk-led companies Tesla and SpaceX have joined a legal brief filed by nearly 100 companies including Google and Apple, that supports an ongoing lawsuit against US President Donald Trump's immigration ban. Notably, Musk is a member of Trump's advisory council. Earlier, Musk had said that he will express objection to the ban during a group meeting with Trump.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes gadget to turn headphones 'wireless'
article: California-based startup Podo Labs, founded by UC Berkeley graduates, has created 'Jack', a gadget that claims to make any pair of headphones wireless. Users can plug their existing headphones into 'Jack', which can then be connected wirelessly to any audio device using Bluetooth. The gadget is claimed to have a 12-hour battery life and will retail for about ₹2,700.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: They’ve mixed up their meds, tweets Jeff Bezos on wrong news
article: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos, reacting to an inaccurate news article about the company's futuristic Amazon Go stores, tweeted, "Whoever your anonymous sources are on this story...they've mixed up their meds!" The New York Post article claimed that the Amazon Go stores will only employ three humans each. Amazon's stores are designed to detect items picked and charge customers through app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Facebook Co-founder invests in Singapore's insurance startup
article: Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin’s VC firm B Capital Group has led a $25 million funding round for Singapore-based online health insurance startup CXA Group, that values the venture at $100 million. Saverin will join the board of CXA, which was founded in 2013 by Rosaline Koo, the daughter of an illegal Chinese immigrant.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Two more senior-level executives quit Snapdeal
article: Snapdeal’s head of corporate development Abhishek Kumar, and senior vice president Sandeep Komaravelly, have quit the homegrown e-commerce company. Kumar was working along with founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal for raising funds. Kumar's responsibilities have been taken over by former Housing CEO Jason Kothari, who joined Snapdeal as Chief Strategy and Investment officer last month.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Noida-based travel startup TravelTriangle raises ₹67 crore
article: Noida-based travel startup TravelTriangle on Monday raised ₹67.4 crore ($10 million) in Series B funding round led by RB Investments, a Singapore-based VC firm. Existing investors SAIF Partners and Bessemer Venture Partners also participated in the round.
