Founded in 2011 by IIT graduates, the startup connects travellers with agents, fetches quotations, customises trips and makes bookings online.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Trump policies will improve ease of business: Masayoshi Son
article: Japanese technology company SoftBank's Founder Masayoshi Son, following the release of the company's quarterly results, said, "President Trump has promised to ease various regulations and that should make it easier to do business." Billionaire Son had pledged a $50 billion investment and 50,000 new jobs in the US after meeting US President Donald Trump in early December.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon adds Indian Flag Code to compliance software
article: E-commerce major Amazon has incorporated the Emblems and Names (Prevention of Improper Use) Act, 1950 and the Indian Flag Code into its global compliance software, the Indian government has said. Amazon edited its compliance software to automatically reject products that misuse Indian national flag and icons after facing flak for products such as doormats and shoes bearing the symbols.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal-owned Shopo shuts after over a year of operations
article: Snapdeal-owned online marketplace Shopo on Friday shut down after a year and a half of operations. Acquired by Snapdeal in 2013, Shopo allowed small and medium-sized businesses to chat, buy and sell on the platform on a zero-commission model. Snapdeal has absorbed all the employees of Shopo.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Longing to be back to investing in startups, says Ratan Tata
article: Tata Sons former Chairman Ratan Tata on Tuesday said the last five months were challenging and he's longing to come back to investing in startups. "When I retired in 2012, I hit upon interacting with startups as a new phase," he said. "As of 23 February I'm back," Tata said, referring to appointment of N Chandrasekaran as Tata Sons Chairman.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Need to ensure local firms aren't killed by foreign: Bansal
article: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal on Wednesday said a level-playing field is needed to ensure local companies can build solutions for the Indian market and don’t get “prematurely killed” by foreign competition. He added, "We're making mistake by not thinking of internet and technology as a strategic sector and depending too much on China and US to build that for us".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Man sues Uber for ₹300 crore claiming bug led to his divorce
article: A French man has sued taxi-hailing service Uber for over ₹300 crore claiming that a bug in the app made his wife suspect that he was cheating, ultimately leading to their divorce. The man claimed Uber's glitch let his wife track his location by sending notifications as well as other transportation details to his wife's smartphone, despite logging out.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart, Snapdeal will be bought or dissolved: Murthy
article: Investor and Seedfund's Co-Founder Mahesh Murthy has said that Flipkart, Snapdeal and Shopclues will either be bought up and/or dissolved in the next few years. He added, "I do not believe they will be key players going forward in India". On Alibaba's India entry, Murthy said, "The Indian consumer will be in for a treat with Amazon versus Alibaba battle".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Online automobile marketplace CarTrade raises ₹370 crore
article: Online automobile classifieds portal CarTrade on Wednesday announced that it has raised about ₹370 crore ($55 million) in a funding round led by Temasek Holdings and a US-based family office. Temasek, which is a government-owned investment firm from Singapore, had led a ₹950 crore funding round in CarTrade in January 2016. CarTrade also provides automobile reviews, on-road prices, and comparisons.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart, Amazon, Snapdeal seek changes in GST draft model
article: E-commerce companies Flipkart, Amazon and Snapdeal on Thursday sought changes in the draft model GST law. The companies opposed the Tax Collection at Source (TCS) provision, that requires them to collect and remit taxes on behalf of sellers. "Tax collection at source is an exception created for online," said Amazon India's head Amit Agarwal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ebay Founder gives ₹3cr to experiment universal basic income
article: American e-commerce company Ebay's Founder Pierre Omidyar's philanthropic investment firm, the Omidyar Network, on Wednesday gave over ₹3 crore ($4,93,000) to a group testing universal basic income in Kenya. The group, GiveDirectly, has launched a 12-year program where it plans to give 26,000 Kenyans some money regularly. GiveDirectly has raised $23.7 million of its targeted $30 million.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Another vending machine for used cars opens in US
article: US-based used cars startup Carvana opened another five-storey car vending machine on Tuesday. The vending machine retrieves and delivers cars to their respective owners after the latter insert coins into it. Carvana, which preloads the cars into the building, raised $160 million (over ₹1,077 crore) in funding last August. This is the third such vending machine it has opened.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Beyonce found AR startup Magic Leap's demo 'boring': Report
article: Singer Beyonce was reportedly given a personalised demo of its product by augmented reality startup Magic Leap, which she found boring. Held on short notice, the demo is being said to be more of the CEO's desire to connect with the celebrities than directly related to business. Founded in 2011, Magic Leap is valued at $4.5 billion.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: App lets users point camera at items to find them online
article: Photo-sharing app Pinterest has launched 'Lens', a tool that lets users point their phone's camera at objects like shoes to search for similar products on the platform. It can be used on items like tables to find similar designs and other furniture from the same era. Another use for 'Lens' includes getting recipe suggestions by pointing the camera at vegetables.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ratan Tata unveils bus to support Indian team's moon mission
article: Ratan Tata on Tuesday unveiled 'Moonshot Wheels', a bus which will travel across the country to spread awareness about India's first private moon mission to be attempted by Bengaluru-based TeamIndus. The bus will travel to 11 states and carry astronomy models. TeamIndus is among five finalists for Google's Lunar XPRIZE competition and has signed a launch contract with ISRO.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat Co-founders are worth ₹27,000 crore each
article: Snapchat Co-founders Evan Spiegel and Bobby Murphy are worth ₹27,000 crore ($4 billion) each, according to Forbes. Each of them owns a 22.4% stake in Snap, the parent company of Snapchat, which is currently valued at ₹1.21 lakh crore ($18 billion). Snapchat has filed for IPO and hopes to hit ₹1.70 lakh crore ($25 billion) in valuation.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Uber introduces service to hire a cab for up to 12 hours
article: Taxi-hailing service Uber has introduced 'UberHIRE' that will allow users to hire a cab for up to 12 hours. The service is currently available in nine cities including New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Pune and Mumbai. The base fare ranges between ₹449-649 for 2 hours and up to 30 kilometres, following which charges will apply at ₹2/min and ₹12/km.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos loses ₹19,000 crore in an hour
article: E-commerce major Amazon's Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos net worth dropped by $2.8 billion (around ₹19,000 crore) on Thursday as his company’s stock fell more than 4%. The fall in the stock came after Amazon’s fourth-quarter revenue didn't meet analysts' expectations. Bezos has now become the world's fourth richest person with a fortune of $69.4 billion (nearly ₹4.6 lakh crore).

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat spent ₹6 crore in 2016 on personal security of CEO
article: Snapchat has revealed the company spent over ₹6 crore on the personal security of its Co-founder and CEO Evan Spiegel because he gets a lot of death threats. Spiegel is a high profile individual who is likely to continue to receive threats in the future as well, said Snapchat. The company spent over ₹2.2 crore on Spiegel's security in 2015.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber may show ride-share users each other's Facebook info
article: Ride-hailing service Uber has filed for a patent which will allow it to show UberPool riders the Facebook friends and interests they have in common with their fellow passengers. Uber also plans to use social media data to send riders notifications on the Uber app if a fellow passenger attended the same school or grew up in the same city.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup acquires Google's satellite imaging business
article: American startup Planet Labs, that launches small satellites into orbit and sells the imagery, has announced its acquisition of Google's 'Terra Bella' satellite business. As part of the agreement, 60 Google employees will join the startup founded by ex-NASA scientists. Terra Bella, formerly Skybox, was acquired by Google in 2014 for $500 million.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 'Hater' dating app matches people with similar dislikes
article: iOS beta app 'Hater,' created by former Goldman Sachs employee Brendan Alper, matches people based on what they dislike from 3,000 pre-determined topics. The list of potential dislikes includes butt selfies, slow walkers, and Donald Trump among others. Users are required to swipe down to hate, up to love, left to dislike or right to like.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapchat paid ₹1000cr in cash to ousted founding team member
article: Snapchat revealed it paid over ₹1,000 crore ($157.5 million) in cash to its founding team member Reggie Brown in 2014 to settle a lawsuit alleging he was pushed out of the startup without compensation. Brown claimed that Snapchat's other Co-founders Evan Spiegel and Bobby Murphy used his 'million-dollar idea' for an app with disappearing photos to create Snapchat.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ola, Uber get 15-day extension on ride-sharing ban in K'taka
article: The Karnataka government has given taxi-hailing apps Ola and Uber a 15-day extension to withdraw their ride-sharing services in the state after they were deemed to be illegal. The transport department had already impounded over 30 cabs found violating the order before the extension was provided. Uber had said it would continue to operate its shared cabs in Karnataka.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: US govt says SpaceX Falcon 9 rockets are prone to cracks
article: An investigation by US' Government Accountability Office has revealed that Elon Musk-led SpaceX's Falcon 9 rockets are prone to cracks. The turbo blades' tendency to crack is a "major threat to rocket safety," since they pump fuel into Falcon 9's rocket engines, the agency said. SpaceX recently won a NASA contract to launch astronauts into space.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Paytm, Jio served with notice for using Modi’s photo in ads
article: Paytm and Reliance Jio have been served with notices by the government for using PM Modi’s photograph in their advertisements, according to reports. The government has asked the companies whether they had taken prior permission before using the photograph. Earlier, Paytm applauded PM Modi's demonetisation decision, while Jio claimed it was furthering government’s ‘Digital India’ move.

author: Ankush Verma
abstract: Airbnb's Super Bowl ad takes dig at Trump's immigration ban
article: The Airbnb advertisement at the Super Bowl took a dig at US President Donald Trump's immigration ban. The advertisement shows a diverse group of people, with captions reading, "We believe no matter who you are, where you're from, who you love, or who you worship, we all belong. The world is more beautiful the more you accept."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Will object to immigration ban in meeting with Trump: Musk
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk, who is also a member of US President Donald Trump’s economic advisory council, has said he will express objection to the immigration ban during a group meeting scheduled on Saturday. "Advisory councils simply provide advice and attending does not mean that I agree with actions by the Administration," Musk said.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Snapdeal stops users' incentive programme amid cash crunch
article: E-commerce platform Snapdeal has reportedly stopped its affiliated incentive programme for customers. The programme comprised coupons and cash back channels, for which Snapdeal had to pay commission. The company reportedly informed its affiliate partners that it will not be able to pay for orders and mobile application installations routed through them.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm's e-commerce to raise $200 mn led by Alibaba: Report
article: Vijay Shekhar Sharma-led Paytm's e-commerce vertical is reportedly raising $180-200 million (around ₹1,210 to ₹1,350 crore) in a funding round led by Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba. The incoming investment would value the online retailer at about $1 billion. Paytm's parent company One97 was valued at nearly $5 billion the last time it raised about $60 million funding in August 2016.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: If trade stops, war starts, warns Alibaba Founder Jack Ma
article: Alibaba Founder Jack Ma has warned that a retreat from globalisation will lead to trouble, stating, "Everybody is concerned about trade wars. If trade stops, war starts." “But worry doesn't solve the problem. The only thing you can do is...actively prove that trade helps people to communicate,” Ma said. "[W]e should have fair trade, transparent trade, inclusive trade,” he added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber hires ex-NASA aircraft engineer to develop flying cars
article: Uber has hired former NASA aircraft engineer Mark Moore as Director of Engineering at Uber Elevate, a unit working on an airborne taxi service. Uber is working on small electric vehicles that can take off and land vertically, and travel up to 160 km per charge. The project aims at developing self-driving air-taxis that can be booked through an app.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk shares video of MIT's Hyperloop run in vacuum tube
article: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has shared a video of MIT's entry to SpaceX's first-ever Hyperloop competition in which teams built pods to travel inside a 1.5-km long tube. "Air has been removed from the Hyperloop tube to almost vacuum conditions," Musk captioned the video. MIT Hyperloop won the Safety and Reliability award at the competition.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Elon Musk explains what Tesla, SpaceX logos mean
article: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in a recent tweet explained what the logos of the companies, which manufacture electric cars and reusable rockets respectively, mean. Tesla's stylised 'T' logo is intended to represent the cross-section of an electric motor, Musk said. The extended 'X' in SpaceX's logo symbolises a rocket's trajectory.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: SoftBank's COO quits boards of Ola, Snapdeal and Housing
article: SoftBank Group's Chief Operating Officer (COO) Jonathan Bullock has resigned from the boards of Ola and Snapdeal due to "personal reasons and other obligations". He also resigned from the board of Housing, citing a regulatory filing. SoftBank's Managing Director David Thevenon is likely to replace Bullock and join the boards of Ola and Snapdeal.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Faraday Future will only build 2 cars from the planned 7
article: Electric car startup Faraday Future is scaling back plans to build vehicles in the US and has reportedly slashed its planned car portfolio from seven to two. Its upcoming $1 billion factory has also been downsized to a quarter of the original size. Faraday Future, which is pitted against Tesla, has lost over 10 key executives in 9 months.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Over 2 lakh users deleted their Uber accounts in a week
article: More than 2,00,000 Uber accounts have reportedly been deleted in the past week as part of the #DeleteUber movement. The hashtag emerged on Twitter after Uber was accused of profiting from a protest against US President Donald Trump’s immigration order by turning off surge pricing. Uber CEO Travis Kalanick on Thursday quit Trump's business advisory council over the executive order.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola's valuation slashed 40% to $3 billion by Vanguard
article: US-based investment firm Vanguard Group has slashed the valuation of its stake in Ola by 40%, bringing the cab-hailing startup's valuation close to $3 billion. Ola's valuation was at a peak of $5 billion when it last raised $500 million in funding in November 2015. Vanguard also owns a small stake in another billion-dollar Indian startup Flipkart.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: uBeam shows wireless charging tech in its first public demo
article: US technology company uBeam has demonstrated its wireless charging technology at the Upfront Summit in Los Angeles. The company claims to have developed a way to charge devices using ultrasonic waves, for cordless charging regardless of the surface the gadget is touching. uBeam has earlier been compared with healthcare company Theranos which downsized operations after reports of false blood tests.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Alibaba-made app helps find 611 missing Chinese children
article: A mobile app developed by Alibaba helped Chinese authorities recover 611 missing children last year. The 'Tuanyuan' app, which means 'reunion' in Chinese, sends push notifications with photos and descriptions to users who are close to the location of a child's disappearance. The notifications are sent to users farther from the location of the disappearance till the child is found.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Debit card for kids made that parents can manage with phones
article: Atlanta-based startup Greenlight has developed a debit card for children that their parents can manage with a smartphone app. The company claims the card enables parents to give a child a specific amount that he or she can spend at a specific store or website. The parents are alerted when purchases are made or the child makes a new request.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Skip the drama of being sanskari, says NestAway’s new ad
article: Targeting the problem of discrimination faced by urban migrants while finding a rented accommodation, NestAway has launched an ad highlighting homes that don’t judge your appearance. It shows how a girl gets judged by her clothes and is not considered ‘sanskari’ enough for the house. This ad is a part of the ‘Homes that don’t discriminate’ campaign by NestAway.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick quits Trump's advisory council
article: Ride-hailing app Uber's CEO Travis Kalanick has quit US President Donald Trump's business advisory council over the executive order banning immigrants from seven Muslim-majority nations. This comes after people in the US started deleting Uber's app over Kalanick's ties with Trump. In a memo to employees, Kalanick wrote, "We will fight for the rights of immigrants in our communities".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: What does the Union Budget 2017 mean for startups?
article: In the Union Budget presented on Wednesday, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley increased the period of profit-linked deductions available to the Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion (DIPP)-recognised startups to seven years from the current five years. Further, the startups were allowed to carry forward their Minimum Alternative Tax (MAT) to 15 years from the present period of 10 years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla drops 'Motors' from its name
article: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla Motors dropped the word 'Motors' from its name on Wednesday. This comes after Tesla acquired solar panel-making company SolarCity in a deal worth $2 billion last year. Earlier, Musk also revealed a plan to start a service where Tesla car owners can rent their cars out when they're not in use.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon to build $1.5B air cargo hub in US, create 2,000 jobs
article: E-commerce major Amazon has announced to spend $1.5 billion to build an air cargo hub in Kentucky, US, that will create nearly 2,000 jobs. Amazon agreed to a 50-year lease for about 900 acres of property from Northern Kentucky International Airport. In 2016, Amazon said it would lease 40 Boeing Co 767 planes, 16 of which are currently in service.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mukesh Bansal's CureFit acquires majority stake in The Tribe
article: Myntra Co-founder Mukesh Bansal's new startup, which he started with former Flipkart executive Ankit Nagori, CureFit on Tuesday acquired a majority stake in fitness centre chain The Tribe. Shwetambari Shetty, Co-founder of The Tribe fitness centres, will join CureFit's management team. CureFit has also closed a deal to buy mental wellness services provider  Seraniti.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon starts selling fresh flowers in five Indian cities
article: E-commerce major Amazon has partnered with flower retailers to launch Fresh Flower Store, which allows flower bookings and deliveries across five cities namely Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Mumbai, Pune and Delhi. Same-day as well as advance flower delivery options are available, along with personalised messages. Amazon recently expanded its grocery delivery service Amazon Pantry to 14 cities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MakeMyTrip's Q3 revenue rises 81% to ₹517 crore
article: India's largest online travel services firm MakeMyTrip on Tuesday said that its revenue for the third quarter ended December 2016 rose 81% to ₹517 crore compared to ₹292 crore a year earlier. It posted a net profit of ₹112 crore for the quarter. MakeMyTrip said it has completed its merger of the ibibo Group, which was announced in October 2016.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Startup directors arrested for cheating user by offering car
article: E-commerce firm DealsDilKi.com directors have been arrested for fraud after they cheated a user of ₹5.12 lakh on the pretext of delivering a car. The user received an email from the company stating that he has won a car as a result of a lucky draw, following which he paid the company over ₹5 lakh for getting the delivery.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: OnePlus, Meizu cheated benchmark performance tests
article: Chinese smartphone makers OnePlus and Meizu cheated in benchmark performance tests by tweaking the processor of its devices, according to a report by mobile software developer community XDA Developers. It claimed that OnePlus 3T's core processor stayed at higher speeds, even at zero percent CPU load. Meizu phones were found switching to the big cores when certain apps were running.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart, Ola built on copy-paste model: Mahesh Murthy
article: Reacting to Snapdeal investor Vani Kola's post opposing foreign capital dumping, early-stage fund Seedfund's Co-founder Mahesh Murthy in a post on Monday said, "Flipkart, Ola, Snapdeal and many other Indian startups have entirely been set up on a copy-paste model". He added, "Copy-paste is dead. Accept it. We can innovate. We can be original. We don't need to be copy-pastes".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat files for $3 billion IPO
article: Five years after its launch, image messaging app Snap, previously called Snapchat, on Friday filed for IPO (Initial Public Offering) where it hopes to raise $3 billion. Snapchat is expected to go public in March this year at a valuation of nearly $25 billion. The app was launched in 2011 by former Stanford University students Evan Spiegel and Bobby Murphy.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Government to set up innovation fund for secondary education
article: Finance Minister Arun Jaitley while presenting the Union Budget on Wednesday announced that the government will set up an innovation fund for secondary education. The fund will support local innovations and support the Startup India ecosystem. He further said an 'Annual Learning Outcome' system will be introduced in schools to improve the quality of education while focussing on science education.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Cafe entirely run by robot opens in San Francisco
article: A startup founded by three college friends, 'Cafe X' has opened a coffee shop in San Francisco that is entirely run by one robot. The robot works inside a glass kiosk and uses beans from local coffee shops to create a variety of coffees. The customers can order coffee either through tablets placed on kiosks or through the cafe's app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Video: CEO explains Snapchat using pen & paper in 4 minutes
article: A three-year-old video shows messaging app Snapchat's Co-founder and CEO Evan Spiegel explaining the concept of the app using pen and paper in under four minutes. In the video, Spiegel describes how the internet works, what social media is and how pictures can be used for talking. "It's all about expressing yourself in the moment," Spiegel says in the video.

author: Tarun Khanna
abstract: Swamy seeks probe into Arnab Goswami’s Republic TV funding
article: BJP MP Subramanian Swamy has sought an investigation into the funding of journalist Arnab Goswami’s news channel 'Republic TV'. “Two money flows require investigation. First, from Singapore in $. Second from an Assam politician in rupees," he tweeted. This comes after Arnab changed the channel’s name from 'Republic' to 'Republic TV' as Swamy raised an objection to the word 'Republic'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ICICI Bank recommences transactions via Flipkart's PhonePe
article: ICICI Bank has allowed its customers to process UPI transactions via Flipkart-owned digital wallet app PhonePe. "The merchant has now adhered to the NPCI guidelines on interoperability by making the necessary corrections in its app," said the bank. Transactions through PhonePe were blocked by the bank accusing it of "restrictive practice" by allowing payments only through its own UPI handle.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ex-BSE CEO and Tata Group official Madhu Kannan joins Uber
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber on Thursday announced the appointment of former BSE CEO and Tata Group official Madhu Kannan as its Chief Business Officer, India and Emerging Markets. Kannan has previously worked as the Managing Director at Merrill Lynch and NYSE Group. The BITS Pilani graduate was the youngest CEO of any of the world's major stock exchanges.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Periscope adds 'Made in America by immigrants' stamp on app
article: Twitter-owned live video streaming app Periscope has added a stamp at the bottom of its loading screen that reads "Proudly made in America by immigrants." In a blog post, Periscope's Founders Kayvon Beykpour and Joe Bernstein wrote, "Periscope is built, maintained, and operated by people from many faiths and countries. Without immigrants and refugees, Periscope would not exist."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Birth of billion-dollar startups fell by 68% in 2016
article: According to a report by market intelligence company CB Insights, only 25 companies entered the league of unicorn startups with a $1 billion-plus valuation in 2016, down 68% from a year ago. Further, Google disclosed the acquisition of 18 companies in 2016, making it the top tech acquirer in terms of volume, with Salesforce and Accenture tying in second place.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twitter-owned ZipDial's Co-founder launches new startup
article: Amiya Pathak, the Co-founder of Twitter-owned marketing platform ZipDial, with former Zephyr Peacock MD Sachin Maheshwari has launched a fintech startup named EzCred. The platform connects lenders with businesses that want to offer credit to their customers at the point of sale. EzCred's Aadhaar-linked app enables instant loan approval at retail outlets.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Action taken against tricolour doormats sold on Amazon: Govt
article: Minister of State for External Affairs M J Akbar on Thursday confirmed that the government has taken action against the Indian tricolour-themed doormats being sold on Amazon. He added that the "issue went up to the owner, the person who runs Amazon, Jeff Bezos" but such things cannot be controlled as there is no international treaty pertaining to this.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Gaming firm Razer buys 'cloud-first' phone startup Nextbit
article: Gaming hardware maker Razer has announced its acquisition of Nextbit, the startup that made Robin smartphone with 100 GB of free cloud storage. Nextbit said it will stop selling Robin to work on more "rebellious" projects. The startup had raised $18 million in funding from Accel, GV and Dentsu, and received $1.36 million through crowdfunding from Kickstarter.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla unveils world’s largest battery storage plant
article: Elon Musk-led electric car maker Tesla on Monday unveiled the world's largest battery storage plant in California, installed in just 94 days. The plant contains 396 Tesla Powerpacks, each fitted with 16,000 lithium-ion battery cells. The plant produces enough energy to power 2,500 homes all day or 15,000 homes for four hours.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Delhi govt, BookMyShow launch online ticketing platform
article: Delhi Tourism has entered into an agreement with BookMyShow for an online ticketing platform for major tourist attractions in the capital. Online ticketing facilities are available for Dilli Haat and Garden of Five Senses, among others, as part of the pilot project. The government is "giving the tourism sector a digital push through this partnership," Tourism Minister Kapil Mishra said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber to continue ride-sharing in Karnataka despite govt ban
article: Ride-hailing app Uber in a press conference said it will continue ride-sharing in Karnataka despite the state government deeming the service illegal. Uber said the service isn't illegal and it will raise the issue with the state transport department. Karnataka's Transport Commissioner said action will be taken and cabs will be seized if cab aggregators don't comply with the rules.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes coin-sized wearable panic button
article: US-based startup Ripple has created a coin-sized panic button which gives wearers access to emergency services at all times. The button can be clicked once to receive a call from Ripple's team in situations when the user is walking home at night or lost in an unknown city. Clicking the button thrice activates an emergency response like sending an ambulance.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Dutch university's pod wins Musk's Hyperloop competition
article: Travel pod named 'Delft Hyperloop' made by students from the Netherlands-based Delft University of Technology has won Hyperloop's first ever competition organised by Elon Musk's space company SpaceX. The pod passed the safety and design tests and reached a speed of 94 kmph at the final run of the competition. A total of 29 teams took part in the competition.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IITs world's 4th largest producer of billion-dollar startups
article: Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs) have been ranked the world's fourth largest producer of billion-dollar startups, according to a study by UK-based accounting company Sage. IIT alumnus accounts for 12 billion-dollar startups including Flipkart, Snapdeal, ShopClues, Zomato and Ola. Stanford University topped the list with 51, followed by Harvard University and The University of California.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Immigrants don't deserve to be rejected: Musk on Trump order
article: Calling US President Donald Trump's decision to limit immigration from seven countries "not the best way to address the country's challenges", Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said immigrants don't deserve to be rejected. This comes a day after Musk was appointed to Trump's manufacturing council. Musk is also a part of Trump's Strategic and Policy Forum advising on economic matters.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm becomes a case study at Harvard Business School
article: The journey of Vijay Shekhar Sharma-led startup Paytm from an online recharge platform to a payments bank has become a case study at the Harvard Business School. Titled 'Paytm: Building a Payments Network’, the study will be available for teaching purposes within and outside Harvard. Founded in 2010, Alibaba-backed Paytm is one of the most funded startups in India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We do not support immigration ban, says Amazon's Jeff Bezos
article: Reacting to US President Donald Trump limiting immigration from seven nations, Amazon's Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos in an e-mail to his employees on Monday wrote, "This executive order is one we do not support". He further wrote, "We’re a nation of immigrants whose diverse backgrounds, ideas, and points of view helped us innovate as a nation for 240 years".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal investor joins Flipkart, Ola in capital dumping row
article: The Co-founder of Snapdeal investor Kalaari Capital, Vani Kola has joined homegrown startups Flipkart and Ola to hit out at foreign firms on their capital dumping practices. "Amazon and Uber weren’t around when these entrepreneurs were busy converting skeptics into customers," Kola wrote on her blog. "Being the first mover doesn’t give anyone entitlement to own the market," she added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup raises ₹4.6 cr to rebuild archaeological sites in VR
article: Australian startup Lithodomos VR has raised ₹4.6 crore in seed funding to rebuild archaeological sites in virtual reality. The virtual reconstructions of the sites will be used in the tourism, education, and entertainment industries. The startup was founded in 2016 by Simon Young, who recently submitted his PhD thesis in archaeology at the University of Melbourne.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: After Samsung, Xiaomi skips Mobile World Congress this year
article: After Samsung confirmed to skip the Mobile World Congress, China's Xiaomi has also decided to not attend the telecom industry's largest event beginning from February 27 in Barcelona this year. Xiaomi took to the stage during last year's event to introduce its flagship smartphone Mi5. This comes after Global Vice President Hugo Barra quit Xiaomi and joined Facebook this month.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SpaceX builds 1.5-km long vacuum tube for Hyperloop pod race
article: Elon Musk-led SpaceX has built a 1.5-km long vacuum tube close to its headquarters in California for a Hyperloop pod competition between 30 teams from across the world. Musk announced his plan for Hyperloop, a futuristic transport system with speeds of over 1125 kmph, in 2013. Most teams are based out of universities including MIT's Hyperloop and Berkeley University's Bloop.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Army veteran-turned-entrepreneur runs military gear e-shop
article: A retired captain in the Indian Army, Captain Chethan YK in 2009 founded a premium e-commerce platform for military gear named 'Olive Planet'. Chethan says that the name, ‘Olive Planet’ was inspired by the ‘Olive Green’ colour, often the colour for many Army-related goods and products. The startup also has a retail store in Bengaluru, which also functions as warehouse.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola, Uber ride-sharing to shut in Karnataka from February 3
article: The Karnataka government has given cab aggregating apps Ola and Uber three days until Thursday, to withdraw their ride-sharing services after they were deemed illegal in the state. According to the government, Ola and Uber have contract carriage permits, which do not allow the companies to pick up and drop passengers during the course of a trip.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk joins Trump manufacturing council with Dell, Ford CEOs
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has been appointed to US President Donald Trump's manufacturing council, led by Dow Chemical CEO Andrew Liveris. Other members of the council include Intel CEO Brian Krzanich, Dell CEO and Founder Michael Dell, and Ford CEO Mark Fields. Musk is also part of Trump's Strategic and Policy Forum, which advises on economic matters.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fitbit to fire 110 employees to reduce costs
article: US-based wearables maker Fitbit on Monday announced that  in order to reduce costs, it will be firing 6% of its workforce affecting 110 employees. Fitbit also shared its preliminary fourth quarter results for 2016, where it said that it had sold fewer wearables than expected during the year. Fitbit recently acquired two smartwatch startups namely Pebble and Vector.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: US' 2nd largest startup Airbnb posts profit for first time
article: Room-rental startup Airbnb, which is the second largest startup of US after Uber, has reportedly made its first profit in the second half of 2016. The startup's revenue increased more than 80% during 2016, the report added. Airbnb, which has a valuation of $30 billion, was founded nine years ago and has raised nearly $3 billion in funding.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Musk seeks recommendations on amendments to Trump's order
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who is also a member of US President Donald Trump's economic advisory council, on Monday took to Twitter to seek recommendations on amendments to Trump's order on immigration. "Will seek advisory council consensus & present to President," tweeted Musk. His tweet comes after Trump signed an order banning visitors from seven Muslim-majority nations for three months.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Arnab Goswami renames Republic after Swamy's complaint
article: Former Times Now Editor-in-chief Arnab Goswami has changed the name of his venture 'Republic' to 'Republic TV'. This comes a week after Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy filed a complaint against the usage of the word 'Republic' for commercial purpose, claiming it would breach the Emblems and Names Act. Republic TV may go live before UP Assembly elections, reports said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Airbnb announces free housing to anyone not allowed in US
article: Responding to US President Donald Trump's immigration ban order, homestay startup Airbnb's Co-founder and CEO Brian Chesky on Sunday tweeted, "Airbnb is providing free housing to refugees and anyone not allowed in the US". Chesky had earlier tweeted, "Open doors brings all of US together. Closing doors further divides US. Let's all find ways to connect people, not separate them."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber's $3mn fund to help drivers affected by immigration ban
article: Uber's CEO Travis Kalanick has announced to set up a $3 million legal defence fund to help drivers affected by US President Donald Trump's executive order on immigration. Kalanick, who is also a member of Trump’s Strategic and Policy Forum, called the immigration ban "wrong and unjust". He said he will raise the issue when he meets Trump on Friday.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: We'll compensate drivers impacted by Trump's order: Uber CEO
article: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick has said the company will compensate drivers impacted by US President Trump's immigration order if they are travelling outside US. Uber hopes to "mitigate financial stress...with supporting their families and putting food on the table," he added. Kalanick added he will raise this issue when he meets Trump for a business advisory group meeting next week.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ex-Hyperloop Co-founder begins new high-speed travel startup
article: The former Co-founder and CTO of Hyperloop One, Brogan BamBrogan, has started a new venture named 'Arrivo' that will build a 21st-century high-speed transportation system for passengers and freight. The new venture's technology will be based on the Hyperloop architecture. BamBrogan had quit Hyperloop last year and sued the company of harassment and violation of the labour laws.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon expands grocery delivery service to 14 Indian cities
article: E-commerce major Amazon has expanded its grocery and household items delivery service called 'Amazon Pantry' to 14 Indian cities including Delhi, Bengaluru, Mumbai and Pune. Until now, the service was only available in Hyderabad where it was launched as a pilot in July last year. Amazon said it will expand the service to more cities in the coming months.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: We shouldn't demonise Trump voters, says Y Combinator head
article: Encouraging tech companies to take a stand against US President Donald Trump's policies, startup accelerator Y Combinator's President Sam Altman on Saturday said, "We should not demonise Trump voters." He added that the movement against Trump requires the eventual support of his voters which "we will not get if we further isolate them."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: #DeleteUber goes viral as US Uber drivers work during strike
article: The hashtag #DeleteUber has gone viral on Twitter with people deleting the ride-hailing app and sharing screenshots as Uber drivers did not join a taxi strike at a US airport on Sunday. The New York Taxi Workers Alliance had called an hour-long strike against US President Donald Trump's immigration ban. Uber employs around 36,000 drivers in New York.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Pak startup develops arm sleeve which detects chucking
article: A Pakistani startup has developed CricFlex, a wearable technology that can detect the legality of a bowler's action by measuring the angle of the elbow tilt in a bowler's action in real time. The device consists of several motion sensors that send readings to an application immediately after the bowler's delivery.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Snapchat may publicly file for IPO next week to raise $4 bn
article: Snapchat plans to reveal financial statements and other disclosures for its initial public offering by next week, according to reports. It will be the company's first public disclosure of its finances as it aims to raise as much as $4 billion in its IPO. Snapchat has already filed its information privately with the US Securities and Exchange Commission.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: User claims Snapchat Spectacles case melted while charging
article: A user of Snapchat's Spectacles has claimed that the case of the smart glasses melted while on charge. "I got a burning smell, it had melted the internals...Luckily, the Spectacles weren't inside the case, so they didn't go the same route as a Note 7," said the user. Snapchat replaced the Spectacles and has recalled the melted case for investigation.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Former CRISIL executive joins MobiKwik as Business Head
article: Indian digital wallet startup MobiKwik has appointed former CRISIL executive Bikram Bir Singh as its Business Head. Singh has 15 years of experience in Business Development and Sales Management across CRISIL Ratings, Citibank and ICICI Bank. Last month, MobiKwik hired Vineet Singh, former Executive Vice President of 99acres, as its Chief Business Officer.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Girnar Software to fire 136 employees to cut costs
article: Consumer internet firm Girnar Software, which runs auto portals like CarDekho, Gaadi, and Zigwheels, is firing 136 employees as part of restructuring exercise to cut costs. The exercise is aimed at becoming profitable by first quarter of next fiscal, as promised to the board. Employees with structurally negative unit economics were identified for job cut, said company's CEO Amit Jain.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart CEO now left with 3 senior leaders as two more quit
article: Flipkart's new CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy is left with just three senior leaders to steer the day-to-day operations after two more senior executives quit Flipkart this week. The two engineering heads, Hari Vasudev and Ashish Agrawal, join three others who quit Flipkart earlier this month. At least 12 leaders at the second-highest executive rank have quit Flipkart over the past year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Cisco buys IPO-headed firm founded by IIT alumnus for $3.7bn
article: Cisco has announced its acquisition of AppDynamics, founded by IIT Delhi alumnus Jyoti Bansal, for $3.7 billion (₹25,000 crore) a day before the startup's IPO was slated to be priced. The IPO would have valued the applications management company at $1.9 billion (about ₹13,000 crore). AppDynamics' largest shareholders, Greylock Partners and Lightspeed Venture Partners, own 20.8% of the company.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: After music startup, card game company offers Obama a job
article: Party game maker Cards Against Humanity has offered former US President Barack Obama a job as its CEO in a job posting. The listing calls for "experience hunting terrorist masterminds" and ideally, a Nobel Peace Prize. Music streaming startup Spotify had also offered Obama a job as its 'President of Playlists' after he created a popular music playlist.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Without tunnels, we'll be in traffic hell forever: Elon Musk
article: Terming being stuck in traffic as "soul-destroying", Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said, "Without tunnels, we will all be in traffic hell forever". He added, "Self-driving cars will make it worse by making vehicle travel more affordable". Musk has been tweeting about tunnels for a month, and even suggested he might start a tunnel-digging firm called 'The Boring Company'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bag of chips that detects alcohol and orders Uber created
article: Chips brand Tostitos and Uber have created a smart bag of chips that detects alcohol from a person's breath and orders a cab to avoid drunk driving. The bag is equipped with a sensor connected to a microcontroller to trace alcohol. The bag communicates over NFC and allows owners to order an Uber by tapping their phone against it.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Faraday Future sued for ₹12.2 crore over unpaid dues
article: Electric carmaker and Tesla rival Faraday Future has been sued for ₹12.2 crore by visual effects studio The Mill Group over unpaid dues. The studio, which made a graphical presentation of the startup's first car FF 91, alleges it received only ₹13 lakh from Faraday against the agreed ₹12.42 crore. Faraday's payment to the company was due in October 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Xiaomi's Hugo Barra joins Facebook to lead its VR efforts
article: Chinese electronics maker Xiaomi's former Global Vice President Hugo Barra, who quit the company on January 22, is joining Facebook to lead its virtual reality efforts, including the Oculus team. "Hugo shares my belief that virtual and augmented reality will be the next major computing platform," said Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg. Previously, Barra helped in developing Android at Google.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola, Uber may have to shut ride-sharing service in Karnataka
article: Ola and Uber may have to withdraw ride-sharing services in Karnataka after state transport commissioner deemed the services illegal. The transport department said ride-hailing services have contract carriage permits, which don't allow them to pick up and drop passengers during the course of the ride. Bengaluru is one of Ola and Uber's top three markets apart from Delhi and Mumbai.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Alibaba posts 54% jump in Q3 revenue to $7.76 billion
article: China's Alibaba on Tuesday reported a net income of $2.57 billion in Q3 2016 with total revenue of $7.76 billion, up 54% from a year ago. The primary source of Alibaba's revenue was its core commerce businesses- online marketplace Taobao and business-to-consumer website T-Mall. Cloud computing was one of its fastest growing revenue streams, with a revenue jump of 115%.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes tiles that generate electricity from footsteps
article: London-based startup Pavegen has made floor tiles that harness kinetic energy from footsteps to generate electricity. Every footstep can power about 20 seconds of light on an LED fitment. Further, the startup provides data like heat mapping and step counting. Pavegen claims to be powering South Korean vehicle manufacturer Kia's factories and football pitches in Nigeria.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Send Rex on a one-way trip to Mars, Twitter user asks Musk
article: After Elon Musk supported US President Donald Trump's State Secretary pick Rex Tillerson, a Twitter user asked Musk, "Can you please send him on a one-way trip to Mars?" Another said, "We're kind of depending on you to save the world." "Please hurry with Space X. I gotta get off this planet before Trump kills it," tweeted another.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup raises ₹110 cr for coating to make sauce slide out
article: MIT spinoff startup LiquiGlide has raised $16 million (approximately ₹110 crore) to make its patented slippery coatings that make products like ketchup and toothpaste easily slide out of their containers. LiquiGlide's Co-founders claim that such a coating will also eliminate the need to wash out containers. The startup made its debut at MIT's business plan competition 'MIT $100K' in 2012.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Japanese startup working to convert used clothes into fuel
article: Japanese startup Jeplan is working to extract cotton fibre from used apparel and convert it to fuel. The startup says that a ton of junked clothing can generate about 700 litres of ethanol. Jeplan has raised about $13 million since it was founded in 2007 and counts Docomo and venture capital firm Jafco among its investors.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Users complain Xiaomi tracker doesn’t work on black people
article: Users of Xiaomi's Mi Band 2 fitness tracker have complained that the device does not work on black people or dark skin. According to users, the device can't pick up accurate heart rates unless it is placed on lighter parts of their skin like the palm. Users also said placing a sheet of paper between the band and skin works.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zuckerberg’s philanthropy organisation buys AI startup Meta
article: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and his wife Priscilla Chan's philanthropic organisation, The Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, has acquired startup Meta. It has developed an AI (Artificial Intelligence) based tool that helps scientists read, understand and prioritise millions of scientific papers. The initiative said that it will be offering the startup's services and features for free to all researchers.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup that makes breathalyser ordered to make full refunds
article: US-based startup Breathometer, that created a smartphone-connected device to monitor blood-alcohol content has been ordered by a federal agency to offer full refunds to users for deceptive advertising. The startup, which also made an appearance on TV show Shark Tank, made false claims about the effectiveness of its products and that they were proven by "government-lab grade testing."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Got laser eye surgery to survive the world's end: Reddit CEO
article: Social media platform Reddit's CEO and Co-founder Steve Huffman has said that he got corrective laser eye surgery to survive the world's end. "If the world ends...getting contacts or glasses is going to be a huge pain in the ass...Without them, I'm f**ked," he said. The 33-year-old also admits to stocking guns and food to prepare for such a scenario.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Alibaba’s local commerce platform Koubei raises $1.1 billion
article: China's Alibaba has announced that its affiliate focused on enabling local commerce Koubei raised $1.1 billion (₹7,500 crore) in equity financing led by Silver Lake, Yunfeng Capital and Primavera Capital. The Wall Street Journal had reported that Koubei would be valued at nearly $8 billion (₹54,475 crore) after fresh funding. The round marks Koubei's first funding from external investors.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla sues ex-Autopilot Director over stolen company secrets
article: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla has sued former Director of its driver-assist technology Autopilot, Sterling Anderson, accusing him of stealing the company's secret information. Tesla accused Anderson of trying to recruit at least a dozen former Tesla colleagues and build a new car startup. Anderson started working on his new autonomous-car venture Aurora Innovation in 2016.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: BookMyShow buys Hyderabad's MastiTickets in all-cash deal
article: Online ticket booking platform BookMyShow has announced its acquisition of Hyderabad-based MastiTickets in an all-cash deal. MastiTickets will transfer its key assets and existing cinema partnerships to BookMyShow. Launched in 2007, BookMyShow was valued at ₹3,000 crore at the time of its last funding in July 2016 in which it raised over ₹550 crore from Network 18 and Accel Partners.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Wi-Fi video streaming camera Dropcam's Founder joins Apple
article: The Co-founder of American Wi-Fi video streaming camera startup Dropcam, which was acquired by Google subsidiary Nest in 2014 for $555 million, Greg Duffy has joined Apple. The move comes after Duffy reportedly accused Nest founder Tony Fadell of "holding back all progress" of his products. Duffy quit Nest but served nearly eight months at Google.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: In a first, logistics startup Shadowfax hires women riders
article: In a first for the industry, hyperlocal delivery startup Shadowfax has inducted women riders to its fleet. About 50 women have started delivering food parcels and e-commerce consignments in select areas of Mumbai and Bengaluru, said Co-founder Abhishek Bansal. Shadowfax started the pilot project with women riders in August last year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk praises US State Secy pick Rex Tillerson
article: Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted his support for US President Donald Trump's State Secretary pick Rex Tillerson, suggesting that he might promote action on climate change. Musk tweeted that the ex-ExxonMobil CEO "supports a carbon tax...This is what is really needed to move the needle," to which a user replied, "He is also a decorated friend of murderer Vladimir Putin."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fidelity slashes Flipkart's valuation to $5.5 billion
article: US-based mutual fund Fidelity Investments has marked down the valuation of its holdings in Flipkart by over a third, bringing down Flipkart's valuation to $5.5 billion. This markdown of 36% by Fidelity is its biggest till date, and fourth overall. In November 2016, mutual fund Morgan Stanley slashed Flipkart's valuation to $5.59 billion, down from $15 billion a year ago.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App turns travellers' leftover currency to gift vouchers
article: Malaysia-based startup AppyKoins has developed an app called WorldKoins that lets travellers convert their leftover foreign currency to gift cards and vouchers to shop online. Travellers can drop off their unspent currency at any of the app's local partner. The money is then transferred to user's account on the app, from where the user can shop online.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber names Pradeep Parameswaran as central operations head
article: Ride-hailing app Uber's India unit has appointed Pradeep Parameswaran as head of its central operations. Parameswaran comes to Uber with more than 15 years of experience with companies like DEN Networks, McKinsey, and Hindustan Unilever. Till September last year, Uber India's employees had grown almost eight times from the year before, from 80 to more than 600.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: It’s time to 'Trump' discrimination, says NestAway
article: Home rental startup NestAway’s cheeky new campaign, coinciding with US President Donald Trump’s swearing in, urges everyone to ‘trump’ discrimination. “The campaign is based on our philosophy of providing homes that don’t discriminate,” said NestAway Co-founder Amarendra Sahu. He added that the ad was topical and relevant as the brand’s ideals resonated with America’s founding principles of freedom and equality.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart's PhonePe app hits out at ICICI Bank in blog post
article: Flipkart-owned payments app PhonePe, which completed a year of launch last week, hit out at ICICI Bank in a blog post for blocking its transactions on its platform since January 13. "First the 'bad' happened! Then the 'ugliness' started," PhonePe wrote in the post, saying that NPCI has no direct legal jurisdiction to 'direct' PhonePe or Flipkart to do anything.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Xiaomi's Global Vice President Hugo Barra quits
article: Xiaomi's Global Vice President, Hugo Barra, has announced to quit the company. Barra, who served for 3.5 years at Xiaomi, said, "The last few years of living in a singular environment have taken huge toll on my life and started affecting my health". He added, "I'll take some much-needed time off before embarking on new adventure back in Silicon Valley".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber to launch its food delivery app UberEATs in India
article: Uber on Monday announced that it will soon be launching its standalone food delivery app UberEATs in India. Uber will partner with local restaurants to list their menu on the app and will have registered couriers to deliver the food. Uber first tested its food delivery service in 2014 in Los Angeles, and currently runs it in 58 cities worldwide.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes drone that can survive a car passing over it
article: Russian startup Aerodyne RC has developed a ₹13,000 drone named 'Nimbus 195' that can even survive a car passing over it. The drone, with a full carbon fibre monocoque body, is weatherproof and can fly up to speeds of 160 kmph. It provides a flight time of three to ten minutes once it is fully charged.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App provides solution on clicking photo of algebra equations
article: US-based startup Socratic run by engineers including one of Indian-origin, has launched an artificial intelligence (AI) app that provides solutions to algebra equations by just clicking a picture of questions. The app reads both math and science questions - even handwritten ones - and gives students step-by-step solutions. It also shows graphs, videos and definitions to support the solutions.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon India leased over 1 million sq ft work space in 2016
article: E-commerce major Amazon's Indian arm leased more than a million square feet of office space last year, according to a report by property consultant Colliers International. The properties include spaces in Delhi, Gurugram, Noida, Mumbai and Hyderabad. Amazon leased equal to or more space last year than it did between 2008 and 2015, the report added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola COO Pranay Jivrajka replaced by PepsiCo veteran Kaul
article: Ride-hailing app Ola's Chief Operating Officer Pranay Jivrajka has stepped down from his position and PepsiCo veteran Vishal Kaul has taken over Jivrajka's role. The company's first employee, Jivrajka, has been given the new role of founding partner. He will work closely with Co-founder and CEO Bhavish Aggarwal to lead strategic initiatives.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ed-tech startup Cuemath raises ₹102 crore from Alphabet
article: Bengaluru-based ed-tech startup Cuemath has raised  ₹102 crore ($15 million) in Series B round of funding led by Alphabet's equity investment fund CapitalG (formerly known as Google Capital). Existing investor Sequoia India also participated in the round. Founded in 2011, Cuemath provides after-school maths learning program for students from grades LKG to 8.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Infosys has infused $62 mn in startups from its $500 mn fund
article: Infosys has invested over $62 million in more than 12 startups from its $500 million Innovation fund operating in spaces such as IoT, automation, and drones. The funded startups include  Stellaris Venture Partners, Unsilo, Trifacta, Cloudyn, and TidalScale. Set up with an initial corpus of $100 million in 2013, the fund was expanded to $500 million in 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I could've chosen my words better: Paytm CEO on viral video
article: Responding to Paytm's annual party video that went viral showing him saying cuss words, CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma posted on Facebook, "I could have chosen some words better". Sharma said he was energised by the spirit of his team who works hard everyday to serve the customers. He added, "I have never taken anything for granted and won’t ever either".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Driver in fatal Tesla crash had 7 secs to react, says report
article: The driver killed in a car crash last year while Tesla's Autopilot was active had at least seven seconds to take action before impact, claims a recently concluded investigation by the US government. Even though the tractor trailer had been visible to the driver, he "took no braking, steering, or other actions," added the report.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: World's longest range electric car travels 539 km per charge
article: Elon Musk-led carmaker Tesla's Model S has become the world's longest range electric car that travels up to 539 kilometres on a single charge. This comes after adding a '100D' battery pack, giving the car an extra range of 32 kilometres. The Model S 100D still hits 250 kmph top speed and goes from 0-100 kmph in 4.2 seconds.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber to pay ₹136 crore for misleading drivers about earnings
article: Taxi-hailing service Uber has agreed to pay ₹136 crore ($20 million) in a settlement with the US government for misleading drivers about how much they could earn through its platform. The startup also made exaggerated claims as to how affordable its vehicle financing plans were. In certain states, less than 10% drivers earned the amount advertised by Uber.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Y Combinator head makes site to track Trump's 1st 100 days
article: Y Combinator President Sam Altman and his team have developed a website called Track Trump to monitor whether Donald Trump delivers on his campaign promises in the first 100 days of presidency. The website tracks Trump's progress in eight categories including immigration, trade, and health care that the US President had outlined in "Donald Trump's Contract with the American Voter."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Former Google Search head Amit Singhal joins Uber
article: Uttar Pradesh-born former head of Google Search Amit Singhal has announced his appointment as Uber's Senior Vice President of Engineering. Singhal, who worked at Google for 15 years, shared a picture of himself with Uber CEO Travis Kalanick captioned, "Catching the next ride of my professional journey with @travisk at @Uber." He will also help grow the startup's self-driving program.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New ₹3,400 kit lets men test fertility through smartphone
article: A US-based startup has developed a ₹3,400 home kit called 'YO sperm' that lets men test their fertility through their smartphone. The kit includes a sample collection cup, a testing slide, a plastic pipette, a special liquefying powder and a mini microscope. The mini microscope attaches to the smartphone's camera to measure the sperm mobility.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber is a geek's candy store: Ex-Google Search head Singhal
article: Announcing his appointment as the Senior Vice President of Engineering at Uber, Former Google Search head Amit Singhal said in a blog post that "Uber is a geek's candy store." The India-born software engineer added that the startup has "one of the most challenging computer science problems I have encountered in my thirty-year career."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: LeEco CEO apologises for 'inapt' comment on firm's stock
article: LeEco CEO Jia Yueting has apologised for making "inappropriate" comments about boosting the share price of LeEco's main listed subsidiary Leshi. "Hope everyone could pool their efforts to bring the price to 100 yuan (about ₹990)," Yueting had told the investors. Leshi's shares climbed as much as 8% to a two-month high after Yueting's apology.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Some US Uber drivers set up camps in parking lots after work
article: Some Uber drivers in the US set up camps in parking lots once their shift ends, to maximise their time and drive extra riders before starting the morning commute, Bloomberg reports. This helps them to make extra money besides their fixed shift timings. "With Uber, people make their own decisions about when, where and how long to drive," says Uber.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Photo-sharing app Timehop Co-founder quits to join Snapchat
article: Co-founder of photo-sharing app Timehop Jonathan Wegener has left the company to join rival Snapchat. Timehop, which has raised about ₹96 crore, shows users reminders of photos and other content that they shared have on social media platforms like Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. Wegener said in a blog, "Snapchat more than anyone else today understands how users think about photos."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Crowdfunding campaign for adoption app suspended
article: Crowdfunding platform Kickstarter has suspended the campaign for 'Adoptly', an app that lets prospective parents use a Tinder-like interface to swipe left or right on pictures of children up for adoption. Adoptly allowed users to filter children by race and gender among other characteristics. The campaign's 16 backers who had pledged a total of $4,000 (₹2.7 lakh) will be refunded.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: NPCI tells Flipkart's PhonePe app to adhere to UPI norms
article: After ICICI Bank refused to follow National Payments Corporation of India's (NPCI) advice to unblock Flipkart's payments app PhonePe from its platform, the corporation asked PhonePe to adhere to UPI norms. ICICI Bank had alleged that PhonePe allows users of only its own UPI handle to make payments via the app. The bank wanted Flipkart to end the “restrictive practice”.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ICICI rejects NPCI call to unblock Flipkart's PhonePe
article: The ICICI Bank has refused National Payments Corporation of India's (NPCI) call to unblock Flipkart's digital wallet PhonePe from its platform. ICICI Bank said PhonePe allows users of only its own UPI handle to make payments via the app, and called it a “restrictive practice". As per UPI guidelines, customers of any bank can use any UPI-based app for payments.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla knew drivers would misuse Autopilot, reveals US govt
article: According to a report released by the US government, electric carmaker Tesla knew that drivers would misuse its semi-autonomous Autopilot mode and tested all possible scenarios. "Tesla considered that drivers might fail to pay attention, fall asleep, or become incapacitated," said the report. Tesla has been cleared of any fault in a fatal accident involving its Autopilot system last year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Vendors lodge FIR against Voonik over ₹2.44 cr unpaid dues
article: A group of Surat-based garment sellers has lodged an FIR against online fashion retailer Voonik for alleged non-payment of about ₹2.44 crore. Voonik has denied the claims and has filed a civil defamation suit against the vendors for maligning its reputation in the local media in Gujarat. It has also sought ₹10 lakh in compensation from the vendors.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rocket Internet raises $1 billion to fund internet startups
article: German Venture Capital company Rocket Internet has raised $1 billion in a new fund to invest in internet startups globally. The new fund will make early-stage and growth-equity investments in startups focused on marketplaces, e-commerce, financial technology, software and travel. In India, Rocket Internet has backed startups like Foodpanda, Jabong and FabFurnish.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla beats world's fastest electric car by 0.001 second
article: Tesla's latest update 'Ludicrous Plus mode' to its Tesla S model made the car accelerate from 0-100 kmph in only 2.389 seconds. This beat the world's fastest production electric car Faraday Future's FF 91 record of 2.39 seconds by just a thousandth of a second. Earlier, Tesla Co-founder Elon Musk tweeted that even 2.34 seconds is achievable by the company.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mark Zuckerberg questioned in court over VR technology theft
article: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg was questioned in court on Tuesday regarding a case where video game company ZeniMax has sued Facebook-owned VR firm Oculus for stealing its technology. Zuckerberg defended Oculus, saying, "I've never even heard of ZeniMax before". ZeniMax has accused Oculus Co-founder of creating a "false and fanciful" story that he built the technology in his parents' garage.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We're not Uber, Amazon wannabe, says Droom Founder
article: Used as well as new automobile marketplace, Droom's Founder and CEO Sandeep Aggarwal in an interview on Wednesday said, "There's nothing like Droom, in my view, anywhere globally. We're the original thinkers. I'm sorry but we're not Uber or Amazon wannabe." Founded in 2014, Droom in June last year raised nearly ₹200 crore in funding led by VC firm Beenext.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mumbai-based home services startup Taskbob shuts down
article: Mumbai-based home services startup Taskbob, which raised ₹38 crore from IvyCap Ventures and Orios Venture Partners, shut down on Thursday after two years of operations. Taskbob's Co-founder Aseem Khare in an email wrote, "A solid business is created only by building scalability & profitability. To achieve those in a low margin business and a tough external market proved unexpectedly daunting".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Which are the billion-dollar startups of India?
article: India has eight billion-dollar startups, led by e-commerce marketplace Flipkart with a valuation of $16 billion, according to analytics platform CB Insights. Flipkart is followed by rival Snapdeal and ride-hailing app Ola, with valuations of $7 billion and $5 billion respectively. Digital wallet Paytm ranks fourth among the country's billion-dollar startups with a valuation of $4.83 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Waited 3 months for $5,000 loan for first business: Jack Ma
article: China's largest e-commerce company Alibaba's Founder, Jack Ma, on Wednesday said that it took him three months to borrow $5,000 from the bank in order to start his first business in China in 1992. "We can make technology very inclusive that every small company can use it," he added. "This is my dream," Ma further said.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Other nations didn't take jobs, it's your strategy: Ma to US
article: Alibaba Chairman Jack Ma has said, “It’s not that other countries steal American jobs; it is your strategy, that you did not distribute the money in a proper way.” “In the past 30 years, America has had 13 wars...That’s where the money went,” he stated. Ma's statement follows claims of US jobs being stolen by countries like China and India.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Kaleja diya, jaan di, sab kuch laga diya: Paytm CEO at party
article: A recent video from digital payments startup Paytm's annual office party shows its Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma saying, "2017 will be ours, kaise nahi hoga? Humne kaleja diya, khoon diya, jaan di, sab kuch laga diya." Talking about the success of the company, Sharma added that Paytm has done in one year what others couldn't do in 10.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Won't fight payments bank interest rate war, says Paytm CEO
article: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma, who is looking to launch Paytm Payments Bank in February, said his bank will not fight interest rate war with rivals. It will compete on the basis of return on yields, and services provided to customers, Sharma said. "Payments bank is an opportunity to give a new business model to the banking world," he added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart launches SOS button for safety of delivery staff
article: E-commerce platform Flipkart has launched an SOS feature on the mobile app meant for its delivery staff which will alert the nearest field executives in case of an emergency. The project has been titled 'Nanjunda' after a delivery man who was murdered in Bengaluru last month by a gym trainer who did not have money to pay for his order.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon fires worker for 'Uncle Adolf' note to Jewish woman
article: An Amazon employee in London has reportedly been fired for leaving a note saying "Greetings from Uncle Adolf" in a package to a Jewish customer. The package was taken for forensic testing and the incident is being investigated as a hate crime. A friend of the customer claimed that Amazon took action against the worker only after social media outrage.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: NPCI asks ICICI to stop blocking Flipkart's PhonePe
article: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), the developer of the interface that allows customers to transfer money across banks, has asked ICICI Bank to stop blocking transactions from Flipkart’s payments app PhonePe. Nearly a week ago, ICICI had temporarily blocked transactions from PhonePe, pending the resolution of its concerns related to restrictive practices followed by the app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zivame CEO Richa Kar steps away from daily operations
article: Lingerie startup Zivame's Founder and CEO, Richa Kar, has stepped away from the day-to-day business operations. Shaleen Sinha, who became the Chief Operating Officer in November 2015, has taken over, in what is being called an investor-led rejig. "Richa Kar continues to be the CEO. She works closely with the board on strategic projects for the company," said a spokesperson.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon India selling skateboards with image of Lord Ganesha
article: E-commerce company Amazon's India website is selling skateboards bearing the image of Lord Ganesha. The platform has also been found selling flip-flops with Gandhiji's picture on them and Indian tricolour-themed shoes. Amazon recently removed doormats featuring the Indian flag from its Canada website after being reprimanded by External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 6 ex-Huawei employees arrested for leaking secrets to LeEco
article: Six former employees of Chinese smartphone maker Huawei have been arrested by the authorities after the company accused them of leaking secrets to rival LeEco. The six employees currently work for Chinese telecom equipment company Coolpad, a subsidiary of LeEco. The company has said that Huawei's claims are "pure rumour.”

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US spent $14 tn on wars instead of infrastructure: Jack Ma
article: During the ongoing World Economic Forum's annual meeting in Davos, Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba's Founder Jack Ma said, "In the past 30 years, the US had 13 wars, spending $14.2 trillion...What if they spent a part of that money on building infrastructure?" He added, "No matter how strategically good it is, you're supposed to spend money on your own people".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: She's the victim of a witch hunt: VC on Theranos' Founder
article: Noted venture capitalist Tim Draper has defended blood test startup Theranos' Founder Elizabeth Holmes by saying, "I believe Elizabeth is the victim of a witch hunt." Draper also accused a journalist of accepting a $4 million bribe to defame Holmes. Her fortune was cut from $4.5 billion to nothing in 2016 after facing lawsuits questioning the accuracy of Theranos' tests.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We are worried about a slowdown in IT, says Naukri CEO
article: Online recruitment classifieds platform, Naukri's CEO Hitesh Oberoi while talking about India's job scenario in a recent interview said, "We are worried about a slowdown in IT". He added, "Growth for the last six to eight quarters has been driven largely by IT sectors, internet services and e-commerce. Now we see banking, financial services and pharma also picking up".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon, Flipkart drop $1 bn Souq acquisition bid: Report
article: E-commerce majors Amazon and Flipkart have reportedly walked way from a bid to acquire Dubai-based e-commerce platform Souq after disagreeing over price. Amazon had entered acquisition talks with Souq last year in a deal that would have been worth about $1 billion. Souq became the highest valued internet company in the Middle East after raising $275 million in February 2016.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon removes flip-flops featuring Mahatma Gandhi's picture
article: E-commerce platform Amazon has removed the listing for flip-flops that featured Mahatma Gandhi's picture from its US website. The platform has also been found selling Indian tricolour-themed shoes and skateboards bearing the image of Lord Ganesha. Amazon recently removed doormats featuring the Indian flag from its Canada website after being reprimanded by External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup once worth $9 billion shuts last blood-testing lab
article: One-drop blood test company Theranos, which was once worth $9 billion, is closing down its last remaining blood-testing facility after the lab reportedly failed a regulatory inspection. The US-based startup's Founder Elizabeth Holmes was banned from operating a medical laboratory for two years in 2016 after US' health agency declared that Theranos had put patients in "immediate danger".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart's valuation slashed to $9.9 billion by investor
article: Homegrown e-commerce major Flipkart's valuation has been marked down by 4% to about $9.9 billion by US-based mutual fund investor T Rowe Price. The investor had invested about $100 million in Flipkart in December 2014, when the firm raised $700 million in funding. Flipkart’s valuation came down by almost a third after frequent valuation markdowns by investors in 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: People criticise us but we're happy about progress: Jack Ma
article: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba's Founder Jack Ma on Wednesday said, "Whether people criticise me, criticise us, the most important thing is that we are happy about the progress we’ve made". On counterfeit goods, Ma said, "Fighting against fake products is a war against human greediness". He added, "It’s not easy and you can’t finish it".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SpaceX tweets picture of Falcon 9 rocket landing
article: Elon Musk-led aerospace manufacturer SpaceX has tweeted a photograph of the Falcon 9 reusable rocket's landing from January 14. The mission, which delivered 10 satellites into orbit, marked the seventh rocket recovered overall by SpaceX, and the first since its rocket exploded on the launch pad while being fuelled in September.

author: Anmol Sharma
abstract: Alibaba becomes major sponsor of Olympic Games until 2028
article: Chinese e-commerce company Alibaba on Thursday became the major sponsor of Olympic Games, after signing a deal with the International Olympic Committee (IOC) that runs until 2028.
