Alibaba will be the official e-commerce and cloud services partner of Olympic Games until 2028, and it joins 12 other companies including Coca-Cola and McDonald's as the top Olympic sponsors.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: App lets users swipe left, right on pics of adoptable kids
article: US-based startup Adoptly has created a smartphone app that lets prospective parents use a Tinder-like interface to swipe left or right on pictures of children up for adoption. Adoptly lets users filter adoptable children by age, race and gender among other characteristics. The startup also requires the parents to undergo background checks.

author: Rini Kapoor
abstract: Startup developing device to identify diseases from voice
article: US-based startup Canary Speech is using machine learning to develop a way of analysing conversations to identify a number of diseases, including Parkinson's, Alzheimer's and dementia. After examining patients' speech patterns, the startup has developed algorithms based on signs such as softening of voice and quality of speech in order to identify several neurological and cognitive diseases.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: CommonFloor founders quit Quikr a year after acquisition
article: All three Co-founders of real estate portal CommonFloor, namely Vikas Malpani, Lalit Mangal and Sumit Jain, have quit Quikr a year after their startup was acquired by the latter. "CommonFloor founding team is moving on to their next endeavour and we wish them all the best in future journey," said Quikr. CommonFloor founders said they're leaving to pursue other interests.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Man stranded as Tesla lock refuses to open with smartphone
article: A man named Ryan Negri was stranded at Red Rock Canyon on Sunday after his Tesla car's smart lock refused to open using his phone. Negri claimed the lock didn't open as the phone was unable to catch a signal. Negri's wife ran three kilometres after which her phone received a signal and she got the car's key from home.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes heated blanket that also charges phone
article: US-based startup Rumpl has created 'Rumpl Puffe', a ₹17,000 portable battery-heated blanket that can also charge a mobile phone. The blanket's battery can be charged in only 90 minutes and it can charge a phone for up to four times. The blanket can remain heated for up to 10 hours and its battery can also be used as a flashlight.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Passenger on board a plane captures SpaceX launch in video
article: A passenger on board a commercial flight successfully captured Elon Musk-led SpaceX's rocket launch through the plane's window at 8,500 ft on Saturday. The passenger, Van Espahbodi, is the Co-founder of an aerospace fundraising firm called Starburst Aerospace Accelerator. His firm has reportedly raised $200 million to fund startups working in the field of space commercialisation.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon faces flak for changing name of London tube station
article: UK lawmakers have criticised an advertising campaign by e-commerce platform Amazon in which it changed the name signs at London's Westminster underground tube station to 'Webminster'. Amazon had paid about ₹3.2 crore to change the signs of the station underneath the British Parliament to publicise its cloud computing business. "They are undermining the word 'Westminster'," said a British MP.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indian journalists better than best to cover world: Arnab
article: Journalist Arnab Goswami on Tuesday said that domestic journalists are better than the best to cover the world. "We do not have the presence in the global media and I think that is sad," he added. "I'd love to bring together some journalists and start covering the world," said Goswami, who quit Times Now to start his new venture ‘Republic’.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Amazon better behave, says Economic Affairs Secretary
article: Economic Affairs Secretary Shaktikanta Das on Sunday said, "Amazon better behave," adding that the e-commerce major should desist from being "flippant about Indian symbols and icons". "Indifference will be at your own peril," Das further said in a post on Twitter. His comments come after External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj targeted Amazon for selling doormats with the Indian flag.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes app to turn any phone into attendance register
article: A Kolkata-based startup has built an app called 'Regular.li' that can turn any smartphone or computer into an attendance register. The app uses GPS and Wi-Fi SSID to mark the presence of a user in a selected area and uses selfies to ensure the check-in. It also allows tracking users in real-time and provides a detailed report every month.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Modified Tesla Model S goes from 0-100 kmph in 2.1 seconds
article: A modified version of the Tesla's fastest electric car Model S, created for the Electric GT Championship, successfully accelerated from 0-100 kmph in only 2.1 seconds. While Tesla's original Model S accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 2.4 seconds, its rival Faraday Future's FF 91, the world's fastest electric car in production, achieves the same feat in 2.39 seconds.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Facebook to participate in world’s biggest startup campus
article: Facebook Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg has announced that the social media major will open a 'Startup Garage' in Station F, the world's biggest startup campus. Facebook will work with 10 to 15 startups every six months in the Paris-based campus. Station F will host over 1,000 startups and is expected to begin operations from April this year.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Amazon India to create over 7,500 temporary jobs
article: Amazon India is going to create over 7,500 temporary jobs for its upcoming Great Indian Sale, and these positions will mostly be in logistics to ensure smooth deliveries. “These roles will be available at 27 fulfilment centres, over 100 delivery stations, and close to 15 sort centres,” it said. Notably, Amazon has committed investments worth $5 billion for India operations.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Zuckerberg-backed Byju's buys career guidance firm Vidyartha
article: Education technology startup Byju's has acquired Bangalore-based learning guidance tool and student profile-builder Vidyartha for a reported amount of ₹50 crore. Byju's offers instruction and assessment for exams like CAT, GRE and GMAT. Byju's raised ₹340 crore in funding led by Chan-Zuckerberg Initiative in September and counts Sequoia Capital and Lightspeed Venture Partners among its investors.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla allows self-driving cars to break speed limit
article: Electric car manufacturer Tesla has rolled back a function that limited the speed of its cars in Autopilot mode according to traffic rules. Users will be able to set the speed limit of their self-driving cars at 8 kmph more than the limit on roads, while the limit for highways can be set up to 145 kmph.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup bans practice of asking candidates' salary history
article: US-based crowdfunding platform Kickstarter has become the first startup to support a New York City bill that would make it illegal for employers to ask candidates about their salary history. The law, applicable to private, government and non-profit organisations, is aimed at reducing the gender-based wage gap. "We heard about this bill and it made sense to us," said Kickstarter.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup charges ₹5 lakh to inject patients with young blood
article: California-based startup Ambrosia has invited volunteers for clinical trials in which it will charge people ₹5.4 lakh to inject them with blood from donors aged 16-25. The volunteers, who are required to be at least 35 years old, will receive 1.5 litres of plasma. Ambrosia believes the process will improve appearance and muscle tone and even slow down aging.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Winding down startup sued for fake promotional videos
article: Selfie drone-making startup Lily Robotics has been sued for false advertising and unfair business practices after the company announced it was winding down. The lawsuit alleges that promotional videos claimed to have been shot using Lily's drones, were shot by GoPro cameras and DJI drones. Lily, which had received ₹232 crore in pre-orders, has said it will refund customers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart puts ₹13.6 cr in parenting social network Tinystep
article: Homegrown e-commerce major Flipkart has invested ₹13.6 crore ($2 million) in Bengaluru-based parenting social network Tinystep. Founded in 2015 by Suhail Abidi, the startup connects parents to help them ask parenting related questions and share their experiences. It also connects the parents to doctors and child service providers globally.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Health startup Practo raises ₹374 cr funding led by Tencent
article: Healthcare startup Practo on Tuesday raised ₹374 crore ($55 million) from new and existing investors in Series D round of funding led by China's Tencent Holdings. Existing investors Sequoia Capital, Google's CapitalG and others also participated. Founded in 2008 by Abhinav Lal and Shashank ND, the startup allows patients to book appointments with doctors for online and in-person consultations.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon fined ₹5.7 crore over misleading pricing in Canada
article: E-commerce company Amazon has been fined approximately ₹5.7 crore by Canada's Competition Bureau over misleading pricing practices. Amazon was advertising products on its platform as being cheaper than regular market prices. The company was accused of giving users an inaccurate picture of how much they would be able to save by shopping on the website.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup that uses AI to detect payment fraud raises $5 mn
article: Fraugster, a German and Israeli startup that has developed Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology to detect payment fraud, has raised $5 million in funding led by European venture investment firm Earlybird. Founded in 2014 by Max Laemmle and Chen Zamir, Fraugster's technology learns from each transaction in real-time and claims to be able to detect fraudulent attacks even before they happen.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapdeal losses grew 150% to ₹3,316 crore in 2016
article: E-commerce startup Snapdeal's losses rose by 150% to ₹3,316 crore in FY 2016 from a year ago, according to documents filed with Registrar of Companies. The company's revenue jumped 56% to ₹1,457 crore during the period, up from ₹933 crore. Snapdeal's results for the year include the financials of digital payments platform FreeCharge, which it had acquired in April 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: HP Enterprise buys data center startup SimpliVity for $650mn
article: Hewlett Packard Enterprise, which split off from HP in 2015, on Tuesday acquired SimpliVity, a startup that sells data center hardware, for $650 million in cash. Founded in 2009, the startup, valuation of which crossed $1 billion in March 2015, was reportedly considering an IPO. SimpliVity sells data center hardware aggregating components like servers and storage boxes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Search engine for online food ordering Ketchupp raises ₹3 cr
article: Search engine for online food delivery, Ketchupp has raised ₹3 crore in seed funding led by India Quotient and other angel investors. Currently catering to nine cities including Delhi and Bengaluru, Ketchupp uses Artificial Intelligence to suggest food items on providing location and cuisine. Ketchupp was founded in 2015 by Chirag Taneja, Abdul Khalid, Narender Kumar and Rohit Taneja.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ed-tech startup Curiositi raises ₹5.4 cr in Series A funding
article: Education startup Curiositi has raised ₹5.4 crore in Series A funding from Menterra Social Impact Fund, floated by Menterra Venture Advisors, and existing investor Unitus Seed Fund. Founded in 2013 by Vinod Abraham and Manoj Thandassery, Curiositi provides math and science programmes for school students with activity kits and software that can be downloaded on laptops or mobile phones.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Accommodation startup Zolo raises ₹26 cr led by Nexus
article: Bengaluru-based managed accommodation startup Zolo has raised ₹26 crore in Series A funding led by Nexus Venture Partners. The round included a venture debt of ₹4.5 crore from InnoVen Capital. Founded in September 2015, the startup provides ready-to-move-in co-living rented accommodation to working professionals and students.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: iService raises ₹3 crore in seed funding from Blume Ventures
article: Gadget repair startup iService has raised ₹3 crore in a seed funding round led by Blume Ventures. Angel investors such as Freshdesk Co-founder Girish Mathrubootham, TaxiForSure Co-founder Aprameya Radhakrishna and Tapzo (formerly Helpchat) CEO Ankur Singla also participated in the round. Founded in 2013, the startup currently operates in Delhi and Bengaluru.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Qualcomm announces investment of ₹57.7 crore in India
article: Qualcomm has announced that it will invest $8.5 million (over ₹57.7 crore) in India with an aim to expand its digital design initiatives in the country. The company also announced the winners of the Qualcomm Design in India Challenge launched in 2015 in association with Nasscom. The winning startups, Carnot Technologies, iFuture Robotics and Uncanny Vision, received ₹68 lakh each.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: SpaceX launches 1st Falcon 9 rocket post September explosion
article: Elon Musk-led space exploration startup SpaceX on Saturday successfully landed its first-stage Falcon 9 rocket on a drone ship, marking the 7th rocket recovered overall, and the first post September blast. SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket will deliver the first 10 Iridium NEXT satellites, that are aimed at replacing the world's largest commercial satellite network of low-earth orbit satellites.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon US website selling Indian tricolour-themed shoes
article: E-commerce platform Amazon's American website is selling shoes and shoe lace metal hoops bearing a likeness to the Indian flag. Amazon recently removed doormats featuring the Indian flag from its Canada website after External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj threatened to not grant Indian Visa to any Amazon official. Swaraj demanded Amazon tender an unconditional apology over the issue.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: NDA's Chandrasekhar Director in Arnab Goswami's Republic
article: Rajya Sabha member Rajeev Chandrasekhar and Vice Chairman of the NDA in Kerala is one of the largest investors and a Director in Arnab Goswami’s media venture Republic. The channel will be a part of company ARG Outlier, where Chandrasekhar has invested ₹30 crore. Goswami was appointed as Managing Director of ARG Outlier a day after he quit Times Now.

author: Tarun Khanna
abstract: Amazon selling flip-flops with Gandhiji's picture on it
article: After External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj raised objection over tricolour doormats being sold on Amazon, the e-commerce giant is now found selling flip-flops with Mahatma Gandhi's picture on it. Amazon had removed the tricolour doormats from its website after Swaraj had warned it that none of its officials will be granted the Indian visa.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Ravindra Jadeja engages in Twitter banter with Flipkart
article: Ravindra Jadeja and Flipkart were involved in a Twitter exchange on Saturday. Flipkart had tweeted, "India's new all-rounder is visiting us on January 19th. One of the best in India! Any guesses who it is?," to which Jadeja replied, "Why this Kolaveri di? Should have informed me before announcing? Anyway, got a match on 19th... let's push this to 20th?"

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Android creator making phone to rival iPhone, Google Pixel
article: Andy Rubin, the Co-founder of Android, is reportedly working on a smartphone to compete with iPhone and Pixel in terms of price and features. Rubin is said to have created a new company called 'Essential' with former employees of Apple and Google. The phone, which will reportedly feature an edge-to-edge screen, will be manufactured by iPhone assembler Foxconn.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon seller recalls boots that leave swastika prints
article: A Californian company has recalled boots it had listed on Amazon after a customer discovered the soles left swastika prints. The company, Conal International Trading, said that the design was not intentional and the designers will be questioned. The company also claimed the designers may have meant to use the swastika as a Buddhist symbol rather than a Nazi symbol.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: We regret hurting Indian sensibilities: Amazon to Swaraj
article: Responding to Foreign Minister Sushma Swaraj's tweet, Amazon has said it regrets hurting Indian sentiments. "At no time did we intend to offend Indian sentiments," it said, adding, "We're committed to respecting Indian laws and customs... We immensely value our relationship with the Indian government." Swaraj had threatened to not grant visas to Amazon officials till the company apologised.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon CEO Bezos buys Washington's biggest house for ₹156 cr
article: American e-commerce major Amazon's Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos has bought the biggest house in Washington DC for more than ₹156 crore ($23 million) in cash. The 27,000 square-foot property includes two mansions that housed a museum for nearly 90 years. Bezos' neighbours include outgoing US President Barack Obama and Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka Trump and her husband Jared Kushner.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: We don't see value in buying wallet startups: Airtel
article: Airtel Chairman Sunil Bharti Mittal at the launch of India's first payments bank said, "Many wallet companies are coming to us to get acquired by us...We don't see much value in putting money behind those companies." Airtel has an e-wallet service called 'Airtel Money' which will be connected to its payments bank, letting users transfer their balance and earn interest.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Gadget to add back ports to MacBook Pro raises $1.5 million
article: US-based startup Sanho, which has created a hub to give the new MacBook Pro laptops the same ports as previous models, has received over $1.5 million in pre-orders. The HyperDrive hub will add a microSD, USB-C, HDMI and two USB 3.1 ports to the laptops which currently have four USB-C ports. Sanho has received funds from over 18,600 backers.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Cash-strapped LeEco raises $2.18 billion from China's Sunac
article: Technology startup LeEco has raised $2.18 billion in funding from Chinese property developer Sunac a few months after admitting it was facing a cash crunch. Sunac will acquire stakes in LeEco's movie and online video divisions. LeEco's Chairman Jia Yueting slashed his income to 15 cents (around ₹10) in November after admitting the company over-stretched as it "blindly sped ahead."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla Gigafactory to get world's largest rooftop solar array
article: Elon Musk-led Tesla's under construction lithium-ion battery factory in Nevada, Gigafactory will reportedly have the world's largest rooftop solar array with a capacity of 70 megawatts. That's seven times larger than any other rooftop installation in the US. The world's largest rooftop solar installation is a 42-acre, 11.5-MW solar farm at the Dera Baba Jaimal Singh in India's Beas.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: ICICI blocked transactions on our payments app: PhonePe CEO
article: Payments app PhonePe's Co-founder and CEO Sameer Nigam on Saturday alleged that ICICI Bank was blocking transactions through its platform since Friday. This is at least the second instance of a commercial bank allegedly blocking an e-wallet service to protect its own services. PhonePe is a Unified Payment Interface (UPI) based e-wallet service under RBI's National Payments Corporation of India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Drone startup shuts despite receiving ₹232 cr in pre-orders
article: US-based portable camera drone making startup Lily announced to shut down on Thursday despite receiving ₹232 crore in pre-orders from customers. The startup said it was unable to raise an additional round of funding which would have allowed it to start production of the drone. The remaining money will be used to reimburse people who pre-ordered the device.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zoomcar to sell all cars in its fleet by year-end
article: Bengaluru-based self-drive car rental startup Zoomcar will be selling all the cars in its fleet by the end of this year. The move is a part of the startup's plan to shift completely to a marketplace model, where associates can add to their cars to Zoomcar's existing fleet. Zoomcar charges a 25% commission on the revenues that its associates make.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Unacademy raises ₹30 crore from Nexus, Blume Ventures
article: Online education platform Unacademy has raised ₹30 crore in Series A funding led by Nexus Venture Partners and Blume Ventures. Freshdesk CEO Girish Mathrubootham, Myntra CEO Ananth Narayanan along with Stanford Angels also participated in the round. The Bengaluru-based startup makes educational videos by experts available free of cost through its platform.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart reshuffle triggered by valuation mark-downs: Report
article: The appointment of Kalyan Krishnamurthy as Flipkart's CEO replacing Co-founder Binny Bansal was reportedly triggered by the repeated mark-downs in the startup's valuation. Flipkart, which became India's most valuable startup in 2015 with a valuation of $15 billion, faced writedowns by Morgan Stanley and Fidelity among others. Flipkart was valued at $5.54 billion at the end of November 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber rival Lyft lost over ₹4,000 crore last year: Report
article: Lyft, the second largest ride-hailing startup in the US behind Uber, lost about ₹4,000 crore ($600 million) last year, according to reports. However, Lyft's revenue increased 250% and it generated about ₹4,770 crore ($700 million) in sales, the report added. According to Uber's first three quarters of 2016, Uber was on track to lose about ₹20,450 crore ($3 billion) globally.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: We have to slow down and improve, Xiaomi CEO tells employees
article: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi's CEO and Co-founder Lei Jun has written a public letter to employees saying, "We have to slow down and further improve in some areas." Jun explained that the company had to improve in order to ensure sustainable growth for a long-term future, adding, "In the first few years, we pushed ahead too fast."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk hints update to make Tesla Model S fastest electric car
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Thursday tweeted about an update to make Tesla Model S world's fastest production electric car by accelerating from 0-100 kmph in 2.42 seconds. This would make the cars 0.05 seconds faster than rival Faraday Future's recently unveiled 'FF91'. Responding to Musk's tweet, Faraday Future said, "We're ready to work together to elevate the electric industry."

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Sony Entertainment CEO steps down to serve as Snap Chairman
article: Sony Entertainment CEO Michael Lynton will step down to become the Chairman of the Board of messaging app Snapchat's owner Snap Inc. Lynton, who joined Sony 13 years ago, will give up his position at the firm's movie and television unit on February 2. Notably, Snap is preparing for an initial public offering, which could value it at $25 billion.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: India's US envoy to tell Amazon to respect sentiments
article: The Ministry of External Affairs has instructed India's envoy to the US Navtej Sarna to convey to e-commerce giant Amazon that while providing a platform for third-party vendors, they must respect Indian sentiments. This comes after Amazon Canada listed doormats featuring the Indian flag. External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj had slammed Amazon and sought an apology for the listing.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Aerospace startup raises $20 million to fully fund moon trip
article: US-based Moon Express, which is competing in Google's Lunar X-Prize to become world's first private company to land on the moon, has raised $20 million in Series B-1 funding. The startup announced it has fully financed its maiden mission to the moon with total funding of $45 million. Moon Express is competing with teams from Israel and India among others.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Self-driving shuttle offers free rides to users in Las Vegas
article: French vehicle manufacturer Navya has started a trial of its self-driving shuttle in Las Vegas, US and is offering free rides to commuters. The 12-seater vehicle has a top speed of about 43.4 kmph but will be restricted to 19 kmph during the trial. The full-scale shuttle service is expected to cost Las Vegas approximately ₹6.8 lakh per month.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Bengaluru-based PaisaWapas raises angel funding
article: Bengaluru-based startup PaisaWapas has secured angel funding from Vividhity Ventures, a group of IIT (BHU) alumni, and executives from Infosys and Dell. Founded in May 2015, PaisaWapas provides a platform for college students to find deals on products and courses. GoPaisa and CashKaro are some of the other startups in the deal discovery space.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Alphabet Chairman-backed real estate startup raises ₹225 cr
article: US-based real estate startup HouseCanary has raised $33 million (₹225 crore) from existing investors like former basketball player Kobe Bryant and Eric Schmidt, who is the Executive Chairman of Google's parent company Alphabet. Using machine learning, HouseCanary assesses and predicts the value of million homes. The assessment takes local schools, employment markets and crime rates into account.

author: Chhavi Tyagi
abstract: No visas until Amazon apologises for flag insult: Swaraj
article: External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj on Wednesday asked e-commerce major Amazon to immediately withdraw all products insulting the Indian flag from its website and tender an unconditional apology over the issue. "If this is not done forthwith, we will not grant Indian Visa to any Amazon official. We'll also rescind the Visas issued earlier," Swaraj added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 3 top Flipkart executives quit a day after new CEO announced
article: Three top Flipkart executives have quit a day after Co-founder Binny Bansal was replaced by former Tiger Global executive Kalyan Krishnamurthy as CEO. Flipkart’s logistics unit Ekart’s head Saikiran Krishnamurthy, Product Head Surojit Chatterjee and Chief Marketing Officer Samardeep Subandh have resigned. Notably, Tiger Global is the largest shareholder in  Flipkart.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Housing CEO Jason Kothari joins Snapdeal
article: A day after realty estate platform Housing merged with News Corp-backed PropTiger, Housing CEO Jason Kothari has joined Snapdeal as the Chief Strategy and Investment Officer. Kothari will work alongside Snapdeal Co-founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal, and his key responsibilities will include raising new capital for the startup. Kothari is also an advisor to the joint Housing-PropTiger entity.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon removes Indian flag doormat after Sushma steps in
article: A day after External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj threatened to not grant Indian Visa to any Amazon official, Amazon removed the doormats bearing the Indian flag from its Canada website. "This is unacceptable. Amazon must tender unconditional apology," Swaraj tweeted on Wednesday. Demanding withdrawal of products insulting the tricolour, she also threatened to rescind already issued visas.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Housing merges with PropTiger in an all-stock deal
article: Online real estate search portal Housing on Tuesday announced its merger with News Corp-backed PropTiger in an all-stock deal. As a part of the transaction, the joint entity will receive investments of $50 million from News Corp's REA Group and $5 million from Japan's SoftBank. PropTiger's CEO Dhruv Agarwala will serve as CEO of the joint entity.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Housing will die a slow death, says Co-founder Rahul Yadav
article: Real estate search portal Housing's ousted CEO and Co-founder Rahul Yadav while talking about the startup's merger with PropTiger said, "Housing will die a slow death after becoming irrelevant". He added that PropTiger will benefit the most as its revenue will be doubled. Yadav called the sale of Housing's stake for a reported $50 million "clearly distressing".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Where will the wallet money go when Paytm launches its bank?
article: The money in about 160 million Paytm digital wallets will be transferred to respective bank accounts when Paytm Payments Bank will launch on January 15. This will happen automatically and users' login details and wallet balance will remain the same without any additional process. Paytm Payments Bank accounts will have a chequebook and a debit card like other bank accounts.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: It took Housing $60 mn to build, $80 mn to shut: Rahul Yadav
article: Real estate platform Housing's ousted Co-founder and CEO Rahul Yadav on Thursday posted on Facebook, "It took Housing in total $60 million to build and revolutionise the whole industry till I was there, and over $80 million to shut post I left". Yadav's comments come after Housing, which he founded with 11 others, merged with News Corp-backed PropTiger on Tuesday.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart's logistics arm Ekart's head quits
article: A day after Flipkart announced the appointment of Kalyan Krishnamurthy as CEO and elevation of Binny Bansal to Group CEO role, its logistics arm Ekart's head Saikiran Krishnamurthy reportedly quit the startup. Flipkart promoted Chief Administrative Officer Nitin Seth as Chief Operating Officer as well as Ekart's head. Reports suggest more senior executives are likely to quit Flipkart next month.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Been playing both Flipkart and Group CEO for a year: Binny
article: On latest reshuffle at Flipkart's top level and being elevated to Group CEO role, Co-founder and former CEO Binny Bansal said, "I’ve been playing both the roles in the last 12 months". He added, "The new organizational charter has been specifically created to look at different commerce areas...And see where we want to make big bets over next 3-4 years".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Jack and I are going to do great things together, says Trump
article: US President-elect Donald Trump after meeting Alibaba Founder Jack Ma on Monday said, "Jack and I are going to do some great things together." The billionaires discussed the creation of one million jobs in US by bringing small businesses onto Alibaba's platform over the next five years. In December, SoftBank's Masayoshi Son pledged creation of 50,000 jobs after meeting Trump.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba posts inaccurate maps of China, US on Twitter
article: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba on Tuesday posted an illustration on Twitter which had inaccurate maps of both China and the United States. While Taiwan and the South China Sea islands were not marked on China's map, Alaska and Hawaii were not included on the US map. Alibaba later apologised and posted a corrected version of the illustration.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: India's largest startup is now VC run, says ex-Flipkart CPO
article: On the appointment of Kalyan Krishnamurthy as Flipkart's CEO and Binny Bansal being elevated to Group CEO, Flipkart's former CPO Punit Soni tweeted, "India's largest startup is now VC run". He further tweeted he expects more leaders will quit Flipkart in coming days. "Kalyan is probably the best fit for the CEO position among all leaders in Flipkart", he added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We will change the way banking is done: Paytm CEO
article: Ahead of Paytm Payments Bank launch scheduled for January 15, Paytm's Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said, "We will change the way banking is done". "This will be an Indian company, owned by Indians, and I am proud about that," added Sharma. Paytm Payments Bank is 51% owned by Sharma and 49% by Paytm's parent company One97 Communications.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grofers losses widen 15 times to ₹60.87 crore in 2016
article: Hyperlocal delivery startup Grofers' net loss widened 15 times to ₹60.87 crore in 2016 from ₹3.9 crore registered a year ago, reportedly due to rapid expansion and high costs.  Grofers' revenue for the year fell 32% to ₹58.34 lakh from ₹86.38 lakh in 2015. Founded in 2013, Grofers shut its operations in nine cities last year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes rearview mirror to turn any car self-driving
article: US-based startup Neodriven, founded by a former Tesla employee, has created a rearview mirror based on George Hotz's Comma.ai software that claims to transform any car into a self-driving car. Priced at $1,495 (approximately ₹1 lakh), the system tracks driving data, feeds it back into the company database and then instructs the car to emulate the driving habits.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MobiKwik accuses Paytm of inflating number of transactions
article: Digital wallet MobiKwik's Co-founder Upasana Taku has accused rival Paytm of inflating volume and number of transactions. "Paytm is definitely ahead of us but I don’t think they have crossed 100 million users," said Taku. She added that RBI's data of 88 million mobile wallet transactions in December 2016 is in sharp contrast to numbers claimed by Paytm.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla hires key designer of Apple's new MacBook Pro
article: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla has hired Matt Casebolt, the key designer behind Apple products like MacBook Air, Mac Pro and the latest MacBook Pro. Casebolt has taken over as the Senior Director of Engineering, Closures and Mechanisms at Tesla Motors. Tesla has also hired Apple's Chris Lattner as its Vice President of Autopilot Software.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: PayPal users donated nearly ₹50,000 crore to charity in 2016
article: Online payments company PayPal has said users donated $7.3 billion (nearly ₹50,000 crore) to charity in 2016 through its platform. The company said it processed the highest amount of daily donations on New Year's Eve. The largest amount given on New Year's Eve was over $230,000 (₹1.57 crore), while the year-long average was $89 (approximately ₹6,000).

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jessica Alba's startup recalls baby powder over infection
article: Honest Company, an American consumer goods startup co-founded by actress Jessica Alba, has recalled its organic baby powder over concerns of eye and skin infections. During the tests conducted on the product by the startup, possible contaminations from microorganisms that could cause skin or eye infections were found. The powder has been in the US stores since April last year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Obama offered job as 'President of Playlists' by Spotify
article: Music streaming service Spotify has offered US President Barack Obama a job as the 'President of Playlists.' The job listing published on Spotify's website requires the candidate to have "eight years experience running a highly-regarded nation... and a Nobel Peace Prize." Obama recently joked that he was waiting for a job at Spotify after he made a popular playlist.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Paytm denies rumour that it'll stop working post January 15
article: Online payments startup Paytm has denied rumours that the e-wallet will not function after January 15. "Nothing could be farther from the truth. On the contrary, Paytm Wallet users will soon enjoy additional benefits through Paytm Payments Bank Account," said the company in a blog post. Paytm's wallet business will be transferred to the newly incorporated Paytm Payments Bank.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Video recaps when Yahoo was a startup​ in 1995
article: Yahoo was founded in 1994 by Stanford University students Jerry Yang and David Filo. In a 1995 interview, Yahoo's Founders said, "What's really important to us is our brand, our recognition. We want people to associate finding information with lots of fun." Yahoo on Monday announced its remaining business after selling core internet component to Verizon will be renamed 'Altaba'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart's Binny Bansal invests in 3D printing startup
article: Flipkart's Co-founder and Group CEO Binny Bansal along with four other angel investors has invested ₹6.6 crore in Supercraft3D, a 3D printing startup focused on health and medicine applications. Founded in 2016, the startup provides visualisation solutions to help hospitals, doctors and academicians get a better understanding of anatomy. It also manufactures customised body implants for patients.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Lawsuit claims Oculus Co-founder spread fake origin story
article: Video game company ZeniMax has sued Facebook-owned Oculus for stealing key technology and promoting a fake origin story to hide the truth. ZeniMax accused Oculus' Co-founder Palmer Luckey of spreading a "false and fanciful story that Luckey was the brilliant inventor of VR technology who had developed that technology in his parents' garage. That story was utterly and completely false."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes heels with adjustable height, heated insole
article: French startup Zhor Tech has developed two models of smart heels, one with adjustable height and the other with heated insoles. Priced at ₹20,500, the height of the Bluetooth-connected mechanical heels can be set from 1.7 inches to 3.1 inches using a smartphone app. Both models of the heels can also act as fitness trackers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla hires senior Apple executive for Autopilot technology
article: Electric carmaker Tesla has hired Apple's Senior Director and Architect Chris Lattner as its Vice President of Autopilot software. During his 11-year stint at Apple, Lattner led the creation of Swift, the programming language for building apps on Apple platforms. Tesla claims Autopilot is a full self-driving capability at a safety level substantially greater than that of a human.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Kalyan Krishnamurthy replaces Binny Bansal as Flipkart CEO
article: Former Tiger Global executive Kalyan Krishnamurthy, who joined Flipkart in June 2016 as head of commerce unit, has been named as the new CEO of Flipkart replacing Co-founder Binny Bansal. Bansal will be moving to a newly created position of Group CEO. The move comes one year after Binny Bansal took over as CEO from Co-founder Sachin Bansal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jeff Bezos gets richer by ₹8,860 crore in one day
article: Amazon's Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos added ₹8,860 crore ($1.3 billion) to his net worth on Friday after his company's stock price rose by 2%. The surge added ₹26,000 crore ($3.8 billion) to his fortune this week. Bezos, who owns over 80 million Amazon shares, is currently the world's fourth richest person with net worth of ₹4.6 lakh-crore ($68.6 billion).

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Who is Kalyan Krishnamurthy, the new CEO of Flipkart?
article: The newly appointed CEO of Flipkart, Kalyan Krishnamurthy joined the e-commerce firm in June 2016 as head of the commerce unit. Before joining Flipkart, Krishnamurthy served as Tiger Global Management's Managing Director from 2014 to 2016. Krishnamurthy also served as Interim Chief Financial Officer at Flipkart from May 2013 to November 2014.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Printer worth ₹8,000 prints selfies on sticky notes in 5 sec
article: Samsung's spin-off startup Mangoslab has created a printer called 'Nemonic' that allows users to print anything from their phone including their selfies on sticky notes in under five seconds. The printer does not rely on ink and uses thermal heat imaging to print. Printable sticky notes are provided with the printer at around ₹270 for 200 sheets.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We went from a new thing to a must-have, says Paytm CEO
article: Digital wallet and m-commerce platform Paytm's Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma, while talking about demonetisation in a recent interview said, "Overnight...We went from a new thing to a must-have". "There are the digitally savvy and then there are those who don't even own a cellphone," said Sharma, adding that he wants Paytm to be India's first $100 billion company.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: E-commerce startups spent ₹7,252 cr on advertising in 2016
article: E-commerce startups including Flipkart, Amazon and Snapdeal spent ₹7,252 crore on advertising in 2016, a 26% jump over the amount spent in 2015, according to Advertising Information System. While Amazon registered a ₹3,572 crore loss last year, it spent ₹946 crore on advertising. Paytm's advertising expenditure was ₹92 crore until October, which soared to ₹239 crore post demonetisation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart knob lets user turn off stove from phone remotely
article: US-based startup Inirv React has created a smart stove knob called 'React' that lets users control the stove through their smartphone even when they are away from home. The smart knob comes with a sensor that is installed on the ceiling above the stove, which automatically shuts off active burners on detection of gas, smoke or prolonged inactivity.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup once worth $9 billion lays off 155 employees
article: One-drop blood test company Theranos, which was once worth $9 billion, has laid off 41% of its workforce or 155 employees. This follows the firing of 340 employees in October last year. The startup has been facing regulatory setbacks and lawsuits pertaining to the accuracy of its tests, with US' health agency declaring that Theranos put patients in "immediate danger".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Eagle-like drone made to keep airports safe from birds
article: Dutch startup Clear Flight Solutions has made a drone named 'Robird' that looks like an eagle to chase away the birds from airport areas to keep aviation safe. The remote-controlled drone can even glide through the air for periods of time and drive birds in the direction it is made to. The drones are 3D printed and assembled by hand.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Woman sues Uber, Honda after being paralysed in car crash
article: An American woman has sued Uber and Honda after the driver of her Uber cab jumped a red light, leading to a crash that left her paralysed from the chest down. The suit alleges security lapse on Uber's part for ignoring previous drug and gambling charges against the driver. The owner of the Honda-branded taxi has also been sued.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes 6-inch PC with more ports than MacBook Pro
article: Dutch startup Ockel has created Sirius A, a small Windows 10 PC with a 6-inch touchscreen that has eight regular-sized ports as compared to five ports on Apple's 13-inch 2016 MacBook Pro. Priced at ₹47,600, the PC has 4 GB RAM with 64 GB eMMC memory. Powered by an Intel Atom x7 chipset, the computer claims a three-hour battery life.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Foot-warming bed to smart hairbrush, gadgets at CES 2017
article: The 50th edition of the world's largest consumer electronics show CES 2017, held from January 5-8, witnessed hundreds of next-generation gadgets including a smart bed to warm user's feet before sleeping. Nokia-owned startup unveiled a smart hairbrush that listens to hair through a microphone to track damage. World's first laptop with three display screens was also unveiled at the event.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes device to keep pillows cool while sleeping
article: French startup Moona has created a temperature-regulating device priced at ₹10,000 that cools a user's pillow while they sleep. A motion sensor monitors the user's head movements and circulates cool water in the pillow to encourage sleepiness. The device also acts as an alarm by sending warm water through the pillow to wake the user up at pre-set time.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Headset prevents people from overhearing phone conversations
article: Ukraine-based developers have created 'Hushme', a voice masking Bluetooth headset that lets users have a private telephonic conversation in public. Hushme combines a pair of earphones with a voice mask that covers the mouth. The headset also connects to a smartphone app to let users make their voice sound like Darth Vader, R2D2 or Minions.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Electric scooter that can charge 5 devices together made
article: A US-based startup has developed a foldable electric scooter 'URB-E Sport' which can charge up to five devices simultaneously. The scooter's battery can charge an Apple MacBook five times or an iPhone 40 times over. Priced at about ₹61,000, the scooter has a range of 25.7 km on a single charge and a top speed of 22.5 km.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes ceiling tile that charges devices 30-feet away
article: Washington-based startup Ossia has created ceiling tiles called Cota which can wirelessly charge electronic devices within a 30-foot radius. The company makes small power receivers that can be embedded into smartphones, standard-size batteries or other devices like smoke alarms to make them compatible with the tiles. Up to four Cota tiles can be linked together to expand the charging radius.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal invests ₹390 crore in FreeCharge
article: Snapdeal's parent company Jasper Infotech has invested ₹390 crore in digital payments platform FreeCharge, according to Registrar of Companies filings. The fresh funds follow a special resolution passed in December, where FreeCharge increased its authorised share capital from ₹6 crore to ₹1,006 crore. Founded in 2010 by Kunal Shah and Sandeep Tandon, FreeCharge was acquired by Snapdeal in 2015.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Project management app maker Trello acquired for ₹2,800 cr
article: Atlassian, maker of work collaboration software Jira and HipChat, has announced that it will acquire project management service Trello for $425 million (over ₹2,800 crore). The acquisition is expected to close before March 31, 2017. Trello's service offers digital post-it notes and whiteboards to organise tasks, and it has 19 million users, a number that almost doubled last year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We are not really worried about Amazon: Flipkart's new CEO
article: Flipkart's newly-appointed CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy on Monday said the startup is not really worried about competition from Amazon. "We have leadership in most key categories. In categories like fashion, between us, Myntra and Jabong, we have 75-80% market share," said Krishnamurthy. "In 2017, we'll get into some new categories...We believe we'll be significant leaders in those as well," he added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: It's musical chair time at Flipkart, tweets user
article: Reacting to former Tiger Global executive Kalyan Krishnamurthy replacing Binny Bansal as e-commerce startup Flipkart's CEO, a user tweeted, "It's musical chair time at Flipkart". Another user tweeted, "Will investors be the new CEOs? Startup CEOs will be the new investors?" A user also tweeted, "So Flipkart does Alphabet".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: InnoVen invests ₹110 crore in 13 startups including Swiggy
article: Singapore's Temasek-owned venture lending firm InnoVen Capital invested ₹110 crore in the December quarter across 13 startups, including food delivery startup Swiggy and furniture rental startup Furlenco. It also invested in XpressBees, Flyrobe, Chai Point and other startups during the period. InnoVen invested about ₹400 crore in 35 Indian startups in 2016, amongst which 26 were new investments.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes headphones with touchscreen, inbuilt storage
article: US-based startup Inspero has developed 'Vinci' headphones with 16 GB of built-in storage that can work without being connected to smartphones. Users can adjust the volume by swiping up or down on the headphone's touchscreen or swipe to the side to change track. Priced at ₹6,750, the voice controlled headphones claim a battery life of 10 hours.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tracker made to tell users which food makes them gassy
article: Irish startup FoodMarble has made a digestive tracker called 'Aire' which claims to tell users which food is incompatible with their body and gives them gas. Aire analyses a user's breath after eating simple carbohydrates to check how their body responds. Using the results, Aire can tell users which food to avoid to prevent problems like bloating, diarrhoea and constipation.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: LED-embedded backpack lets cyclists give traffic signals
article: Flexible electronics maker Royole has developed a backpack that features flexible LEDs embedded in the fabric to let cyclists create traffic signals alerting others on the road. The bag also has flexible sensors in the shoulder straps that lets riders give left or right indicators with the swipe of a finger.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Lenskart raises ₹24 crore from Ronnie Screwvala’s Unilazer
article: Eyewear startup Lenskart has raised ₹24 crore in fresh funding from Unilazer Ventures Founder Ronnie Screwvala. This brings Unilazer’s cumulative investment in Lenskart to about ₹100 crore, which values the startup at ₹2,000 crore. In September last year, Wipro Chairman Azim Premji's investment arm PremjiInvest infused an undisclosed amount of fund in Lenskart at the same valuation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Gujarat launches ₹200 crore fund to back student startups
article: The Gujarat government has launched a student startup fund under which it will provide ₹200 crore in grants to startups led by students. The fund is aimed to support around 1,000 student-led startups and establish a pre-incubation support system at all the universities across the state. The government would also help these startups to create prototypes and file for patents.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: French startup creates smart vibrating shorts for women
article: French startup Spinali Design has created a smart pair of shorts for women, which integrates two vibrating sensors on a belt on either of its sides. Connected to a smartphone via an app, the shorts help women navigate their route by vibrating for left or right turns. The shorts also alert women of any incoming message, call or email.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyderabad Ola, Uber drivers strike as income falls to ₹15000
article: Ola and Uber drivers have gone on a five-day strike in Hyderabad following fewer bookings and monthly earnings falling from ₹70,000 to ₹15,000. Uber and Ola employ around one lakh drivers in Hyderabad and majority of them have joined the protests. Drivers claim the earnings reduced after the companies inducted more cars and started giving more rides to newly-registered drivers.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Pichai announces tool to help firms make website in 10 mins
article: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on Wednesday announced a tool to allow small businesses in India to set up a free website using a smartphone in under 10 minutes. Pichai also launched a training program called Digital Unlocked for small business enterprises in partnership with FICCI. Over the next three years, Google will hold 5,000 training workshops across 40 Indian cities.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon Canada removes doormat featuring Indian flag
article: The Canadian website of e-commerce major Amazon has removed listings for doormats featuring the Indian flag after facing flak. The doormat faced criticism on various social media platforms, and a Change.org petition was also started. The vendor of the doormats, 'XLYL' also lists similar doormats featuring the flags of countries such as the United Kingdom and the United States.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Man posing as Paytm employee dupes woman of ₹18,000
article: A Chandigarh woman has been duped of ₹18,000 by a man who pretended to be an employee of digital wallet Paytm. The man called the woman asking for an OTP number sent to her citing an issue in her Paytm account. On sharing the OTP, ₹18,000 was deducted from the woman's Paytm wallet and the man's contact number became unreachable.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ex-employees of 12 Indian unicorn startups made 700 startups
article: Former employees of 12 Indian billion-dollar startups including Flipkart and Ola who went on to form their own ventures have created a total of 700 startups, according to data by Tracxn. As many as 177 startups have been founded by former Flipkart employees. Interestingly, former employees of Infosys and Wipro have founded 867 and 685 companies respectively to date.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SBI temporarily blocks cash transfer to major mobile wallets
article: The State Bank of India has temporarily blocked major digital wallets including Paytm, MobiKwik and FreeCharge from its net banking service. The move disables SBI customers from transferring money from their bank account to the mobile wallets. SBI Chairman Arundhati Bhattacharya has said that the service has been blocked following recent breaches and security reasons.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New ₹6,700 gadget turns MacBook into a touchscreen
article: A startup has made a ₹6,700 device called 'AirBar' that turns an Apple MacBook into a touchscreen. The bar-like device is a magnetic sensor that is placed below the bottom edge of the laptop's display to allow scrolling, swiping, zooming and other actions with touch. Available only for 15.6-inch Windows laptops until now, AirBar is also available for 13-inch MacBooks.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: You're not entitled to a refund, says startup after shutdown
article: London-based wearables startup Vinaya has sent a letter to the backers of its Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign saying, "Technically we are not liable, and you are not entitled to a refund or even the product you ordered." The startup announced its shutdown and added that if the Founders start a new company, the backers will receive some shares in the entity.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Smart universal remote made to control over 25,000 devices
article: California-based startup Sevenhugs has created a smart remote to control over 25,000 devices from companies like Samsung, LG, and Sony. The remote's 3.53-inch screen can adapt to each device the user points it at using WiFi, Bluetooth, Infrared and even motion tracking. Using special sensors, users can even order an Uber by simply pointing the remote at the door.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ₹2,000 smart fitness tracker made to check eyesight at home
article: US-based startup EyeQue has built a ₹2,000 smart fitness tracker that lets users check their eyesight at home by connecting it to a smartphone. The cylindrical microscope uses the phone’s display and a set of lenses to measure the eyesight. On completing the checkup, the tracker provides users with an eyeglass number through a dedicated app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba sues sellers for $200k over fake Swarovski watches
article: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba has sued two vendors for $2,02,000 alleging that they used the company's online shopping website Taobao for selling fake Swarovski watches. This is the first time that a Chinese e-commerce company has taken action against sellers of counterfeit goods. The Taobao website was put on a US trade agency's fake goods blacklist last month.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Gadget for dustbins makes shopping list of items thrown away
article: A US-based startup has created 'GeniCan', a smart accessory that can be attached to a garbage can to scan barcodes on products thrown and add them to a shopping list on a connected smartphone app. Products without barcodes can be added by using voice recognition. GeniCan operates on AA batteries and has been priced at $125 (about ₹8,500).

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Senior-level executives quit Flipkart to start own ventures
article: Homegrown e-commerce major Flipkart has witnessed more senior-level exits from its e-commerce vertical as well as fashion marketplace Myntra that it owns. Myntra's supply chain's Senior VP Rajul Jain, Myntra's VP Raghuram Talluri, and Flipkart's engineering VP Sharad Agarwal confirmed their exit from the company. All the three executives have quit the company to start their own ventures.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tinder trolls technology show crowd with fake VR headset
article: Dating app Tinder has put a fake virtual reality headset on display at the ongoing Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas to mock the trend of VR headsets. Two people stand at opposite ends of the multi-user VR headset to have a face-to-face conversation, which the company claims lets "real people have a real experience."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Japanese startup creates world's first virtual reality shoes
article: Japanese startup Cerevo has developed 'Taclim', a pair of what it claims to be the world's first virtual reality shoes for simulating different surfaces like desert, grassland or water in a game. The shoes have eight built-in interactive tactile devices which bring a sense of touch and allow a user to even feel kicking an enemy during a game.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Fired Snapchat exec sues company for misleading investors
article: Anthony Pompliano, former head of Snapchat's growth and user engagement team has sued the company after being fired three weeks into his tenure. Pompliano claims the social media startup, which is headed for an IPO, misrepresented internal key performance metrics to mislead investors. Pompliano also alleges that Snapchat prevented him from getting a new job and sabotaged his new ventures.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tool made to alert users when Trump tweets about their stock
article: US-based startup Trigger Finance has created a tool called 'Trump Tiggers' that notifies users whenever US President-elect Donald Trump tweets about a publicly traded stock they hold. These notifications are aimed at helping users manage their holdings based on the market's reaction to Trump's remarks. For example, Boeing's stock fell 1.4% after Trump's tweet on rejecting Air Force One plane.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Apple invests $1 bn in world's largest tech fund by SoftBank
article: Technology giant Apple has confirmed that it plans to invest $1 billion in a $100 billion technology fund being set up by Japan’s SoftBank Group. SoftBank last year announced the world's largest technology fund with $45 billion investment from Saudi Arabia's sovereign Public Investment Fund. The fund will include $25 billion investment from SoftBank.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: We need a superhighway in space, tweets Amazon's Jeff Bezos
article: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos on Thursday tweeted his support for constructing a "superhighway in space." Bezos shared an article which said NASA should focus on developing infrastructure in space like human habitats with vegetable gardens and gas stations instead of building rockets. The article proposes that rockets be provided by private ventures like Elon Musk's SpaceX and Bezos' Blue Origin.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber hikes ride time charges by up to 50% in Delhi NCR
article: Taxi-hailing service Uber has increased the ride time charges by 50% from ₹1 per minute to ₹1.5 per minute in Delhi NCR for its UberGO, UberX, and UberPOOL services. UberGO has a base fare of ₹40 but the minimum fare for the service has been increased to ₹60. The changes are expected to raise the total ride fare by 10-15%.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 500 Startups delays $25 million India-focussed Kulfi fund
article: California-based early-stage seed fund 500 Startups, has reportedly delayed its plans to raise a $25 million India-focussed fund called 500 Kulfi. The accelerator, led by angel investor Dave McClure, cited taxation and regulatory concerns as reasons for putting the fund on hold. 500 Startups has invested in over 50 companies in India since 2011 including Instamojo and CultureAlley.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: ₹10,200 wristband soothes nausea and motion sickness
article: A US-based startup has created 'Reliefband Neurowave', a wristband that claims to provide relief from nausea and vomiting caused by morning sickness and motion sickness, priced at about ₹10,200. The device applies pulses with specific waveforms, frequency and intensity to modulate the median nerve on the underside of the wrist to block the waves of nausea produced by the stomach.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Air mask with built-in fans provides fresh air to wearer
article: A French startup has developed an Air Mask named 'Wair' that has built-in fans on its sides to provide fresh breathing air to the wearer. The washable mask also comes with changeable triple-layered filters to block allergens, bacteria, and other particulates associated with pollution. The mask also has its own mobile app that gives users pollution warnings.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Faraday Future car's self-parking fails during launch event
article: American startup Faraday Future, which unveiled world's fastest production electric car FF 91, failed to get the car park itself with a button press following a technical glitch during launch. The car failed to move when company's investor and LeEco Founder Jia Yueting pressed the self-parking button. "It's a little bit crazy," said an executive after the failed attempt.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Earphones that can be boiled to mould to users' ears made
article: Colorado-based startup Decibullz has created a pair of earphones that can be softened by putting in boiling water to mould the wings around the earbuds according to the shape of a user's ears. The wired earphones are priced at $59 (approximately ₹4,000) while the wireless version costs $119 (approximately ₹8,100). The earphones claim a battery life of 3-4 hours.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Samsung announces $150 mn fund for technology startups
article: Samsung's investment arm Samsung NEXT on Wednesday announced a $150 million fund to invest in startups focusing on virtual reality, artificial intelligence, Internet of Things and other technologies. So far, Samsung has made investments in 10 startups through the fund. The new fund comes after Samsung changed its arm's name to Samsung NEXT from Samsung Global Innovation Center.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: World's fastest electric car goes from 0-100kmph in 2.39 sec
article: American startup Faraday Future on Wednesday unveiled the 'FF 91', which it claims is the world's fastest production electric vehicle that accelerates from 0-100 kmph in just 2.39 seconds and generates 1050 horsepower. Expected to launch in 2018, the fully self-driving car can travel about 608 km on a single charge and has facial recognition technology that allows keyless entry.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart losses narrowed to ₹544.6 crore in 2016
article: Indian e-commerce major Flipkart's losses narrowed to ₹544.6 crore in 2016 from ₹826.7 crore in the previous year, according to data platform Tofler. Flipkart posted a revenue of ₹13,177 crore in 2016, up 43% from ₹9,226 crore in the previous year. Flipkart's rival Amazon India’s both revenue and losses more than doubled in 2015-16.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Paytm gets RBI’s permission to formally launch payments bank
article: The Reserve Bank of India on Tuesday gave permission to formally launch the Paytm Payments Bank, the m-commerce platform's official blog stated. Paytm's CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma further said that he intends to take a full-time executive role in the bank. Earlier, he revealed that around ₹220 crore had been invested in the payments bank.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Delhi startup shuts down, Founder says 'I have failed'
article: Delhi-based ed-tech startup KleverKid has shut down operations, the Founder and CEO  Shabnam Aggarwal announced in a blog post titled 'Confessions of a Failed Entrepreneur'. "I have failed. I’m still not sure what I’d do differently next time," she said. Founded in 2013, KleverKid was backed by Aarin Capital and former Infosys board member Mohandas Pai.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ₹13,000 smart hairbrush listens to hair to track damage
article: Nokia-owned startup Withings and L'Oreal have created a ₹13,000 smart hairbrush called 'Hair Coach', that comes with an inbuilt microphone to listen to the hair brushing patterns for tracking damage. It has a gyroscope to analyse brushing force and speed and a vibrating handle that suggests better brushing techniques. A dedicated mobile app shows users their hair brushing analysis.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Actor suing us using celebrity status to hurt company: Tesla
article: Responding to South Korean celebrity Ji Chang Son's lawsuit, electric vehicle maker Tesla said that before filing the lawsuit the actor threatened to use his celebrity status to hurt the company. The actor claims that a Tesla Model X suddenly accelerated during parking, and rammed through his living room causing injuries to him and his son.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hero's Sunil Munjal eyeing Paytm stake at $5.7 bn valuation
article: Hero MotoCorp's Joint MD Sunil Munjal and Adventz Group Chairman Saroj Poddar are reportedly looking to buy a 0.35% stake or 1.6 lakh shares in Paytm, that would value the mobile wallet $5.7 billion (₹38,800 crore). The duo will buy the ₹50 crore worth of stake from early investor Nikhil Vora at ₹8,000 per share.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Lenskart losses rise 78% to ₹113 crore in 2016
article: Eyewear startup Lenskart's losses rose by 78% to ₹113 crore in 2016 from a year ago, according to documents filed with Registrar of Companies. However, Lenskart's revenue jumped 63% to ₹99 crore during the period. Lenskart was one of the most funded startups of 2016 after raising ₹600 crore from Ratan Tata, World Bank arm IFC and others.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola's head of luxury cab business Abhimanyu Rawal quits
article: Homegrown ride-hailing app Ola’s head of luxury cab category, Abhimanyu Rawal, quit the company last week and joined a US retail firm. Rawal was involved in the launching and expanding the Ola Lux category launched in May, that lets riders book luxury sedans like BMW and Jaguar. Ola’s head of new initiatives, Sundeep Sahni, also quit the company last week.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm removes dependency on banks, adds UPI support to app
article: To remove dependency on banks, Paytm has added Unified Payment Interface (UPI) support to its app allowing users to transfer money to their digital wallet with their UPI ID. Developed by a government-backed corporation, the UPI framework for online transactions supports at least 27 banks. This comes a week after SBI disabled the option to transfer money to Paytm.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jaipur rider takes highest number of Uber rides on New Year
article: Uber has revealed that a Jaipur rider took 12 rides through its service on New Year's eve, the highest ever took in India during the period. The Jaipur rider was followed by a Chandigarh rider, who took 10 Uber rides. Uber further shared that 6,883 riders got out of their cab within nine minutes of midnight December 31, 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Delhi Metro halts decision to accept Paytm at 10 stations
article: Delhi Metro's move to make 10 stations cashless has been halted after CM Arvind Kejriwal questioned allowing payments only through Paytm. "How can they force a decision like this? They are promoting Paytm through this. I will seek an inquiry," said Kejriwal. However, Delhi Metro Rail Corporation has said that Paytm won the contract through an open tender.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SpaceX explains why its Falcon 9 rocket exploded
article: Elon Musk-led space exploration startup SpaceX on Monday said that its Falcon 9 rocket exploded during the launch in September 2016 due to a buildup of oxygen in the aluminum liner. The explosion destroyed Facebook's satellite being carried by the rocket. SpaceX said that it will implement design changes to prevent any anomaly in the future.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Government allows bike taxis to operate in Noida, Ghaziabad
article: The regional transport authority has allowed the bike taxis to operate in four Uttar Pradesh districts including Ghaziabad, Gautam Budh Nagar, Hapur and Bulandshahr. There are 17 conditions that have to be fulfilled in order to get a permit for registering a bike taxi, according to the officials. Startups like Rapido, Baxi, Ola and Uber provide bike taxis.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Has BJP turned into a sales team of Paytm, asks AAP
article: Aam Aadmi Party spokesperson Richa Mishra on Tuesday enquired, "Has BJP turned into a sales team of Paytm?" Paytm is sponsoring BJP rallies and BJP leaders are in turn promoting the e-commerce platform that has a Chinese company as its “biggest investor”, she stated. AAP further released videos showing Paytm being promoted at a slum cluster by Delhi BJP leaders.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: ₹6 was the least spent on an order: Zomato
article: The least amount spent on an order was ₹6 on a ketchup sachet and the most ₹37,000, Zomato has said in its 'How India ate in 2016' consumer trends report. Meanwhile, the most ordered-in meal was dinner. Interestingly, a Zomato user from Delhi made nearly 600 online food orders between January and November.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: US Uber driver saves 16-year-old sex trafficking victim
article: An Uber driver saved a 16-year-old sex trafficking victim after overhearing a conversation between her and two women accused of pimping, as he drove them to a hotel, California Police said. Keith Avila said he became suspicious when he overheard the women giving the teenager sex tips. He said the teenager, a runaway, was later reunited with her parents.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup launches app for short-time meditation based on mood
article: Startup Aura Health has launched 'Aura', an iOS app that creates up to 200 short three-to-seven-minute meditation sessions based on the user's current mood — be that stressed, anxious, happy or sad. The app collects data on demographics and age to better understand what type of meditation suits the user. It also provides users with a graph of their mood.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Firm makes fitness tracking ring to measure calories burned
article: California-based startup Motiv has created a water-resistant smart ring that tracks users' activity, heart rate and sleep. The titanium-encased wearable also measures steps taken, calories burned and distance covered and shares it to a connected iOS app. Priced at $199 (₹13,600), Motiv Ring claims a battery life of up to five days on a 90-minute charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart shirt monitors heart rate with fabric-embedded sensors
article: Finnish startup Polar has created a smart workout shirt called 'Team Pro Shirt' that has a pair of sensors embedded into the fabric that contact with the skin to track the user's heart rate in real-time. A built-in sensor in the back collar tracks the wearer's speed, distance and acceleration. The shirt will be available for buying from March.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ex-Infosys CFOs invest in tax information platform TaxSutra
article: Pune-based online tax information platform TaxSutra has raised ₹2.5 crore from existing investors and former Infosys CFOs TV Mohandas Pai and V Balakrishnan. New investors like ex-Wipro taxation head PV Srinivasan also participated in the round. Founded in 2011, TaxSutra provides real-time news and case law analysis on income tax from the High Courts and the Supreme Court.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart makeup mirror senses surroundings for perfect lighting
article: A US-based startup has created 'Juno', a ₹5,400 smart makeup mirror that senses the surroundings to provide perfect lighting for various occasions like indoors, office, and evening. The lighting can also be controlled through a dedicated app. The mirror, with 5-times zoom, also comes with special built-in light for selfies and can also serve as a reading lamp when required.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Arizona man develops portable solar-powered refrigerator
article: Arizona-based innovator Spencer Trotter has developed 'Anywhere Fridge', a solar-powered fridge and freezer with a cooling range from minus 15°C to 10°C. The fridge has an integrated battery which powers it even on cloudy days and allows phone charging. Besides outdoor hangouts, it can be used for grocery shopping of cold items and to keep vaccines cool during natural disasters.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Banking platform for immigrants raises ₹68.3 crore
article: UK-based fintech startup Monese, which provides a banking platform for immigrants and expats, has raised $10 million (₹68.3 crore) in Series A funding. Anthemis Exponential Ventures and Korea Investment Partners participated in the round, along with Monese's existing investors SmartCap and Seedcamp. Monese claims users can open accounts via its smartphone app in under three minutes.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: InstantPay secures up to ₹34 crore in pre-series A funding
article: InstantPay has raised funding in the range of $3 million to $5 million (₹20 crore to ₹34 crore) from Singapore-based RB Investments and Kaleden Holdings. New Delhi-based InstantPay provides services including mobile recharge, insurance premium payments, and travel bookings among others. Founded in 2012, InstantPay also facilitates digital payments at kirana stores in tier-II and tier-III cities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal's former CPO invests in online shopping portal Fynd
article: Snapdeal's former Chief Product Officer and currently a Facebook executive, Anand Chandrasekaran has invested an undisclosed amount in online shopping portal Fynd. Arvind Sports Lifestyle CEO and online home design startup Livspace's Co-founder also participated in the round. Fynd in 2015 raised its Pre-Series A funding from Snapdeal founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal.

author: Akshita Jain
abstract: AIIMS partners with MobiKwik to go cashless
article: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Delhi has partnered with mobile wallet MobiKwik to make its payment facilities cashless. Payment of consultation fee, tests and other services will be made cashless from the first week of January. Upasana Taku, Co-founder of MobiKwik said, "We are proud to support Indians during the current situation of cash crunch."

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Swiggy promises on time delivery this New Year
article: Food delivery platform Swiggy is introducing time guaranteed deliveries from more than 1,200 restaurants across cities on 31st December and 1st January. Swiggy is offering a 100% cashback capped at ₹200 if the order is not delivered within the promised delivery time. The restaurants can be identified by the ‘Swiggy Assured’ tag in Delhi and 'On-time' banner in other cities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: World's cheapest phone Freedom 251 maker's MD quits
article: Noida-based company, which claims its phone Freedom 251 is the world's cheapest, Ringing Bells' MD Mohit Goel has quit weeks after the company confirmed his wife and CEO Dharna Goel's resignation. Earlier this month, Ringing Bells rubbished the reports of its shutdown. "Anmol Goel, one of the founder directors, is looking after the company affairs," said a company spokesperson.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Which companies faced criticism for their ads in 2016?
article: Pan Bahar's ad campaign featuring Pierce Brosnan made headlines after the actor claimed the product was pitched to him as a tooth whitener. Jack and Jones removed billboards featuring Ranveer Singh after they were accused of being sexist. Ola also withdrew a commercial with the line, "My girlfriend costs ₹525 per km, but Ola Micro costs just ₹6 per km."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Former Flipkart CPO Punit Soni praises Amazon
article: Former Flipkart Chief Product Officer Punit Soni, who quit the e-commerce major in April this year, has praised Flipkart's rival Amazon in a recent tweet. In November, Soni announced his own venture named 'Learning Motors', a machine learning startup. Prior to working with Flipkart, Soni had worked with companies like Google, Motorola and Intel.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: What were the biggest logo redesigns of 2016?
article: The year 2016 witnessed many large companies including Instagram, Uber and Subway change their logos to connect to their customers with a fresh approach. While Mastercard changed its logo for the first time in 20 years, Kodak changed its logo after ten years. Snapdeal did a major rebranding by introducing a new logo and a tagline by spending ₹200 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Which were the most funded Indian startups of 2016?
article: The year 2016 witnessed more startup deals than the previous year, with e-commerce platform ShopClues and messaging app Hike joining the billion-dollar club. Paytm raised ₹400 crore at a valuation of $5 billion in August. In September, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's Chan Zuckerberg Initiative made its first Asian investment by infusing $50 million in Bengaluru-based ed-tech platform Byju's.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Airbnb CEO asks on Twitter what company can launch in 2017
article: Short-term lodging startup Airbnb's CEO Brian Chesky recently took to Twitter to get ideas from people on what his company can launch in the next year. Within two days of posting the tweet, Chesky said he has received more than 1,700 different ideas. While one of the users suggested "Airbnb on Mars", Chesky tweeted in response, "Working on that...no joke."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: What were the biggest startup acquisitions in India in 2016?
article: The year 2016 saw more acquisitions than last year, with hyperlocal delivery, online travel and e-commerce startups being the biggest gainers in India. While Myntra bought Jabong for $70 million, MakeMyTrip bought rival Ibibo for $720 million to create the country's largest online travel firm. PayU bought Citrus Pay for $130 million, making 15 Citrus Pay employees crorepatis.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: What were the roadblocks faced by startups in 2016?
article: Major Indian startups like Snapdeal and Flipkart witnessed a valuation markdown this year. Companies like Zomato were forced to lay off staff and some had to rethink business models. Data analytics unicorn Mu Sigma faced uncertainty after its former CEO Ambiga Subramanian divorced the Co-founder Dhiraj Rajaram, while Paytm faced flak for gaining undue benefit from India's demonetisation drive.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra loss widens to ₹816 crore in 2016
