article: Flipkart-owned online fashion retailer Myntra's losses widened to ₹816 crore for the financial year 2015-16 compared with ₹741 crore a year earlier, according to data platform Tofler. However, Myntra reported revenue of ₹1,069 crore this year, compared with ₹773 crore a year earlier. It reported a slower growth this year which is being attributed to Myntra's app-only model.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: MobiKwik to allow payment of utility bills through e-wallet
article: Mobile wallet MobiKwik has received in-principle approval from the RBI to facilitate payment of utility and convenience bills on its platform. MobiKwik will be integrated into Bharat Bill Payment System to accept payments for utility services like electricity, water, gas, telephone, and Direct-to-Home (DTH). In October, MobiKwik launched Unified Payments Interface on its platform with ICICI Bank.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola's head of new initiatives Sundeep Sahni quits
article: Cab-hailing app Ola’s Vice President of new initiatives Sundeep Sahni has quit the company to reportedly start his own firm. Sahni, who joined Ola in July 2015, was heading multiple Ola businesses including Ola Shuttle, Ola Auto, Ola e-rickshaw and Ola Kaali-Peeli. Before joining Ola, he was the Managing Director and Co-founder of Rocket Internet-incubated e-commerce platform Lazada Indonesia.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Global CEO of Faraday Future quits before debut of 1st car
article: Ding Lei, Global CEO of Tesla's rival electric vehicle startup Faraday Future has quit the Chinese-backed, American start-up technology company days before the debut of its first fully electric production car at Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2017. Lei is also a top executive at technology firm LeEco and spearheaded its self-driving electric car project, the LeSEE.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Delhi has the most number of restaurants: Zomato
article: According to Zomato's year-end consumer trends report, Delhi has the highest number of restaurants among major cities, with nearly 16,000 eateries. The Zomato 'How India ate in 2016' report also said that North Indian and Chinese were the most popular cuisines among Indians. Meanwhile, Biryani was popular in Hyderabad, South Indian cuisine in Bengaluru and Italian in Mumbai.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rapper sues Amazon for merchandise sale without permission
article: American rap group Run-DMC's Founder Darryl McDaniels has sued Amazon and Walmart for selling clothes and accessories bearing the group's name without permission. McDaniels is seeking $50 million in damages from the retailers over the alleged sale of products that infringe the Run-DMC trademark registered in 2007. He said the retailers are confusing customers and trading on the group's goodwill.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon refuses to give police Echo recordings in murder case
article: E-commerce major Amazon has refused to give US police access to recordings from a voice-controlled Echo speaker after authorities issued a warrant demanding data from the device to help solve a murder case. However, Amazon has handed over the account information related to the Echo device and a list of purchases made from the account.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Twitter CEO asks users to suggest how it can improve in 2017
article: Following Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky, Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey also asked users what improvements they would like to see on the platform in 2017. Among the most requested was the ability to edit tweets and a plan to reduce abuse and harassment on the platform, which Dorsey said was Twitter's top priority.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SpaceX teases the 'most powerful rocket in the world'
article: Elon Musk-led aerospace manufacturer SpaceX has teased Falcon Heavy, which it claims is the most powerful operational rocket in the world. The rocket, which is scheduled to launch in 2017, can lift 54,000 kg into the orbit. SpaceX has said the rocket can carry twice the payload of the next most powerful rocket Delta IV Heavy, at one-third cost.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber fares will be highest between 12-3 am on New Year's eve
article: Uber has warned users that surge pricing will be the highest between midnight and 3 am in its 'New Year's Eve Ride Guide'. Uber says it anticipates the number of riders around the world to triple from 50 lakh last year to 1.5 crore on this New Year's Eve. Further, Uber has launched a #LeaveTheKeys campaign to discourage drunk driving.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Facebook acquires eye-tracking startup The Eye Tribe
article: Facebook has acquired Danish eye-tracking technology startup The Eye Tribe for an undisclosed amount for its virtual realty-focused Oculus division. The startup was founded in 2011 by four students from the IT University of Copenhagen. The Eye Tribe develops software that enables eye control on mobile devices and computers, allowing hands-free navigation.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Delhi spent the most on food: Zomato
article: People in Delhi spent the most amount of money on an order, an average of ₹522, while those in Pune spent the least, an average of ₹362, Zomato has said in its 2016 consumer trends report. People spent between ₹500 and ₹1000 on a meal for two while dining out. Zomato added that its most popular promotional code was 'Broke'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal to home-deliver Reliance Jio SIMs
article: Snapdeal will begin home delivery of Reliance Jio SIMs at select locations, the company has said in an e-mail sent to a set of customers. The e-mail recipients can enter details like time and when and where they want their SIM to be delivered. A Jio executive will visit the house of the customers to deliver and activate the SIM.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Lenskart to build other streams of revenue post ₹64 cr loss
article: Eyewear startup Lenskart is planning to build other streams of revenue, besides the existing e-commerce vertical and offline stores, according to CEO Peyush Bansal. It posted losses of ₹64 crore on the back of revenue of ₹61 crore for the year ended March 2015. Lenskart recently piloted a new programme under which customer can purchase eyewear through text messaging.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon patent shows flying warehouse plan for drone delivery
article: New patent filings by Amazon show how the e-commerce major could make doorstep drone deliveries through airborne fulfillment centers (AFCs) or warehouses. The airborne warehouses would be stocked with inventory and positioned near a location where Amazon predicts demand for certain items will spike. Drones could also be stocked at the AFCs and sent down to make on-demand deliveries.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Coca-Cola shuts its 3-year-old startup incubator
article: Coca-Cola has shut its three-year-old Founders program under which it gave startups access to its resources and seed funding worth $1 million or less. Coca-Cola said it will continue to work with the 12 companies it had funded, but will not fund new ones under the program. David Butler, VP of Innovation of Founders initiative has also left the company.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon launches platform to let people sell used products
article: E-commerce major Amazon has launched a new platform named 'Sell as Individual' that lets users sell used goods in their city on paying a fixed amount of fee. Currently being operated in Bengaluru, users need to share pictures and details of the products on Amazon's website and the company will provide doorstep pick-up, packing, and delivery of their goods.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup raises ₹37.5 crore to make smart vending machines
article: California-based startup Byte Foods has raised $5.5 million (₹37.5 crore) in seed funding for its smart vending machines in office spaces. The machines let users take out items and examine them without charging as long as the items are placed back. Byte Foods also developed software to predict demand for different items at each office where its machines are stationed.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: What were the biggest startup shutdowns in India in 2016?
article: In 2016, many startups emerged and received massive funding rounds, however, many other startups, especially the ones operating in the food and grocery delivery space, faced shutdown. The biggest shutdowns include PepperTap, TinyOwl, and Housing Co-founder Rahul Yadav's new venture. Used car marketplace GoZoomo witnessed a unique shutdown after founders returned the remaining funds to investors.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Firm claiming it put 'bullet in Google's head' shuts service
article: Cyanogen, the startup that aimed to build a better version of Android than Google and claimed it was "putting a bullet through Google's head," has announced the end of its services and operating system. This update means Cyanogen OS devices like the OnePlus One will have to transition to CyanogenMod ROM, which is managed by former Cyanogen Co-founder Steve Kondik.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm has more than ₹1,000 crore in its wallet, says CEO
article: Digital wallet and m-commerce platform Paytm's CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma in a recent interview revealed that the wallet has more than ₹1,000 crore in its account. "Right now Paytm gets deposits of anywhere between ₹122 to ₹150 crore every day in its account," Sharma added. He claimed that since demonetisation, Paytm user base increased from 15 crore to 17.2 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SBI disables the option to transfer money to Paytm wallet
article: The State Bank of India has disabled the option to transfer money to Paytm wallets from its internet banking services. "We recommend using State Bank Buddy mobile (bank's own wallet) app for Android and iOS devices", SBI tweeted. When one of the bank's users tweeted that SBI Buddy's interface is poor, Paytm replied by tweeting, "Happiness is guaranteed at Paytm".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Shilpa's channel hasn't paid dues for a year, sellers allege
article: Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra, Akshay Kumar and Sonakshi Sinha-owned shopping channel Best Deal TV has unpaid dues worth crores for a year, sellers who sold goods on the platform have alleged. Launched in 2015, the channel suspended its operations this month. Payments of ₹4.5 crore will be disbursed once CEO Kundra returns from vacation on January 9, the company said.

author: Ankur Vyas
abstract: Go to play school, understand meaning of Paytm: BJP to Rahul
article: Responding to Congress Vice President Rahul Gandhi referring to Paytm as 'Pay to Modi', BJP has advised him to go attend a play school and learn the meaning of Paytm. "Rahul Gandhi's statements will remain statements only, they will not have any impact on the people," BJP's Rahul Sinha said. Sinha further asserted that BJP will keep the politics clean.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon copies everything from us, says Flipkart
article: Flipkart's Head of Category Design Organization, Kalyan Krishnamurthy, in an interview said, "They (Amazon) copy everything, or they wait for someone from somewhere to tell them what to do." He added, "We came up with Big Billion Days, they copied that...When we have a bank offer, they have it too." He added Amazon can't get anywhere by just pouring money.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon India registers ₹3,572 crore loss in 2016
article: Flipkart rival Amazon India's losses for the financial year 2015-16 soared to ₹3,572 crore from ₹1,724 crore in the previous year, according to regulatory documents sourced from data platform Tofler. However, the company's revenues grew more than double compared to the last year, to ₹2,275 crore. Earlier this month, Amazon made its single largest investment of ₹2,010 crore in India.

author: Tarun Khanna
abstract: ‘BJP wing was asked to force Snapdeal to dump Aamir Khan’
article: BJP’s IT cell head had asked the party’s social media cell to pressurise e-commerce platform Snapdeal to drop actor Aamir Khan as its brand ambassador, an ex-volunteer of the party has reportedly claimed. Sadhavi Khosla, who quit the BJP social media cell in 2015, has shared a WhatsApp message which read, "Appeal Snapdeal to drop Aamir Khan from their ads."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Cash is like a drug, says Flipkart CEO Binny Bansal
article: E-commerce major Flipkart's CEO Binny Bansal in a recent interview said, "Cash is like a drug, and when you start solving problems with cash you get addicted to it." He added, "It’s hard to get out of that addiction." Bansal's comment comes after Amazon made its single largest investment of ₹2,010 crore in India earlier this month.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indian startup makes bed with inbulit power outlet, speakers
article: Bengaluru-based furniture rental startup Furlenco has created a bed called 'Pod' which comes with a 32-inch television and inbuilt power outlets, lamp, speakers with subwoofer, Bluetooth connectivity, and a bookshelf. The Pod is available for rent in limited numbers across Bengaluru, Mumbai and Pune for ₹2,999 a month and ₹2,499 for the version without a television.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: On-demand delivery startup Shadowfax raises ₹68 crore
article: Logistics startup Shadowfax has raised ₹68 crore in Series B funding led by existing investor Eight Roads Ventures, an investment arm of Fidelity International. Shadowfax is an intra-city logistics service catering to neighbourhood merchants, grocery shops, pharmacies and e-commerce. Set up as a food-only delivery player in 2015, it later diversified across multiple verticals.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola posts series of tweets for drunk driving awareness
article: Ride-hailing app Ola on Sunday posted a series of unusual tweets, after which people started speculating a possible Twitter hack. "Bro @onlybabasehgal, aaja meri gaadi mein baet ja, and then let's go to the Gym!" read one of the tweets. Ola later revealed that the tweets were posted to raise awareness against drunk driving.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Woman develops bedtime story projector for smartphones
article: New York-based entrepreneur Natalie Rebot has created a ₹2,400 device called 'Moonlite' that can be added to a smartphone's camera to act as a bedtime story projector. The device comes with story reels and a dedicated app that includes sound effects and high-definition images. The images can be projected on the ceiling, walls or a projection screen.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Investments in Indian startups plunged by 44.3% in 2016
article: Indian startups witnessed a 44.3% decline in value of investments in 2016 at $1.452 billion, down from $2.606 billion in 2015. According to VCCEdge, the FinTech sector secured the most number of deals this year, with 67 investments worth $183 million, while HealthTech startups attracted about $69 million across 60 deals, followed by EduTech with $21 million through 41 deals.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart's Sachin, Binny Bansal back health startup Pandorum
article: Flipkart's founders Sachin Bansal and Binny Bansal have invested an undisclosed amount in Pandorum Technologies, a health startup that has found a way to 3D-print experimental-stage human liver tissues in a laboratory. This marks their fourth investment in a healthcare startup. Founded in 2011, Pandorum Technologies designs and manufactures functional human tissues intended for medical research.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Infosys Co-founder Nilekani invests ₹34 cr in 10i Commerce
article: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani has reportedly invested $5 million (nearly ₹34 crore) in Bengaluru-based e-commerce startup 10i Commerce, bringing his total investment in the firm to about $10 million (nearly ₹68 crore). 10i Commerce has built a technology platform called ShopX to help small brick-and-mortar retailers set up their own online stores to compete with large online retailers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat acquires Israeli startup Cimagine
article: Photo messaging app Snapchat has acquired an Israeli artificial intelligence startup named  Cimagine for a reported $30-$40 million. Cimagine, which counts global giant Coca Cola among its clients, lets consumers instantly visualise products they want to buy in their intended location. Snapchat is reportedly aiming for an IPO in March 2017, that could value the company between $20-$25 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Suresh Raina's quote among Richard Branson's top 10 list
article: Virgin Group Founder Richard Branson has shared a list of top 10 quotes on celebrating, which also includes a quote by cricketer Suresh Raina. "It lifts the energy levels of the entire side if you are positive and vocal when a wicket falls," reads Raina's quote. "Never underestimate the importance of celebrating," Branson said in his post.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: FreeCharge denies reports of sale to PayPal
article: Homegrown e-wallet FreeCharge has dismissed reports that suggested global payments platform PayPal is set to buy a 25% stake in the company. Media reports claimed on Sunday that PayPal is expected to take a significant stake in FreeCharge for around $200 million.  "There is no such discussion or proposal and the story is completely incorrect," a FreeCharge spokesperson said.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: French grocery chain trolls Amazon's hi-tech store concept
article: French grocer Monoprix has released a video mocking Amazon's 'Go' stores which will detect items picked and charge customers through an app without having to wait in lines. Monoprix's ad is a recreation of Amazon's and depicts its 10-year-old service that lets users walk out after choosing what they want and then delivers it to their house within an hour.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Finland turning 130-year-old hospital into a startup campus
article: Finland’s Helsinki has launched a plan to turn a 130-year-old abandoned hospital into a startup campus where entrepreneurs and investors can connect. Spread across 32,000 square metres, the campus is already home to 80 startups and at least two venture capital firms. Startups have to apply, get selected, and pay a monthly fee for each desk in the space.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Teams from India, Japan partner to share ride to moon
article: India's entry to Google Lunar X Prize competition, Team Indus has partnered with Japanese team Hakuto to carry its four-wheeled lunar rover to the Moon’s surface. Earlier this month, Team Indus announced that it had signed a launch contract with ISRO to launch its lunar lander and rover with the PSLV rocket.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Delhi NCR tops in online shopping, reveals Flipkart
article: E-commerce major Flipkart on Sunday said it saw the highest number of shoppers on its platform coming from Delhi NCR this year. It was followed by Bengaluru, Mumbai, Chennai, Hyderabad and the other metro cities. Among the tier III towns of the country, Vellore accounted for most of the online shopping on the platform.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Shaadi.com acquires mobile dating app Frivil
article: Matrimonial site Shaadi.com has acquired mobile-based dating app Frivil. The app shows users photographs of two people from which they have to choose one potential date and matches users based on popularity and location. In January 2015, the parent company of Shaadi.com acquired a 25% stake in Frivil's parent firm Thrill for $1 million.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Personal care startup MCaffeine raises ₹2cr in angel funding
article: Ecommerce-based personal care products startup MCaffeine has raised ₹2 crore from a clutch of angel investors including Ola's COO Pranay Jivrajka. Launched in 2015 by Vikas Lachhwani and Tarun Sharma, the startup deals in personal care products like shampoo, face-wash and shower-gels infused with caffeine and ginseng among other products for energising results.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Panasonic to invest $256 mn in Tesla's solar cell factory
article: Japanese electronics company Panasonic will invest more than $256 million in a New York production facility owned by Elon Musk's Tesla Motors to make solar cells and panels. Following the announcement, Tesla's shares were up by 3.5% on Tuesday. Panasonic is the exclusive supplier of batteries for Tesla's Model S, Model X, and the upcoming Model 3.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal starts home delivery of cash up to ₹2,000
article: E-commerce platform Snapdeal has started a new service called 'Cash@Home’ where it is delivering cash up to ₹2,000 to customers' home at a convenience fee of ₹1. Snapdeal personnel will arrive at customers' doorstep with PoS machines where ATM cards can be swiped for hard cash up to ₹2,000. As of now, the service is live in Gurugram and Bengaluru.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Delhi named India's most well-read city of 2016 by Amazon
article: Delhi has emerged as the country's most well-read city the fourth consecutive year with Bengaluru and Mumbai taking the second and third spot, according to Annual Reading Trends Report 2016 by Amazon. For the first time, Karnal, Vadodara and Patna made it to the top 20 cities, having bought more books than cities like Coimbatore, Visakhapatnam and Lucknow this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: PayPal to buy 25% stake for $200 mn in FreeCharge: Report
article: American payments platform PayPal is reportedly buying a 25% stake in Snapdeal-owned payments platform FreeCharge for around $200 million. Reports claim that PayPal’s initial offer was for a controlling 51% stake, but FreeCharge's largest shareholder SoftBank is not keen to divest a majority stake. Interestingly, Alibaba, in which SoftBank has a significant stake, has a controlling stake in Paytm.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Don’t care about Flipkart, Ola's protectionist calls: Amazon
article: Amazon India head Amit Agarwal has said that his company does not care about the efforts homegrown rival Flipkart and cab aggregator Ola are making to seek government help to take on global rivals. He added, "We always keep complying with whatever rules are set by the government...I know there are things that will not change, no matter what happens."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola, Uber losing ₹340 crore every month: Meru CEO
article: Meru Cabs CEO Siddhartha Pahwa has claimed that its rivals Ola and Uber are each losing ₹340 crore every month. "The only difference between us and them is that they are dumping capital on drivers and customers, and we aren’t," he said. "The day the incentives stop, drivers will move away from Uber and Ola," added Pahwa.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart, Amazon spar over TV brand after OnePlus spat
article: Flipkart-exclusive television brand Vu has warned customers not to buy its televisions from any other online marketplace as they may not be genuine. However, Amazon said that products on its platform like Vu TVs are directly sold by independent sellers. This comes after Amazon-exclusive phone maker OnePlus issued a similar advisory when its phones were listed for sale on Flipkart.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: 'Republic' will change perspective of journalism, says Arnab
article: Television journalist and former Editor-in-Chief of Times Now Arnab Goswami has said his new venture 'Republic' would change the “perspective” of journalism. “The people who rejoiced when I left will eat their words now, because I am coming back with Republic,” he said. As long as he remains in the journalism profession, he won't “let down” people’s faith, Goswami added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SoftBank puts $1bn in firm launching 648 internet satellites
article: In its first US investment after SoftBank's CEO Masayoshi Son met US President-elect Donald Trump, the Japanese conglomerate has invested $1 billion in US-based satellite startup OneWeb. The startup plans to launch a constellation of 648 satellites in 2018 to provide internet across the world. The investment is expected to create 3,000 new jobs in the US over four years.

author: Daisy Mowke
abstract: Uber CEO announces scholarship for baby named 'Uber'
article: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick has announced a scholarship of approximately ₹8.14 lakh for the higher education of a baby named Uber who recently turned a year old. Babli, the mother, had delivered the baby in an Uber cab last December with help from the driver, who had provided her with towels and water stored in the car.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MobiKwik trolls rival Paytm over frequent outages
article: MobiKwik on Wednesday trolled rival Paytm as it faced frequent service outages. MobiKwik started tweeting back Paytm users' complaints with responses like "Don't worry #MobiKwikHaiNa" and "We never go offline." MobiKwik's CEO Bipin Preet Singh retweeted a Paytm user's tweet which read, "Hi Uber, since you're having trouble with Paytm wallets, it'd be a great time to allow MobiKwik payments."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: CBI registers new FIR against 7 customers for cheating Paytm
article: CBI has registered a fresh case against seven customers and 'unknown officials' of online payments company Paytm for allegedly cheating the startup of ₹3.21 lakh through 37 orders over the last two years. Paytm has said it can identify those employees who duped the company by wrongly making refunds to these customers, even for successfully completed deliveries.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: China's Alibaba back on US fake goods blacklist
article: A US trade agency on Wednesday put Chinese e-commerce major Alibaba's Taobao platform on its fake products blacklist, four years after removing it from the list. The agency cited an unacceptably high level of reported counterfeiting and piracy for adding Alibaba back to the "Notorious Markets" list. Alibaba claimed the move is linked to the "current political climate" in US.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Note ban has been good for Amazon, says India head Agarwal
article: Amazon India head Amit Agarwal has said that since demonetisation the number of customers switching to digital has gone up 10 times, adding that overall note ban has been good for the company. Further, "Our business is back to normal. Taking into account the Diwali sale, our growth is 100% year on year," Agarwal added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber allows to set people as destinations in US
article: Ride-hailing app Uber has allowed its users in the US to set people instead of places as their destinations. On syncing their phones' contacts with the Uber app, Uber will allow the riders' friends to share their location to be used as the destination. Uber will also text the ride information and the estimated arrival time to the chosen contact.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Cab aggregator policy needs least govt interference: HC
article: The Delhi High Court on Wednesday said any policy to regulate app-based cab aggregators like Ola and Uber should have minimum government interference. Adding that market forces should be allowed to operate, the court added that regulation could "bring in corruption" in this emerging sector. The court also asked Delhi government to look at a policy drafted by its panel.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Byju's raises funding from World Bank's arm IFC
article: Education technology startup Byju’s on Tuesday said it has raised an undisclosed amount from World Bank's arm International Finance Corporation. This comes after Byju's raised $50 million earlier in September led by the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, a personal fund set up by Facebook Co-founder Mark Zuckerberg and his wife Priscilla Chan. Byju's was founded by Byju Raveendran in November 2011.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zoomcar raises funding from Chinese VC firm Cyber Carrier
article: Self-drive car rental startup Zoomcar on Tuesday raised an undisclosed amount from China-based venture capital firm Cyber Carrier CL as an extension of its Series B funding round. Zoomcar had raised $24 million in August in Series B round led by Ford Smart Mobility LLC, a unit of carmaker Ford. The company has so far raised at least $45 million.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BigBasket to launch its own wet wipes, disposable bags brand
article: Grocery delivery startup BigBasket will soon be launching its private label for non-food products including wet wipes, disposable bags and buckets. It will also sell new food products such as noodles and papads under its private brand Tasties, and honey, cereals and flavoured tea under brand Royal. Earlier this month, BigBasket launched Lindberg, a private brand for chocolates.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber admits its self-driving cars took dangerous turns
article: Uber has admitted that there's a problem with the way its self-driving cars cross bike lanes in San Francisco, that the advocates fear could have deadly consequences for cyclists. An Uber spokeswoman said engineers are working to fix the flaw in self-driving programming. On the first day of its launch in the city, an Uber car jumped the red light.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber's Middle east rival Careem receives $1 bn valuation
article: Uber's middle eastern rival Careem has raised $350 million (approximately ₹2,380 crore) in Series D round of funding, valuing the taxi-hailing startup at $1 billion (₹6,790 crore). The funding was led by Japanese e-commerce firm Rakuten and government-controlled Saudi Telecom Company (STC). Founded in 2012, Careem operates in the Middle East, Turkey, Pakistan and parts of North Africa.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: This is our last funding round before IPO: Uber rival Careem
article: Mudassir Sheikha, Co-founder of Uber's cab-hailing rival in the Middle Eastern region Careem, which raised $350 million at a valuation of $1 billion on Monday, has said that the company does not need to raise more money before its IPO. The company is on a path to profitability and aims to cover 20 countries between Pakistan and Morocco, Sheikha added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber launches fleet of electric Tesla cars in Spain
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber has launched a fleet of electric Tesla Model S cars in Madrid, Spain. Uber was banned in the city till March this year and aims to improve its image in the city with the introduction of cleaner cars. The company started trials with fully-electric cars in Portugal and London, earlier this year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 2 top executives quit Faraday Future before debut of 1st car
article: Tesla's rival electric vehicle startup Faraday Future has reportedly lost two of its top executives, less than a month before the debut of its first production car at Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2017. Marco Mattiacci, Chief Brand and Commercial Officer, and Joerg Sommer, VP for Product Marketing and Growth have been removed from the company's website.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: QuizUp's maker acquired by game developer Glu Mobile
article: Glu Mobile, developer of celeb-themed games including those on Kim Kardashian and Nicki Minaj, has acquired Plain Vanilla and its mobile social trivia game QuizUp. The deal was reportedly valued at $7.5 million (₹50.8 crore), including forgiven debt. Iceland-based Plain Vanilla had raised over $40 million (₹271 crore) in total funding, with Sequoia and Tencent among notable investors.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapchat sets up office in China despite being banned
article: Social media company Snapchat, which has been rebranded as Snap, has set up an office in China despite being banned in the country. The operation will reportedly focus on Snap's video-recording sunglasses Spectacles, which are assembled in China. The company is said to be looking at hiring employees from companies like Alibaba, Baidu or Tencent.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber Q3 loss exceeds $800 million after China exit: Reports
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber has reportedly lost more than $2.2 billion in the first nine months of this year, including a loss of over $800 million in the third quarter despite exiting from China in August. However, the world's most valuable startup is said to be on track to post a revenue of more than $5.5 billion this year.

author: Chhavi Tyagi
abstract: Government very keen on encouraging start-ups: PM Modi
article: Inaugurating the National Institute of Securities Markets in Maharashtra, PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said, the government is "very keen to encourage start-ups". "Stock markets are essential for the start-up ecosystem. India has earned a good name for its well-regulated securities markets," he added. He also said they will continue "with sound economic policies to ensure India's bright future."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I will apply to be a citizen of India if needed: Uber CEO
article: Ride-hailing app Uber's CEO Travis Kalanick hit at rival Ola on Thursday and said, "If it is about whether I am personally Indian, I will apply to be a citizen of India if this is what gets us over the hump." Kalanick's comments come after Ola's CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said that Indian government should change policies to protect homegrown startups.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Lalit, Aanchal most right swiped Indian names on Tinder
article: The online dating platform Tinder has revealed a list of the most right-swiped names in India in 2016. According to the list, Lalit is the most popular name among boys while Aanchal is the most right-swiped name among girls. Other popular female names are Sonal, Kritika, and Sakshi, while among males, Joel, Kushagra and Junaid are popular.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon makes single largest investment of ₹2,010 cr in India
article: Amazon has infused fresh ₹2,010 crore capital in India, making it the single largest investment made by the e-commerce major in the country. The latest investment has taken the total capital invested by Amazon in the past 12 months in India to ₹7,000 crore. "We'll invest what it takes to become Indian customers’ preferred choice," said Amazon India.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: PayPal files complaint against Paytm for copying its logo
article: Multinational online payments company PayPal has called Indian e-payments startup Paytm's logo "deceptively and confusingly similar" to its own in a complaint filed with the Trade Marks Registry. Paytm has "slavishly adopted the two-tone blue colour scheme," stated the complaint. Further, PayPal has also opposed Paytm's use of the term "Pay" and the similarity in lengths of the two logos.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Arnab Goswami's new venture to be called 'Republic'
article: Television journalist and former Editor-in-Chief of Times Now and ET Now Arnab Goswami has revealed that his new venture will be called 'Republic'. "I seek the support of the people of India," he added. Goswami, known for his prime-time debate show ‘The Newshour’, quit Times Now on November 1 this year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Landed in India without a valid visa, reveals Uber CEO
article: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick has revealed he encountered a "scary situation" on his arrival in India as he landed without a valid visa and NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant saved him from being deported. "On the Indian visa, they go the opposite direction...November 12 would be 11/12 in the US and 12/11 in India. There was a misunderstanding," he said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grofers losing ₹5.1 crore a month now: CEO Albinder Dhindsa
article: Grofers' losses have been brought down by 30% from ₹7.2 crore in July to ₹5.1 crore a month now, CEO Albinder Dhindsa has claimed. Grofers is using four-wheelers instead of two wheelers for deliveries, which has increased the delivery capacity by 10%, he added. Dhindsa further claimed the average order value of ₹750 in July has gone up to ₹1,000.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: We thought Goibibo couldn't build a business: MakeMyTrip CEO
article: Online travel portal MakeMyTrip's Co-founder and CEO Deep Kalra has said that the company used to call then-rival Goibobo a 'discount shop', adding, "We knew you can’t build a business on discounting. But we were wrong." MakeMyTrip bought Ibibo Group this year to create the biggest player in the online travel bookings market in the country.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber CEO tweets Sant Kabir's doha learnt in India
article: Ride-hailing app Uber's Co-founder and CEO Travis Kalanick, who is on a visit to India, on Friday tweeted Sant Kabir's doha that he learned from his team in the country. Earlier, Kalanick met NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant and Union Information Technology Minister Ravi Prasad in New Delhi. He had also met former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar earlier in Mumbai.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Paytm claims to be cheated of ₹6 lakh by customers
article: Digital payments platform Paytm on Friday claimed that the company has been cheated of ₹6.15 lakh by its customers. CBI has registered an FIR against employees from Paytm's parent company One97 and 15 customers from South Delhi. Paytm says the customers were given refunds in 48 cases for incomplete orders even though they had successfully received the products ordered.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Our battle in China went global: Uber CEO on exit from China
article: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick on Friday said the company sold its stake in China to rival Didi Chuxing as "the battle in China became global." Kalanick explained that Chinese wealth was being invested in Uber's competition globally, while American tech companies were investing in Uber's Chinese competitor. He added that exiting from China helped Uber focus on its Indian operations.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Twitter killed India-made chat app before launch: Report
article: Twitter's Indian engineering center in Bengaluru developed an instant messaging app for emerging markets but the product was killed before launch, a new report has claimed. The company shut down the engineering center in September this year and laid off around 20 employees. Twitter India head Rishi Jaitly also quit the company in November this year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Why do we need self-driving permit but not Tesla, asks Uber
article: Uber has responded to California regulators' order to stop its self-driving taxi service in San Francisco by asking why it is required to get a permit while Tesla's autopilot technology does not need one. The multi-billion dollar startup has argued that its self-driving cars don't need the permit since there is always a human driver behind the wheel.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Chrome extension by Washington Post fact-checks Trump tweets
article: The Washington Post has launched a Google Chrome extension called "RealDonaldContext" that claims to let users check the accuracy of US President-elect Donald Trump's tweets. Donald Trump has tweeted over 34,000 times and has 17.4 million followers on the platform. In June, Trump temporarily banned The Washington Post from covering his Presidential campaign's events, calling the paper "dishonest."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Faraday Future sued for $10 mn for late payments to supplier
article: Tesla's rival Faraday Future has been sued for $10 million by its supplier named Futuris over late payments. Futuris alleged that Faraday owes it $10 million, of which the payment of $7 million is more than 30 days late. A warehouse owner has also sued Faraday claiming that the company owes it over $100,000 in missed payments.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: I better love Hindi weddings: Uber CEO on Indian citizenship
article: After saying that he was ready to apply to be a citizen of India, ride-hailing app Uber's CEO Travis Kalanick joked, "If I am looking for an Indian citizenship, then I better love Hindi weddings."  Kalanick called Indian weddings "very customer-centric," where the bride and groom do the hard work and others get to enjoy.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Healthcare startup Practo makes 5th acquisition in 2 years
article: Bengaluru-based healthcare services platform Practo has acquired healthcare analytics solutions firm Enlightiks in a cash and stock deal, making it Practo's fifth acquisition in two years. Practo counts Tencent, Google Capital and Sequoia Capital among its investors. It was valued at over ₹3,300 crore at the time of its last funding in August 2015.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Red heart most Instagrammed emoji of 2016
article: The red heart has emerged as the most Instagrammed emoji of 2016, Instagram has revealed. It has been followed by the smiling face with heart-shaped eyes and the face with tears of joy. The kissing face,  double hearts, smiling face, OK and victory signs, confetti ball and blue heart have completed the top ten.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amma venture fund of ₹200 crore to fund Tamil Nadu startups
article: The Tamil Nadu government will soon make ₹200-crore 'Amma Venture Capital Fund' announced by former CM late J Jayalalithaa operational to boost entrepreneurship in the state. The fund will provide each selected startup with ₹1 crore in funding. The new fund will work in conjunction with an already launched ₹20-crore biotech incubation centre in Chennai.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hotel booking startup Trivago raises $287 million in IPO
article: Germany-based online hotel booking platform Trivago has raised $287 million in its initial public offering. Shares of the company rose as much as 10.7% to a high of $12.18 in their debut on Friday, valuing Trivago at about $2.89 billion. American travel agency Expedia owns a 62% stake in Trivago, for which it paid over $600 million in 2012.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon India launches e-wallet for its platform
article: Amazon India has launched an online wallet called 'Amazon Pay Balance' which can only be used to make Amazon-based transactions. Amazon Pay Balance can be credited with money using internet banking or credit or debit cards and used to make payments for purchases from the e-commerce portal. Amazon has said the wallet will also enable customers to get faster refunds.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Elon Musk jokes about starting 'The Boring Company'
article: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk on Saturday joked about starting a tunnel boring company called 'The Boring Company.' Musk tweeted,"Traffic is driving me nuts. Am going to build a tunnel boring machine and just start digging," adding, "It shall be called 'The Boring Company'... Boring, it's what we do."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Instagram fixes bug that made Singapore-tagged posts viral
article: Instagram said that it has fixed a bug that reportedly increased the reach of posts that were geo-tagged in "Singapore, Singapore" even if the users were not at the location. The hack is said to have existed since November 30 and was reportedly used by popular Instagrammers King Bach and Dan Bilzerian to increase engagement on their posts.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Amazon pilots warn of delays in holiday deliveries
article: A union representing pilots who fly products for e-commerce major Amazon ran digital advertisements on Friday that suggest delays in holiday gifts' delivery. The ads, ran on Facebook and Google, link to a site called "Can Amazon Deliver?", warning customers of staffing problems. "This holiday season, Amazon customers may want to think twice before ordering last-minute deliveries," the site said.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Unicorn startup GitHub loses $66 million in 9 months
article: Online project hosting startup GitHub, which was valued at $2 billion at the time of its last funding in 2015, lost $66 million in the first nine months of the year. In comparison, the company had posted a loss of $27 million for the fiscal year ended in January 2016. GitHub counts Andreessen Horowitz and Sequoia Capital among its investors.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Eduwhere launches free mock test series for IIT-JEE 2017
article: Eduwhere, an online test preparation platform, has launched free assessment and online test series for IIT-JEE 2017. Eduwhere's data & machine learning techniques provide detailed analysis reports to the candidates to evaluate their performance. Test Takers will be able to attempt free weekly quizzes on the Eduwhere Knowledge Hub. Aspirants can also access previous years papers for free.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Property startup NoBroker raises ₹47 crore in fresh funding
article: Real estate startup NoBroker has raised $7 million (over ₹47 crore) as an extension to its Series B funding from South Korean investment firm KTB Ventures. According to NoBroker, this marks the first time a Korean fund has led the funding round for an Indian startup. The company connects property owners with prospective buyers directly without a need for brokers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ambani, Tata join Bill Gates for $1 bn clean energy fund
article: Reliance Industries Chairman and India's richest person Mukesh Ambani and Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata with Bill Gates, Jack Ma and other billionaires have created a $1 billion fund to invest in clean energy. Called the Breakthrough Energy Ventures, the fund will invest the sum to fight climate change through innovation in clean energy over the next 20 years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indian takes world's highest number of Uber rides in 2016
article: A Bengaluru rider took 3,135 Uber rides in 2016, making it the highest number of rides taken by a single rider through the ride-hailing app this year worldwide. This means the rider took about eight Uber rides per day on an average. For Uber, India became the largest market outside of the US this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Larry Page named world's most powerful CEO by Forbes
article: Google's parent company Alphabet's CEO Larry Page has been named the world's most powerful CEO by Forbes, with his company having a market capitalisation of over $550 billion. Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg and Amazon's Jeff Bezos have been ranked second and third respectively. Tesla's Elon Musk and Walmart's Doug McMillon have also featured on the list.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Businesses that seem sexy are not real: MobiKwik to Paytm
article: Taking a hit at rival Paytm, MobiKwik's Co-founder Upasana Taku on Monday tweeted, "Businesses that seem sexy are not real; Real businesses may not look so sexy!" "Competition is busy pasting stickers near media houses," she said in another tweet. MobiKwik's CEO Bipin Preet Singh said, "Paying at a paan shop is good for marketing yourself...but that’s not real business".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyperloop to reduce Pune-Mumbai travel time to 25 minutes
article: US-based high-speed transportation system Hyperloop, if introduced in India, will reduce the travel time between Pune to Mumbai to only 25 minutes, according to company's Chairman Bibop G Gresta. "You can live in Pune and work in Mumbai or vice-versa," said Gresta. The Hyperloop proposal is with Union transport minister Nitin Gadkari for its feasibility evaluation in the country.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Gym trainer murders Flipkart delivery man over smartphone
article: Police have arrested a Bengaluru gym trainer for allegedly murdering a Flipkart delivery man as he did not have money to pay for the Redmi Note 3 mobile phone he had ordered. The victim was found with his throat slit in the basement of the gym. Reportedly, the accused also stole the other phones in the delivery man's bag.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: What is Hyperloop transportation and how does it work?
article: American startup Hyperloop Transportation Technologies is developing a high-speed transportation system including vacuum tube trains traveling at speeds up to 1,200 kmph. It claims to cover the distance of 328 kilometres between Washington DC and New York in 30 minutes. The system includes self-driving cars to pick and drop passengers from their location to Hyperloop stations and vice-versa.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla rival Lucid Motors' new car travels 640 km per charge
article: Electric vehicle maker Tesla's rival Lucid Motors on Thursday unveiled its first car called the 'Air' which travels over 640 kilometres on a single charge. Powered by a 100 kWh battery, the luxury sedan accelerates from 0-100 kmph in just 2.5 seconds. Founded by former Tesla and BMW executives, Lucid Motors plans to launch the Air in 2018.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Yes Bank partners with Grofers to home deliver cash
article: Yes Bank has tied-up with grocery delivery startup Grofers to deliver up to ₹2,000 cash to customers when they order grocery worth minimum ₹1,000 online. The service, which is open to all bank account holders, is currently operational in Mumbai, Gurugram and Bengaluru. Grofers delivery executives will carry Yes Bank PoS machines that users can swipe to get cash.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Paytm dumping capital to gain customers: MobiKwik CEO
article: Mobile wallet MobiKwik CEO Bipin Singh has accused sector leader and rival Paytm of dumping capital to gain customers. Singh added the investment has been used only for cashback and discount offers by Paytm, without contributing anything to innovation. Referring to Paytm's biggest investor Alibaba, Singh cautioned that data of Indian customers can be used by foreign companies.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 2 arrested for duping Flipkart of ₹1.05 crore, 152 phones
article: Two men were arrested by Rajasthan police for allegedly duping Flipkart of ₹1.05 crore and 152 mobile phones. Flipkart said the duo ordered the smartphones under different names, IDs and addresses and then asked the company for refunds by claiming they had received empty boxes. The scam was noticed after Flipkart received two refund requests from the same bank account.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon makes its first ever drone delivery
article: E-commerce major Amazon on Wednesday successfully made its first-ever fully autonomous drone delivery without any human pilot. The delivery was made to an England customer's farmhouse, who ordered a digital media console and a popcorn packet. It took the drone only 13 minutes to make the delivery. Amazon is testing under 30-minute deliveries via drones that fly below 400 feet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber CEO meets Sachin Tendulkar in Mumbai
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber's Co-founder and CEO Travis Kalanick, who is in India for a business review meeting, met former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar in Mumbai. "Learnt about a religion called cricket from the god himself! Thanks for having me over," tweeted Kalanick and shared a picture of himself with Tendulkar.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon accused of 'intolerable' work conditions at warehouse
article: One of the biggest e-commerce companies, Amazon has been accused of 'intolerable' working conditions at its Scotland warehouse, with workers being penalised for sick days and some camping nearby to save money commuting to work. An investigation claims that while a worker walks up to 16 kilometres a day during work, water dispensers at the warehouse are regularly empty.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Woman driver in US makes ‘longest ever Uber ride’
article: A woman driver reportedly made what is believed to be the longest Uber ride on record, when a customer undertook an over 600-kilometre-long journey from Virginia to Brooklyn. The customer, who wanted to meet her boyfriend, was driven by 64-year-old Janis Rogers. The drive took nearly eight hours to complete, with the bill accounting to nearly ₹20,000 ($294.09).

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 2 Indian-origin entrepreneurs in America's richest under 40
article: Two Indian-origin businessmen have been included in Forbes' list of America's wealthiest entrepreneurs under the age of 40. Biopharmaceutical company Roivant Sciences Founder Vivek Ramaswamy ranked 24th on the list with a net worth of $600 million, while Instacart Founder Apoorva Mehta ranked 31st on the list with an estimated worth of $360 million.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Will reduce the need for cars by using cars: Uber CEO
article: Cab-hailing service Uber's CEO Travis Kalanick has said, “By using reliable travelling options, we will reduce the need for cars by using cars." Uber plans to employ more cars and 10 lakh drivers in India, Kalanick stated. Use of UberPool and carpooling will reduce cars, and even New Delhi might be traffic free in the next 5-10 years, he added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber staff secretly track politicians, celebs, says lawsuit
article: According to a lawsuit filed against Uber by its former forensic investigator, the company's employees accessed its tracking system to monitor locations of "high profile politicians, celebrities, and even personal acquaintances including ex-boyfriends/girlfriends." The suit also accuses the ride-hailing app of age discrimination and retaliation for whistleblowing on alleged security lapses.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber ordered to stop self-driving cabs on day of launch
article: Uber has been ordered by regulators to stop testing its self-driving cabs in San Francisco after they were launched on Wednesday. Uber was asked to secure the necessary permit that allows companies to test autonomous vehicles on public roads. However, Uber claims it doesn't need the permit as there is always a standby human driver present in its self-driving cabs.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber's self-driving cabs start picking San Francisco riders
article: Uber on Wednesday expanded the pilot of its self-driving taxi service to San Francisco, its second location. The self-driving Volvo XC90 SUVs with a spinning LIDAR sensor and rooftop cameras will be offered to UberX riders. The cars will have a safety driver and Uber test engineer onboard to monitor the rides and take control of the wheel if required.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber's self-driving car runs red light on day of launch
article: One of Uber's self-driving taxis was caught running a red light on Wednesday, the same day the service was launched in San Francisco. However, the ride-hailing service has blamed the incident on the human driver who sat behind the wheel of the autonomous car to take control if required. Uber added that it has suspended the driver involved.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Infosys leads ₹67 crore investment in Indian drone startup
article: Mumbai-based drone startup ideaForge has secured ₹67 crore ($10 million) in Series A funding round from Infosys, WRV Capital, and IndusAge Partners. Founded in 2007, ideaForge's drones have been used by the Indian Armed Forces for surveillance, crowd monitoring, and rescue operations. Infosys participated in the round through its Innovation Fund set up in 2013, now worth over ₹3,000 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla's emergency braking system prevents serious accident
article: The automatic emergency braking of a Tesla Model X electric car recently helped in preventing a potentially serious accident. The car, which was not on Autopilot or semi-autonomous mode, used its sensors and radar to determine an accident was imminent before sounding the alarm and applying the brakes.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: OYO rival WudStay shuts budget hotel aggregation segment
article: Gurugram-based startup WudStay has reportedly shut its budget hotel aggregation business in which it rivalled OYO Rooms. The company has removed hotel inventory from its website and will now operate in the PG and hostel segment that it started earlier this year. WudStay had raised $3 million (approximately ₹20 crore) in Series A round of funding last year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Detachable watch dial that acts as bike speedometer made
article: Swiss startup Moskito has created a smartwatch whose dial can be detached from the straps and mounted between the handlebars of a bicycle to act as a speedometer. In the speedometer mode, the watch's second hand shows the current speed and the minute hand shows the total distance travelled. The device also shows call and text notifications from Bluetooth-connect smartphones.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Fitness startup Fitpass raises ₹6.7 crore in seed funding
article: Delhi-based fitness startup Fitpass has raised over ₹6.7 crore ($1 million) in seed funding from Mumbai Angels and other angel investors from Delhi and Bengaluru. The startup provides an online marketplace to give users access to fitness studios and gyms close to their location. It also provides users with diet plans and workout guides.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Slack launches video calling feature
article: Group chat platform Slack on Tuesday started rolling out one-to-one and group video calling functionalities on Mac, Windows and Chrome versions of its app. The feature also includes an emoji response feature that lets users ask a question by posting the hand emoji or show approval by using a thumbs up emoji without interrupting the conversation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Foodpanda blames tech spend as loss rises 4 times to ₹142 cr
article: Rocket Internet-backed food delivery startup Foodpanda's India losses widened by four times to ₹142 crore during the financial year 2016, according to the company’s filing with the registrar of companies. Foodpanda attributed the increased losses to higher investment in technology. The startup's revenues during the period increased 700% to ₹37.8 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm Founder raises ₹325 crore by selling 1% stake
article: Digital wallet Paytm's Co-founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma has raised ₹325 crore by selling 1% of his stake in Paytm's parent company One97 Communications. The money will be used to fund Paytm's Payments Bank scheduled to launch early next year. Earlier this month, Sharma announced to split Paytm's e-commerce and digital wallet business.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Trump meeting makes Masayoshi Son $755 million richer
article: Japanese billionaire and SoftBank Founder Masayoshi Son added $755 million to his wealth after meeting US President-elect Donald Trump on Tuesday. SoftBank's shares surged by over 5% to their highest in over a year after Son promised to invest $50 billion in US businesses. With a net worth of $12.4 billion as per Bloomberg, Son is Japan's second-richest man.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm allows money transfer to non-smartphone users
article: Digital wallet Paytm on Wednesday launched a new feature that allows non-smartphone users to transfer and receive money through their Paytm accounts. The transactions will take place through a new toll-free number after users register their mobile number and set a four-digit PIN. Mobile recharge facility is also available through the toll-free number.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bezos got a letter from oldest astronaut the day he died
article: Amazon and aerospace company Blue Origin's Founder Jeff Bezos during an award ceremony on Thursday received a letter from the world's oldest astronaut John Glenn, who died earlier that day. In the letter dated November 28th, Glenn had praised Bezos for the award and said he was deeply touched that his company's next generation rockets would be named after him.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Rocket Internet-backed Foodpanda acquired by Delivery Hero
article: Online food-ordering service Delivery Hero is acquiring its competitor Foodpanda, bringing together two top food delivery startups based in Germany. Rocket Internet, a backer of both companies, said the combined business will process more than 20 million orders a month and operate in 47 countries. Delivery Hero and Foodpanda have raised more than $1.5 billion combined.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tinder CEO Sean Rad steps down
article: Dating app Tinder's Co-founder Sean Rad has stepped down as the CEO of the company and has taken over as the Chairman. Rad will focus on 'Swipe Ventures', a newly-launched investment arm of Tinder. This is the second time Rad has stepped down as the CEO, after being removed from the position in 2014, which he got back in 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bill Gates, other billionaires pledge $1 bn for clean energy
article: As many as 20 billionaires worldwide including Microsoft's Bill Gates, Amazon's Jeff Bezos and Alibaba's Jack Ma have together committed $1 billion towards clean energy. Called the 'Breakthrough Energy Ventures', the fund will invest the money for 20 years into risky, long-term energy technology to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Virgin Group Founder Richard Branson has also backed the fund.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Valuation markdowns are theoretical exercises: Sachin Bansal
article: On the recent valuation markdowns, Flipkart's Co-founder Sachin Bansal said, "These are theoretical exercises...any investor who has an opinion on our valuation outside...they are doing markdowns based on some public information which is accessible to everybody". He added, "Valuation is what will happen when a real transaction takes place and not just on paper".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm means 'Pay to Modi': Rahul Gandhi on demonetisation
article: Marking the first month of demonetisation as 'Black Day', Congress Vice President Rahul Gandhi on Thursday referred cashless transactions-allowing startup Paytm as "Pay to Modi". Calling the scrapping of high-value notes a "foolish decision", Gandhi insisted that a voting on the decision should be held at the end of the debate.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber rival Careem introduces women drivers in Pakistan
article: Dubai-based taxi-hailing service Careem on Wednesday introduced women drivers on its platform to pick both male and female passengers in Pakistan. Careem reportedly has a larger market share than Uber in most of its 32 cities of operation worldwide. Careem's Pakistan General Manager Ahmed Usman said that seven women drivers had qualified to join the fleet so far.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Masayoshi Son to invest $50 billion in US post Trump meeting
article: SoftBank Founder Masayoshi Son on Tuesday pledged to invest $50 billion in the US and create 50,000 jobs in startups and new companies. US President-elect Donald Trump claimed that Son said he "would never do this" if Trump had not won the presidential election. The investments will be made through American telecom Sprint, of which 82% is owned by SoftBank.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup with most funded Kickstarter project ever shuts down
article: Smartwatch maker Pebble, which had the highest-funded campaign in the history of crowdfunding website Kickstarter, has shut down. The startup's software assets will reportedly be acquired by fitness band maker Fitbit for less than $40 million. Pebble had raised over $20 million on Kickstarter from more than 78,000 backers and claims to have shipped over 2 million smartwatches globally.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Honda invests in Uber's rival Grab
article: Japanese automobile maker Honda on Monday invested an undisclosed amount in Southeast Asian ride-hailing service and Uber's rival Grab. Honda's investment is focused on Grab's motorbike-hailing service. Grab raised $750 million in a funding round in September this year, that valued the company at more than $3 billion.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart enters private label business with electronics
article: E-commerce platform Flipkart has launched its first private label under an umbrella brand called 'Flipkart SmartBuy', as part of a push to improve margins. The label will span 25-30 categories starting with electronics, electronic accessories, and home plastics, said Flipkart's head of private labels Adarsh Menon. Flipkart will also launch a second label in 2017 targeting home decor and furniture.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber's new US policy asks people not to flirt in cars
article: Ride-hailing app Uber has updated its guidelines for riders in the United States, asking them not to touch or flirt with other people in the car. "It’s okay to chat with other people in the car...But please don’t comment on someone’s appearance or ask whether they are single," it added. Notably, Uber already banned sexual conduct between drivers and riders.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BookMyShow app allows splitting ticket cost while booking
article: Entertainment ticketing platform BookMyShow has updated its Android app, allowing users to split the ticket cost for their group during booking. Based on the bookings, separate tickets of every movie goer will also be made automatically by the app. Features like 'Mini Maps' for a birdseye view of the event premises and language-wise selection of movies has also been introduced.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fashion startup StalkBuyLove raises ₹41 crore funding
article: Online shopping platform for women, StalkBuyLove has raised ₹41 crore ($6 million) in its Series A funding round led by Kalaari Capital. Existing investors including FabIndia's Managing Director William Bissell also invested in the round. Founded in 2013, StalkBuyLove operates in a market dominated by Flipkart-owned online fashion stores Myntra and Jabong.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Uber India profit rises six times to ₹18.7 crore
article: Online taxi aggregator Uber posted a six-fold jump in its net profit at ₹18.7 crore in FY16 in India, according to the company's filing. During the period, revenues of the company increased five-fold to ₹375 crore. In its first year of operations in FY14, Uber India had made a profit of ₹7 lakh on a revenue of ₹2.2 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 2016 was a year of transition, says Flipkart's Sachin Bansal
article: E-commerce major Flipkart's Co-founder and Executive Chairman Sachin Bansal has called 2016 a year of transition for himself. "I am now settled in that role and the next year I look to take that forward." Earlier this year, Bansal had revealed that he was removed as the company's CEO because of performance issues.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup with ₹500 cr in funding lays off 60% staff
article: Anonymous social network Yik Yak, which has raised nearly ₹500 crore ($73.5 million) in funding since it was founded in 2013, has laid off 60% of its staff amid a downturn in growth prospects. The community, marketing, design, and product teams were said to be worst affected. Yik Yak was rivalled by California-based startup Secret, which has shut operations.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal's former CPO invests in fashion startup Wooplr
article: Snapdeal's former Chief Product Officer Anand Chandrasekaran, who is now working with Facebook, has invested an undisclosed amount in women's online fashion marketplace Wooplr. Founded in 2013, Wooplr allows women to upload their picture in different outfits and lets their followers buy those outfits through Wooplr's app or website.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Richard Branson shares list of his favourite books from 2016
article: Virgin Group founder Richard Branson has shared a list of his favourite books from this year. The list includes books 'Winners', 'If I Could Tell You Just One Thing', 'Black Box Thinking', 'Ending the War on Drugs', and 'Travels with Charley'. Branson said these books have helped him shape his perspective on leadership.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Probe ordered into Uber's alleged abuse of market dominance
article: The Competition Appellate Tribunal has reportedly ordered fair trade watchdog Competition Commission of India (CCI) to probe afresh the alleged abuse of dominance by taxi aggregator app operator Uber. This comes after radio taxi service provider Meru approached the tribunal against the CCI’s earlier decision to not probe Uber for its alleged unfair practices including predatory pricing.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup raises ₹15 crore for app with animal videos
article: US-based startup Waggle has raised over ₹15 crore ($2.3 million) in seed funding for its mobile app and website that lets users share videos of their pets. The funding round was led by Raine Ventures and included participation from Broadway Video Ventures, the venture arm of the production company behind comedy shows like Saturday Night Live.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Real estate portal Housing.com to re-enter rentals business
article: Online real estate portal Housing.com is relaunching its home rentals business after shutting it down last year to focus on the home buying and selling segment. The company had earlier moved to a new model, earning advertising revenue from property listers that pay for greater visibility of their properties. Housing.com was founded by students from IIT Bombay in 2012.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Proposal is on Gadkari’s table, we are ready: Hyperloop COO
article: Hyperloop Transportation Technologies COO Bibop G Gresta has said that the company is ready to test its high-speed transport system in India. "I have met Modi and Gadkari, your Minister of Road Transport and Highways... we have kept a proposal on the table." Hyperloop's system could reportedly cut travel time from Mumbai to Nagpur from 14 hours to 35 minutes.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: I was richer than Bill Gates for 3 days: Masayoshi Son
article: Referring to the dot-com bubble when his company's valuation crossed $200 billion in 2000, SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son said he was richer than Bill Gates for three days. SoftBank, however, lost 99% of its worth after the dot-com bubble burst and became a $2 billion company. And, Masayoshi Son lost almost all his $70 billion wealth.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I miss Nikesh, wish he was still at SoftBank: Masayoshi Son
article: Japan's SoftBank Founder and CEO, Masayoshi Son in an interview said that he misses former President and COO Nikesh Arora and wishes he was still at the company. Son added, "I'm still not retiring and I'm still enjoying my work. To have Nikesh wait for next 10 years is something I feel sorry for...he is too talented to wait."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: It's actually sad to be rich, says billionaire Masayoshi Son
article: Japanese billionaire Masayoshi Son on Friday said, "It's actually sad to be rich...My net worth was growing at $10 million a day before the ‘dot com bubble’ burst and I started asking myself, 'What is money?'" The SoftBank Founder admitted he "started feeling the value of money again" after losing 99% of his wealth in the 'dot com bubble' burst.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm to split its wallet and e-commerce business
article: Paytm is splitting its wallet and e-commerce businesses and transferring its digital wallet to yet to be launched Paytm Payments Bank, where Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma holds a 51% stake. Paytm is one of the 11 recipients of payments bank licences which were given by RBI in August 2015. Paytm plans to launch its payments bank early next year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indonesia's first unicorn startup started as a call centre
article: First Indonesian unicorn or billion-dollar startup, Go-Jek, was started in 2010 by Nadiem Makarim as a call centre with 20 drivers, to pick and drop customers on their demand. Go-Jek developed itself as an on-demand bike service for courier, transport and shopping services. Funded by Sequoia Capital and DST Global, Go-Jek raised $550 million in August at $1.3 billion valuation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon to launch hi-tech store with no billing lines
article: Amazon has unveiled a technology to run a grocery store where customers can enter by scanning their phones and leave without paying for the items. Called 'Amazon Go', the store will be able to detect the items picked and charge the customers accordingly through a dedicated app. The first such store will be launched in Washington in early 2017.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Elon Musk named most admired leader in technology
article: Tesla and SpaceX Founder Elon Musk has been named the most admired leader in the technology space, in a survey conducted by VC firm First Round Capital involving over 700 startup founders. Amazon's Jeff Bezos emerged as the second most admired technology leader, followed by Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg and Apple's Steve Jobs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Virgin Galactic's spaceplane completes first test flight
article: Billionaire Richard Branson-led aerospace company Virgin Galactic's spaceplane 'VSS Unity' successfully completed its first test flight on Sunday. During its 1 hour 20 minute flight, the plane achieved a maximum speed of approximately 740 kmph while gliding back from an altitude of 50,000 feet. Aimed at space tourism, the plane will take passengers to the upper edge of Earth's atmosphere.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup claims honeymoon on moon possible in 10 yrs at ₹6L
article: Space exploration startup Moon Express' Co-founder Naveen Jain has predicted that trips to the moon will be possible in the next 10 years for as low as ₹6.7 lakh ($10,000). Jain said he believes that by 2026, there will be a gentleman on his knees asking, "Honey, will you go to the moon with me for our honeymoon?"

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Pepperfry posts 2-fold rise in losses to ₹154 crore
article: Online furniture retailer Pepperfry reported a net loss of ₹154 crore for the year ended March 31, 2016, up from ₹80 crore in the previous year. However, the revenue of the company rose to ₹98 crore for the period as against ₹25 crore in FY15. Pepperfry is considered to be the best funded Indian online furniture retail startup.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ola may deploy 1 million electric cars, says Masayoshi Son
article: Ola investor SoftBank's Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son has said that the ride-hailing startup may introduce a fleet of one million electric cars. The vehicles will be locally manufactured to support the government's 'Make in India' campaign, he added. SoftBank has already invested $2 billion in Indian startups like Ola, Snapdeal, Oyo Rooms, and Grofers among others.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New app 'AirDates' made for in-flight dating
article: A London-based startup has created an app called 'AirDates' that lets users discover passengers to date while travelling. Users can post their travel itineraries ahead of time to potentially meet other passengers on the same journey. The company's CEO Michael Richard claims that the inside of a plane is the "safest place to have a date."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: IBM predicted concept of Amazon's hi-tech stores 10 yrs ago
article: Multinational technology company IBM had released a video in 2006 of a concept similar to the hi-tech 'Go' stores unveiled by Amazon on Monday. The video shows a man walking around a supermarket, putting items in his jacket, and walking out without paying the bill. Amazon Go stores will detect the items picked and charge the customers through an app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ex-Samsung engineers make smart umbrella that tells weather
article: Former Samsung engineers have come together to form a startup that builds smart umbrella 'Opus One' which tells the weather report before a user leaves home. Connected to the user's smartphone through an app, the umbrella vibrates to notify of any incoming call or text. If the user forgets the umbrella somewhere, the umbrella's handle alerts the user through Bluetooth.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: University uses Snapchat to inform students of selection
article: An American university has been using social media platform Snapchat to inform students about their acceptance to college. In addition to an email and a formal letter, the students receive a congratulatory 'snap' on their smartphones. "Students definitely get a snap before they get their mail packet," said an official from the university's admissions office.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Quikr's loss widens to ₹534 crore
article: Online classifieds platform Quikr's loss for the financial year ending March 2016 widened to ₹534 crore from ₹446 crore the year before, according to the startup's filings with the Registrar of Companies. Quikr's total revenue rose by 44% to ₹94.5 crore. In October this year, Quikr’s valuation rose to $1.47 billion (₹10,000 crore), as per investor Kinnevik’s quarterly report.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Kolkata's TYGR app raises ₹20 crore led by Franchise India
article: Transport and logistics app TYGR has raised over ₹20 crore ($3 million) in a Pre-Series A round of funding from Asian retail solutions provider Franchise India and others. The Kolkata-based startup monitors and automates delivery, logistics, and specialty vehicles. TYGR's Bengaluru-based rival, logistics service provider GoPigeon, recently raised about ₹10 crore ($1.5 million).

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon launches global startup program 'Launchpad' in India
article: E-commerce major Amazon on Monday launched its global startup program 'Launchpad' in India, an online portal featuring over 400 products from different startups including 25 Indian startups. The program will also help Indian startups to sell their products overseas. First started in 2015, Amazon Launchpad is now available in seven regions.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart does not need a turnaround: Kalyan Krishnamurthy
article: Flipkart's Head of Category Design Organization, Kalyan Krishnamurthy has said that the e-commerce major does not need a turnaround. "We are among the top three-four consumer brands in the country. We have assets that are unmatched," he added. Krishnamurthy, who served a two-year stint at Flipkart from 2013, was bought back from Tiger Global to join Flipkart again this year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Indian fintech startup raises ₹27 cr led by American Express
article: Delhi-based online lending marketplace IndiaLends has secured over ₹27 crore ($4 million) in a Series A funding round led by American Express Ventures. China's Cyber Carrier, Noida-based AdvantEdge Partners and DSG Consumer Partners also participated. IndiaLends connects individuals with lenders to secure loans through its data analytics and proprietary credit underwriting algorithm.

author: Rini Sinha
abstract: Startup makes coats usable as sleeping bags for homeless
article: US-based startup 'The Empowerment Plan' makes coats which can be used as sleeping bags for homeless people. The non-profit organisation has employed 34 homeless individuals since 2012, who have been trained to make these coats which can also be used as over-the-shoulder bags. Over 15,000 such coats have been distributed across Canada and USA.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon launches in-house fashion brand 'Myx' in India
article: The Indian arm of e-commerce major Amazon has launched its second in-house private fashion label, an ethnic wear brand for women called 'Myx'. Amazon India had launched its menswear brand 'Symbol' in September. Flipkart-owned Myntra owns 11 private labels, including Hrithik Roshan's HRX and Virat Kohli's Wrogn.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: You deserve better, says startup CEO to customers
article: Dan Shapiro, CEO of 3D laser printer manufacturing startup Glowforge, has apologised to customers for delaying deliveries of the printers by over a year. "You deserve better and you deserve not to have to wait," said Shapiro in a post on the startup's website. US-based Glowforge had made $27.9 million in sales through a 30-day crowdfunding campaign last year.

author: Mansha Mahajan
