abstract: Volkswagen launches mobility service start-up MOIA
article: German carmaker Volkswagen on Monday unveiled its new mobility brand MOIA under which it plans to focus on ride-hailing, autonomous driving and electric cars in European cities from next year. This comes amid Volkswagen's attempt to become a leading on-demand transport service provider. The business could reportedly generate revenues worth $2.1 billion by decade end.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: How much Flipkart, Paytm, Ola founders own in their startup?
article: Flipkart Co-founders Sachin and Binny Bansal together own around 14% of the company while Paytm founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma controls roughly 20% of the payments platform. Ola Co-founders Bhavish Aggarwal and Ankit Bhati own little over 10% of the company. On the other hand, Snapdeal Co-founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal together own only 6.5% of the company.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup home delivers cash up to ₹1,000 in valid notes
article: In the wake of demonetisation, a Noida-based startup named Tailmill is making home deliveries of cash up to ₹1,000 per day per customer in valid currency notes. However, a user is eligible for cash delivery only on ordering groceries through a company the startup has partnered with. To get cash delivered, customers need to pay ₹1,000 plus the product cost.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup's electric truck travels 1930 km on one charge
article: US-based electric vehicle startup Nikola has unveiled its new hydrogen fuel cell powered 'Nikola One' semi-truck that claims to travel 1930 kilometres on a single charge. The truck's navigation system will determine the most effective route between destinations. Nikola has also announced plans to build stations to refuel its new trucks, that will be launched in 2020.

author: Prashanti Moktan
abstract: Sunny Leone launches her own mobile app
article: Sunny Leone has launched her own mobile app in partnership with New York-based startup 'Escapex'. Sunny said, "The shelf-life of a Bollywood actor is not always long until you are Salman, Shah Rukh or Aamir Khan!" The app allows access to Sunny's social media handles on a single platform while fans can interact with her through an in-app social feed.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Children say other word for Paytm is ‘PayPM': Mamata
article: Criticising PM Narendra Modi's demonetisation decision, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday said, "Children these days say the other word for Paytm is PayPM". Mamata was the first leader who spoke against demonetisation policy and has played a major role in bringing together the opposition parties to organise a protest against ruling BJP.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal CEO responds to company's sale rumours in poem
article: Snapdeal's Co-founder and CEO, Kunal Bahl on Thursday responded to the rumours of his company being sold to Alibaba through a poem. Bahl tweeted, "Rumour rumour on the wall, which troll did you call. You said sold, they said bought, but whoever listened to you didn't get diddly squat".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Jack Ma's Alipay apologises for 'sexually explicit' feature
article: Lucy Peng, Executive Chairman of Ant Financial, an affiliate of Jack Ma's Alibaba, has apologised for a social feature in the company's wallet app Alipay that enabled a "sexually explicit dating service." The 'Circles' feature mostly lets women post photos or videos, while men are restricted to commenting or paying money in the form of 'tips' for the pictures.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: This has been the best year Myntra ever had, says CEO
article: Online fashion retailer Myntra's CEO Ananth Narayanan in an interview said, "This year, if I put it in a historical context, has been the best year Myntra has ever had". He added that Myntra's acquisition of Jabong had also boosted the numbers for the venture. Earlier this year in July, Flipkart-owned Myntra acquired Jabong for $70 million.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber to track user location even when app is not in use
article: Ride-hailing service Uber is asking customers for permission to collect location data even when they are not using the app. Uber has said that it will access riders' locations from the moment they request a ride to five minutes after the driver drops them off. The company claims this information will make drop-offs and pick-ups easier and more precise.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nokia leads $20 million investment in period tracking app
article: Women's menstrual cycle tracking app Clue has raised $20 million in Series B round of funding led by Nokia. Launched in 2013, the Berlin-based startup's app also tracks ovulation cycles and claims to have more than 5 million users. Clue also allows women to privately share their data with doctors for consultation purposes.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Indian startup signs contract with ISRO for mission to moon
article: Bengaluru-based aerospace startup Team Indus has become the first private entity to secure a dedicated Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle from ISRO. Team Indus is the only Indian team in Google's $20 million Lunar XPRIZE competition to become the first privately funded team to land a robot on the Moon that successfully travels 500 meters.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: FreeCharge partners Mumbai Police for traffic fine payments
article: In the wake of demonetisation, Snapdeal-owned digital payments platform FreeCharge has tied up with Mumbai Police for digitally collecting traffic fines from offenders. About 500 e-challan devices have been provided at various traffic chowkis across the city. An e-challan will be generated against the offenders and will be instantly sent to their mobile phones.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Accel Partners raises ₹3077 crore to fund Indian startups
article: Venture capital firm Accel Partners, which has backed high-profile technology companies like Facebook and Flipkart, has raised ₹3077 crore ($450 million) for its fifth Indian fund. The fund is larger than the ₹2221 crore ($325 million) Accel raised in its previous fund. The latest fund will bring Accel's assets under management in India to more than ₹6834 crore ($1 billion).

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: George Hotz makes code behind self-driving project public
article: George Hotz, the hacker known for unlocking the first iPhone, has publicly released the self-driving car software developed by his startup, which he called an "open source alternative to Tesla's Autopilot." Hotz recently cancelled his startup's $999 kit which could be fitted into cars to turn them self-driving as he did not want to "deal with regulators" in the US.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes wallet that shows contact information if lost
article: A South Korea-based startup has developed 'Wonder Wallet' with e-paper technology that lets users change the wallet's design to any image they want. In case the wallet gets lost, it will display a help message with the user's contact information. The wallet connects to users' phones through Bluetooth and sends alerts if the users are ever separated from it.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: UK startup starts food deliveries using self-driving robots
article: Online food ordering startup Just Eat has started delivering food to its customers in London using self-driving robots. Developed by Starship Technologies, the six-wheeler robots use GPS and various sensors to deliver food by rolling along pavements. The robots can carry up to 9 kg and can only be accessed using a code sent to the user via text.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Wearable airbag made to prevent hip fractures in the elderly
article: Netherlands-based startup Wolk has developed an airbag to prevent hip fractures in the elderly caused by falling. The airbag, which is to be worn as a belt, uses algorithms and sensors to detect when the user is about to fall and automatically inflates. The airbag can then be reused by fitting it with a new inflator.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Didi Chuxing CEO named Forbes Asia's Businessman of the Year
article: Cheng Wei, Co-founder and CEO of Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi Chuxing has been named Forbes Asia's 2016 Businessman of the Year. Led by the 33-year-old entrepreneur, Didi Chuxing acquired its rival Uber's China business earlier this year. The service, which lets users hail taxis, private cars, limousines and commuter buses, reportedly commands 85% of China's ride-sharing market.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup's free software plan declared illegal in Washington
article: Human resources startup Zenefits has been ordered to stop providing its software platform in Washington state for free. The Insurance Commissioner said Zenefits must charge customers for the software as it violates laws which prevent providers from undermining competition with extreme incentives. In response, the startup said that it will charge client companies $5 per employee per month.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SoftBank has invested $2 bn in India so far: Masayoshi Son
article: While speaking at a summit on Friday, Japanese telecom and media giant SoftBank’s CEO Masayoshi Son said that the company had already invested $2 billion (₹13,600 crore) in India. In November, SoftBank had written down as much as $560 million (₹3,800 crore) in its Indian investments including cab-hailing service Ola and e-commerce platform Snapdeal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart valuation slashed to $7.3 billion by Vanguard
article: US-based investment firm Vanguard has marked down the valuation of its holding in Flipkart by a third, bringing down the e-commerce retailer's valuation to $7.3 billion from $11 billion valued in March. Earlier this month, Morgan Stanley slashed Flipkart's valuation to $5.54 billion, making it the seventh time the startup's valuation was marked down this year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SpaceX rival unveils website to check cost of rocket launch
article: Spacecraft launch services provider United Launch Alliance on Wednesday unveiled its 'RocketBuilder' website that lets users customise rockets and check cost of launch. It offers different commercial rockets with available launch dates and types of orbits. "Someday the rest of the industry will become as reliable as we are," said the company's CEO, taking a dig at rival SpaceX.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Twitter changes product head for third time in a year
article: Microblogging platform Twitter has appointed Keith Coleman as head of its product team, the third executive to lead the division in less than a year. The company on Thursday confirmed that it has acquired Coleman's consumer mobile app startup Yes. Twitter itself has been rumoured to be up for sale and reportedly hired bankers last month to field acquisition offers.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup creates technology for a self-making bed
article: A Canadian startup has created an inflatable sheet and a connected air pump that makes beds automatically. The inflatable sheet fits between the bedsheets and the quilt and is connected to a smartphone-controlled air pump. When the pump is activated, it inflates the sheet's air chamber placing the quilt and sheets back in position, making the bed look tidy.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup raises ₹36 crore to make health tracking jewellery
article: Finland-based startup Oura has raised over ₹36 crore (€5 million) in Series A round of funding to produce its smart, health-monitoring jewellery. The company’s 'wellness ring' and connected mobile app track how users' bodies are responding to what they eat and how much they sleep. The app further recommends things users can do to improve their overall health or performance.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: BMW expands its venture capital fund 5-fold to ₹3,627 crore
article: BMW is increasing the size of its venture capital fund, BMW i Ventures, nearly fivefold to $530 million (₹3,627 crore) from around $106 million (₹725 crore), according to a German business daily. The fund has been focussed on themes such as electric mobility and mobility services, and plans to expand to autonomous driving, digitalisation, cloud services and artificial intelligence.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: John Collison becomes world's youngest self-made billionaire
article: US-based online payments startup Stripe's 26-year-old Co-founder, John Collison has become the world's youngest self-made billionaire with a net worth of $1.1 billion. Until now, Snapchat's CEO Evan Spiegel, two months older to Collison, was the world's youngest self-made billionaire. Collison became a billionaire after Stripe raised $150 million at a valuation of $9.2 billion, as per Forbes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I want Paytm to be a verb, more than a noun: Paytm CEO
article: Paytm's Co-founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma, in a recent interview, said, "I want Paytm to be a verb, more than a noun". He added, "When I remember the old days, I tell myself that there is nothing that can corrupt me…I have seen the worst". He says, "the obligation to stay relevant" has been his career's biggest motivation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon worker jumps off 12-storey building after mail to CEO
article: An Amazon employee was injured and hospitalised after he jumped off the company's 12-storey headquarters in the US, after writing an email to hundreds of co-workers and CEO Jeff Bezos. In the e-mail, the employee had criticised how the company handled his transfer request. The employee had sought a department transfer, but was instead placed on an employee improvement plan.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: We're as Indian as Maruti: Paytm CEO on Chinese ownership
article: Vijay Shekhar Sharma, Founder and CEO of online payments platform Paytm, has responded to criticism over China's Alibaba and its affiliate Ant Financial holding a significant stake in the company, saying, "We are as Indian as Maruti is...we are 'India story' in every sense." Alibaba and Ant Financial have invested $680 million in Paytm taking its shareholding to over 40%.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Can turn profitable if we stop reacting to competition: Ola
article: Ride-hailing app Ola's Chief Operating Officer Pranay Jivrajka, in a recent interview, said, "We can become profitable tomorrow if we stop reacting to competition and stop incentives in key markets". He added, "The reason why we’re not profitable in the key markets, which also form the chunk of our business in the cabs space, is because of capital dumping".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm, MobiKwik to hire over 200 IIT, IIM graduates
article: In order to scale operations following demonetisation, digital wallets Paytm and MobiKwik are planning to hire over 200 graduates from IITs and IIMs. MobiKwik is planning to hire 100 graduates from IITs and IIMs at an average salary of ₹15 lakh per annum. Placements across all business schools and engineering colleges will be held around December.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Japanese startup makes paper from rock
article: Japanese startup that makes paper from limestone, TBM has received funding from the country's biggest printing company, Toppan Printing. The paper made from limestone is lighter and resists water. Founded in 2011, TBM claims that if only 5% of the world's paper could be made with stone, water equivalent to the annual need of 220 million people could be saved.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart's CTO Peeyush Ranjan quits
article: Flipkart's Chief Technology Officer Peeyush Ranjan and private label head Mausam Bhatt have quit the company. Ranjan will be joining online rental platform Airbnb in the US. At least seven executives at the level of Senior Vice President, the second highest rank at the company, have quit Flipkart this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Foodpanda ropes in Sunny Leone for online campaign
article: Food delivery startup Foodpanda has roped in Sunny Leone for its online campaign wherein the actress would target users through various social platforms like Snapchat, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Leone with her real-life husband Daniel Weber, has posted a series of videos on Twitter with food ordered from the platform.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola cabs providing cash on swiping card
article: Ride-hailing app Ola has partnered with state-run banks like the SBI and PNB to provide up to ₹2,000 cash on swiping a debit card in selected cabs in Kolkata and Hyderabad through POS machines. The week-long service will continue till the end of the month. Ola is looking to extend the service in other cities including Delhi.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber-owned startup ran driverless truck without license
article: Self-driving technology startup Otto, which demonstrated a driverless truck in Nevada and got acquired by Uber, did not have a license for autonomous testing and knowingly broke the traffic rules, according to an investigative study. However, Otto didn't face any consequences as the current rules don't punish violations. Amendments to the current regulations could introduce penalties only by 2017.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon puts limit on number of reviews a user can post
article: E-commerce major Amazon has introduced changes to its policy that will allow users to post only five product reviews a week if the purchase has not been verified. The policy will not apply to digital and physical books, music, and video. Amazon has previously sued sellers on its platform for buying fake reviews to influence customer decisions.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup launches 'Thanks, 2016. It's been weird' campaign
article: Music streaming service Spotify has launched its biggest campaign, called 'Thanks, 2016. It's been weird.' Spotify compiled global data of its users throughout the year to make posters with facts and figures like, "Dear 3,749 people who streamed 'It's The End Of The World As We Know It' the day of the Brexit Vote. Hang in There."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Meru Cabs CEO Siddhartha Pahwa quits
article: Meru Cabs CEO Siddhartha Pahwa has quit the company and will be replaced by CTO Nilesh Sangoi from January next year. "I’ve decided to move over from Meru. I’ve spent a good five years in Meru," said Pahwa. He added, "Meru was a 24/7 job. Now I’m going to evaluate a few things, including the idea of an own venture".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Biotech startup Theranos sued by 2 more investors for fraud
article: US-based biotech startup Theranos, founded by Elizabeth Holmes, who topped Forbes' list of 'America's Richest Self-Made Women' last year, has been sued by two more investors for making misleading claims to raise money. The company has been sued by several investors and customers after a US federal authority declared the company was putting patients in "immediate danger."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Cricketer Mohit Sharma invests in startup Crossahead
article: Cricketer Mohit Sharma has invested an undisclosed amount in Noida-based startup Crossahead, a social networking platform that lets users discover and hire artists. The platform features modelling, dance, makeup, interior and other professionals. It claims to have more than 10,000 verified artists listed on its platform.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart employees perform mannequin challenge
article: Online retailer Flipkart has shared a video of its employees performing the mannequin challenge in the office. "We’re ecstatic, mind-blown & stunned!" said Flipkart in its post. The mannequin challenge is a new internet trend where people remain frozen in action like mannequins while a video is recorded, with music playing in the background.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart valuation slashed to $5.54 bn by Morgan Stanley
article: Morgan Stanley has marked down the value of its shares in Flipkart by 38%, slashing the e-commerce major's valuation to $5.54 billion. This is the fourth consecutive markdown by Morgan Stanley in nine months, one of Flipkart's biggest mutual fund investors. Flipkart was valued at $9 billion in the last quarter and $15.2 billion in July 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MobiKwik launches new app to work with slow internet
article: Digital wallet MobiKwik has launched a new 'MobiKwik Lite' app addressing to the users with slow internet connection. The size of the new app is only 1 MB and it can be downloaded in 30 seconds by giving a missed call on a number. Users can make and receive payments, pay bills, bank transfers and recharges through the app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber expands 'Dial an Uber' service to all cities
article: Uber has expanded its 'Dial an Uber' service to all the 29 cities it operates in, allowing users to book cabs without installing its app on their smartphones. The 'Dial an Uber' feature allows users to book cabs through Uber's website and requires payments to be made only in cash.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra appoints Ajit Narayanan as its new CTO
article: Flipkart-owned fashion platform Myntra has appointed Ajit Narayanan as its new Chief Technology Officer (CTO) as its previous CTO Shamik Sharma has moved on to an advisory role. Narayanan was formerly the head of engineering at Myntra. Sharma is reportedly expected to leave Myntra after a four-year stint at the company.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber deactivates New York driver for 'advertising' rivals
article: Uber has deactivated the account of at least one New York driver and warned others for "displaying advertising of other ride-sharing companies while on Uber trips." Uber has objected to drivers having its rival Juno's app open, showing its competitor's logo and rider discounts. Juno pitches itself as a "driver-friendly" app by offering drivers a stake in the company.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Over 53,000 petrol pumps to accept FreeCharge payments
article: Digital payments platform FreeCharge has announced that it has partnered with Indian oil marketing companies Indian Oil, Hindustan Petroleum and Bharat Petroleum and will be accepted in over 53,000 of their petrol pumps. FreeCharge will also be accepted by nearly 17,000 LPG distributors and users will be able to pay for home-delivered LPG cylinders by using the online wallet.

author: Aman Bhalla
abstract: Online to offline shopping app gets $1mn in seed funding
article: HyperKonnect Technologies owned online to offline shopping app ShopsUp has raised $1 million (around ₹6.6 crore) in seed funding from two individual investors. The app lets customers search for products online and shop offline from nearby places and also shows various deals available at neighbourhood stores. The app was officially launched on Tuesday.

author: Rini Kapoor
abstract: Karnataka to have 'largest' incubation centre for startups
article: The Department of Information Technology and Biotechnology has earmarked ₹75 crore for creating an incubation centre for startups in Karnataka, claimed to be the largest in the country. The centre will be set up in Bengaluru with all necessary infrastructure for startups and will provide mentoring to the newly established businesses, officials said.

author: Rini Sinha
abstract: Startup makes recyclable shoes from plastic bottles
article: San Francisco-based startup 'Rothy's Shoes', founded by Stephen Hawthornthwaite and Roth Martin, recycles plastic bottles to create sustainable shoes. The shoes have a carbon-free rubber sole and are created by a 3D knitting machine, which takes approximately six minutes to make them. Priced at about ₹8,500 (approximately $125), the shoes are anti-microbial, machine washable and recyclable.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Fintech firm Stripe valued at $9 bn after raising $150 mn
article: San Francisco-based financial technology company Stripe has raised $150 million in a Series F funding round, valuing the company at over $9 billion. The round was led by CapitalG and General Catalyst, with participation from existing investors including Sequoia Capital. With a user base in 110 countries, Stripe's payment platform has clients like Adidas and Kickstarter, among others.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm app starts acting as a card swiping machine
article: Vijay Shekhar Sharma-led digital wallet Paytm on Wednesday allowed merchants to use its app to accept debit and credit card payments without a card swiping machine. Paytm’s app will function as a digital point of sale, once the merchants declare themselves as a business on Paytm's website. Paytm has announced a 0% fee on debit cards till December 31.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm pulls back POS option over security issue within a day
article: Just a day after allowing merchants to accept debit/credit cards using the Paytm app without a card swiping machine, the Vijay Shekhar Sharma-led digital wallet has dropped the feature over security concerns. The Reserve Bank of India asked Paytm to address the issues and relaunch the feature after several banks raised possible security concerns.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Will kidnappers accept ransom through Paytm, tweets user
article: Following Paytm's announcement that merchants can now use the app as a virtual point-of-sale (POS) or a card swipe machine, a Twitter user said, "If someone gets kidnapped, will kidnappers accept ransom in cheque or Paytm?" Another tweeted, "Even robbers are feeling awkward." "Forced into downloading PayTM. Well done" said another user on Twitter.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Paytm resumes POS service pulled back over security concerns
article: Vijay Shekhar Sharma-led digital wallet Paytm on Saturday resumed the point-of-sale (POS) feature that was pulled back a day after its launch over security concerns. Paytm has said the feature was withdrawn to "add additional certifications and features". The facility allows merchants to use its app to accept debit and credit card payments without a card swiping machine.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Invested ₹220cr in Paytm payments bank: Vijay Shekhar Sharma
article: Paytm's Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma has revealed that ₹220 crore has been invested in Paytm's Payments Bank to date, which is expected to launch in early 2017. He added that the initial investment could go as high as ₹400 crore and will be deployed in tranches. Paytm is one of the 11 recipients of RBI’s payments bank licence.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Over 12,000 Ola, Uber drivers go on strike in Guwahati
article: More than 12,000 drivers of ride-hailing apps Ola and Uber on Thursday started a 36-hour strike in Guwahati. The move comes in the wake of both Ola and Uber acquiring more cars and hiring more drivers, leading to shrinking incentives for the current drivers in the cab driving business.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Australian team unveils pod design at Hyperloop competition
article: VicHyper from Australia, one of the 30 teams selected through Elon Musk-led SpaceX's competition to develop a viable high-speed Hyperloop transport system, has unveiled the design for its pod vehicles. The pod will head to California for testing by SpaceX in January, 2017. The Hyperloop system will reportedly have a top speed of 1,200 kmph.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart posts 2-fold rise in losses to ₹2,306 crore
article: Indian e-commerce major Flipkart has reported a net loss of ₹2,306 crore for the year ended March 31, 2016. Its losses more than doubled from ₹1,096 crore in the previous financial year, while its revenue grew to ₹1,952 crore in FY16. Founded in 2007, Flipkart has raised over ₹21,500 crore so far.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart may appoint an investment bank to raise funding
article: For the first time in years, e-commerce major Flipkart may reportedly appoint an investment bank to attract new investors for its next round of funding. Flipkart even held talks with several investment banks including Goldman Sachs Group. Flipkart, with its fashion verticals Myntra and Jabong, burns a total of ₹275 crore ($40 million) a month.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola seeking funds at 40% lower valuation: Report
article: Ride-hailing app Uber's rival Ola is reportedly seeking funding at a 40% lower valuation of around $3 billion. Existing investor SoftBank may join the next round, but not lead it. If the deal goes through, Ola will be India's first unicorn, or billion-dollar startup, to accept funds at a lower valuation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon to sell Amul products in nine foreign countries
article: Amazon India will sell dairy cooperative Amul's products in nine foreign countries, starting with the US. In May 2015, Amazon launched its Global Selling program, under which Indian vendors can sell their products in nine countries including the US, the UK, Japan, Canada and France. In October this year, Amazon India sold US products in India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: It's still very early days to talk about IPO: Freshdesk CEO
article: Customer support software startup Freshdesk's CEO Girish Mathrubootham in an interview said, "An IPO is definitely the desired outcome, but it's still very early days to talk about that." Talking about his mistakes, Mathrubootham said, "Until last month, we didn't have an HR manager at all...when you're adding a lot of people...there needs to be a clear focus on communication."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: John McAfee trashes startup's claim that he joined as CSO
article: John McAfee, Founder of antivirus software maker McAfee, has rubbished claims by Canadian startup Equibit that he had joined the company as its Chief Security Officer. "Equibit has vastly exaggerated my role... I advise dozens of companies," he said adding that whatever relationship he had with Equibit will not continue anymore. McAfee is currently the CEO of MGT Capital Investments.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New power bank generates energy when rolled with wrists
article: Irish startup Be.Energy has developed a spherical power bank called 'HandEnergy' that generates electricity when the user rotates it with the wrist. The mechanical power is turned into an electric current, charging the built-in batteries. It takes 40-60 minutes of spinning to charge the HandEnergy, which can in turn charge smartphones, flashlights, and cameras among other electronics.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 7 Indian startups selected for Google Launchpad Accelerator
article: Google has selected 7 Indian startups to participate in the third edition of its Launchpad Accelerator program. The selected mid to late stage startups include Flyrobe, HashLearn, RentoMojo, Kapture CRM, Curofy, Happy Adda Studios and Playment. Google will provide them with $50,000 (₹34 lakh) in equity-free funding and a two-week all-expense paid boot camp at Google Headquarters in Silicon Valley.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Peter Thiel's CIA-backed startup Palantir raises $20 million
article: Data mining company Palantir, chaired by venture capitalist Peter Thiel and backed by American intelligence agency CIA, has raised $20 million (₹137 crore) in fresh funding. Palantir provides government, finance and other organisations with analytics and security. It was valued at $20 billion (₹1.3 lakh crore) in December 2015 when it closed off an $880 million (₹6 thousand crore) round.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Bengaluru taxi firm to plant a tree for every 100 rides
article: Bengaluru-based taxi aggregator firm 'Hi Cabs' is seeking to plant a tree for every 100 rides and it has targeted to plant 2.5 lakh trees in five years. The firm was started by ex-Senior Operations Director at Ola Joe Matthews, and it provides services without surge pricing and cancellation charges. 'Hi Cabs' will also be building houses for its drivers.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Laundry startup Pick My Laundry launches 1st offline store
article: On demand washing and dry cleaning startup, Pick My Laundry has launched its first offline store in Gurugram. The store is equipped with coin-operated machines and offers steam ironing facility. The startup will offer doorstep service to walk-in customers and to orders placed via its app with a 48 hour delivery time.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes smart socks to track diabetic health
article: Diabetic health tracking startup Siren Care has created smart socks that use temperature sensors to detect inflammation in real-time for diabetics. A connected app sends users alerts to check their foot when the sock detects a high-temperature difference. The battery in the socks is built to last for six months and they automatically go into sleep mode when taken off.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: UK will invest ₹3,400 crore in startups to prevent buyouts
article: The UK government has announced plans to invest ₹3,400 crore (£400 million) into venture capital via the British Business Bank, in order to prevent the sale of promising UK startups to foreign buyers. Some of the major technology acquisitions from UK include artificial intelligence company DeepMind, which was sold to Google and keyboard software firm SwiftKey, bought by Microsoft.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Limit for angel investors in a scheme raised from 49 to 200
article: SEBI on Wednesday eased regulations for investments in startups by increasing the limit on the number of angel investors in a scheme from 49 to 200. Angel funds will be allowed to invest in startups incorporated within five years, up from three years. Additionally, the minimum investment by an Angel is reduced from ₹50 lakh to ₹25 lakh.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Bengaluru social network ShareChat raises ₹27.5 crore
article: Regional language social networking app ShareChat has raised nearly ₹27.5 crore ($4 million) in Series A round of funding, led by Lightspeed Venture Partners India. Existing investors SAIF Partners and India Quotient along with Venture Highway also participated in the round. Bengaluru-based ShareChat started as a content discovery app for sharing videos, jokes and images on WhatsApp in 2015.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SpaceX wins NASA contract for first survey of Earth’s water
article: Elon Musk-led aerospace manufacturer SpaceX has been selected by NASA to launch satellites aimed at surveying all of Earth's surface water for the first time ever. The satellite will survey at least 90% of the Earth's surface waters at least twice every 21 days. Previously, Musk said that profits from NASA contracts will help fund the company's Mars colonisation plans.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Electric carmaker raises ₹9 crore through crowdfunding
article: Sweden-based startup Uniti has raised nearly ₹9 crore ($1.3 million) through a crowdfunding campaign for its three-wheeled electric vehicle. The two-seater cars, which will cost about ₹14.8 lakh each, claim a top speed of 130 kmph and a range of 150 km on a single charge. The car aims to rival Renault and Nissan's electric vehicles.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Background verification startup BetterPlace raises funding
article: Bengaluru-based digital background verification startup BetterPlace has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Venture Highway. Founded in 2015, the startup leverages Aadhaar card information, tracks digital footprints and crowdsources social media data besides conducting traditional background checks of workers. It focuses on workers in the logistics and hyperlocal services space.

author: Rini Sinha
abstract: Elderly women knit woollen products for NY fashion startup
article: New York-based fashion startup 'Wooln' has nine elderly women as employees, who create hand-knit woollen accessories. Started by two French women, the startup aims to welcome elderly women back into "active workforce" and "encourage the value of their talents by including them into the economy". The accessories, priced between ₹4,450 and ₹13,300 ($65 to $195), include hats, scarves and snoods.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Online pharmacy Netmeds acquires rival Pluss
article: Online pharmacy Netmeds has acquired Delhi NCR-based hyper-local health delivery startup Pluss in a stock deal. Pluss lets users order medicines, baby care, pet care, and personal wellness products through its app. The startup had raised ₹6.8 crore ($1 million) in pre-Series A funding from IDG Ventures India, Singapore's M&S Partners and US-based Powerhouse Ventures in November last year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla runs an entire island on solar power
article: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle company Tesla, which recently acquired solar panel-making company SolarCity, has revealed that it runs the entire island of Ta'u in American Samoa on solar power. The island is equipped with 5,328 solar panels and 60 Tesla Powerpacks that store the solar energy. It took Tesla one year to make the island run entirely on solar energy.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup provides helper to stand in ATM queue at ₹90/hr
article: A Delhi-based startup called 'Book My Chotu' is providing helpers in Delhi-NCR for standing in the ATM or bank queues for its users at ₹90 per hour. The helpers will not go inside the bank or ATM, and will just stand in the queue for the customers. The startup also provides on-demand helpers for cleaning, shifting and grocery shopping.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: RBI doubles balance limit for digital wallets to ₹20,000
article: In the wake of government's demonetisation move and increased efforts towards a cashless economy, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Tuesday doubled the balance limit of digital wallets like Paytm to ₹20,000. Additionally, merchants can transfer up to ₹50,000 every month from these prepaid wallets to their bank accounts. The relaxation will be applicable until December 30.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Quikr buys home rental startup Grabhouse in all-stock deal
article: Bengaluru-based classified advertising platform Quikr on Monday acquired home rental startup Grabhouse in an all-stock deal reportedly worth ₹68 crore ($10 million). As it struggled to grow, Sequoia Capital and Kalaari Capital-backed Grabhouse was looking for a buyer and was in talks with NestAway and Oyo for buyout. In December 2015, Grabhouse fired 100 employees following a restructuring.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Freshdesk CEO surprises customer with personal email
article: Customer support software startup Freshdesk's CEO Girish Mathrubootham recently surprised a customer named Alex JV, when he asked if the CEO himself writes the 'welcome email' received on signing up. Mathrubootham replied to Alex, “The team uses my email address to connect with customers, but I read replies from customers and write back to them if necessary".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: American cab concept in India will not go far: Ola's CEO
article: In a recent interview, Ola's Co-founder and CEO Bhavish Aggarwal, while talking about competition in India, said, "Mobility market, in general, is so large in India. I believe there is enough room for several." Taking a dig at Uber, he added, "If you only get an American concept to India, it will only go so far and not beyond that."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Richard Branson cuts off tie worn by an audience member
article: Virgin Group's billionaire Founder Richard Branson, during a recent question and answer, cut off a tie worn by an audience member when he asked for a suggestion to make his workplace more relaxed. "I've always thought that ties are only inflicted on people because their bosses had them inflicted upon them...Everyone would be more productive without their ties," Branson said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup creates drone that fits inside a phone cover
article: An Italian startup has created a ₹20,000 drone called 'AirSelfie' which fits inside the mobile cover that comes along with it. Integrated with a camera, the drone allows taking aerial photos and selfies directly from the phone using a dedicated app. On putting the drone back into the cover, it gets charged again within 30 minutes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: If competing keeps you awake, you're in wrong biz: Paytm CEO
article: Digital payments platform Paytm's Founder and CEO, Vijay Shekhar Sharma, in an interview said, "If competition can keep you awake, then you are in the wrong business and your plans are down." He added, "Competition should not define who you are." He says that he asks his people to remove the competition slides and thinks it's a waste of time.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon adds X-ray feature to iOS app to 'see' inside boxes
article: Amazon has added a 'Package X-ray' feature to its iPhone app to let users 'see' what's inside their packages without opening them. Users can only scan the barcode on the packages which have been ordered using their Amazon account to view a list of all its contents. Amazon claims this will help users keep track of packaged Christmas presents.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New electric car goes 0-100 kmph in 2.7 seconds
article: Chinese startup NextEV has unveiled its first electric car 'NIO EP9' which accelerates from 0-100 kmph in only 2.7 seconds. Powered by four electric motors, the car generates 1,360 hp and has a top speed of 314 kmph. Only six units of the car have been made, which are already bought by the startup's founders at ₹8.1 crore each.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 20-yr-old's software gives tour of five star hotel suites
article: A 20-year-old student, Rachana Bagde has created a software called 'G for Gestures', which uses hand gestures to give a tour of five-star hotel suites in virtual reality. The software along with a body sensor are equipped with a system, allowing guests to explore the interior and outside view of different suites. The starting price of the software is ₹60,000.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Musk responds to troll who called him 'national disgrace'
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk on Tuesday responded to a troll who called him a "national disgrace" in one of his articles. "Can anyone uncover who is really writing these fake pieces? Can't be skankhunt42. His work is better than this," Musk tweeted. Notably, 'skankhunt42' is a cyber bully who trolls people in the popular cartoon show South Park.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Laundry folding robot making startup raises ₹408 crore
article: Japanese electronics maker Panasonic has invested ₹408 crore in a startup that makes a laundry folding robot called 'Laundroid'. The robot uses artificial intelligence and image recognition to detect what kind of clothes are put into it, folds them, and stacks the folded clothes on the inbuilt shelves. The robot is set to launch in Japan next year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla invites people to swap cars with Model S for 1 week
article: Electric carmaker Tesla has launched a 'Drive to Believe' challenge in European markets that will let selected people exchange their cars with Tesla's Model S for one week. According to the company, "It takes driving a Tesla and experiencing its superior performance, safety, and technology to be convinced." Model S claims a range of up to 572 km per charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart to begin grocery sales next year: Binny Bansal, CEO
article: Flipkart will begin experimenting with grocery sales next year and scale up operations over a three-year period, according to CEO Binny Bansal. "There’s definitely room to build a profitable grocery business, but it’s hard. That doesn’t mean it’s not possible, but it’s hard," added Bansal. He said that fashion will remain Flipkart's best-selling category for the next few years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup raises ₹245 crore to make one-drop blood test
article: US-based startup Genalyte has raised ₹245 crore ($36 million) in funding led by Khosla Ventures and Redmile Group. It uses a lab-on-a-chip technology that claims to run through up to 128 different tests on a single finger prick of blood in under 15 minutes. The silicon chip involved in the test contains sensors to detect diseases like rheumatoid arthritis.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes alarm clock that plays music, shows traffic
article: Los Angeles-based startup Holi has created a ₹17,000 smart alarm clock called 'Bonjour' which talks to the user, plays music and shows traffic. The clock checks traffic reports and wakes up the user earlier than scheduled if there’s a major traffic jam. It also records sleep patterns and gives suggestions to enhance the sleep.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Airbnb blocks professor after he finds evidence of racism
article: Airbnb blocked Harvard professor Ben Edelman after he found evidence of racial discrimination, with black users being 16% less likely to be accepted than identical guests with white names. Edelman has claimed Airbnb ignored his pleas and reinstated his account only once a journalist contacted it. Meanwhile, Airbnb has claimed the suspension was a mistake as Edelman had multiple accounts.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tata Sons to launch a startup incubator
article: Tata Sons is planning to launch a startup incubator in Pune or Bengaluru and is currently laying out the blueprint for the same, according to Chief Technology Officer Gopichand Katragadda. The basic process to set up an incubator will be completed in the next three months. The group is also looking for startups that it can incubate at certain events.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SoftBank’s Masayoshi Son to visit India in December: Report
article: The Founder and CEO of Japan's SoftBank, Masayoshi Son is reportedly visiting India in early December this year. SoftBank is one of the largest investors in some of the biggest Indian startups, including Ola, Snapdeal, Oyo, Housing and Grofers. Earlier reports had suggested that Ola is in talks with SoftBank to raise around $500 million in fresh funding.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Video shows how a Tesla car drives itself
article: Elon Musk-led electric car making startup Tesla has released a video which shows how it looks like from the inside of a car when it fully drives itself. While the car's steering can be seen moving on its own, three different camera views show the car detecting lanes, people, traffic lights, other cars, signs and houses on the road.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Matchmaking site ties up with Aadhaar to ensure authenticity
article: Matrimonial matchmaking website, 'LoveVivah', has collaborated with Unique Identification Authority of India, making 'Aadhaar' verification mandatory to ensure the authenticity of profiles. The user verification will also ensure a five-step verification through various social media sites. The recently-launched platform also serves Indian communities in US, Canada, UK, Australia and Singapore.

author: Aman Bhalla
abstract: Ola launches a new car entertainment feature 'Ola Play'
article: Ride-hailing app Ola on Tuesday launched a new car entertainment platform 'Ola Play' that allows passengers to listen to their choice of music. The feature is aimed at attracting mostly business travellers who use Ola Prime. Third-party developers can also develop apps for Ola Play; with entertainment, shopping and tourism apps to be among the first to be featured.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Cloud telephony startup Knowlarity raises ₹136 crore
article: Gurugram-based cloud telephony startup Knowlarity has raised over ₹136 crore ($20 million) in series C round of funding led by Dubai-based private equity investor Delta Partners. Existing investors Sequoia Capital India and Mayfield Fund also participated. Founded in 2009, the startup provides services to Google, Amazon, Uber, Practo, Ola, Zomato and Swiggy.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Indian laundry service provider UClean raises seed funding
article: Laundry service provider UClean has secured seed funding led by franchise and retail solution group Franchise India. The startup is developing a platform to let customers pre-book their laundry slots at UClean stores or schedule pick up and drop facilities. Founded by IIT Bombay graduate Arunabh Sinha, UClean plans over 500 laundromats in India over the next five years.

author: Aman Bhalla
abstract: SoftBank invests $5 million in Housing: Report
article: Japanese telecom and internet company SoftBank has reportedly put in an additional $5 million (around ₹34 crore) in real estate portal Housing. Notably, SoftBank had invested $15 million (around ₹102 crore) in Housing in January this year. This comes after SoftBank CEO and MD Masayoshi Son announced plans to visit India in December this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New supersonic jet can cover 5500 km in 3.5 hours
article: Virgin Atlantic's Founder Richard Branson-backed startup Boom has unveiled a supersonic jet-prototype named 'Baby Boom', that covers 5500 km distance between New York and London in just 3.5 hours. A passenger plane usually takes at least 6.5 hours to cover the same distance. With a capacity of 44 passengers, the jet will be launched in 2020 for ₹34,000 a ticket.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: No one uses Hike app, numbers are fraud: Mahesh Murthy
article: Seedfund Co-founder Mahesh Murthy and Hike Founder Kavin Bharti Mittal got into a Twitter spat after the former claimed that Hike's numbers are fraudulent and investors only invest in the company because Mittal will "inherit Airtel". Mittal hit back with a graph comparing Hike's numbers to Facebook Messenger's and wrote, "I wonder how you make investment decisions at Seedfund."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup CEO fired after joking about killing Trump
article: The Founder and CEO of a US-based technology startup PacketSled, Matt Harrigan was fired after he joked about killing US President-elect Donald Trump. "I'm going to kill the president-elect...In no uncertain terms, f*** you America. Seriously. F*** off," Harrigan posted on Facebook. Before stepping down, he tweeted an apology saying his opinion doesn't represent the views of his company.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup's 'anti-smartphone' device to ship from Nov 30
article: A New York-based startup that had crowdfunded its 'anti-smartphone' phones called 'Light Phone', has confirmed that the devices will start shipping by the end of November despite delays. The credit card-sized phone will have the ability to take and make calls only and claims three weeks of battery life on a single charge. The phone is priced at $100 (₹6,780).

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Not afraid of Amazon or Alibaba: Flipkart's Sachin Bansal
article: Flipkart Co-founder and Executive Chairman Sachin Bansal on Wednesday said that the Indian e-commerce company was "not afraid of Amazon or Alibaba". Speaking at the Global Mobile Internet Conference (GMIC) in Bengaluru, Bansal added that any company that manages to 'Indianise' its offerings for the local customers will eventually succeed.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm, Zomato founders get into Twitter spat
article: Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma and Zomato Co-founder Deepinder Goyal got into a Twitter spat after a Zomato consumer accused the company of selling data to Paytm on Thursday. While Sharma responded, "We didn't buy data", Goyal tweeted, "This is poor user experience, our users are getting confused about payment options".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat files for one of the biggest tech IPOs: Report
article: Snapchat has reportedly filed for an IPO in March 2017 that could value the company between $20 billion to $25 billion. Snapchat's IPO could be the largest technology IPO since Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba went public two years ago, valued at $170.9 billion. It would also be the biggest US technology IPO since Facebook's 2012 debut at $81.2 billion valuation.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Food delivery startup Swiggy posts 65-fold hike in losses
article: Bengaluru-based food delivery startup Swiggy posted an almost 65-fold increase in losses for the fiscal year ended March 2016. The company, which started operations in August 2014, saw its losses rise to ₹137.18 crore from ₹2.12 crore a year ago. During this period, Swiggy raised a reported ₹150 crore in Series C and D rounds of funding.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup lets owners park their dogs in smart homes
article: A New York-based startup provides a 'Dog Parker' service to let owners park their dogs in smart homes while they buy grocery or have dinner at a restaurant. The dog house has internet connectivity for live webcam feed to owners and gets automatically sanitized through UVC light. The service costs ₹1,700 a year plus ₹14 per minute.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: No company I really respect in this sector: UrbanClap CEO
article: On-demand home services startup UrbanClap's Co-founder and CEO, Abhiraj Bhal in an interview said, "There is no company I really respect in this sector, which has a meaningful scale, has a great team, and has figured out something we haven’t". Speaking about competition, he said, "We hardly spend any energy worrying about competition...Less than 1% of this market is penetrated".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SpaceX employee quits after Trump's election win
article: SpaceX Head of Communications Dex Torricke-Barton on Tuesday announced that he was quitting the Elon Musk-led company to focus on "social change" following Donald Trump's victory. "The only reason to leave my dream job was to go and fight a nightmare...a future where the world is less open, less compassionate, more closed," he said in an interview.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: LeEco raises $600 million in funding amid cash crunch
article: Chinese technology company LeEco on Tuesday raised $600 million in fresh funding from a dozen local investors. This comes after LeEco's billionaire Founder Jia Yueting admitted that the company is facing a cash crunch to sustain a headlong rush into businesses ranging from electric cars to smartphones. He also slashed his income to 15 cents (around ₹10).

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Demonetisation wake-up call for digital firms: Sachin Bansal
article: Flipkart Co-founder and Executive Chairman, Sachin Bansal on Wednesday said, "Demonetisation decision is a wake-up call for digital companies". He added, "It suddenly converted tens of thousands of people into digital consumers and this transformation is a huge business opportunity in the digital space". Bansal further said that the move will have long-term positive impact in business.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tinder announces 37 gender identity options for users
article: Dating app Tinder on Tuesday launched its 'AllTypesAllSwipe' campaign and announced that it will add 37 new gender options on its platform. The app, which only offered male and female options will let users identify themselves using 'transgender' or 'trans woman/man' among other customisable options. The update will initially be available for users in the US, UK and Canada.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SpaceX plans 4,425 satellites launch for high-speed internet
article: Elon Musk-led aerospace startup SpaceX has filed an application with the US Federal Communications Commission, seeking permission to launch 4,425 satellites to provide high-speed, global internet coverage. There are less than 1,500 active satellites in orbit around the Earth presently. The project, which Musk previously said would cost at least $10 billion, was first announced in January 2015.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyperloop One settles lawsuit with Co-founder BamBrogan
article: High-speed transport system Hyperloop One has settled a lawsuit brought against it by Co-founder Brogan BamBrogan alleging harassment. The suit also accused Hyperloop One's Executive Chairman Shervin Pishevar of using company money to overpay a PR consultant he was dating. Hyperloop One had counter-sued BamBrogan for $250 million, claiming that he tried to lead a coup within the company.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla's 'instant' acceleration avoids rear-end accident
article: A video captured by a Tesla Model S P85D's rear-mounted dashcam shows how the car's 'instant torque' feature helped avoid a rear-end collision. The video shows a speeding Toyota Prius coming from behind the stopped Tesla car. Through the ability of Tesla's electric motors to speed up instantly, the driver was able to accelerate before the Prius collided into it.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Facebook acquires emotion detection startup FacioMetrics
article: Facebook on Wednesday acquired face recognition technology provider FacioMetrics, a Carnegie Mellon University spin-off company. The startup has created an app called Intraface that can detect seven different emotions on the user's face. A Facebook spokesperson said, the acquisition "will help bring more fun effects to photos and videos" on the platform.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart resumes cash on delivery option for payments
article: Indian e-commerce company Flipkart on Wednesday announced that it has resumed cash on delivery (CoD) payments up to any amount. Flipkart and Amazon had stopped accepting CoD payments on November 9 following the demonisation of old ₹500 and ₹1000 notes. According to industry estimates, about 70% of online shoppers opt for CoD while buying a product.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New Amazon ad features priest and imam
article: Amazon has released a new TV commercial featuring an imam and a priest that ends with both men kneeling to pray as per their respective faiths. The campaign, which has been launched in the US, UK and Germany follows an increase in reports of hate crimes against Muslims, Latinos and African-Americans after the US presidential elections.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Microsoft partners Elon Musk-backed AI project
article: Technology major Microsoft on Tuesday announced that it had partnered with Elon Musk and Peter Thiel-backed research project called OpenAI. The project aims to 'democratise' artificial intelligence and make it more accessible to the public. OpenAI will use Microsoft's Azure as its primary cloud platform to create new tools and technologies that are only possible with the cloud.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapdeal to invest ₹678 crore in 1 year on fashion
article: E-commerce platform Snapdeal will invest $100 million (₹678 crore) within a year to boost fashion retailing. While speaking at an IIM-Calcutta event, Snapdeal Co-founder and CEO Kunal Bahl said that Snapdeal's current model is unviable and that the startup was building new capabilities. "We will not limit ourselves to selling other people's products only," he said.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Delhi-based lawyer search platform LawRato raises funding
article: Legal advice startup LawRato has raised an undisclosed amount in its Pre-Series A round of funding led by Indian Angel Network (IAN). The Delhi-based lawyer search platform recently launched a Hindi version of the platform, with an aim to extend its services to rural and semi-urban areas in the country.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapdeal’s logistics unit COO Vijay Ghadge quits
article: Vijay Ghadge, COO of Snapdeal's in-house delivery arm Vulcan Express, has stepped down from his post less than five months after joining the company. He was previously the COO of e-commerce logistics startup GoJavas, in which Snapdeal holds a 42% stake. Ghadge was also the Director of Operations at Jabong, which is now owned by Flipkart.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Helpchat app renames itself to 'Tapzo'
article: Personal assistant app Helpchat on Thursday renamed itself to a crowdsourced name 'Tapzo' after it dropped the chatting feature. This is the second rebranding for the company, which was earlier called 'Akosha' before it changed its name to Helpchat. Founded in 2010, Helpchat has raised over $21.2 million in funding from Sequoia Capital and American Express Ventures.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Airbnb launches local tour feature
article: Airbnb recently launched a feature called 'Trips', which enables travellers to experience local activities in places they visit. The flagship piece of Trips, called 'experiences', will match travellers with locals who offer guided activities in the area. The feature, available in 12 cities, currently lists about 500 experiences including multi-day excursions and hours-long experiences.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Infosys invests ₹14.5 crore in Danish AI start-up
article: Infosys has invested ₹14.5 crore from its “innovation fund” in UNSILO, a Danish artificial intelligence start-up on advanced text analysis. This is Infosys’ 11th investment in a start-up from its $500 million innovation fund and fourth in 2016. "We will partner with UNSILO to bring their artificial intelligence and machine learning technology to our... clients, " an Infosys official said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart not to hire from IITs and IIMs in 2017
article: E-commerce retailer Flipkart has decided not to hire new candidates from IITs and IIMs for the year 2017. According to Flipkart's Chief Administrative Officer Nitin Seth, absorbing the previously hired students will meet Flipkart's campus need for the next year. Earlier in August, 31 startups were banned from IITs over revoking job offers and last-minute pay cuts.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba made more money in a day than Flipkart did in a year
article: In the 'Singles' Day' sale held on November 11, Jack Ma-led Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba made more money than what Flipkart did last year. The Singles' Day is one of the biggest sale events in China, where Alibaba clocked over $17.7 billion in sales in a day. Flipkart's Gross Merchandise Value for last year is estimated to be $10 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I fear Trump, won't stay silent: Silicon Valley entrepreneur
article: Silicon Valley entrepreneur and a partner at Facebook board member Peter Thiel's venture firm, Geoff Lewis on Monday published a blog saying "I fear Trump and I won't stay silent". In his post, Lewis said, "If we take Trump seriously, it may not be safe for me to write a post like this a year from now".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba clocks ₹1 lakh-cr sales in a day, breaks own record
article: Jack Ma-led Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba's 'Singles' Day' sale on Friday clocked over ₹1 lakh-crore, breaking its own record of ₹96,000 crore sales clocked last year. Launched in 2009, the sale is aimed at consumers who do not have a partner. The 'Singles' Day' is a Chinese festival celebrated every year on November 11 by singles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Second hand goods startup Zefo raises ₹40 cr from Sequoia
article: Bengaluru-based second-hand goods marketplace Zefo on Tuesday raised ₹40 crore in Series A round of funding, led by Sequoia India. Venture capital firms Beenext and Helion Ventures also participated in the funding. Founded in 2015, Zefo sells used goods including furniture and home appliances, which are verified by the website. It had raised ₹5 crore in funding last year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: It simplifies e-comm biz: Snapdeal Founder on demonetisation
article: E-commerce platform Snapdeal's Co-founder and CEO, Kunal Bahl on Monday while talking about the demonetisation's impact on his company said, "It simplifies the e-commerce business on the whole…This is better economics for the e-commerce business". Admitting that the government's move has marginally hit the cash-on-delivery mode, Bahl added that the dip was temporary in nature.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon, WH Smith found selling bomb-making handbooks
article: Major online retailers in the UK including Amazon and WH Smith were found to have listed a number of banned bomb-making manuals on their websites. These books were originally made back in the 1960s for the US military personnel. While WH Smith shut its website on Thursday to remove the books, other platforms reportedly have the books still listed.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zomato to start setting up kitchens next year
article: Food ordering platform Zomato is launching two new initiatives between February and June 2017—Zomato Infrastructure Services and Zomato Red. Under the first initiative, Zomato will build kitchens in areas where there aren't any good restaurants to deliver the food through its platform. Zomato Red will be a membership feature allowing its users to avail exclusive offers at pubs and restaurants.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: GrubHub reviews fall after CEO asks pro-Trump staff to quit
article: Users have submitted one-star reviews of US-based food ordering major GrubHub on the App Store after its CEO Matt Maloney sent an e-mail to employees asking the ones supporting Donald Trump's 'hateful attitude' to resign. One of the reviews read, "Worst business ever. Wouldn't buy anything from them or follow them because they hate half of America."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm faces heat over its new ad on demonetisation
article: Digital payments and m-commerce platform Paytm on Sunday faced heat from people over its new advertisement in regard with the demonetisation of ₹500 and ₹1000 notes. The advertisement showed a domestic help asking her employer to stop dramatising the situation and use Paytm. "Paytm mocking people facing hardship due to demonetisation", tweeted a user, after which Paytm edited the advertisement.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba's Jack Ma funds education of his 8-yr-old look-alike
article: China's e-commerce giant Alibaba's Founder, Jack Ma has decided to fund the education of his eight-year-old look-alike Fan Xiaoqin till he graduates. The boy, who comes from a small Chinese village, became popular as 'mini Jack Ma' after one of the villagers posted his video on the internet in 2015. Ma is the richest Chinese billionaire in the technology industry.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Google buys search startup founded by ex-Apple employee
article: Google has reportedly acquired search-focused startup Undecidable Labs, co-founded by Apple's former Director of Engineering, Cathy Edwards. Edwards has joined Google as head of engineering and product development for its image search tool. San Francisco-based Undecidable Labs reportedly raised under $1 million (₹6.7 crore) funding before its acquisition without releasing any products.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm Founder invests in property search platform NoBroker
article: Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma has invested an undisclosed amount in Bengaluru-based property search platform NoBroker. Besides funding, Sharma has joined the startup as an advisor. Earlier in September, Facebook executive and entrepreneur Anand Chandrasekaran also invested an undisclosed amount in the startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rental startup What's on Rent shuts down, returns 50% funds
article: Amidst the inability to raise the next round of funding, Bengaluru-based online rental startup What's on Rent has announced to shut down and return over 50% of raised seed funding to its investors. "The shutdown was a conscious business decision...changing the consumer behaviour that renting makes more sense was a big deal", said the startup's Co-founder Bharat Goyal.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber driver accused of raping unconscious teenager in US
article: An Uber driver in California has been arrested for allegedly raping an unconscious 17-year-old girl. The suspect, 23-year-old Samer Alaaeldin Mahran, is being held on $100,000 (₹67.5 lakh) bail and could face a maximum sentence of up to 28 years in prison if convicted. Earlier this year, a report suggested Uber was dealing with "thousands" of sexual assault cases internationally.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Street lights powered by footsteps installed in Las Vegas
article: A New York-based startup, EnGoPlanet has installed smart street lights in Las Vegas, which are powered by the sunlight and the pedestrians' footsteps. While the street lights have solar panels installed on them, special pads put on the sidewalks absorb the kinetic energy produced by the footsteps. The street lights also serve as Wi-Fi hotspots and device charging stations.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber rival Lyft cars to display personalised text for users
article: Uber's US rival Lyft has introduced a dashboard display called 'Amp' which will change colours and display personalised messages to help users find their rides. The colour of the Amp will match the colour displayed in the app on users' phones. Lyft President John Zimmer said that Amp's capabilities will be enhanced to help find self-driving cars in the future.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New stickers let users access fingerprint locks with gloves
article: Canada-based startup Nanotips has created 'Taps' stickers that can be stuck on gloves to make them touchscreen-friendly, using electric conductivity. The textured stickers also have a unique 'fingerprint' which can be used to access a phone's fingerprint lock without users having to take off their gloves. The Taps stickers are priced starting at approximately ₹550 for a pack of four.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup's Pro-Trump CEO removed from Y Combinator network
article: Andrew Torba, CEO of social media platform Gab, has been removed from startup incubator Y Combinator's alumni network for "harassing" other startup founders. Torba, who identifies as a "conservative Republican Christian", posted a Facebook comment about his support for Donald Trump that read, "Take your morally elitist bullshit and shove it... I helped meme a President into office, c*cks."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Video shows how Snapchat's smart sunglasses work
article: A four-minute YouTube video explains how Snapchat's smart sunglasses 'Spectacles' work. The social media company's first ever hardware product has an inbuilt camera which can capture and share circular videos by clicking a button on the side. The $130 (₹8,700) Spectacles come with a case which doubles as a charger and can charge the glasses about four times fully.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber trolled by rival Lyft in a new series of ads
article: Uber's biggest rival in the US, Lyft has launched a series of four 30-second advertisements to troll the former. One of the advertisements shows Uber executives plotting against Lyft and discussing ideas like lasers and sending cattle on the road to block Lyft rides. Notably, Uber lost over $100 million in the US in the second quarter.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Lyft COO not interested in Donald Trump's cabinet post
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber's rival Lyft has dismissed the possibility of the company's Chief Operating Officer, Rex Tibbens, joining the cabinet of US President-elect Donald Trump. "Rex Tibbens would be a valuable asset to any organization, but he is not interested in pursuing a role outside of Lyft," the company said in a statement.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Mobile van helps converts wet waste into compost in Pune
article: A startup called 'MobiTrash Recycle Ventures' provides garbage trucks that help convert wet waste and green waste into compost after the segregation of waste. The mobile van is fitted with machines that initiate the process of composting and later the waste is taken to grounds on the outskirts of the city. The vans later deliver cured compost to customers.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber drivers in UK go unpaid over banking error
article: Hundreds of Uber drivers in UK have not been paid this week because of an error by the bank, Uber has said. The glitch is expected to delay the payments till next week. Drivers have claimed they will not be able to pay bills or buy petrol in order to work over the weekend without their earnings.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Startup uses jellyfish to make eco-friendly diapers and pads
article: Israeli startup 'Cine'al' uses high absorbing biological material extracted from jellyfish to make eco-friendly diapers and pads. The process converts the jellyfish into a strong, flexible but fully biodegradable material called 'hydromash'. Antibacterial nanoparticles are later added to the material before transforming it into various forms of utilities.

author: Rini Sinha
abstract: Startup to launch chocolate lollipops of human faces
article: A London-based startup, 'Candy Mechanics', will launch 'Lolpops', which are 3D lollipops of human faces made from chocolate, in December. Customers will have to upload their video on the website, based on which their face will be drilled onto a plain chocolate lollipop inside a glass box. A box of three such lollipops is priced at £20 (approximately ₹1,600).

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Startup develops 'anti-snore' wearable electronic device
article: Netherlands-based startup Sleep.ai has developed an 'anti-snore' wearable electronic device. Designed as a band that wraps around a wearer's arm, the device vibrates whenever its partner smartphone app detects snoring, in an effort to coax a person into turning over to their side. The device has been launched for crowdfunding on Kickstarter with a price tag of $77.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: LeEco Chairman to cut his salary to ₹10
article: The billionaire Chairman of Chinese tech firm LeEco Jia Yueting has admitted his technology empire is running out of cash, and has pledged to slash his income to 15 cents (around ₹10). In a letter to employees, Jia apologised and further pledged to slow LeEco’s pace of expansion. The firm will immediately begin cost-cutting programmes, he added.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: We're f*ck*d: Google Ventures' general partner on Trump win
article: Reacting to Republican nominee Donald Trump's victory in the 2016 US Presidential elections, Google Ventures' general partner MG Siegler tweeted, "I hate to break out hyperbole. But we're f*ck*d. Not because of Trump necessarily. But the people who elected him." The executive added, "Billionaire who lives in penthouse spewing nonsense tricks those in opposite situation to follow him to hell."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Paytm Founder responds to Delhi CM Kejriwal's allegations
article: Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma responded to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's claim that Paytm was the biggest beneficiary of PM Modi's move to demonetise ₹500 and ₹1,000 notes. Kejriwal called Modi's appearance in Paytm ads "utterly shameful". Sharma tweeted, "The biggest beneficiary is our country. We are just a tech startup, trying to solve financial inclusion & make India proud."

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos gains $2.6bn in 1 day on US elections
article: E-commerce giant Amazon's founder Jeff Bezos gained $2.6 billion on Monday as stock markets rallied amid speculation that Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton will be elected US President over Republican rival Donald Trump. The rise in Bezos' net worth was the highest among world’s wealthiest people, who together gained $35.4 billion. Bezos is currently the third richest person in the world.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: eBay fires its product and technology team in India
article: American e-commerce company eBay has fired the product and technology team from its India development centre in Bengaluru, citing a review in operational structure. Only a total of 15 employees from both the teams have been retained who will move to the US. eBay had reportedly fired 50 employees from the same office last year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SoftBank writes down investments in Ola, Snapdeal by $555 mn
article: Japan's SoftBank has written down the value of its investments in startups Ola and Snapdeal by $555 million (₹3,700 crore), the company said in its six-monthly report. The news comes in at a time when both Ola and Snapdeal are looking to raise fresh funds. While Ola is reportedly planning to raise $300-$500 million, Snapdeal raised $500 million last year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapchat sells $130 Spectacles through vending machines
article: Snapchat on Thursday started selling its 'Spectacles' smart sunglasses for $130 (₹8,700) through vending machines called 'Snapbots' which will travel around the US. The Snapbots feature a display that lets shoppers virtually try on the glasses in coral, black or teal colour. Spectacles feature an in-built camera and can be connected to smartphones to take and send 10-second snaps.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba Singles' Day sale hits record ₹33.5 k-cr in an hour
article: Jack Ma-led Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba's 'Singles' Day' sale on Friday set a new record by surpassing ₹33.5 k-crore ($5 billion) milestone in the first hour. It took 90 minutes to hit the same milestone in 2015. The 'Singles' Day' is a Chinese festival celebrated every year on November 11 by singles who are proud of their relationship status.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: What is the meaning of a write-down?
article: A write-down is the reducing of the book value of an asset because it is overvalued compared to the market value. It typically occurs on a company's financial statement, when the value of the asset can no longer be justified as fair value. Japan's SoftBank has written down the value of its investments in Ola and Snapdeal by $555 million.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyperloop Co-founder backs California's US exit on Trump win
article: Hyperloop One Co-founder Shervin Pishevar has backed the 'Calexit' movement for California to exit from the US and become an independent nation following Donald Trump's victory in the US presidential elections. Shervin said he was "very serious... and there'll be announcements" about his plans to implement the program. He also shared an image on Twitter captioned, "New California Republic Flag".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: If Trump doesn't work with China it will be a disaster: Ma
article: China's e-commerce giant Alibaba's Founder Jack Ma while reacting to Donald Trump's win at the US presidential elections said, "I don't fear Trump's presidency. China and US can solve a lot of problems – poverty, disease, environment. But if they don't work with each other, it's going to be a disaster". Trump had earlier accused China of stealing US' jobs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm, MobiKwik, Ola welcome PM Modi's move
article: Digital wallets Paytm and MobiKwik, and other startups who accept cashless transactions such as Ola, Zomato and Grofers have welcomed PM Narendra Modi's move to scrap old ₹500 and ₹1,000 notes. While Paytm tweeted "We have got two words for you: Paytm Karo", Ola tweeted "Do Note Worry...Well let's just say thank God for Ola money!"

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart, Amazon stop cash on delivery option for payment
article: Following the government's move to make the old ₹500 and ₹1,000 invalid effective Tuesday midnight, e-commerce majors including Flipkart and Amazon have stopped their cash on delivery mode of payment. A note on Amazon's website read, "We have disabled COD for you to save cash for essential payments". Snapdeal is accepting cash on delivery with the "right denominations".

author: Chhavi Tyagi
abstract: 'What is the deal with Paytm, Mr PM?', asks Kejriwal
article: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's announcement to demonetise high currency notes, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "Paytm biggest beneficiary of PM's announcement. Next day PM appears in its ads.
