What's the deal, Mr PM?" Kejriwal added, "Utterly shameful. Do people want their PM to model for private companies? Tomorrow, if these companies do wrongdoings, who will act against them?"

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: ₹8,700 Snapchat Spectacles sell for ₹67,000 on eBay
article: Several pairs of Snapchat's 'Spectacles' sunglasses priced at ₹8,700 ($130) have been listed on e-commerce major eBay for up to ₹67,000 ($1,000) each. The company on Thursday started selling its smart glasses with built-in cameras through vending machines called 'Snapbots' and the initial supply has already been sold out. Spectacles can be used to capture and share 10-second snaps.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber rival Karhoo shuts down after raising $250 million
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber's rival Karhoo, which was active in London and New York, on Tuesday announced its shutdown after raising $250 million in October last year. The company was reportedly looking to raise $1 billion in total funding but failed to raise more money. "The financial situation was pretty dire...We're looking at the next steps for the business", Karhoo said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jabong sees top-level exits 3 months after Flipkart takeover
article: Online fashion retailer Jabong's Chief Marketplace Officer and head of human resources have quit the firm just three months after it was acquired by Flipkart. A Jabong spokesperson said that both the executives have decided to pursue other career opportunities. Flipkart-owned Myntra had acquired rival Jabong in a $70 million deal in July this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Oyo appoints Amazon executive as CTO
article: Oyo Rooms has appointed Anil Goel, a former Amazon executive, as the company's Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Goel was the global head of technology for customer returns and reverse logistic business at Amazon, and prior to that, he was the CTO for Hike Messenger. Oyo last year raised ₹635 crore in a funding round led by SoftBank.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Karnataka bans surge pricing by Ola, Uber taxis
article: The Karnataka HC on Thursday upheld the rules framed by the state government, banning cab-hailing apps like Ola and Uber from charging anything extra over the base fares. Uber filed a petition in June this year, seeking withdrawal of new rules, terming it as “anti-constitutional”. States including Delhi, Maharashtra and West Bengal have framed similar rules to ban surge pricing.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart's ex-CPO Punit Soni launches his own startup
article: E-commerce platform Flipkart's former Chief Product Officer Punit Soni on Tuesday announced the launch of his own startup 'Learning Motors'. He tweeted, "A machine learning company focused on a real world problem. More soon". Prior to working at Flipkart, Soni had worked with Google and Motorola. He is also an adviser and investor in at least three startups.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Anil Ambani's Reliance Group invests ₹80 cr in Square Yards
article: Anil Ambani-led Reliance Group's investment arm has provided ₹80 crore in funding to Gurugram-based real estate startup Square Yards. Founded in 2013, the startup provides real estate aggregation and transaction services in India and abroad. It raised over ₹73 crore in pre-Series A round of funding in May 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon drivers admit skipping toilet breaks for deliveries
article: Online retailer Amazon's drivers in the UK have admitted to breaking speed limits and skipping toilet breaks due to the tight delivery schedule of the products. Some drivers even claimed they defecated in bags and urinated in bottles to make deliveries on time. Some staff also complained that Amazon's delivery schedule does not take traffic jams and breaks into consideration.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart not to take 40% space in new campus to cut costs
article: E-commerce platform Flipkart has decided not to take up 40% office space at the company's new campus in Bengaluru, to cut costs. Flipkart, which is undergoing a restructuring drive, will now take 12 lakh sq ft office space instead of the earlier plan of occupying 20 lakh sq ft space. Flipkart in September reportedly fired 1,000 people over underperformance.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart faces valuation markdown by investors
article: Flipkart's investors Valic and Fidelity have marked down their shares in the e-commerce startup by 11.3% and 3.2% respectively, for the last quarter. The markdown has reportedly put Flipkart's valuation between $8.7 billion and $10.25 billion. Both the investors in May had marked up their shares in Flipkart, which valued the startup at $11.5 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Logistics startup Rivigo raises ₹500 crore in funding
article: Gurugram-based logistics startup Rivigo on Monday raised over ₹500 crore in Series C round of funding by an affiliate of Warburg Pincus. The startup raised ₹200 crore in Series B funding round in December last year. Rivigo caters to sectors such as apparel and lifestyle, auto components, pharmaceuticals, e-commerce, electronics, consumer goods and others.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon ordered to refund parents for kids' in-app purchases
article: A US federal judge has ordered online retailer Amazon to reimburse the parents whose children made in-app purchases without their permission. The Federal Trade Commission in July 2014 accused Amazon of making it too easy for children to make in-app purchases while playing mobile games, resulting in $86 million of unauthorised charges.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Golf aggregation startup raises ₹6.6 crore in angel funding
article: Golf aggregation platform GolfLAN has raised ₹6.6 crore ($1 million) in angel funding from existing investor YourNest Angel Fund. African IT company iSON also invested in the Delhi-based startup which offers online tee slot bookings, membership plans for golf courses and a marketplace for golf equipment. Founded in 2013, GolfLAN claims to provide access to 1,000 golf courses.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyperloop to cover two-hour distance in 12 minutes
article: High-speed transportation startup Hyperloop One has released a teaser of its launch in Dubai, where it claims that its tubes will cover the 125 km distance between Dubai and Abu Dhabi in 12 minutes at 1,041 kmph. A car currently takes about two hours to cover the same distance. On November 8, Hyperloop is set to make a major announcement.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indian makes game where players send Elon Musk to Mars
article: Siddhartha Sahai, a BITS Pilani graduate, has created 'Musk2Mars' game which requires a player to send a cutout of SpaceX Founder Elon Musk from Earth to Mars. The game includes Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos, self-driving cars, NASA, Iron Man and gorilla Harambe among other obstacles. Musk, in September this year, unveiled his plan to build a human colony on Mars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Self-driving electric truck that builds in 4 hrs unveiled
article: UK-based startup Charge has unveiled a self-driving electric truck that takes only four hours to be built by a single person. Made with ultra-lightweight materials, the truck produces zero emissions for the first 160 kilometers it travels. The truck will be available for sale by the next year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Meru's drivers decide how much they want to work, says CEO
article: Meru Cabs' CEO Siddhartha Pahwa in an interview said, "Meru’s business model is that the driver decides how much he wants to work. We never had rules on how many hours he has to work". He added, "We give you (drivers) a car, you pay a sum on the car, you keep it 24x7 and then all upsides are yours".

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Amazon beats Flipkart in customer experience: Report
article: Amazon India has beaten home-grown rival Flipkart in delivering superior customer experience, according to a report by market research company Forrester. Amazon shares the top spot with online grocery store BigBasket, while Flipkart-owned Jabong was the biggest improver in the list. Overall customer service for online retail as a category improved from "poor" last year to "OK" this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Universal income to cover humans displaced by robots: Musk
article: Electric vehicle maker Tesla's Co-founder and CEO, Elon Musk in an interview said that a universal basic income can take care of human workers who will get displaced by robots and software in the future.  He added, "I'm not sure what else one would do. That’s what I think would happen."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google Capital changes its name to 'CapitalG'
article: Google Capital, the search giant's venture arm that invests in growth-stage companies, has changed its name to 'CapitalG'. The old GoogleCapital.com domain now forwards to CapitalG.com, and Google Capital's Twitter account has announced that it’s being retired in favour of a new @CapitalGTweets account. CapitalG’s new site confirms a previously unmentioned detail that it has invested in Snapchat.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Israeli startup makes camera strap for Apple Watch
article: Israel-based technology startup Glide has created a $249 (approx ₹16,600) camera-embedded band for the Apple Watch. The 'CMRA' band incorporates an 8-megapixel primary and 2-megapixel secondary camera. Glide has also developed a stand to charge both the Apple Watch and the CMRA band. Apple recently launched an Apple Watch series 2 variant with a Nike Sport rubber strap.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: 24-inch portable display that opens like umbrella made
article: Texas-based startup Arovia has developed a high-resolution 24-inch screen that collapses & expands like an umbrella. Called the Spontaneous Pop-up Display (SPUD), the device uses a flexible polymer that can't get cracked and is also washable. SPUD can be connected to a smartphone, tablet or laptop and has four times more screen area than a 13-inch laptop screen.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Slack publishes full-page newspaper ad mocking Microsoft
article: Team communication service Slack on Wednesday took out a full back-page ad in the New York Times welcoming Microsoft to the messaging market with "friendly advice". In the open letter, Slack explains why copying its app's features won't help Microsoft's newly-launched 'Team' messaging service. As a final point of advice, the letter says, "Slack is here to stay".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes $34 light bulb that can charge phones
article: California-based startup Mega Tiny Corporation has developed 'PowerBulb', a light bulb that can double as a charger. The LED bulb, which costs $34 (₹2,270), has two USB charging ports that can be used even when the light is off. The startup claims to use 'MegaSmart' charging technology that sends more power to the device when it senses a lower charge.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyundai to let users make calls by pointing at windscreen
article: Automaker Hyundai has partnered with Seoul-based startup VTouch to commercially produce gesture-based heads-up displays (HUDs) by the end of 2017. The display above the dashboard will let drivers browse through music, make calls or set navigation just by making gestures with their fingers towards the windscreen. BMW recently unveiled a similar concept called 'AirTouch' for its 7 Series.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Microsoft launches group messaging service to rival Slack
article: Microsoft on Wednesday launched 'Microsoft Teams', a chat tool for businesses. The messaging service integrates Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Skype into the platform. Microsoft Teams, which will be offered to the 85 million monthly users of Microsoft's Office 365 software suite, will rival communication app Slack which was founded in 2009 and the newly-launched Facebook Workplace service.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk impersonator accuses Tesla of hacking Twitter account
article: Todd Katz, a former oil services firm executive who was sued for pretending to be Tesla CEO Elon Musk in an email, has accused Tesla of hacking his Twitter account. Katz also argued that the email sent was too "goofy" to be believed and "nobody who received this...grammatically deficient email ever believed that it really came from Elon Musk".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Urgent need for regulation to curb capital dumping: Ola COO
article: Japan's SoftBank-backed ride-hailing startup Ola's Chief Operating Officer Pranay Jivrajka on Sunday said, "There's an urgent need for adequate regulation to curb predatory pricing and capital dumping in the ecosystem in the interest of co-existence of all players in the ecosystem". He added, "Capital should be used for sustainability". Notably, Ola has raised ₹8,010 crore from foreign investors.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Australian startup plans 'men only' co-working space
article: Australian startup Nomadic Thinkers has announced plans to open a co-working space which will only be open for men. The startup claims it has the backing of six investors for its co-working space which doubles up as a gym. Nomadic Thinkers' Founders claim the initiative will help tackle the issue of domestic violence and depression among men.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We are not desperate for money, says Nearbuy's CEO
article: Hyperlocal e-commerce platform Nearbuy's Co-founder and CEO, Ankur Warikoo in an interview said, "We are never going to say no to good money. At the same time, we're not desperate for money. So if the right partner comes with the right terms, we are open to it". He added, "We realised the economics of food delivery business is not viable".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm Founder to invest ₹10 crore in environment startups
article: Paytm's Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma has announced to invest ₹10 crore of his personal money in the startups that are interested in working on environment’s sustainability in India. Sharma also plans to invest in any ongoing government or private initiative working on the protection of the environment. "My investment will not be for return", said Sharma.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Online platform explaining Indian laws launched
article: An online platform named 'Nyaaya' has been launched in India which explains the country's central and state laws in a user-friendly method, supported by interactive guides and visualisations. It explains sexual harassment, domestic violence, dowry and anti-corruption laws among others. Currently available in English, Nyaaya wants to launch its service in India’s 22 official languages.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber unveils biggest app redesign since 2012
article: Uber on Wednesday rolled out a redesigned version of its app which has been "rebuilt completely from the ground up". The new app learns from users' routines to offer 'shortcuts' predicting their destination and lets them compare the fares of UberGo, UberX and Uber Pool easily. Users can sync their contacts within the app and share their location with friends.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola launches one way inter-city rides
article: Ride-hailing app Ola, which launched its inter-city travel service 'Outstation' in June this year, has now launched one-way rides between cities. One-way on Outstation gives riders the option of booking a cab for another city without having to pay for a round trip that they haven’t taken. Ola claims to connect over 500 cities through the Outstation service.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup develops modular blocks that form a 'music studio'
article: British music creation startup Roli has created 'Blocks', a set of modular pieces that can be joined to create a 'music studio'. Starting at $179 (approx ₹12,000), the default pressure-sensitive Block can create about 120 instrument sounds with varying vibrato, pitch and tone. The connected iOS app can be used to store and share the music created.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Alibaba's net income falls 69% to $1.06 billion
article: China-based e-commerce firm Alibaba Group on Wednesday reported a 69% year-on-year decline in net income for the quarter ended September to $1.06 billion. However, revenue for the quarter rose 55% to $5.14 billion during the period under review. Further, the company's media and digital entertainment business saw revenues rise 302%, mostly due to the consolidation of site Youku Tudou.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber sued over missing food delivery tips
article: A courier in New York who used to deliver food for Uber under the company's UberEats vertical, has filed a lawsuit against the company over unpaid tips. The courier claims that the tips from customers never made it to him and other delivery personnel for UberRush and UberEats. Both UberEats and UberRush deliver food to customers' doorstep from nearby restaurants.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup Magic Leap's top marketing executive quits
article: US-based augmented reality startup Magic Leap's top marketing executive Brian Wallace has quit before the company has even brought its first product to market. Prior to Magic Leap, Wallace had worked with BlackBerry, Samsung, and Google. The startup has raised more than $1.3 billion to date from investors including Alibaba, Google and Warner Bros.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Google hires team behind game-focused Android emulator
article: The team behind LeapDroid, an Android emulator made for PCs that specialises in games, has announced that they are joining Google. The team has suggested that this is not a conventional acquisition and that LeapDroid is still "not affiliated" with Google. They also announced that they are halting the development and support of the LeapDroid platform.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We worked even on our wedding day: MobiKwik Founders
article: Digital wallet MobiKwik's Founder duo Upasana Taku and Bipin Preet Singh in a recent interview revealed that they worked even on the day of their wedding by taking 'work breaks' at their wedding venue. "We were a six-member team in 2011...We used to work out of two rooms of my 4bhk apartment...I used to cook lunch for everyone," said Upasana.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: India now world's third largest startup base: Nasscom
article: India has emerged as the world's third largest startup base, behind the US and UK, according to a new report by Nasscom. Nearly 1,400 new Indian startups are expected by end of 2016, and the country will be home to 10,500 startups by 2020, the reports claims. It added that Bengaluru, NCR, and Mumbai remain the country's major startup hubs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Elon Musk unveils solar roof made of glass tiles
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk unveiled a solar roof made up of glass tiles on Friday. Made jointly with SolarCity, a solar company that Musk seeks to acquire, the tiles have been designed in four styles and cost less than conventional solar panels. It can also incorporate heating elements to clear the roof of snow and keep generating energy.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber charges riders for taking free DND flyway
article: Despite the Allahabad HC's announcement of making the Delhi-Noida-Delhi (DND) flyway toll-free with immediate effect on October 26, Uber still charged its riders a toll tax on taking the flyway. Responding to the issue, Uber said that it has stopped charging the toll since 28th morning and will refund for the trips for which the toll was charged.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: It hasn’t burst but it’s a bubble: Accel Founder on startups
article: Venture firm Accel Partners Co-founder Jim Swartz while talking about growing startup fundings in a recent interview said, "Just because it doesn’t burst doesn’t mean it’s not a bubble. You’ll get to the point where people conclude these unicorns aren’t as valuable as we thought". He added, "Over time, some funds will disappear that didn’t make money".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Freshdesk raises $55 million in Series F funding
article: Cloud-based customer support software Freshdesk on Tuesday raised $55 million in Series F round of funding led by Sequoia Capital India with participation from Accel Partners. This takes Freshdesk's total funding raised to $150.5 million. Founded in 2010 by Shan Krishnasamy and Girish Mathrubootham, Freshdesk has offices in Berlin, London, Sydney, California and Chennai.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal cuts cost, shifts Mumbai office to co-working space
article: In an attempt to cut costs, online retailer Snapdeal has vacated its 200-seat office in Mumbai and shifted base to a 90-seat office at a co-working space in Andheri. The expected reduction in costs is expected to be around 10%. Snapdeal in September this year spent over ₹200 crore on rebranding and reportedly fired 200 employees.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jack Ma's wealth rose by $5.9 bn to $35.6 bn this year
article: China's richest person and e-commerce giant Alibaba's Founder, Jack Ma's net worth rose by $5.9 billion to $35.6 billion this year, helped by a 25% rise in his company's shares. Ma became China's richest person in April, surpassing China's largest real estate developer's Chairman Wang Jianlin's net worth of $31.6 billion. Besides China, Ma is also Asia's richest person.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon won't slow down investments in India: Amit Agarwal
article: E-commerce major Amazon's India Head Amit Agarwal in a recent interview said the company would not at all slow down investments in India despite lower-than-expected results in the third quarter. "India is very early in its e-commerce trajectory...To transform how India buys is going to take a long time and a lot of investment...We’re growing at 150% year-over-year," he added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart can defeat 22-year-old Amazon: Binny Bansal
article: E-commerce platform Flipkart's Co-founder and CEO Binny Bansal in a recent interview said, "A home-grown company (Flipkart) can successfully fend off a 22-year-old global behemoth (Amazon) pouring in money to buy market share". On Flipkart's funding, Bansal said, "Flipkart likes to raise funds when they're available than when we need them...We've raised enough money in the past..there is no rush".

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Israeli firm creates '100% more fuel efficient' car engine
article: An Israeli firm named Aquarius Engines claims to have created an internal combustion engine with more than twice the efficiency of currently available alternatives. The $100 engine, which the firm says can allow cars to run up to 1,600 km on a full tank, replaces the traditional multiple-vertical piston engine with a novel single-horizontal piston design.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: George Hotz cancels kit made to turn cars self-driving
article: George Hotz, the hacker known for unlocking the first iPhone, has cancelled the kit developed by his startup Comma.ai, which could be fitted into cars to turn them self-driving. A US regulatory agency had asked Comma.ai for information regarding safety following which Hotz tweeted, "Would much rather spend my life building amazing tech than dealing with regulators...It isn't worth it."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup stops sale of two items after customers fall ill
article: Meal replacement startup backed by top Silicon Valley investors, Soylent has stopped the sale of its two products - a protein bar and a powder mix, after some customers complained of stomach-related problems. The bar was recalled earlier this month, just after a month of its launch. Soylent is reformulating its products and will resume the sales early next year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Laundry startup Pick My Laundry raises ₹1.3 crore
article: Gurugram-based on-demand laundry startup Pick My Laundry has raised $200k (nearly ₹1.3 crore) in an angel round of funding. The startup has reportedly secured a commitment of another $300k funding from a couple of other angel investors. Founded in 2015, the laundry startup plans to set up offline stores to reduce the last mile logistics cost.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Family sues Amazon after hoverboard burns their $1M home
article: A US-based family has sued Amazon after a hoverboard purchased through the platform caught fire and burned their $1 million home down in January. The family, which is seeking $30 million in damages, alleges that Amazon knowingly sold the product despite knowing of its potential danger. Following a spate of explosions, hoverboards were banned and deemed unsafe earlier this year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: $20 billion startup Palantir wins lawsuit against US Army
article: Peter Thiel-backed software startup Palantir, which was last valued at $20 billion, on Monday won its lawsuit against the US Army. Palantir alleged that the Army didn't research commercially available products before awarding contracts for its combat data system as the law required. The verbal ruling allows the company to be eligible for the $200 million contract.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon may enter the real estate business: Report
article: E-commerce retailer Amazon may reportedly enter the real estate business and start providing houses in Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru, Pune and Gurugram. Without confirming the move, Amazon India Head Amit Agarwal said, "People trust Amazon for everything in their lives… It’s like the Roti, Kapda aur Makaan, and when you start trusting someone for that, that’s very much it".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla rival Fisker's first car travels 640 km on one charge
article: Elon-Musk founded electric car startup Tesla's rival Fisker on Monday revealed its first electric luxury sedan named 'EMotion', which claims to travel over 640 kilometres on a single charge. The car will have all the hardware required to allow full self-driving ability in the future, and a top speed of 259 kmph.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: GIF platform Giphy raises $72 mn at valuation of $600 mn
article: New York-based startup Giphy, which is a search engine for short looping videos called Graphics Interchange Format (GIF), on Monday raised $72 million (₹ 480 crores) in Series D round of funding at a valuation of $600 million (₹4,000 crore). Founded in 2013, the startup recently announced that its GIFs are seen by over 100 million people per day.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Merger with SolarCity to add $1 bn to Tesla revenue in 2017
article: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle startup Tesla's $2.6-billion merger with solar panel maker SolarCity would contribute over $1 billion to Tesla's revenue in 2017, the company has said. The merger would further add over $500 million in cash to Tesla's balance sheet over the next three years. The largest shareholder in both the companies, Musk calls the merger a "no brainer."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Conventional jobs will be cannibalised by automation: Shaw
article: Biotech entrepreneur and Biocon's Founder Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw on Monday said, "Conventional jobs will be cannibalised by automation. However, e-commerce will create new jobs that will multiply current jobs that are in the bricks and mortar". She added new-age businesses like Uber, Ola and Flipkart are creating millions of jobs which are several orders of magnitude higher than conventional jobs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart planning to enter food delivery business: Report
article: E-commerce retailer Flipkart, which began piloting its food delivery business in Bengaluru in March this year, is scaling up its food delivery arm and planning to enter the vertical on a larger scale. Flipkart in February had shut down its grocery delivery business 'Nearby'. Flipkart's rival Amazon is also reportedly entering the business by investing in a food delivery startup.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber loses right to term drivers as freelancers in UK
article: A UK tribunal has ruled that ride-hailing service Uber cannot consider its drivers as freelance workers and should pay them minimum wages. The company is currently not responsible for drivers' costs like health insurance or pension. Uber argued that it was a technology firm not a transport business and its drivers were self-employed contractors who could choose when to work.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: FB failed to acquire Snapchat-like service called Snow
article: Facebook made an unsuccessful bid earlier this year to acquire Snow, a one-year-old Asian Snapchat-like service from Naver, the Korean firm behind chat app Line. This comes after Line invested $45 million in Snow, raising its valuation to $180 million. With around 80 million downloads, Snow offers a range of filters for images and video, including celebrities and cartoon characters..

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Startup lets users find and book musicians online
article: A UK startup called Encore lets users discover and book musicians for their event online. Event hosts can submit details like instrument, genre, time and place on the mobile app, following which an alert is sent to matching registered musicians and bands. According to its Co-Founder, Encore aims to improve pay and conditions for musicians by removing conventional agency middlemen.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Startup makes external light source for smartphones
article: San Diego-based startup Lume Cube has created the Life Lite, a Bluetooth-controlled, pocket-sized detachable light source for smartphone photography and videography. The Life Lite measures 1.5 inch by 1 inch, weighs 50 g, is waterproof up to 10 m and has a light output of up to 1,000 lumens. Priced $39, the product has been launched for crowdfunding on Kickstarter.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Amazon to acquire remaining 74% stake in Westland
article: Online marketplace Amazon has agreed to acquire the remaining 74% stake in Westland, the publishing unit of the Tata-owned retail company Trent. However, the terms of the deal were not immediately disclosed. Amazon had bought a 26% stake in Westland for about ₹9.5 crore in February. Following this, Amazon will also get to elect one member to the Westland board.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos loses $3 billion in an hour
article: E-commerce major Amazon's Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos's net worth dropped by $3.2 billion in an hour after Amazon missed its expected earnings for the third quarter. Bezos, however, has maintained his position as the third richest person in the world, preceded by Zara's Founder Amancio Ortega and Microsoft's Co-founder Bill Gates.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: An absolute load of crap: Ex-Flipkart CFO on fraud rumours
article: Outgoing Flipkart Chief Financial Officer Sanjay Baweja has denied allegations that the startup paid Tata Communications 30% more than it was paying its previous data centre supplier because of him. "It's an absolute load of crap. We have robust processes...Tata Communications were the only ones who could have delivered. I don't know where this 30% is coming from," he said.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla posts second quarterly profit in 13-year history
article: American electric car manufacturer Tesla on Wednesday announced its first profit after 12 consecutive quarterly losses, and only the second profitable quarter in its 13-year history. The company, led by Elon Musk, recorded net income of $21.9 million for the third quarter compared to a loss of $229.9 million a year earlier. Tesla's revenue more than doubled to $2.3 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber reveals its plan for flying cars
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber has revealed a 98-page research about flying cars titled "Fast-forwarding to a future of on-demand urban air transportation". The research explores the viability of an aircraft that can take off and land vertically for city use. While Uber isn't planning to make the flying car by itself, it looks to collaborate with vehicle developers for the car.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We’ve lost many great employees to entrepreneurship: Branson
article: Virgin Group Founder Richard Branson in a recent blog post said, "We’ve lost plenty of talented people from across the Virgin Group to the draw of entrepreneurship - and I’ve always supported them in taking the plunge". He added, "Working for someone else can act as a launch pad for greater things, but choosing the wrong employer can stifle you".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon's income triples in Q3 to $252 million
article: Jeff Bezos-led e-commerce major Amazon on Thursday reported a three-fold increase in its income to $252 million in its third quarter this year. This marks the company's sixth straight profitable quarter. However, the earnings did not meet analysts' expectations and Amazon's shares went down by 6% after the earnings announcement.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Don’t sell your company: Vine Co-founder on shutdown
article: Following Twitter's announcement that it was shutting down Vine, the video-sharing platform's Co-founder Rus Yusupov tweeted, "Don't sell your company!" Twitter had acquired Vine in 2012 for a reported $30 million. Yusupov was laid off by Twitter last year after Vine's other two Co-founders quit in 2014.

author: Ankur Vyas
abstract: ATMs to dispense gold coins set up in Bengaluru, Delhi
article: On the occasion of Diwali, online jewellery startup BlueStone has set up ATMs which dispense 24 karat gold coins instead of money in Bengaluru and Delhi. Users can buy gold coins ranging from 1 gram to 20 grams at market rates using cash or cards. The machine also delivers a certificate of purity while dispensing the gold coins.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon files fresh suits against paid reviews
article: E-commerce giant Amazon has filed three new lawsuits against sellers who buy fake reviews for products listed on its platform. The lawsuits claim that over 50% of reviews on products of two of these sellers are fake. Since 2015, Amazon has sued more than 1,000 defendants who offered to post fake reviews on its site in exchange for compensation.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup hosting auction to raise money for Uri martyrs
article: Online textile marketplace XSTOK has announced that it will host an online auction starting from 5 pm, October 27 to raise long-term investments for the families of soldiers martyred in the Uri attacks. The Mumbai-based startup hopes to sell over 50 handwoven garments from Indian designers priced between ₹5,000 and ₹50,000 through the 'Weaves of Gratitude' auction.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hero MotoCorp to invest ₹205 cr in electric vehicle startup
article: Indian motorcycle manufacturer Hero MotoCorp has announced to invest ₹205 crore in Bengaluru-based electric vehicle startup Ather Energy. The company will pick up a 26-30% stake in the startup which claims to make India's first smart electric scooter, S340. Founded in 2013, Ather Energy has previously raised funding from Tiger Global Management, and Flipkart Co-founder Sachin and Binny Bansal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Shooter Abhinav Bindra invests in tea startup Kettlery
article: Ahmedabad-based tea startup Kettlery has raised ₹6.71 crore in seed funding from shooter Abhinav Bindra’s fund Shooting Star Sports LLP and Franchise India Brands. Launched in April last year, Kettlery operates in both online and offline formats and sells a variety of tea blends and accessories. It competes with the likes of Chai Point and Chaayos.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: MakeMyTrip Q2 losses triple as revenues rise 27%
article: India's largest online travel services firm MakeMyTrip on Wednesday reported a three-fold rise in net losses for the second quarter, in spite of their revenues rising by 27%. Net loss widened to $39.4 million from $12.2 million, even as growth in air ticketing and hotel booking businesses drove up their revenues to $83.1 million from $65.5 million a year earlier.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Just Dial loses its second CTO in a year
article: Online local business search service Just Dial’s Chief Technology Officer RV Raman has quit the company. This is the second time in a year that the company's CTO has called it quits, after seven-year CTO Sandipan Chattopadhyay stepped down in December last year. Founded in 1996, Just Dial is one of the few Indian technology companies which went for IPO.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart in strong hands now: Outgoing CFO Sanjay Baweja
article: Former Chief Financial Officer of online marketplace Flipkart, Sanjay Baweja, who quit earlier this week, has said that the company has built a strong leadership team and raised its standards of governance during his two-year tenure. "The company is in strong hands, I can move on to something fresh", he said on being asked the reason behind his resignation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber may tie up with Railways for pickup, drop to station
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber has reportedly approached the Indian Railways to integrate its services with its app, including ferrying passengers to and from the stations in various cities. Uber has proposed setting up kiosks at stations to help passengers book cabs. The deal could add around ₹150 crore in annual revenue for the Railways through commission on cab bookings.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sachin Bansal to create lobby group for startups: Report
article: Flipkart's Co-founder and Executive Chairman Sachin Bansal is reportedly looking to create a lobby group with entrepreneurs and investors to represent the interests of Indian startups. Bansal has approached Ola’s Bhavish Aggarwal, Snapdeal’s Kunal Bahl, Paytm’s Vijay Shekhar Sharma and FreeCharge's Kunal Shah to join the group. Sachin has been thinking about the group for over a year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Alibaba's Global Managing Director joins Paytm board
article: Digital payments platform Paytm has brought Alibaba Global Managing Director K Guru Gowrappan to its board. Gowrappan, who focuses on Alibaba's products and strategy for international markets, will guide business, product and technology teams at Paytm, the Noida-based startup said in a statement. Chinese e-commerce company Alibaba is said to be the largest investor in Paytm.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New Ola feature to notify users when peak pricing ends
article: Indian ride-hailing startup Ola on Wednesday launched two new features on its smartphone app to provide real-time notifications to its users. The 'Just in Time' feature sends notifications when a cab becomes available or when the peak pricing for a user's desired cab category ends. The 'Rich Notifications' feature will help users track their booked ride through real-time push notifications.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Faraday Future shows its first production car in new clip
article: Elon Musk's rival electric vehicle startup Faraday Future has released a short 15-second video clip showing its first production car riding in a desert. No sound of the engine is audible in the clip, where the company says, "Can't hear the engine? You're not supposed to". This is the first time that the company has shown its working prototype.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Anti-aging startup raises $116M from Jeff Bezos, Mayo Clinic
article: Unity Biotechnology, a startup developing anti-aging medicines, has raised $116 million in a Series B funding round led by Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos and Mayo Clinic, among others. The company also announced that the former CEO of KYTHERA Biopharmaceuticals, Keith Leonard, would assume the position of CEO, and the previous CEO and Co-Founder Nathaniel David will be Unity's President.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Freight logistics firm FR8 raises ₹6.5 cr from Omnivore
article: Chennai-based B2B freight logistics startup FR8 has raised ₹6.5 crore (about $971,000) from agritech-focussed venture capital firm Omnivore Partners. The funding will help the company expand into other Indian cities. Founded in 2016, FR8 offers long-haul trucking solutions to large corporates, SMEs and the agri-business ecosystem, with a clientele including Philips, Asian Paints and Britannia.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Snapchat may be looking to raise up to $4 bn in IPO
article: Snapchat will seek to raise as much as $4 billion in its planned initial public offering, according to reports. The IPO could value Snapchat between $25 billion and $40 billion. The company, which recently rebranded to Snap Inc, has crossed 150 million daily active users and, according to sources, is looking to generate around $1 billion revenue next year.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Just Dial's Q2 net profit down by 27%
article: Online local search service company Just Dial has reported a 27% dip in net profit for the quarter ended September. Net profit slid to ₹29.62 crore against ₹40.49 crore in the same quarter last year, the company said. Operating revenues for the second quarter, however, grew 10% from ₹163.86 crore last year to ₹180.32 crore.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup that helps monitor brain health raises $3 million
article: US-based cognitive health startup BrainCheck on Thursday raised $3 million (approx ₹20 crore) in seed funding for its app which lets users monitor their brain health. BrainCheck’s 5-minute long tests help users check for a concussion, or temporary brain damage from a blow to the head, and compare their results with average users.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Community-based social network Imzy raises $8M Series A
article: A community-based social network called Imzy, which aims to be "a platform for genuine conversations with like-minded people," closed an $8 million Series A funding round led by Index Ventures. This came ahead of Imzy's public launch on Thursday. Founded in 2016 by two ex-Reddit employees, Imzy lets users create multiple, even anonymous, profiles to join communities that interest them.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Intel Capital to expand to include LGBTQ, disabled founders
article: Intel-owned venture capital firm Intel Capital has announced that it is expanding its focus to include founders from the LGBTQ community, military veterans, and founders living with disabilities. The diversity fund was established in 2015 as a means to promote equal access to resources and capital for startups, with $125 million promised over a five-year period to support this cause.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I will be surprised if someone beats us: ShopClues CEO
article: E-commerce startup ShopClues CEO Sanjay Sethi in a recent interview said, "I will be surprised if someone beats us. I think ShopClues will be the first e-commerce company to get profitable". He added, "In the last eighteen months, a lot more sanity has come in the market...These are good times, as the mad rush for GMV is over".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 1st delivery by Uber's self-driving truck is 50k beer cans
article: Uber's 18-wheeler self-driving truck recently made its first ever delivery by transporting 50,000 cans of Budweiser beer across nearly 200 km in the US. The delivery was in partnership with brewing company AB InBev and each can read, "First delivery by self-driving truck". The Volvo truck was supplied by Otto, a self-driving vehicle group acquired by Uber in August.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SoftBank may invest up to ₹2,000 crore in Ola
article: Japan's SoftBank is reportedly planning to invest $250-$300 million (₹1,700-2,000 crore) in ride-hailing app Ola by leading its new round of funding. While SoftBank is reportedly looking to commit more capital, Ola wants to control dilution. Ola was valued at about $5 billion (₹33.4k crore) when it closed $500 million (₹3k crore) in funding in November last year.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Flipkart CFO Sanjay Baweja resigns
article: Online marketplace Flipkart on Tuesday announced that its Chief Financial Officer Sanjay Baweja has resigned from the company. Baweja, who had joined Flipkart in 2014, will leave by the end of the year, said the company. This comes amid several changes in Flipkart's top management, including the replacement of Sachin Bansal with Binny Bansal as company's CEO earlier this year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Former HCL CEO Anant Gupta launches ₹100 crore tech fund
article: Former HCL Technologies CEO Anant Gupta on Friday launched a ₹100 crore investment fund called 'Techcelx' to "help startups develop next-gen technology solutions to disrupt legacy operating models". The fund will invest between ₹50 lakh and ₹10 crore in start-ups focused on digital technologies such as machine learning, Internet of Things, artificial intelligence and analytics.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Sequoia hires its first female partner in US from Yahoo
article: Silicon Valley-based venture capital firm Sequoia Capital has hired the first female investing partner for its US operations in its 44-year history. Jess Lee, 33, will become the 11th partner and one of the youngest investing partners at the firm. Lee is the Co-founder of e-commerce website Polyvore, which was acquired by Yahoo for $230 million in 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Trusting entrepreneurs failed in India: Rocket Internet
article: German investor which has invested in Indian startups including Foodpanda and Jabong, Rocket Internet's Asia CEO Hanno Stegmann on Thursday said, "You have this approach…Basically to put a lot of trust in everyone...It is something we like but it is not really working everywhere". He added, "It doesn’t mean we are not looking at India at all".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Humans will live in glass domes on Mars: Elon Musk
article: SpaceX Founder Elon Musk, who last month unveiled the plan to colonise Mars, has said the colony would have "glass panes with carbon fiber frames to build geodesic domes on the surface, and a lot of miner droids". He added, "You can build a huge amount of pressurised space for industrial operations and leave the domes for green living space".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Maharashtra rules to make service costly, unreliable: Uber
article: Uber has said that the new Maharashtra City Taxi Rules 2016, which include clean fuel for taxis and fixed minimum and maximum fares, will make operations expensive and hurt the quality of service. The rules seek to implement a dress code for drivers and a colour code for cars. Uber has also raised an objection to the price of permits.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm brings Goldman Sachs Vice Chairman to its board
article: Digital payments and m-commerce platform, Paytm has brought Goldman Sachs Vice Chairman Mark Schwartz to its board. Currently based in Beijing, Schwartz is also the Chairman of Goldman Sachs' business in Asia Pacific region. The 12th member on Paytm's board, Schwartz played a major role in helping Alibaba's Founder Jack Ma with the company's $25 billion IPO in 2014.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Yuvraj Singh-backed startup Healthians raises ₹20 crore
article: Cricketer Yuvraj Singh-backed diagnostic and wellness startup Healthians has raised ₹20 crore in Series A round of funding from Japanese early-stage investor Beenext. Japanese incubator Digital Garage and Beenos also participated in the round. Founded in 2014, Gurugram-based Healthians aggregates diagnostic labs, lab sample collectors, and nearby doctors.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: BMW, Ola tie up for luxury cab services
article: Luxury carmaker BMW and taxi-hailing app Ola have entered into an agreement to provide on-demand luxury cab services in India. The tie-up will allow Ola cab operators to avail cheaper credit to buy BMW cars, receive after-sales support and guaranteed buyback. Ola will induct BMW cars across Delhi, Mumbai, and Bengaluru as a part of its Ola ‘Lux’ fleet.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Space is about to enter a golden age: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos
article: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos on Thursday said he wants to build infrastructure that would allow businesses to be set up in space with his aeronautics company Blue Origin as "space is about to enter a golden age". Comparing businesses on the internet with his vision for space, he said, "Nobody predicted Snapchat...you can't predict what entrepreneurs can do in space."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sequoia-backed Creo stops making phones 6 mths after launch
article: Sequoia Capital-backed Indian smartphone maker Creo has completely stopped making smartphones, just six months after launching its first handset 'Mark 1'. The startup, which raised $3 million, has shifted its focus to building its operating system 'Fuel OS'. The startup reportedly sold around only 1,000 smartphones.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Airbnb banned from listing rentals below 30 days in NY
article: New York on Friday passed a law making it illegal for lodging platform Airbnb to list rental apartments for less than 30 days on its platform. A bill was passed in June to make the law, after which Airbnb spent $10 million on a campaign against it. Airbnb has now sued New York, its Attorney General, and its Mayor.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Former Google Search head Amit Singhal joins Paytm board
article: Former head of Google Search Amit Singhal has joined the board of online payments and e-commerce startup Paytm, confirmed Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma through a tweet. The 48-year-old, who worked at Google for 15 years, will be the 11th member on the board of the startup. He also founded 'Singhal Foundation' to provide education to under-privileged children in India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grofers ditches app-only model, launches website
article: Tiger Global-backed grocery delivery startup Grofers has ditched its app-only model and started a website where users can purchase their daily staples. Grofers in November 2015 raised ₹780 crore led by Japan's SoftBank. Earlier this year, Grofers laid off some employees, revoked campus offers and shut down in nine cities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla rival Atieva rebrands itself as Lucid Motors
article: Electric vehicle maker Tesla's rival Atieva has changed its name to Lucid Motors. The Silicon Valley-based startup will unveil a concept of its electric sedan by the end of this year and begin the sales by 2018. It will be powered by an 87 kWh battery that generates 900 horsepower and provides acceleration from 0-100 kmph in under 3 seconds.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Consumer Reports ranks Tesla among least reliable carmakers
article: Consumer-advocacy organisation Consumer Reports on Monday ranked autonomous carmaker Tesla 25 on a list of 29 automakers, calling it one of the least reliable car brands. Consumer Reports has also listed Tesla's Model X as the sixth least reliable car of 2016, calling it "more showy than practical". The car's "falcon wing" doors are said to be a problem area.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes self-charging foldable electric bike
article: Austria-based startup Vello has created a foldable electric bike that can charge itself while the user pedals, by converting mechanical energy into electrical energy. The less than 12-kg bike has a 250-watt motor and offers top speeds of 25 kmph with a range of 50 km on a single charge. The base model can be pre-ordered for $1,899 (approximately ₹1,27,000).

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Weed delivery startup Eaze raises $13 million
article: US-based medical marijuana delivery startup Eaze on Monday raised $13 million (approx ₹86.8 crore) in Series B round of funding from Fresh VC, Doll Capital Management and Tusk Ventures. Launched in 2014, the startup also lets people get a medical weed card in California over the phone in under 10 minutes. Eaze delivers weed on-demand in nearly 100 US cities.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Google buys eye-tracking startup for new VR headset
article: Google has acquired US-based eye-tracking startup Eyefluence to reportedly integrate the technology in its new Virtual Reality (VR) headset. Eyefluence enables users wearing head-mounted VR glasses to use their eyes as a mouse and make selections only with their eye movements. Founded in 2013, the startup had raised a total of $21.6 million (over ₹144 crore) from two funding rounds.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber to deliver free vaccinations for a day in US
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber has announced that it will deliver influenza vaccinations free-of-cost to users in 17 cities across the US on Tuesday. Under the UberHEALTH program, the startup will deliver wellness packs and flu shots for up to five people at every pick-up location. The shots will be administered by a registered nurse from Uber's partner organisation Passport Health.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Blume Ventures closes its second fund at ₹401 crore
article: Seed-stage venture capital firm Blume Ventures has closed its second fund at $60 million (approximately ₹401 crore). One-third of the total money raised has come from domestic investors including IIFL Wealth Management, government's India Aspiration Fund, and SIDBI. Blume Ventures had reportedly closed its first fund in December 2015 at over $30 million (approximately ₹200.5 crore).

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Intel invests ₹254 crore in 12 startups worldwide
article: The world’s biggest chip maker, Intel on Monday announced that it has invested over ₹254 crore in 12 startups. The startups focus on solutions for seniors and disabled people using the Internet of Things or making everyday objects smart and connected. Since 1991, Intel has invested ₹78,000 crore in 1,458 startups worldwide.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Foodtech startup Box8 secures ₹50 cr Series B funding
article: Mumbai-based on-demand food delivery startup Box8 has raised ₹50 crore ($7.5 million) in Series B funding round led by IIFL Seed Ventures Fund and Mayfield Ventures. Founded in 2012 by IIT alumni Amit Raj and Anshul Gupta, Box8 caters across Mumbai, Pune and Bengaluru. According to a company statement, Box8 now serves 12,000 meals every day through 60 stores.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: F&B marketplace WOTU raises funding from Kae Capital
article: B2B food-and-beverage marketplace We Organise The Unorganised (WOTU) has secured an undisclosed amount of funding from Mumbai-based venture capital firm Kae Capital. Founded in 2015 by former PayPal employees, Dhruv Sawhney and Mihir Mehta, WOTU directly connects farmers, processors and manufacturers with last-mile F&B outlets ranging from standalone restaurants to large scale food chains.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: All new Tesla cars to have full self-driving capabilities
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced on Wednesday that all vehicles currently in production by the electric carmaker will have a fully self-driving hardware. The hardware, being installed on Tesla's Model S, X and forthcoming Model 3 sedans, will make the cars "substantially safer than a human driver". The cars will have 8 cameras with 360-degree viewing and 12 ultrasonic sensors.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Video shows a Tesla car driving and parking itself
article: A four-minute video shows a Tesla car driving completely by itself and parking in an empty lot without any human assistance. The car is fitted with eight 360-degree cameras and twelve sensors that can distinguish between hard and soft objects. A radar allows the car to 'see' through heavy rain, fog, dust and even the car ahead.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 90% official Apple chargers sold on Amazon are fake: Apple
article: Tech giant Apple's examination has revealed that almost 90% of power adapters and charging cables sold through Amazon in the US by manufacturer Mobile Star were fake and had the potential to catch fire or electrocute users. The company has filed a trademark infringement case against the manufacturer and is seeking a compensation of $2 million per product type.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart may open offline stores: Report
article: E-commerce marketplace Flipkart is planning to launch offline stores in small cities, where awareness about online shopping is low and users have inconsistent or limited internet access. Flipkart recently partnered with StoreKing, which offers products via its tablets installed at retail outlets in rural areas. Flipkart's rival Amazon launched its offline shopping initiative called Udaan in 2014.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla targets fully self-driving road trip of over 4,400 km
article: American electric carmaker Tesla is targeting a road trip from Los Angeles to New York, covering a distance of over 4,400 km, in one of its fully self-driving cars by end of 2017. Tesla CEO Elon Musk said on Wednesday the goal was to travel from "LA to Time Square in New York and then having the car park itself".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla asks owners not to use self-driving cars to make money
article: Following the announcement of fitting all its new cars with fully self-driving hardware, electric carmaker Tesla has asked customers not to use the cars to earn money. "Using a self-driving Tesla for car sharing and ride-hailing for friends and family is fine, but doing so for revenue purposes will only be permissible on the Tesla Network," the company said.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Firm creates autonomous suitcase that follows owners
article: San Francisco-based startup Travelmate Robotics has created an autonomous suitcase that follows its users by tracking the location of their smartphone through a connected app. The 'Travelmate' suitcase can travel at a top speed of 10.8 kmph and has built-in sensors that can avoid obstacles like people and furniture. Travelmate is available for pre-order starting at $399 (about ₹26,600).

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Google allows booking Ola, Uber directly from Search
article: Google India on Wednesday added a functionality for Android and iOS users to allow booking Ola or Uber cabs directly from Google Search. On searching for directions, users will be shown a tab for cab services with fare estimates. After the user selects from Ola or Uber, Google will redirect them to the app to book rides with one tap

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Why Tesla Model X’s doors open and close automatically
article: Elon Musk Co-founded electric vehicle startup Tesla's Model X, which was launched in 2015, automatically opens and closes its doors to drop off owners. The feature is a part of Tesla's larger plan to make cars able to drop its owner off and park itself. Musk on Wednesday revealed his plan to have fully self-driving capabilities in company's new cars.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla Autopilot will run on ‘shadow mode’ to prove safety
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced on Wednesday that all Tesla cars being produced will have the hardware to achieve full Level 5 self-driving. To prove the safety of Tesla's autonomous Autopilot mode, the cars will initially run with Autopilot in the background in "shadow mode" which will register how the car would have acted if the computer was in control.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Self-driving car collides with truck in Singapore
article: US-based self-driving car startup nuTonomy's car on Tuesday collided with a truck in Singapore during an attempt to change the lane. No one was hurt in the accident where two engineers were onboard the self-driving car traveling slowly. In September, Uber's rival Grab partnered with nuTonomy to allow some users to book driverless cars via its app in Singapore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon patents voice-controlled pocket size drone
article: Amazon has patented a voice-controlled drone that's small enough to fit in the pocket. Amazon says that the drone can help find lost cars in parking lots, lost children in a grocery store, and tell how many persons are ahead of the owner in a queue. It would also respond to instructions from an app and return to its owner.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Negative media on autonomous cars killing people: Elon Musk
article: In response to a question about the safety of Tesla's autonomous systems, CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday said, "In writing some article that's negative, you effectively dissuade people from using an autonomous vehicle, you're killing people." He added that he finds the media coverage of Autopilot crashes "quite disturbing", as they are "basically almost none" relative to manual crashes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Freshdesk acquires Bengaluru-based Chatimity
article: One of the largest SaaS-based startups from India, Freshdesk on Tuesday announced the acquisition of Bengaluru-based social chat platform Chatimity, for an undisclosed amount in a cash and equity deal. This marks Freshdesk’s sixth acquisition in 14 months. Founded in 2011, Chatimity's seven-member team has moved to Chennai and joined Freshdesk.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Online furniture rental startup Furlenco raises ₹200 crore
article: Online furniture rental startup Furlenco has raised ₹200 crore in equity and debt funding in a Series B round of funding led by existing investor LightBox Ventures. Other investors include Hong Kong-based Axis Capital, HDFC Bank and Kotak Mahindra Bank. The startup, which currently operates in Bengaluru, Mumbai and Pune, plans expansion to Delhi and Hyderabad with the new funds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: TinyOwl Co-founders quit Runnr after acquisition
article: Food delivery startup Runnr has hired senior executives from Bharti Group, Uber and Facebook, after TinyOwl’s Founders Harshvardhan Mandad and Saurabh Goyal quit the company. Runnr acquired TinyOwl in June and bought its 90-member team onboard its platform. The appointments come about two months after Runnr raised $7 million in funding from existing investors Blume Ventures and Nexus.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Urban Ladder to open offline stores
article: Online furniture platform Urban Ladder will be opening eight offline stores in select cities over the next two years, the startup's Chief Marketing Officer Sanjay Gupta has confirmed. “Our idea was always to function as a brand, and not as a marketplace,” said Gupta. The startup has also partnered with Flipkart and Amazon to sell furniture through the e-commerce platforms.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal Founders sued for trademark infringement of 'Dhoti'
article: E-commerce startup Snapdeal's Founders Rohit Bansal and Kunal Bahl, and another company have been sued by Century Textiles for trademark infringement of its product 'Dhoti', a men's garment. Century Textiles, a BK Birla Group company, claims that the dhoti being sold on Snapdeal under the brand name ‘Paramsukh’, is a registered trademark of the Birlas since 1942.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: RailYatri raises funding from Nandan Nilekani, others
article: Online portal for Indian Railways travelers, RailYatri on Wednesday raised fresh funding from existing investors - Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani, Helion Ventures, Omidyar Partners and Blume Ventures. Founded in 2011 by Kapil Raizada, Sachin Saxena and Manish Rathi, it provides train and platform information, passenger amenities at stations, and sends personalised alerts via its mobile app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Would be very difficult to get AskMe buyer: Ex-Chairman
article: Troubled startup AskMe's former Chairman, Sanjiv Gupta in a recent interview said, "It would be very difficult to get a new buyer for the defunct businesses during the court administered sale". He added, "I would again urge Astro to consider our proposal so that the company operations can be re-initiated and the possible wind-down be avoided".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New rule requires London's Uber drivers to pass English exam
article: London has imposed a rule requiring privately-hired drivers, including those from Uber, to meet an English-language qualification before driving in the city. Uber has argued against the rule, claiming that a test would reduce the number of drivers on the road and increase prices. It added that the test was tougher than the exam required to gain British citizenship.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla’s self-driving car hardware to cost $8,000 extra
article: The new self-driving car hardware being fitted into new Tesla cars will cost customers $8,000 (₹5,35,000) more on the company's S and X models, Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said. However, he added that the software required to enable fully autonomous operation is still being tested. The cost for the upcoming Model 3 starts at $35,000 (₹23,41,000) without new hardware.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Auto aggregator Jugnoo launches grocery delivery service
article: Auto-rickshaw aggregator Jungoo has launched its own grocery delivery service in Delhi, after recently introducing a service to deliver fresh fruits and vegetables. Auto-rickshaw drivers will be making the deliveries during their free time between 4-8 pm, the startup said. Jugnoo plans to launch an 'Express Store' in December, to make deliveries within two hours of an order's placement.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber still not ready for IPO: CEO Travis Kalanick
article: Travis Kalanick, CEO of world's most valuable startup Uber has said the ride-hailing service is not ready to go public. "It's the ninth grade. It's not time to go to prom yet," he said comparing Uber's growth to a school student. With reference to Uber's self-driving fleet, Kalanick said, "We're at the very beginning stages of becoming a robotics company."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Asthma-tracking startup Propeller Health raises $21.5 mn
article: US-based startup Propeller Health that provides a platform to support respiratory health management raised $21.5 million (approx ₹143.5 crore) in Series C round of funding on Thursday. Launched in 2010, the startup offers sensors, apps, analytics, and services to let patients upload their information to their doctor. Glaxo Smith Kline's venture arm and Hikma Ventures participated in the round.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IIT KGP's Entrepreneurship Awareness Drive reaches Lucknow
article: IIT Kharagpur entrepreneurship cell's Entrepreneurship Awareness Drive (EAD) has reached its 17th destination Lucknow, after taking place in Mumbai, Delhi and other cities. EAD is being held in 23 cities with guest lectures and panel discussions for students and startups. Global Entrepreneurship Summit and Empresario are the other initiatives of the institute's E-cell to promote entrepreneurship.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SolarCity gives Airbnb hosts up to $1,000 cashback on panels
article: Solar panel-making company SolarCity is offering up to $1,000 cashback to short-term lodging Airbnb hosts on installing solar power system. In return, SolarCity customers are getting $100 travel credit for their Airbnb stays. Airbnb claims that the company's efforts have reduced the greenhouse gas amount equivalent to the gas generated by 5.6 lakh cars on the US roads per year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MakeMyTrip buys rival ibibo Group
article: Online travel platform MakeMyTrip on Tuesday bought rival ibibo Group for an undisclosed amount. Owned by Naspers and China's Tencent Holdings, ibibo owns consumer travel brands goibibo, redBus and Ryde. Following the development, Founder Deep Kalra will remain MakeMyTrip's Group CEO and Executive Chairman. Ashish Kashyap, Founder and CEO of ibibo, will join MakeMyTrip as Co-founder and President.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I have 53,950 unread emails in my inbox: BookMyShow CEO
article: BookMyShow's Co-Founder and CEO Ashish Hemrajani in a recent interview said, "I have 53,950 unread emails sitting in my inbox. I don’t read emails. My entire business runs on WhatsApp. I've different groups and everything happens instantly." Hemrajani, who shut his Facebook account four years ago, says that life's meant to be lived in the real world and not virtual.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startups will shut shop if they don't have viable model: Pai
article: Former Infosys board member TV Mohandas Pai while commenting on Indian startup ecosystem said, "It is a very competitive environment. People will have to tighten their belts. More companies will shut shop, if they do not have viable model". Pai added, "The funding is coming in but investors are asking questions like when are you going to become viable".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Death of 44-yr-old Chinese CEO stirs debate on work hours
article: The premature death of Zhang Rui, the 44-year-old Founder and CEO of China-based health startup Chunyu, due to a heart attack has raised concerns over the 70-hour work week in the country's technology sector. When Chunyu was founded in 2011, it required working from 9 am to 9 pm, six days a week, said the startup's spokesperson.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Airbnb hosts can earn $10 extra by offering a hair dryer
article: Hosts on peer-to-peer homestay network Airbnb who offer a hair dryer to guests can earn $10 more. "Per night, $10. Like, that's how important a hairdryer is," said the company's Co-founder Nathan Blecharczyk at a conference. An earlier report indicated that facilities like WiFi and cable can help a host earn an additional $8 and $16 per night respectively.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Boman Irani invests in sports fans connecting app Rooter
article: Actor Boman Irani has invested an undisclosed amount in the angel investment round of Rooter, an app that aims to connect sports fans across the world. Launched in 2016 by Piyush and Soham Sinha, Rooter connects users with people having similar sports interests, around their workplace and home. It also provides pre-match quizzes, live match prediction games, and post-match interactions.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba's new app lets users pay by nodding
article: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba recently demonstrated its app 'VR Pay', that will let customers shopping in virtual reality to make payments by nodding their heads. People using virtual reality goggles to browse Alibaba's virtual reality shopping malls will be able to pay for their purchases without taking off the goggles. The users, however, would still need to enter their password.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber uses drones to advertise to drivers stuck in traffic
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber has been using drones to advertise its carpooling service 'UberPool' to drivers stuck in traffic in Mexico City. One of the Spanish signs said, "Driving by yourself? This is why you can never see the volcanoes", referring to smog in the city. However, the company has said it will not replicate the strategy in other markets.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Germany asks Tesla to not use 'Autopilot' in ad
article: German Transport Minister Alexander Dobrindt has asked Elon Musk's electric vehicle maker Tesla to stop using 'Autopilot' term in its advertisement, as this might suggest drivers' attention is not needed during driving. A Tesla spokeswoman said that the company has always made it clear to the customers that the Autopilot assistance system requires drivers to pay attention all the time.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ronnie Screwvala's edtech startup UpGrad acquihires Pyoopil
article: Media industry veteran and philanthropist, Ronnie Screwvala's Co-founded education technology startup UpGrad has acquihired Pyoopil, a startup that lets corporates create training courses for employees. Pyoopil will continue to build learning products for working professionals. Founded in 2015, UpGrad provides online courses in entrepreneurship, digital marketing, and data analytics.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Pure e-comm to take long time to be profitable: FirstCry CEO
article: Baby products startup which recently acquired Mahindra's BabyOye for ₹362.1 crore, FirstCry's Co-founder and CEO Supam Maheshwari in an interview said, "Pure play e-commerce model will take a long time to become profitable". He added, "The only model which can become sustainable and profitable is the omni-channel model because 90% of the market still remains offline".

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: ZTO to launch largest Chinese firm IPO in US since Alibaba
article: Delivery company ZTO Express aims to raise as much as $1.3 billion from its initial public offering (IPO), making it the biggest US IPO by a Chinese entity since that of e-commerce major Alibaba. ZTO will launch the IPO later this month. Earlier in 2014, Alibaba raised $25 billion in the biggest ever IPO in history.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber inks pact with Electronics and IT Min to train drivers
article: Ride-hailing app Uber on Saturday inked a pact with the Ministry of Electronics and IT's CSCs (Common Services Centres) to train drivers on its platform. A part of company's UberSHAAN initiative, the agreement will help individuals receive driver training, facilitate license procurement and vehicle financing. Through the initiative, Uber aims to create 10 lakh job opportunities in India by 2018.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Elon Musk postpones Tesla's new product unveiling
article: Electric vehicle maker Tesla's Co-founder and CEO, Elon Musk has postponed the unveiling of the company's new product, which was scheduled for Monday. "Moving the Tesla announcement to Wednesday. Needs a few more days of refinement," tweeted Musk. In an earlier tweet, Musk had said that Tesla's new product will be "unexpected by most."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber releases video on completing 3 years in Delhi
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber has released a video to celebrate three years of its launch in Delhi. The video, a tribute to Delhi, features major city landmarks including the Lotus Temple, Jantar Mantar, Jama Masjid, Red Fort, and India Gate. "As Uber Delhi turns 3, we thank the city for the incredible ride it has been," tweeted Uber.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Microsoft backs startup that lets landline send texts
article: Seattle-based startup Zipwhip, which enables landlines to send and receive text messages, on Monday raised $9 million in Series B round of funding from technology major Microsoft and others. Founded in 2007, Zipwhip’s cloud-based software receives mobile text messages and sends it to an app that looks like an email interface, provided to the business landlines.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Diversity group ends Y Com ties over Thiel's Trump support
article: Silicon Valley diversity initiative 'Project Include' has cut ties with incubator Y Combinator after venture capitalist Peter Thiel pledged to donate $1.25 million to Donald Trump's Presidential campaign. Project Include Co-founder Ellen Pao called the donation by Thiel, who is a part-time partner at Y Combinator, "a direct contribution to creating hate and instilling fear."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: MobiKwik allows transfer of money across banks using UPI
article: Indian mobile payments startup MobiKwik has launched Unified Payments Interface (UPI) on its platform, allowing users to transfer money across different banks with the use of a single identification and password. The startup also has a cash pick up and cash deposit service for wallet-loading. Founded in 2009, Gurgaon-based MobiKwik has raised over ₹846 crore in funding so far.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Predatory pricing harmful but we react to competition: Ola
article: Ride-hailing service Ola on Monday admitted that "predatory pricing is detrimental to the industry...and will not benefit anyone", adding that it "reacts to competition" to ensure there is no monopoly in the Indian market. The Competition Commission of India (CCI) in September had dismissed allegations that Ola abused its dominant position in Delhi with predatory pricing ways.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Bike-hailing startup partners Bajaj Finance for easy loans
article: Gurgaon-based on-demand bike taxi startup Baxi has partnered with Bajaj Finance to procure loans with minimum processing fees and low down payment. These loans will be provided to salaried individuals who want to buy new bikes with the option to operate on a ride-share basis for Baxi. Founded in 2015, the startup claims 3,000 daily rides in Gurgaon and Faridabad.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber, T-Hub to connect Indian startups with global mkt
article: Ride-hailing app Uber and startup ecosystem builder T-Hub on Saturday launched 'T-Bridge', a program to connect Indian startups with global opportunities. The program will further focus on bringing global companies to the country. T-Bridge will also create a network of mentors, VCs, incubators and accelerators to help the Indian startup ecosystem.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Housing's ex-COO to start online grocery startup
article: Real estate portal Housing's former Chief Operating Officer Rishabh Gupta with another former Housing executive has founded 'The Box', a subscription-based grocery delivery startup. It is currently in the testing phase and will be launched as an app-based service by November end. An IIT-Bombay alumnus, Gupta was briefly the interim chief executive of Housing after Co-founder Rahul Yadav's exit.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup recalls food bars after some customers get sick
article: Andreessen Horowitz-backed food supplement making startup Soylent has recalled its $2 snack bar that was introduced in August. The recall follows reports by customers of the food bars making them "violently ill", with complaints including nausea and diarrhoea. Founded in 2013, the Los Angeles-based startup has raised a total of $22.3 million in funding.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyderabad-based bike rental startup Tazzo raises ₹1.5 cr
article: Hyderabad-based bike rental startup Tazzo Bikes on Saturday raised ₹1.5 crore in seed funding from DSG Consumer Partners. Founded in 2015, Tazzo is an on-demand hyperlocal delivery service of self-driven motorbikes, which can be booked through a dedicated app. Prices start from ₹5/km and users can also choose a point for delivery and pickup of the bike.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Delhi-based Play Your Sport acquires Directground
article: Delhi-based sports tech startup, Play Your Sport has acquired sports discovery and booking platform, Directground. Post the acquisition, Directground's Founder and CEO Arun Singh Chauhan will join Play Your Sport as Chief Technology Officer. Founded in 2015 by Supriya Mamgain and Varoon Kapoor, Play Your Sport helps users discover fellow sports and fitness enthusiasts near them.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Bengaluru foodtech startup Trilyo raises seed funding
article: Bengaluru-based foodtech startup Trilyo has raised an undisclosed amount of seed funding. The round was led by a Singapore-based private investor and backed by Bengaluru-based entrepreneur and ex-Infosys SVP Vishnu Bhat, Mumbai-based entrepreneur Rajiv Lunkad and Dubai-based Naresh Ravindranath. Founded in 2015, Trilyo is a cloud-based service app for restaurants.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Jack Ma's wealth rose 41% to $30.6 billion in 2016
article: Chinese e-commerce major Alibaba Group Chairman Jack Ma's wealth increased by 41% to $30.6 billion, making him the country's second richest person, Hurun's 'Richest People in China' 2016 list stated. The rise was due to a surge in the market cap of Alibaba, the most valuable company on the list. Notably, Dalian Wanda Chairman Wang Jianlin topped the list.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Shah Rukh Khan can’t make people buy: BigBasket CEO
