article: BigBasket Co-founder and CEO Hari Menon in an interview admitted that while Shah Rukh Khan's endorsement of the online grocery delivery startup was "massively" helpful, he "can't make people buy." Menon said that the startup gained visibility through advertisements featuring the actor, but the conversion was up to BigBasket alone. Founded in 2011, BigBasket has raised $246.76 million so far.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: FirstCry acquires BabyOye from Mahindra for ₹362.1 crore
article: Shopping store for kids and baby products, FirstCry on Saturday acquired rival BabyOye from owner Mahindra Retail for ₹362.1 crore. FirstCry has additionally raised $34 million of new equity capital from the Mahindra Group, equity fund Adveq, and Infosys Co-founder Kris Gopalakrishnan. FirstCry will now operate all BabyOye stores under its own franchise.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jeevansathi turns profitable for the first time in 10 yrs
article: Matrimonial platform Jeevensathi has turned profitable at the operating level in the first quarter of 2016-17, a first for the company in 10 years. The platform clocked in ₹65 lakh in earnings before interest and taxes during the first quarter of the current financial year. The revenue grew 34% y-o-y from ₹10.9 crore to ₹14.6 crore in FY 2016-17.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 'Ok Google, bad job of copy editing', tweets Paytm Founder
article: Following Google Pixel's advertisement in Times of India newspaper depicting its Google Assistant giving out incorrect information, Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma shared a picture of the ad with, "Ok Google, bad job of copy editing." A user tweeted, "Agency will now get bajaoed for this goof," while another said, "Robot let down by human!"

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup unveils self-driving garden cleaning robot
article: A New York-based startup has unveiled 'Kobi', a $4,000 fully self-driving robot that can cut grass, collect leaves, and clear snow from the garden. The robot can also be controlled by the owner through a dedicated smartphone app. The robot, which travels at a speed of 3 kmph, automatically docks itself to the charging station when its battery gets drained.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup's first electric car to rival Tesla's Model S
article: Silicon Valley startup Atieva's first electric car, to be unveiled in December 2016, reportedly resembles rival Tesla's Model S sedan. The car, which will be called 'Atvus', will be a four-door sedan, like a Model S. Earlier in September, the company's deputy general manager had revealed that the car will accelerate from 0-100 kmph in under three seconds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Only 9 startups became unicorns in Q3 2016
article: During the third quarter of this year, only nine startups became unicorns or billion-dollar ventures, including Hike messenger, founded by Sunil Bharti Mittal's son Kavin Bharti Mittal. During the period, 35 unicorns raised a collective $8.38 billion from 38 funding events compared to $17 billion funding through 61 events last year. While one startup went for IPO, two were acquired.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber hikes fares by up to 100% in Delhi NCR
article: Ride-hailing app Uber on Friday announced a hike of up to 100% for trips exceeding 20 km in Delhi NCR. From now after 20 km, riders will be a charged a higher fare of ₹12/km on UberGO rides and ₹13/km on UberX rides. Uber's new rates are similar to what Ola charges for longer trips.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber to allow Mumbai users to book Porsches on Oct 16
article: Ride-hailing app Uber has partnered with German sports car maker Porsche to allow its Mumbai users to book the car between 2 pm to 4 pm on October 16, 2016. Porsche rides will be available under a 'Supercar' option in the app. Selected riders will also get a chance to experience Porsche's Boxster roadster and win Uber's 'Swag Baskets'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Disability rights group sues Uber over wheelchair access
article: A Chicago disability rights group has sued Uber over wheelchair accessibility, arguing that its adherence to disability laws “ranges from token to non-existent”. The lawsuit seeks Uber to comply with the Americans With Disabilities Act, by making more wheelchair-accessible vehicles available. Uber previously said that it doesn't come under the Act as it's a technology company.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indian entrepreneur in Silicon Valley rides auto to office
article: Silicon Valley's web-based research technology company, QuestionPro's CEO Vivek Bhaskaran rides an autorickshaw to his office. "It's a great conversation starter. The minute someone sees it there's a big smile on their face because it looks out of place here,” says Bhaskaran. He imported two autorickshaws from Pune and asks everyone on board to wear a helmet during a ride.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyperloop One raises $50 mn, hires former Uber CFO
article: American transportation technology company Hyperloop One on Thursday raised $50 million (₹334 crore) in a fresh round of funding led by Dubai-based DP World Group. The startup also hired former Uber Chief Financial Officer Brent Callinicos as a full-time strategic adviser. Hyperloop One will reportedly conduct a full-scale test of a Hyperloop system in the first quarter of 2017.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Why we shutdown our dating app: dateIITians Co-founder
article: Layak Singh, Co-founder of Indian dating platforms dateIITians and COGXIO, founded in 2011 and 2014 respectively, has written a post explaining why the startups were shut. "Our assumptions were proved false and we did not achieve the growth we were expecting," wrote Singh. He also cited lack of funding and customer retention as the reasons behind their shutdown.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Google's Rajan Anandan backs women health tracker startup
article: Google Southeast Asia and India Vice-President Rajan Anandan has invested an undisclosed amount in Bengaluru-based women's health tracker startup Maya. Founded in 2012, Maya helps women to keep track of their menstrual and physiological health through a connected mobile application. The startup had raised ₹5 crore seed funding from Prime Venture Partners earlier this year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ola to raise $500m from SoftBank, General Motors: Report
article: Indian cab-hailing startup Ola is reportedly in talks with existing investor SoftBank and American automaker General Motors among others to raise $500 million in a fresh round of funding. Ola had raised $57.3 million in Series G round of funding in December 2015 from an unknown investor and, has raised a total of $1.23 billion so far.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ex-Flipkart CPO Punit Soni backs co-working space Innov8
article: Flipkart's former Chief Product Officer Punit Soni has invested an undisclosed amount in Innov8, a Delhi-based co-working space. Innov8's Founder Ritesh Malik said that the company has raised money from 20 other investors besides Soni. Innov8 is one of the three Indian companies selected by Silicon Valley incubator Y Combinator, for its summer batch of 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup to launch 50 satellites to monitor Earth every day
article: Japanese startup Axelspace is working on project 'AxelGlobe', a constellation of 50 satellites equipped with imaging sensors, that will monitor the Earth every day. The startup will take six years to complete the project. Axelspace will provide a paid access to the collected data, that can be used to detect changes in specific areas of Earth and track crop growth.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon's 'Global Store' allows buying products from US
article: Amazon India has launched a 'Global Store' on its platform, that allows users to buy products from the company's US online store. The store has 4 million products across 12 categories including apparel, home appliances and books, said Amazon India's Country Manager Amit Agarwal. He added that more products will be added to the store over the next few months.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: API-testing platform Postman raises ₹46.6 crore
article: Bengaluru-based startup Postman, which offers users a testing platform for APIs, on Thursday raised ₹46.6 crore in Series A funding round from existing investor Nexus Venture Partners. Founded in 2014, Postman claims 30 lakh active installations and over 15 lakh active monthly users. Nexus Venture Partners had also invested ₹6.6 crore in the startup in May 2015.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup aims to immediately refund money after online return
article: California-based startup Returnly, which aims to refund customers' money immediately after returning an online purchase, raised $3.2 million (₹21 crore) in seed funding on Thursday. Returnly puts customers' money in an online wallet that can be used for repurchases from the same brand that has been returned. Once the retailer receives the returned item, money is refunded in customer's account.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Campsite aggregator Deyor Adventures raises ₹3.3 crore
article: Campsite aggregator Deyor Adventures said it has raised $500,000 (nearly ₹3.3 crore) in its latest round of funding. Founded in January 2016, the company provides alternative accommodation such as tents, cottages and tree houses through its mobile application and website along with booking location-based adventure activities. The startup had raised an undisclosed amount of funding in July.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Facebook's Oculus acquires low-power LED display maker
article: Facebook-owned virtual reality (VR) firm Oculus has acquired InfiniLED, an Irish startup that manufactures low-power LED displays. Founded in 2010, InfiniLED specialises in ILED (inorganic LED), which could replace OLED and plasma by offering greater power efficiency at a lower cost. Earlier, Oculus had acquired the company that designed Microsoft's Xbox 360 controller, among other acquisitions.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Game engine startup fires almost all employees
article: San Francisco-based game development platform MaxPlay has terminated almost all of its 70-member workforce. This comes after the company ran out of funds after a failed transaction aiming to push its MaxCore game engine to the market, according to CEO Sinjin Bain. He added that the company will now focus on licensing its technology to others.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Mobile marketing startup mParticle raises $17.5M
article: New York-based mobile marketing startup mParticle has raised $17.5 million in Series B round of funding, the company announced on Friday. The funding round was led by Bain Capital Ventures, with participation from Social Capital. Founded in 2013, the startup helps marketers collect user data through various services and channels that data to other marketing and analytics platforms.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Uber invests ₹200 cr in Mumbai car leasing firm
article: Taxi aggregator Uber has reportedly invested around ₹200 crore in Mumbai-based car leasing firm Xchange Leasing India, between June and September this year. This comes after it earlier invested around ₹43 crore in the firm. This can help Uber retain drivers exclusively on their platform, as they are offered an option to own a leased car after an initial period.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Indian School Finance Company raises $6 mn
article: Hyderabad-based private lender Indian School Finance Company (ISFC) has secured $6 million in a Series A round of funding led by Atlanta-based social venture capital firm Gray Matters Capital. The company plans to use the funds to increase its loan ticket size and expand its client base. ISFC started operations in 2008 to help infrastructure improvement in educational institutions.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Amazon has done in 3yrs what rivals couldn't in 10: Agarwal
article: E-commerce major Amazon India Chief Amit Agarwal said the firm has accomplished in three years what rivals hadn’t in 10, despite launching earlier and acquiring many companies. "We’ve grown 135%...year-over-year in every quarter (this year), against flat growth for others," he said. This follows Flipkart CEO Binny Bansal's comments that Amazon misjudged customers’ needs in the festive sale.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Can run sale on hing and churan: Amazon to Flipkart
article: Following Flipkart's comments on selling FMCG products, e-commerce major Amazon India's CEO Amit Agarwal said, "You can run sale on hing, churan, besan and bournvita anytime.” According to Agarwal, people are now switching to e-commerce for everyday things. Earlier, Flipkart CEO Binny Bansal had said that during the festive sale, Amazon's sale of groceries helped inflates its numbers.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Baidu sets up $3 bn internet investment fund
article: Chinese web services company Baidu said on Wednesday that it has established a 20 billion yuan ($3 billion) investment fund, Baidu Capital. Investments will focus on mid and late-stage deals in the internet sector, with individual funding amounts ranging from $50 million to $100 million, the company said. The fund will have two-three managing partners, Baidu added.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Tesla’s Autopilot a “hazard”: German report
article: A study by a Germany-based institute has reportedly found that the autopilot feature of Tesla Model S constitutes a "considerable traffic hazard." The study, however, was reported to be an internal one and did not represent final evaluation. Tesla CEO Musk responded by saying that reports were "not actually based on science," adding, "Autopilot is safer than manually driven cars."

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Google Pixel listed on Flipkart ahead of pre-order
article: Online retailer Flipkart has listed variants of Google Pixel smartphone on its website, before its scheduled pre-order in India from October 13. Pixel's 32GB black and silver colour variants, which have a 5-inch display and Qualcomm Snapdragon 821 chipset, are listed at ₹57,000. Pixel XL, the bigger size variant with a 5.5-inch display, is priced at ₹67,000.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Startup Eduwizards slams investors over funding pull back
article: Online tutoring platform Eduwizards has claimed that the company's main investor Gautam Dalmia (MD of Dalmia Cement) pulled back on the commitment of ₹20 crore made to the startup in 2014. The investor, however, argued that the performance of the startup has been unsatisfactory, which caused the pullback. The investors only invested ₹9.68 crore in the company, the founder alleged.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Bengaluru-based startup inks ₹650 cr deal with Peruvian army
article: Bengaluru-based imaging-design startup, Tonbo Imaging has reportedly entered into a $100 million (around ₹650 crore) contract with the Peruvian army. The startup will manufacture and export 'night-vision sights' for the army's weapons. Tonbo Imaging designs and builds advanced imaging and sensor systems to sense, understand and control complex environments.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: TV streaming service Yupp TV secures ₹330 crore funding
article: Internet-based TV streaming service provider Yupp TV has secured $50 million (nearly ₹330 crore) in a Series B round of funding led by Emerald Media. Founded in 2006, YuppTV is an over-the-top (OTT) Internet Pay TV platform, reaching over 400 million households worldwide. YuppTV services are accessible on multiple Internet enabled devices like smart TVs, smartphones and tablets.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Investor sues Theranos for “series of lies”
article: Hedge fund Partner Fund Management LP has filed a lawsuit against biotech startup Theranos and its Founder Elizabeth Holmes for allegedly lying to attract its nearly $100 million investment. The lawsuit claims that Theranos deceived executives into investing by claiming it had "proprietary technologies that worked." The startup, however, dismissed the charges as 'without merit.'

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Tesla to unveil new product on October 17
article: Making an announcement about an upcoming 'unexpected' product, Tesla CEO and Founder Elon Musk tweeted, "Tesla product unveiling on the 17th (unexpected by most), followed by Tesla/SolarCity on the 28th." Musk previously teased the October 28 event, saying it would include the unveiling of joint products from both the electric car and the solar energy companies.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Musk responds to coal-mining CEO calling Tesla a fraud
article: Responding to criticism of his company by the CEO of a coal mining corporation, Tesla's Elon Musk tweeted, "Real fraud going on is denial of climate science. As for "subsidies", Tesla gets pennies on dollar vs coal. How about we both go to zero?" The CEO had called Tesla a fraud for taking subsidies and failing to turn enough profits.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Uber plans bus, mini-van ride sharing service in India
article: Uber reportedly plans to launch ride-hailing services for buses and mini-vans in India under a new service named Uber Everything. The pooled ride-sharing service for buses will start as a pilot project and be overseen by Uber's India technical centre in Bangalore. The company has earlier experimented with scheduled bus service under UberHop.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Startup gives newborn baby girls free ride back home
article: Self-drive car rental company Revv has come up with an initiative to honour the birth of a girl child, through which the parents of a newborn girl child can get a free car ride back home in an exclusively decorated car. The offer is available in three cities, Delhi NCR, Hyderabad and Bengaluru and will continue till October 14.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Indian Oil Corporation launches ₹26cr fund for startups
article: Indian Oil Corporation has reportedly launched an initiative to nurture tech-driven startups and has set aside a fund of $4 million (around ₹26 crore) for the same. The startups need to be focussed on environment protection, social relevance and should have a significant business potential to be eligible for the programme, as per the official statement.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Mahindra MOJO motorcycle available online at Paytm
article: Automaker Mahindra Two Wheelers and e-commerce platform Paytm have entered into a partnership to make the Mahindra MOJO motorcycle available online. Mahindra has opened the first two-wheeler brand store on Paytm, listing the Mahindra MOJO. The automobile manufacturer has also launched an introductory benefit of a Magnetic Tank Bag on every purchase of MOJO made through Paytm.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Pre-orders go live for $199 Oculus Touch motion controllers
article: Oculus is now taking pre-orders for their Touch motion controllers that bring your hands and body into VR on their Rift headset. The company announced details regarding the controllers, including the $199 price and December 6 ship date, at their Oculus Connect developers conference last week. There are 35 new games also launching on December 6.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: World Economic Forum to set up tech-focused hub in SF
article: With the increasing role of technology in the global economy, the World Economic Forum is establishing a new center in San Francisco to connect tech companies and policymakers. The new facility will focus on bringing government officials and tech companies together to create frameworks for more productive legislative policies that can be implemented worldwide.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: France’s Navya raises $34M for its self-driving shuttle bus
article: Navya, a startup out of France that makes driverless shuttles, has raised $34 million in funding to build self-driving shuttle busses. The funding is coming from two strategic backers, public transportation provider Keolis and automotive parts group Valeo, along with Qatari investors Group8. Navya is not disclosing its valuation but one report from Funderbeam estimates it at $222 million.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Food-tech start-up Holachef in talks to raise $6 million
article: Food-tech start-up Holachef is in talks to raise $6 million in its latest round of venture capital fundraising, led by existing investor Kalaari Capital, two people aware of the development said to LiveMint. Mumbai-based Holachef, which was launched by Saurabh Saxena and Anil Gelra in 2014, delivers home-cooked food to customers. The startup has a presence in Mumbai and Pune.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Greylock closes $1 billion fund
article: Long-time venture capital firm Greylock Partners just announced its 15th fund of $1 billion, bringing the total to $3.5 billion currently under management. With 50 years of investing in the books, Greylock has backed industry leaders in the enterprise IT and consumer internet categories, including LinkedIn, Dropbox, Facebook and Airbnb.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Everwise lands $16 million led by Sequoia
article: Everwise, a startup focused on how to make professional development scalable, has raised $16 million in Series B funding led by earlier backer Sequoia Capital. The start-up’s primary focus has long been connecting online executives willing to volunteer their time with people looking for mentorship — from new entrepreneurs to budding sports coaches.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Biotech startup Zymergen nabs $130 million from Softbank
article: Bay Area startup Zymergen, which creates all sorts of materials from genetically altered microbes, recently raised $130 million in Series B funding. Softbank led the round for Zymergen and was joined by previous investors DCVC, True Ventures, AME Cloud Ventures, DFJ, Innovation Endeavors, Obvious Ventures, and Two Sigma.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Amazon to build convenience stores: Report
article: Amazon is planning to build convenience stores and develop curbside pickup locations for food shoppers in its latest move to expand into groceries, The Wall Street Journal reported. Amazon’s stores will sell perishable goods including milk and meats, the newspaper said, citing unnamed sources. Customers in the stores can also order other items with longer shelf lives for same-day delivery.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Rental matchmaker start-up HomeMe raises $3.2 million
article: HomeMe, a start-up which currently operates in several cities in Texas (US), has raised $3.2 million in its first institutional round of financing. The real estate start-up allows users to input their financial information and the company matches them with an apartment that’s in their price range and available to rent given their credit history.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Payfit grabs $5.6 million to manage French payrolls
article: French startup Payfit, which aims to modernize the good old paychecks in France, just raised $5.6 million from Otium Venture and Xavier Niel. Payfit officially started in April 2016 and so far, over 250 companies have signed up to Payfit, such as Heetch, Sellsy, Nestor or Aircall.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: US-based VenueNext raises $15 million funding
article: US-based VenueNext has raised $15 million in Series B funding from Causeway Media Partners to bring its venue management technology to Europe, and beyond the live entertainment industry. Using VenueNext apps, people can wave their mobile tickets at the gate to get into a game or concert, order food, drinks or merchandise to be delivered to their seats.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Only Flipkart can do something of this scale: Binny Bansal
article: Describing the recent Big Billion Day sale as a "flawless event", Flipkart CEO Binny Bansal said, "It is now clear that if anybody can do something of this scale, it is Flipkart." The company claims to have sold 15.5 million units in five days of sale across three platforms: Flipkart, Myntra, and Jabong and crossed internal targets by 40 percent.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Dhiraj Rajaram takes over as Mu Sigma CEO from ex-wife
article: Data analytics startup Mu Sigma's Founder Dhiraj Rajaram has taken over as the CEO from his estranged wife Ambiga Subramanian and bought back the shares held by her. Subramanian will continue to be a board member in a non-executive capacity. "She will support me in continuing to build my dream and will continue to be on our board,” said Rajaram.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Uber to help startups raise funds in 7 minutes
article: Cab-aggregator Uber has announced a startup initiative UberPitch, in collaboration with the Ministry of Commerce and Industry, which will let startups present their business idea to investors in seven minutes. The two-day event will be launched in November 2016 in 28 Indian cities. The three finalists will also get a chance to meet Uber leadership team at Silicon Valley.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart makes one-day sale record of ₹1,400 crore
article: E-commerce retailer Flipkart, which is observing the festive Big Billion Days sale, posted its highest ever single day sales by selling record ₹1,400 crore worth of goods on Monday. In October 2015, Flipkart claimed selling goods worth ₹2,000 crore during a five-day sale. "This indeed is a historic moment," said Flipkart Co-founder and CEO Binny Bansal on achieving the milestone.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Snap to launch IPO valuing the company at $25 bn: Report
article: Snap, the parent company of photo-sharing app Snapchat, is working on an initial public offering (IPO) that could value the company at $25 billion or more, the Wall Street Journal has reported. The company would reportedly sell shares around March 2017. Notably, this would be the largest IPO by a technology firm since e-commerce major Alibaba went public in 2014.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Samsung acquires startup founded by Apple's Siri creators
article: Samsung has acquired Viv, a startup founded by Apple's voice-based assistant Siri's creators Dag Kittlaus, Adam Cheyer and Chris Brigham, for an undisclosed amount. Founded in 2012, Viv is an artificial intelligence platform that enables developers to create a conversational interface to anything. "The deal showcases Samsung's commitment to virtual personal assistants," said Samsung.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Freshdesk, Zoho troll Salesforce at its own conference
article: Customer Relationship Management products Freshdesk and Zoho led ad-campaigns to troll rival Salesforce at its own CRM event, Dreamforce. Freshdesk launched campaign called 'Sorry we didn't launch earlier,' a satirical apology for users disappointed by Salesforce. Indian origin Zoho took to skies for its campaign with a plane in San Francisco writing out the phrases "#Outsmart Einstein. Zoho CRM."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bezos' Blue Origin rocket clears in-flight escape test
article: Jeff Bezos' aerospace company Blue Origin successfully completed its rocket's in-flight escape system test. While the crew capsule was safely recovered during the test, the New Shepard rocket unexpectedly remained intact and returned to the Earth. Prior to the launch, Bezos had expected the rocket to be destroyed during the test. This marks the rocket's fifth successful return to Earth.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: GoDaddy launches social networking app for entrepreneurs
article: Internet domain name enterprise GoDaddy has launched a social networking app for entrepreneurs named 'Flare'. The app allows entrepreneurs to share their business ideas and get feedback, advice and insights from other entrepreneurs available on the app. The app includes features like a top chart that displays 20 most popular ideas within a user’s community on a given day.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Silicon Valley startup's receptionist sits in New Delhi
article: A Silicon Valley startup has hired a receptionist who sits in New Delhi and greets visitors as they enter its office. The receptionist communicates with visitors through a digital screen, and a webcam attached to his device allows him to see the surroundings near the reception. Visitors at the office can hear the receptionist speak through a microphone.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra's Mukesh Bansal joins Swiggy, Rivigo board
article: Online fashion retailer Myntra's Co-founder Mukesh Bansal has joined the boards of food ordering platform Swiggy and logistics startup Rivigo, as Strategic Advisor. Bansal sold Myntra to Flipkart in 2014, and joined the e-commerce giant. He quit Flipkart in February this year and announced CureFit, a health startup.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Alibaba affiliate Ant Financial names new CEO
article: Chinese e-commerce major Alibaba's financial affiliate Ant Financial has appointed its President Eric Jing as its new Chief Executive Officer. The move comes ahead of the company considering to launch its initial public offering (IPO) in 2017. Notably, Ant Financial, which is worth at least $75 billion (₹5 lakh crore), is China’s largest online financial services company.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm appoints Madhur Deora as Chief Financial Officer
article: Online payments and m-commerce platform Paytm has appointed former Citigroup's Managing Director Madhur Deora as the company's Chief Financial Officer and Senior Vice President. Deora will be responsible for building, managing, and expanding Paytm's financial services business. Paytm is scheduled to launch its first payments bank during Diwali this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw invests in health tech startup
article: Biocon Founder Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has led $1.2 million funding in mobile-based health technology startup UE LifeSciences. Existing investor Unitus Seed Fund also participated in the funding. Founded in 2009 by Mihir Shah, the startup has made a portable and radiation-free device called 'iBreastExam', which performs bilateral breast examinations and claims to provide results under five minutes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal launches real estate sale on its platform
article: Online retailer Snapdeal on Wednesday launched a real estate sale on its e-commerce platform. The sale, which will continue till October 21, will offer apartments in Delhi NCR, Mumbai, Bengaluru, Chennai, Hyderabad, Pune, Kolkata, Ahmedabad and Jaipur, ranging from ₹30 lakh to ₹5 crore. In a similar sale last year, Snapdeal claimed selling nearly 150 homes in seven days.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Elon Musk responds to claim of following no women on Twitter
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO on Tuesday took to micro-blogging site Twitter to respond to an article pointing out that he does not follow any women on Twitter. "Guess how many women Elon Musk follows on Twitter? Hint: same number of people currently on Mars," said the article. Soon after his response, Musk followed GQ Magazine's Caity Weaver on Twitter.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart CEO Binny Bansal delivers iPhone 7 to customers
article: Flipkart Co-founder and CEO Binny Bansal on Friday hand-delivered the e-commerce company's first iPhone 7 within 30 minutes of its launch in India. Bansal tweeted pictures of him delivering at least three iPhone 7 devices to customers. He further claimed that "99% of all the customers are getting their iPhone 7 delivered within 2 hours of launch."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Theranos shuts down all its labs and wellness centres
article: American health startup Theranos is permanently shutting down all its labs and wellness centres and firing at least 340 employees, CEO Elizabeth Holmes announced on Wednesday. This comes after the startup made a new device 'miniLab', that claims to run 40 tests on 160 microlitres of blood sample. However, the FDA didn't approve the device over improper patient safety protocols.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Puja booking startup Muhurtmaza raises funding
article: Online platform to book over 140 pujas, Muhurtmaza on Wednesday raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding from a US-based HNI investor. Founded in 2014 by Sughosh Sowale, Muhurtmaza allows customers to book a priest online through its website and app for conducting various pujas including Grih Pravesh and Vastu Shanti. The startup also delivers things required during the puja.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Netflix Co-founder owns Facebook shares worth over $10 mn
article: Netflix Co-founder and CEO Reed Hastings, who turns 56 today, reportedly owns Facebook shares worth over $10 million as of September 2016. Hastings had bought shares worth $1 million in the company shortly after he joined as a board member in 2011. His current holding is estimated to be up from 47,846 shares in 2012 to 83,075 shares.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola provides flight from Bengaluru to Mysuru
article: Taxi-hailing app Ola on Tuesday started providing a direct flight from Bengaluru to Mysuru in collaboration with Karnataka State Tourism Development Corporation, aimed at the popular Dasara celebrations in Mysuru. Ola is charging ₹2,000 plus taxes per person for the flight. However, the flights will be available only to the people who win a contest being organised by Ola.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: 'Startups can raise ₹20 cr in overseas funds annually'
article: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Tuesday announced that startups can raise up to ₹20 crore in Indian rupees or foreign currency through external commercial borrowings (ECBs) in a financial year. Startups can help with economic growth and job creation by injecting innovation and competition, RBI added. Notably, India has the third-largest number of start-ups globally.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Food startup InnerChef raises $2.5 million funding
article: Gurgaon-based food startup InnerChef has raised $2.5 million in funding led by Japanese fund Mistletoe. Existing investor M&S Partners also participated in the round. Launched in April 2015 by Rajesh Sawhney, Sanjeev Singhal and Bal Dighent, InnerChef gives its users the required sauces, seasonings, measured ingredients and recipe to cook a dish available in their menu.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Career platform for women SHEROES acquires Gharkamai
article:
Online jobs and career community for women, SHEROES has acquired an online platform that assists professional women in finding work opportunities from home, called Gharkamai.
Launched in 2014 by Sairee Chahal, SHEROES is a career destination for women in India to find mentorship, resources and career content along with career advice and had raised $1.8 million (₹12 crore) in August.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 500 Startups launches $50 mn fund for Southeast Asia
article: Early-stage venture fund 500 Startups' organisation 500 Durians has launched a new $50 million fund for emerging startups in Southeast Asia. Launched initially with $20 million, 500 Durians has earlier invested in Uber rival Grab and social commerce app Carousell among others. It has backed over 1,500 startups worldwide with funds in countries like Mexico and India.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Sports education startup KOOH Sports raises ₹13 crore
article: Tech-enabled sports startup KOOH Sports has raised $2.2 million (₹13 crore) from existing investors including HDFC, Faering Capital, and Elevate Sports. Founded in 2010, the startup offers a training programme for children and works with schools to inculcate sports education at the grassroot level. KOOH has currently partnered with 180 schools across 50 cities, 80 sports academies in 25 cities.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Facebook Messenger tests Snapchat Stories-like feature
article: Facebook Messenger is testing a feature called 'Messenger Day', which is similar to Snapchat Stories. It lets users post photos and videos, with filters, that disappear after 24 hours. The feature was rolled out for Messenger users in Poland, a country with relatively fewer Snapchat users. The social networking giant had a face swap app, named Masquerade, earlier this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I am not at all anti-startups: Kishore Biyani
article: Reacting to his recent remark of 90% startups being nonsense, Future Group Founder Kishore Biyani on Saturday said, "I'm not at all anti-startups. We've invested in over 36 companies. For me, startups have to succeed". Biyani added, "There’s the Sturgeon’s Law that says 90% of whatever we do is nonsense...So that is normal...But startups should do value-addition to the economy".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Dhiraj Rajaram takes over as Mu Sigma CEO from ex-wife
article: Data analytics startup Mu Sigma's Founder Dhiraj Rajaram has taken over as the CEO from his estranged wife Ambiga Subramanian and bought back the shares held by her. Subramanian will continue to be a board member in a non-executive capacity. "She will support me in continuing to build my dream and will continue to be on our board,” said Rajaram.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Readwhere launches online test preparation platform Eduwhere
article: Online reading and publishing hub, Readwhere on Monday launched online test preparation platform Eduwhere. It provides free online mock-tests for recruitment & competitive exams like RRB, SBI Clerk, SBI PO, MBA (MAT, CAT), IBPS PO & Clerk, among others. The platform helps leverage data and machine learning to deliver targeted practice tests customised for each aspirant.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart makes one-day sale record of ₹1,400 crore
article: E-commerce retailer Flipkart, which is observing the festive Big Billion Days sale, posted its highest ever single day sales by selling record ₹1,400 crore worth of goods on Monday. In October 2015, Flipkart claimed selling goods worth ₹2,000 crore during a five-day sale. "This indeed is a historic moment," said Flipkart Co-founder and CEO Binny Bansal on achieving the milestone.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Build products to solve inefficiency: FreeCharge Co-founder
article: FreeCharge's Co-founder Kunal Shah while talking about startups on Saturday said, "Every time you cross an inefficient phase and take consumers to higher levels of efficiency, you've created wealth. Build products to solve an inefficiency". He added, "When I started FreeCharge...I asked people if they would use it. Only when there was 95% confirmation, I went ahead and built it".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Solar road tiles put on public test for first time
article: Solar road tiles were put on a public test for the first time by US-based renewable energy startup Solar Roadways on Sunday. Fitted with multi-coloured lights, the 30 tiles generate enough power for the fountain and restrooms in a public square. The startup is also live streaming the tiles on its website.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup raises $1.3 mn to make smart shower
article: Dutch startup Hamwells has raised $1.3 million funding to create a smart shower that recycles each water drop seven times. While the shower can be fixed on a wall, the reservoir that collects and recycles the water can be submerged into the floor. Connected to an app, the shower lets users stream music and records the quantity of water saved.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Samsung acquires startup founded by Apple's Siri creators
article: Samsung has acquired Viv, a startup founded by Apple's voice-based assistant Siri's creators Dag Kittlaus, Adam Cheyer and Chris Brigham, for an undisclosed amount. Founded in 2012, Viv is an artificial intelligence platform that enables developers to create a conversational interface to anything. "The deal showcases Samsung's commitment to virtual personal assistants," said Samsung.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: GoDaddy launches social networking app for entrepreneurs
article: Internet domain name enterprise GoDaddy has launched a social networking app for entrepreneurs named 'Flare'. The app allows entrepreneurs to share their business ideas and get feedback, advice and insights from other entrepreneurs available on the app. The app includes features like a top chart that displays 20 most popular ideas within a user’s community on a given day.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bezos' Blue Origin rocket clears in-flight escape test
article: Jeff Bezos' aerospace company Blue Origin successfully completed its rocket's in-flight escape system test. While the crew capsule was safely recovered during the test, the New Shepard rocket unexpectedly remained intact and returned to the Earth. Prior to the launch, Bezos had expected the rocket to be destroyed during the test. This marks the rocket's fifth successful return to Earth.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra's Mukesh Bansal joins Swiggy, Rivigo board
article: Online fashion retailer Myntra's Co-founder Mukesh Bansal has joined the boards of food ordering platform Swiggy and logistics startup Rivigo, as Strategic Advisor. Bansal sold Myntra to Flipkart in 2014, and joined the e-commerce giant. He quit Flipkart in February this year and announced CureFit, a health startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Puja booking startup Muhurtmaza raises funding
article: Online platform to book over 140 pujas, Muhurtmaza on Wednesday raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding from a US-based HNI investor. Founded in 2014 by Sughosh Sowale, Muhurtmaza allows customers to book a priest online through its website and app for conducting various pujas including Grih Pravesh and Vastu Shanti. The startup also delivers things required during the puja.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm appoints Madhur Deora as Chief Financial Officer
article: Online payments and m-commerce platform Paytm has appointed former Citigroup's Managing Director Madhur Deora as the company's Chief Financial Officer and Senior Vice President. Deora will be responsible for building, managing, and expanding Paytm's financial services business. Paytm is scheduled to launch its first payments bank during Diwali this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in fitness wearable maker GOQii
article: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata has invested an undisclosed amount in California-based fitness wearable maker GOQii. Founded in 2014 by Vishal Gondal, the startup has earlier received investments from actress Madhuri Dixit Nene and her husband Shriram Nene, and WhatsApp's Neeraj Arora. Tata has invested in many startups including Snapdeal, Urban Ladder and Ola.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Elon Musk responds to claim of following no women on Twitter
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO on Tuesday took to micro-blogging site Twitter to respond to an article pointing out that he does not follow any women on Twitter. "Guess how many women Elon Musk follows on Twitter? Hint: same number of people currently on Mars," said the article. Soon after his response, Musk followed GQ Magazine's Caity Weaver on Twitter.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm, FreeCharge Founders back payments startup Remitr
article: Cross-border payments platform Remitr has raised ₹6.6 crore in seed funding from Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma. FreeCharge Founders Kunal Shah and Sandeep Tandon,  Singapore Angel Network and other investors also participated in the funding. Founded in 2015, Remitr is a digital money transfer platform that enables its users to make payments and remittances globally.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Silicon Valley startup's receptionist sits in New Delhi
article: A Silicon Valley startup has hired a receptionist who sits in New Delhi and greets visitors as they enter its office. The receptionist communicates with visitors through a digital screen, and a webcam attached to his device allows him to see the surroundings near the reception. Visitors at the office can hear the receptionist speak through a microphone.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Theranos shuts down all its labs and wellness centres
article: American health startup Theranos is permanently shutting down all its labs and wellness centres and firing at least 340 employees, CEO Elizabeth Holmes announced on Wednesday. This comes after the startup made a new device 'miniLab', that claims to run 40 tests on 160 microlitres of blood sample. However, the FDA didn't approve the device over improper patient safety protocols.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal launches real estate sale on its platform
article: Online retailer Snapdeal on Wednesday launched a real estate sale on its e-commerce platform. The sale, which will continue till October 21, will offer apartments in Delhi NCR, Mumbai, Bengaluru, Chennai, Hyderabad, Pune, Kolkata, Ahmedabad and Jaipur, ranging from ₹30 lakh to ₹5 crore. In a similar sale last year, Snapdeal claimed selling nearly 150 homes in seven days.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MobiKwik launches short-term credit loans
article: Mobile wallet and digital payments startup MobiKwik has entered the short-term consumer loan segment. The startup claims that a loan request will be approved within 30 minutes and initially a loan of up to ₹50,000 will be available for the users. Founded in 2009 by Upasana Taku and Bipin Preet Singh, MobiKwik has raised $126.85 million to date.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw invests in health tech startup
article: Biocon Founder Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has led $1.2 million funding in mobile-based health technology startup UE LifeSciences. Existing investor Unitus Seed Fund also participated in the funding. Founded in 2009 by Mihir Shah, the startup has made a portable and radiation-free device called 'iBreastExam', which performs bilateral breast examinations and claims to provide results under five minutes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 10 Indian startups to take part in Japan's largest IT forum
article: Ten Indian startups will take part in Japan’s largest IT forum named Combined Exhibition of Advanced Technology (CEATEC), on October 4. The startups, who are developing solutions in domains like agriculture, logistics and industrial automation, will participate in the IT and electronics exhibition. The startups are getting a full-funded trip to Japan, along with an exhibition booth from Nasscom.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola provides flight from Bengaluru to Mysuru
article: Taxi-hailing app Ola on Tuesday started providing a direct flight from Bengaluru to Mysuru in collaboration with Karnataka State Tourism Development Corporation, aimed at the popular Dasara celebrations in Mysuru. Ola is charging ₹2,000 plus taxes per person for the flight. However, the flights will be available only to the people who win a contest being organised by Ola.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: 'Startups can raise ₹20 cr in overseas funds annually'
article: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Tuesday announced that startups can raise up to ₹20 crore in Indian rupees or foreign currency through external commercial borrowings (ECBs) in a financial year. Startups can help with economic growth and job creation by injecting innovation and competition, RBI added. Notably, India has the third-largest number of start-ups globally.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Food startup InnerChef raises $2.5 million funding
article: Gurgaon-based food startup InnerChef has raised $2.5 million in funding led by Japanese fund Mistletoe. Existing investor M&S Partners also participated in the round. Launched in April 2015 by Rajesh Sawhney, Sanjeev Singhal and Bal Dighent, InnerChef gives its users the required sauces, seasonings, measured ingredients and recipe to cook a dish available in their menu.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 500 Startups launches $50 mn fund for Southeast Asia
article: Early-stage venture fund 500 Startups' organisation 500 Durians has launched a new $50 million fund for emerging startups in Southeast Asia. Launched initially with $20 million, 500 Durians has earlier invested in Uber rival Grab and social commerce app Carousell among others. It has backed over 1,500 startups worldwide with funds in countries like Mexico and India.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Startup creates crayon wall art from photos
article: US-based ColorWorks creates crayon wall art from photos clicked by users. The startup has an in-house team of artists who use a palette of 173 different shades of crayons, using the tip of a single crayon to represent a single pixel of the photo. The artworks can be custom-sized, with prices starting at $69 for a six-inch frame.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: India's first electric motorcycle launched at ₹1.25 lakh
article: India’s first all-electric motorcycle 'Tork T6X' was launched by Pune-based startup Tork Motorcycles at ₹1.25 lakh on Friday. To be sold in Pune, Bengaluru and Delhi initially, the bike has a top speed of 100 kmph and can travel up to 100 kilometres on single charge. The startup has already set up six charging stations in Pune and Lonavala.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Burger Singh, MobiKwik offer 'surgical strike discounts'
article: Following news of Indian Army conducting surgical strikes in Pakistani territory, startups like Burger Singh and online mobile recharge platform MobiKwik extended special discounts. Promotional messages from Burger Singh and MobiKwik offered "fpak20" and "1STSTRIKE" coupon codes respectively. A call centre executive from one of the startups said that the offer "has now been called off".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Took us 100 meetings for acquisition: Citrus Pay Co-founder
article: Citrus Pay Co-founder Jitendra Gupta, who recently sold the payments solution startup to Naspers-backed PayU, says "It took more than 100 meetings for the CitrusPay team to finally decide in favour of the merger!" Commenting on acquisition, Gupta said, "I'm not seeing this as an exit. I'm seeing this as a partnership with Naspers to build India's largest fintech company."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Only reason to make money is to colonise Mars: Elon Musk
article: Space exploration startup SpaceX's Founder Elon Musk while revealing his plan to set up a human colony on Mars said, "The main reason I’m personally accumulating assets is to fund this." Regarding the plan's funding, Musk said, "I think the support will snowball over time." He is willing to spend his personal assets worth $8.6 billion to fund the plan.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart trolls Amazon, Snapdeal in Tinder style
article: Ahead of the festive season sale, e-commerce giant Flipkart on Friday trolled rivals Amazon and Snapdeal through a Tinder-style GIF. Titled 'Notice issued in shoppers' interest', the GIF showed a buyer 'pass' or ignore Amazon's and Snapdeal's sale, and 'like' Flipkart's sale. While Amazon's festive sale began on Saturday, Flipkart and Snapdeal's sale will begin on Sunday.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup puts free to use smartphone in hotel rooms
article: Hong Kong-based startup Tink Labs, which provides free to use smartphone in hotel rooms, has raised $125 million in funding led by existing investor Foxconn. The startup's flagship product is 'Handy', a smartphone that allows hotel guests to make calls, send texts and provides information about hotel services and nearby activities. The four-year-old startup has raised $170 million to date.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla on Autopilot mode collides with bus in Germany
article: German police on Thursday said that a Tesla car operating under Autopilot mode had driven into the back of a bus while changing lanes. The police said they plan to investigate "why (Autopilot) did not work". However, the electric car maker said in a statement that the collision was unavoidable because the bus swerved into the vehicle's lane.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Walmart in talks to invest $1 bn in Flipkart: Report
article: World's largest retailer Walmart is reportedly in advanced talks to invest up to $1 billion in Indian e-commerce major Flipkart and take a minority stake in the startup. Notably, both Walmart and Flipkart battle Amazon in retail. Flipkart's most recent valuation was about $16 billion, according to research firm CB Insights.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Men's grooming startup Beardo raises $500k
article: Actor Suniel Shetty-backed men’s grooming startup Beardo has raised $500,000 in seed funding from Venture Catalysts. Founded in 2015 by Ashutosh Valani and Priyank Shah, the Ahmedabad-based startup provides grooming products for beard to men. The startup claims to have crossed a GMV of ₹120 lakh per month and says that it receives around 500 orders a day.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Virgin Group staff shuts email for two hours a week
article: Richard Branson-led Virgin Group has asked its employees in the UK and US to shut down their emails for two hours a week, in a bid to improve their creativity. Running since June, the policy encourages employees to take part in brainstorming sessions, walking meetings and running clubs. Employees can also hold one-on-one meetings with their bosses during the break.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: I feel 50 pounds lighter without Twitter: Andreessen
article: Venture capitalist and Facebook board member Marc Andreessen has said that he feels "50 pounds lighter" and "free as a bird" after announcing a break from Twitter. On being asked how his Twitter followers were taking his silence, he said, "I think they'll get by." Andreessen, known for coining the term 'Tweetstorm', deleted his old tweets abruptly earlier this week.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Indian startup launches 'Blink' smartwatch at ₹12,999
article: Bengaluru-based technology startup Witworks on Friday launched its flagship smartwatch 'Blink' priced at ₹12,999. The device runs on Witworks' own voice-based operating system Marvin OS. Blink has a 1.39-inch screen, 1 GB RAM, 8 GB internal storage and can run for up to two days on a single charge. The company has opened pre-booking for the smartwatch at ₹2,500.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Startup makes iPhone 7 case to reintroduce audio jack
article: Texas-based startup Actual Innovation has crowdfunded the Fuze, an iPhone 7 case that contains a lightning port-to-3.5mm audio jack converter. The case, also available for the 7 Plus, comes with battery backup, and scratch and shock protection features. Priced at $69, the Fuze case is up for preorder and is expected to be available this December.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm Founder named 'Best Businessman' at GQ Awards
article: Online payments and m-commerce platform Paytm's Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma has been named the 'Best Businessman' at the annual 'GQ Men of the Year Awards 2016'. Sharma is the first Indian startup entrepreneur to be on the list. "It validates the efforts of the Paytm team to build India’s first $100 billion firm," said Sharma.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Elon Musk plans to generate fuel on Mars
article: While unveiling SpaceX's plan to transport people to and from Mars, the aerospace manufacturer's Founder Elon Musk has said fuel can be created on Mars with "relative ease". Since no rocket has ever been launched from Mars before, Musk has said SpaceX will build a "propellant farm" on the planet to synthesise Methane from the ice and carbon dioxide available.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Any similarity with events is coincidental, tweets MobiKwik
article: Responding to comments on its '1STSTRIKE' coupon, mobile recharge startup MobiKwik tweeted, "Any similarity with events or characters is purely coincidental." A user responded to a similar discount by Burger Singh with, "Don't 'FPAK', F your immaturity." Another user tweeted, "Can we stop outraging & order the damn burgers?" while another said, "More surgical strikes...more celebration discounts."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart offers ESOPs to over a third of its staff
article: Indian e-commerce startup Flipkart has handed out employee stock option plans (ESOPs) to over a third of its workforce, the company's Chief Administrative Officer Nitin Seth said. Seth added that it was a "very, very significant increase from previous years". Earlier, Flipkart had modified its variable pay structure for middle and senior managers to give less cash and more ESOPs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola allows Siri to book cabs for iOS 10 users
article: Ride-hailing app Ola has launched an update for iOS 10 users that allows Apple's voice assistant Siri to book a cab for them. The update also allows users to book an Ola ride through Apple Watch and Apple Maps. The users will just need to say, "Hey Siri, get me an Ola cab" to book a ride.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes 'iPal' robot nanny for kids
article: Chinese startup AvatarMind has created a three-foot robot nanny named 'iPal' to look after the kids aged between 3-8 years. The robot's autonomous learning engine helps it to remember the kids' preferences and interests in order to improve the conversation. It constantly takes photos and videos of the kids, which can be accessed by the parents on their smartphones.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google-backed startup fined $6.3 mn for deception
article: Technology major Google-backed loan startup LendUp has been fined $6.3 million by the US government for a number of deceptive practices. The startup has been proved guilty of misleading customers, hiding its true credit costs, and reversing prices without disclosing it to consumers. The startup has raised $111.5 million to date from many high-profile Silicon Valley-based investors.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: eBay India's new ad features a gay couple
article: Online retailer eBay's Indian unit has launched a new advertisement titled 'Things don’t judge' which features a gay couple, wherein a man goes down on one knee to propose to his partner with a ring. It also features men pouting for selfies and a salwar-kameez clad woman riding a motorcycle. The advertisement ends with the saying 'Live and let live'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Beyoncé invests $150k in tech startup Sidestep
article: Singer Beyoncé and the management company she started called Parkwood Entertainment, have invested $150,000 in the seed funding round of Sidestep, an app that lets users buy concert merchandise. The startup originally started selling t-shirts and posters for Beyoncé. Prior to Sidestep, Beyoncé had invested in WTRMLN WTR, a watermelon beverage company.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Druva raises $51 million from Sequoia, others
article: California-based cloud data protection startup Druva has raised $51 million in Series E round of funding, led by existing investor Sequoia Capital. New investors including Singapore Economic Development Board's investment arm EDBI and Blue Cloud Ventures also participated in the round. Founded in 2008 by Jaspreet Singh and Milind Borate, Druva has raised $118 million to date.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: VC apologizes for sexist remarks on women in tech
article: Venture capitalist John Greathouse has issued an apology for an op-ed he wrote suggesting women in tech would be better off if they hid their identities online. "I hurt women and I utterly failed to help, which I wholly regret," wrote the VC. The op-ed had said that women in tech "create an online presence that obscures their gender."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Writers' social network Kalaage raises funding
article: Social networking platform for writers, Kalaage has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Rajasthan Angel Innovators Network. Founded in 2014 by Raghav Sharma, Himanshu Agarwal, and Ravi Piplani, Kalaage's platform connects literary people with publications. Content shared on the platform can be directly published by magazines and newspapers present on the platform.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Firm raises $2.5mn to protect self-driving cars from hackers
article: Israeli cybersecurity startup Karamba Security has raised $2.5 million in series A funding to protect internet-connected cars and self-driving vehicles from hackers. Venture firm Fontinalis Partners led the investment, joined by existing investors YL Ventures and GlenRock. Karamba's software locks in factory settings of a car, and prevents foreign code and restricted behaviour from running.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: New device helps grow fruits indoors, without soil
article: US-based food technology startup SproutsIO has developed a device that lets users grow fruits and vegetables indoors, without soil. The device consists of a light source and a basin in which users can pour water and place their seeds. The device's mobile app then scans and identifies the plant to customise growing conditions. The product has been launched on Kickstarter.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Elon Musk reveals plans to set up colony on Mars
article: SpaceX Founder Elon Musk on Tuesday revealed plans to set up a colony on Mars, by sending humans to Mars for $200,000 in 80 days within the next decade. “One path is we stay on Earth forever, and there will be some eventual extinction event... the alternative is to become a space-faring civilization and a multiplanet species,” Musk added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Trip to Mars could cost same as buying a house: Musk
article: SpaceX Founder Elon Musk on Tuesday said the company was working to reduce the cost of a Mars trip from $10 billion per person to around $200,000, which is the median house price in US. To improve the costs by "five million percent", Musk has suggested methods like reusable ships, refilling in orbit, and using inexpensive methane as fuel.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mars visitors should be prepared to die: Elon Musk
article: Space exploration startup SpaceX's Founder Elon Musk, who on Tuesday unveiled a plan to send humans to Mars, said that people interested in going to Mars should also be prepared to die. "The first journey will be very dangerous, and the risk of fatality will be very high,” he added. Musk plans to send humans to Mars in 10 years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup creates 'NoPhone Air' that does nothing
article: A New York-based startup has created 'NoPhone Air', a mobile phone-shaped plastic package that has nothing but air in it. The product was created to combat the rapid decline of real-life social engagement that has stemmed from chronic smartphone use. It is being sold for $3 per piece to fulfill the constant need humans have to hold a mobile device.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk's SolarCity sued for intellectual property theft
article: Solar energy provider SolarCity, chaired by Elon Musk, has been accused of intellectual property theft by Cogenra Solar, a SunPower Corporation and Khosla Ventures subsidiary. The company has been accused of gaining undue advantage of Cogenra's technology that helps manufacture high-efficiency solar panels. SolarCity has responded saying that it had independently developed the technology.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Goods exchange platform Let's Barter raises funding
article: Delhi-based pre-owned goods barter platform Let's Barter has raised an undisclosed amount in investment from VC firm Scale Ventures. Founded in 2015 by Pooja Bhayana and Sahil Dhingra as a Facebook group, the platform lets users exchange pre-owned goods and services including electronics, furniture, passes and clothing. The barter platform was launched as a mobile app in August this year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Jugnoo shuts auto-hailing services in Bengaluru
article: Chandigarh-based auto rickshaw-hailing startup Jugnoo has shut down its pilot programme in Bengaluru which had launched in May this year. The startup is reportedly working on expanding across hyperlocal logistics in the B2B and B2C domains through its 'Dodo' and 'Fatafat' delivery services. Founded in 2014, Jugnoo claims 40,000 daily commuters, 3.5 million users and 12,000 auto rickshaw drivers.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon issued show cause notice over selling used phones
article: E-commerce company Amazon has been issued a show cause notice by the government for importing and reselling refurbished mobile phones in India. Other portals like Snapdeal, eBay and Olx have also been asked to stop the import of used electrical and electronic equipment (EEE). Companies are required to have the Environment Ministry's permission before importing waste items for reuse.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: An entrepreneur is never on holiday: YuppTV Founder
article: Udaynandan Reddy, Founder and CEO of online Indian content provider YuppTV, while describing his daily routine, in an interview said, "Even when I am not working, I am networking/ meeting people. An entrepreneur is never on holiday." The Delhi College of Engineering graduate added that while there are many challenges in the job, there is "nothing to hate about" it.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Video sums up Musk's Mars colonisation event in 5 mins
article: A YouTube video summarises SpaceX Founder Elon Musk's presentation on Tuesday in under five minutes. Musk unveiled the aerospace manufacturer's Interplanetary Transport System, which aims at setting up a fully self-sustaining civilisation on Mars within the next 40-100 years. He also outlined plans of setting up fuel farms on the planet to launch rockets from Mars to Earth.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startups can take long-term risk with Indian money: Nilekani
article: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani, while commenting on Indian startup scenario said, "Indian startups are not obligated to their limited partners, exits or returns to shareholders...They can take longer term risk. I'm very bullish on the Indian startup scenario." Nilekani further said that many startups wouldn't succeed but entrepreneurs gain tremendous experience and can go to another startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber, Ola start services for government officers
article: Ride-hailing apps Ola and Uber have started providing taxi services to government departments at special rates. While both Ola and Uber have registered themselves at government e-marketplace (GeM) to provide the service, Uber has launched a separate mobile app for government officials. The government departments currently spend as much as ₹40,000 on one taxi per month.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart, Amazon, Snapdeal to begin festive sale from Oct
article: Online retailers Flipkart, Amazon, Snapdeal and ShopClues are set to begin their festive sale from October this year. While Flipkart's Big Billion Day and Snapdeal's Unbox Diwali sale will be held from October 2-6, Amazon's Great Indian Festival sale will take place from October 1-5. In October 2015, online retailers did business worth nearly ₹9,000 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart to give less cash, more ESOPs to executives
article: In a bid to cut costs, Indian e-commerce giant Flipkart has modified its variable pay structure for middle and senior managers to give less cash and more ESOPs. The cash component of variable pay has been cut by up to 40% and replaced with stock options. This means the executives' pay will now be affected by Flipkart's performance and valuation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber rival Didi Chuxing invests in bike startup Ofo
article: Ride-hailing major Uber's Chinese rival Didi Chuxing has invested an undisclosed amount in Ofo, a bike-on-demand startup. The two-year-old startup operates almost 70,000 bikes across 20 Chinese cities, mostly around college campuses. Didi Chuxing recently acquired Uber's China business and is currently said to be valued at $35 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber working on small planes to travel within city
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber is researching building small planes to help commuters cover small distances within a city, according to the company's Chief Product Officer Jeff Holden. The planes would be able to hover, take off and land vertically, and would reportedly be battery-powered and more silent. Holden said that such planes could be in use within a decade.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: E-ink display for truck shows traffic jams ahead
article: German advertising company RoadAds and Slovenian startup Visionect have created a 32-inch E-ink display for the trucks to show traffic jams ahead in real-time. The display can also be used to show location-based advertisements and information like the distance to the next gas station. The GPS, 4G and Wi-Fi-enabled display can also be used to track a truck's location.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tweetstorm father Marc Andreessen deletes all his tweets
article: Popular Silicon Valley entrepreneur and the man who coined the word 'Tweetstorm', Marc Andreessen recently deleted all his tweets from his Twitter account, without citing any reason. "Taking a Twitter break!" tweeted Andreessen after deleting all his tweets. 'Tweetstorm' is a series of related tweets that are sent in quick succession which starts with a number and a slash.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Paytm acqui-hires edtech startup EduKart
article: Delhi-based online education platform EduKart announced that it has been acqui-hired by payment services provider Paytm. The company will absorb EduKart's 50-member team and its Co-founder Ishan Gupta will join Paytm as Vice-President of business. Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma was the first investor in EduKart.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jeff Bezos tweets 1st images of space tourism rocket model
article: Aerospace startup Blue Origin's Founder Jeff Bezos on Monday tweeted images of the model of rocket 'New Glenn' aimed to take humans on a space tour. The rocket is named after the first US astronaut to orbit Earth. Bezos showed the images hours after SpaceX Founder Elon Musk tweeted images of the rocket engine aimed to take humans to Mars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We know India has potential: YCombinator's Tim Brady
article: One of the top three startup accelerators in the world, YCombinator's Partner Tim Brady, while commenting on India's potential as a startup nation said, “We know India has potential – we don’t think it.” Brady added, "With 1.3 billion people living here...there’s a tonne of opportunity...there’s a huge pool of engineering talent...these things together make it an exciting place.”

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Startup makes mod to add camera controls to iPhones
article: Israel-based camera accessory startup Miggo has made the Pictar, a camera mod for iPhones. The device has a grip that allows the iPhone to be handled like a typical SLR camera, with features including a dedicated shutter button, an exposure control wheel and a zoom dial-cum-selfie-button. The $90 device is compatible with all iPhone models up to the 6S Plus.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola cuts 'Share' service fares by up to 45%
article: Ride-hailing app Ola has cut the company's 'Ola Share' or ride-sharing service's fares by up to 45% in seven cities. The highest reduction has been done in Mumbai and Bengaluru, where the fare has been revised to about ₹3 per km. The startup has also launched its Ola Share service in three new cities namely Chandigarh, Jaipur and Ahmedabad.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zomato acquires logistics tech startup Sparse Labs
article: Food ordering and restaurant discovery platform Zomato has acquired logistics technology startup Sparse Labs for an undisclosed amount. The two-year-old startup helps restaurants to track and optimise their in-house delivery fleet. Sparse Labs will be renamed as Zomato Trace, and it will help the Zomato users to get real-time GPS-based status updates on their orders.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Rolling Stone sells 49% stake to Singapore's BandLab
article: Singapore-based start-up BandLab Technologies has bought a 49% stake in the Rolling Stone magazine, in a bid to popularise the music and pop culture brand in Asia and other markets. BandLab Technologies is the first-ever outside investor in the 49-year-old magazine. Under the deal, a fully-owned subsidiary called Rolling Stone international will be established in Singapore.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Startup provides personal letter-writing services
article: 'The Indian Handwritten Letter Co', provides personal letter-writing services at a fee of ₹99, and has sent over 2,500 handwritten notes in 6 months."We want to turn handwritten letters into a lifestyle product and enable people to send letters the way they send flowers and cakes," said Co-founder Ankit Anubhav. Others startups like 'Letteramail' and 'Callyally', also provide such services.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Startup creates battery-powered personal flight system
article: Italy-based startup Glauco has developed a battery-powered personal flight system called 'Revolt'. The machine consists of a harness up front and four propellers in the rear, and is portable enough to fit in a small car. Launched on Kickstarter, the system is reported to deliver 90 kg of thrust, delivering performance equivalent to a 250 cc petrol engine.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Apple makes its first startup acquisition in India
article: Technology giant Apple has made its first ever startup acquisition in India, by acquiring Hyderabad-based machine learning startup Tuplejump for an undisclosed amount. Founded in 2013 by Rohit Rai and Satyaprakash Buddhavarapu, Tuplejump operates in India as well as the United States. As per CrunchBase, Apple has made 82 acquisitions since it was founded in 1976.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Sachin and Binny Bansal out of Forbes India rich list
article: Flipkart Co-founders Sachin and Binny Bansal have not featured on the Forbes 2016 list of India's 100 Richest People, after making a debut in 2015 with a net worth of $1.3 billion each. The net worth of the Bansals fell to $1.24 billion each due to multiple markdowns in Flipkart’s valuation over the last one year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber China drivers using zombie photos to scare riders
article: Ride-hailing app Uber's drivers in China are reportedly using zombie-like profile pictures in the app to scare riders and make them cancel their rides. When a ride is cancelled by the rider, the driver receives a small cancellation fee. Uber has started banning such accounts and is refunding the riders affected by the scam.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Deeply sorry that my actions impact Oculus: Co-founder
article: Oculus Co-founder Palmer Luckey on Saturday in a Facebook post said, "I am deeply sorry that my actions are negatively impacting the perception of Oculus and its partners". "My actions were my own and do not represent Oculus," he added. Luckey recently invested $10,000 in Nimble America, a company creating anti-Hillary Clinton memes and supporting US Presidential candidate Donald Trump.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat rebrands itself to 'Snap'
article: Photo and video sharing platform Snapchat on Saturday rebranded itself as 'Snap'. The company also forayed into the hardware segment by launching a pair of smart glasses called 'Spectacles', that take 10-second videos. "Now that we are developing other products, like Spectacles, we need a name that goes beyond just one product," said Snapchat's Co-founder Evan Spiegel.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon's share price soars over $800 for first time
article: After e-commerce major Amazon posted record profits for three straight quarters, the company's per-share price shot over $800 for the first time ever on Thursday. Amazon's cloud computing business also contributed to the surge in the company's share price. Amazon's $386 billion market cap is the fourth largest in the world, behind Apple, Alphabet and Microsoft.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Falcon 9 blew up due to helium system breach: SpaceX
article: Elon Musk co-founded aerospace manufacturer SpaceX said that its Falcon 9 rocket may have exploded due to a large breach in its helium system. The rocket exploded while launching in September, destroying Facebook's satellite that would've provided free internet across 14 African countries. The satellite's maker Spacecom is asking SpaceX for either $50 million in compensation or a free flight.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat launches smart glasses to take 10 sec videos
article: Photo-sharing platform Snapchat on Saturday forayed into the hardware segment by launching a pair of smart glasses called 'Spectacles' that capture 10-second videos. Priced at $130, the glasses will allow the video to sync wirelessly to a user's phone for sharing purposes. The camera in the glasses will use a 115° lens and the video captured will be circular.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Airbnb raises $555 mn from Google Capital, others
article: US-based startup that lets people rent out their homes to travellers, Airbnb has raised $555.5 million in latest funding from Google Capital and others. The funding has valued Airbnb at $30 billion. Earlier reports had suggested that Airbnb was attempting to close an $850 million round. Airbnb is on the verge to become the fourth most valuable billion-dollar private startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AskMe to shut down as investor Astro rejects buyout
article: Cash-strapped e-commerce startup AskMe is heading for a shutdown as its parent Astro Group has rejected the buyout proposal made by the startup's management. Astro has left it to the liquidator appointed by the court to find a potential buyer for AskMe. The startup in August had shut down its operations and fired all its 4000 employees and 1000 vendors.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mu Sigma Founder to buyout ex-wife's stake: Report
article: Mu Sigma Founder Dhiraj Rajaram is reportedly planning to acquire control of the Indian data analytics startup by buying out the 48% owned by his former wife and Mu Sigma CEO Ambiga Subramanian and private equity firm General Atlantic. According to reports, Rajaram is seeking funds from International Finance Corp and Apollo Global Management to buy the shares.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber drivers in US to share selfies to prevent frauds
article: Uber drivers in the US will periodically need to share a selfie of themselves before accepting rides for a real-time identity check to prevent frauds. If the selfie and the file photo of the driver with Uber don't match, the driver's account will be temporarily blocked. The move will ensure that the right person is behind the wheel, said Uber.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Apple partners Flipkart to sell iPhone 7 in India
article: Technology giant Apple has partnered with e-commerce company Flipkart to sell its latest smartphones, iPhone 7 and iPhone 7 Plus in India from October 7. Flipkart will source the phones directly from Apple instead of its third-party sellers. The price of iPhone 7 starts at ₹60,000, whereas the base iPhone 7 Plus model is priced at ₹72,000.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Lingerie retailer Zivame becomes private label business
article: Online lingerie retailer Zivame has bought its three private labels — Penny, Cou Cou and Rosaline into Zivame, and has become a private label business. "With this change, every product you buy will be created by us," said Zivame. The company was founded in 2011 by Richa Kar as an online lingerie aggregator.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New ride-sharing electric car to last for 16L kms
