article: Dutch startup Amber Mobility is planning to launch a ride-sharing electric vehicle next year called 'Amber One' which will have a lifespan of more than 16 lakh kilometres. It will accelerate from 0-100 kmph in seven seconds and have a top speed of 160 kmph. The company claims it to be the first car specifically designed to be shared.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Gol gappa seller accepts payments through Paytm
article: A gol gappa seller in Patna has started accepting payments through digital wallet Paytm. According to the seller, payments through Paytm are hassle-free when it comes to providing change compared to big currency notes. Inspired by the seller, several other stall owners in the area have also started to accept digital payments.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jabong's technology team joins Myntra
article: Less than two months after Flipkart-owned Myntra acquired rival Jabong for $70 million, Myntra has moved the technology team of Jabong in Bengaluru to its own facility. While the two teams will work separately, they'll be sharing infrastructure in the interest of cost efficiency. Earlier, Myntra CEO Ananth Narayanan had said both Myntra and Jabong would run as separate entities.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mobile repair startup Gadgetwood raises $6 million
article: New Delhi-based startup Gadgetwood, which offers on-demand repair services for mobile phones and tablets, on Thursday raised $6 million in funding from private equity fund Carpediem Capital. Founded in 2013, the startup claims to repair over 10,000 devices every month and plans on expanding its services to laptops, wearables and LED TVs, among others.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes Gangs of Wasseypur-themed pitch to investors
article: Indian entertainment startup Paper Weight has released a short film titled 'Keh Ke Lengey Funding' as a proposal for the investors to raise funding. Made on the lines of Bollywood movie Gangs of Wasseypur, it features the startup's team members and takes jibes at rivals AIB and TVF. The startup has dedicated the short film to filmmaker Anurag Kashyap.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Elon Musk to unveil solar roof with integrated battery
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk is planning to unveil solar roof with integrated Tesla battery on October 28 this year. The product is in line with Musk's vision of green homes that run on solar energy and use battery storage to help power systems, including charging electric cars. Tesla is buying renewable energy company SolarCity for $2.6 billion.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup develops electric car for on-demand carpooling
article: Danish startup Spiri has revealed a prototype of the electric car for its on-demand carpooling service set to launch in 2017. The startup has pooled talent from Aston Martin and Tesla to create the "lab on wheels". Spiri has claimed that through its system, the average passenger fare will be as low as a bus ticket.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber rival Grab launches self-driving car fleet
article: Uber's rival Grab has become the world's second ride-hailing service to offer self-driven cars on a trial basis by launching a fleet of autonomous cars in Singapore. This comes days after Uber debuted its self-driving vehicles in the United States. Grab has teamed with driverless software developer nuTonomy for the fleet, and plans a commercial launch by 2018.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba plans to launch world's first e-comm satellite
article: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group's shopping website Juhuasuan is planning to launch the world's first e-commerce satellite next year. The satellite will analyse agricultural cultivation and harvesting data to help provide people with the best vegetables. The company is further planning to develop a series of customised products with the help of satellite data.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes 29-pocket jacket that can hold 2 laptops
article: Steve Wozniak-backed smart clothing startup SCOTTeVEST has launched its 'Off The Grid' jacket which has 29 pockets and can house up to two full-size laptops. The water resistant nylon jackets also feature clear touch pockets to see and use touchscreen devices without removing them from pockets. The jackets, for men and women, are available at a starting price of $215.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Xiaomi plans to launch crowdfunding platform in India
article: Chinese electronics maker Xiaomi is planning to launch a crowdfunding platform in India that will help startups working on consumer electronics to raise funds and sell their products through the medium. Xiaomi already runs a similar crowdfunding platform in its home market China. "We'll have to change certain things before we can launch in India," said Xiaomi VP Hugo Barra.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Investor accuses software firm VSoft of ₹25 cr fraud
article: US and Hyderabad-based software company VSoft Technologies has been accused of fraud of ₹25 crore by its investor, Mauritius-based Peepul Capital. The private equity firm alleged that VSoft's CEO and his wife diverted funds to a company called Smart Staffing Source over the past three years. Previously, a Mauritius court had directed VSoft to pay ₹150 crore over other disputes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IIM Bangalore's annual business summit Vista begins
article: IIM Bangalore's annual business summit 'Vista' began on Friday with participation from over 350 colleges across the country to compete for prizes worth over ₹16 lakh. During the three-day event, students will be addressed by shooter Abhinav Bindra, politician Sachin Pilot and Railways Minister Suresh Prabhu. Competitions across domains including finance and marketing will also be held.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Shaadi.com loses case against rival over domain name
article: Matrimonial site Shaadi.com has lost a case against rival Secondshaadi.com, where the former wanted the latter to take down 'Shaadi' from its domain name. A matrimonial portal focused at widowed people and divorcees, Secondshaadi.com was launched after Shaadi.com. The court said that the word 'Shaadi' is generic and Shaadi.com cannot stop others from using the word in their domain name.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Alibaba IPO was bigger than Google, Facebook combined
article: Chinese e-commerce company Alibaba, which went public on September 19, 2014, raised more money through its initial public offering than Google, Facebook, and Twitter combined. These companies had raised a total of $19.76 billion together while Jack Ma-led Alibaba alone raised $25 billion, the largest in history. The e-commerce giant was valued at $167.6 billion immediately after the IPO.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Alibaba Founder Jack Ma's 1st web search was 'Beer'
article: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba's Founder Jack Ma first came across the internet in 1995 during a trip to USA and his first web search was 'Beer'. Believing “this Internet thing” was going to change the world, Ma founded the first commercial website in China called 'China Pages'. He later founded Alibaba in 1999, which went public on September 19, 2014.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bihar entrepreneur invited by Obama to the White House
article: A 24-year-old Bihar entrepreneur, Sharad Sagar has been invited by US President Barack Obama to the White House to a gathering of innovators from across the world on October 3, 2016. Sagar is the Founder and CEO of Dexterity Global, a platform for students to access information, opportunities and resources. Sagar has also appeared in Forbes 30 under 30 List.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart 1st Indian e-comm firm to cross 100 mn users
article: India's e-commerce giant Flipkart on Wednesday announced crossing 100 million registered customers on its platform, becoming the first e-commerce company in the country to achieve the milestone. Launched in 2007, Flipkart has raised over $3.15 billion to date. "9 years, 100 million @Flipkart registered customers... so humbled and proud! Thank you!" tweeted Flipkart Co-founder and CEO Binny Bansal.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Video: Jack Ma's original sales pitch in 1999
article: A two-minute YouTube video shows Alibaba Founder Jack Ma delivering a speech to 17 friends in his apartment to introduce Alibaba and lay out his plan to compete with US internet titans. He raised $60,000 to launch the e-commerce website for small and medium-sized firms conducting business online. Alibaba went public two years ago on September 19, 2014.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Jack Ma started his career as an English teacher
article: Founder of e-commerce giant Alibaba, which went public on September 19, 2014, started his career teaching English at a university. “My pay was 100 to 120 renminbi, which is like $12 to $15 per month,” he had revealed in a 2008 interview. Interestingly, Ma himself learnt the language by acting as a free guide for foreign tourists in China.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: LeEco raises $1.08 bn to build electric sports car
article: Chinese technology company LeEco has raised $1.08 billion in its latest funding to make its first electric sports car. LeEco's Founder and CEO Yueting Jia claimed that the funding is the largest ever in the automotive industry to date. The company has already unveiled the LeSEE, a concept sedan design intended to be completely self-driving.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Firm makes real-flame candle that can be lit via app
article: California-based startup LuDela has developed a 'smart' candle with a real flame for $99 which can be lit, extinguished and controlled via an app. Branded as the "world's safest" candle, it auto extinguishes when knocked over and also has a timer and child lock. The battery-powered candle also ensures that hot candle wax doesn't drip.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Pepperfry raises ₹210 crore in Series E funding
article: Online marketplace for furniture and home products, Pepperfry on Wednesday raised ₹210 crore in Series E round of funding from existing investors including Goldman Sachs, Norwest Venture Partners and Zodius Technology Fund. Including the latest funding, Pepperfry has raised approximately ₹1,068 crore to​ date. Pepperfry was founded in 2012 by former eBay executives Ambareesh Murty and Ashish Shah.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ex-Snapdeal CPO Anand Chandrasekaran joins Facebook
article: Online retailer Snapdeal's former Chief Product Officer Anand Chandrasekaran has been roped in by social media giant Facebook to work for the company's Messenger app. In a global role, he will be working out of the Silicon Valley headquarters of Facebook. Prior to Snapdeal, Chandrasekaran had worked with Bharti Airtel, Wynk Music and Yahoo.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon makes users pay extra for popular items: Study
article: Amazon's algorithms make customers pay more for popular products and give prominence to items that benefit the company, according to a study by non-profit corporation ProPublica. Almost three-quarters of the time, products in the popular category were the ones that benefitted Amazon. The study claimed that customers pay 20% more than the lowest price on products recommended by Amazon.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Delhi man launches food startup 'Dalit Foods'
article: A former rebel fighter and member of the Dalit community, 58-year-old Delhi-based man Chandra Bhan Prasad has launched a food startup named 'Dalit Foods' with his wife to challenge the caste-based discrimination. The startup sells packaged spices, pickles and grains online. "I was born impure. But I have the right to sell pure," says Prasad.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Used car startup Vroom raises $50 million
article: US-based used car startup Vroom has raised $50 million in Series E round of funding, bringing its total capital raised to $218 million to date. Founded in 2013, Vroom sells pre-owned vehicles to both individual consumers and rental car companies. It also sells scrap or aftermarket parts from vehicles that cannot be fully repaired.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Swiggy raises ₹100 crore in Series D funding
article: Online food delivery startup Swiggy on Monday raised ₹100 crore in Series D round of funding led by US-based venture capital firm Bessemer Venture Partners. Existing investors including Accel India, SAIF Partners and Norwest Venture Partners also participated in this round. Swiggy has raised over ₹500 crore till date and is now valued at around ₹1,350 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Oracle buys Indian-origin Founders' startup Palerra
article: Computer technology major Oracle has acquired US-based cloud security startup founded by Indian-origin entrepreneurs - Rohit Gupta and Ganesh Kirti. The terms of the deal were not disclosed. Founded in 2013, Palerra raised $25 million from investors including Norwest Venture Partners and August Capital. Oracle has made over 100 acquisitions to date, but not many in the area of security.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal sets up a wholesale unit
article: Jasper Infotech, which runs e-commerce platform Snapdeal, has created a wholesale unit called E-Agility Solutions to buy products that will be sold to consumers directly through Snapdeal's platform. A completely owned subsidy of Jasper Infotech, E-Agility Solutions will act as Snapdeal's associated entity. It will reportedly cater to fashion brands that want to sell directly to e-commerce firms.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Startup helps new PC users navigate the internet
article: Netsaar, an Indore-based startup, helps new PC users across the country navigate the digital space by guiding them to the best websites on the internet and offering tutorials on how to use them. Netsaar filters online information to provide users with a list of ten most relevant and popular websites each in about 65 categories like banks, automobiles, and cooking.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber rival Grab raises $750 mn led by SoftBank
article: Ride-hailing app Uber's arch rival in Southeast Asia, Grab has raised $750 million in Series F round of funding led by existing investor SoftBank. The fresh funding has valued the startup at $3 billion. The funding is the largest raise for a technology startup in Southeast Asia to date.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla sued by shareholders over $2.6 bn SolarCity deal
article: Electric car manufacturer Tesla has revealed that the company faces four lawsuits filed by its  shareholders opposing Tesla's $2.6 billion acquisition of solar energy company SolarCity. The lawsuits allege that Tesla and SolarCity board members, including Tesla CEO Elon Musk, breached their legal duties as they own shares in both the companies. Tesla said that the actions are "without merit".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba launches trade facilitation services for SMEs
article: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba has launched a programme called Trade Facilitation Centre (TFC) to help Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) with finance, logistics and credit services. Alibaba has entered into agreements with Kotak Mahindra Bank, IDFC Bank, Delhivery, DHL and Aditya Birla Finance to expand the service in India. The company has been operating in India since 2007.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: IBM, IIM-A announce entrepreneurship challenge
article: Software giant IBM and Indian Institute of Management-Ahmedabad on Monday announced the Cognitive Entrepreneurship Challenge (CEC) 2016 to encourage young entrepreneurs to build business solutions using analytical and cognitive technologies, reports said. The competition invites startups and students from across the country, and will reportedly have multiple rounds till mid-November.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mumbai-based laundry startup DoorMint shuts down
article: Mumbai-based on-demand laundry startup DoorMint has shut down its operations in all cities. Confirming the development, the startup's Co-founder and CEO Abhinav Agarwal said, "We decided to wind up our operations because it is difficult to manage unit economics". He added, "We could not manage to raise another round of funding, making sustenance of operations even more difficult".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smartphone repair startup JustLikeNew raises $500k
article: Online platform for smartphone repair, JustLikeNew has raised $500,000 via LetsVenture in its second round of funding. Founded in 2014, the startup repairs gadgets like smartphones and tablets within claimed 48 hours. It also offers other services like free pickup and drop, standby replacement phone and after-service warranty.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: 'Fidget Cube' raises over $4.5 mn through crowdfunding
article: Fidget Cube, "a desk toy for anyone who likes to fidget", has raised over $4.5 million (around ₹30 crore) through crowdfunding platform Kickstarter. Created by Matthew and Mark McLachlan, the cube has "something to fidget with" on all sides, including buttons that click, spin, and flip. Available in eight colours, the "unusually addicting" toy seeks to help a person focus.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: New York record store holds Airbnb stay contest
article: The Rough Trade record store in New York has been listed on Airbnb, and guests can enter a competition to spend the night there on select weekends in October and November. The record store has partnered with American company Sonos to create a Listening Room featuring a curated selection of records, out-of-print music magazines and a Sonos sound system.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon launches men's fashion brand 'Symbol'
article: Amazon India has launched a private fashion label named 'Symbol', a western wear brand for men that has a collection of formal and casual wear. Amazon is reportedly planning to launch six private labels on its platform by the year-end. While regular brands get online retailers margins of 35-45%, margins from private brands can be as high as 60-65%.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon India losing $1 billion a year: Report
article: Online retailer Amazon's India unit is currently losing $1 billion a year, according to a new report by Bank of America Merrill Lynch (BofA-ML). "By 2025 estimate, Amazon India could generate $81 billion in gross merchandise value and $2.2 billion in operating profit," the report added. It further said that Flipkart will continue to lead the e-commerce market in India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Intel buys Indian origin Founders' startup for $300 mn
article: American technology major Intel has acquired Indian origin entrepreneurs - Mahesh Lingareddy and Mohammad A Abdallah's startup Soft Machines for $300 million in a cash and stock deal. Founded in 2006, Silicon Valley-based Soft Machines is a semiconductor startup. All the professionals at Soft Machines have become part of Intel. Until now, the startup had raised close to $175 million.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Unilever may buy Jessica Alba's startup for over $1 bn
article: Consumer goods major Unilever is reportedly in talks to buy Honest Company, a startup co-founded by actress Jessica Alba, for more than $1 billion. The startup, founded five years ago in LA, was reportedly valued at $1.7 billion when it raised $100 million in financing last year. Honest Company sells natural and organic household cleaning goods.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Alibaba becomes most valuable Asian listed firm
article: China-based Alibaba has become the most valuable Asian listed company, after its market valuation rose to $266 billion, Chinese media reported on Saturday. This came amid internet firms' rallying share prices due to booming business. Notably, Alibaba, the world's largest e-commerce platform, posted a 59% rise in revenue in the June quarter, the strongest since its IPO in 2014.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba fires 4 for hacking website to steal cakes
article: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba recently fired four of its software engineers for hacking the company's internal website to steal 124 boxes of cakes. A part of the Mid-Autumn festival, a box of cake is given by Alibaba to all its employees as a holiday gift. The employees were fired just two hours after the heist was discovered by the management.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon starts selling refurbished smartphones in India
article: Online retailer Amazon has started selling used and refurbished smartphones and tablets in India with a minimum of six months of warranty. It is currently selling professionally restored smartphones of several brands including Samsung, Xiaomi, OnePlus and Asus among others. These smartphones cost up to 25% less than their new counterparts.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Couple socialising app Milofy raises ₹5 cr from Accel
article: Couple socialising app Milofy, run by Bengaluru-based Futuron Systems, has raised ₹5 crore in seed funding from Accel Partners. This marks Accel Partners' first investment in a social networking app in the country. Launched in June 2016, the app lets like minded couples meet and explore activities such as outdoor sports and theatre across New York City.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bengaluru startup lets women design and order blouses
article: Bengaluru startup 'House of Blouse' founded by entrepreneurs Roopa and Rachana Reddy lets women custom design and order blouses in India, US, UK and other countries. The blouses can be designed on the online store of the startup. The store's website also allows women to see the variations of the design of the blouses live on a model.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Troubled startup AskMe's MD offers buyout to investor
article: Troubled hyperlocal e-commerce and online grocery startup AskMe's MD Sanjiv Gupta has offered investor Astro Group to buy the venture for the third time. Gupta has reportedly put the startup's valuation at less than $100 million for the buyout. The offer comes amidst the company firing all of its 4,000 employees and 1,000 vendors following cash crunch.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk good model of how to use Twitter well: CEO Dorsey
article: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey while recently addressing a digital marketing show in Germany said that Tesla Co-founder Elon Musk is a "good model of how to use [Twitter] well". Dorsey explained that Musk is constantly on Twitter, holds conversations, and also shares how he is feeling. "He's very open and using it to correct press," Dorsey added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IITs to favour PSUs over startups during placements
article: Following a series of complaints of startups revoking job offers to its students, IITs have decided to give early placement slots to Public Sector Units (PSUs) this year. The early slots have been allocated to PSUs despite companies offering a lesser pay package than startups. Earlier this year, IITs banned 31 startups from its campus placements.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Used car marketplace Droom starts selling new cars
article: Gurgaon-based startup Droom has forayed into the new cars segment, in addition to providing a platform for buying and selling used automobiles. The startup has tied up with brands like Nissan, Chevrolet, and Hero Electric for this purpose. Droom will reportedly also let users take a bank loan of up to 50% of the vehicle's pre-approved value.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon to open 'seller cafes' across 24 cities
article: Online retailer Amazon is opening 'seller cafes' across 24 Indian cities to offer on-ground help to the merchants on its platform ahead of the festival season. At the cafes, sellers will be helped to set up a new account for imaging or cataloguing, or any other issue they face. Amazon has added 20,000 new sellers in the last six weeks.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Most Lyft rides to be self-driving in 5 yrs: President
article: US ride-hailing giant Lyft's Co-founder and President John Zimmer in a blog post on Sunday said, "Within five years a fully autonomous fleet of cars will provide majority of Lyft rides across the country". Zimmer added, "By 2025, private car ownership will all-but end in major US cities". Notably, Lyft rival Uber recently launched the first fleet of self-driving cars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Women make smart device to help build good habits
article: San Francisco-based entrepreneurs Kayla Matheus and Laura Day have developed a smart device called 'Moti', which helps users to build good habits like exercise and drinking more water. The device keeps reminding the user to continue the good habit and gets angry or sad when the user breaks the routine. On completing the task, the device celebrates by emitting light.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes AR system to play games while climbing
article: A Finnish startup has developed an Augmented Reality (AR) system that turns climbing walls into interactive surfaces, enabling users to play games like 'Whack-A-Bat' and 'Climball'. The AR setup monitors users as they move across a climbing wall through a depth sensor, computer vision technology and a video projector. The mobile setup can be installed on existing climbing walls.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup develops world's first airbag for cyclists
article: Swedish startup Hovding has developed what it claims to be the world's first airbag for cyclists. Designed like a hood, the airbag inflates and provides shock absorption in case of an accident, and protects all of the cyclist's head. The airbag's sensors measure the cyclist's surroundings 200 times a second to decide​ whether it should inflate or not.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal warehouses to generate solar energy
article: Online retailer Snapdeal has announced green initiatives in which the company's warehouses operated by Vulcan Express will begin generating solar energy. Snapdeal added that the testing phase has been completed at the centres in Gurgaon and Hyderabad. The warehouses will produce nearly 1MW at peak through solar panels and generate 1.5 million units per year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup lets elderly book assisted-living stays
article: San Francisco-based startup Seniorly lets senior citizens book short-term assisted-living stays, ranging from three days to three months. The assisted-living is usually booked by travelling families, who need somebody to take care of their aging relatives. Launched in January 2015, the startup has raised $1.2 million in seed funding.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Women's job platform Sheroes acquires LoveDoctor
article: An online job and career community for women, Sheroes has acquired health counselling platform LoveDoctor for an undisclosed amount. LoveDoctor's Founder and CEO Avani Parekh will join Sheroes as the Director of Community and Empathy. Launched in 2013 by Sairee Chahal, Sheroes helps women find mentorship, career resources and corporate jobs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IIT-B's Eureka competition to close entries on Sept 28
article: IIT-Bombay's business model competition 'Eureka!' will stop accepting entries on September 28. The 17-year-old competition will help winning ideas to draft a business model, receive mentorship and win prizes worth up to ₹50 lakh. The finalists will get to pitch their ideas to investors and VCs including IAN, Microsoft Ventures and Unitus Seed Fund.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Solar-powered cover to charge e-readers made
article: French e-reader making startup Bookeen has launched solar-powered covers to let users charge the company's e-readers. The startup says the cover can power Bookeen's 8-inch Cybook Ocean e-reader for 30 minutes after an hour of charging in the sunlight. The solar-powered cover is priced at about $67, while the e-reader costs approximately $213.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: HR analytics startup inFeedo raises ₹1 cr
article: Gurgaon-based human resource analytics startup, inFeedo has raised around ₹1 crore in an angel round of funding led by Dheeraj Jain, Managing Partner at Redcliffe Capital, a UK-based hedge fund. Palash Jain, ex-head of Google India Core Operations, also participated in the round. Founded in 2013, inFeedo is a B2B employee engagement platform whose clients include MakeMyTrip, RedBus, and Nearbuy.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Digital key-copying startup raises $15 mn
article: New York-based KeyMe, which lets users make digital copies of physical keys in under 30 seconds, has raised $15 million in Series C funding round, bringing the company's total funding to around $50 million. Founded in 2012, KeyMe enables customers to save their keys in the cloud, and recover a copy securely using fingerprint scanning at any of its kiosks.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Startup provides service to rid office paperwork
article: A California-based startup, Pulpstream aims to get rid of paper-based forms at businesses, replacing them with mobile-based digital processes. The forms can be customised to a variety of businesses, and can be created by employees themselves , requiring no programming expertise to build. According to CEO Pankaj Malviya, this will enable professionals in the field to efficiently collect data.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: K'taka announces ₹8 cr-fund for state startup cell
article: Karnataka IT minister Priyank Kharge has announced an ₹8 crore fund toward the state's startup cell, in an attempt to boost Karnataka’s startup ecosystem. The cell has received around 1,400 registrations over the last two months, according to an official statement. "Our idea is to break into world’s top 10 startup destinations," Kharge said.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Paytm to invest $150 mn in e-commerce business
article: Digital payments platform Paytm is planning to invest up to $150 million to develop its e-commerce business. According to an official statement, the move, which comes after $60 million in funding from Mediatek last month, is to tackle competition in the online retail market, as well as to develop its new payments bank venture scheduled to launch this October.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Gay dating app owner to pay $1.1 billion for divorce
article: Chinese billionaire Zhou Yahui, who owns a controlling stake in the gay dating app Grindr, was ordered by a Beijing court on Tuesday to give 705.4 million shares of his company 'Beijing Kunlun Wanwei Tech', to his wife Li Qiong as part of divorce settlement. The shares are worth about $1.1 billion, making it one of the costliest divorce settlements.

author: Oxigen
abstract: Oxigen Wallet gives its users a chance to meet NZ cricket team
article: Mobile payments company Oxigen Wallet has launched the season 2 of 'Play The Host' on September 9. Winners of the month-long contest will get a chance to meet the New Zealand Cricket team. There will also be assured coupons for all participants worth ₹3,500 and more in categories including e-commerce, entertainment, travel and food.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Oyo Rooms incurring ₹46.9 cr loss per month: Report
article: According to a Financial Express report, Oravel Stays, parent company of hotel room aggregator Oyo Rooms, has been registering a monthly loss of ₹46.9 crore since January 2016. The report attributed the loss to high customer acquisition costs. The startup’s COO Abhinav Sinha has said that on an average, Oyo clocks 7-8 lakh monthly bookings, generating revenues of ₹19.2 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Gadkari wants Hyperloop to test-run train in Pune
article: The Minister of Road Transport and Highways, Nitin Gadkari while speaking about his recent visit to America, said that he has proposed Hyperloop to test-run its futuristic high-speed train in Pune. Gadkari has also offered free of cost land to the company near some ports. Hyperloop is working on high-speed transport that could run at a speed of 1,120 kmph.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 18-yr-old's startup delivers condoms in 30 minutes
article: 18-year-old Sirhaan Seth, has launched a startup called 'SMS Contraceptive', which delivers sexual wellness products including condoms and contraceptives within 30 minutes to the user's doorstep. The 24x7 service accepts orders through a phone call, a text message, WhatsApp and Snapchat. Currently active in Gurgaon, the service will go live in South Delhi in the next two weeks.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google shortlists Indian startup to send robot to Moon
article: Technology giant Google has shortlisted an Indian space technology startup named Team Indus to send a robot to the Moon under the company's Lunar XPRIZE competition for $30 million. If selected, the spacecraft making startup will become the first privately-funded entity to make a lunar landing. The startup's spacecraft is scheduled to launch at the end of 2017.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IITs invite banned startups for placements
article: Ignoring the recent verdict by All-IITs Placement Committee (AIPC) to ban 31 startups from placements this year, some IITs have invited the banned startups for placements at their campuses. Around 30 such startups including NowFloats and Medd have been reportedly invited for campus placements at IIT Delhi, Kanpur, Madras, Kharagpur and Guwahati.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: One red logo and jingle song is ₹200 cr, tweets user
article: Reacting to Snapdeal's new logo and ₹200 crore investment towards rebranding, a user tweeted, "One red logo and one jingle song is equal to ₹200 crore! They can fund about 200 new startups with this money #SnapdealLogo." Another user tweeted, "Investor: We're not making money. We suck at customer experience. Snapdeal: Say no more. I GOT THIS! *Changes the logo*."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: PayU acquires Citrus Pay for $130 mn in all-cash deal
article: In one of the largest fintech deals in India, online payments startup PayU on Wednesday acquired rival Citrus Pay for $130 million in an all-cash deal. Citrus Pay's earliest backer Sequoia, which invested $10 million, will reportedly earn a four-fold return on its investment. Citrus Pay's MD Amrish Rau will take over as the CEO of the merged entity.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Turakhia brothers to invest $110 mn in four startups
article: Brothers Bhavin and Divyank Turakhia-led technology company Directi is reportedly investing $110 million four startups namely Zeta, Flock, Ringo and Radix. The company is also planning to buy a 1 lakh sq ft building in Bengaluru to accommodate the company’s expansion plans. The duo's adtech startup Media.net was recently acquired by a Chinese consortium for $900 million.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indian startup introduces smart shoes in US
article: Mumbai-based startup Boltt on Tuesday introduced smart shoes, a range of smart bands, shoe pod sensor and wireless headsets at a technology event in the Silicon Valley. The smart shoes scientifically improve running and fitness levels by giving real-time feedback to the user through a dedicated app. The startup will begin pre-orders of its products in October.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ex-Google employee builds English learning app
article: A former product manager at Google, Yi Wang has built an English learning app called 'LiuLiShuo', which means 'speaking fluently', in Mandarin. The app uses artificial intelligence to analyse the student’s learning process and tailors the learning program according to his needs. The startup raised $42 million at a valuation of $200 million last year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber to pay riders $384,000 over misleading tip policy
article: A US court on Thursday directed Uber to pay $384,000 to 47,000 users to settle claims that it had misled users through its tipping policy. Users claimed that Uber charged them a 20% 'gratuity', but then paid less than half the amount to its drivers. According to the filing, Uber collected about $860,000 from these tips.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: George Hotz unveils $999 kit to turn car self-driving
article: The first known person to unlock an iPhone, George Hotz on Tuesday unveiled 'Comma One', a $999 kit that turns select cars to self-driving vehicles. The first product of his startup, named Comma.ai, when fitted into a car wouldn't require a driver to touch the wheel or the brake. Hotz will start shipping the kit by the end of 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google's Rajan Anandan backs edtech startup Stoodnt
article: Google's VP for Southeast Asia and India, Rajan Anandan has invested an undisclosed amount in US-based education technology startup Stoodnt. Founded in 2015 by Harvard Business school alumni, the startup provides guidance to students looking for graduate, undergraduate and other courses in the US. It also counsels students on college selection, interview preparation and visa-related queries.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber to divert part of China funds towards India
article: Uber India President Amit Jain has said that the company will divert a "significant portion" of the $1 billion investment it had planned to make in China towards India. In August this year, Uber sold its China business to rival cab-hailing company Didi Chuxing. Uber plans to increase the Bengaluru engineering team to 50 from 15 by year-end.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Jeff Bezos announces Blue Origin’s 1st orbital rocket
article: Private aerospace manufacturer Blue Origin's Founder Jeff Bezos on Monday revealed plans for 'New Glenn', the company's first orbital rocket. Named after John Glenn, the first US astronaut to orbit the Earth, the reusable rocket will be able to launch payloads and humans into the orbit. Bezos has said New Glenn will be launched before the end of the decade.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber launches first self-driving fleet
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber on Wednesday launched its first self-driving fleet for select users in Pittsburgh, US. Uber displayed a fleet of 14 Ford Fusions equipped with radar, cameras and other sensing equipment for self-driving. While a driver will always be behind the steering wheel, Uber riders will be able to see the car drive itself from the back seat.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hero's Sunil Munjal leads ₹82 cr funding in Nykaa
article: Online cosmetics and wellness products retailer Nykaa has raised ₹82 crore in a fresh round of funding led by Hero MotorCorp's Chairman Sunil Munjal and Marico's Mariwala family. Some of the existing investors also participated in the funding. Expected to be announced later this week, the latest funding will reportedly value the startup at ₹775 crore.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Uber partners with Maruti to train 1mn by 2018
article: Uber has partnered with India's largest automaker Maruti Suzuki and National Skill Development Corporation to create 1 million livelihood opportunities under the UberSHAAN initiative, Uber India President Amit Jain said on Thursday. Under the initiative, Uber will train drivers, and help drivers receive commercial licenses, vehicle financing, and leasing solutions, he added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla-SolarCity merger a walking insolvency: Chanos
article: American investment manager and short-seller Jim Chanos on Tuesday said that the announced merger of Tesla with SolarCity in a $2.6 billion deal will make Tesla a "walking insolvency". Chanos added, "The synergies are questionable at best." He further predicted that the combined entity will depend accessively on the capital market and will​ burn roughly $1 billion cash per quarter.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Startups turnaround in 1-2 yrs: Infosys Co-founder
article: Infosys Co-founder Senapathy Gopalakrishnan on Wednesday said the funding challenges faced by the startups are "temporary phenomenon" and they will see a turnaround in 1-2 years. Further, he added that a lot of new startups are coming up and India is the only country where one can get 7-8% returns.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sequoia to sell stake in eight firms for $200 mn
article: One of the most active VC firms in India, Sequoia Capital is reportedly in talks to sell its stake in eight companies in a deal worth $200 million. These stakes mostly belong to the non-technology companies that Sequoia has invested in. Sequoia currently has investments in 130 companies and has invested around $2 billion in India in the last decade.

author: Ankur Vyas
abstract: Raman Singh launches 'Start Up Chhattisgarh' project
article: In line with the Centre's 'Start Up India' initiative, Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh on Tuesday launched the 'Start Up Chhattisgarh' programme to encourage entrepreneurs in the state. The government also announced the setting up of a dedicated startup centre. Further, the startups can avail free electricity for the first 10 years and 100% subsidy on land purchase or lease.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber releases video showcasing its self-driving taxis
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber has released a video titled 'Pittsburgh, your self-driving Uber is arriving now', showing one of its self-driving taxis driving passengers in the US city. The self-driving cars are currently supervised by a human in the driver's seat. The fleet consists of 14 modified Ford Fusion sedans with sensors that use cameras, lasers, radars, and GPS receivers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal launches first ad after rebranding
article: Online retailer Snapdeal on Monday launched the first advertisement after its recent rebranding where the company changed its logo and introduced a new tagline 'Unbox Zindagi'. The 59-second commercial was shared by Snapdeal Co-founder and CEO Kunal Bahl on Twitter. Notably, Snapdeal has spent over ₹200 crore on its rebranding ahead of the festive season.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SAP-backed venture commits $1 billion investment
article: German software giant SAP-backed Sapphire Ventures has raised $1 billion in new capital to invest in tech startups and early stage venture firms. The company will set up a $700 million growth fund and a $300 million early-stage tech fund. The commitments bring the firm's total assets under management to about $2.4 billion.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup unveils 1-seater electric car with 3 wheels
article: Canadian startup Electra Meccanica on Friday unveiled its 2017 SOLO electric car which has three wheels and seats one person. The car can travel at a top speed of 130 kmph, accelerating from 0-100 kmph in under eight seconds. Priced at roughly $15,500, SOLO will be able to operate for 160 km on a single charge.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Zuckerberg foundation leads $50mn funding in Byju's
article: Ed-tech startup Byju's has raised $50 million in a new round of funding led by Chan-Zuckerberg Initiative, Mark Zuckerberg and wife Priscilla Chan's foundation. Existing investors Sequoia Capital, Sofina and Lightspeed Ventures also participated in this round. With Zuckerberg's foundation making first investment in Asia, Byju's has now raised a total capital of $150 million .

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Firm claims to make 1st Indian crossover electric bike
article: Chennai-based startup Volta Motors has developed 'Volta Zap' which it claims is the first crossover electric bike to be made completely in India. The bike offers a range of 60 km on a single charge and running cost of 7 paise per km. Volta Zap's battery can also be used as a power bank for charging mobile phones and laptops.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Elon Musk asks Twitter for help with rocket explosion
article: SpaceX Founder Elon Musk on Friday took to Twitter to ask for help in understanding the launchpad explosion of the aerospace manufacturer's Falcon 9 rocket earlier this month. "Support & advice from NASA, AFPAA (US Air Force) & others much appreciated", Musk tweeted. He also asked witnesses to share any footage they had of SpaceX's "most difficult and complex failure...ever".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ananya Birla launches luxury e-commerce startup
article: Ananya Birla, daughter of Aditya Birla Group Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla, on Thursday launched 'CuroCarte', a luxury e-commerce platform which will go live on September 11. CuroCarte will offer products priced at ₹7,000-12,000 curated from nine countries including Spain, Thailand, Morocco and France. Birla's first venture was a micro-finance institution aimed at empowering women in rural areas.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mumbai startup claims inspiring Snapdeal's new logo
article: Mumbai-based data analytics startup LogiNext has claimed that online retailer Snapdeal's new logo is inspired by the company's own logo. "We just inspired a Billion dollar startup. Check out the new logo of @snapdeal!" tweeted LogiNext. In a brand overhaul bid, Snapdeal on Sunday unveiled a new logo and tagline and committed over ₹200 crore towards its rebranding.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Note 7 battery caused SpaceX explosion, tweets a user
article: After SpaceX Founder Elon Musk took to Twitter asking for help to understand the recent Falcon 9 rocket explosion, a user reacted with a tweet saying, "It was a Note 7 battery exploding." Another user tweeted, "Aliens dude. Aliens", to which Musk responded with, "Nope, it wasn't me". "Do not exclude sabotage", tweeted another user.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal spends over ₹200 crore on rebranding
article: Online retailer Snapdeal has invested over ₹200 crore on rebranding, ahead of the festive season. This includes the new logo and tagline 'Unbox Zindagi' unveiled by the startup on Sunday. "The new logo, with two arrows forming a box, conveys Snapdeal's journey as partners and enablers, indicating progress, onwards and upwards," said Co-founder and CEO Kunal Bahl.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapdeal unveils its new logo
article: Indian e-commerce startup Snapdeal on Sunday unveiled its new logo as part of an overall brand repositioning strategy. The startup revealed the new red and white logo, which looks like a box, after posting teasers on its social media handles. In August, Snapdeal had said it would spend over ₹200 crore on a pre-Diwali campaign.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Amazon India's Cloudtail stops selling mobiles
article: Amazon India's largest merchant Cloudtail, a joint venture between Amazon Asia and Infosys founder Narayana Murthy’s private investment fund, has reportedly stopped the sale of smartphones via the e-commerce platform. The development follows India’s foreign investment policies that prevent a single seller from accounting for more than 25% of a marketplace’s total sales, reports added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in food tech startup Idea Chakki
article: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata on Monday invested an undisclosed amount in Delhi-based food technology startup Idea Chakki. The startup provides digital video menus for restaurants to present their food. Tata has been actively investing in startups in India and abroad including Snapdeal, Urban Ladder, Xiaomi, Ola and others.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Quikr launches real-time car tracking platform
article: Classifieds platform Quikr has launched QuickScanner for Cars, a system for car tracking and diagnostics in real-time. The system includes a plug-and-play device that fits into a car's OBD2 ports, and offers real-time engine diagnostics. It also offers features like GPS tracking, real-time engine monitoring for fuel efficiency and theft or tow alarm, via the 'QuikrScanner for Cars' smartphone app.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Instagram tells anti-litter app to change its name
article: British anti-garbage startup LitterGram has been asked by Instagram's lawyers to change its name as the use of "gram" could undermine Instagram's brand. LitterGram lets users share photos of garbage, geotag its location and report it to the local council. The use of photography and social aspects of the app have also been argued as being similar to Instagram.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Mahindra-Ola partner for sales, future vehicle design
article: Automaker Mahindra & Mahindra has agreed to a partnership with Ola to design future vehicles required by ride-hailing services in return for about $400 million in revenue, Mahindra Chairman Anand Mahindra said on Thursday. Earlier, Toyota had invested an undisclosed sum in Uber in a lease partnership, while General Motors invested $500 million in American ride-sharing startup Lyft.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm launches Aadhaar-based system for KYC
article: Digital payments and e-commerce platform Paytm on Monday launched an Aadhaar-based eKYC (E-Know Your Customer) service. KYC is a customer identification procedure followed by banks and wallet companies. KYC-enabled Paytm customers are allowed a wallet balance limit of up to ₹1 lakh, as opposed to ₹10k for non-KYC ones. Paytm is set to launch its payments bank before November.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Elon Musk calls SpaceX blast ‘most complex failure’
article: SpaceX Founder Elon Musk has called the explosion of the aerospace manufacturer's rocket "the most difficult and complex failure" since SpaceX was founded 14 years ago. A SpaceX-led accident investigation overseen by the US Federal Aviation Administration is currently underway, trying to understand why the rocket burst into flames on the launchpad on September 1.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart to hire 10k temporary staff in festive season
article: Indian e-commerce major Flipkart will hire about 10,000 temporary staff for its delivery and logistics service to meet an expected surge in demand during the upcoming festive season. This comes as e-commerce companies prepare to launch annual festive period offers. Rival startup Snapdeal also expects to create a similar number of temporary jobs between September 15 to November 15.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Google invites startups for launchpad program
article: Google has invited late-stage app startups from India, Brazil, Indonesia and Mexico to apply for the third class of its Launchpad Accelerator program. Under the program, startups will work closely with Google for six months, including a two-week all-expense-paid training at Google headquarters in Silicon Valley. Startups can apply for the program by October 24, 2016.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ford to enter bike-sharing, shuttle service businesses
article: American automaker Ford has announced its acquisition of shuttle service startup Chariot and investment in bike-sharing program Motivate. Ford will also set up a "city solutions" team to work with global cities to solve congestion issues. "We want to work with communities to offer even more transportation choices and solutions for people—for decades to come," said Ford CEO Mark Fields.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: PayPal ignores request from Palestine firms for access
article: American online payments platform PayPal has reportedly ignored an open letter published by 43 companies and organisations from Palestine, requesting PayPal to be accessible there. PayPal currently does not work for Palestinians in the West Bank or Gaza, but it does work for Israelis living in settlements in the West Bank, which are illegal by international law.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Flipkart denies laying off 800 employees
article: Indian e-commerce company Flipkart has denied rumours that it was letting go of 800 employees. "We completely and unequivocally deny any such move from Flipkart. This is completely false and baseless," said the company's Chief Administrative Officer Nitin Seth. He added that Flipkart was hiring more than 10,000 temporary staff in logistics to meet the demand during the festive season.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Airbnb to introduce new anti-discrimination policy
article: Online rental marketplace Airbnb is introducing a new anti-discrimination policy, proposing changes such as requiring users to sign a "stronger" anti-discrimination policy and allowing guests to book rooms without prior approval from the hosts. A 2015 study found that hosts were less likely to accept guests with 'names which sounded black', compared to guests with 'names which sounded white'.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Didi Chuxing gets $119.9 mn at $34 billion valuation
article: Chinese ride-hailing company Didi Chuxing has been valued at $34 billion after an investment of $119.9 million by a subsidiary of Foxconn Technology Group. Foxconn, the main assembler of Apple devices, has acquired a 0.355% stake in the startup through the deal. In May this year, Apple had invested $1 billion in Didi Chuxing.

author: Azhar Iqubal
abstract: Jessica Alba’s Honest Company in talks to sell
article: The Honest Company, the consumer products startup co-founded by actress Jessica Alba, is talking with larger, more traditional consumer packaged goods outfits for sell. Honest Company, founded five years ago in LA, was reportedly valued at $1.7 billion when it raised $100 million in financing last year. Altogether, it has raised $222 million from investors.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: 'Sewbo' makes first robot that sews entire shirt
article: Seattle-based startup Sewbo has developed a robotic arm that it claims is the first robot that can sew an entire article of clothing. The robot uses a non-toxic polymer to stiffen fabric to make it resemble cardboard, and the pre-cut pieces are fed into a sewing machine. The polymer stiffener is later removed by dropping the fabric in hot water.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Myntra CEO invests in ed-tech startup Makkajai
article: Pune-based educational gaming startup Makkajai has secured $250,000 in seed funding from Myntra CEO Ananth Narayanan, Snapdeal's former CPO Anand Chandrasekaran and Swastika Company among others. Founded in 2014, the firm develops math games for children studying in classes first to fifth. Other than India, Makkajai's user base is also spread over countries like Australia, Canada and Germany.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Ex-Apple employee's startup develops go-karts for kids
article: California-based Actev Motors, co-founded by ex-Apple engineer Tony Fadell, is preparing to ship its new product, an all-electric go-kart for kids aged five to nine. The vehicle, priced roughly $1,000, features a Formula One-like body kit in silver or red, and comes bundled with an app that lets parents limit their kids' speed, and keep them within a particular boundary.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Paytm founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma becomes billionaire
article: Following a sharp increase in Paytm’s valuation, founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma has become a billionaire with a net worth of $1.10 billion (₹7,300 crore), as per Hurun’s 2016 Rich List. Flipkart Co-founders Sachin Bansal and Binny Bansal’s wealth dropped to $812 million (₹5,400 crore) each, from $1.35 billion (₹9,010 crore) due to a drop in Flipkart's valuation.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 90% of startups are nonsense: Kishore Biyani
article: Future Group Founder and CEO Kishore Biyani on Wednesday said, "I think 90% of the startups have no meaning at all, they are nonsense." He added, "They are just building startups to sell them, there is no long-term goal." Biyani also criticised the business of taxi-aggregation and said, "They are not creating a new economy any which way."

author: Chhavi Tyagi
abstract: Ola apologises for charging a user over ₹83,000
article: Ola has reportedly apologised to Ghatkopar-based businessman Kamal Bhatia for charging him ₹83,395 for travelling from Mumbai to Pune and back. Blaming "server" for the wrong bill statement, Ola also waived off Bhatia's entire bill. Recently, a Hyderabad-based man had also received a bill of ₹9.15 lakh from Ola for travelling from Jubilee Hills to Nizamabad, estimated at ₹5,000.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Startup sues investor for stealing business ideas
article: California-based big-data startup Palantir has filed a lawsuit against major early investor Marc Abramowitz, claiming he filed patents based on the confidential information he "stole" from the company. Palantir's motto is "Save the Shire" and the company alleged that the investor also tried to trademark the word "Shire."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Airbnb host claims secretly filming guests having sex
article: A person claiming to be host at home rental platform Airbnb has admitted using hidden cameras to film guests having sex. On a secret-sharing platform PostSecret, the host further said that the hidden camera's sex videos are swapped with other Airbnb hosts. However, an Airbnb spokesperson refuted the report and said, "There is no evidence to support this claim."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Explosion may cost SpaceX $50 mn or a free flight
article: Israel's Space Communication company on Sunday said that it could seek $50 million or a free space flight from SpaceX. The company's satellite was destroyed by an explosion at the company's Falcon 9 rocket launch last week. The Israeli company said that it could also collect $205 million from Israel Aerospace Industries, which built the satellite.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indian startup lets families crowdsource baby's name
article: A Hyderabad-based startup called 'Name R Newborn' allows families to crowdsource their baby's name through its platform. At a fee of ₹1,500, families can start a contest where users suggest baby names based on the preferences provided. While the user whose name suggestion is accepted by the family gets ₹1,200 in reward, the startup takes the remaining amount.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyperloop track construction delayed in California
article: High-speed transport system developer Hyperloop Transportation Technologies (HTT) has not yet filed an environmental review application, delaying construction of the "world's first passenger-ready" Hyperloop track in California. In January this year, the company had said it would start construction in the middle of 2016. HTT CEO Dirk Ahlborn has blamed the delay on "bureaucratic processes".

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Snapdeal ex-CPO invests in real estate portal NoBroker
article: Bengaluru-based real estate portal NoBroker has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from former Snapdeal and Airtel CPO, Anand Chandrasekaran. NoBroker has so far raised $13 million in funding from investors including SAIF Partners and BEENEXT. NoBroker was launched in March 2014 with an aim to make real estate a broker-free space.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mercedes unveils delivery vans that launch drones
article: Mercedes-Benz along with drone-making startup Matternet on Wednesday unveiled 'Vision Van' concept, an automated cargo van with integrated drones. Vision Van's rooftop serves as the launch and landing pad for drones that can carry packages weighing 2 kg across 20 km. The electric van can load cargo and change batteries without human intervention.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Gurgaon-based Burger Singh raises $1 million funding
article: Gurgaon-based burger chain Burger Singh has raised $1 million in funding from investors, including Rahul Singh of Beer café and Rannvijay Singh of MTV Roadies. Burger Singh had raised an angel round of ₹2.2 crore from investors last year. Burger Singh currently has eight outlets in the city and is planning to scale up to 26 through its franchise-model.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 54% won't buy online without offers: Inshorts Poll
article: According to Inshorts Youth of the Nation Poll 2, around 54% Indians would not shop online if there are no discounts, and if the price of a product is same in the retail market. While 42% respondents said that they would shop online without discounts, 4% said they do not prefer buying products online.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes solar-powered bags that charge phones
article: US-based startup BirkSun has made solar-powered backpacks which can be used to charge smartphones or tablets. The startup claims the bag can generate 1% smartphone battery power for every 3 minutes that the solar panels are in sunlight. Priced at $249, the solar-powered backpacks are waterproof.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smartphone cover with in-built selfie stick made
article: An Israeli startup has built a $40 smartphone case called 'StickBox' that comes with a full-length in-built selfie stick. It slides out from the rear of the case and extends to a 28-inch long aluminium selfie stick with a button that snaps photos on pressing. The company is planning to launch another cover with light-weight carbon fiber selfie stick.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes smart belt that tracks fitness
article: Technology major Samsung's spinoff startup has developed a $119 smart waist belt that measures a user's waist size, counts steps taken and tracks sitting time. The collected data is available on a dedicated app for the belt, which also monitors overeating patterns. Made for both men and women, the belt has a battery life of up to 20 days.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Lenskart raises funding from PremjiInvest
article: Eyewear retailer Lenskart today raised an undisclosed amount from PremjiInvest, the private investment arm of Wipro Chairman Azim Premji. The latest investment comes four​ months after Lenskart raised ₹400 crore in Series D round of funding led by World Bank's investment arm IFC. The recent funding is said to have valued Lenskart at around ₹2,000 crore.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Bihar govt approves ₹5,000 crore startup fund
article: The Bihar government on Tuesday approved a ₹5,000 crore Startup policy to provide funds to entrepreneurs in the state to start new ventures, reports said. The policy is a part of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's ‘seven resolves’ and will be reportedly adopted as a governance policy. Earlier, states like Odisha and Telangana had announced similar policies to promote startups.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Cycling helmet lets users take calls, get directions
article: US-based startup Coros Wearables has developed 'Linx', a smart cycling helmet that lets cyclists listen to music, take calls, and get route directions. The water-resistant helmet makes use of bone conduction technology to transmit sounds wirelessly. Linx lasts for 10 hours on a single charge and can be connected to an app to track data like ride distance and speed.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon to invest in food startup Swiggy: Report
article: The India arm of e-commerce giant Amazon is reportedly looking to invest in online food delivery startup Swiggy. Founded in 2014, the Bengaluru-based startup was valued at an estimated $190-200 million at the time of its latest round of funding. According to the report, Alibaba-backed Chinese food delivery venture Ele.me has also displayed interest in investing in Swiggy.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup to let users dine at local’s home gets $4.2 mn
article: VizEat, a European startup that enables travellers to dine at a local’s home, has raised $4.2 million in a new funding round. Founded in July 2014, VizEat's platform connects those seeking an authentic local dining experience with hosts who are willing to cook and invite strangers into their homes.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: 54% Indians prefer working with a startup: YOTN2 Poll
article: According to the second edition of the Inshorts Youth of the Nation Poll, 54% of the 51,629 respondents prefer working with a startup instead of a large corporation, if given a similar job offer by both. Notably, in Youth of the Nation Poll 1, conducted in January, 68% of the respondents preferred working for startups instead of a large corporation.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New 3D-printing pen can draw with wood, bronze
article: Technology startup WobbleWorks has launched '3Doodler PRO', a 3D-printing pen which can print with materials like wood, copper, bronze and nylon. Elements of these materials are blended into the plastic filament used in the 3D-printing pen. The resulting prints smell like wood, shine like metal, or have a fabric-like feel which can be dyed in different colours.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: OYO opens hospitality training campus in Gurgaon
article: Hotel aggregator OYO Rooms has opened a new skill training campus in Gurgaon, where it plans to train one lakh hospitality personnel. "It will provide a platform for recognition of prior learning through informal and on-the-job learning for hospitality workers," said OYO Founder Ritesh Agarwal. The startup raised $62 million from Japan's SoftBank in August this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indonesia asks Jack Ma to advise its e-comm industry
article: Indonesia has asked Chinese online retail giant Alibaba's Founder Jack Ma to act as an adviser in the development of the country's e-commerce industry. Indonesia is setting up a 10-minister committee to promote the growth of country's e-commerce industry, seeking Ma to be the committee's adviser. An Alibaba spokeswoman declined to comment on Ma's acceptance of the offer.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: MobiKwik launches one-step offline payments mode
article: Mobile payments app MobiKwik has launched 'Bubble Pin', a one-step offline payment mode aimed at users with slow data connections or in areas with limited cell reception. The app will generate a pin with a 60-second validity when the 'Pay at store' option is clicked. Users then need to share the unique pin with the retailer to make the payment.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Online fashion marketplace Zilingo raises $8 mn
article: Singapore-based online fashion marketplace Zilingo on Monday raised $8 million in Series A round of funding from Venturra Capital. Sequoia Capital and Susquehanna International Group also invested in the startup founded by Ankiti Bose and Dhruv Kapoor. Zilingo has over 2,000 sellers listed on its platform and is planning expansion to Indonesia.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Designer Anita Dongre invests in Social Quotient
article: Fashion designer Anita Dongre and her son Yash Dongre have invested an undisclosed amount in Mumbai-based social causes startup Social Quotient. Following the investment, Yash Dongre has been appointed as the Director of the startup. Founded in 2015, the startup helps social enterprises to create and manage projects in the domain of water, digitisation, skill development and education.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Mukesh Ambani sets up ₹5,000 crore fund for startups
article: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani on Thursday announced that the company is setting up a ₹5,000 crore fund to invest in digital startups. The fund will be invested in startups over the next five years. The company will also be setting up entrepreneurship hubs in key cities and towns, Ambani announced.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Yuvraj Singh launches his own fashion brand
article: Cricketer Yuvraj Singh on Saturday launched his own fashion brand YouWeCan Fashion (YWC Fashion). Cricketers including Dwayne Bravo, Chris Gayle and Bollywood actors Amitabh Bachchan, Deepika Padukone and others were present during the launch. "YWC’s motto is 'Live, Dare, Inspire!'" said Singh. Sale proceeds from the apparel brand will contribute to Singh's NGO YouWeCan started in 2012.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Would be awesome to throw pie in naysayers' face: Musk
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk in a recent email to employees said, "It would be awesome to throw a pie in the face of naysayers on Wall Street who keep insisting that Tesla will always be a money loser!” Calling Q3 "critical", Musk urged them to cut costs and deliver “every car we possibly can” for a positive quarter.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Elon Musk loses $779 million in a day
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk on Thursday lost $779 million following a drop in the stock prices of companies Tesla and SolarCity. Further, Musk put up an additional $489 million of his Tesla and SolarCity stocks as collateral to secure personal borrowings. According to Bloomberg, Musk's current net worth is $8.3 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola fires over 250 employees citing performance issues
article: Ride-hailing service Ola has fired over 250 employees citing performance issues and elimination of contractual roles due to a business realignment. "An annual attrition of 3-4% is a natural churn that's witnessed in the current industry scenario," said an Ola spokesperson. Ola last month had fired over 1,000 employees after it shut down the TaxiForSure business it acquired in March.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SolarCity advisor miscalculated Tesla deal analysis
article: The investment bank that advised SolarCity in its $2.6 billion sale to Tesla, Lazard made a mistake in its analysis and valued SolarCity $400 million less. During analysis, Lazard double-counted SolarCity's projected indebtedness. The mistake was discovered two weeks after the deal was signed. However, both the companies have agreed that the error won't change their view of the deal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AskMe employee threatens suicide over unpaid salary
article: An employee of e-commerce startup AskMe in an email to the senior management has threatened to commit suicide if no communication is made within five days regarding unpaid salary. "Management of Getit, Astro (AskMe investor) and Sanjiv Gupta will be held responsible for this", wrote the employee. AskMe hasn’t paid salaries for two months and fired all 4,000 employees.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: TruckSumo Co-founder slams article claiming shutdown
article: Co-founder of Hyderabad-based truck aggregator TruckSumo, Arun Rao, recently slammed a media article claiming that the startup has shut down. "This is the second time you've killed us in as many months...Keep pushing the bar down on your journalistic standards...We'll be watching from the sidelines as long as we're alive," said Rao. The article was later updated with Rao's response.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyperloop shows its test track site for first time
article: High-speed transportation system making company Hyperloop One recently showed its test track site in Nevada's desert for the first time. "Roads? Where we're going, we don't need roads... #TheFutureIsHappening", tweeted Hyperloop One. The company is building a transportation system that will let people travel in pods running through vacuum tubes at speeds of over 1000 kmph.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Company law tribunal steps in to stop AskMe shutdown
article: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has asked online search platform AskMe's owner Getit Infoservices to stop the shutdown of the startup and maintain the present status of assets. According to a petition filed by Getit MD Sanjiv Gupta, AskMe's major investor Astro Holdings owes the startup $50 million. The NCLT has given Astro four weeks to file its response.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyperloop One claims Co-founder plotted coup in garage
article: High-speed transport system Hyperloop One on Wednesday amended its complaint against Co-founder Brogan BamBrogan accusing him of holding meetings in his garage to plot a takeover. The complaint also said BamBrogan created a fake Twitter account to promote negative news. BamBrogan had sued the company in July for violating labour laws, to which Hyperloop One had responded with a countersuit.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola volunteers help people affected by rains in Delhi
article: Ola on Thursday deployed over 100 volunteers across Delhi NCR to help the people affected by heavy rainfall and waterlogging. Ola tweeted, "If you're stuck in #DelhiRains tweet your location with #OlaRescue & we'll try to send our rescue team to help you." While volunteers managed the traffic at busy junctions, Ola shuttles ferried people to their nearest metro stations.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Auto converted into workshop to boost entrepreneurship
article: Maker's Asylum, a community workspace promoting entrepreneurship, recently unveiled the 'Maker Auto', an auto-rickshaw converted into a mobile workshop space in Mumbai. The auto, designed with Autodesk software to fit multiple tools without hampering mobility, is equipped with foldable tables, hammers, a 3D printer and laser cutter.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fabindia MD backs fashion retalier StalkBuyLove
article: Ethnic wear brand Fabindia's Managing Director William Bissell has invested an undisclosed amount in online fashion retailer StalkBuyLove. The funding is an extension to the startup's last round of funding in March, where it raised an undisclosed amount from 500 Startups, Singularity Ventures and others. Founded in 2013, StalkBuyLove lets women shop fashion through its app and website.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Smart watchband lets users make calls by touching ear
article: South Korean startup Innomdle Lab has created 'Sgnl', a watchband that lets users make phone calls by touching their fingers to their ear. The strap, which has a built-in mic, connects to phones via Bluetooth and directs audio into the user's ear through vibrations. Priced at about $139, the strap can be attached to any watch including the Apple Watch.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: CCI rejects predatory pricing allegations against Ola
article: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has rejected allegations that Ola operator ANI Technologies misused its dominant position in Delhi-NCR with predatory pricing. It was alleged that the company's fares were less than one-third of government prescribed rates to drive out other players. CCI said the case doesn't present any new facts compared to previous complaints against Ola and Uber.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jabong extends maternity leave to six months
article: Online fashion retailer Jabong has extended the maternity leave for its employees from three months to six months. The move comes ahead of the Maternity Benefits (Amendment) Bill 2016 expected to be tabled in Lok Sabha in the upcoming Winter Session. “Women represent 30% of Jabong’s workforce and impact 60% of our revenue," said Jabong's HR head Deepa Chadha.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: MakeMyTrip exec's arrest unconstitutional: Delhi HC
article: Delhi High Court on Thursday said that the arrest of MakeMyTrip's Finance Vice President MK Pallai without a show-cause notice over company's alleged tax evasion was "unconstitutional". The HC further directed the tax department to refund the ₹70 crore service tax paid by MakeMyTrip within four weeks, as the payments were "not voluntary but under coercion and duress".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes ring that turns pen digital
article: A French startup has created a ring that can turn any pen or pencil digital, and transfer anything written or drawn on a paper to a computer screen in real-time. The ring makes the pen or pencil compatible with a special slate to place the paper on, which has 32 sensors that track the exact position of the user's pen.

author: Rini Kapoor
abstract: 'Chennai Gives', Uber partner for charity drive
article: Charity initiative 'Chennai Gives' has partnered with Uber, Aircel and The Hindu to collect contributions like clothes and stationary for the underprivileged starting September 4. The collections would be done by Uber reportedly through a 'Chennai Gives' button on its app. The 'Chennai Gives' initiative was first implemented by Round Table India in 2015 and distributed over one lakh items.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Govt suspects 200 e-commerce companies to be fake
article: The Ministry of Consumer Affairs has identified about 200 e-commerce companies that may be fake and has referred the matter to the Department of Industrial Promotion and Policy (DIPP). While the names of the companies haven't been disclosed, the department said that it will coordinate with state governments and the ministry to get to the bottom of the issue.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: GirnarSoft launches BusesDekho for commercial vehicles
article: Jaipur-based GirnarSoft, the parent company of CarDekho and Zigwheels, has launched a passenger vehicle portal BusesDekho.com. The new offering, BusesDekho.com, lets fleet owners research, analyse and compare models of 156 buses, 18 vans and 15 auto rickshaws. GirnarSoft was founded in 2007 by IIT-Delhi alumni Amit Jain and Anurag Jain.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Arvind Internet acquires apparel brand Freecultr
article: Arvind Internet, the e-commerce arm of textile manufacturer Arvind Ltd, has reportedly acquired apparel brand Freecultr. Founded in 2011, the startup raised a total funding of more than $13 million from investors like Sequoia Capital and ru-Net Holdings. In May 2016, Arvind Internet launched its omni-channel fashion platform 'NNNow.com'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Chinese regulators open inquiry into Didi-Uber deal
article: Chinese regulators have begun an investigation into the merger of ride-hailing companies Didi Chuxing and Uber's domestic business in a deal announced in August that would value Didi at $35 billion. The regulators are investigating the deal in accordance with the law, to safeguard fair competition and consumers’ interests. The deal would give Didi 90% control of China's ride-hailing market.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Gaming & hospitality firm buys Adda52 for $23 mn
article: Online poker and rummy gaming website Adda52.com was acquired by casino and hospitality operator Delta Corp on Wednesday for $23 million in a cash and stock deal. Delta Corp will initially acquire a 26% stake in Adda52's holding company Gaussian Networks and complete the transaction by June 2017. The five-year-old Kolkata-based startup was founded by IIT-Delhi alumnus Anuj Gupta.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Sequoia backs AI startup Mad Street Den
article: Mad Street Den, a startup focused on artificial intelligence that was started by ex-Silicon Valley founders, has raised an undisclosed amount in Series A round of funding from Sequoia Capital India. Founded by husband-wife duo Anand Chandrasekaran and Ashwini Asokan,  the two-and-a-half-year-old startup has also focused on developing products for e-commerce through its Vue.ai sub brand.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Startup reveals toy for workplace fidgeters
article: Denver-based Antsy Labs has unveiled the 'Fidget Cube', a cube-shaped pocket-sized desk toy designed to help users focus at work. Each of the cube's six faces has a different item for users to fidget with, such as a rotatable dial, clickable buttons, a toggle switch and a joystick that glides across the surface. The product has been launched on Kickstarter.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Paytm raises $300 million at $4.8 billion valuation
article: Online payment and mobile commerce firm Paytm on Tuesday raised $300 million from a group of investors led by Taiwanese semiconductor maker MediaTek. The investment will see the valuation of the Noida-based company more than double to over $4.8 billion. Existing investors including Alibaba, its payments affiliate Alipay and SAIF Partners also participated in the round.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat deletes its Facebook Page
article: Photo messaging app Snapchat has deleted its official Facebook Page reportedly due to lack of its use.
