Snapchat had not updated its Facebook Page for over two years and the last public post made on its page was in August 2013. Before being deleted, Snapchat's Facebook Page had over 6.5 million Likes.

author: Chhavi Tyagi
abstract: Man's FB post tells why users prefer Uber over autos
article: Mumbaikar Dhruv Souran has posted reasons on Facebook explaining why auto drivers are losing business to cab aggregator Uber. Slamming the auto unions for calling strikes against such aggregators, he added that it is their own behaviour of denying services which is to be blamed for their low trade​. Souran's post has over 21,000 likes/reactions and 13,000 shares so far.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We are neck-to-neck with Paytm: MobiKwik COO
article: Mobile wallet MobiKwik's Chief Operating Officer Mrinal Sinha in a recent interview said, "Who says Paytm is market leader? I think that people make very big statements...MobiKwik and Paytm are pretty much neck-to-neck." He added, "We do see Paytm as competition and FreeCharge is also a competition." While MobiKwik raised $40 million last week, Paytm on Tuesday raised $300 million.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 2 Ola drivers held for rape, murder of Kolkata minor
article: Two Ola cab drivers on Wednesday were arrested for allegedly raping and murdering a 12-year-old in Kolkata. According to the police, the drivers forced the girl into an Ola cab and dumped the body in a canal. Ola issued a statement saying that the cab's account had been suspended, but the incident had "not occurred while on the Ola platform".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Not investing in India, says Media.net CEO
article: Mumbai-based advertising technology startup Media.net's Founder and CEO Divyank Turakhia in a recent interview said, "At this time we are not investing in India except for our own two startups — Ringo and Zeta. It’s not a huge amount of money." Earlier this month, Media.net was acquired by a Chinese consortium for $900 million.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bengaluru-based Livspace raises ₹100 cr in funding
article: Bengaluru-based home design and decor portal Livspace on Monday raised ₹100 crore in Series B round of funding led by existing investors Bessemer Venture Partners. Jungle Ventures and Helion Ventures also participated in the funding. Founded in 2012 by Anuj Srivastava, Ramakant Sharma and Shagufta Anurag, Livspace lets users discover interior designs for home and purchase the desired furnishings.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Can't stop Ola, Uber from giving discounts: Delhi HC
article: The Delhi HC on Tuesday said that it cannot stop taxi aggregators like Ola and Uber from levying lower charges or giving discounts to consumers. The court was hearing an application by a taxi association alleging that taxi aggregators weren't complying with the rates fixed by the government. "The consumers should be benefited...ultimately, consumer is the king," the court added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup's CEO accused of borrowing $50k from employee
article: Silicon Valley-based job search platform WrkRiot's CEO has been accused of borrowing $50,000 from an employee and issuing fake pay slips. The accusations were made by a former employee in a blog post who also alleged that WrkRiot had fired her in retaliation for filing a wage claim. The startup has shut down its official Facebook page and company website.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Myntra Co-founder invests in agritech startup
article: Delhi-based agritech startup DayBox has raised $104,000 (approximately ₹70 lakhs) from Myntra Co-founder Ashutosh Lawania, Yebhi.com Co-founder Rajul Jain and eight other angel investors. Founded in 2016 by IIT Delhi and IIIT Allahabad alumni, the startup supplies fresh fruits and vegetables to F&B and retail businesses, which, as of now, includes Grofers, Route04 and Berco's, among others.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup plans to sell 'flying cars' for $600K
article: Dutch startup PAL-V has developed a two-seater 'flying car' which it claims will be ready for sale in US for $600,000 by 2018. The vehicle takes ten minutes to convert from automobile to aircraft and hits top speeds of 170 kmph on road and 180 kmph in air. Reportedly, Google Co-founder Larry Page is also funding development of flying cars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart apologises to Gorkha community over racist ad
article: Flipkart on Monday apologised to the Gorkha community regarding a racist television advertisement through an official blog post. "We are aware that we may have unintentionally hurt the sentiments of our Gorkha brothers and sisters," said Flipkart. The online retailer further informed that an update in the advertisement has been initiated across all channels.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Alphabet executive steps down from Uber board
article: David Drummond, the Senior VP of corporate development at Google's parent company Alphabet, has left Uber's board of directors amid growing competition between the two companies over self-driving cars and other areas. He reportedly didn't attend recent board meetings due to the conflicts. He joined Uber's board in 2013 when Google Ventures invested $258 million in Uber, its largest investment.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal launches free next day delivery service
article: In a bid to compete against recently launched speed delivery services by rivals Flipkart and Amazon, Snapdeal has launched 'Snapdeal Gold', a free next day delivery service. The service allows users in select cities to get next day delivery and extended 14 days return policy instead of seven days on prepaid orders.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Dating app for differently abled people raises ₹1 cr
article: Dating app for the differently abled people, Inclov has raised ₹1 crore in seed funding from former Capital 18 MD Sarbvir Singh, Raghav Bahl-led digital news venture Quintillion Media and others. The startup had raised about ₹6.5 lakh on crowdfunding platform Wishberry last August. Inclov lets users find a match on the basis of their age, location and disability type.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber hires Target CMO as Ridesharing President
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber on Tuesday appointed US retail major Target's Chief Marketing Officer Jeff Jones as its new Ridesharing President. Jones will be responsible for Uber’s global operations, marketing and customer support. Before joining Target, Jones had worked with Coca-Cola, creative agency Leo Burnett and American clothing retailer Gap.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber releases video to mark three years in India
article: Uber on Monday completed three years of its launch in India and released a video to mark the milestone. It features Uber India's journey across various cities including Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata and Bengaluru. Uber claimed that its ride-sharing service UberPOOL saved over six lakh litres of fuel, which is enough to fill 60% of an Olympic-sized swimming pool.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: FoodPanda's 'Food Doctor Program' to check hygiene
article: On-demand food delivery startup FoodPanda has launched a 'Food Doctor Program' to check the quality and hygiene standards of food being prepared at its partner restaurants. FoodPanda will check kitchen operations starting from procurement of raw material to dispatching of food. It will rate the restaurants on audits, which will be available for customers and restaurants on a separate portal.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: US-based home design startup Houzz enters India
article: US-based online home design and decor startup Houzz has hired BabyOye Co-founder Sanjay Nadkarni to begin operations in India. Nadkarni will initially set up a nuclear team of less than 10 people within the next 6-12 months. The startup, which is entering India before China, has raised over $213 million and is reportedly valued at $2.3 billion.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Mattress designing startup raises $7.35 million
article: US-based custom mattress design startup Helix Sleep has raised $7.35 million in Series A round of funding. The startup assesses customers' body type and sleeping preferences and processes the information using its proprietary algorithm to construct a custom mattress. The biomechanics and sleep ergonomics based algorithm creates a design to ensure spinal alignment while sleeping.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Online photography startup Canvera raises $3 mn
article: Bengaluru-based online digital photography startup Canvera has raised $3 million in a funding round led by existing investor Info Edge (India), after reporting a 'down round' less than a year ago. Founded in 2007 by Peeyush Rai and Dhiraj Kacker, the startup offers prints, calendars and photo books, while letting customers find professional photographers for events and occasions.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Uber introduces electronic cabs in London
article:
Ride-hailing app Uber on Wednesday
introduced a new electric car service on a pilot basis in London with 50 vehicles. Uber will offer its top rated drivers with the leasing options for fully-electric cars to be included in the current fleet. According to Uber, over 60% rides in London already take place in hybrid cars.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Fashion rental startup Flyrobe raises $5.3 mn
article: Mumbai-based on-demand fashion rental startup Flyrobe has raised $5.3 million in Series A round of funding led by IDG Ventures. Sequoia Capital, Japan's GREE Ventures and Paytm Founder also participated in the round. Founded in 2015 by IIT Bombay alumni Pranay Surana, Shreya Mishra and Tushar Saxena, Flyrobe previously raised funds from Founders of Snapdeal, FreeCharge and Powai Lake Ventures.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: 'AngelList will make all its deals private'
article: Silicon Valley-based online marketplace for startup investing and recruiting, AngelList will make all deals on its platform private by default, the company Co-founder Naval Ravikant said during an interview. He added that 75% of the deals are now private, up from 45% a year ago. AngelList claims to be the largest hiring platform for startups, hiring 800-2000 employees every month.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: E-grocer HappyFresh raises Series B, exits 2 markets
article: Indonesia-based e-grocer HappyFresh has raised an undisclosed amount in a Series B funding round led by Dubai-based private equity firm Samena Capital. This comes with the startup's decision to exit from two of its Asian markets, Taiwan and the Philippines. Launched in 2014, HappyFresh sells groceries through its web and mobile apps and promises delivery within one hour.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: FinTech startup LoanTap raises $3 million
article: Mumbai-based financial technology startup LoanTap has raised $3 million in Series A funding from HNIs Abhishek Pandey and Jaysukh Sapra. The startup was launched in 2016 by Satyam Kumar and Vikas Kumar and provides EMI-free loans up to ₹10 lakh to salaried professionals. LoanTap will reportedly utilise 85% of the funding for onward lending to its customers.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: 'Petcube' lets owners play with pets remotely
article: US-based startup Petcube has developed a platform that lets pet owners interact with their pets remotely. While 'Petcube Bites' allows users to throw treats at their pets at home via a smartphone app, 'Petcube Play' allows users to exercise their pets using a laser toy that can also be controlled via the app. The products have been launched on Kickstarter.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Over half of successful startups have only one Founder
article: Over half of the world's successful startups have only one Founder, according to data compiled by TechCrunch. Around 52.3% of more than 6,000 startups that either successfully made an IPO or got acquired, had only one Founder. Some well known sole Founders include Jeff Bezos and Sam Walton, who founded multi-billion dollar startups Amazon and Walmart respectively.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Big Bazaar's e-commerce platform to shut down
article: Future Group-owned online platform to buy Big Bazaar products, 'Big Bazaar Direct' is shutting down next week following losses, the Group's Founder and CEO Kishore Biyani has confirmed. "I attempted e-commerce four times in my life. We started FutureBazaar way before Flipkart. We lost ₹300-350 crore in business. Then, we created Big Bazaar Direct...We lost there as well,” said Biyani.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I attempted e-commerce 4 times in life: Kishore Biyani
article: Future Group's Founder and CEO Kishore Biyani in a recent interview said, "I attempted e-commerce four times in my life." He added, "We started FutureBazaar way before Flipkart. We lost ₹300-350 crore in business." Biyani last year said, "Who's afraid of e-commerce? Even if you open 10 sites in 10 years, it'll be 10% of the total organised retail market."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart taken to court over racist television ad
article: The Gorkha community has reportedly filed a petition against Flipkart and its Co-founders in a Delhi court to stop airing a television advertisement that puts the community in bad light. The advertisement stereotypes the community by showing a kid wearing a watchman's uniform with a traditional Nepali hat. It was recently released by Flipkart to promote its 'Flipkart Assured' service.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indian startup to launch smartphone at ₹501
article: Indian startup ChampOne Communications is launching a smartphone named 'ChampOne C1' at a price of ₹501 through a flash sale on September 2. However, the current price is for sales promotion only and once the device is launched nationwide, it will cost nearly ₹8,000. It comes with 5-inch display, fingerprint sensor, 2 GB RAM and 16 GB of internal memory.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Billionaire's son starts his own music startup
article: Singaporean billionaire Kuok Khoon Hong's 28-year-old son Kuok Meng Ru has Co-founded his own music startup instead of joining his father's palm oil business. Named 'BandLab', the startup is a global cloud-based community for people to create, collaborate and share music. According to Kuok, BandLab is generating millions of dollars in annual revenue and will be fully funded by 2019.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: There will be one winner in e-comm: Flipkart’s ex-CPO
article: Flipkart's former Chief Product Officer Punit Soni recently in a tweet said, "There will be one *big* winner in E-commerce and one in Ride sharing. It will be a one horse race." On being questioned about Amazon, Soni replied, "Didn't mention Amazon. Just said there will be one big winner in each market."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kim Kardashian's tweet shuts down startup's server
article: Private jet startup JetSmarter recently revealed that its servers were briefly shut down after reality television star Kim Kardashian tweeted about its app. "JetSmarter makes private travel so easy! I wish I would have thought of this app, it's genius!" Kardashian had tweeted in May. JetSmarter says that the tweet resulted in so many calls that its servers shut down.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Performance applies even to Founders: Sachin Bansal
article: Reacting to a recent top level shuffle at Flipkart by CEO Binny Bansal, the company's Co-founder and Chairman Sachin Bansal said, "We believe that in a merit-based organisation, performance applies to everyone including the Founders.” Sachin Bansal had earlier said that he was removed from the CEO position over "performance issues and missed targets."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup starts delivering $999 robot rotimaker
article: Singapore-based startup Zimplistic, which started taking orders for its $999 robotic rotimaker 'Rotimatic' in 2014, has started deliveries in the US. The fully automated rotimaker takes flour, water and oil, and pushes out a fresh three-layered roti every minute. According to Co-founder Pranoti Nagarkar, the startup took eight years to manufacture the final product.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Snapdeal users sent 20k ‘Happiness Boxes’ to Army men
article: Users of online marketplace Snapdeal have reportedly sent around 20,845 ‘Happiness Boxes’ to soldiers in the Indian Army and Navy around the period of Independence Day and Rakshabandhan. Each box contained a gratitude letter, a thank you seed paper card, a rakhi and an ‘I Love India’ luggage tag. Notably, no proceeds from the initiative will go to Snapdeal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber halts operations in Abu Dhabi, drivers arrested
article: Ride-hailing services Uber and Careem have suspended their services in Abu Dhabi after at least 50 drivers were arrested and 70 cars were impounded by the police. The drivers have reportedly been arrested over violation of regulations and licensing issues. "This is a temporary suspension and we will let you know of any further updates,” said an Uber spokesman.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon testing 30-hr work week for select teams
article: Online retailer Amazon is launching a new pilot program where it will let select part-time employees from a few technical teams to have a 30-hour work week. The selected employees will be paid 75% of what the regular 40-hour work week employees are paid. In April last year, Amazon was criticised for being a stressful and overbearing place to work.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm to raise $300 mn at $5 bn valuation: Report
article: Digital payments and m-commerce platform Paytm is reportedly raising $300 million in a funding round which will more than double its valuation to $5 billion. Led by Taiwan’s MediaTek, the round will also see participation from Paytm's existing investors including Alibaba and SAIF Partners. Paytm is set to launch its first payments bank in the next few months.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Three US mothers run Uber-like service for kids
article: Three US-based mothers run an Uber-like ride booking service for kids called HopSkipDrive. Launched in 2014, the startup's app allows parents to pre-select time and schedule a driver to pickup their kids. The parents can track their kids' ride through GPS tracking available on the app. Notably, Uber passengers need to be above 18 years of age to ride alone.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Govt plans to launch TV reality show for startups
article: The Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion (DIPP) is planning to launch a television reality show for Indian startups on Doordarshan channel. The show will be a platform for startups to pitch their ideas to the investors, where funding will be provided to the winners. The government is also planning to launch a dedicated channel for Indian startups and entrepreneurs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Backpack startup donates a bag for every bag it sells
article: US-based backpack startup 'State Bags' donates a new bag with essential school supplies to an American child in need for every bag it sells. The idea came to its founders after they saw kids bringing their belongings to a summer camp in trash bags. Launched in 2013, the startup has partnered with various influencers and brands like Beyonce and Twitter.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Swamy writes to Corporate Ministry to save AskMe
article: BJP leader Subramanian Swamy has written to the Corporate Affairs Ministry seeking intervention to prevent the closure of e-commerce firm AskMe and save 4,000 jobs. He requested the government to buy the majority stake in AskMe, held by its Malaysia-based investor Astro Overseas. He called for urgent resolution of the whole matter as it will become "infructuous​ after August 31”.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart valuation slashed to $9 bn by Morgan Stanley
article: Flipkart investor Morgan Stanley has marked down the valuation of the online retailer by 4.1% to $9 billion. This is the third consecutive markdown by the investor in the past six months. Besides Morgan Stanley, four other investors including T. Rowe Price and Fidelity have also marked down Flipkart's valuation this year.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Online food delivery startup Runnr raises $7 mn
article: Bengaluru-based online food delivery startup Runnr has raised $7 million in a funding round co-led by Nexus Venture Partners and Blume Venture Partners. Former investor Sequoia Capital did not participate in the funding round. Founded in 2015 by Mohit Kumar and Arpit Dave as Roadrunnr, the entity Runnr emerged after Roadrunnr acquired TinyOwl in June this year.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: New rule to help foreigners start business in US
article: A new federal rule was formally proposed in the US on Friday to allow foreign entrepreneurs to legally work in the country for two years with a one-time three-year extension. The foreigners have to own at least 15% of a US-based startup and must have 'significant' investment from US-based investors. The rule does not require congressional support to be implemented.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Google hires Airbnb executive for self-driving cars
article: Google has hired Shaun Stewart, former head of Airbnb’s vacation rentals business, as Director of Google's self-driving car project. The top Airbnb executive will help Google commercialise its self-driving technology, which has been under development for over seven years. Stewart will report to John Krafcik, who was hired by Google as the project's CEO in 2015.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Startup offers free Wi-Fi when air is clean
article: Amsterdam-based startup TreeWiFi provides free Wi-Fi to people when the air around the locality is clear. Founded by Joris Lam, the startup uses 'smart birdhouses' with sensors that determine the air quality and showcases it through the attached LED system. TreeWiFi also provides tips to improve the air quality, thereby motivating people to organise car-free​ days.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: India fastest-growing business across the globe: Uber
article: Uber Asia's Head of Business Eric Alexander on Monday said that India is now Uber's "fastest-growing business across the globe." He further added, "Uber has invested over a billion dollar into India and we will continue to do so." Talking about the startups in the country, Alexander remarked India is a "huge driver for budding entrepreneurs."

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: App provides low-cost banking to migrants
article: Mobile application Monese has been offering low-cost international banking transactions to migrants in the United Kingdom. Unlike several banks that require special fees for immigrants, Monese charges a monthly fee of $6.5 for almost all of its services. The application claims that users can open an account under 3 minutes, requiring just a government-issued ID for authentication.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Govt plans to incubate 50 early-stage startups
article: In a bid to incubate 50 early-stage startups and build at least five global companies over a five-year period, the Electronics and Information Technology Ministry has inaugurated an 'Electropreneur Park' at the Delhi University, an official release stated on Saturday. The incubation centre already has six projects onboard and has received over 200 proposals for incubation so far.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Odisha govt bags $13.5 bn for startup investment deals
article: In a recent Odisha Investors' Meet in Bengaluru, Odisha government and representatives from over 60 companies agreed upon a $13.5 billion investment pool for startups in the state. Industry stalwarts like Sachin Bansal, Sajjan Jindal and Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw participated in the event, which marked the launch of Odisha Startup Policy 2016. The policy aims at creating 1,000 startups by 2020.

author: OYO
abstract: OYO now open to couple & local ID guests in 100 cities
article: Hotel brand OYO has recently launched 'Relationship Mode', a new feature on its app that helps couples identify and book couple-friendly hotels. Many hotels do not allow unmarried couples or guests with Local IDs (address in the same city as the hotel). Now 4,000+ OYO hotels across 100+ cities address this.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: World's first self-driving taxis debut in Singapore
article:
Three-year old startup nuTonomy on Thursday
started the public trial of self-driving cabs in Singapore, becoming the world's first company to publicly test self-driving taxis. It will offer free rides to select customers in its six modified Renault and Mitsubishi electric cars. Taxi hailing app Uber is also planning to launch its autonomous taxis in the US within a few weeks.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Uber lost over $1.27 billion in 1st half of 2016
article: Ride-hailing app Uber has reportedly incurred a loss of at least $1.27 billion in the first half of 2016. It lost about $520 million in the first quarter and over $750 million in the second quarter of 2016. According to Uber's Head of Finance Gautam Gupta, subsidies for drivers are responsible for majority of the company's losses.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Appie's funding just a PR gimmick: Founder's father
article: Mumbai-based product discovery platform Appie's Founder Kartik Sanghavi's father has reportedly denied the $1 million funding claim by his son and called it a PR gimmick. The startup has failed to pay almost all of its employees since May this year. Employees claim that Sanghavi hasn't been coming to office since a month.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: GoZoomo shuts down, founders return money to VCs
article: Used car marketplace GoZoomo has decided to shut down and return the remaining money to the VCs. Founded in 2014, GoZoomo raised $6 million in funding from top VCs including SAIF Partners. “The right thing to do is to treat the capital respectfully and deploy it where there's a better chance to create huge value,” said GoZoomo Co-founder Arnav Kumar.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: #BoycottMyntra trends over controversial image
article: A hashtag attributed to online fashion retailer Myntra, #BoycottMyntra was trending on Twitter on Friday after a controversial religious image surfaced online. The image featured Draupadi's 'Cheerharan' scene where Lord Krishna is searching for "extra long sarees" on Myntra's portal. However, it was later found that the image was not created by Myntra, but by a private publication.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: IIT Bombay blacklists 9 companies from placements
article: IIT Bombay on Thursday announced names of nine companies which have been banned from the placement procedure for one year. The list includes PepperTap, IndusInsight, and Portea Medical. The institute cited several grounds for the ban, namely, revoking offers, delaying joining date and those found to be fake with no proper office address.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra sues publisher for using name in Draupadi spoof
article: Online fashion retailer Myntra has said that it will pursue legal action against online publisher Scroll Droll for using Myntra's brand name in an image created to spoof Draupadi's 'Cheerharan'. "This creative was done and posted by a third party without our knowledge or approval," tweeted Myntra. The image showed Lord Krishna searching "extra long sarees" on Myntra's portal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IITs ban 31 startups from placements this year
article: A total of 31 startups including Grofers and PepperTap have been banned by all the IITs from conducting placements this year over revoking job offers or delaying the joining date. While Zomato faces the ban two years in a row, Flipkart has just been issued a warning letter for deferring joining dates last year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup provides email addresses in Hindi
article: Delhi-based startup Data Xgen Technologies has started a paid service to provide email addresses in Hindi characters with '.bharat' domain, which is available in Devanagari script. These emails are supported by email service providers like Gmail and Microsoft. "We wish to start a free email id on the domain soon just like Gmail of India," said Founder Ajay Data.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Job portal connects fired Flipkart staff to employers
article: Job portal CutShort has launched an initiative called 'Flipkart Connect' where it is connecting laid off Flipkart employees with potential employers. The initiative was originally launched to help the Flipkart employees after a recent layoff but is now extended to all existing and former Flipkart employees. Flipkart in July had fired 700-1000 of its employees citing underperformance.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: A first in the Indian startup scene, tweets user
article: Reacting to used car marketplace GoZoomo's decision to shut down and return money to the VCs, a user tweeted, "A first in the Indian startup scene, bold decision." Another user tweeted, "A story of integrity! We don't get to hear of it too often!" A user also tweeted, "This is the DNA that needs to be built among Indian entrepreneurs."

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Ford leads $24 million investment in Zoomcar
article: Automaker Ford has led a $24 million funding round in Bengaluru-based Zoomcar, a self-drive-focused car rental company, with participation from returning investors Sequoia Capital, Nokia Growth Partners and Empire Angels. This takes the four-year-old startup's total funding to over $45 million. According to Zoomcar, Ford provides most of the vehicles on its platform.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart gives two key units to ex-Tiger Global exec
article: A recent top level shuffle at Flipkart has put two key business units under former Tiger Global executive Kalyan Krishnamurthy. After starting his second stint at Flipkart in June this year, Krishnamurthy will now head Flipkart’s marketplace, retail and advertising businesses and report to Co-founder and CEO Binny Bansal. Notably, Tiger Global is Flipkart's largest investor.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes bear-shaped universal remote
article: A Luxembourg-based startup has made 'Bearbot', an emotive universal remote that can control household devices through gestures. The interactive remote can be 'trained' through a smartphone app to connect to devices using infrared, bluetooth or radio within a 5-metre range. Bearbot also performs spontaneous actions like sneezing and yawning and functions for approximately one month per charge.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Freecharge Founders invest in cash-back app Crownit
article: Merchant discovery and rewards platform Crownit has raised an undisclosed amount in funding from Freecharge Founders Kunal Shah and Sandeep Tandon, Freshdesk Co-founder Girish Mathrubootham and ex-Snapdeal CPO Anand Chandrasekaran. Gurgaon-based Crownit currently lists 15,000 restaurants, hotels, gyms, and spas and previously raised funding from Accel Partners and Helion Ventures.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapchat highest crashing app on iOS: Report
article: According to a report by data security provider Blancco Technology Group based on the second quarter of 2016, Snapchat was the most-likely app to crash on iOS, with a 17% failure rate. Facebook-owned Instagram had a 14% failure rate, followed by Facebook itself with 9%, and Facebook’s mobile-messaging service Messenger with 5% rate of crashing.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Financial services startup InCred raises $75 million
article: Mumbai-based non-banking financial company (NBFC) InCred Finance, founded by former Deutsche Bank senior executive Bhupinder Singh, has secured $75 million in a funding round led by Deutsche Bank's former co-CEO Anshu Jain. The latest investment is one of the largest fintech deals in India this year. The startup focusses on providing SME loans, home loans and education loans.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jawbone accuses Xiaomi of copying its speaker
article: American consumer technology startup Jawbone has accused Xiaomi of copying the design of its speaker. Jawbone's Chief Creative Officer Yves Behar tweeted, "Sad for you @xiaomi , ripping off the @jawbone Mini #jambox. Sad." Xiaomi's Mi Square Box Bluetooth Speaker unveiled in 2015 has been accused of copying Jawbone's Mini Jambox launched in 2013.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Lifestyle startup NearFox raises funding
article: Mumbai-based lifestyle content and discovery platform NearFox has raised an undisclosed amount of funding led by Globevestor Angel Fund, CoverFox CTO Devendra Rane, GenY Medium Co-founder Ravi Jain, and Craftsvilla Product VP Arpan Nagdeve, among others. Founded in 2015 by IIT Bombay alumni Kiran Patil and Pritesh Mittal, NearFox lets users discover and explore what is happening in their city.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra Co-founder's startup invests $3 mn in Cult
article: Myntra Co-founder Mukesh Bansal and Flipkart's former Chief Business Officer Ankit Nagori's startup CureFit has invested $3 million and acquired a major stake in Bengaluru-based fitness startup Cult. The startup will continue to run as an independent company. Founded in 2015, Cult is a training facility that provides machine-free training programs through fitness trainers.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup reduces phone bill if users watch ads
article: Telecommunications startup Unlockd offers its users discounted bills, free data, or a $5 recharge in exchange for viewing full screen ads when they unlock their phones. Operational in US, UK and Australia, the startup backed by Rupert Murdoch's son estimates that average users unlock their smartphones about 150 times per day, guaranteeing advertisers first access to users.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Xiaomi unveils Redmi Note 4 in China at $135
article: Chinese technology company Xiaomi on Thursday unveiled its new smartphone Redmi Note 4 in China priced at $135. The unibody handset sports a 10-core processor, 5.5-inch screen and 4,100 mAh battery. The phone comes with 16GB or 64GB storage, expandable up to 128GB and runs Android Marshmallow. It also has a 13MP camera and a fingerprint sensor at the back.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Consumer IoT company Witworks raises seed funding
article: Bengaluru-based consumer IoT company Witworks has raised an undisclosed seed round of funding led by Fireside Ventures, Investopad, P39 Capital and a group of angel investors. This comes ahead of Witworks' launch of a smart wearable platform, BLINK. Founded in 2014 by IIT Kharagpur alumni, the startup makes smart connected devices in the home and lifestyle space.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Four Gurgaon food startups face shutdown
article: Four Gurgaon-based on-demand food delivery startups namely CyberChef, MealHopper, Bite Club, and Foodpost have reportedly shut down their operations in the last few months. All these startups networked with home chefs to deliver food to its users through their website or app. While several chefs working with CyberChef have claimed of unpaid dues, Bite Club chefs claim Founders' bankruptcy.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup funds lawsuits with chances of winning
article: Litigation financing startup Legalist, backed by PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel, provides funding to civil-lawsuits based on algorithms which determine their likelihood of success. Factors like court type, the judge and lawyers involved, and facts about the case are taken into consideration. Legalist aims to cover the cost of a lawsuit in exchange for a share of the financial settlement.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Uber to offer retirement plans to drivers in US
article: Ride-hailing app Uber on Wednesday announced partnership with automated investment service Betterment to offer retirement plans to its drivers in the US. According to Uber, the retirement savings feature has been designed based on drivers' feedback. This announcement comes as Uber is caught in a legal battle in the US over whether the drivers are its employees or independent contractors.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Legal e-discovery automation startup raises $10mn
article: American startup Logikcull, a cloud-based e-discovery automation platform, has raised $10 million in Series A from OpenView Ventures and Storm Ventures. Its systems organise different file types into one searchable database, and make scanned documents searchable using an optical character recognition technique. The startup reportedly offers its services to small law firms for $15k-$30k per year.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: US startup monitors construction workers' safety
article: US-based startup SmartSite has released hardware and cloud-based software to assist construction companies in monitoring their workers' health and safety at sites. The startup's systems monitor noise levels, airborne particulates and UV rays and estimate on-site risks. Part of the current batch of Y Combinator, SmartSite's solutions don't need the workers to carry any additional gear.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra to open its first offline store this year
article: Flipkart-owned online fashion retailer Myntra's CEO Ananth Narayanan on Monday said that the company will open its first offline store before the end of this year. Narayanan added, "This strategy is meant for marketing and touch-and-feel experience." Myntra in July acquired fashion retailer Jabong in a deal worth $70 million.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm losses up 314% to ₹1,534 crore in FY16
article: Digital payments and m-commerce platform Paytm posted a net loss of ₹1,534 crore in the financial year ending March 2016, up by 314% y-o-y, according to a filing with the registrar of companies. The Alibaba-backed startup had projected a revenue of ₹869 crore for the year. Founded in 2010, Paytm was valued at $2.3 billion as of June 30, 2016.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Startup helps men shop for celeb-style apparel
article: US-based startup Looklive helps men shop for clothing and fashion apparel based on the style of celebrities and influencers. After searching the web for celebrity photos, the startup uses data mining and image analysis to compare the photos to those from brands. An editorial team helps curate bargain versions of the apparel, which users can then buy.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: $15 mn fund for northeast startups launched
article: The North Eastern Development Finance Corporation Ltd (NEDFi) has set up a $15 million fund for startups in the region. Its initial focus will lie on early and growth stage startups in IT, food processing, healthcare, tourism, retail and aggregation of services. NEDFi has also inked an MoU with the government to build the corpus of funds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Not everyone has the guts to say this, tweets user
article: Reacting to Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal being removed as CEO over performance issues, a user tweeted, "Not everyone has the guts to say this!" Another user tweeted, "Failure is part of life except for Rajinikanth." A user also tweeted, "Takes guts to admit that you have to step down from the company which you had built grounds up!"

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: New York food startup employs refugees to cook
article: A New York based startup 'Eat Offbeat' employs refugees to cook authentic meals based on their family recipes. Co-founded by Manal Kahi and Wissam Kahi, the delivery-only restaurant has hired 12 women from at least five countries. The company builds on the culinary heritage and home-cooking skills of the refugees to provide people with an authentic 'eat-like-a-local' experience.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IT startup dupes 600 of ₹1.5 crore
article: An IT startup named 'PC Technology' has duped at least 600 people from Mumbai of ₹1.5 crore and reportedly thousands from seven other cities. Claimed to be Dehradun-based, the startup assured jobs to people after a three-month training at a cost of ₹25,000. The scam was unearthed when the trainees found the office locked after returning from Independence Day holiday.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: US state to start taxing ride-hailing apps
article: The state of Massachusetts in USA is preparing to impose a 5-cent fee per trip on ride-hailing apps like Uber and Lyft, and spend the earnings on the traditional taxi industry. The law levies an overall 20-cent fee, with 5 cents for taxis, 10 cents for cities and towns and 5 cents for the state transportation fund.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber honours Sindhu by replacing cars with shuttles
article: Ride-hailing app Uber on Saturday honoured shuttler PV Sindhu for winning silver at Olympics by replacing cars with shuttlecocks. "Sindhu has not only brought glory to India but also fired up the imagination of millions across the country," said an Uber spokesperson. The 21-year-old shuttler on Friday became the first Indian female to win a silver medal at the Olympics.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bengaluru home to India's most tech startups: Study
article: Bengaluru is home to the country's largest number of technology driven startups, according to a study by Assocham. Delhi NCR and Mumbai account for the country's second and third largest share of technology driven startups, the study added. It further noted that the cities Hyderabad and Chennai are also popular among the startups and budding entrepreneurs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart back with kids in latest ad commercial
article: Online retailer Flipkart has brought back its 'kids as adults' concept in the company's latest television commercials, where kids dress and talk like adults. The 30-second commercials are focused on the company's recently launched 'Flipkart Assured' service. The service allows users to get certain items delivered within two to four days.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Customisable earphones maker Even raises $2 mn
article: US-based startup Even, which makes customisable earphones, has raised $2 million from individual and seed investors. Founded by composer and sound designer Danny Aronson and his CTO Ofer Raz, Even's headphones are tuned by taking a two-minute hearing test that determines users' ability to hear certain frequencies at different volumes. The startup has already shipped two batches of its product.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Food startup Zzungry gets funding from Silicon Valley
article: Bengaluru-based food startup Zzungry has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Silicon Valley-based entrepreneurs Satish Vasudeva, Madhusudhan Jujare and a clutch of other investors. Founded in 2015, Zzungry delivers Indian food on demand at home and offices. Zzungry's meals are prepared by in-house chefs, who change the menu every week.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Unacademy raises funding from Flipkart, Paytm founders
article: Online education platform Unacademy has raised $1 million in funding led by Blume Ventures. Stanford Angels India, WaterBridge Ventures and angel investors including Flipkart founders Sachin and Binny Bansal. Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma and FreeCharge Founder Kunal Shah also participated in the funding. Founded in 2010, Unacademy makes educational videos available free of cost to its users.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola launches 6-seater 'Prime SUVs' in 10 cities
article: Taxi-hailing service Ola has launched six-seater 'Prime SUV' cabs in 10 cities including Delhi, Bengaluru and Mumbai. Ola will provide vehicles like Toyota Innova, Maruti Suzuki Ertiga, Nissan Evalia and Chevrolet Enjoy within the service, with Wi-Fi and top-rated drivers at a base fare of ₹80. The Prime SUVs are available for booking under the Prime category on Ola app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I was removed as Flipkart CEO: Sachin Bansal
article: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal during a recent meeting with employees admitted that he was removed from the CEO position "because of performance issues". “Look at the top level around you. Everyone has changed. In fact, even I am gone. Some of our targets have been missed and everyone, including the top management, has paid the price," Bansal reportedly said.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Kobe Bryant to launch $100 mn investment fund
article: Former Basketball player Kobe Bryant along with investor Jeff Stibel is set to launch a $100 million investment fund for startups in technology, media and data domains. Although the duo have invested in 15 companies since 2013, the investing arm has been made official now with the name 'Bryant Stibel' and the VC firm will be based in Los Angeles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Not investing in Tesla stings every day, says VC
article: Byron Deeter, partner at venture capital firm Bessemer Venture Partners, in a recent live chat said, “Tesla stings every day I drive my Model X to work." Deeter had refused to invest in the electric vehicle making company in 2006 over negative margins. Notably, Bessemer Venture Partners has also refused to invest in companies like Apple, eBay and Facebook.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AskMe fires 4,000 employees over cash crunch
article: Consumer internet search platform AskMe has reportedly fired 4,000 of its employees as it is shutting down due to cash crunch. AskMe's sister concerns, online retailer AskMeBazaar and furniture seller Mebelkart, have also stopped operations. The shutdown comes after AskMe's investor Astro Holdings, which owns over 97% stake in the company, refused to participate in the next round of funding.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber most popular taxi app in 108 countries
article: According to data by analytics company SimilarWeb, Uber is the most popular ride-hailing app in 108 countries across the world, from the 171 Android markets analysed. Uber is the dominant player in North America and most of Europe, Africa, Australia, and South America. In most Asian countries, local competitors like Ola in India remain the dominant taxi apps.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AskMe blames investor Astro for unpaid salaries
article: In an internal email, the recently shut startup AskMe has blamed its major investor Astro Overseas Limited (AOL) for the non-payment of its employees' salaries. AskMe said that the investor breached its promise of funding the company and sending $5 million by August 5. "We are pushing AOL very hard through all means to clear all dues," added the email.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Startup develops 'FaceCradle' neck travel pillow
article: An Australia-based startup has developed 'FaceCradle' travel neck pillow which features five adjustable positions including a deep sleep mode and a table nap mode. Developed by Roz and David, the pillow is made of machine-washable hypoallergenic memory foam and is attached to a harness that can be looped around one's seat.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: India third biggest tech startup hub: Study
article: According to an Assocham study, India is home to the world's third largest number of technology driven startups. The United States holds the top position, followed by the United Kingdom. The study added that India is among the five largest hosts in the world for both technology and non-technology startups.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Global investors eye Mu Sigma's 48% stake at over $1bn
article: Global investors are competing with PE funds like Blackstone and Bain Capital to acquire 48% stake in data analytics firm Mu Sigma at over $1 billion. The company's CEO Ambiga Subramanian and investor General Atlantic Partners are in talks to sell their 24% stake each. Mu Sigma's growth reportedly slowed after the divorce between Founder Dhiraj Rajaram and CEO Ambiga.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Not losing any money per order: FoodPanda's India CEO
article: Rocket Internet-backed on-demand food delivery service FoodPanda's India CEO Saurabh Kochhar in a recent interview said, "We're no longer losing any money per order." Kocchar added, "We've seen a 30-40% surge in number of orders after March. Till March this year, we clocked 70,000 orders a day." Earlier this year, FoodPanda opted for automation and sacked 500 of its employees.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: FoodPanda to sell Indonesia biz for under $1 mn
article: Rocket Internet-backed on-demand food delivery startup FoodPanda has reportedly put its Indonesia business for sale at less than $1 million. The startup slashed the price for its Indonesia operations after more than a year of unsuccessful attempts of trying to sell the business. FoodPanda had earlier tried selling its India business for $10-15 million, but was unsuccessful.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Another one bites the dust #AskMe, tweets user
article: Reacting to reports of startup AskMe's shutdown, a user tweeted, "₹800 crore vanishes into thin air. Another one bites the dust. #AskMe #Shutdown." Another user tweeted, "If you try to be everything at once, you end up being nothing at all #AskMe." A user also tweeted, "#AskMe how does it feel after spending ₹30+ crore in marketing and shutting down."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Merger with Snapdeal completely baseless: Flipkart
article: Refuting the reports of merger talks between Snapdeal and Flipkart, a Flipkart spokesperson said that the reports are "completely false and baseless.” Snapdeal too termed the reports baseless and called it a "categorically denied speculative, unfounded story." Earlier, media reports had suggested that Snapdeal was initiating talks with rivals Flipkart and Amazon to explore a possible merger.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Tendulkar launches menswear brand on Myntra
article: Sachin Tendulkar launched his menswear brand 'True Blue' on Flipkart-owned e-commerce platform Myntra on Tuesday. In partnership with fashion retailer Arvind Fashion Brands, True Blue's collection, which was introduced in May, includes summer suits, shirts, t-shirts, waistcoats and other basics. Tendulkar said, "True Blue embodies my identity and corresponds to the way I look at fashion."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ola lays off 700 employees, shuts TaxiForSure: Reports
article: According to reports, ride-hailing company Ola has laid off about 700 employees and has shut down its TaxiForSure unit. The cost reduction following these layoffs is claimed to be around ₹30 crore a month. Ola had acquired TaxiForSure in 2015 for $200 million and has been integrating TaxiForSure offerings into its own app since then.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Ola shuts taxi, for sure, tweets a user
article: Following Ola Cabs shutting down TaxiForSure on Wednesday, a user tweeted, "News: Ola shuts TaxiForSure. Interpretation: Ola shuts taxi, for sure". Another user tweeted, "TaxiForSure was actually good. Till it got Ola-fied with a fleet of old cars". "#PoeticJustice will be served, when #Didi comes in and closes #Ola brand as Ola did to #TaxiforSure", read another tweet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kunal Bahl slams media over merger rumours
article: Snapdeal's Co-founder and CEO Kunal Bahl has slammed the reports of company's merger with rivals Flipkart or Amazon on Twitter. "Snapkartazon! Baseless but I would do it just for the exciting name which seems out of Star Wars! Or like a medicine," tweeted Bahl. A Snapdeal spokesman said, “Your so-called ‘news’ is baseless and we deny this speculative, unfounded story.”

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Xiaomi phone shipments fall 38.5% in China
article: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi witnessed a decline of 38.5% in phone shipments in its home market in the second quarter. According to research firm International Data Corp, Xiaomi shipped 10.5 million smartphones in the quarter, down from 17.1 million in the year ago period. The company is currently the fourth-largest competitor in the Chinese market, behind Huawei, OPPO and Vivo.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Snapdeal shuts down Exclusively.com
article: E-commerce firm Snapdeal has shut down Exclusively, a marketplace for branded fashion and lifestyle products. The Exclusively catalogue has been integrated into Snapdeal's platform, and the merchandise will be available under Snapdeal Fashion and will be delivered by its own logistics network. Exclusively was acquired by Snapdeal in February 2015 for an undisclosed sum.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Google to open 14,000-sq ft startup space in US
article: Google on Thursday announced its plans to open a 14,000-square-foot space for startups and developers in San Francisco this September. The space will host events like developer meet-ups, Codelabs, and Tech Talks. The third class of Launchpad Accelerator, Google's program under which it provides startups with resources and up to $50,000 in equity-free funding, will also be held there.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Hyperloop in talks to build its 1st route in Dubai
article: US-based transportation startup Hyperloop One has partnered with the world's third largest port operator DP World to build its first commercial route in Dubai. The team is conducting a feasibility study to assess the possibilities of submerged tubes to ferry cargo at Dubai's Jebel Ali Port. The startup is also studying Russia, Finland, Sweden, Switzerland and ports in US.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IIT, IIM Indore to organise startup carnival
article: IIT and IIM Indore students are organising a two-day startup carnival called 'i5 Summit' from August 20 this year. Entrepreneurs will be able to pitch their startup for funding to a line-up of 15 investors in an event named 'Get Funded!'. Talks, workshops and panel discussions will also take place with CxOs of 20 companies including Hyperloop, Tinder and Microsoft.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Quikr raises ₹130 cr from BCCL's Brand Capital
article: Online classifieds platform Quikr has raised ₹130 crore from Bennett Coleman & Company Ltd's private equity investment arm Brand Capital. The investment arm, which also holds stake in Snapdeal, is reportedly in talks to pick up stake in Flipkart for ₹500 crore. Founded in 2008, Quikr currently focuses on five segments namely automobiles, real estate, jobs, services and customer-to-customer sales.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SolarCity Co-founders take $1 in salary
article: US-based solar power company SolarCity's Co-founders Lyndon Rive and Peter Rive have agreed to cut their salaries to $1 a year. In addition to their salaries, Lyndon and Peter earned $98.3 million and $65.5 million respectively in non-cash payments last year. The company is firing unspecified number of employees and plans to bear $3-5 million in severance cost.

author: Rini Kapoor
abstract: Indian startup makes ink from air pollution
article: Indian startup Graviky Labs has initiated a venture called 'Air Ink' which creates pens with ink made of recycled air pollution. The venture strives towards arresting carbon from car emissions​ and recycling it into usable ink. Each pen contains an equivalent of 30 to 50 minutes of air pollution generated by car exhaust.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: We don't compete with WhatsApp: Hike CEO
article: Hike Messenger Founder and CEO Kavin Mittal in an interview said that Hike is not competing with global giant WhatsApp. He further added, "We are more than just a messaging platform." The company recently raised $175 million in Series D round of funding at a reported valuation of $1.4 billion.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Restaurants end tie-ups with food delivery services
article: Restaurants have started ending partnerships with food delivery services like Swiggy and Shadowfax and have begun cancelling orders from them. This comes due to a hike in commission by 25% per order, according to the restaurants. Delayed pickups, unprofessional manner of dressing by delivery boys and declining standards in deliveries are reportedly other major reasons for ending the tie-ups.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapchat a threat to Twitter, not FB: Analyst
article: Based on revenue generated from advertisements, Snapchat is more of a threat to Twitter than it is to Facebook, according to an internet analyst from Credit Suisse. Brands advertising on Snapchat for its reach-and-frequency targeting are withdrawing from Twitter rather than Facebook, Instagram, or YouTube, the analyst explained.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Wouldn't pay more than $2 billion for Lyft: Uber
article: Ride-hailing service Uber has reportedly told its investors it would not pay more than $2 billion to purchase rival Lyft. Uber has not yet made a formal offer and CEO Travis Kalanick is not in support of the deal fearing intense regulatory scrutiny. Lyft reportedly seeks a sum of $9 billion but has not been able to attract investors' interest.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Pocket-sized power bank that charges laptop made
article: A US-based startup has developed a $249 pocket-sized power bank named 'Omnicharge Pro', that can charge a laptop and a smartphone at the same time. The 20,400 mAh power bank comes with three outlets including two USB ports and a three-pronged AC/DC outlet. It also has a LED panel that displays the battery's temperature and remaining charging time.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Coursera Co-Founder to join Alphabet subsidiary
article: Coursera's Co-founder Daphne Koller has announced in a blog post on Wednesday that she has quit Coursera to join Calico, an Alphabet subsidiary, as its Chief Computing Officer. Created by Google in 2013, Calico tackles challenges of human ageing and associated diseases. Koller co-founded Coursera with Andrew Ng in 2012, and both remain Co-chairs of Coursera's Board of Directors.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AskMe shuts down, lays off all employees: Report
article: Gurgaon-based consumer internet search platform AskMe has reportedly shut down its operations and laid off all the employees. The step is said to be taken after investor Astro Holdings, which owns 98.5% stake in AskMe, refused to participate in the next round of funding. While AskMe's e-commerce website is still live, it is not accepting any new orders.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart Assured launched to take on Amazon Prime
article: In order to tackle Amazon's recently launched Prime service in India, e-commerce retailer Flipkart on Friday launched a new service, 'Flipkart Assured'. The service lets users get certain items in key categories delivered within two to four days without any extra charges. It will be available to Flipkart users on the app, desktop and mobile site on orders above ₹500.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 30% US tech startups will lose unicorn status: Report
article: Silicon Valley-based financial services company SharesPost on Tuesday published a report claiming that approximately one-third of US tech startups will lose their unicorn status in the next 24-36 months. The startups will either go public or get acquired at a lower valuation, according to the report. Unicorns are venture-backed private companies with a valuation of $1 billion or more.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Device to see through walls developed
article: Israel-based 3D imaging startup Vayyar has developed a $200 device called 'WalabotDIY' that lets users see at least four inches through walls. Using algorithms which detect radio emissions and reflections of different objects, the device and its app figure out what is behind a wall in real-time. The device helps find out wires, studs and pipes behind walls.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber enables cab-hailing without app
article: Uber India on Tuesday launched a mobile site to let users hail a ride directly from web browsers without downloading the Uber app. Presently, users in Nagpur, Kochi, Guwahati, and Jodhpur will be able to book UberGO taxis through their Uber accounts from dial.uber.com. In July, Uber partnered with Snapdeal to let users book cabs from the latter's app.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Uber is worth $28 bn, not $62.5 bn, says expert
article: Ride-hailing app Uber is actually worth $28 billion against its current valuation of $62.5 billion, according to Aswath Damodaran, a professor at NYU's business school. He cited the reasons for this estimate as Uber's hurdles in revenue generation, operational costs upon expansion and entry of larger players. He published a blog detailing calculations and comparisons to arrive at his estimate.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon India launches used books store
article: Amazon India recently launched a used books store on its online platform, that allows users to choose from over 1,00,000 books across genres such as literature, romance, biography and textbooks. The company is giving 100% purchase protection on the books. Earlier in July, Amazon launched its Prime subscription service in India for same day and two-day deliveries.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Brilliant mind, flawed personality, tweets user
article: Reacting to US-based startup Gravity4's Indian Co-founder Gurbaksh Chahal getting jail for hitting women, a user tweeted, "#GurbakshChahal's self-destruction and abuses -  brilliant mind, flawed personality." Another user tweeted, "This time the powerful did NOT get away." A user also tweeted, "Goes on to show that education and money don't necessarily guarantee a strong character!"

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart rings made to send heartbeat in real-time
article: A startup has developed a pair of smart rings called 'HB Rings' that allows couples to send and receive each other's heartbeat in real-time. Connected through an app, the steel rings send the user's heartbeat to the paired ring on a single tap. Each ring lasts for about 14 hours on a single charge and has a scratchproof sapphire surface.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Online lingerie seller Buttercups raises funding
article: Bengaluru-based online lingerie retailer Buttercups has raised an undisclosed amount of funding led by Snapdeal’s former Chief Product Officer Anand Chandrasekaran and existing investors. Founded in 2014 by Arpita Ganesh, the startup provides women's innerwear with a range of lingerie and shapewear. It also runs a detailed online quiz to help women find their perfect fit.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We don't give a shit: Flipkart's Sachin Bansal
article: Reacting to a media report titled '10 per cent markup by Valic gives Flipkart reason to cheer', Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal tweeted on Thursday, "No, we don't give a shit about this." Flipkart's valuation rose to $11.5 billion after US-based investor Valic marked up its shares in the online retailer by 10%.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup to sell 3D printed pizzas at concerts
article: 3D food printing startup BeeHex plans to make customised, on-demand 3D printed pizzas at amusement parks and concerts. The 3D printer made by the startup was originally designed for NASA astronauts to take on their missions to Mars. BeeHex claims the machine can make a pizza in just four minutes, compared to nine minutes it takes for a human.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla removes 'autopilot' from its China website
article: Electric vehicles maker Tesla has removed the word 'autopilot' and a Chinese term for 'self-driving' from its China website. This comes after a driver in Beijing who crashed in autopilot mode accused Tesla of overplaying the function's capability and misleading the buyers. The crash, which took earlier this month, is reportedly the first known Tesla crash in China.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We've decided not to expand: BigBasket CEO Menon
article: On-demand grocery delivery startup BigBasket's Co-founder and CEO Hari Menon said, "We are through with our expansion in 25 cities — eight tier-1 cities and 17 tier-2 ones — and have decided not to expand." Menon added, "Instead, we will go deep into each city to create minimum critical mass." He further said that BigBasket doesn't require funds right now.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Indian founder gets jail in US for hitting women
article: Gurbaksh Chahal, Co-founder and ex-CEO of San Francisco-based startup Gravity4, has been sentenced to 12 months in jail. Accused of hitting his girlfriend over 100 times in 2013, he was on probation during which he attacked another woman in September 2014. The judge revoked his probation and the jail sentence is on stay pending an appeal from Chahal's lawyer.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes protein powder from edible insects
article: Israel-based startup Flying Spark makes protein powder for human consumption from fruit fly larvae, which are rich in calcium, magnesium, iron and protein. Founded in 2014, the startup farms as well as processes the larvae into edible powder. It plans to sell its powder directly to manufacturers to incorporate it in their products, ranging from breads and cereals to tofu.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IITs likely to ban 20 startups from placements
article: The IITs are likely to ban 20 startups from its placement season this year. Decided by all the IITs unanimously, the startups that in the past deferred placements or cut pay will get warning letters, while the ones that withdrew job offers will be banned. While Flipkart will get a warning letter, Zomato faces a ban for two consecutive years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hike raises $175 million in Series D funding
article: Hike Messenger on Tuesday announced that it has raised $175 million in Series D round of funding led by new investors including China's Tencent and Foxconn. The recent funding has reportedly valued the company at $1.4 billion. The messaging app was founded in 2012 by telecom giant Bharti Airtel's Founder and Chairman Sunil Bharti Mittal's son Kavin Bharti Mittal.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: First guest on Airbnb was an Indian
article: Airbnb's first guest was an Indian, Amol Surve, who was hosted by the startup's Co-founders Brian Chesky and Joe Gebbia at their Rausch Lane apartment in San Francisco, US in 2007. Surve published a blog when Airbnb reached the milestone of having served 100 million guests. His post shares details about his stay, including a photo of him with Chesky.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SpaceX successfully completes 4th sea-landing
article: Elon Musk-led space exploration startup SpaceX on Sunday successfully recovered its Falcon 9 rocket for the fourth time on a drone ship at sea. The rocket also completed its primary mission of deploying Japanese communications satellite, JCSAT-16, into orbit. The launch marks the eighth SpaceX mission this year, with a proposed goal of 18 missions by the end of 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba Founder Jack Ma's net worth hits $34 bn
article: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba's Founder Jack Ma's net worth hit $34 billion on Thursday after the company reported its highest growth since 2014. Alibaba's shares rallied 5% after the company's quarterly revenue and profit beat analysts' estimates. Notably, Forbes ranked Jack Ma as the world's eighth richest tech billionaire on Wednesday.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Didi Chuxing Founder once worked at foot massage firm
article: The Co-founder and CEO of taxi-hailing app Didi Chuxing, which bought Uber's China business earlier this month, 33-year-old Cheng Wei was once assistant to the head of a foot massage firm. After a year, Wei started working at Alibaba as a sales person and six years later in 2012, he co-founded Didi Chuxing. Wei's net worth is currently $1 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: GoJavas gets acquired by Pigeon Express: Report
article: Logistics firm GoJavas has reportedly been acquired by inter-city courier service Pigeon Express. While the financial details of the deal have not been disclosed, majority of GoJavas employees have been asked to quit and the company will be shutting down all the operations in due course. Snapdeal, which owns 42% stake in GoJavas, was also looking to acquire the company.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Investor Rizvi halves stake in Twitter
article: Twitter investor Rizvi Traverse Management, managed by Suhail Rizvi, has halved its stake in the microblogging platform. The private equity firm held over 15% stake in Twitter at the time of its IPO in 2013, which is now down to 0.2%. Interestingly, the firm has also increased its holding in Jack Dorsey-led Square.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: OYO Rooms raises $90 million from SoftBank
article: Hotel aggregator OYO Rooms has reportedly raised $90 million in a round of funding from its existing investor SoftBank. However, none of its other existing investors including Greenoaks Capital, Sequoia Capital and Lightspeed Venture Partners, participated in the funding. The startup was reportedly looking to raise over $100 million in this funding round.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra buys 51% stake in Hrithik's brand
article: Flipkart-owned Myntra on Friday acquired a majority stake of 51% for an undisclosed amount in actor Hrithik Roshan's fitness and sportswear brand HRX. “I’ve always been passionate about physical and mental fitness...this collaboration is a positive step we have taken towards the change,” said Hritik. Myntra last month had acquired fashion retailer Jabong for $70 million.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Lyft rejects acquisition bid by General Motors
article: San Francisco-based ride-hailing startup Lyft reportedly declined acquisition interest from General Motors (GM) and has instead opted to raise new funding. The startup has raised $2 billion till now, including a $500 million investment from GM in January. The partnership between Lyft and GM also includes testing self-driving cabs with autonomous systems installed in electric Chevrolet cars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kunal Bahl in LinkedIn India's most viewed CEOs list
article: Online retailer Snapdeal's Co-founder and CEO Kunal Bahl has been featured in the LinkedIn's list of most viewed CEOs in India for 2016. Bahl co-founded Snapdeal along with Rohit Bansal in 2010. The list also includes Futurebrands Managing Director and CEO Santosh Desai, Tata Power's Anil Sardana and HCL Technologies' Anant Gupta among others.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ONGC sets up ₹100 crore fund for startups
article: Celebrating its diamond jubilee, Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) on Sunday announced that it has set up a ₹100 crore startup fund to support new ideas related to its sector. The initiative called 'ONGC Startup' is a part of government's Start-up India programme. Under the initiative, ONGC will provide the startups with seed capital, hand-holding, market linkage and follow-ups.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Gay dating app Grindr launches own clothing line
article: Gay and bisexual men's dating app Grindr has launched its own clothing line. The new collection features tops, outerwear, bottoms, accessories and other clothing items. The apparel line is meant for "the guy who likes to break a sweat" and the sale proceeds are being donated to Athlete Ally, an organisation focused on ending homophobia and transphobia in sports.

author: Saloni Tandon
abstract: Zomato associates with RHA for #Mission500k
article: Food startup Zomato has associated with the Robin Hood Army for their Independence Day special campaign #Mission500k. The startup has been encouraging people and food partners to volunteer and associate with the cause. Through the campaign, the organisation aims to distribute food to five lakh less privileged people across India and Pakistan on August 14 and 15.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Tiny computer to build hardware projects costs $5
article: US-based IoT startup Onion has built a $5 tiny computer that is suited to develop complex hardware projects with ease. The Onion Omega2, which begins to ship in November, is Arduino-compatible but also runs Linux natively. It comes with built-in Wi-Fi and supports cellular, Bluetooth and GPS connections. The base model has 32 MB RAM and 16 MB storage.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: GIFs and emoji lead to better responses: Tinder
article: According to dating app Tinder, GIF and emoji messages are 30% more likely to receive a response from matches than non-GIF ones, and conversations with GIFs last two times longer than those without. Tinder says more than 100 million GIFs have been sent around the world since the launch of the feature in January 2016.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Flipkart valuation marked up by 10% to $11.5 bn
article: Flipkart's valuation rose to $11.5 billion after the firm's US-based mutual fund investor Valic marked up its shares in the e-commerce company by 10%. The shares were valued at $108.04 at the end of quarter ended May, against $98.19 in the previous quarter. This comes after Flipkart's investors, including Valic, had marked down its valuation in the past.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Startup raises $5mn to develop in-space communications
article: Canada-based startup Kepler Communications has raised $5 million in seed funding to "establish an in-space telecommunications network for space-borne assets." With a network of small, replaceable satellites, the startup is building a real-time system for machinery and device communication. Co-founder Mina Mitry said, "We’re setting up to have our first two satellite launch at the end of 2017."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup gets $160 mn to make car vending machines
article: US-based used cars startup Carvana on Wednesday raised $160 million in Series C round of funding to make car vending machines. A car vending machine is a big glass building that automatically dispenses cars preloaded by the startup. On inserting a coin, the fully-automated machine delivers the car to its respective owner.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jeff Bezos sells record $757 mn of Amazon shares
article: Amazon Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos last week sold one million of his company shares for a record $757 million, according to a US Securities and Exchange Commission filing. This is the biggest ever share sale for Bezos, exceeding the $671 million worth of shares he sold in May. Bezos still owns 80.9 million Amazon shares worth $62 billion.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Arianna Huffington quits The Huffington Post
article: Huffington Post Co-founder Arianna Huffington announced on Thursday that she will be stepping down as the Editor-in-Chief of Huffington Post to focus on her wellness startup 'Thrive Global'. "I thought it would be possible to build a startup and continue as Editor-in-Chief of the Huffington Post. Today, it's clear that was an illusion," she said.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Apple rehires Flipboard Co-founder Evan Doll
article: Apple has rehired Flipboard Co-founder Evan Doll to work on health-related software after he quit Apple to found the digital news magazine app Flipboard. Doll had worked as a software engineer at Apple from about 2003 to 2009 and had helped develop the first iPhone operating system. Doll left Flipboard in October 2015 along with other executives of the startup.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: EdTech startup Genext Students raises ₹1.4 cr
article: Mumbai-based education technology startup Genext Students announced on Wednesday that it has raised ₹1.4 crore funding from 1Crowd, an equity crowdfunding platform for startups. Founded in 2011 by London School of Economics alumni Ali Asgar Kagzi and Asad Daud, Genext Students is an online learning platform for students of grade 1-12, across CBSE, ICSE and RBSE boards.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Food chain Sattviko acquires packaged food firm FYNE
article: Vegetarian food chain Sattviko on Wednesday acquired Delhi-based packaged food company FYNE Superfood for an undisclosed amount. FYNE's brand and products will be merged with Sattviko, and its Co-founder Darpan Majumdar will join Sattviko. This is at least the second acquisition made by the startup within a year after it acquired food delivery startup Call A Meal in November 2015.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tinder use up by 129% in Rio Olympic Village
article: A spokesperson for dating app Tinder has revealed that usage has "skyrocketed" in Rio de Janeiro since the 2016 Olympic Games began. "Over the weekend, matches in the Olympic Village increased by 129% and we expect this trend to continue throughout the Games," she said. About 450,000 condoms were supplied by the International Olympics Committee to the athletes this year.

author: Chhavi Tyagi
abstract: HC directs Ola, Uber to follow Delhi govt fares
article: The Delhi High Court on Thursday directed app-based taxi services, including Ola and Uber, to not charge more than the rates set by the Delhi government after August 22 in the National Capital Region. The court also directed the Centre to review Delhi government's draft policy for app-based cabs and submit a final report in three months.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes ready-to-drink breakfast 'Coffiest'
article: US-based meal replacement beverage making startup Soylent on Tuesday launched a ready-to-drink breakfast called 'Coffiest'. A combination of soy protein, algal oil, coffee and amino acid L-theanine, its plant-based formula claims to provide 20% of a person's daily nutritional requirements. A Coffiest bottle is equivalent to a 16-ounce cup of coffee and contains 400 calories.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Google to let users order food from search page
article: Google India on Monday introduced a new feature which will allow users to order food and reserve tables online directly from the Google Search results page. The 'Place an order' option will show up when users search for a nearby restaurant on their phone and let them choose a delivery service like Zomato or Swiggy to complete the order.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Madhya Pradesh bans Uber, Ola over surge pricing
article: The Madhya Pradesh transport department on Tuesday banned the services of taxi aggregator firms Uber and Ola in the state with immediate effect. The ban was imposed for the violation of the Central Motor Vehicles Act, which does not provide for surge pricing or a 'peak time' charge, a regional transport officer said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bombay Shaving raises ₹4 crore in seed funding
article: Men's grooming products startup Bombay Shaving Company on Wednesday raised ₹4 crore in seed round of funding from a clutch of angel investors. Former TCS CEO Subramanian Ramadorai, former Tech Mahindra CEO Kiran Deshpande and others also participated in the funding round. Founded in 2015, the Delhi-based startup provides men's shaving products on a subscription basis.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart opens office in the Silicon Valley
article: India’s largest e-commerce marketplace Flipkart has opened a new office in the Silicon Valley's Palo Alto city. The startup's Chief Technology Officer Peeyush Ranjan on Thursday tweeted, "Great day at our new Palo Alto, CA office with @sachinbansal and @binnybansal...We are live in the Bay Area!" Earlier in May, Flipkart rival Snapdeal had opened its data centres in the US.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup to launch Virtual Reality camera satellite
article: US-based startup SpaceVR has announced its plans to launch what is claimed to be the world's first virtual reality camera satellite into space in 2017. The satellite, Overview 1, will orbit the Earth and capture high resolution, fully immersive, 360-degree videos through its 4K sensors. The content will be viewable on any virtual reality device, including smartphones.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Startup lets users grow weed at home via app
