article: Canadian startup Grobo has launched a device that lets users grow cannabis at home via a connected app. Users can fill the device's reservoir with water and nutrients, insert seeds into its base and start the growing process via the app. The $899 device monitors the condition of the plant, adjusts its watering schedule, and informs when ready to harvest.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: App for home delivery of printouts launched
article: Bengaluru-based startup Printo has launched an app called Print Instantly (Pi) which delivers printouts and other printed products directly to users. The on-demand printing service is integrated with email, cloud and mobile storage and connects users with the nearest suppliers. This allows them to print pictures, documents and posters from their phones.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Online portal for homestays 'HeyBnb' enters India
article: Singapore-based online portal for homestays, HeyBnb has entered the Indian market. The portal, which allows hosts to register their accommodations online and set price tags, is currently available in 17 cities including New Delhi and Mumbai. HeyBnb Co-founder Stan Dong said, "most properties listed on our platform are in the price range from ₹1,000 - ₹13,000."

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: P2P lending platform Faircent raises $1.5 mn
article: Gurgaon-based peer-to-peer (P2P) lending platform Faircent has raised $1.5 million funding from Brand Capital. Founded in 2013, Faircent provides a platform for potential borrowers and lenders to transact deals. The startup, which featured in Interbrands' global list of Breakthrough Brands 2016, currently has over 6,000 lenders and 26,000 borrowers, and has disbursed a total loan of₹6.5 crore.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Online bus booking portal raises $7 million
article: Bengaluru-based online bus booking portal Travelyaari has raised $7 million in Series B funding from Gujarat Venture Finance, Bennett Coleman & Co and others. The startup had raised $3 million in Series A two months earlier. Founded in 2007 by IIM-A graduates, the startup also offers B2B software solutions for bus operators and travel agents.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jugnoo launches lunch delivery service 'Meals'
article: Autorickshaw-booking app Jugnoo has launched a ready-to-eat on-demand lunch delivery service called 'Meals'. The service will be a part of grocery-delivery Fatafat app integrated on its platform, allowing users to choose from a menu including sandwiches, meal combos, desserts and other food items. Delivered through its own autorickshaws, the service will have no minimum order price.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: DST launches $15 mn programme for startups
article: Department of Science and Technology (DST) has launched a $15 million programme called 'NIDHI' for Indian startups. DST plans to support additional 15-20 incubators this year and has plans to provide all kinds of assistance to startups. The programme also aims to provide financial support to 20 student startups each year, which will be selected through a national level competition.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SolarCity to sell roof with solar panels: Musk
article: Tesla's Co-founder and CEO, Elon Musk said on Tuesday that SolarCity, which the company acquired for $2.6 billion recently, will sell roofs integrated with solar panels. Musk said, “It’s a solar roof, as opposed to a module on a roof...it’s not a thing on a roof, it’s the roof.” Currently, SolarCity installs solar panels on the roofs of its customers.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: I'm leaving because everything is great: Maris
article: Google Ventures' Founder Bill Maris has quit the venture capital firm, and will be replaced by one of his deputies, David Krane. When asked for the reason, he said, "If it (GV) weren’t in great shape, that would be the wrong time to leave. I’m leaving because everything is great." Interestingly, Maris didn't hold a board seat at the firm.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BMW mocks Tesla in its new advertisements
article: German luxury carmaker BMW has mocked electric vehicle maker Tesla in two new advertisements of its 2016 BMW 330e plug-in hybrid version of its 3-Series sport sedan. "You will wait, and wait, and wait some more, all before that electric-car company’s new model ever even arrives,” says the advertisement. Notably, Tesla's Model 3 is scheduled to launch in late 2017.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Snapchat removes 'racist' Asian filter
article: Snapchat has taken down a filter it had introduced on Tuesday after allegations that the filter promotes racial stereotypes against Asians. The filter featured a caricature-like face with squinty eyes, which a Twitter user called "the most overly racist filter ever”. Meanwhile, Snapchat has said the filter was Anime-inspired and was "meant to be playful".

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Indoor skydiving equipment startup raises funding
article: Mumbai-based indoor skydiving equipment making startup Wefly has raised an undisclosed amount from Hong Kong-based investment firm Swastika Company. The investment firm has acquired a 20% stake in the company and its director will join the startup's board. Founded in May 2015, Wefly manufactures aerosports equipment and plans to launch a mobile indoor skydiving unit next month.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Augmented Reality startup Skully shuts down
article: US-based augmented reality startup Skully has reportedly shut down due to lack of funds and inability to raise capital in time, according to a letter by the company to its customers. It has filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy, under which the customers will not get refunds for their pre-orders of the AR-1 Motorcycle Helmets that the startup was designing.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Firm turns old smartphones into security devices
article: US-based startup Modifi has built mods that can convert old smartphones into cost-efficient sensor systems for security, fleet management and baby monitoring purposes. The mods can detect light, sound, movement, magnetic fields and power outages, while users can create customised sensor alerts for the same. The devices can also begin recording videos according to user-defined triggers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 3D printer startup lies about contract with Dell
article: Poland-based 3D printer making startup Zortrax lied about signing a contract in 2014 with Dell for 5,000 printers, according to TechCrunch. The startup had raised $3.5 million capital on the news of the contract. While Dell says that "no transaction between Dell and Zortrax has ever occurred," Zortrax on Monday claimed that the potential contract concluded unsuccessfully.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Healthcare startup Tricog raises Series A funding
article: Bengaluru-based Tricog Health has raised an undisclosed amount in Series A funding from Inventus Capital Partners, Blume Ventures and a group of angel investors. Founded in 2015, the startup builds technologies that help doctors detect a heart attack within minutes of a patient's arrival. Tricog's cloud-connected ECG devices provide real-time reporting of results after specialists' interpretation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: No scope left for a third player: CarDekho CEO
article: Automotive classifieds portal CarDekho's Co-founder and CEO Amit Jain in an interview said, "There is no scope left for a third player now. You will have to come up with at least $200 million to make it big in the industry now". Jain added, "It is a two-player market now. We acquired Gaadi and ZigWheels and they (CarTrade) acquired CarWale".

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Mu Sigma's CEO, investor plan to sell 48% stake
article: US-based big data analytics firm Mu Sigma's CEO and its largest investor General Atlantic are reportedly planning to sell their combined 48% stake in the company. This comes two months after the news of company's Co-founder Dhiraj Rajaram and CEO Ambiga Subramanian's divorce. Subramanian and General Atlantic hold 24% stake each, and the 48% stake is valued at $1.5 billion.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Startup builds automated robotic massage equipment
article: Singapore-based startup AiTreat has built a robotic masseuse called 'Emma' (short for Expert Manipulative Massage Automation) to improve physicians' efficiency in a Chinese healing medical massage 'tuina'. Emma treats patients and athletes at the Singapore Sports Hub and the data collected from the therapy sessions can be processed to generate a performance report.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Jugnoo integrates Pokémon Go into app
article: Auto-rickshaw aggregator Jugnoo has integrated a Pokémon Go mode into its app, providing an alternative to playing while driving. The update will make Pokéstops and PokéGyms visible on the Jugnoo app to help users plan their routes. Jugnoo Co-founder and CEO Samar Singla said, "We saw an opportunity and realised that playing in an auto could be fun".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Logistics firm GoJavas suspends operations
article: Online retailer Snapdeal-backed logistics firm GoJavas has temporarily suspended its operations citing technical issues. In October 2015, Snapdeal had invested an additional $20 million in the Gurgaon-based logistics supply chain, taking up 42% stake in GoJavas. Reports last month had suggested that Snapdeal was planning to fully acquire GoJavas.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AngelList to launch 'Syndicates' in India
article: Silicon Valley-based online marketplace for startup investing and recruiting, AngelList is launching private single-deal VC funds 'Syndicates' in India. It allows technology investors to create a single-investment VC fund that raises money from institutions and angel investors. AngelList has appointed Utsav Somani as an Advisor to spearhead its operations in the country.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Video: Electric van outruns BMW i8, Dodge Viper
article: Silicon Valley startup Atieva has released a video of its electric van 'Edna' outrunning a BMW i8 and a Dodge Viper in a 400-metre drag race. 'Edna' completed the race in 11.3 seconds, going 0-100 kmph in 2.94 seconds, reaching a top speed of 188 kmph. In July, Atieva had released a video of 'Edna' outrunning a Tesla and Ferrari.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: US startup launches on-demand drone insurance
article: US-based startup Verifly has launched an on-demand, per-flight insurance for drone users with a new mobile app and service. The Verifly app draws a 400-metre circle around users and provides an estimated risk after analysing information from its proprietary geospatial and weather databases. It accordingly sets a price for the drone pilot on a policy which they can buy on-the-spot.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Startup builds content creation VR technology
article: US-based startup Visionary VR has unveiled its new product, called Mindshow, that lets users define their environments, interactive surroundings and create content in first person perspective. Users can create characters with their own voice and movements and even participate in scenes created by friends. Currently in early stages of rollout, Mindshow has opened sign-ups for early access.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla's Autopilot drives owner to hospital
article: Joshua Neally, a 37-year-old owner of Tesla Model X has claimed that the car's Autopilot mode saved his life and drove him to hospital in July. Neally, who suffered blockage in lung arteries while driving, was driven for over 32 km by the car's Autopilot. However, Neally had to drive the final bit to the hospital on his own.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Not making an investment in Netflix: Alibaba
article: China's retail giant Alibaba is not making an investment in Netflix, the company's spokesman has confirmed. The spokesman was responding to market rumours about a possible deal between the Chinese e-commerce company and the US video service. Following the rumours, Netflix shares had rose by 3.49% on Friday.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grofers denies committing jobs to students
article: Responding to a legal notice by students over revoking their job offers, Grofers has denied any commitment to provide jobs to the students. Grofers said, "Until acceptance of the offer by execution of the Company’s ‘Appointment Letter’, there exists no employer-employee or other contractual relationship." Grofers has further asked the students to withdraw the allegations within 14 days.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Walmart buys Amazon rival Jet for $3.3 billion
article: American multinational retail chain Walmart on Monday acquired Amazon's rival Jet for $3 billion in cash, plus up to $300 million in shares for the founders. The deal is the largest ever purchase of a US e-commerce startup. Founded in 2014, Jet is an online-only shopping site that has raised $565 million in four rounds of funding from investors including Alibaba.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Microfinance firm Chaitanya Rural raises ₹47 cr
article: Bengaluru-based microfinance company Chaitanya Rural Intermediation and Development Services has raised ₹47 crore from a fund managed by private investment firm Equator Capital and other investors, the company said on Friday. Started in 2009, the microlender provides microfinance, livestock financing, two-wheeler financing and micro-housing loans to the low-income rural population.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla requires $1.1 billion in cash for Q3
article: Electric vehicles maker Tesla has disclosed that it needs $1.1 billion in cash for the third quarter to meet its requirements in payments and planned expenditures. The amount is about a third of the company's cash in hand mid-year. Earlier in March, Tesla said the cost of building and operating its Gigafactory in Nevada, US could exceed the company's expectations.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes bell to turn any bicycle 'smart'
article: A Hungary-based startup has created a bicycle bell called 'Shoka Bell' which claims to turn any bicycle into a smart bike. The bell, which also acts as a front light, comes with a theft alert alarm, a 200-hour battery life per charge and an LED display for navigation. It is also capable of adjusting its volume according to the environment.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon Great Indian Sale to begin from August 8
article: Online retailer Amazon's 'Great Indian Sale' is beginning from 12 am midnight on August 8. The three-day sale will let users buy electronics, home and kitchen appliances, clothing, sports equipment and other products at discounted prices. This year's sale will also include Prime-only deals, with Prime members being given 30-minute early access to deals.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup sends staff to buy own product to boost sales
article: US-based startup Hampton Creek sent employees to buy its own mayonnaise 'Just Mayo' from supermarkets, to boost the product's sales. It also asked workers to call store managers pretending that they were customers to enquire about the product. Creek's CEO Josh Tetrick said they were "assessing the product from the customer perspective...we’ll continue doing it".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Xiaomi's Hugo Barra challenges InMobi CEO for planking
article: Xiaomi's Vice President Hugo Barra on Monday shared a video of himself doing the plank exercise position for 1 minute and 50 seconds, where he challenged InMobi's CEO Naveen Tewari to beat his time. Accepting the challenge, Tewari shared a video where he planked for over 3 minutes. Barra has also challenged Hungama Founder Neeraj Roy for the same.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Device made to help wheelchair users play Pokémon Go
article: Canadian startup Komodo OpenLab has built a device called 'Tecla' that helps wheelchair users play the mobile game Pokémon Go. The device, which allows controlling the game through Bluetooth, is installed on the wheelchair. It is capable of responding to the light touch and hand gestures of the users.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup founders accused of using funds at strip clubs
article: US-based smart helmet startup Skully's founders have been sued by a former employee, who claims that they spent the raised funds on sports cars and strip clubs. One of the founders is also accused of paying for apartments accommodated by his family under ‘corporate housing’. Skully recently announced its shutdown due to lack of funds and inability to raise capital.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber invests in four European startups
article: Uber's Co-founder and CEO Travis Kalanick has announced that the company has invested in four European startups namely Brigad, Memrica, Otly and Hipromine. Interestingly, startup Hipromine is researching the potential uses of insects in medicine, meals and bio-fuel. The investments were a part of 'UberPitch', an Uber program that allows entrepreneurs to pitch their ideas to local investors.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Reputation management startup raises $2 million
article: BrandYourself, a US-based online reputation management startup, has raised $2 million in funding. BrandYourself had also pitched on American reality show Shark Tank in 2015, but it was refused funding due to disagreements in company valuation. Founded in 2009, BrandYourself lets users create a better online reputation by developing personal websites, and social media profiles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Apple acquires machine learning startup Turi
article: Technology giant Apple has acquired US-based machine learning platform for developers and data scientists, Turi for a reported $200 million. Previously known as 'Dato', the startup changed its name to Turi in July this year after a trademark dispute. “The company buys smaller technology companies from time to time", said Apple in a statement.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Theranos CEO unveils new blood testing device
article: Elizabeth Holmes, CEO of US-based blood analysis startup Theranos, presented a new device called 'miniLab' on Monday which claims to run up to 40 tests on 160 microlitres of blood sample. She also presented clinical data for 11 tests which has been sent to authorities for validation. Earlier in July, Theranos was sued for inaccurate results on its blood tests.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: CouponDunia launches premium lifestyle card 'Quirk'
article: Mumbai-based coupons and cashback portal CouponDunia has launched 'Quirk', a premium card which offers privileges at restaurants and bars. Currently available for Bengaluru, it offers unlimited usage, monthly value-adds and credits for spas and food delivery portals. CouponDunia also plans to start the service in other cities and across segments like hotels, health and fitness, and travel.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Startup gives lease for houses across the world
article: Travel startup 'Roam' provides an international network of co-living spaces based on a flat price system. With the freedom to move across locations, the space includes a bedroom, a bathroom, cleaning service, and WiFi at around $500 per week and $1800 per month. Currently operating in Miami, Bali, and Madrid, the company plans to expand to 8-10 locations by 2017.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Food delivery startup Deliveroo raises $275 mn
article: European on-demand restaurant food delivery startup Deliveroo on Friday raised $275 million in Series E round of funding, which reportedly values the startup at $1 billion. The round was led by new investor Bridgepoint and previous investors DST Global and General Catalyst, with participation from existing investor Greenoaks Capital. The startup has now raised $475 million to date.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Ratan Tata to set up venture fund for startups
article: Chairman emeritus of Tata Sons, Ratan Tata is reportedly planning to set up a venture capital fund in partnership with the University of California with a corpus of around $100-150 million. The fund is reportedly looking at investments in the ticket size of around $10-15 million. However, initially, the fund can also invest around $5 million.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: App to transform videos into moving paintings
article: Video editing app Artisto lets users transform their videos into moving paintings reflecting styles of popular artists like Vincent van Gogh and Pablo Picasso. Available for both, Android and iOS, the app lets users record 10-second videos or use one directly from the gallery. The company claims to have developed the app in eight days.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon launches its own air cargo network
article: Online retail giant Amazon on Friday launched its own dedicated cargo plane service for deliveries to its Prime members. Amazon also debuted its first ever branded air cargo plane 'Amazon One', a Boeing 767-300. The company said that it will lease 40 such planes in the next two years for its deliveries across the United States.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Was scared of using the word dating: TrulyMadly CEO
article: Dating app TrulyMadly's Co-founder and CEO Sachin Bhatia in an interview said, "We were scared of using the word 'dating'. Although the mushrooming café culture was legitimising courtship, dating was still not fully out of the closet." Bhatia added, "We wanted to show people that a date’s just a date, it's not sex, it's not marriage—it's just clean, easy fun."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart pen that writes in 16 million colours made
article: A US-based startup has made a smart pen called 'Cronzy Pen' that collects colour from its surroundings and allows writing in over 16 million colours. Connected to a dedicated app, the pen scans colours from the objects and saves it to the user's smartphone. It takes a minute before the pen is ready for writing with the scanned colour.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Yepme losing ₹4 crore a month: COO Sandeep Sharma
article: Fashion retailer Yepme is losing ₹4 crore per month, according to the startup’s Co-founder and Chief Operating Officer Sandeep Sharma. Yepme, however, is reporting revenues of ₹20 crore per month. At the current rate, Yepme for the last three months from April-July has reported losses of ₹12 crore on revenues of ₹60 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart launches 'Fliptech' and 'Hobby Hub'
article: Online retailer Flipkart has launched two new services on its platform called 'Fliptech' and 'Hobby Hub'. Fliptech is a curated product guide that contains content about the electronics, fashion, mobiles and home categories to help customers make informed purchases. Further, Hobby Hub helps customers learn more about their hobbies and directs them to make purchases based on their preferences.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Reality show for Indian startups to launch in October
article: A new television reality show for Indian startups, 'The Vault' is set to go live in October this year. The show would allow startups to pitch their ideas before six investors and raise an investment amounting between ₹1 lakh and ₹1 crore. A total of 36 startups will be shortlisted to be featured on the show.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: UTOO Cabs gives ₹15-20L apartments to drivers
article: In a bid to retain drivers, Chennai-based taxi-hailing service UTOO Cabs is giving its drivers ownership of apartments costing ₹15-25 lakh, where drivers would have to pay 10-15% of the apartment's cost. If the driver does not have the money, he would need to complete 5,000 trips, which takes about 12-18 months. The company claims to have purchased 200 flats.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm wallet to allow buying Big Bazaar products
article: Paytm has tied up with Big Bazaar to let users buy the retailer's products online through its wallet. Further, offline customers will be able to pay through Paytm at Big Bazaar’s retail outlets across the country. "We see a fantastic opportunity to create a mobile first, omni-channel retail and payment solution for our consumers," said Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ShopClues ready for IPO in 2017, says Co-founder
article: Online retailer ShopClues Co-founder Radhika Aggarwal in an interview said, "We do plan to go for an initial public offering (IPO). By the end of next year, we will be ready for IPO.” Earlier in June, ShopClues Co-founder and CEO Sanjay Sethi had denied reports of the startup's merger with rival Flipkart.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Instagram introduces Snapchat-style 'Stories'
article: Instagram on Tuesday announced 'Instagram Stories' that lets users share videos and photos which will only be visible for 24 hours from the time of posting. Instagram Co-founder Kevin Systrom credited Snapchat for developing the stories format, adding that it's about putting "your own spin on it". The feature will launch on iOS and Android over the next few weeks.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Former Housing employee launches own startup 'Pinvest'
article: Former Sales Manager at real estate portal Housing, Jeeten Desai has launched a real estate investment advisory startup called Pinvest. The startup helps HNIs and Ultra HNIs to invest money in real estate globally. "Many HNIs are now looking to diversify their assets. We are trying to solve the liquidity problem in the real estate space," says Desai.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 1st private company gets US nod for moon mission
article: Space-exploration startup Moon Express on Wednesday became the first ever private company to receive permission by the US government to travel to the moon. The company plans to fly a suitcase-sized lander to the moon for a two-week mission in 2017. The spacecraft will carry some science experiments on its one-way trip.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: On-demand alcohol delivery startup raises $15 mn
article: US-based on-demand alcohol delivery startup, Drizly on Thursday raised $15 million in Series B funding led by Polaris Partners. The startup allows users to select the liquor, as well as see the delivery windows and prices from its retail partners. These partners can then receive orders and place deliveries with their own people, paying Drizly a slice of the transaction.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Gadget repair platform Repaireasy raises $275k
article: Pune-based gadget repair platform Repaireasy has raised pre-Series A funding of $275,000 from Morris Street Advisors and P Krishnamurthy among others. Founded in 2013 by Rishi Wahi and Naveen Goyal, it provides repair services for phones, laptops and tablets with free pickup and delivery. It also provides corporate services like IT assets audits, network security, and IT upgradation consultancy.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Uber completes 100 million trips in New York
article: Ride-hailing service Uber on Tuesday announced that the company has completed 100 million trips in the New York City. The official twitter handle of Uber NYC tweeted, "On June 30, 2012, we reached 1,000 trips in NYC. Today, we reached 100,000,000. Where to next, New York?" Notably, Uber completed 2 billion trips globally last month.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Startup lets use on-demand services without apps
article: US-based startup GoGoGrandparent has launched an alternative service to use on-demand services like Uber without smartphone apps. Part of Y Combinator's 2016 batch, the startup uses a hotline on which customers can call and book rides on Uber for an additional fee of $2.50. Using an automated phone-line, GoGoGrandparent aims to cater to older generations who lack familiarity with smartphones.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Farhan Akhtar-backed film discovery app raises funding
article: Actor Farhan Akhtar-backed film discovery app Flickbay has raised $890,000 in seed funding from Paul Roy, Chairman of Dubai-based Riva Digital. The app lets users discover movies, rate them and create personalised watchlists for Bollywood films, songs and trailers. Flickbay was incubated under movie production house Excel Entertainment, co-founded by Akhtar. He's also a stakeholder in the startup.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Threesome dating app '3nder' renamed post Tinder suit
article: 3nder, a dating app for people seeking threesomes, announced on Tuesday that it had rebranded to 'Feeld: Discover the Undiscovered' and also launched on Android. The company is currently fighting a lawsuit against Tinder over trademark infringement. Tinder had claimed that 3nder was purposely seeking to mislead Tinder users by using a similar name.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Women-focused job portal Sheroes raises $1.8 mn
article: Delhi-based online job portal for women, Sheroes on Tuesday raised $1.8 million in Series A funding led by Lumis Partners. The HR Fund and angel investor Rajul Garg along with existing investor, Raghav Bahl-led Quintillion Media also participated in the round. The startup had earlier raised $770K in an angel round in August 2015.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Uber to sell China business to rival Didi Chuxing
article: Ride-hailing app Uber is reportedly selling its China business to rival Didi Chuxing. The valuation of the combined company will be around $35 billion with investors in Uber China receiving a 20% stake in the combined entity. Didi Chuxing is also making a $1 billion investment in Uber at a $68 billion valuation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Is Tesla biting off more than it can chew, tweets user
article: Reacting to Tesla buying SolarCity in a $2.6 billion deal, a user tweeted, "Is #Tesla biting off more than it can chew?" Another user tweeted, "New power couple set a date." A user also tweeted, "An insider deal of two overvalued companies! #Tesla." "Can't wait to buy a car made out of solar panels!", read a tweet.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes wireless modular music system
article: A US-based startup has developed 'Sonic Blocks', a modular wireless music system that lets users swap the speakers, panels, lights, or expand the number of units. Priced at $199, the starter kit comes with the "brain" or computer base of the speakers which the users can customise to build a home theatre or office music system among other options.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Tesla minibus will be built on Model X platform
article: In line with Tesla CEO Elon Musk's master plan, the upcoming electric minibus will be built on the Model X platform. Confirming the development, Musk tweeted, "Some good guessing by Jalopnik. The Tesla Minibus will be built on a Model X chassis. People density potential is surprisingly high." Earlier last month, Musk had revealed a fleet of Tesla electric vehicles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Boat that folds up like a suitcase developed
article: A Belgium-based startup has developed a $1,110 boat called 'Onak' that folds up as a suitcase and unfolds in 10 minutes. Made from the startup's patented Honeycomb Curv Polypropylene material, the boat can stay afloat even when it is entirely flooded with water. The 183-inch long and 33.5-inch wide boat accepts weights between 200-250 kg.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We'll make Uber lose again: Grab CEO Anthony Tan
article: After Didi Chuxing announced buying rival Uber's China business on Monday, Uber's Southeast Asia competitor Grab's CEO said, "They’ve (Uber) lost once, and we will make them lose again." Tan added, "We know that we are not here to only serve a privileged segment of users who can afford surge-pricing." Grab in August 2015 had received investment from Didi Chuxing.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla buys SolarCity in biggest solar power deal
article: Electric vehicles maker Tesla on Monday bought US-based solar energy company SolarCity in a $2.6 billion all-stock deal, making it the biggest ever solar power deal to date. SolarCity stockholders will receive 0.11 share of Tesla for each SolarCity share. The combined entity will make solar panels, home battery storage systems and electric cars under a single brand.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber CEO explains why he sold China biz to Didi
article: After Uber announced selling its China business to rival Didi Chuxing, Uber's Co-founder and CEO Travis Kalanick said, "Uber and Didi are investing billions of dollars in China and both companies have yet to turn a profit there." Kalanick added, "If you've the opportunity to build both Amazon and Alibaba at the same time, you’d be crazy not to try."

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Salesforce buys word processor Quip for $582 mn
article: Salesforce on Monday announced the acquisition of word processing app startup Quip for $582 million. Founded in 2012, Quip has raised $45 million in funding so far and is in direct competition with Google Docs, Sheets, Microsoft's Word and Excel. Quip Co-founder and CEO Bret Taylor was previously the CTO at Facebook after the social network acquired Taylor's startup FriendFeed.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Yepme plans to have 75-100 outlets by Diwali: CEO
article: Yepme's Co-founder and CEO Vivek Gaur on Monday said that the online fashion retailer is planning to have 75-100 offline stores by Diwali this year. Gaur added, "From the four outlets in Gurgaon, we're doing five times more than what we do from online sales in the same city." Yepme will be expanding in Noida, Meerut, Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Ludhiana and Latur.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grofers gets legal notice on revoking job offers
article: Hyperlocal grocery delivery startup Grofers, which revoked the job offers of 67 students in June, has received a legal notice collectively sent by 20 students. The last date to reply to the legal notice is this Friday. Grofers had revoked the offers "owing to market conditions and changes which affect their business.”

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Virgin Galactic gets licence for commercial spaceplane
article: Spaceflight company Virgin Galactic has obtained licence from the US Federal Aviation Administration for flight-testing its commercial spaceplane SpaceShipTwo. The spaceplane is designed to take passengers into the sub-orbital space. SpaceShipTwo is the second version of the original spaceplane, which suffered a crash during a test flight in October 2014.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Uber was losing $1 billion a year in China
article: In an interview in February, Uber CEO Travis Kalanick said, "We’re profitable in the USA, but we’re losing over $1 billion a year in China." About local competition from Didi Chuxing, he added, "We have a fierce competitor that’s unprofitable in every city they exist in, but they’re buying up market share." Didi Chuxing acquired Uber's China business on Monday.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart sneakers made to help catch Pokémon
article: New York-based startup Vixole has created a pair of smart sneakers called 'Matrix' that helps Pokémon Go mobile game players to catch Pokémon. The sneakers sync with the game's app and sends notifications to the users of nearby Pokémon. The sneakers are also embedded with LEDs to display various Pokémon figures.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Uber has no effect on drunk driving: Study
article: According to a study, Uber and other app-based ride-hailing services have had little effect on fatalities due to drunk driving. The researchers studied 2005-14 data on drunk driving-related, and holiday-specific traffic fatalities in 100 most-populated areas in the US. Previously, Uber had claimed that ride-hailing services have reduced drunk driving cases.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes smart wearable camera for dogs
article: A US-based startup has created 'PawsCam', a smart wearable camera for dogs to let owners keep track of their pets. The bite-proof and water resistant camera detects interesting movements such as standing up, rolling, chasing, jumping, licking, or barking and shoots 6-second shareable videos. The camera's battery lasts for up to 10 days on a single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Didi Chuxing confirms buying Uber's China business
article: Taxi-hailing service Didi Chuxing on Monday confirmed that it is buying rival Uber's China business. Uber will get a 5.89% stake and its existing Chinese investors will receive 2.3% of the newly merged business. While Uber will maintain its branding, app and business operations, Didi will be responsible for the managerial and technological experience of the two companies in China.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: HealthKart raises $12 million from Sequoia, Kae
article: Gurgaon-based platform to buy health supplements and fitness equipment, HealthKart on Monday raised $12 million in Series E round of funding from existing investors Sequoia Capital India, Kae Capital and others. Founded in 2011, HealthKart currently has two offline stores and has plans to set up seven-eight more stores in the next six months.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Did Apple just grab a slice of Uber, tweets user
article: Reacting to acquisition of ride-hailing service Uber's China business by rival Didi Chuxing, a user tweeted, "Did Apple just grab a slice of Uber?". Another user tweeted, "Smart deal. Win Win for everyone except for Olacabs". "Uber begins its long march to becoming Yahoo", read another tweet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Privacy flaws found in fertility tracking app Glow
article: Privacy flaws were discovered in women's fertility tracking app Glow, developed by a US-based startup. The privacy loophole let hackers access personal information including data and comments about users’ sex lives, menstrual cycles, e-mail address, location, history of miscarriages, abortions and other health details. However, the issues were later resolved by the developers.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Ad-blocking web browser raises $4.5 million
article: Brave Software has raised $4.5 million in funding to continue the development of its open source web browser which blocks ads and other trackers while surfing. Founded by former Mozilla CEO Brendan Eich, it claims to offer 40-60% speed increase on desktop and 200-400% on mobile devices. It also supports fingerprint shields, phishing protection, malware filtering and encrypted data traffic.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart bracelet made to track women's fertility
article: US-based startup Ava Science has created a smart bracelet called 'Ava' that helps women track their fertility. The bracelet identifies an average of five fertile days per cycle, doubling the women's chances to conceive. While its sensors gather physiological data points including body temperature to detect the fertile window, a dedicated app gives women an insight about their menstrual cycle.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Quikr shuts down CommonFloor's Flatchat office
article: Six months after acquiring real estate portal CommonFloor, Quikr has shut down the Bengaluru office of flatmates finding app Flatchat owned by the portal. Quikr has offered Flatchat employees to join one of its portfolio companies and move geographically. According to an employee, Quikr gave Flatchat employees a month's notice without any severance package.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart CEO invests in packaged food startup YumLane
article: Mumbai-based packaged food startup YumLane has raised $1 million in seed funding round led by Flipkart Co-founder and CEO Binny Bansal. People Group Founder Anupam Mittal, MakeMyTrip Co-founder Sachin Bhatia and Darius Pandole, partner at private equity firm New Silk Route, also invested in the round. Launched in March this year, the startup currently has 10 retail outlets in Mumbai.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IIM-B entrepreneurship summit to begin from Aug 6
article: IIM Bangalore's entrepreneurship summit 'Eximius 2016' is set to begin from August 6. The two-day summit would be a platform for entrepreneurs to showcase their ideas through events including pitching to VCs, workshops and panel discussions. Author and leadership consultant Devdutt Pattanaik and actors Kunal Kapoor and Piyush Mishra will be attending the summit.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla app to let owners share their cars: Musk
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk on Friday said that the Tesla app will let owners allow others to drive their cars when they aren't using it. Owners will be able to add or subtract users from the 'shared fleet'. Announced last week, 'shared fleet' enables Tesla owners to make money for them when they aren’t using it.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jeff Bezos' net worth hits record high of $66.5 bn
article: Amazon Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos' net worth hit a record high of $66.5 billion on Thursday, after a ninefold increase in the company's net income led to a rise in Amazon's shares by 2%. With this, Bezos has become the third richest person in the world behind only Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates and Zara Founder Amancio Ortega.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes tech to charge phones using radio waves
article: US-based startup Radient Micro-Tech has received patents for a technology that charges phones by capturing energy from their radio waves. The concept aims to repurpose a phone’s screen into an energy harvesting antenna to absorb and reuse its own wasted radiated power and extend battery life by 30%. The company claims to be the first to patent "greener wireless charging".

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Startup develops smartphone-based eye test
article: New York-based startup Smart Vision Labs has launched the SVOne Enterprise, a device that lets users test their own vision using their smartphones. The device can measure both spherical and cylindrical errors in vision. The prescription can be downloaded after approval by a remote eye doctor.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart lays off 700-1000 employees: Report
article: Flipkart has reportedly asked 700-1000 of its underperforming employees, who represent 2.3-3.3% of the total workforce, to either resign or leave the company with severance pay. Flipkart in a statement said that the employees who don't progress despite being put on a performance improvement plan, are encouraged to seek opportunities outside the company where their skills can be better utilised.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rannvijay Singh backs styling app IStyleYou
article: Roadies winner Rannvijay Singh has invested an undisclosed amount in Gurgaon-based personal styling mobile app 'IStyleYou'. Rannvijay will also be endorsing the app. Launched in 2015 by Pallav Modi, Amit Kejriwal and Vinayak Khanijo, the app lets users chat with personal stylists who help them with apparel shopping on various online stores.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra CEO Narayanan to take over as Jabong CEO
article: Flipkart-owned Myntra's CEO Ananth Narayanan will also take over as the CEO of online fashion retailer Jabong, which the company acquired for $70 million on Tuesday. Jabong's outgoing CEO Sanjeev Mohanty has said that he will help in the transition process till mid-September. Mohanty in a letter to Jabong employees said the deal is the “birthing of a giant”.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Snapdeal ties up with Uber to enable cab booking
article: E-commerce marketplace Snapdeal has partnered with ride-hailing app Uber to let customers book cabs directly from the Snapdeal app. Uber India's Head of Business Mahesh Bhalla said, "This partnership with Snapdeal is the first completely native Uber API integration in India and we are excited about this.” Snapdeal has also partnered with Cleartrip, Redbus, UrbanClap and Zomato for their services.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: T Rowe Price marks down Flipkart valuation by 20%
article: Global investment management firm T Rowe Price has marked down its shares in Flipkart by 20%, valuing the company at $10.3 billion. However, another mutual fund investor Fidelity marked up the valuation of its Flipkart shares by 3%, valuing the company at about $9 billion. Flipkart was valued at $15 billion when it last raised funds in May 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Wireless charger that levitates phone mid-air built
article: Canadian startup AR Designs has built a wireless charger called 'OvRcharge' that not only charges a smartphone, but also levitates and rotates it mid-air. The charger consists of two parts - a magnetic charging base and a special phone case. It stops charging the phone when the battery is full but keeps levitating it until it is removed.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Home rental startup Square Plums raises $446k
article: Bengaluru-based home rental startup Square Plums on Wednesday raised $446,000 in a funding round led by Indian Angel Network (IAN). As a part of the deal, IAN investor VGN Prakash will join the startup’s board. Started in 2015 by BITS Pilani alumni Rajesh Kumar Kotta and Hemant Attray, Square Plums provides fully furnished ready to move in shared homes.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: SEBI to allow investing using digital wallets
article: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) is planning to allow investors to invest in mutual funds through digital wallets. It is in discussion with the RBI to frame regulations for the same. Earlier in June, SEBI also revealed its plans to allow online marketplaces such as Flipkart and Amazon India to sell mutual funds.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Uber, Didi Chuxing to be legal in China
article: Ride-hailing apps like Uber and Didi Chuxing will be legal in China from November, according to an announcement made on Thursday. Rules regarding payments, drivers' experience and user information have been laid out among others. The on-demand transportation industry in China is expected to be worth $200 billion over the next five years.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Shared housing startup Roomi rasies $4 million
article: US-based shared housing marketplace Roomi raised $4 million in seed funding led by DCM Ventures, taking their total funding to $6 million. The app lets users discover prospective roommates via Facebook profiles, and conducts background checks for security. Launched in June last year, Roomi has over 3,75,000 users across North America and plans to expand internationally.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes 'beef' burger from plant protein
article: Food startup Impossible Foods on Wednesday launched a vegetarian 'beef' burger, the 'Impossible Burger' which uses plant-based protein to give its burgers a meaty taste. The ingredients of the burger are water, wheat protein, coconut oil, and newly-discovered 'heme' proteins. Impossible Food claims the burger has protein and iron comparable to beef without the cholesterol and hormones.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: French startup raises $555k to make flying river taxis
article: French startup SeaBubbles on Thursday raised $555,000 in funding to build egg-shaped taxis flying above the river Seine to reduce traffic in Paris. The battery-driven taxis can travel for up to 80-100 km on a single charge. Expected to launch in 2017, the taxis will be available for booking through a dedicated app and will have their own docking ports.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla master plan will need modest capital raise: Musk
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk on Tuesday said that the company's master plan revealed last week will require only a modest capital raise. However, Musk added that the move could cost Tesla tens of billions of dollars over the long term. Musk's master plan includes Tesla's foray into making electric trucks and buses, as well as car sharing.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Paytm, Zomato in global breakthrough brands list
article: Mobile payment platform Paytm and restaurant discovery app Zomato have been included in a list of top 60 global breakthrough brands published by Interbrand. Other than these, a Gurgaon-based P2P lending marketplace Faircent has also been included in the Finance category. Approximately 200 brands were nominated, out of which only 60 were finalised to feature in the 'Future Growth' report.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Nikesh Arora’s tenure cost SoftBank $300 million
article: Japan's SoftBank bore $300 million (31.5 billion yen) in compensation and related expenses during its former President and COO Nikesh Arora's two-year tenure. In a statement on Thursday, the company booked about $65 million in expenses arising from Arora’s resignation in June. As of 2015, Nikesh Arora was the highest paid executive in Japan according to Bloomberg estimates.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Genomics startup raises $10 mn to test fertility
article: Computational genomics startup Phosphorus has raised $10 million in a Series A funding round led by FirstMark Capital. The startup tests couples for signs of infertility, lets them take preventive measures against potential infertility and informs them when it's safe to start trying to conceive. Its FertilityMap processes genetic data which is useful for both physicians and users.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: No lay-offs expected at Jabong, says Myntra CEO
article: Reacting to Flipkart's acquisition of Jabong for $70 million earlier this week, Myntra CEO Ananth Narayanan said on Friday, "As of now, we have no reason to believe that there will be any lay-offs." He added, "This transaction will provide Jabong employees an opportunity to shape the future of fashion e-commerce at a larger scale."

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Startup makes self-cleaning smoothie machine
article: San Francisco-based startup Replenish has made a self-cleaning smoothie machine that takes in customised cups of different flavours and blends it to make the smoothie. It comes with specially formulated ingredients to make certain smoothie flavours. Replenish is still in the testing phase, but has been launched as a part of a pre-order campaign at select locations.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Chai Point to launch smart tea dispensing machines
article: Bengaluru-based tea retail chain Chai Point is launching Internet of Things-enabled tea dispensing machines 'boxC' for corporate offices. Connected to a cloud-platform, the machines will be accessible to customers who can keep track on the functioning and the billing process. Chai Point's CEO Amuleek Singh Bijral said, "Unlike regular tea machines, boxC will make tea from natural tea leaves."

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: E-commerce to create 12 mn jobs in 10 yrs: HSBC
article: Around 12 million jobs will be created in India's e-commerce sector over the next 10 years, according to an HSBC study. It also estimated that the number of people employed in e-commerce will grow by 700% by 2020. About 70% of those jobs will be in logistics and delivery, while the remaining will be in customer care, IT, and management.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Baidu records largest profit drop in 11 years
article: Chinese web services company Baidu on Friday reported the largest drop in profits since its IPO that took place 11 years ago. Baidu reported a net income of $363.2 million for Q2 2016, down 34.1% year-on-year. The profit drop was reportedly triggered by a public enquiry following the death of a man who took a cancer treatment advertised on its service.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Book praised by Elon Musk sold out on Amazon
article: A history book from 1929 titled 'Twelve Against the Gods' by William Bolitho has sold out on Amazon after Tesla Co-founder Elon Musk praised it on Thursday. Musk, who is currently reading the book, said, "It's really quite good”. The price of a secondhand copy of the book went up from $6.35 to $99.99 before it was sold out.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola responds to Kejriwal's parody Twitter handle
article: Taxi-hailing service Ola recently replied to a parody Twitter handle of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal which goes by the name '@TrollKejri'. The handle tweeted to Ola, "@Olacabs Modi ji mujhe maarne ke lie tumse gaadi maangne aayenge. Dena mat." In response, Ola tweeted, "@TrollKejri Looks like his trip has just ended. You're on your own, buddy! Cab chahiye kya?"

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Good quality beats celebrity influence: Survey
article: According to a survey by coupons and cashback platform CashKaro, celebrities as brand ambassadors fail to entice customers unless the product that they endorse delivers. The survey including 1,000 participants aged between 20-30 years, also concluded that 35% people prefer online shopping over offline mediums. Further, 71% participants said that the discounts and deals make them shop online.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Flipkart acquires fashion e-tailer Jabong
article: Flipkart on Tuesday announced the acquisition of fashion e-commerce platform Jabong through its unit Myntra for an undisclosed amount. Jabong, which went live in 2012, has been looking for a buyer following reports of its investors being unwilling to infuse fresh capital. "Welcome @JabongIndia to the @Flipkart family. We'll create history together", Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal tweeted.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra will kill it: Ex-Flipkart CPO on acquisition
article: Reacting to Flipkart's acquisition of Jabong, the company's former Chief Product Officer Punit Soni said, "In India, if there is one place where there is a guaranteed win: it's Myntra. They will kill it. They are the big winners." However, he also said, "If I was forced to invest all my money in one company today, it would be Amazon."

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: India is youngest startup nation: Commerce Min
article: India is the world's youngest startup nation with 72% of the founders below the age of 35 years, the Commerce and Industry Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Saturday. Claiming that startups are the country's "next big economic force", Sitharaman added that around 4,400 technology startups exist in India, and this number is expected to reach over 12,000 by 2020.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Workspace rental startup Qdesq raises funding
article: Gurgaon-based workspace rental startup Qdesq on Monday raised an undisclosed amount of angel funding from a clutch of angel investors. Existing investors including Redcliffe Capital's Partner Dheeraj Jain also participated in the round. Founded in 2015 by Paras Arora and Lavesh Bhandari, the startup provides ready-to-move in offices in Gurgaon and Delhi-NCR.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jabong sell-off to help us get profitable: GFG
article: Rocket Internet-controlled Global Fashion Group (GFG), which sold Jabong to Flipkart for $70 million on Tuesday said, "The transaction will de-consolidate our highest loss-making operation while delivering capital that can be deployed in high-return opportunities across GFG’s footprint.” According to GFG, Jabong accounted for 13% of the group’s net revenues and 22% of adjusted EBITDA loss.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Govt to invest ₹200 crore to scale up incubators
article: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant on Saturday said that the government will identify 10 startup incubators out of existing 200 such centres and invest ₹200 crore to scale up their capacity by 10 times. Each selected incubator will receive ₹20 crore. Kant added, "We're going to open 100 new incubation centres this year. We have received 3,000 applications for it.”

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup to send people's letters to Army on Aug 15
article: Hyderabad-based startup that specialises in providing surprises, Oye Happy will be sending people's personalised letters to the Army soldiers at the Indo-Pak border on the Independence Day. The startup claims to trek the Himalayas to personally deliver the letters to the soldiers. A dedicated portal has been launched by Happy Oye to let people submit their letters.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jabong would be a terrific asset: Myntra CEO
article: After Flipkart-owned Myntra acquired Jabong on Tuesday for $70 million, Myntra CEO Ananth Narayanan said, "When we thought of we can continue shaping the fashion and lifestyle market, we thought Jabong would be a terrific asset." He added, "While it’s an acquisition, I actually look at it as a partnership.” The two companies will continue to function as different brands.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart took 3 days to acquire Jabong
article: According to Ganesh Prasad and Vinay Joy, Partners at Khaitan & Co, which advised Flipkart in its $70 million Jabong acquisition, "The deal was signed in less than three days from start to finish." They added, "It was quite exhausting and challenging...Though Flipkart has been in the fray from start, but things picked up pace on the weekend."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Quikr acquires online recruitment startup Hiree
article: Online classifieds platform Quikr on Monday acquired Bengaluru-based online recruitment firm Hiree for an undisclosed amount. Hiree will be merged with the startup's jobs vertical QuikrJobs, and will work out of Quikr headquarters. Founded in 2014 by former Yahoo executives Manjunath Talwar and Abhijit Khasnis, Hiree is an online hiring platform focused on white collar jobs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: PT Usha joins Fitso as advisory head coach
article: Former Olympian PT Usha on Monday joined running and fitness app Fitso as an advisory head coach. Usha will overview all the training activities on the platform. "I always felt that health and fitness awareness was missing from Indian culture," said Usha. Launched in January, Fitso tracks users' fitness, and helps them to lose weight and reach their fitness goals.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: NDMC nod to Atal Incubation Centre for startups
article: The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has cleared a proposal to set up 'Atal Incubation Centre' for startups. NDMC will assist 20 startups to nurture their idea by providing basic amenities like internet connectivity, conference rooms and libraries. A fund of a ₹12.5 lakh will be given to each startup under the project, according to senior NDMC officials.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jabong rode a rocket, landed in Flipkart, tweets user
article: Reacting to Flipkart buying Rocket Internet-backed Jabong for $70 million, a user tweeted, "#Jabong rode a rocket but landed in #Flipkart and #Myntra’s arms". Another user tweeted, "#Jabong is new #NeilNitinMukesh of IndianFashion Ecommerce." A user also tweeted, "I guess in some time #Flipkart will offer both #Myntra and #Jabong to #Amazon as a package deal...Buy one get one free."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Gift cards startup Qwikcilver raises $10 million
article: Bengaluru-based gift cards providing startup Qwikcilver Solutions on Monday raised $10 million in funding led by Sistema Asia Fund. Existing investors Amazon Asia-Pacific, Accel India and Helion Venture Partners also participated in the funding. Founded in 2007, the startup provides end-to-end stored-value-card solutions to its retail and corporate customers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nandan Nilekani funds e-commerce startup 10i
article: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani on Monday invested an undisclosed amount of funding in Bengaluru-based online commerce startup 10i Commerce Services. Founded in 2015 by Amit Sharma and Apoorva Jois, 10i provides technology, logistics and supply solutions to traditional small retailers. 10i has reportedly raised ₹25-30 crore so far from Nilekani, who also owns a minority stake in it.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Govt urges Uber, Ola to train women drivers
article: The government is in talks with taxi aggregators like Ola and Uber to train one lakh commercial drivers in India every year, with majority of them being women. It has urged the companies to set up driver training institutes in small towns to teach driving and passenger safety. The move will contribute to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 'Skill India' initiative.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Indian 'Tinder Plus' users swipe most in Delhi
article: Recent data released by Tinder shows that Indian 'Tinder Plus' users swipe the most in New Delhi, followed by Bangalore, Mumbai, Pune and Kolkata. Meanwhile, London tops the international destinations preferred by Indian users, followed by New York, Dubai, Los Angeles and Amsterdam. 'Tinder Plus' allows users to change their location while travelling, through the feature 'Tinder Passports'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart crate made to help dogs get rid of anxiety
article: Florida-based startup PNP Robotics has created a smart crate called 'ZenCrate' that helps dogs to get rid of anxiety. The crate automatically detects when a dog comes inside and begins playing calming music and turns on the fan. Further, the crate's vibration damping technology reduces the physical vibrations from the outside thunder or heavy machinery.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Self-driving suitcase that follows user created
article: A Chinese startup has developed a smart self-driving suitcase called 'Cowarobot R1' that follows its user while avoiding any obstacles in its path. The suitcase comes with a bracelet to be worn by the user, so that it remains within an arm's distance from the user. It also features an automatic lock that is operated by tapping on the bracelet.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Google-backed Chinese startup sells $200 smartwatch
article: Beijing-based AI startup Mobvoi, whose last funding round was led by Google, is set to sell its $200 smartwatch Ticwatch 2 in US in September. The watch's new version has a voice-activated search which responds to questions in English and users can order pizzas, book cabs and browse restaurants. Notably, this investment was Google's first direct investment in China.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Home-rental startup Fella Homes raises $2 mn
article: Gurgaon-based home rental service startup Fella Homes raised $2 million in seed funding from undisclosed investors. Founded in 2015, the startup provides fully furnished homes on per room basis to working individuals in metro cities. It is currently operational in Gurgaon and Noida and plans to launch operations in Bengaluru, Pune and Hyderabad by the end of 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart CEO writes to staff on Jabong takeover
article: After Flipkart acquired Jabong for $70 million on Tuesday, Flipkart's CEO Binny Bansal wrote a letter to employees which said, "This acquisition is a continuation of the group's journey to transform commerce in India." It further said, "Myntra and Jabong are all set to define the next generation of online shopping offering the best of brands to Indian consumers."

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Device to home-brew alcoholic beverage unveiled
article: US-based startup Alchema has designed a device to home-brew fruit-based alcoholic beverage cider. Users need to select a recipe from a dedicated app and follow the instructions to prepare the drink. The device has an in-built scale to notify users of the quantity of ingredients and also features a UV light system to kill bacteria.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyperlocal friends finder app WakoW gets funding
article: An app that lets user find friends with common interests near them, WakoW recently closed its second angel round of $141,000 funding from an undisclosed investor. Launched in June this year, the app lets users find people with whom they can do yoga, jog, party, carpool or play sports. It also has a dedicated section for the differently abled.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Flipkart CFO invests in cyber security startup
article: Delhi-based cyber security startup Lucideus raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Flipkart CFO Sanjay Baweja. The startup offers consultancy, training and solutions to counteract cyber attacks and has RBI, IBM and Microsoft as clients among others. Prior to this, the firm had raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Snapdeal’s former CPO Anand Chandrasekaran.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zoomcar raises $25 million in Series C from Ford
article: Self driving car rental service Zoomcar has raised $25 million in Series C round of funding from American automaker Ford Motor Company. Zoomcar's existing investor Sequoia Capital along with new investor, Reliance Ventures also participated in the round. With the latest funding, the Bengaluru-based startup has raised a total of $46.2 million in equity funding.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup's $99 accessory turns phone to a laptop
article: US-based startup Andromium has developed a $99 accessory called 'The Superbook' that claims to turn any Android smartphone into a laptop. The accessory, a laptop shell, provides a screen, keyboard, multi-touch trackpad, phone charging capabilities and eight hours of battery on a single charge. It allows users to create and edit documents, run apps installed on phone and write programs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla shares fell post Musk revealed Master Plan
article: Shares of Tesla fell by 3.4% to $220.50 a share on Thursday after Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk revealed his 'Master Plan'. Standard & Poor’s cut its rating on Tesla saying that the new plan may "create a short-term cash flow sink hole.” Musk plans to expand Tesla into car-sharing, electric trucks, buses and solar energy systems.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Pull a supermodel, become a billionaire, tweets user
article: Reacting to model Miranda Kerr announcing her engagement with Snapchat Co-founder Evan Spiegel, a user tweeted, "How to pull a supermodel.. Become a billionaire." Another user tweeted, "An attractive and wealthy man marrying a super model... How original #MirandaKerr." A user also tweeted, "Miranda Kerr marriage will last for less than a year."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New Tinder feature lets groups plan a night out
article: Dating app Tinder on Thursday launched 'Tinder Social', a feature that lets users invite Facebook friends to join a group, then swipe and match with other groups nearby to plan a night out. It is an opt-in feature, with users having the option to turn on regular Tinder and Tinder Social, or one version of the app at a time.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jeff Bezos becomes world's third richest person
article: Amazon Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos has toppled Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett to become the third richest person in the world with a net worth of $65.05 billion, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Bezos has surpassed Buffett's wealth by $32 million. Currently, the world's richest person is Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates with a net worth of $89.1 billion.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Teal unveils world's fastest production drone
article: US-based startup, Teal has unveiled what it claims is the world's fastest production drone. It can fly at speeds up to 112 kmph, has a two-mile range and 20-minute flight time and can withstand winds traveling at 64 kmph. The $1299-drone features a 13 MP 4K camera and offers built-in apps for controlled flying, racing and follow mode.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Dog food e-tailer raises angel funding
article: Bengaluru-based natural dog food e-tailer Dogsee Chew has raised ₹2 crore in an angel round of funding. The startup was launched in 2015 and provides healthy and organic options for dog food sourced from manufacturers in the Himalayan region. The Dogsee Chew bars are made from yak's milk to maintain food's nutritional balance.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Inter-city taxi provider Wiwigo raises funding
article: Delhi-based inter-city taxi provider Wiwigo has raised ₹4 crore from Indian Angel Network and two other high net worth individuals. Founded in 2014 by Sunil Chaula and Nilesh Pawaskar, the startup offers round trip and multi-city travel bookings. Wiwigo's services are currently available in 40 cities in the country and has a network of 1,200 vendors with 5,000 cabs running.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hokey Pokey ice cream's parent firm gets ₹44 cr
article: The parent company of Hokey Pokey ice cream, Drums Food International on Thursday raised ₹44.5 crore in Series A round of funding led by Belgian investment firm Verlinvest. DSG Consumer Partners and existing investors - Fireside Ventures and Bollywood actor Kunal Kapoor also invested in the round. Hokey Pokey has presence in six Indian cities including Delhi, Mumbai and Bengaluru.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Video explains how Jeff Bezos built Amazon
article: A documentary by Bloomberg describes how Jeff Bezos used his 'get big fast' mantra to build Amazon. It tracks the company's growth since its inception, also explaining how Amazon survived the dot-com bubble in 2000 and posted profits for the first time in 2002. Jeff Bezos overtook Warren Buffett on Friday to become the third richest person in the world.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: SpaceX plans to land 3 Falcon rockets together
article: After successfully landing its Falcon 9 rocket on Monday, aerospace manufacturer SpaceX is seeking permission for two additional sites in Florida to land three rockets together. The landing sites are needed to recover the rockets from SpaceX's new launch vehicle Falcon Heavy, within minutes from one another. The company said it may attempt drone ship landings instead of ground landings.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup lets users pay for flight in instalments
article: A US-based startup named Airfordable lets travellers pay for their flight tickets in instalments. Travellers need to find their preferred flight online and upload a screenshot with their flight details. Airfordable makes a payment plan for up to three months that starts with an upfront deposit and ends before the traveller's flight takes off.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat Co-founder Spiegel's net worth is $2.1B
article: Snapchat Co-founder Evan Spiegel, who on Wednesday announced his engagement with former Victoria's Secret model Miranda Kerr, is currently valued at $2.1 billion by Forbes. The 26-year-old is also one of the world's youngest self-made billionaires. Spiegel founded the image messaging and multimedia app Snapchat in 2011 with his Stanford University friends Bobby Murphy and Reggie Brown.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startups to need only DIPP certificate for IPR gains
article: Commerce and Industry Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday announced that startups would now need only a Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion (DIPP) certificate to avail Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) benefits. Earlier, an entrepreneur had to approach an inter-ministerial board to procure the IPR benefits. The move is a part of the government's 'Start-up India’ action plan.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Food delivery startup BiteClub halts operations
article: Gurgaon-based online marketplace for chef-prepared meals, BiteClub, has halted its operations temporarily. Co-founder Prateek Agarwal said, "While scaling up we faced certain problems repeatedly. So we thought it is better to take a step back, resolve all the problems and then start.” BiteClub raised an undisclosed sum in December 2015 and ₹3 crore in March 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bengaluru job site posts ad for Pokemon Catcher
article: Bengaluru-based job site Babajob has posted an advertisement for a new job called 'Pokemon Catcher’ which promises a remuneration of ₹15,000 per month. The advertisement seeks to build a team of Pokemon Catchers for a self claimed ‘Pokemon Trainer’. "Physical fitness is a must, since the role involves running around town to catch ‘em all," says the job's description.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup Village named best incubator in India
article: Kochi's Startup Village has topped the '100 Best Startup Incubators in India' list released on Friday by the India edition of Entrepreneur Magazine. Since 2012, Startup Village has supported nearly 590 physical and virtual incubatees in Kochi and 200 in Vizag. The incubator in 2015 had received the National Award for Technology Business Incubator from the government.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Elon Musk reveals Tesla 'Master Plan'
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday unveiled plans to expand the company into car-sharing, electric trucks, buses and solar energy systems. The car-sharing feature would let Tesla owners add their cars to the Tesla shared fleet to generate income when their cars are not in use. Musk also announced that the electric trucks and buses will be unveiled next year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Treebo Hotels raises $16.7 million in funding
article: Bengaluru-based chain of hotels Treebo Hotels on Friday raised about $16.7 million in Series B round of funding led by Bertelsmann India Investments. Existing investors SAIF Partners and Matrix Partners India also participated in the round. Founded in 2015 by Sidharth Gupta, Rahul Chaudhary and Kadam Jeet Jain, the hotel chain currently has presence in 22 Indian cities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon Founder Bezos once worked at McDonald's
article: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos, who on Friday became the world's third richest person with a net worth of $65.05 billion, worked at McDonald's as a teenager. Bezos says, "My favourite shift was Saturday morning. I'd get a big bowl and crack 300 eggs in it." He once said, "You can learn responsibility in any job, if you take it seriously."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes ink that conducts electricity
article: Japanese startup AgIC has developed a pen called 'Circuit Marker' which uses a silver quick drying ink that conducts electricity. The pen allows users to draw electric circuits that can withstand up to 100 volts and power LEDs and motors. Priced at $14.99, the Circuit Marker is to be used on a special electronics-embedded paper which costs $37.49.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes levitating cup that floats mid-air
article: US-based startup Oak Bottle has made a $149 'Levitating Cup' that floats mid-air. It consists of two parts, a cup and a magnetic base that use the physics principles of 'Quantum Locking' to set itself afloat and spin 360 degrees in mid-air. The cup can be left suspended in air for up to eight hours on a single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Theranos customer sues startup over heart attack
article: US-based blood analysis startup Theranos has been sued by a former customer, alleging that the startup’s faulty blood tests led him to a heart attack. This is reportedly the ninth lawsuit against Theranos after a criminal investigation by the US government regarding its technology. Earlier this month, Theranos CEO Elizabeth Holmes was banned from running labs for two years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Man recreates 'Kabira' song to 'Startup Anthem'
article: Osho Jain, a student at Mumbai's True School of Music, has recreated the 'Kabira' song from movie 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani' to 'India's Startup Anthem' titled 'Mera Bhi Karobar'. The song is about the India's startup culture coming into existence and attracting the youth. The 3-minute and 30-seconds song also explains how an entrepreneur thinks about his business.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Miranda Kerr gets engaged to Snapchat Co-founder
article: Former Victoria's Secret model Miranda Kerr on Wednesday announced her engagement with 26-year-old Snapchat Co-founder and CEO Evan Spiegel. Kerr and Spiegel first met at a Louis Vuitton dinner in New York in 2014 and have been dating for one year. This will be 33-year-old Kerr's second marriage after previously being wed for three years to British actor Orlando Bloom.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rideable luggage made that travels at 13 kmph
article: US-based startup Modobag has developed a smart rideable luggage that has a top speed of 13 kmph. The luggage, which claims to get people to their destination three times faster than walking, is GPS-enabled for tracking purposes and comes with two USB charging ports. It features a padded seat, speed control settings and dual wheel braking system.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart watch tracks pregnant women's health
article: A Bengaluru-based startup IoTranic has made a smart watch for pregnant women called 'SaveMom'. It tracks the heart rate and sleep patterns of pregnant women, works without networks or bluetooth connectivity, has zero radiation and comes with a battery life of nine months. The watch stores all its data on a memory card, which can be shared with the doctor.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Audit reveals lapses by former Jabong executives
article: An audit conducted by investor Rocket Internet has revealed corporate governance violations by former top executives at Jabong. The investigated individuals included Jabong’s former MD Praveen Sinha, former CEO Arun Chandra Mohan and former Rocket Internet India MD Heavent Malhotra. Transfer of Jabong’s logistics unit GoJavas to an entity controlled by Sinha is also under the scanner.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MP may impose a 6% entry tax on online retailers
article: The Madhya Pradesh government is planning to impose a 6% entry tax on the online commerce firms by amending the legislation to increase its revenue. The government will introduce a bill in the upcoming monsoon session to amend the laws to bring such firms in the state's tax regime. It is expecting a revenue of ₹300 crore from the move.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart locker collects package in owner's absence
article: Estonian startup Cleveron has launched its smart locker 'PackRobot'. Packages submitted by the delivery persons are stored by the locker and a unique QR code is sent to the package receiver on their smartphones. Owners can receive their packages by presenting the code to the locker. With a capacity to store over 500 packages, PackRobot comes with climate control adjustments.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyperloop One countersues Co-founder for $250 mn
article: A week after Hyperloop One Co-founder Brogan BamBrogan sued the company over alleged harassment, his former partners have countersued him for at least $250 million. The suit claims that BamBrogan with three other employees attempted to start a competing venture, 'Hyperloop Two', adding that BamBrogan filed a "sham complaint" after his "attempt to seize control of the Company" failed.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber completes 2 billion rides
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber has completed more than two billion trips on its platform six months after hitting its first billion. Interestingly, the company took five years to complete one billion rides. As revealed by Uber CEO Travis Kalanick on Monday, 147 rides started at the same second in 16 countries to tie for the two billionth trip.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: CaratLane appoints its employees as Co-founders
article: In a first for an Indian startup, online jewellery store CaratLane on Monday appointed two of its employees as Co-founders. Avnish Anand, Senior VP of product and category, and Gurukeerthi G, Senior VP of technology, have become the Co-founders of CaratLane along with Mithun Sacheti, Founder and CEO. "They are as important to the business as I am," said Sacheti.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Video: Self-driving electric pods concept unveiled
article: A one-minute video unveils Italy's NEXT Future Transportation's self-driving electric pods concept, forming a modular transport system. Pods can drive individually or attach to one another like a bus, whose full-scale prototype was launched last month. Each pod can accommodate upto 10 passengers, and offers value added services like food and drinks which can be booked via a mobile app.

author: Pragya Swastik
