abstract: Unilever buys Dollar Shave Club for $1 billion
article: Multinational consumer goods company Unilever has agreed to buy men's grooming products startup Dollar Shave Club in a deal worth $1 billion. The acquisition marks one of the biggest online commerce deals in the recent years. Founded in 2011, the US-based startup delivers razors and other personal grooming products to men on a subscription basis.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Smart tag launched to track keys, wallets at ₹1k
article: Bengaluru-based startup Gida has launched 'Yoky Tag', a smart device priced at ₹1,000 that can be attached to keys or wallets to track them using Bluetooth. Conversely, users can also find their phones by shaking the tag thrice. The tags have a maximum range of 250 feet and beep loudly if the tagged belongings go out of range.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Uber to get detailed hi-res satellite imagery
article: Uber on Tuesday announced a partnership with a satellite imaging company DigitalGlobe to get high resolution satellite imagery for its services. The detailed photos can reveal changing topography of modern cities with clarity and immediacy which helps in navigation and route planning. DigitalGlobe offers its imagery services to Apple, Google and the US government.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Autorickshaw-hailing app AUTOnCAB shuts down
article: Gurgaon-based autorickshaw booking app AUTOnCAB has shut down its operations owing to competition from its rivals. Launched in 2014, the startup laid off 40 employees in the process. “Uber and Ola have been offering a lot of discounts and incentives...We did not want to burn cash unnecessarily,” said the startup's Co-founder and CEO Vinti Doshi.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 70% of startups will fail: Kris Gopalakrishnan
article: Infosys Co-founder Kris Gopalakrishnan recently said that almost 70% of startups globally will fail and only 5-10% will become large and scale up. Kris added, "This should not, however, be treated as a concern or a challenge, but it is a part of natural process of evolution." He also said that Flipkart and Snapdeal "have made a mark".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla Autopilot issue may fix through an update
article: Following a crash that killed a driver, Tesla will release a software update that may fix the Autopilot issue in its cars. "Promising call today with @BoschGlobal, maker of our radar sensor. Looks like significant improvements possible via OTA software update," tweeted Tesla's Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk on Monday. The US government is running an investigation regarding the crash.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Paytm wallet allows booking of Renault KWID
article: Renault India and Paytm announced a strategic tie-up on Tuesday which provides users the opportunity to book all variants of Renault's KWID on Paytm for ₹10,000. The users can also pay the booking amount at the dealerships using their Paytm wallets. Currently available for the Delhi-NCR area, the companies plan on extending the partnership at pan-India level soon.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra to acquire Hrithik's clothing brand HRX
article: Online fashion retailer Myntra is buying a majority stake in actor Hritik Roshan's clothing and shoes brand HRX. Myntra did not disclose the financial terms of the deal but said that the transaction will be completed in the next few weeks. HRX is also planning to launch offline stores in India, followed by other countries in West Asia.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Online jewellery store BlueStone raises $30 mn
article: Online jewellery store BlueStone on Monday raised $30 million in Series D round of funding led by Accel Partners and financial services firm IIFL Holdings. Kalaari Capital, RB Investments and IvyCap Ventures also participated in the round. Founded in 2011 by Gaurav Singh Kushwaha and Vidya Nataraj, BlueStone lets users buy gold, diamond, gemstone and other jewellery through its platform.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Govt sets incubation cell for export startups
article: The Centre on Monday set up an incubation cell at the Indian Institute of Foreign Trade to offer "support" to export startups. The initiative named KITTES (Knowledge for Innovation in Trade and Technology for Entrepreneurial Start-ups), will allow start-ups to expand their business to foreign markets. Further, it will offer expert advice and technical guidance to entrepreneurs at one place.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ayoo Jabong. Why this Kolaveri D? tweets user
article: Reacting to Rocket Internet's audit revealing corporate governance violations at Jabong, a user tweeted, "Ayoo Jabong. Why this Kolaveri D?" Another user tweeted, "Story of billion dollar company wd zero corporate governance. Story of frauds wd German precision Jabong & GoJavas." A user also tweeted, "Indian #Startup scene shadiness continues to baffle me."

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Video: Electric van outruns Tesla and Ferrari
article: Silicon Valley startup Atieva released a video of its electric van prototype 'Edna' outrunning a Tesla Model S and a Ferrari California in a drag race. Atieva claims 'Edna' sports a 0-100 kmph time of just over three seconds and delivers 900 HP to its four wheels. Interestingly, Atieva has a number of former Tesla employees in its ranks.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla drops 'Motors' from its web address
article: Electric vehicles maker Tesla has dropped 'Motors' from its web address. The company had reportedly acquired the new web address earlier this year and started shifting its employees' emails to the new domain. Earlier this month, Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk had tweeted, "Working on Top Secret Tesla Masterplan, Part 2. Hoping to publish later this week."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Illegal wildlife trade on Amazon, Snapdeal: Govt
article: Government on Monday said illegal trade of rare animals and their body parts is happening through websites including Amazon, Snapdeal, Quikr, Olx, eBay and others. Environment Minister Anil Madhav Dave furnished a list of 106 such websites in the Rajya Sabha, collated by the Wildlife Crime Control Bureau. The websites are being monitored by the government to combat cyber crime.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup designs weather sensor to aid farmers
article: US-based startup Arable has developed Pulsepod, a solar powered crop and weather sensor to reduce agricultural risks. The device measures rainfall, crop water demand, light and heat levels, and even the colour of berries to determine harvest-readiness of the crops. Farmers are reportedly already using Arable’s hardware and cloud-based software to calculate harvest timing and potential yield.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Former Coca-Cola executive launches food startup
article: Shripad Nadkarni, former marketing head at Coca-Cola India is launching a food startup named 'Fingerlix' with an initial investment of $1.3 million from Maverix Platforms. The startup will sell ready-to-cook foods such as curries, batter and mixes in Mumbai. The items will be sold across general trade and retail stores like Big Bazaar and Reliance Retail.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I have done nothing wrong: Jabong Co-founder
article: Reacting to accusations of violating corporate governance at Jabong, the fashion marketplace's Co-founder and former Managing Director Pravin Sinha said, "I have done nothing wrong." Jabong's parent investor Rocket Internet recently conducted an internal audit on the transfer of Jabong’s logistics arm GoJavas to an outside entity QuickDel Logistics. Notably, Sinha holds 50% stake in QuickDel.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: NowFloats acquires chat-based platform LookUp
article: Hyderabad-based startup NowFloats which creates websites for Small and Medium Businesses on Monday acquired business-to-customer chat platform LookUp. LookUp’s core team is expected to join NowFloats next week. Founded in 2014, LookUp had raised $5.8 million from Infosys Co-founder Kris Gopalakrishnan and Twitter's Biz Stone among others but was reportedly unable to raise follow-on rounds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber gifts jumpsuits to babies born in its taxis
article: Uber, which completed 2 billion rides on Monday, has a policy of gifting jumpsuit or onesie to babies born in or through the help of its taxis. Onesies are also given to expecting mothers who take Uber to visit hospital when in labour or bring their babies home from the hospital. Drivers who encounter these scenarios are also reportedly rewarded.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup gives holiday on Rajini's Kabali release
article: Chennai-based data management startup Fyndus has declared a holiday on July 22, on the account of release of actor Rajinikanth's movie 'Kabali'. The move is an effort to avoid piled up leave requests to the human resources department for the day. The startup is also providing free movie tickets to all of its employees to support anti-piracy.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Silicon Valley startup hiring Pokémon Go experts
article: A Silicon Valley-based billion dollar startup named Thumbtack is hiring experts in mobile game Pokémon Go. The startup has launched a new 'Pokémon Go Help' category where it is providing an online marketplace for expert services in the game. The service lets users hire an expert to help them with tips and tricks to perform better in the game.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App made to suggest users what to wear every day
article: A New York-based startup has developed an app called 'Tailor' that suggests users what to wear every day. It uses miniature sensors called ‘TailorTags’ which are embedded in the user's clothes to detect and track the garments worn on a daily basis. The app learns the user's style and gives suggestions based on the day's weather and occasion.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Startup makes wine without grapes, fermentation
article: San Francisco-based startup Ava Winery claims that it can turn water into fine expensive wines without using grapes, yeast or any kind of fermentation. The company, currently focused on replicating three wine clones, analyses molecular profiles of the wines and then reconstructs them as a bioidentical match. The startup was founded in April this year and has raised $2.5 million.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Travel Boutique Online partners with Fxkart.com
article: B2B travel portal Travel Boutique Online (TBO) on Thursday entered into a strategic partnership with Fxkart.com, an online aggregator of foreign exchange dealers. The partnership will allow travel agents from TBO to make foreign exchange bookings for customers. Travel agents will be able to access forex rates instantly on Fxkart.com's network of over 250 RBI authorised money changers across India.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup fights fake products using invisible ink
article: Kodak and Alibaba-backed startup, eApeiron, offers invisible and digitally traceable markers for brands to ensure authenticity of their products. The mark, which cannot be removed, is not visible with either UV or visible light to safeguard against counterfeiting. Other products include tagging systems with unique signature profiles for tracking products throughout the supply chain.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Gadget tells users where to apply sunscreen
article: US-based startup Voxelight has developed Sunscreenr, a portable viewer that shows users where they've missed a spot when applying sunscreen or where sunscreen has worn off. Looking through Sunscreenr, users will be able to see dark areas that are covered with sunscreen, and light areas that are vulnerable to sun damage. The waterproof viewer can be pre-ordered for $109.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SpaceX successfully lands its Falcon 9 rocket
article: SpaceX on Monday successfully landed its two-stage Falcon 9 rocket. The landing marks the second time SpaceX recovered a rocket on land and their fifth recovered first stage in all. A Dragon capsule was perched on the top of the rocket carrying 2,267 kg of supplies for six crew members working at the International Space Station.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Yatra announces merger at a valuation of $218 mn
article: Online travel platform Yatra has announced merger with Nasdaq-listed special acquisition firm Terrapin 3 Acquisition Corporation (TRTL) in a deal which will value the former at $218 million. However, Yatra will continue to be led by Co-founder and CEO Dhruv Shringi post the merger. The company plans to list itself on Nasdaq following the completion of the transaction in October.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon's Alexa wouldn't work in India: Flipkart
article: Flipkart's Chief Technology Officer Peeyush Ranjan in an interview said that he does not believe that Amazon's voice-based assistant Alexa will work in India. Ranjan added, “The problems that we see over here (in the US) are not what we see in India." He further said, "The real challenge we’re going to have to solve is bigger than Alexa.”

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Quikr launches on-demand beauty service
article: Online classifieds portal Quikr has launched an on-demand beauty service called ‘AtHomeDiva’ within its category of QuikrServices. The launch follows Quikr’s recent acquisition of in-home beauty service provider, Salosa in May. AtHomeDiva includes services like skincare, bodycare, haircare, make-up and special beauty packages. It is currently available on Quikr app and website.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: ShopClues acquires mobile payments startup Momoe
article: Gurgaon-based online marketplace ShopClues on Friday acquired mobile payments startup Momoe Technologies. ShopClues will reportedly use Momoe’s technology to boost digital payments on its platform. IDG Ventures, Jungle Ventures and India Quotient had invested $1.2 million in Momoe in 2014, and will receive cash and stock in ShopClues as part of the transaction.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kerala govt proposes rules for cab aggregators
article: Kerala government has come up with a draft policy for taxi aggregators like Ola and Uber operating in the state. Before the draft is converted into law, a discussion will be held with the respective stakeholders. The policy includes rules like mandatory license to ply cabs, 24×7 call centre service for customers and panic button in the app among others.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Autopilot was off in Pennsylvania crash: Musk
article: Tesla's Elon Musk on Friday tweeted that the Tesla Model X which crashed in Pennsylvania on July 1 had autopilot disabled during the crash. The accident wouldn't have occurred if autopilot was on, he added. This came after a US Senate Committee called out Musk, seeking answers about the autopilot technology and how the company is educating drivers about it.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal founders deny layoffs in Bengaluru
article: Snapdeal founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal have denied reports of laying off 150 employees at the startup's Bengaluru office. "Journalism hits a new low with absolute fiction being peddled as news headline!" tweeted Rohit Bansal. Reacting to the reports, Kunal Bahl tweeted, "Complete nonsense! "Skeptics" turning to fabricating facts for more tech gloom-doom masala."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon CEO to appear in the next Star Trek movie
article: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos will appear in the upcoming Star Trek movie 'Star Trek Beyond'. Bezos has a one-scene cameo in the movie, where he plays a “Starfleet Official”. "He had to wait around all day because it was one day we were shooting like three different scenes...he just nailed it every time," said Star Trek director Justin Lin.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mumbai gets startup co-working space 'Garage'
article: A startup co-working space named 'Garage' was opened in Mumbai on Friday by JetSynthesys, a digital technology company backed by Infosys Co-founder Kris Gopalakrishnan. The Wi-Fi enabled co-working space has a capacity of about 170 seats with options for private offices, conference room, events centre and personal lockers. It can be rented by startups on a weekly or monthly basis.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Employees save money to gift CEO a Tesla car
article: Dan Price, Co-founder CEO of US-based credit card payment processing company Gravity Payments, was recently gifted a Tesla car by his employees. Price in 2015 had raised wages of 120 employees to a minimum of $70,000 in a year. The CEO had also reportedly doubled the wages of some employees and slashed his own compensation from $1.1 million to $70,000.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: GirnarSoft acquihires Valueserve in a cash deal
article: GirnarSoft, the parent company of auto portals such as CarDekho, Gaadi and Zigwheels, has acquihired Valueserve Management Consultants in a cash deal. The move marks a diversification of the company to cater to the public sector by providing e-governance solutions, consulting and management support services. Valueserve is GirnarSoft’s ninth deal in the last two years.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 'Tesla's Autopilot too much, too soon'
article: Consumer-advocacy organisation Consumer Reports has called Tesla's Autopilot system "too much autonomy too soon". The blog urges the automaker to disable hands-free feature until its system can be made safer. Laura MacCleery, Vice President of Consumer Policy and Mobilisation of Consumer Reports said, "By marketing their feature as ‘Autopilot,’ Tesla gives consumers a false sense of security".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: RentoMojo raises $5 million from IDG, Accel
article: Bengaluru-based home appliances and furniture rental startup RentoMojo on Wednesday raised $5 million from existing investors including IDG Ventures and Accel Partners. The new funding comes after the startup raised $2 million in pre-Series A funding last year. Founded in 2014, the startup lets users rent furniture and home appliances in Delhi-NCR, Mumbai, Bengaluru and Pune.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber investigators admit to lying during probe
article: Ergo, the CIA-linked intelligence firm which Uber hired to investigate the plaintiff in one of its lawsuits, has admitted to lying and illegally recording phone calls during its probe. In a US court, Ergo’s investigator said he “dissembled and used false pretenses in his duties.” Uber is accused of a scheme to fix prices in violation of antitrust laws.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup raises $9.3mn to transfer data via light
article: Light communications technology startup PureLiFi on Friday raised $9.3 million (£7 million) in its Series B funding round led by Singapore-based investment company Temasek. The startup said that the new capital will be used to begin commercialising the light fidelity (LiFi) technology. This WiFi alternative uses modulating LED light to send data from one LiFi-equipped device to another.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ZopNow's CEO Mukesh Singh steps down
article: Grocery delivery startup ZopNow's Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer Mukesh Singh has stepped down from his position. Singh will now work on the technology-related operations of ZopNow. He will be replaced by Raj Pandey, a former Executive Director at JP Morgan. ZopNow's other Co-founder Bal Krishn Birla quit in 2013 and claimed of being wrongly ousted from the startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SpaceX postpones Hyperloop pod event till 2017
article: SpaceX has postponed its Hyperloop pod competition till January 2017. The startup said that the competition, originally scheduled for later this summer, is being delayed as many teams sought more time to refine their pod designs. The US-based company is developing high-speed transportation system 'Hyperloop One' that involves pods carrying passengers at speeds of over 1000 kmph in vacuum tubes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Public transport app Ridlr raises $6 million
article: An app that provides live updates about traffic and public transport services, Ridlr on Thursday raised $6 million in Series B funding from Times Internet, and existing investors Matrix Partners and Qualcomm Ventures. InnoVen Capital also participated in the round. Founded in 2010, Ridlr app also provides live timetable updates and booking options for metro, local trains and buses.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup applies for jobs on behalf of its users
article: US-based startup Mentat optimises users' LinkedIn and resumes, writes cover letters and applies to jobs on their behalf. By using machine learning to match job seekers with potential jobs, Mentat gives users a money-back guarantee that they’ll get at least one interview. The startup, which offers its services at $249, is also working to partner with educational institutions.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart LED bag that responds to music beats made
article: A New York-based entrepreneur has developed a smart LED bag called 'LiLu Smart Bag', which responds to music beats though various light formations. A dedicated app for the bag allows users to take control of the bag's LED panel, sensitivity towards music and check the bag's battery. LiLu is waterproof and claims to last for 10 hours on single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New iOS app turns users' photos into paintings
article: Russian startup Prisma Labs has launched a new photo-editing app on iOS named 'Prisma', that lets users convert their photos into paintings. The app currently has 34 different filters which draw inspiration from painters including Van Gogh, Picasso, Levitan and others. The startup has plans to launch the Android app by the end of this month.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart pillow 'Zeeq' lets users stream music
article: US-based startup REM-Fit has created a smart pillow named 'Zeeq' that comes with in-built speakers to let users stream music through their smartphones. While the users are asleep, the pillow tracks their motion and the volume of snoring to indicate the overall quality of their sleep. Further, a motor fitted inside the pillow vibrates to stop the users from snoring.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Online tailoring startup raises funding
article: Bengaluru-based online tailoring startup Urban Tailor on Wednesday raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Unitus Seed Fund. Founder of TRRAIN and Former MD of Shoppers Stop, BS Nagesh also participated in the round. Founded in 2015, the startup provides dress material stitching services for women and alteration services for both men and women with doorstep pickup and delivery facility.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla unveils cheaper Model X priced at $74,000
article: Tesla on Wednesday unveiled 'Model X 60D', a more affordable version of its Model X SUV with a starting price of $74,000, which is around $6,000 cheaper from the original model. The Model X 60D can go 0-100 kmph in six seconds, has a top speed of 210 kmph and allows travelling up to 320 kilometres on a single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Beauty startup Purplle raises $6 million
article: Mumbai-based beauty products and services platform Purplle today raised $6 million in Series B round of funding from existing investors led by JSW Ventures. Blume Ventures and IvyCap Ventures also participated in the round. Founded in 2012 by IIT alumni Manish Taneja and Rahul Dash, Purplle lets users buy beauty products and book salon and spa services through its platform.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra acquihires Bengaluru-based Cubeit
article: In its third technology focused acquisition, online fashion retailer Myntra on Monday acquihired Bengaluru-based content aggregation app Cubeit. As a part of the deal, Cubeit's team has been inducted into Myntra's technology team. Founded in 2014 by four IIT Gandhinagar alumni, Cubeit allows users to aggregate content from anywhere, and organise, view, and share it from one place.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hotel aggregator Find My Stay raises funding
article: Delhi-based hotel booking platform Find MY Stay has raised an undisclosed amount in Pre-Series A round of funding from Indian Angel Network. Founded in 2012 by Rohit Khetrapal and Simran Sial, the platform lets users book hotels, service apartments, bed and breakfast stays and guest houses. Its 'Your Stay At Your Price' feature lets users bid prices for their stays.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Food startup Twigly raises $600k in seed funding
article: Gurgaon-based food ordering portal Twigly on Wednesday raised $600,000 in seed round of funding. Tracxn Labs, Hyderabad Angels, FreeCharge's Kunal Shah, Flipkart's VP of Engineering Gaurav Bhalotia, partners at McKinsey and other angel investors participated in the funding. Founded in 2015, Twigly lets users order Italian, Asian and Continental cuisines through its app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyperloop Co-founder sues company for harassment
article: Former Hyperloop One CTO and Co-founder Brogan BamBrogan who quit last month, has sued the company and its Co-founder Shervin Pishevar over alleged harassment. BamBrogan accused defendants of violating labour laws and using Hyperloop to boost their romantic lives, personal brands and wallets. He also accused Shervin of dating Hyperloop’s PR vendor and increasing her salary from $15,000 to $40,000.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: WhatsApp Co-founder invests in 'Trak N Tell'
article: Gurgaon-based vehicle tracking solutions startup Trak N Tell has raised an undisclosed amount in Series A round of funding from a group of investors led by Brian Acton, WhatsApp Co-founder. Acton along with two other investors have reportedly invested ₹23.3 crore in the startup. Founded in 2009, Trak N Tell's technology enables users to track their vehicle's location and performance.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IITs may ban Stayzilla for revoking 9 job offers
article: Hotel booking platform Stayzilla may face ban from the All IITs Placement Committee (AIPC) for cancelling job offers of nine students out of 13 recruited from IIT Kharagpur. The institute has sought an explanation from Stayzilla and will discuss the issue at an AIPC meeting in August. Stayzilla's HR Manager said the offers were cancelled due to a recent reorganisation.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: 'Tesla being probed over its autopilot crash'
article: According to a Wall Street Journal report, the US Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating whether Tesla breached securities laws by not disclosing to its investors its autonomous car's fatal crash on autopilot in May. Reportedly, amid several state and federal ongoing investigations, it is still not clear if Tesla's Autopilot features contributed to or caused the accident.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Believers, not skeptics, build businesses: Snapdeal
article: Reacting to an article titled 'Snapdeal may die a slow and painful death', the startup's Co-founder and COO Rohit Bansal said, "Believers, not skeptics, build businesses." Bansal added, "We'll make mistakes, but we'll also make it right and create great impact." He further said, "The best is yet to come. We’ve just gotten started and covered 5% of the journey."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Working on top secret masterplan: Elon Musk
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Sunday tweeted, "Working on top secret Tesla masterplan, Part 2. Hoping to publish later this week." The tweet comes amid the ongoing investigations by the US government in two crashes involving Tesla cars. Interestingly, Musk in August 2006 published a blog titled 'The Secret Tesla Motors Master Plan' where he revealed plans for new cars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Discrimination biggest challenge for Airbnb: CEO
article: Airbnb's CEO Brian Chesky on Tuesday said the online home rental startup's biggest challenge is not the regulatory crackdown from cities such as New York, but blatant discrimination occurring on the company's platform. "There are racists in the world and we have to have zero tolerance," added Chesky. He also admitted that Airbnb was late to acknowledge and address discrimination.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ajay Piramal invests in taxi aggregator Utoo
article: Industrialist and social entrepreneur Ajay Piramal has bought a marginal stake in Chennai-based taxi aggregator Utoo. The investment has been routed through Piramal Group's private company Alpex Corporate Services. Founded in 2016, Utoo is in a soft launch phase and facilitates cab bookings through a dedicated app or over calls and text messages.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal ends ‘no questions asked’ return policy
article: Online retailer Snapdeal has ended its 'no questions asked' return policy on electronic products purchased through its platform. Buyers returning electronic items will now need to present a proof from an authorised service centre stating that the delivered item is defective, within seven days. Returns or replacements will be accepted only for those items which are declared as defective.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: In Musk we trust, tweets a user
article: Reacting to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's top secret masterplan, a user tweeted, "In Musk We Trust.  Kill the short sellers and all the negative nellies Elon.  We proud shareholders back your plan!" Another user tweeted, "Is it conquer the world or a car that can fly?" A user also tweeted, "Your own cologne? You could call it Elon Musk."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla has no plans to disable Autopilot: Musk
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk has said that the company has no plans to disable the Autopilot feature in its cars. "A lot of people don’t understand what it is and how you turn it on,” Musk added. Musk's statement comes amid the US government's ongoing probe into a couple of Tesla crashes believed to be caused by Autopilot.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart engineers to fix phone glitches at home
article: Flipkart provides a service where engineers are sent to the homes of the customers who face problems with their smartphones purchased through the platform. The engineers try to resolve the smartphone issue or initiate a return on the customer's behalf if the product is found to be faulty. Launched in March, the service is currently available in 10 cities.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Paytm offers loans to auto drivers, kirana shops
article: Online payment platform Paytm on Monday announced that it has started offering working capital loans of ₹10,000- ₹1,00,000 to kirana stores, auto and taxi drivers, milk cooperatives and other merchants who accept payments through Paytm. The merchants' credit profiles based on their transaction histories will be shared with third-party financial institutions like Capital Float for risk assessment.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: eBay acquires predictive analytics startup
article: E-commerce giant eBay on Monday announced the acquisition of Israel-based predictive analytics startup SalesPredict that leverages advanced analytics to predict customer buying behaviour and sales conversion. Although the terms of the deal were not revealed, eBay stated that the move is an effort to make itself better understand how to reach those looking to buy from its online marketplace.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Vernacular social network ShareChat gets $1.35M
article: Bengaluru-based social networking app that allows interaction in regional languages, ShareChat on Wednesday raised $1.35 million in funding led by SAIF Partners. Existing investor India Quotient also participated. Launched in 2015 by IIT-Kanpur alumni, the app lets users share and discover content like jokes, videos and songs in languages including Hindi, Telugu, Marathi, and Malayalam.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ibibo buys majority stake in Peru-based Busportal
article: Online travel company Ibibo Group today acquired a majority stake in Peru-based bus ticketing platform Busportal for an undisclosed amount. The investment in Busportal will give Ibibo Group’s bus ticketing platform redBus an entry into Latin American markets including Peru, Colombia and Chile. In June 2013, Ibibo acquired a controlling stake in redBus, valuing it at around $140 million.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup offers trips to surprise destinations
article: US-based travel startup Pack Up + Go plans vacations for travellers without revealing the destination until they are about to depart. The startup books the trip based on a survey taken by users to choose their budget, travel dates, and other preferences. Only the weather forecast of the destination and recommended items to pack are disclosed a week before.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola gets show cause notice over surge pricing
article: Three weeks after Ola obtained operating licence from Karnataka's transport department, it has received a show cause notice for bringing back surge pricing in Bengaluru. The notice states that Ola continued to charge customers beyond the fare fixed by the government. The department has also termed the startup's Ola Shuttle service illegal.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: News discovery app SmartNews raises $38 million
article: Tokyo-based news aggregation app SmartNews on Thursday raised $38 million in its Series D round of funding led by the Development Bank of Japan. The startup, which has raised $88.2 million till date, is now reportedly valued at $500-$600 million. The app’s algorithm delivers curated news content from the internet to its users based on their reading activity.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Virgin Galactic to resume public spaceship tests
article: Commercial spaceship startup founded by billionaire Richard Branson, Virgin Galactic will resume test flights of its new spaceship 'Unity' from August this year, while attached to an aircraft. It is scheduled to begin independent, fully powered flights next year. The company's flights have been grounded since October 2014, after its 'SpaceShipTwo' broke up in mid-air, resulting in a fatal crash.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber suspends services to protest violence in US
article: Uber on Friday night suspended its services for a minute in the US to protest against the recent race and gun violence in the country. A message on the app said, "You’ll see a peace sign in our app. As we move around our cities this weekend, let’s take a moment to think about what we can do to help."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ratan Tata named top angel investor of 2016
article: After investing in 14 startups this year, Ratan Tata has topped the list of active angel investors in 2016, compiled by VCCEdge. Artha India Ventures Managing Partner Anirudh A Damani and Aarin Capital Chairman TV Mohandas Pai were ranked second and third respectively. FreeCharge's Kunal Shah, TaxiForSure's Raghunandan Gangappa and Infosys' Kris Gopalakrishnan were also featured in the list.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart suitcase that transforms into vehicle made
article: Iranian startup IKAP-Robotics has developed 'Olive', a smart interactive suitcase that can be transformed into a vehicle to carry its user. Connected through an app, the suitcase allows users to set reminders, charge devices through in-built USB port and get information about its weight. The suitcase can also be locked or unlocked remotely and tracked in real-time through the app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Dont Scratch Your Head raises $250k in funding
article: Ahmedabad-based SaaS startup Dont Scratch Your Head (DSYH) on Wednesday raised $250,000 in seed funding led by Venture Catalysts and Zaffiro Ventures. Founded in 2015, the startup connects online commerce companies to their sales channels, orders, inventory data under various heads. This helps the companies to improve productivity, understand financials, increase profits and scale.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US regulator probes yet another Tesla crash
article: The US regulator is investigating a Tesla Model X car crash that took place on July 1 in Pennsylvania, injuring the driver and a passenger. "We have no reason to believe that Autopilot had anything to do with this accident," said Tesla. The company is facing another probe against a fatal car crash that happened on May 7.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Snapchat sued over sexually explicit content
article: Snapchat is facing a class-action lawsuit for showing sexually explicit content to minors without providing proper warnings. A fourteen-year-old and his mother filed the lawsuit in California after he came across several X-rated posts on the app's 'Discover' section. However, a company spokesperson claimed that their 'Discover' partners have editorial independence.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: One startup out of 571 selected for tax benefits
article: In the second round of the inter-ministerial meeting under the Startup India Action Plan, only one startup has been selected out of 571 applicants for a three-year tax benefit. Kanpur-based Bhurak Technologies has fulfilled the criteria under the same. In the first round held in May, Hyderabad-based renewable energy startup Cygni Energy was the only startup selected among 200 applicants.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Facebook Messenger allows booking UberPOOL in US
article: Facebook Messenger on Friday announced that it will let users in the United States to book and share UberPOOL rides through its service. A car icon or More (three-dots) option in an open Facebook conversation can be used to request a ride. The driver's arrival time, name and car model will be sent to the users on their Messenger.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Starship's robots to deliver food in London
article: Self-driving robots made by UK-based startup Starship Technologies will start delivering orders of European food giant Just Eat in London in the next few months. Starship was founded by two Skype Co-founders. The six-wheeled robots come with theft-prevention and nearest inch tracking features. To receive their meals, people will need to provide a secure access code to the robots.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Housing CFO Ritesh Jain quits, opens new startup
article: Real estate platform Housing's Chief Financial Officer Ritesh Jain has resigned to launch his own startup named FlexiLoans. Co-founded with Manish Lunia and Deepak Jain, FlexiLoans is an online lending platform that provides loans to SMEs. Confirming Jain's departure, Housing CEO Jason Kothari said, "We're excited and supportive about his passion to start a new innovative entrepreneurial venture."

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: US startup delivers packed suitcases for travel
article: A startup in the United States called unPack packs and delivers everything its customers will need during their travel directly to their hotel, so that their customers can travel without their luggage. The startup also offers its customers the option to choose their size and clothing style, and its service costs $20 per day.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup's tech to control computer with eyes
article: A Silicon Valley-based startup named 'Eyefluence' is working on a technology that would allow users to control their computer screens with their eyes. The technology includes a pair of eye-tracking augmented reality glasses equipped with cameras that preview the computer's screen. It allows users to click on icons with a glance and send messages by dictating.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AeroMobil unveils new flying car prototype
article: Slovakian startup AeroMobil has put a flying car prototype 'AeroMobil 3.0' on display from July 7 to August 1 in Brussels. The car fits into any standard parking space and can take off and land using both grass and paved surfaces, just a few hundred metres long. The vehicle also features autopilot mode and an advanced parachute deployment system.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Open to joining forces, says Housing CEO Kothari
article: Responding to merger and acquisition talks involving real estate platform Housing, the startup's CEO Jason Kothari said, "If it’s beneficial for us to join forces with someone, we would be open to it." Kothari added, "We have a lot of those options on the table, but at the same time we’re also confident about our position as a standalone business.”

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Dating app for lesbian women launches on Android
article: 'Her', a dating app for lesbian women, was launched on Android on Friday. The app lets its users, aged 18 and above, stay updated about LGBT meet-ups and parties happening near them. 'Her' was originally launched in 2013 in the UK on iOS and is available in over 10 countries now.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Theranos CEO banned from running labs for 2 yrs
article: Elizabeth Holmes, Founder and CEO of blood analysis startup Theranos, was banned for two years from operating a blood testing lab. Theranos had claimed that it could detect health ailments by testing blood drawn through a finger prick. Later, a review of its practices found that all 81 patient results the company inspected in a blood clotting test were inaccurate.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Y Combinator picks 3 local startups for 1st time
article: Making it by far the largest representation of Indian startups at Y Combinator, the American seed accelerator has picked three Indian startups for a three-month programme. The startups include co-working space Innov8, car rental platform JustRide and app to create Facebook shop, Meesho. Y Combinator typically invests $120,000 in startups for a 7% equity stake across two batches every year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: If you want to sue us, sue us: Alibaba's Jack Ma
article: Responding to an ongoing probe by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) regarding Alibaba's accounting practices, Founder and Executive Chairman Jack Ma said, "If you want to sue us, sue us." Ma added, "It's an opportunity for us to let them understand what we're doing." He further informed that Alibaba has provided SEC with everything it had asked for.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google buys image recognition startup Moodstocks
article: Google on Wednesday announced that it has acquired Moodstocks, a startup based out of Paris that develops machine-learning based image recognition technology for smartphones. Terms of the deal were not disclosed and it’s not clear how much Moodstocks had raised. Moodstocks said that its current paying customers will be able to use its services until the end of their subscription.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Autopilot user safer than regular driver: Tesla
article: Responding to the fatality believed to be caused by Tesla's Autopilot mode, the company released a statement which said, "Customers using Autopilot are statistically safer than those not using it at all." Tesla added, "To be clear, this accident was the result of a semi-tractor trailer crossing both lanes of a divided highway in front of an oncoming car."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart worker arrested for stealing 12 iPhones
article: A 21-year-old delivery boy at a Flipkart warehouse in Chennai was recently arrested for swapping 12 iPhones worth ₹5 lakh with fake models. He ordered the phones from fake addresses, swapped them with the fake ones, and returned them to the warehouse. Flipkart noticed that majority of the returns were happening from one particular area and initiated an internal investigation.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Paytm to sell Xiaomi smartphones from today
article: Mobile payment and e-commerce platform, Paytm will start selling phones by Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi from July 8. The company's latest offering, Mi Max will also be made available on Paytm starting July 13. As part of the alliance, Mi India will open a brand store on Paytm to create a smartphone and accessories portfolio.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba's Ant Financial named top China unicorn
article: Alibaba's affiliate and online payments service provider Ant Financial has been named the top unicorn in China in terms of valuation, according to a list compiled by Chinese data analytics firm iResearch. Smartphone maker Xiaomi and taxi-hailing app Didi Chuxing were ranked second and third respectively. DJI, Uber China, Meizu, Letv and Baidu were also featured in the list.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Overcart raises $3 million in Series A funding
article: New Delhi-based startup Overcart on Friday raised $3 million in a Series A funding round from JSW Ventures, Omidyar Network, Sattva Capital, and Venture Works. Founded in 2012 by Alexander Souter and Saptarshi Nath, Overcart operates an online marketplace for over-stock, unboxed, refurbished, and preowned products across electronic categories.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Car repair and servicing startup raises funding
article: Bengaluru-based car repair and servicing startup Pitstop on Friday raised seed funding from Goldbell COO Alex Chua, and Rahul Garg, Founder of Moglix. Pitstop lets users place their car service request online, track its progress, get notifications regarding updates, and pay for the services. The startup has also tied up with local garages to help users find the nearest dealers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Women's fertility tracking app raises $6 million
article: An app to let women track their fertility, Natural Cycles on Monday raised $6 million in Series A funding led by Swedish venture fund Bonnier Growth Media. Existing investors Sunstone and E-ventures also participated in the round. Founded in 2013, Natural Cycles is a subscription-based app that analyses women's body temperature to tell them when they are ovulating and fertile.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mukesh Bansal's new startup raises $15 million
article: Mukesh Bansal and Ankit Nagori, who quit Flipkart in February this year, have received $15 million in Series A funding for their startup CureFit. The funding was led by Accel Partners, IDG Ventures and Kalaari Capital. Scheduled to launch in early 2017, CureFit will provide end to end solutions to people's healthcare needs and offer sports and fitness services.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla driver killed in crash with Autopilot mode
article: In the first known fatality in a Tesla where Autopilot was active, a Model S driver was recently killed in a crash with a tractor trailer on a highway in Florida. The National Highway Transportation Safety Administration is investigating the incident. "Our condolences for the tragic loss," tweeted Tesla CEO Elon Musk.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Making Alibaba life's biggest mistake: Jack Ma
article: Chinese online commerce giant Alibaba's Founder and CEO Jack Ma in an interview said, "My life's biggest mistake was I made Alibaba." Ma added, "I was just trying to do a small business and it grew this big...every day is as busy as a President." Ma further said, "In my next life I would never do a business like this."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mohandas Pai invests in drone startup SwarmX
article: Former Infosys CFO and currently the Chairman of Manipal Global Education, TV Mohandas Pai has invested an undisclosed amount in Singapore-based drone technology startup SwarmX. Founded in 2015 by Roger Chang, 	Nigel Wylie and Pulkit Jaiswal, the startup has developed a drone base station called 'SwarmX Hive' that allows users to manage a fleet of drones from a single interface.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BookMyShow raises over ₹550 crore in funding
article: Bigtree Entertainment, which owns online entertainment ticketing platform BookMyShow, on Tuesday raised over ₹550 crore in its fourth and largest single funding round. While US-based Stripes Group led the funding, existing investors - Network 18, Accel Partners and SAIF Partners also participated in the round. This funding has reportedly valued Bigtree Entertainment at more than ₹3,000 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Axis Bank sets up incubator for fintech startups
article: Axis Bank has launched an innovation lab facility called 'Thought Factory' to accelerate fintech startups that develop technology solutions for the banking sector. Located in a 10,000 sq ft area in Bengaluru, the lab has an in-house innovation team and a three-month accelerator program. After three months, an Investor Day will be organised to facilitate funding for the shortlisted startups.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: DVD player recovered from crashed Tesla car
article: Florida Highway Patrol officials said on Friday that they have recovered a DVD player from the autopilot active Tesla Model S car which collided with a truck trailer in May. Whether the portable DVD player was operating at the time of the crash has not been determined. Tesla is facing an inquiry over the crash which killed the car's driver.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba launches system to remove fake products
article: Chinese online commerce giant Alibaba on Friday launched 'IP Joint-Force System', an online system to track and remove fake products from its shopping platform. This comes after Alibaba Founder and CEO Jack Ma stated last month that counterfeit goods have no place on its platform. Notably, Alibaba was removed from the Washington-based International AntiCounterfeiting Coalition earlier this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: FB's Kirthiga Reddy invests in Wedding Wishlist
article: Chennai-based wedding gift registry portal Wedding Wishlist on Monday raised $297,000 in seed funding led by Facebook's Kirthiga Reddy, Multiples Equity founder Renuka Ramnath, Cherrytin and others. Founded by Kanika Subbiah, the startup lets couples create a list of things they want, share it with their guests, and receive the gifts according to their delivery preferences.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Happily Unmarried raises ₹5 crore from Info Edge
article: Delhi-based gifting startup Happily Unmarried has raised ₹5 crore in an all stock deal from Info Edge. This leads to Info Edge's total investment in the startup to ₹21.3 crore, raising its stake to 48% in the startup. Launched in 2003, Happily Unmarried makes gifts, organises music festivals and works with corporate houses for branding, communication and interiors.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Meru accuses Uber of breaking the law
article: Meru Cabs has accused Uber of breaking the law in a blog post which said, "First break the law – then use billions of dollars of funding to kill the competition through unrealistic and predatory pricing to consumers and massive incentives to drivers." Earlier in June, Ola in a blog post said that Uber is disrespectful of the law.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jessica Alba's startup in no rush for an IPO
article: US-based consumer goods startup 'The Honest Company', founded by actress Jessica Alba and three others, is in no rush for an IPO said Jeremy Liew, a board member at the startup. Founded in 2011, it lets users buy over 100 products for babies, personal care, and wellness. Investors valued Honest at $1.7 billion in a financing round last year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup develops personal health robot for home
article: A US-based startup has developed a $599 personal health robot for home called 'Pillo'. The artificial intelligence-based robot recognises family members and manages their medicines by storing, dispensing, and ordering refills. While it can wirelessly connect with other smart devices, the robot also answers health and wellness questions and connects users to healthcare professionals.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sensor turns any surface to music, gaming device
article: A London-based startup has developed a smart sensor called 'Mogees Play', that turns any surface into a musical and gaming device. The sensor needs to be plugged into a smartphone or a tablet and then attached to any object. It senses vibrations in the objects when they are touched and converts them into sound or displays action on a screen.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: The law is the law: Ola COO Jivrajka on Uber
article: Reacting to Uber's statement of being as foreign as its competitors, Ola COO Pranay Jivrajka published a blog titled 'The law is the law'. Jivrajka said, "It's a shame that our competition has to fan a debate of nationalism to hide their identity of being a multi-national... It's not about foreign vs local but who is respectful of the laws."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zoox raises $200 mn to develop self-driving cars
article: Palo Alto-based startup Zoox has raised $200 million at a valuation of $1 billion to develop self-driving cars. The latest round of funding included investors Lux Capital and DFJ. Founded in 2014 by Tim Kentley-Klay and Jesse Levinson, Zoox is said to be building technology that could compete with Google’s self-driving cars and Cruise Automation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Government relaxes deposit norms for startups
article: The government has announced relaxation in the deposit norms for startups. Any advance of over ₹25 lakh to a startup from alternate investment fund, domestic venture capital funds as well as mutual funds has now been exempted from being treated as deposit. Earlier, any startup that received money from any person for over 365 days, was considered as a deposit.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Non-performers will have to leave: Snapdeal CEO
article: Snapdeal's Co-founder and CEO Kunal Bahl in a company meeting said, "Those who do not perform will have to leave." Earlier in February this year, 200 Snapdeal employees were put on notice citing performance issues. While reports suggest that the startup has seen a large number of employees exit in four months, Snapdeal said there had been no layoffs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Israeli startup makes smart gun lock 'Zore X'
article: An Israeli startup has made a smart gun lock 'Zore X' that allows quick access and provides tampering alerts to users. While the tampering alert is sent on the user's phone through an app, the lock prevents the gun from being loaded. It features a rotating dial to set a code that allows unlocking the gun even in the dark.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyperloop could cover 500 kms under 30 minutes
article: According to a new study, high-speed transport system Hyperloop One could get from Helsinki to Stockholm, which are around 500 kilometres apart, in less than 30 minutes at speeds more than 1000 kmph. Covering the same distance usually takes around 3.5 hours via an airplane or overnight through a ferry. It would cost $21 billion to build the transport system.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup DoorDash delivers beer with food
article: A US-based on demand food delivery startup, DoorDash on Wednesday started delivering beer, wine and other spirits with its orders in Southern California. To deliver alcohol to its customers, the startup has partnered with restaurants, breweries and liquor stores in the town. DoorDash said that it is planning to quickly expand the service to other cities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla told govt of Autopilot crash after 9 days
article: Tesla Motors on Wednesday said that it informed the government of the fatality in an Autopilot mode-activated Model S car nine days after it crashed on May 7. A probe was announced by the government on June 30. Notably, Tesla raised at least $1.46 billion from investors between May 18-19 through a stock offering.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba unveils its first smart car 'Roewe RX5'
article: Chinese online retail giant Alibaba on Wednesday unveiled its first smart car Roewe RX5 in Hangzhou. Jointly developed with automaker SAIC Motor Corp and launching in August this year, the SUV runs on YunOS and suggests alternate routes in case of road closures or traffic. Alibaba's CTO Wang Jian said, "You'll quickly see driverless car technology resulting from this platform."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Luxury 3D printer can print 4 materials at once
article: Paris-based startup Pollen AM has developed a $8,900 luxury 3D printer called 'Pam' that can print up to four different materials at once. It has a printing resolution of up to 40 microns and printing speed up to 400 mm per second. The printer comes with its own software named Honeyprint, which can be controlled by any device from anywhere.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyperloop One CTO Brogan BamBrogan quits
article: The Co-founder and Chief Technology Officer (CTO) of high-speed transport system Hyperloop One, Brogan BamBrogan quit the company on Friday. Former Senior Vice President of Engineering, Josh Geigel will be taking over BamBrogan’s role as CTO. Founded in 2014, the US-based startup Hyperloop One is working on developing vacuum pods that can travel upto 1,200 kmph.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Online pharmacy 1mg acquires lab aggregator Medd
article: Gurgaon-based online pharmacy 1mg on Monday acquired diagnostic labs aggregator Medd for an undisclosed amount. However, as a part of the deal, all the three founders of Medd - Arpit Kothari, Anurag Mundhada, and Era Dwivedi, have joined the 1mg team. Earlier in April this year, 1mg raised ₹100 crore in Series B funding led by Maverick Capital Ventures.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Virat Kohli launches new venture Stepathlon Kids
article: Cricketer Virat Kohli on Tuesday launched his new venture Stepathlon Kids that will help kids aged 8-12 years adopt a healthy lifestyle and make them aware about various health issues. A joint venture between Mumbai-based fitness startup Stepathlon Lifestyle and Kohli, Stepathlon Kids will conduct an annual 30-day pedometer-based virtual race, urging children to take 15,000 steps per day.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Smart measuring tape saves readings, voice memos
article: California-based startup Bagel Labs has created a digital measuring tape that can save measurements, record voice memos and send data to its companion mobile app. It features three different modes of measuring distances – string, wheel and remote. The device can be used to measure distances up to 10 feet using a string that can withstand up to 50 kgs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon named world's smartest company of 2016
article: Jeff Bezos-led online retail giant Amazon has topped MIT's annual list of the world's smartest companies of 2016 for combining innovative technology with an effective business model. Chinese web services company Baidu and the world’s largest DNA-sequencing company Illumina have been ranked second and third respectively. The list also includes Tesla Motors, Alphabet, Facebook, SpaceX and Snapchat.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Paytm scales same day delivery to 20 cities
article: E-commerce platform Paytm has announced to scale its online-to-offline same day delivery service to 20 cities for products like mobiles and large appliances. Under the O2O model, a consumer can search for products or services online and buy it through an offline channel. Notably, Paytm seeks to add around 10,000 sellers in the top 50 cities to this model.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup lets users book religious pilgrimage
article: A Gurgaon-based travel platform called 'ReligiousTrip' has introduced travelling services for devotees, tourists and seasoned travellers to visit religious destinations across India. The platform provides packages to visit places like Golden Temple, Mahabodhi Temple, Ajmer Sharif Dargah, Tirupati and Vaishno Devi. Besides packages, it also lets travellers book flights, hotels and cars separately.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jeff Bezos announces new Blue Origin facility
article: Blue Origin Founder Jeff Bezos on Tuesday announced a new facility in Florida, US to manufacture the company's orbital vehicles. The 7,50,000 square feet facility can accommodate manufacturing, processing, integration and testing of orbital rockets. Bezos stated that the new facility is expected to be completed by December 2017.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup creates face-recognising robot 'Cozmo'
article: US-based artificial intelligence startup Anki has created a palm-sized smart robot called 'Cozmo', that recognises and remembers people's faces. Anki claims that Cozmo can process more data per second than all the NASA Mars Rovers combined. It nudges users if they haven't played with it in a while, and its battery lasts up to two hours in a single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We are not shutting down: LazyLad Co-founder
article: Dismissing rumours of grocery shopping assistant LazyLad's closure, the startup's Co-founder Saurabh Singla said, "We are not shutting down.” Singla added that LazyLad has just pivoted its business model from B2C to B2B. He further said, “We had commitments for our hyperlocal model for Series A round, but yes it didn’t go as planned as the grocery market really crashed.”

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Device allows measuring sperm quality at home
article: US-based biotech startup Sandstone Diagnostics has got FDA clearance for its male fertility testing device called ‘Trak’. While the device enables users to measure semen quality at home, a dedicated app provides feedback and wellness advice on ways to improve and track sperm count. The startup will start shipping its product by the end of summer this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Meru Cabs raises $25 million from BCCL
article: Radio taxi service Meru Cabs on Thursday raised $25 million in funding from Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd's investment arm Brand Capital. The company is looking to raise an additional $75 million as part of its $100 million fundraising plan. Earlier in March 2015, Meru Cabs had raised $50 million from India Value Fund Advisors.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Time for change in focus: Snapdeal's Kunal Bahl
article: The Co-founder and CEO of online commerce platform Snapdeal, Kunal Bahl on Thursday published a blog titled 'Ecommerce: Time for change in focus, not conviction.' Bahl said, "Companies that continue to lose money per order will have a tough time sustaining in this market... In trying to be everything to everyone, companies will risk being nothing to no one."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hotel aggregator FabHotels raises ₹54 crore
article: Gurgaon-based hotel aggregator FabHotels on Tuesday raised over ₹54 crore in Series A round of funding from Accel Partners and RB Investments. Mohandas Pai’s Aarin Capital and Qualcomm Ventures also participated in the funding. Founded in 2014 by Vaibhav Aggarwal and Adarsh Manpuria, the startup lets users book hotels in over 15 cities including Delhi, Bengaluru, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Pune.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SoftBank faces enquiry over Arora's exit: Report
article: SoftBank is reportedly facing an enquiry from the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) over former President Nikesh Arora’s activities before he resigned last week. SEC is probing whether Arora had conflict of interest or engaged in questionable behaviour, as well as SoftBank’s disclosures to investors. However, the enquiry cannot make SoftBank or Arora face an enforcement action.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: It is going to be a grind from now: Nikesh Arora
article: In his first interview to Indian media after quitting SoftBank, Nikesh Arora talked about the Indian startup scene and said, "It is going to be a grind from now...people have to hire the right people and execute." Arora added, "They have to keep executing and make sure they don't run out of resources and money."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Stop playing with people's careers, tweets user
article: Reacting to startup Grofers cancelling 67 job offers, a user tweeted, "Dear startups, stop playing around with people's careers". Another user tweeted, "Amazing job @Grofers Removed the Careers page after the @YourStoryCo Coverage". A tweet also read, "Another of @grofers kaarnama!! 8 students from one college cheated at 1st step of career... Pathetic!"

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup gets $8.9M for food poisoning test tech
article: US-based startup Ancera on Tuesday raised $8.9 million in Series A round of funding to develop 'Piper', a device to test food poisoning and prevent recalls. Launching next month, the device is a small printer-sized instrument which uses disposable cartridges about the size of a smartphone. It can detect and quantify sickness causing bacteria salmonella within one to eight hours.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Travel platform offers tour of B'luru startups
article: Travel platform Explore Life Traveling is organising a guided tour of startups including Dunzo, Razorpay, Axilor Ventures and itself in Bengaluru. The tour participants will not only visit the startup offices, but will also meet its founders and employees. Scheduled to take place on 28 June, the startup tour costs ₹1,000 per person.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fintech startup Lendingkart raises ₹205 crore
article: Financial services startup Lendingkart on Tuesday raised over ₹205 crore in Series B funding led by Bertelsmann India Investments. Darrin Capital Management and existing investors Mayfield India, Saama Capital and India Quotient also participated in the funding. Founded in 2014 by Harshvardhan Lunia and Mukul Sachan, Lendingkart provides short term loans to entrepreneurs and small businesses.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SolarCity forms committee to review Tesla deal
article: SolarCity's board of directors has appointed a two-member committee to take a decision on Tesla's offer to acquire the company for $2.8 billion. The committee consists of SolarCity board members Donald Kendall and Nancy Pfund, who have no special connection with Tesla. Earlier, Tesla CEO Elon Musk and SolarCity's CTO Peter Rive had announced not to vote on the deal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grofers announces to fire 10% of its workforce
article: After cancelling job offers of 67 selected candidates, grocery delivery startup Grofers on Wednesday announced it's firing up to 10% of its workforce. "We are downsizing some of the teams given the market environment and our revised growth projections," said Grofers in a statement. Grofers founders Saurabh Kumar and Albinder Dhindsa also published a blog apologising for their decisions.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hacker names himself CEO on Oculus CEO's Twitter
article: Twitter account of Oculus Co-founder and CEO, Brendan Iribe was on Wednesday took over by a hacker who announced himself as the new CEO of the virtual reality company. "We here @oculus are very excited to announce our new CEO. @Lid !," tweeted the hacker. Earlier this month, Twitter accounts of Travis Kalanick, Mark Zuckerberg and others were also hacked.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart helmet navigates cyclists to destination
article: US-based startup Brooklyness has developed a $299 smart helmet for cyclists called 'Classon', which navigates riders to their selected location. It has indicator lights, which light up by sensing hand gestures. Further, cameras installed within the helmet record every ride, footage of which can serve as evidence during an accident.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal's former CPO invests in six startups
article: Anand Chandrasekaran, who quit as the Chief Product Officer of Snapdeal a month ago, has announced investments in six startups including Truce, MagicX, Lucideus, LoanCircle, Lernr and Rupeek. Chandrasekaran also plans to invest in five more startups by the end of 2016. He typically invests about $25,000 in each startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grofers cancels job offers of 67 candidates
article: Gurgaon-based on demand delivery service Grofers has cancelled job offers of 67 candidates who were scheduled to join the startup in July, owing to "market conditions." The candidates belonged to NIT Allahabad and Surathkal, BITS Pilani and Goa, and ISM Dhanbad. Some of the candidates were reportedly informed of the development two days before their joining dates.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indian gay couple in UrbanClap's photo shoot
article: As a part of its campaign to support the LGBT community, on-demand services startup UrbanClap organised a photo shoot of an Indian gay couple. The Bengaluru-based couple, Vaibhav Dalal and Sukanth, met on a social networking site and have been together for five years. "We hope it makes people realise we are as normal as anyone is," said Dalal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Airbnb sues San Francisco over new rental law
article: Online marketplace to list, find and rent vacation homes, Airbnb on Tuesday filed a suit against a new law that requires it to verify that its hosts have registered with the San Francisco city. Scheduled to come into effect on August 1, the law requires to Airbnb pay up to $1,000 per day for every unregistered listing on its platform.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Steph Curry's wife Ayesha launches food startup
article: The wife of NBA star Stephen Curry, Ayesha Curry has launched a food delivery startup called 'Gather', which will deliver ingredients and recipes weekly to the customers' doorsteps. The recipes will be inspired by meals Ayesha cooks for her family, including baby food. Earlier this month, she along with celebrity chef Michael Mina opened a pop-up restaurant in San Francisco.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Swiggy temporarily shuts its services in Kolkata
article: On-demand food delivery startup Swiggy on Monday announced that it's temporarily shutting down its services in Kolkata. The decision was made "owing to certain unavoidable operational challenges pertaining to our delivery fleet", Swiggy said in a statement. Since the start of 2016, Swiggy has reportedly received over ₹285 crore in funding.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Device made to transfer landline calls to mobile
article: French startup Invoxia has developed a $99 device called 'Voice Bridge', that transfers the users' landline calls to their smartphones or tablets through Wi-Fi. Plugged into the landline, the device also lets users choose a contact from their smartphones and dial it through the landline. Users can connect up to five of their devices to a single Voice Bridge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Counterfeit goods have no place on Alibaba: Ma
article: Chinese online retail giant Alibaba's Founder and CEO Jack Ma on Wednesday said, "Counterfeit goods are absolutely unacceptable, and brands and their intellectual property must be protected." Ma added, "Alibaba is only interested in supporting those manufacturers who innovate and invest in their own brands." Earlier this month, Ma stated that fake products are better than the real ones.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: 4 Chinese companies in top 5 VC fundings in 2016
article: According to analytics firm Tracxn's report of 50 largest VC fundings of 2016 so far, four out of the top five investments have been made into Chinese companies. Uber rival Didi Chuxing, Alibaba's Ant Financial, Suning Commerce Group and Meituan are the four Chinese companies in the list. Uber is the only non-Chinese company to feature in the top five.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes soccer ball that charges devices
article: New York-based startup Uncharted Play has developed 'Soccket', a soccer ball that can charge devices. The ball's mechanism captures human movement and transforms it into electrical charge. Once the ball is charged, users can plug their devices into the ball through a USB adapter. A 30-minute play with the ball can power an LED lamp for three hours.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zomato launches photo filters on its Android app
article: Zomato has launched photo filters on its Android app to let users edit their food pictures before posting it on the platform. The pictures can also be cropped, rotated and their brightness, contrast, saturation, colour overlay and vignette can be adjusted. A total of 17 different filters have been introduced on the app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Faraday to test self-driving cars in California
article: California Department of Motor Vehicles on Tuesday said that the US-based electric vehicles startup Faraday Future has been approved to test self-driving vehicles on public roads. Faraday plans to begin testing prototypes of its self-driving vehicles in California later this year. Faraday is one of the several Chinese-funded startups competing with Tesla in the premium electric vehicles segment.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nikesh victim of my desire to stay in power: Son
article: SoftBank's Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son admitted on Wednesday that former President and COO Nikesh Arora was a victim of Son's desire to hang on to power for a little bit longer. The 58-year-old Founder, Son had initially talked about stepping aside when he turns 60, naming Arora as his heir apparent. However, Arora resigned from his position on Tuesday.

author: Yash Kumar
abstract: Elon Musk is SolarCity's largest shareholder
article: Elon Musk, whose company Tesla is looking to acquire SolarCity, is the Chairman and the largest shareholder of SolarCity owning 23%. Interestingly, the company was also co-founded by Peter and Lyndon Rive, who are Musk's cousins. The acquisition will be an all-stock deal, valued as much as $2.86 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra tests 'Try on Delivery' service in B'luru
article: Flipkart-owned fashion marketplace Myntra is piloting a 'Try on Delivery' service on its orders in Bengaluru. Launched around two weeks ago, the service is available at select pincodes of Bengaluru. "We recognise that one of the barriers to buying fashion online is the lack of touch, feel and trial factor," said Manish Pansari, Vice President of Supply Chain at Myntra.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zomato admits that its app is outdated
article: Zomato on Wednesday admitted in a blog post that its app is outdated. "We have a confession to make. Over the last two years, we’ve been so busy with our international expansion that we let the basic USP of our core product, search and discovery, suffer a fair bit," the company said. Zomato has started personalising its app for users.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber rolls out upfront fares in India
article: Uber has announced that users will be able to see upfront fares of their rides before booking a cab. Users have to enter the destination and the fare will be calculated on the basis of expected travel time, distance, traffic and tolls. The company will do away with the surge pop-up screen and factor in surge in the upfront price.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: InMobi fined $950k for tracking users' location
article: Mobile advertising platform InMobi has been fined $950,000 by the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) for deceptively tracking locations of hundreds of millions of consumers without their knowledge or consent. The locations were tracked for geo-targeted advertising. "InMobi is subject to a $4 million penalty, which is suspended to $950,000 based on the company’s financial condition," said FTC.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Line struggles to show its growth plan can work
article: Ahead of the biggest tech IPO of 2016, Line app is reportedly struggling to convince the fund managers of how its revenue strategy will work. They have also raised doubts over Line's expansion plans. "I went to the company's meeting with investors...but nothing moved me," said a fund manager. Line is set to raise about $1 billion through its IPO.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Karma is a bitch: Rahul Yadav on Arora's exit
article: SoftBank-backed Housing's Co-founder and former CEO Rahul Yadav said, “I have always liked him. He is very positive. But karma is a bitch,” over Nikesh Arora's exit from the Japanese multinational company. Arora, the former President and COO of SoftBank, was reportedly one of the investors responsible for Yadav's dismissal from Housing.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 500 Startups launches fund for Black founders
article: US-based early-stage VC firm, 500 Startups on Thursday announced a $25 million micro-fund for Black and Latino founders. The fund will invest in over 100 US-based companies and give them access to capital, networks, and expertise. It will be led by Monique Woodard, Venture Partner at 500 Startups and Co-founder of Black Founders.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Flipkart CEO Binny Bansal buys ₹32 crore house
article: Flipkart Co-founder and CEO Binny Bansal has purchased a ₹32 crore house in Bengaluru's Koramangala locality. The 10,000-sq-ft house is reportedly one of the most expensive residential deals in Bengaluru recently. The society houses other billionaires like Infosys Co-founders Nandan Nilekani and Kris Gopalakrishnan. Flipkart's Sachin Bansal also owns a house in the same locality.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup runs robotic pizzeria in Silicon Valley
article: US-based startup Zume Pizza runs a robotic pizzeria in the Silicon Valley. The pizzeria employs both, humans and robots, where humans create the dough and robots spread the sauce and put the pizzas in the ovens. The startup has also created special delivery trucks that cook pizzas on their way to delivery.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Knowlarity blocked by telco authorities in Delhi
article: Gurgaon-based cloud telephony startup Knowlarity's services have been blocked by the telecom authorities in Delhi owing to regulatory issues. The blockage has affected its clients in Delhi-NCR. The startup has also launched an online campaign called "#SaveCloudTelephony" seeking support from its users to get its services restored by the concerned authorities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Brexit gives a new vocabulary to Europe startups
article: A set of Brexit-styled words to describe the European startup scene after Britain voted to leave the EU were posted by TechCrunch on Monday. While 'Eurogeddon' describes fall in the startup fundings, 'Eurogration' means top entrepreneurs fleeing from Europe for brighter funding prospects. 'Berlinifacation' describes expectations from Berlin to become Europe's technology hub in the next five years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Elon Musk just gave himself a bonus, tweets user
article: Reacting to Tesla's offer to buy SolarCity for $2.8 billion, a user tweeted, "Elon Musk just gave himself a bonus." Another user tweeted, "From engagement to marriage #Tesla eyes #SolarCity." A user also tweeted, "Vertical Integration at its best." "Passing shareholder funds from one pocket to another," read a tweet.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Obama hints at venture capitalism as future plan
article: In a Bloomberg interview, US President Barack Obama said he might try venture capitalism once his term ends. "Well, you know, it’s hard to say. Just to bring things full circle about innovation—the conversations I have with Silicon Valley and with venture capital pull together my interests in science and organisation in a way I find really satisfying," he said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 10k firms at mercy of DoT official, tweets user
article: Reacting to startup Knowlarity's services being blocked in Delhi by telecom authorities, a user tweeted, "10,000 businesses at the mercy of 1 DoT Official. #startupIndia can't work without startups." Another user tweeted, "This is 21st century not 19s...system has to redefine." A user also tweeted, "How is it fair to use 'call Forwarding feature' for business activity and exploit telcos?"
