author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Delhi-NCR named India's most funded startup city
article: According to a Tracxn report, Indian startups raised $1.8 billion in the first six months of 2016, of which more than half was pumped into Delhi-NCR through 155 deals. While Bengaluru and Mumbai were ranked second and third, Pune and Hyderabad were ranked as the fourth and fifth most funded startup cities in the country.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startups can open foreign currency accounts: RBI
article: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) recently allowed startups with an overseas subsidiary to open foreign currency accounts with a bank outside India. The accounts will help the startups to credit foreign exchange earnings from exports and sales. RBI added that the balance in such accounts, to the extent they represent exports, should be returned to India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola gets licence to operate in Karnataka
article: Karnataka's transport department has issued a licence to Ola under the state's On-Demand Transportation Technology Aggregators Rules 2016, according to a senior transport official. The rules require cabs to have digital meters capable of printing receipts and fares not to be higher than that fixed by the state government. Notably, Uber is yet to obtain a licence from the government.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart ring made to track user's health and sleep
article: A Swedish startup has developed a $299 smart ring called 'BioRing', that tracks the user's calorie intake, stress level, steps taken, heart rate and sleep. It uses the collected data to create personalised health and fitness plans for the user. The app-based scratch proof and waterproof ring also vibrates and sends important health notifications on a user's smartphone.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Truck aggregator Dipper raises angel funding
article: Online truck aggregator and freight logistics marketplace Dipper on Tuesday raised an undisclosed amount in angel funding from unnamed investors. Founded in 2015 by Suryansh Jalan and Ayush Syal, Dipper connects truck owners with people seeking inter-city freight services, without charging commission. It also gives real-time location of freight to the users through a GPS-enabled dashboard.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Lingerie startup PrettySecrets raises $6 million
article: Online lingerie retailer PrettySecrets has reportedly raised $6 million in funding from Singapore-based VC fund RB Investments. Existing investor Orios Venture Partners also participated in the round. The startup last raised $2 million in Series A funding in 2014. Founded in 2011 by Karan Behal, PrettySecrets provides women's lingerie, sleepwear, swimwear, shapers and accessories.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Funding to mobile startups rose by 600% in 5 yrs
article: Funding to startups working across mobile reportedly grew over 600% from $3.7billion to $28.2billion over the last five years with early-stage startups clinching the majority of deals. The funding to such startups in 2015 grew by 75% year-over-year. The notable fundings this year include Didi Chuxing's $7.3 billion, Uber's $3.5 billion and Snapchat‘s $175 million.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart named India's most sought-after company
article: Online retailer Flipkart has topped LinkedIn's 'Top Attractors' list of the most sought-after companies by professionals across India. Amazon and Capgemini have been ranked second and third respectively. The list, released on Monday, featured a total of 25 companies including Google, Adobe, Ola, Snapdeal, Microsoft and Zomato among others.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SoftBank committee clears President Nikesh Arora
article: SoftBank on Monday announced a special committee of independent members of its Board of Directors has cleared President and COO Nikesh Arora from the allegations against him. Arora's track record and qualifications as President and heir apparent to SoftBank Founder Masayoshi Son was earlier questioned by a group of SoftBank investors. "I am pleased...the claims are without merit,” said Son.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Sudden exit. There's a movie script, tweets user
article: After SoftBank President and COO Nikesh Arora's resignation on Monday, a user tweeted, “Highest paid exec. Poster boy. Allegations. Clean chit by board. Sudden exit. There's a movie script in there somewhere.” “Just in time to be next RBI Guv," read a tweet. “Most expensive notice period," a user posted. “It’s raining resignations," another tweet read.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup makes smart ring with panic button
article: A US-based startup has developed 'Nimb', a $150 smart ring with a panic button to send alert to family, friends, nearby people, police and emergency services during a threat situation. The app-connected ring has a button which needs to be pressed to send emergency alert to the pre-selected contacts. It also sends the user's GPS location to the selected contacts.

author: Yash Kumar
abstract: Didn't want to be CEO in waiting: Nikesh Arora
article: Commenting on his resignation, Nikesh Arora tweeted, “No...didn't want to be CEO in waiting past my sell by date." Arora, who was earlier seen as the heir apparent at SoftBank, stepped down from the Japanese company after the 58-year-old founder Masayoshi Son announced that he will continue as the CEO in the near future.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Big setback for Indian startups: Paytm Founder
article: Terming the resignation of SoftBank President Nikesh Arora as ‘a big setback’, Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma tweeted, “Why o why? That's a big setback for Indian startup ecosystem. Best wishes and hoping even bigger impact next.” Notably, SoftBank has invested over $2 billion in India in startups like Snapdeal, Ola and Housing.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Kellogg’s creates $100 mn fund for food startups
article: Kellogg's has launched a $100 million fund named Eighteen94 Capital (1894) to invest in food and food-related tech startups. It will invest in North American companies making natural and organic foods or beverages with a revenue between $5 million to $10 million. The fund expects to invest $1 million to $3 million in Series A and Series B stage startups.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ken Miyauchi replaces Nikesh Arora at SoftBank
article: SoftBank Group on Wednesday named Ken Miyauchi as its new President and Chief Operating Officer after Nikesh Arora resigned on Tuesday. Miyauchi currently serves as the Director of SoftBank Group and also as the President and CEO of the company's telecommunications and Internet arm, SoftBank Corporation. Masayoshi Son will remain as the Chairman and CEO of the SoftBank Group.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart rehires Tiger Global's Krishnamurthy
article: Tiger Global's Managing Director Kalyan Krishnamurthy has joined Flipkart in his earlier role as the Head of Categories. Krishnamurthy will directly report to Flipkart's CEO Binny Bansal. During his nearly two-year stint at Flipkart starting in early 2013, Krishnamurthy served as the Head of Categories and the interim Chief Financial Officer.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: SoftBank President Nikesh Arora resigns
article: SoftBank on Tuesday announced that its President & COO Nikesh Arora has resigned from his post to pursue a different path. “I was thinking of handing over my job as CEO when I turn 60, but thought maybe I’m still a bit too young, and still have energy to continue,” SoftBank's Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Wearable made to deliver beats directly to body
article: German startup Lofelt has developed a wearable called 'Basslet', which delivers beats and basslines directly to the body by vibrating according to the music the user is hearing. The Basslet works with anything that has sound including a user's smartphone, laptop, gaming console, VR headset and walkman without any app. It lasts up to six hours in a single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: London startup develops home blood test kit
article: London-based startup Thriva has developed a $72 finger-prick blood test home kit that enables users to test their cholesterol, kidney and liver function. Each kit includes lancets to prick a finger, a collection tube and a prepaid envelope to return the sample. The samples need to be sent to the startup, which creates a report and suggests lifestyle changes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Travel portal Cleartrip raises funding
article: Online travel portal Cleartrip on Tuesday raised an undisclosed round of funding from Concur Technologies, Gund Investment and other existing investors. Cleartrip's President and COO Samyukth Sridharan said that the startup has raised $75 million so far. Cleartrip also launched a new segment called 'Local' on its app to let users book places for events, fitness, food and adventure.

author: Yash Kumar
abstract: SoftBank paid Nikesh Arora $135 mn in 6 months
article: Nikesh Arora, who resigned on Tuesday as the President of SoftBank, earned about $135 million between joining the company in September 2014 and March 2015. This pay package made him the world's third highest paid executive at that time, behind GoPro and Liberty Global's CEOs. Arora had earlier worked as Google’s Chief Business Officer.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New York State Senate passes anti-Airbnb bill
article: The New York State Senate on Friday passed a bill that would make it illegal to advertise rentals of less than 30 days for entire homes on Airbnb. In the next step, New York State Governor will either sign or veto it. If the bill becomes a law, people posting such rentals on Airbnb could be fined up to $7,500.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App lets users find friends while travelling
article: A New York-based entrepreneur Mazen Jundi has created 'Tripstir', an app that lets users follow other travellers and get notified of travel overlaps with the people they are following. Users can search travellers, cities or date combinations to see where others are planning to travel. It also allows users to share recommendations, photos and videos from their trips.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Russia signs deal to build Hyperloop in Moscow
article: Hyperloop One on Tuesday signed a deal with Russia's investment firm Summa Group to build a 70-kilometre high-speed transportation system in Moscow at a cost of $450 million to $607 million. This makes Moscow Hyperloop's fourth engineering site after Finland, the UK and the US. Hyperloop One is making vacuum pods that can travel upto 1,200 km/h.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Nikesh Arora sells all of his SoftBank shares
article: Former SoftBank President Nikesh Arora has sold all of his SoftBank shares to company’s Founder Masayoshi Son at a ‘minimal loss’, after he resigned from the company on Tuesday. Notably, Arora had borrowed heavily to buy $483 million worth of SoftBank’s shares last August, which was the biggest insider purchase in Japan in the last 12 years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Musk responds to cousin seeking a Tesla discount
article: Responding to his cousin Lyndon Rive seeking a family discount on a Tesla car, the company's Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk said, "Yeah absolutely. Go to TeslaMotor.com, buy the car online, and the price you see there is the family discount." “Everyone gets a family discount,” Musk added. "He treats everyone the same...There’s no nepotism at all,” said Rive later.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: New app lets users watch celebrities chat
article: Avner Ronen, the ​founder of freeware media player platform 'Boxee', has launched Public, an app that lets its users discover and follow conversations between celebrities from the fields of entertainment, politics, sports, and technology. The app is initially launching with chats dedicated to the fields of technology, pop culture, LGBTQ people, and black art and literature.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola pilots hourly cab rental service
article: Taxi-hailing service Ola is piloting an hourly cab rental service called 'Rentals'. The new service will let Ola users hire a cab on a pay-per-hour basis in select cities. Earlier this year, Ola launched 'Ola Outstation' service to hire cab between cities and 'Ola Lux' service to hire luxury cabs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Edtech startup Qonfuse raises seed funding
article: Education technology startup Qonfuse on Monday raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding from CureInstant Founder Hamraj Kumar. Founded by Mahesh Gaur, Shivraj Dhusariya and Himanshu Srivastava, Qonfuse helps users prepare for competitive and other exams through an online exam interface similar to the actual one. It currently helps users to prepare for CAT, GATE, SSC exams among others.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Tata, Uber tie up for solutions to cab drivers
article: Tata Group on Thursday announced a partnership with taxi-hailing service Uber to offer vehicle purchase and ownership solutions to drivers on the Uber platform. The drivers will be provided financing solutions to purchase Tata Motors' vehicles besides insurance services, it added. The initiative, first launched in Hyderabad, aims to provide the services to 20,000 drivers in the next one year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jabong CPO Saurabh Goel to start own venture
article: Saurabh Goel has quit as the Chief Product Officer of fashion platform Jabong to launch his own venture in the financial technology space. Goel's startup, a marketplace for financial products like mutual funds and insurance, 'Prosperx.com' will launch in July. While Jabong is looking for a new CPO, company's Chief Operating Officer Muralikrishnan B will directly oversee the CPO role.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon files case against Gujarat govt over tax
article: Amazon has filed a case in Gujarat High Court against the state government for imposing ‘Entry Tax’ on goods. The tax is levied on goods purchased through online portals and delivered from outside the state. Amazon has challenged the definition and the very concept of the tax, arguing that it's a facilitator of goods and not the importer or consumer.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We understand the Indian context better: Ola CEO
article: Ola's Co-founder and CEO, Bhavish Aggarwal in an interview said, "We understand the Indian context so much better.” Aggarwal added, "Uber conquered a market where people had cars in their garages. In India, we didn’t have garages, we didn’t have cars, we didn’t even have roads.” Aggarwal also said that Uber's entry in India made Ola more ambitious.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Yatra acquires auto rickshaw aggregator mGaadi
article: Gurgaon-based travel portal, Yatra.com acquired Bangalore-based auto rickshaw aggregator, mGaadi for an undisclosed amount on Friday. Founded in 2012, mGaadi is an app-based commuting service from India Drivers Network, a Bangalore-based social enterprise. As a part of the deal, mGaadi's employee transportation platform, Cartr along with other technologies will be integrated into Yatra’s products.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Disney's Lucasfilm partners with Magic Leap
article: Disney-owned Star Wars production​ company Lucasfilm and augmented reality startup Magic Leap have announced a mixed reality-focussed strategic alliance. Magic Leap, which was founded in 2011 and is working on a head-mounted augmented reality display, has raised $1.39 billion in funding till now. As a proof of concept, the companies have released a short video featuring famous Star Wars robots.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Intel Capital invests in Pryme Vessyl smart cup
article: Intel's venture capital and investment division, Intel Capital has invested $4 million in San Francisco-based startup Mark One, the creator of Pryme Vessyl smart cup. The cup tracks and displays users' personal hydration needs by taking into account several factors like their height, weight and age. With this investment, the startup has raised a total of $7 million so far.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Snapchat to launch tech-based digital magazine
article: Snapchat will launch Real Life, an online magazine that will publish roughly one technology-related article each weekday, starting from June 27. In a blog post, Snapchat employee and social media critic Nathan Jurgenson wrote, "Real Life will publish essays, arguments, and narratives about living with technology". "It won’t be a news site with gadget reviews or industry gossip", he added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Govt scraps angel tax on startup investments
article: The Indian government has removed angel tax levied on investors providing funding to startups. Resident angel investors, domestic family offices or funds which weren't registered as VC funds have been exempted from the tax. Welcoming the move, Niti Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant tweeted, "It is a great step forward. Will give a boost to funding in startups in India."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup launches circular smartphones at $399
article: US-based startup Monohm on Wednesday​ launched its circular smartphones 'Runcible Babbage' and solid wood back 'Runcible Lovelace' for pre-order at $399 and $499 respectively. Based on Android 5.1 operating system, the palm-sized 2.5 inched round screen smartphones support LTE, WiFi and bluetooth. Both the smartphones feature a 7 MP rear camera and a Snapdragon 410 quad core processor.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: China's taxi app Didi Chuxing raises $7.3 bn
article: China's largest taxi-hailing app Didi Chuxing on Thursday closed a $7.3 billion funding round, reportedly valuing the startup at around $28 billion. Investors including Apple, China's insurance company China Life, Alibaba's Ant Financial and SoftBank participated in the round. Didi said it now has about $10.5 billion in disposable funds following the new fundraising.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Airbnb raises $1 bn debt facility from US banks
article: US-based online rental startup that enables people to list, find and rent vacation homes, Airbnb on Thursday raised $1 billion from some of the largest banks of the Unites States. The debt deal was led by JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup and Bank of America. Morgan Stanley also participated in the financing. Airbnb was last valued at $25.5 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Chan Zuckerberg Initiative backs first startup
article: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's charitable foundation Chan Zuckerberg Initiative on Thursday made its first investment in 'Andela', by leading the startup's $24 million Series B funding round. The startup identifies developers across Africa to train and pair them with companies as team members. “We live in a world where talent is evenly distributed, but opportunity is not," Zuckerberg said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Product rental startup GrabOnRent raises funding
article: Bengaluru-based on demand product rental marketplace on Wednesday raised an undisclosed amount in pre-Series A round led by IvyCap Ventures and Unicorn India Ventures. Prayag Mohanty, VP at IvyCap and Bhaskar Majumdar, Managing Partner at Unicorn Ventures will join GrabOnRent's board. The platform lets users rent home appliances, furniture, cameras, gaming consoles, hoverboards and bicycles.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Microsoft partners with marijuana startup
article: In a first for Microsoft, the company has announced a partnership with a Los Angeles-based startup Kind, to offer a software that will help keep tabs on legalised marijuana's sale and commerce. The startup offers a range of products such as ATM-style kiosks that facilitate marijuana sales, seed-to-sale tracking and compliance platform, and cash-free mobile payments platform.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: ClearTax raises $12 million in series A funding
article: Bengaluru-based online tax filing startup ClearTax on Friday raised​ $12 million in Series A funding led by SAIF Partners. Founded by Archit Gupta in 2011, the ClearTax portal helps users prepare and file tax returns online. ClearTax had earlier closed a $2 million seed round following an initial $1.3 million raise.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Uber investor BlackRock part of Didi's funding
article: New York-based investment firm BlackRock, an early Uber investor, has reportedly invested an undisclosed​ amount in the $7.2 billion investment round of Uber's Chinese rival Didi Chuxing. BlackRock has been included alongside Apple, Alibaba's Ant Financial and SoftBank. Notably, insurance firm China Life has also invested in both the companies.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MobiKwik questions Nielsen's report on wallets
article: MobiKwik on Wednesday questioned 'Nielsen Informate Mobile Insights’ report from December 2015 featuring Paytm, FreeCharge and the wallet itself. MobiKwik termed the report's sample size of 6,000 smartphone users and comparing wallet apps with recharge apps "irrelevant". It also questioned the report's timeframe from May to July 2015, as FreeCharge wallet officially launched in September 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Queue management app Sminq raises ₹6.7 crore
article: Pune-based queue management app Sminq on Wednesday raised ₹6.7 crore in seed round of funding led by Saama Capital and Blume Ventures. Angel investor Vaibhav Domkundwar of micro-venture firm Better Inc also participated. Launched in July 2015, Sminq gives users real-time updates of physical queues at hospitals, clinics, banks and restaurants and lets them join these queues remotely.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Fake products better than real ones: Jack Ma
article: Alibaba founder Jack Ma on Tuesday said that fake products today are of better quality and better price than the real names. "They are exactly the same factories, exactly the same raw materials but they do not use the names," he said at Alibaba’s investor day in Hangzhou. Alibaba has been reportedly facing controversy over counterfeit products on its websites.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: When will the fundraising war end, tweets user
article: Reacting to China's largest taxi-hailing app Didi Chuxing raising $7.3 billion, a user tweeted, "When will the fundraising war end?" Another user tweeted, "#China's version of #Uber now valued at $28 Billion." A user also tweeted, "Didi Chuxing on a roll, whatchu gonna do @Uber_China ??" "Fierce competition between #Uber & #DidiChuxing! Curious about their next moves," read another tweet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fake success better than the real, tweets user
article: Reacting to Alibaba Founder Jack Ma's statement of fake goods being better than the real ones, a user tweeted, "Fake success is better than the real success." Another user tweeted, "Is that how you cover up #Alibaba #CounterfeitProducts." A user also tweeted, "Forget about your competitors, just focus on your #customers." "A completely irresponsible message from #JackMa", read another tweet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SBI launches ₹200 cr fund for fintech startups
article: The State Bank of India on Thursday launched a ₹200-crore 'IT Innovation Start-up Fund’ to invest in startups operating in the financial technology space. “This fund shall consider assistance of up to ₹3 crore to an Indian registered company for promoting their business innovations using IT in India for banking and related technology,” said SBI Chairman Arundhati Bhattacharya.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fitness app BYG raises funding via LetsVenture
article: Bengaluru-based fitness services discovery and purchase app BYG (BookYourGame) has raised an undisclosed amount of funding through deal-making platform LetsVenture. The app was launched in December 2015 by former Goldman Sachs employees Devi Prasad Biswal and Avijeet Alagathi. BYG lets users discover and purchase services from gyms and fitness centres around them with an hourly workout option.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup becomes a US national stock exchange
article: A US-based startup named 'IEX' was on Friday approved by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to become the nation's 13th full-fledged stock exchange. Founded in 2012, IEX has created a patent-pending technology to create a trading exchange shielded from high-frequency traders. Other exchanges and trading firms had urged the SEC to reject IEX's application to become an exchange.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Voonik raises $20 million from Sequoia, others
article: Fashion marketplace Voonik on Thursday raised $20 million in Series B round of funding led by existing investor Sequoia Capital. FreeCharge Co-founder Kunal Shah, Times Internet, Beenext, Tancom Investments and Japan's e-commerce operator Beenos also participated in the funding. Earlier this month, Voonik forayed into premium online retail segment by launching a new fashion platform Vilara.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Oyo gets legal notice for unpaid dues of ₹1.5 cr
article: Hotel room aggregator Oyo Rooms has reportedly been dragged to the Delhi High Court by a Mumbai-based hospitality research and advisory firm Noesis over non-payment of over ₹1.5 crore for using its services. The firm has filed a winding up petition against Oyo Rooms to recover the dues. "That matter is presently sub-judice," said a Noesis spokesperson.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Custom shirt making startup raises ₹6.7 crore
article: Mumbai-based custom shirt making startup Bombay Shirt Company on Monday raised ₹6.7 crore, in bridge round of funding from existing investor Patni Group and an undisclosed investor. Launched in 2012 by Akshay Narvekar, it lets customers design their own shirts at its online and retail stores. It also sends stylists to customers' homes to help them pick designs and sizes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber's Chinese rival Didi Chuxing raises $600 mn
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber's Chinese rival, Didi Chuxing today raised $600 million in its latest funding round from China Life, Asia Pacific’s highest valued insurance firm. The yet-to-close funding round will reportedly value Didi Chuxing around $25 billion. Interestingly, China Life had also invested $200 million in Uber last year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Premium coffee pod startup Bonhomia raises $500k
article: Delhi-based premium coffee and tea pods making startup Bonhomia on Tuesday raised $500,000 in a bridge round from existing and new investors including Valpro Capital. Launched in 2014 by Kunal Bhagat and Tuhin Jain, Bonhomia puts gourmet tea and coffee blends in single serve capsules. It recently launched its coffee brewer Bonhomia Boho, which brews coffee with a single touch.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber offers choppers in Brazil to escape traffic
article: Uber on Monday launched 'UberCOPTER', a month-long trial of on-demand helicopter rides in Sao Paulo, Brazil, to let users avoid traffic between airports, hotels and convention centres. Starting at around $20, this is Uber's first attempt in Brazil to provide helicopter rides for short distances. Uber helicopters will currently connect four airports and five other helipads in Sao Paulo.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I don't have a driver's license: Uber CEO Travis
article: US-based taxi-hailing app Uber's Co-founder and CEO Travis Kalanick on Wednesday said that his driver's license has expired. "I have a very weird car," said Travis. He further added that he owns a 1999 BMW M3 convertible with a broken alternator valve. Notably, Uber is the most valued private technology startup in the world.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Quality Council offers jobs to Flipkart recruits
article: Quality Council of India (QCI), a quasi-governmental organisation, has offered jobs for six months to one year to IIM graduates whose joining dates were deferred by Flipkart. "Of course we cannot pay them as well...but they can contribute to flagship public projects like Swachh Bharat and Swachh Survekshan," said QCI Chairman Adil Zainubhai.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla gives free sunshades to Model X owners
article: Tesla is giving free sunshades to its Model X owners after they complained of heat and glare from the car's glass roof. The removable sunshade claims to block 66% of the light out. Tesla CEO Elon Musk says the 31 sq ft glass roof was made to give a helicopter cockpit-like riding experience.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber slashes UberGO fares to ₹6/km in Delhi NCR
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber on Monday slashed the fares of its low-cost UberGO service to ₹6/km in Delhi NCR. The new fare matches with its rival Ola’s fare under its low-cost service Micro. The new fare comes two months after Uber cut fares by up to 22% in 10 non-metro cities in the country.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Apple's Siri to let users book Uber rides
article: Uber on Monday announced that iPhone users will soon be able to use Siri, Apple’s voice-activated personal assistant, to request rides and receive real-time updates. On requesting a ride through Siri, users will be able to see the fare, driver information and confirm the ride. Uber added that its rides can also be booked within the Apple Maps app.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Uber to allow scheduling cabs 30 days in advance
article: Taxi-hailing service Uber on Thursday announced that it is globally rolling out the 'Scheduled Rides' feature starting from Seattle. The feature would allow users to schedule their trips from 30 minutes to 30 days in advance only for uberX cabs. Uber said that it will send two reminders, one 24 hours and another 30 minutes ahead of the scheduled ride.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Food in train startup KhanaGaDi raises funding
article: KhanaGaDi, a startup which delivers food in trains, on Saturday raised an undisclosed amount of funding from 50K Ventures. Founded in 2015 by Amit Deep Kumar, Naman Goswami and Sunil Kumar Awasthi, the startup lets users order food at their train seats at around 150 stations. It also updates users in case of any change in the train schedules.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes device to help fall asleep faster
article: US-based startup iFutureLab has created a device called 'FitSleep', that lets users fall asleep faster. Put beneath a pillow or mattress, FitSleep tracks users' heart rate, respiration rate, body movements and sleep patterns to emit alpha waves of 0-13 Hz. These waves accelerate the time taken by the users to fall asleep and reach the deep sleep phase.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zomato's 'Project Warp' to tackle biased reviews
article: Restaurant search and discovery platform Zomato recently launched 'Project Warp', an anti-bias algorithm to tackle biased and fake restaurant reviews. To encourage unbiased reviews, user credibility score and a moderation history of their reviews will be maintained by Zomato. Further, very old ratings and reviews will not be included in the average rating of restaurants.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Airbnb best place to work in the US: Glassdoor
article: Airbnb, a company that lets users list, find and rent lodging, has been ranked as the best place to work in the United States on Glassdoor. Consulting firm Bain & Company and software publisher Guidewire have been ranked second and third respectively. The list of 50 companies also includes Facebook, LinkedIn, Google, Adobe, Apple, Twitter, Red Bull and Nike.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: TVS invests $11 million in three startups
article: TVS Automobile Solutions on Thursday invested a total of approximately $11 million in three startups, Jazzmyride, Autosense, and Redsun Telematics. Jazzmyride deals with auto parts and accessories, Autosense provides technology and analytics-based​ customer management services, while Redsun Technologies is an Internet of Things start-up that develops business solutions like connected cars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Charging cable with automatic phone backup made
article: A UK-based startup has made 'Meem', a charging cable that automatically backs up a device every time it is charged. The app-connected cable compatible with both Android and iOS devices includes a small physical device to store a device's data backup. Users can retrieve their backed up data by entering a four-digit PIN on the cable's app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We are a data business, says Alibaba's Jack Ma
article: Alibaba Founder and Executive Chairman Jack Ma on Tuesday said, "Alibaba is not a retail business, we are a data business.” Jack added that everything Alibaba does, including financial services like Alipay and investing in logistics, is to gather more data. He added that Alibaba wants to more than double its revenue to a trillion dollars by 2020.

author: Prashanti Moktan
abstract: Lawrence to play Holmes in film on Theranos
article: Actress Jennifer Lawrence is reportedly set to portray Elizabeth Holmes, founder of the medical startup 'Theranos', in an upcoming film being directed by Adam McKay. The company was recently downgraded by 'Forbes', with Holmes’ portion of the company dropping from $4.5 billion to zero over discrepancies in the company's claim of testing blood using only a few drops of blood.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Twitter reacts to Theranos movie announcement
article: Reacting to Jennifer Lawrence playing Theranos CEO Elizabeth Holmes in an upcoming movie, a user tweeted, "A drama isn't a drama till Hollywood steps into it. A movie on #Theranos in the works". While another tweet read, "Jennifer Lawrence will play #Theranos CEO but who will play @JohnCarreyrou, the WSJ reporter who broke the story?"

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Line made $270 mn in 2015 by selling stickers
article: Japanese mobile messaging app Line made more than $270 million in 2015 by selling packs of stickers, according to the company's data. A pack containing about 12-18 stickers typically trades for a dollar or two. Notably, the app recently filed for a dual US-Japanese IPO following aborted efforts in 2014 and 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Used car marketplace HopCar merges with Spinny
article: Gurgaon-based used car marketplace HopCar has announced to merge with Spinny, a startup operating in similar space. Post merger, the two startups will work under a common brand name Spinny. Further, the four Co-founders of HopCar including Arijit Biswas, Rahul Thakur, Anish Karan and Rahul Anand will join the core team members at Spinny.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in e-ticketing site Kyazoonga
article: Ratan Tata, Chairman emeritus of Tata Sons, has invested an undisclosed amount in e-ticketing portal Kyazoonga. Founded in 2007 by Neetu Bhatia, Akash Bhatia and Arpita Majumder, Kyazoonga is an entertainment and sports ticketing company, which has sold tickets for events like ICC Cricket​ World Cup and FIFA World Cup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Patent Office issues guidelines to startups
article: Indian Patent Office has issued guidelines to startups regarding the procedure for filing and processing applications for patents, designs, trademarks and fees to be paid to the facilitators. A startup will need to select a facilitator to prepare a patent request and assess the patentability. Further, the application fee and other statutory fees would be borne by the startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Andreessen Horowitz raises $1.5 bn for new fund
article: US-based venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz, founded by Marc Andreessen and Ben Horowitz, on Friday confirmed raising $1.5 billion for its fifth and newest fund. "The fund will go toward everything from seed to mid-stage investments," the firm said in a blog post. The latest fund raising brings Andreessen Horowitz's total amount raised to around $6.2 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Abof to provide on-spot alteration of clothes
article: Aditya Birla Group-owned online fashion marketplace Abof is launching an on-spot apparel alteration service in Bengaluru and Hyderabad. "Size and fitting issues owe to one fifth of our total returns...the initiative will help us reduce returns," said Abof COO Sukanta Das. The service will be free for Abof customers. Myntra offers a similar service at a minimum cost of ₹50.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup lets landlords snoop tenants' Facebook
article: UK-based startup Score Assured has developed a software which lets landlords scan social media accounts including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and LinkedIn of the potential tenants. It makes a report of potential tenants including their personality, life events and financial level based on their social media posts. The startup has recently faced heat on social media for its operations.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: UK startup creates emotion-tracking wearable
article: UK-based startup Vinaya has created 'Zenta', a $249 wearable which tracks users' fitness, activity, sleep, as well as emotions including happiness and stress. It tracks users' heart rate, electrodermal activity, respiration and blood oxygen levels to state their emotional status through visual representations. Zenta also prompts personalised notifications to help users build better habits.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup makes apparel-folding robot FoldiMate
article: A US-based startup has created 'FoldiMate', a robot that folds apparels by sensing the size and thickness of the fabric. Users need to hang the clothes on a rack attached to the robot and select the type of clothing through the provided buttons. FoldiMate folds, perfumes and de-wrinkles the apparels. It costs around $700-$850 and can be pre-ordered in 2017.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Guj govt announces new policy for IT start-ups
article: The Gujarat government on Sunday announced a new policy to promote IT and electronics-based start-ups. Under the policy, the government will set up startup incubators and will provide financial assistance for filing patents, power tariff subsidies, and other incentives. CM Anandiben Patel said the policy can bring investments worth ₹7,000 crore to the state.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fashion marketplace Voonik acquires 3 startups
article: Online fashion marketplace Voonik has acquired three startups including Zohraa, Picksilk and Styl for an undisclosed amount. While Zohraa makes premium occasion wear, Picksilk is an online store for silk sarees and Styl is a mobile app to book salons and spas. The acquisitions will reportedly help Voonik strengthen its premium fashion products platform Vilara.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon announces $3 billion investment in India
article: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos on Tuesday said that the online retailer will invest an additional $3 billion in its Indian arm. The announcement was made in the presence of PM Narendra Modi at the US-India Business Council’s 41st Annual Leadership Summit in Washington DC. Earlier in July 2014, Amazon had announced a $2 billion funding in India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kickstart Jobs gets funding led by ah! Ventures
article: Gurgaon-based entry-level hiring startup Kickstart Jobs on Thursday raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding led by ah! Ventures. Kellogg’s Asia-Pacific President Amit Banati, Wyzen Tech Founder Vivek Joshi, Team Works Art Chairman Mohit Satyanand and others also participated. Founded in 2015 by IIT- XLRI alumni, it connects employers to job seekers in blue and grey collared jobs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart toothbrush captures video inside the mouth
article: US-based startup Onvi has developed a smart electronic toothbrush 'Prophix', which live streams the inside of the users' mouth on their smartphones through an app. Priced at $400, it also allows users to take pictures of the interior of their mouths and choose from various attachments including mirror, rubber scaler and others. Prophix's app also provides tips to improve brushing.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes flame-free electric lighter 'Volt'
article: A UK-based startup has created an eco-friendly and flame-free electric lighter called 'Volt'. Priced at $32, the lighter claims to be windproof, waterproof and built by recycled products. It can light paper, cardboard, sparkles, candles and other items. Rechargeable through a USB cable, it claims to last for a month in a full charge, which takes five minutes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We are as big as Ola, says Uber India President
article: Uber India President Amit Jain has said, "We are as big as Ola with a 50% market share." "To us, it doesn't matter if it's public or private transport...Uber wants to be the transportation provider of choice and replace car ownership," added Jain. He also said that Uber is not profitable in India right now.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Edtech startup Cuemath raises $4 mn in funding
article: Education platform Cuemath on Tuesday raised $4 million in Series A funding from Sequoia Capital and existing investor Unitus Seed Fund. Founded in 2011 by father-son duo of Jagjit and Manan Khurma, Cuemath is an after-school math program designed for students from grades LKG to 8. It uses worksheets, quiz cards and in-house tablet-based content to teach math.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in kids gaming startup MadRat
article: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata on Wednesday invested an undisclosed amount in kids gaming startup MadRat Games. Ola founders Bhavish Aggarwal and Ankit Bhati, Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal and Freshdesk's Girish Mathrubootham also participated in the funding. Founded in 2010, MadRat creates puzzle games, board games and wearable gaming platform SuperSuit for kids aged 2-12 years.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Amazon thinks big and does big too, user tweets
article: Reacting to Amazon pledging an investment of $3 billion in India, a user tweeted, "#Amazon Thinks Big and Does it Big too". Another user tweeted, "Nightmare for #flipkart With $5 Billion Investment, #Amazon Now Wants To Completely Dominate Indian eCommerce Market". "As #India is one of the few bright spots in the world, #Amazon is doubling down", read another tweet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: CashKaro Founder tweets to MobiKwik CEO for dues
article: Cashback and coupons site CashKaro's Co-founder Swati Bhargava on Thursday asked digital wallet startup MobiKwik's Founder and CEO Bipin Singh for pending payments on Twitter. Bhargava tweeted, "Hi @BipinSingh Please see the mail I sent this morning. Payments are pending from @MobiKwik for 6 month now.. request your help. Thanks." The tweet was however removed by her later.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App to buy and sell used goods ListUp gets $500k
article: Mumbai-based app to buy and sell used goods, ListUp on Wednesday raised $500,000 in its seed funding round led by Kae Capital. The fund's Founder Sasha Mirchandani has joined the startup's board. FreeCharge founders Kunal Shah and Sandeep Tandon also participated in the round. Founded in 2015, ListUp lets users buy and sell used mobiles, furniture, electronics and other items.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Helpshift gets $23M led by Microsoft, Salesforce
article: US-based customer support platform for mobile apps, Helpshift on Tuesday raised $23 million in Series B funding led by Microsoft and Salesforce. Existing investors Intel Capital, Nexus Venture Partners, True Ventures and Visionnaire Ventures also participated in the round. Founded in 2011 by Abinash Tripathy and Baishampayan Ghose, the startup has raised a total of $36.5 million so far.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: UrbanClap releases short film to support LGBTs
article: UrbanClap has released a short film supporting the LGBT community titled 'Capture Your Love - Come out in support of true love'. The startup also announced to sponsor photoshoots for same-sex couples in India. UrbanClap Co-founder Abhiraj Bhal said, "We believe that everyone should have the right to love whoever they want to as it's the most basic human right."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Huffington to launch a new media startup: Report
article: Arianna Huffington, Co-founder and Editor-in-Chief of The Huffington Post is reportedly launching a media startup called 'Thrive', focused on health and wellness. The startup will feature lifestyle content contributed by celebrities and bloggers and provide wellness consulting services to companies. Alibaba's Co-founder and Chairman Jack Ma has reportedly agreed to fund Huffington's new startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MobiKwik withdraws 6% annual profit on wallets
article: MobiKwik has reportedly withdrawn 6% annual profit announced last week on wallets maintaining a monthly balance of ₹5,000 or more. It was withdrawn after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) stated that mobile wallet companies are not permitted to mobilise deposits by offering cash back in nature of interest. Notably, RBI had earlier rejected MobiKwik's application for payments bank licence.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup launches money-back policy on homes
article: US-based online home-selling startup Opendoor on Tuesday launched a policy where it will refund house owners within 30 days if they change their minds. It will provide 180-point house inspection report to the buyers and fix anything that breaks in the house in two years for free. Founded in 2014, Opendoor has raised a total of $110 million so far.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon removes doormats with Gods and Goddesses
article: Amazon on Monday removed the doormats with pictures of Hindu Gods, Goddesses, Jesus Christ and Quran verses from its American website after people raged over the products on Twitter with '#BoycottAmazon'. The products were being sold by a retailer called Rock Bull on Amazon. Several users had uninstalled the online retailer's app and gave it negative ratings over the products.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Two accused of selling fake Uber, Alibaba shares
article: Two hedge fund managers have been indicted by the US for fraudulently raising $10 million from investors by selling fake pre-IPO shares of Uber, Alibaba and Airbnb. The duo reportedly used the money to visit casinos and stay at high-end hotels in Las Vegas. If convicted, the accused may face up to 20 years in prison and fines.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart home device 'Sense' cancelled by Silk Labs
article: US-based startup Silk Labs, co-founded by former Mozilla CTO Andreas Gal, on Wednesday cancelled the production of its smart home device 'Sense' and announced to refund its backers. Sense claimed to facially recognise a house owner, manage smart home devices and keep a tab on pets. Gal said that the startup currently wants to focus only on the software.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Chef hiring platform Cookifi raises seed funding
article: On-demand chef hiring platform Cookifi on Wednesday raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding from FreeCharge Co-founder Kunal Shah, Capillary Technologies CEO Aneesh Reddy and others through Tracxn Syndicate. Founded in 2015, Cookifi lets users hire chefs to host events at home. The platform also lets users rate and review their experience with the hired chefs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Oyo Rooms taken down like a boss, tweets user
article: Reacting to a post claiming that startup Oyo Rooms is equivalent to a Ponzi Scheme, a user tweeted, "Oyo Rooms taken down like a boss." Another user tweeted, "So basically another investment of @softbank will go down the drain?" "Oyo only provides branded toiletries," read another tweet. "There certainly seems many gaps in this insane valuation game," a user tweeted.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tinder to bar users below 18 years of age
article: Starting next week, Tinder will discontinue its services for users below 18 years, the dating app's Vice President of Communications Rosette Pambakian said. Notably, Tinder allowed users aged 13 years or above to use the app since its launch in 2012. However, users between 13-17 years were only allowed to match with others in the same age group.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twitter reacts to Elon Musk's flying metal suit
article: Reacting to SpaceX Founder Elon Musk's "Something like a flying metal suit" answer to "What was Musk doing at the Pentagon?" article, a user tweeted, "The problem with you saying such things is that we can't be sure you are joking." Another user tweeted, "Tony Stark was modelled after Elon." "I knew that you were Iron Man", tweeted a user.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fashion discovery platform Shopwati gets funding
article: Fashion discovery platform Shopwati raised an undisclosed amount of seed funding from Sanjiv Rai of SRKK Advisors on Wednesday. Founded in 2015 by Mehak Suri and Ankit Bajaj, Shopwati lets users discover fashion, find products and take a poll on what to buy. The platform features stylists, bloggers, private labels, designers and brands to help the users make fashion-related decisions.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tinder to get transgender-friendly: CEO Sean Rad
article: Tinder CEO Sean Rad has said that the dating app will unveil a new experience for transgender users in the next two months. “It’s harder for them to get what they are looking for. We've to modify our experience to address that,” added Rad. Currently, Tinder users are limited to express themselves as either male or female on the app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Runnr acquires food ordering app TinyOwl
article: Hyperlocal delivery startup Runnr on Saturday announced that it has acquired Mumbai-based food ordering app TinyOwl. With the acquisition, Runnr has transitioned into a food ordering and delivery platform that will let users order food across South Mumbai with no minimum order amount. In March, the startup rebranded itself as Runnr from RoadRunnr, following an intellectual property right lawsuit.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bus aggregator Limo raises $1 million in funding
article: Mumbai-based bus aggregator Limo on Wednesday raised $1 million in funding from Rainmaker Ventures. Founded in 2014 by Siddharth Sharma, Anshul Khandelwal and Vivek Choksi, Limo, formerly known as rBus, provides air-conditioned shuttle buses to office and back in Mumbai. It also provides services like Wi-Fi, app-enabled payments, flexible timings, and live tracking of buses.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Ola unveils app for taxi operators
article: Taxi-hailing service Ola on Friday announced the launch of the 'Ola Operator' app that is built for people who employ drivers to work on the platform. The new app will help the entrepreneurs improve efficiency by allowing them to track location and performance in real time. The app will also allow them to store all documents required for the vehicles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart finds paid internships for IIT recruits
article: Flipkart has arranged paid internships at startups including Rivigo and GreyOrange for the IIT recruits whose joining dates were delayed by the online retailer by six months from June to December. The recruits will be paid ₹50,000 a month during their internships, with an option to either join Flipkart in December or continue at their respective startups.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jugnoo announces ride-sharing option Jugnoo Pool
article: On demand auto-rickshaw booking app Jugnoo on Friday announced a new feature called 'Jugnoo Pool', to let users share their rides with people travelling in the same direction. A 20% discount on the fare will be allowed to the users who choose the pooling option. The feature will be available in all cities where Jugnoo is operational.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Seek revenge and you shall dig two graves: Bezos
article: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos on Tuesday said, "Seek revenge, and you shall dig two graves, one for yourself," on the ongoing tussle between Gawker Media and PayPal Co-Founder Peter Thiel. "If you absolutely can't tolerate critics...then don't do anything new or interesting," Bezos added. Thiel is backing wrestler Hulk Hogan's lawsuit against Gawker Media for making Hogan's sex tape public.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MobiKwik announces 6% annual profit on wallets
article: Mobile wallet MobiKwik on Wednesday announced a 6% annual profit for all its users who maintain a monthly balance of ₹5,000 or more in their wallets. The profits will be credited to the user's MobiKwik account on a monthly basis. These profits will get added to the eligible user's wallet on the 5th of every subsequent month.

author: Anupama K
abstract: India Post releases Amazon India stamp
article: The India Post released a ₹5 stamp called 'My Stamp' on Friday, to mark the third anniversary of the ​online marketplace, Amazon India’s services across the country. “The department of post has released ‘My Stamp’ for the first time to commemorate a milestone with an e-commerce marketplace. The launch reinforces the Amazon-India Post relationship," an official said.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Glassdoor raises $40 mn at $1 bn valuation
article: Glassdoor, a platform that helps people look for jobs and research companies, has raised $40 million in Series H funding round, taking its valuation to nearly $1 billion. Henry Ellenbogen and T. Rowe Price led the round which also saw participation from previous investors including Tiger Global. With this investment, Glassdoor has raised a little over $200 million.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: On-demand healthcare app Visit gets seed funding
article: Delhi-based on-demand healthcare app Visit on Wednesday raised an undisclosed amount of seed funding from technology firm MapmyIndia. Founded in 2015 by BITS Pilani alumni, the app lets users discover and consult therapists, physicians, dermatologists or nutritionists within 30 minutes through voice or video calling. Every visit includes seven days of free messaging and follow-up with the doctor.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twitter reacts to Uber's $3.5 billion funding
article: After Uber raised $3.5 billion from Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund on Wednesday, a user tweeted, "If 80% of Uber's riders in your country are women then you know it's worth investing!" Another user tweeted, "Who needs an IPO?" "Saudi Arabia desperately looking for opportunities beyond oil may soon challenge hegemony of US & China in VC," read a tweet.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Flipkart launches its own eSports tournament
article: E-commerce giant Flipkart has launched Flipkart Gaming Online Championship (FGOC), an online eSports tournament being held between June 3 and July 11. The tournament will feature four games, namely FIFA, Counter Strike: Global Offensive (CS:GO), League of Legends (LOL) and Defense of the Ancients 2 (DotA 2). Gamers can register for the same on a Facebook page named "Flipkart Gaming".

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Richest self-made woman of US now worth nothing
article: Forbes has lowered the estimated net worth of Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes, who topped the Forbes list of 'America’s Richest Self-Made Women' last year, from $4.5 billion to nothing. Forbes said the controversy-ridden company is actually worth $800 million as opposed to $9 billion. Holmes' 50% stake would reportedly be worth nothing because investors would be paid back first.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mobiles worth ₹10L stolen from Amazon warehouse
article: Mobile handsets worth around ₹10.37 lakh were reportedly stolen by five contractual employees from Amazon's warehouse located at Kurund village in Thane, Mumbai. According to the police complaint lodged by Amazon on May 22, a total of 17 mobile handsets were stolen from the warehouse. No arrest has been made in connection with the theft so far.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Whirlpool creates device to brew beer in 7 days
article: Whirlpool's division W Labs has developed 'Vessi', a beer brewer for home priced at $1,800, which claims to brew beer within seven days. It consists of a single tank that ferments and carbonates the beer and lets users add flavours and additives. Further, the brewed beer can be filled into bottles or cans on a temperature selected by the user.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes a pad to charge devices wirelessly
article: A French startup has created 'Energysquare', a $65 mousepad-sized rechargeable pad that allows users to charge multiple devices wirelessly at one time by attaching a small sticker to their devices. Energysquare is compatible with smartphones and tablets powered by Android, Windows and iOS. It also features a smart sleep mode to prevent any power wastage when no devices are connected.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Won't impound Ola, Uber cabs: Karnataka govt
article: Karnataka state transport department on Wednesday gave an undertaking to the state's High Court that it will not impound Ola and Uber cabs for plying without necessary license. However, the department said the crackdown against surge pricing will continue. The department had earlier asked the taxi-aggregators who are yet to obtain the required licenses to stop operations with immediate effect.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twitter reacts to Holmes worth cut to 'nothing'
article: After Forbes lowered the estimated net worth of Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes from $4.5 billion to nothing, a user tweeted, "Somewhere a writer is starting a bio titled 'Drawing Blood: The Takedown of #ElizabethHolmes." Another user tweeted, "So far, I am apparently having a better day than #ElizabethHolmes." "This is called markdown!" read another tweet.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Snapchat passes Twitter in daily usage: Report
article: According to a Bloomberg report, Snapchat has 150 million daily active users, making the four-year-old service more popular than Twitter by daily usage. As per the report, Twitter has less than 140 million daily active users. While Twitter's recent earnings reported that it has 310 million monthly active users with about 44% of them being active each day.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: SoftBank to sell stake worth $7.9 bn in Alibaba
article: SoftBank Group, the largest investor in Alibaba Group, on Tuesday said it will sell at least $7.9 billion of its stake in the Chinese e-commerce major to raise funds to reduce its debt. The transaction, which marks the first sale of Alibaba shares by SoftBank, would bring down the Japanese firm's stake in Alibaba to 28% from 32.2% in March.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Uber raises $3.5 bn at $66 bn valuation
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber, which is currently operational in 69 countries, on Wednesday raised $3.5 billion from Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund at a valuation of $66 billion. This is Uber's largest investment from a single investor, and it brings the US-based company's total balance sheet of cash and convertible debt to more than $11 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SoftBank not buying Yahoo's assets: Nikesh Arora
article: Nikesh Arora, SoftBank's President and COO on Wednesday said that the company is not planning to use the funds raised from sale of Alibaba shares to buy assets put on sale by Yahoo. Arora added that the sale proceeds will be used to manage SoftBank's leverage and balance sheet. SoftBank recently announced selling its $7.9 billion worth stake in Alibaba.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes portable smart window AC 'Noria'
article: US-based startup Noria Home has developed 'Noria', a $400 portable smart window air conditioner (AC) that can be controlled through a dedicated mobile app. While Noria includes a knob on the front to control the temperature, the AC's app uses bluetooth to set energy saving schedules. It can cool an area up to 160 square feet and weighs 13 kg.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon enters used, refurbished goods business
article: Online retailer Amazon through its subsidiary Junglee has started selling used and refurbished products on its platform. The service lets users buy and sell used products including books, mobiles, laptops, tablets, watches and video games. Amazon is also selling refurbished items in these categories through the platform.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sports discovery app Play Your Sport gets funded
article: Delhi-based app to discover sports and fitness enthusiasts nearby, Play Your Sport has raised an undisclosed amount of pre-Series A funding. The funding was led by Ashish Gupta, Founder and Trustee at Ashoka University. Founded in 2015 by Supriya Mamgain and Varoon Kapoor, the app lets users discover fitness centres or create sports events by finding like-minded people nearby.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Automobile marketplace Droom raises funding
article: Gurgaon-based automobile marketplace Droom on Wednesday raised an undisclosed amount in its series B round of funding led by Singapore-based Beenext and Digital Garage of Japan. Existing investors LightBox Ventures and Beenos also participated in this round. Founded in 2014, the startup lets users buy and sell new and used automobiles and automobile services on its online platform and app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App lets users insure devices by swiping right
article: A US-based startup has launched an on-demand insurance app called 'Trov' in Australia, which lets users insure their electronic items against damage, theft and loss by swiping right. While users can choose the amount of protection, the damages can be informed and claimed over texts. The startup had raised $25.5 million in funding in April this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla Model S on autopilot crashes into a van
article: A Tesla Model S car on autopilot mode reportedly crashed into a parked van on a Switzerland highway last week. The Tesla was behind a car, which later switched lanes to avoid a van that had stopped on the highway. The driver has blamed the car for not spotting the van and the automatic braking system for failing to trigger.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Delhi-based T'pot Cafe raises seed funding
article: Delhi-based food-tech startup focused on serving the ‘chai-nashta’ segment, T'pot Cafe on Monday raised an undisclosed amount of seed funding. The funding was led by Ashish Gupta, Founder and Trustee of Ashoka University and Co-founder of Evalueserve. Launched in 2013 by Robin Jha, Atit Verma and Asad, the startup currently runs 20 cafe outlets across Delhi and NCR.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Intel buys self-driving car tech startup Itseez
article: Intel on Friday acquired San Francisco-based startup Itseez, which has developed advanced driver assistance systems for self-driving cars, for an undisclosed amount. Itseez equips cars with lane departure warning, traffic sign detection, forward collision warning and pedestrian detection. The acquisition is part of Intel’s strategic shift from chip maker to cloud computing and Internet of Things.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jayant Sinha speaks on Flipkart, IIM-A tussle
article: On Flipkart deferring joining of IIM Ahmedabad recruits by six months, Jayant Sinha, MoS for Finance said, "After what Flipkart did, what do you think is going to happen at the IITs and IIMs?" "You think anybody is going to want to work for a startup?”, Sinha added and further said that Flipkart's move affects the startup ecosystem and recruitment.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Complaints against Snapdeal, Amazon ads upheld
article: The Advertising Standards Council of India has upheld consumers complaints against Snapdeal, Amazon and Just Dial advertisements. While “Snapdeal Accessories Mela – Flash sale at just Rs.11/-” was termed ambiguous, Amazon's commercial “Easy Returns” was slammed for omitting terms and conditions. Further, Just Dial's claim "JD Verified" was slammed for giving wrong sense of security to the viewers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: UK startup makes alarm clock that brews coffee
article: A UK-based startup has developed 'The Barisieur', an electric alarm clock that can also brew a cup of coffee or tea. While users need to fill the clock's compartments with water, coffee and milk before sleeping, the clock automatically brews the beverage at the set time and wakes up the users. It also has a USB port for charging phone.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup makes wearable Android tablet
article: US-based startup Rufus Labs has created 'Rufus Cuff', a $300 Android Kit Kat-based wearable tablet which also tracks the user's fitness. The waterproof tablet has a 3-2-inch touchscreen display, 16 GB storage space, multiple language support and LED alerts for incoming texts and calls. Designed to wear on the wrist, it also comes with a front-facing camera for video calling.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart starts zero-interest EMI on electronics
article: Flipkart has launched 'No Cost EMI' or zero-interest on equal monthly instalments on purchase of electronics including premium smartphones, televisions, home appliances worth ₹5,000 or more. Flipkart tied up with lender Bajaj Finserv and electronic brands to launch the consumer finance product earlier this month. No fees, interest or downpayment is required to purchase the items under the scheme.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US wheelchair startup Whill raises $17.5 mn
article: US-based startup Whill, which makes wheelchairs that can move on rough terrain, has raised $17.5 million in Series B round of funding. Whill uses a patented wheel that allows users to make tight turns even on grass, dirt, snow and sloping surfaces. The startup is planning a technology that will allow its wheelchairs to drive autonomously and be managed remotely.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tata Group forays into e-commerce with Tata CliQ
article: The Tata Group forayed into e-commerce on Friday with the launch of 'Tata CliQ', an online and app-based platform to let users buy apparel and electronics. The products purchased through the platform are also accepted for return at the physical stores of Westside or Croma. It also allows users to get their orders delivered ​within 24 hours​.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: FreeCharge founders fund health startup Pianta
article: Bengaluru-based home healthcare startup Pianta on Friday raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding from FreeCharge founders Kunal Shah and Sandeep Tandon. Founded in 2015, the startup connects users with home health care providers for services including nursing, lab sample collection, physiotherapy and consultation. It currently operates in Bengaluru, Chennai, Hyderabad, Gurgaon and Noida.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ravi Gururaj's QikPod runs into legal trouble
article: QikPod, the yet-to-launch logistics platform, has run into legal trouble after a fallout between Founder Ravi Gururaj and his associate Neeraj Ray over ownership. Ray has filed an injunction suit against QikPod, accusing Gururaj of not giving him the promised equity in QikPod. Gururaj, however, said the allegations made and reliefs sought by Ray are false and unsustainable.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart wallet digitally holds all cards together
article: US-based startup X Lab has developed 'Spendwallet', a $99 smart wallet that digitally holds up to 20 cards of a user into one device. To make payments, a user needs to tap the smart wallet on the card reader installed at the stores. The rechargeable wallet claims to last for a month in a single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: World's most secure phone launched at $14,000
article: British-Israeli startup Sirin Labs has launched 'Solarin', a smartphone that the company claims to be the world's most secure. Priced at $14,000, it includes military-grade encryption and a physical security switch that activates a shielded mode to make secure calls. Powered by Snapdragon 810 processor, Solarin comes with a 5.5-inch display, a 23.8 megapixel camera and quick charging technology.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twitter reacts to Mu Sigma Founder's divorce
article: After data analytics company Mu Sigma's Founder Dhiraj Rajaram and wife Ambiga, the CEO of Mu Sigma, confirmed their divorce, a user tweeted "Old Jungle saying: Don't take your work home and don't take your home to work". Another user tweeted, "The light at the end of the rainbow might be dim".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mumbai artist turns Tinder dates into drawings
article: Indu Harikumar, an illustrator and writer from Mumbai has started a project "#100IndianTinderTales", where she turns the experiences of users on dating app Tinder into drawings. "I am interested in people's stories, what makes them tick, their fears, their aspirations, how they overcome things," said Harikumar. The artist has been sharing her illustrations on Facebook and Instagram since April.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Twitter reacts to launch of $14,000 smartphone
article: After British-Israeli startup Sirin Labs launched the Solarin smartphone priced at $14,000, claiming to be the most secure phone, users reacted with tweets like "$14000? This phone is also pretty secure from customers" and "Sirin Labs build the Rolls Royce of smartphones". "The launch might be a little bit Skynet, but the #SOLARIN is pretty darn cool", read another tweet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Freshdesk opens new office in Berlin
article: Cloud-based customer support software startup Freshdesk has opened a new regional office in Berlin, Germany. The Berlin office will be led by Arun Mani, Managing Director in Continental Europe. Founded in 2010 by Girish Mathrubootham and Shan Krishnasamy, the startup's investors include Accel Partners, Google Capital and Tiger Global among others.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal opens data sciences centre in the US
article: Online retailer Snapdeal on Monday announced the opening of its data sciences centre in California, United States. The centre will be headed by Nitin Sharma, Senior Vice President of Data Sciences at Snapdeal. The online retailer said that the centre will focus on big data and advanced analytics to support its consumer initiatives.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sandeep Goyal raises ₹100 cr for tech startups
article: Sandeep Goyal, Chairman of Mogae Media has raised around ₹100 crore to fund the acquisition of digital startups. These startups would be the ones that have built brands, but are now struggling to raise funds for re-engineering or re-launch. It will focus on companies operating in the area of analytics, mobile ad serving platforms and mobile-based programmatic buying.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: LimeRoad enters menswear segment
article: Online fashion retailer LimeRoad has entered menswear segment by launching 'LimeRoad for Men' category which includes clothing, footwear and accessories for men. Launched in 2012 with focus on women's fashion, LimeRoad also entered the home decor segment last year. It competes with the likes of larger rivals in the fashion space including Myntra, Jabong, Amazon, Flipkart and Snapdeal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nest's Co-founder Fadell develops smart go-kart
article: Alphabet-owned Nest Labs CEO and Co-founder Tony Fadell recently unveiled 'Arrow Smart-Kart', a $600 electric go-kart for kids developed by Actev Motors, another startup co-founded by him. The Wi-Fi and GPS-enabled customisable kart is app-connected and lets parents limit its driving area, top speed or hit a stop button in an emergency. It can travel up to 19 kilometres/hour.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nest's Co-founder Fadell develops smart go-kart
article: Alphabet-owned Nest Labs CEO and Co-founder Tony Fadell recently unveiled 'Arrow Smart-Kart', a $600 electric go-kart for kids developed by Actev Motors, another startup co-founded by him. The Wi-Fi and GPS-enabled customisable kart is app-connected and lets parents limit its driving area, top speed or hit a stop button in an emergency. It can travel up to 19 kilometres/hour.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart bracelet made to help the hearing impaired
article: French startup Novitact has developed 'Unitact', a smart bracelet that helps the hearing impaired people communicate easily through touch and vibrations. The app-connected device vibrates on the set alarm timings and lights up on receiving texts, calls or notifications. Users can also communicate important messages by assigning different vibrations to each message through the app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup develops smart massaging hoodie
article: A US-based startup has developed 'AiraWear', a $199 app-connected massaging hoodie which relaxes body through acupressure technology and claims to improve the body posture. It includes a six-modular detachable massage unit and an inflatable posture correction vest. Users can customise their massage type and intensity through the app. It claims to deliver three hours of massage in single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twitter reacts to Nikesh Arora's ₹490 cr salary
article: After SoftBank documents revealed that President and COO Nikesh Arora received over ₹490 crore in salary for the latest fiscal, a user tweeted "50% drop in @nikesharora's "valuation" from last fiscal to this...winter has truly arrived...". Another tweet read, "If folks stopped wasting time wondering about what @nikesharora earns, they might manage to earn more themselves".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon stops giving refunds after price drop
article: Amazon has reportedly ended its price protection policy on all products except televisions, that refunded customers with the difference in the price drop of an item after seven days of purchase. However, Amazon only matched its own prices for refund claims. The move is reportedly targeted towards the startups that track prices for Amazon customers and request refunds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volkswagen invests $300 mn in Uber rival Gett
article: German car manufacturer Volkswagen on Tuesday invested $300 million in Uber's rival Gett. Volkswagen plans to use the investment to spearhead its own move into ride-sharing, on-demand transportation and self-driving cars. Founded in 2010, Gett's on-demand taxi booking service exists in over 60 cities including London, Moscow and New York.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SoftBank's Nikesh Arora gets ₹490 cr in salary
article: Nikesh Arora, SoftBank President and COO, received over ₹490 crore in salary for the latest fiscal year, making him one of the world's top paid executives. Arora's package falls in the same range with Apple's Tim Cook and Walt Disney's CEO Bob Iger. Arora in the previous fiscal had received a record ₹906 crore in salary including a signing bonus.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Little Black Book raises funding from IDG
article: Delhi-based local discovery platform has raised an undisclosed amount from IDG Ventures. The funding has come almost a year after it raised $150,000 in seed funding from Rajan Anandan of Google India and others. Launched in 2012 by Suchita Salwan, Little Black Book is a curated cultural and lifestyle guide for restaurants, shopping and events in Delhi, Gurgaon and Noida.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twitter reacts to Helpchat firing 150 employees
article: After reports emerged of Helpchat app firing 150 employees and shutting down its chat-based assistance service, a user tweeted "Now that Helpchat has dropped chat, will it rechristen itself to just "Help"? "Help-anti-chat" sounds too clunky no?" Another tweet read, "If these kind of firing will continue, then whats the future of #entrepreneurship #Startups #HelpChat."

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Zomato pulls out of 9 global markets
article: Restaurant discovery platform Zomato has scaled back operations in nine of its 23 overseas markets, including US, UK, Italy, Sri Lanka, Chile and Canada. "We have taken a remote management approach in these markets. We do not have any physical presence, but we will continue to manage the operations out of our headquarters in India", Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal said.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Twitter reacts to Flipkart's valuation markdown
article: Reacting to Flipkart's markdown in valuation by Morgan Stanley Fund by over 15%, a user posted, "The hawa of ecommerce company billion dollar evaluation is vanishing. Wait n watch. Doomsday near #flipkart". "Seems Morgan Stanley didn't heed Bansal's new hocus-focus on 'Net Promoter Score' while marking down value 15% more!", read another user's tweet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Facebook acquires VR audio startup Two Big Ears
article: Social media giant Facebook on Monday acquired UK-based Virtual Reality audio startup Two Big Ears for an undisclosed amount. The startup's technology has been made free to download as 'Facebook 360 Spatial Workstation'. Founded in 2013 by Varun Nair and Abesh Thakur, the startup specialises in spatial 3D audio in cinematic and gaming experiences.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Valuation markdown is a global thing: Flipkart
article: On the recent valuation markdown, Flipkart CEO Binny Bansal told Mint, "They’re very small investors. It’s a global phenomenon; it’s not specific to Flipkart". He added, "The funds have their way of calculating valuations which isn’t clear." Bansal said, "If in future they mark up our valuation by 30%, it’s not like we’re suddenly going to be happy."

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: US-based startup develops molecular air purifier
article: San Francisco-based startup Molekule has developed a molecular air purifier that uses a new technology, called Photo Electrochemical Oxidation, to remove contaminants like bacteria, allergens, mold and chemicals from air. The $799 cylindrical device treats​ air using UV-A light, which breaks down contaminant compounds into non-harmful elements such as water, carbon dioxide and elemental nitrogen.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: FreeCharge names Govind Rajan as CEO
article: Snapdeal-owned digital payments platform FreeCharge on Tuesday appointed Govind Rajan as the Chief Executive Officer and elevated Co-Founder and former CEO Kunal Shah as the company's Chairman. Rajan joined FreeCharge in 2015 and was the Chief Operating Officer at the company. An alumnus of Indian Institute of Foreign Trade, Rajan has previously worked with Bharti Airtel and Hindustan Unilever.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Car charging network ChargePoint raises $50 mn
article: US-based electric vehicle charging network ChargePoint has raised $50 million in its latest round of funding led by Linse Capital. This takes the total funding raised by the startup to $164 million from investors including BMW iVentures and Siemens. Founded in 2007 by Richard Lowenthal and Praveen Mandal, the startup has over 28,000 stations across the US, Europe, Australia.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Toyota invests in Uber to explore ride-sharing
article: Toyota announced on Tuesday that it has made a strategic investment in taxi-hailing app Uber to explore ride-sharing collaboration. Toyota and Uber will start ride-sharing trials in various countries and let customers cover their Toyota lease payments from earnings as Uber drivers. The companies will also jointly develop in-car apps to support Uber drivers and accelerate their respective research.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ClearTax raises $2 mn from Thiel's fund, Sequoia
