article: ClearTax, which facilitates online filing of returns, on Thursday raised $2 million in funding from PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel's angel investing arm FF Angel and Sequoia Capital. Earlier in April, it raised $1.3 million in seed funding from PayPal Co-founder Max Levchin and others. ClearTax was founded in 2011 by Archit Gupta, Raja Ram Gupta, Srivatsan Chari and Ankit Solanki.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart's 'Big Shopping Days' begins today
article: Online retailer Flipkart's mega sale event 'Big Shopping Days' will take place from May 25-27 this year. The products that will be available on discounts during the sale include air conditioners, sunglasses, refrigerators, smartphones, laptops and shoes among others. Flipkart has also launched a 'Snakes & Ladders' game on its app that unlocks offers applicable for the shopping event.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Osmo develops toys to teach kids coding
article: US-based startup, Osmo has developed a Lego-like iPad-based toy to teach coding to kids. The game features a character who aims to collect strawberries, which is achieved by arranging magnetic physical blocks together that act as different commands like jump, move and grab. The game also provides better rewards if you're smart enough to create more sophisticated sequences.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat raises $1.8 bn at $20 bn valuation
article: Snapchat on Thursday raised $1.8 billion in its Series F round of funding from investors including Sequoia Capital, General Atlantic, IVP and Fidelity. The latest funding round reportedly values the company at around $20 billion. According to recent documents, the Los Angeles-based photo-messaging and multimedia app generated $59 million in revenue in 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Helpchat fires 150 employees, shuts chat wing
article: Bengaluru-based personal assistant app Helpchat has shut down its chat-based assistance service which let users book cabs, movie tickets, order food and has fired 150 of its employees. Helpchat's Founder Ankur Singla said that a severance package of three months has been given to the sacked employees. The startup had fired 112 of its employees in October 2015.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Morgan Stanley cuts Flipkart valuation to $9.4bn
article: Morgan Stanley Fund has marked down the value of its shares in Flipkart by 15.5% to $87.9 per share as of March 31, 2016 from $103.97 as of December 31 last year. This is the second consecutive markdown by Morgan Stanley pegging Flipkart's valuation at $9.39 billion, as compared to the $15.2 billion when it last raised capital.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal CPO Anand Chandrasekaran quits
article: Snapdeal's Chief Product Officer, Anand Chandrasekaran on Tuesday quit the company in less than one year. Snapdeal Co-Founder Rohit Bansal tweeted, "proud of the super work by you and the product team. Hard to believe that this was just 1 yr. Farewell, keep rocking!". Chandrasekaran replied, "Thanks for the support. We did in 1 what would take 3 years anywhere."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart faces heat from IIM-A over late joining
article: Flipkart has reportedly received an email from the Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad after the online retailer postponed the joining dates of the new recruits from June to December. The email said that the delay should be shortened and ₹1.5 lakh in compensation for the same is not acceptable. Flipkart said the delay is due to ongoing corporate restructuring.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Twitter reacts to IIM-A's e-mail to Flipkart
article: Reacting to IIM-A's e-mail to Flipkart over delayed joinings, a user tweeted, "Terrible move by Flipkart...bad timing and worse optics. Clearly, a case of being penny wise and pound foolish". Another tweet read, "Forget about common people, @Flipkart fails to deliver promises even to #IIMA students". "New Bansal is a strategy and PR disaster @Flipkart @binnybansal @_sachinbansal", a user tweeted.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Not looking to sell Housing: Jason Kothari, CEO
article: SoftBank-backed real estate portal Housing's CEO Jason Kothari in an interview said, "Almost all competitors in our space have approached us...But we're not looking to sell the company." Kothari added, "We are not in any talks with Snapdeal for a sale." "This is completely untrue and it appears one of our competitors may be feeding these false rumours," said Kothari.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Ola launches luxury cars category in Mumbai
article: Taxi-aggregator company Ola on Friday introduced a new category on its app called, ‘Ola Lux’, a service which provides luxury cars including Jaguar, Mercedes, Audi and BMW among others. The ‘Ola Lux’ service, which is piloting in South Mumbai, is available for booking at a minimum fare of ₹200 for 5 km, and ₹19 per km then onwards.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Paytm to hire IIM-A grads with Flipkart offers
article: Online payments and m-commerce firm Paytm has claimed that it will evaluate the resumes of the 18 Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad graduates after Flipkart deferred their joining by six months. “We have received mails from the placement cell of IIM-A and we will look at hiring these graduates, but only after interviews,” said Paytm's Vice President.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Anand Mahindra invests in SheThePeople
article: Anand Mahindra, Chairman of Mahindra Group, on Monday invested an undisclosed amount in SheThePeople, a video storytelling platform for women achievers. Founded in 2014 by Shaili Chopra, the platform shares success stories of women entrepreneurs, authors, game-changers, sportswomen, corporate executives and their other achievements. The stories are currently offered in English and Hindi.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in chatbot startup Niki.ai
article: Ratan Tata, Chairman emeritus of Tata Sons, has invested an undisclosed amount in artificial intelligence based chatbot niki.ai. Existing investor, Ronnie Screwvala’s Unilazer Ventures, which invested in its seed round last October, also participated. Started in 2015 by IIT Kharagpur alumni Sachin Jaiswal, Keshav Prawasi, Nitin Babel, and Shishir Modi, it helps users order services through a chat.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup makes smart tea brewer 'Chime'
article: US-based startup Camellia Labs has developed a $249 smart tea brewer 'Chime', which claims to brew a cup of Indian tea in three minutes. It includes a tea boiler, a milk carafe and tea capsules that contain cardamom, ginger and other traditional tea ingredients. The brewer's app allows users to adjust their tea to milk ratio, brew strength and temperature.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Brazil startup makes face-controlled wheelchair
article: Brazilian startup HOO.BOX has developed 'Wheelie', prototype of a face-controlled wheelchair which operates through facial, head, or iris movements. The wheelchair consists of a 3D RealSense camera that captures nearly 80 expressions from a user's face including smile, eyebrows up, kiss movement, tongue out and others. These expressions are used by the wheelchair to move, turn and stop itself.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Startup to create meteor shower for Olympics '20
article: Tokyo-based startup Star-ALE is designing an artificial meteor shower for the 2020 Olympics. Dubbed 'Sky Canvas', the meteor shower would be visible from an area of over 190 km, the company claimed. To launch the fireworks, it will send a microsatellite in space armed with 1,000 to 5,000 combustible pellets, which will be ignited 56 to 80 km above Earth.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: FreeCharge enables money transfer via WhatsApp
article: Digital payments platform FreeCharge announced on Thursday that it has enabled money transfer through WhatsApp. To enable the feature, users need to grant accessibility permission to the app under the 'FreeCharge on WhatsApp' option in its menu. To transfer money, the user should send 'XFC' as a text message, where X is the amount to be transferred.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Twitter reacts to Tinder's lawsuit against 3nder
article: After dating app Tinder sued 3nder, a dating app for people seeking threesomes, Twitter users reacted with tweets like, "A touching story of tech startup. #TinderSuckMySocks". Another user tweeted, "No one is going to confuse tinder with 3nder. Suing them is ridiculous". "You don't like threesomes? Feel free to avoid them, but suck my socks (they stink)", read another tweet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Self-driving taxi startup nuTonomy raises $16 mn
article: Self-driving taxi startup nuTonomy has raised $16 million in Series A round of funding led by Highland Capital Partners. Ford’s fund, Singapore Economic Development Board and other existing backers including Signal Ventures and Samsung Ventures also participated. An MIT spinoff founded in 2013, the startup is testing self-driving taxis which it plans to launch commercially in Singapore by 2018.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: TaxiVaxi raises $500k in seed funding
article: Delhi-based cab aggregator TaxiVaxi on Wednesday raised $500,000 in its second round of seed funding from a clutch of High Networth Individuals. Founded in 2014, the app-based platform lets users book radio taxis, tour taxis, share rides or rent a car for self driving with fare comparison option. The startup currently operates in around 20 cities including Delhi and Mumbai.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Coworking Space BHIVE raises $1 mn from Blume
article: Bengaluru-based coworking space BHIVE Workspace on Wednesday raised $1 million in a funding round led by Blume Ventures. Launched in November 2014, BHIVE Workspace provides secured and Wi-Fi connected office spaces to entrepreneurs, startups and freelancers. BHIVE Workspace currently operates in four locations covering 47,000 sq ft with over 800 occupancy.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber confirms testing self-driving cars in US
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber on Thursday confirmed testing its self-driving cars in Pittsburgh, the US. The car is a hybrid Ford Fusion which includes sensors like radars, laser scanners, and high resolution cameras to map details of the environment up to 100 meters in any direction. However, a trained driver will monitor operations when a car's self-driving mode is turned on.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 'Users don't prefer round number surge pricing'
article: According to Keith Chen, Uber's Head of Economic Research, more riders accept the surge pricing if it isn't a round number. Chen also revealed that riders are more likely to accept the surge pricing when their phone's battery is about to die. Chen added that Uber isn't acting on these data points, but making a note of the human behaviour.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: TinyOwl shuts down in all cities except Mumbai
article: Food delivery startup TinyOwl has reportedly shut down its operations in all cities except Mumbai. Users of TinyOwl’s app started seeing a notification last week that the service will be discontinued after May 22. Earlier this month, reports suggested that TinyOwl, which has raised over $27 million, is merging with Runnr, a Bengaluru-based hyperlocal on-demand delivery startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart device turns any surface to remote control
article: A US-based startup has developed 'Knocki', a $129 smart device that can turn any surface into a remote control to operate various devices. The device turns any surface into a touch interface. Connected through an app, it can let users control lights, find phone, adjust room temperature, access television, and brew coffee from bed by knocking on the Knocki-attached surfaces.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tinder sues dating app for threesomes '3nder'
article: Dating app Tinder has reportedly sued '3nder', a dating app for people seeking threesomes, over the similarity between the names. Launched in 2014, 3nder is currently available on iOS and plans to launch an Android app this month. In response to Tinder, 3nder has launched a site called 'Tinder Wants to Kill 3nder' and is promoting '#TinderSuckMySocks' on Twitter.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Used cars startups get record funding in Q1 2016
article: Used cars startups received record funding in the first quarter of this year with a 74% growth and a 20% increase in deals over the previous quarter. Notably, India and China combined saw nearly half of all the deals occurring in the past 4 years. Mumbai-based auto classifieds platform CarTrade raised $145 million in Series B funding in January.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App made to delete junk photos from WhatsApp
article: Artificial Intelligence-powered startup Siftr Labs has launched an app called 'Magic Cleaner', that finds and deletes junk photos from messaging apps including WhatsApp, Hike, Line and Telegram. It contains a virtual character 'Doctor Kleen', which needs to be tapped to start the cleaning. The app separates the junk from the important photos for the user.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 500 Startups backs hairdresser booking app
article: London-based hairdresser booking app Rock Pamper Scissors has raised over $1.7 million in funding from US-based 500 Startups, European pre-seed and seed investor Seedcamp and others. Tom Singh, Founder of the New Look chain of high street fashion stores in the UK, also participated. Founded in 2013, the app lets users book local hairdressers with emphasis on individual stylists.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tim Cook meets UrbanClap, Sweet Couch founders
article: Apple CEO Tim Cook met the founders of four startups including UrbanClap, Sweet Couch, Cynapse and Avaz. While UrbanClap is a home services startup, Avaz is a speech therapy app for autistic children. Further, Sweet Couch is a fashion shopping platform and Cynapse is a software products maker. The four startups gave a demo of their iOS apps to Cook.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twitter reacts to notification bug in Myntra app
article: After users of the fashion app Myntra started getting notifications of items they didn't order, Twitter users reacted with tweets like "Calm down @myntra I didn't even know I had the Myntra app in my phone until it started PMSing". "#Myntra gone drunk!", read a tweet. A user tweeted, "The Myntra app was also shocked by the election results today!".

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Uber ends surge pricing in Delhi; Caps fares
article: Uber has ended surge pricing completely in New Delhi after warnings were issued by Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. The company has also agreed to not exceed the government-prescribed fare. The government-iterated taxi fares are ₹12.50/km for economy radio taxis, ₹14/km for non-AC black-and-yellow cabs and ₹23/km for radio taxis, with additional 25% night charges.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Zomato slams user on posting fake reviews
article: Online restaurant discovery platform Zomato quashed claims of a user Prateek Dham, who accused Zomato of paid reviews and deleting his account without intimation. Dham's account, with almost 5,000 followers, was deleted because he approached restaurants for a free meal in exchange of a positive review, Zomato Co-founder Pankaj Chaddah, claimed in a blog post.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Urban Ladder allows 6 months of maternity leave
article: Bengaluru-based furniture platform Urban Ladder has increased the maternity leave for its full-time women employees from thirteen weeks to six months. The employees can opt for additional three months of part-time work at regular pay basis or three months of unpaid leave. The benefits which came into effect from April this year, also apply to the adoption and surrogacy cases.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sorry, we messed up, says Myntra on tech glitch
article: After Myntra app users received notifications of orders they never placed on their smartphones, the fashion retailer said "Sorry, we messed up" in a blog post on Friday. Myntra's Chief Technology and Product Officer, Shamik Sharma said the glitch was the result of a code change in the notification servers. However, the glitch has been fixed by Myntra.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes portable bottle-shaped microwave
article: UK-based startup Wayv has developed 'Adventurer', a bottle-shaped portable microwave with 900ml capacity priced at $199. It comes with a digital counter display and buttons for various functions. The microwave claims to deliver over 30 minutes of operational time in a single charge. The dishwasher-safe microwave can be charged at home, in the car or through portable solar panels.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 3D-printed wheelchair with customised seat made
article: Benjamin Hubert, Director of the London-based industrial design agency Layer, has created 'GO wheelchair', a 3D-printed wheelchair with customisable seat to meet the specifications of the user's body. The user's body is scanned and the needs are assessed to 3D-print a seat. Further, the wheelchair comes with special gloves to access its wheels which have “almost BMX bike” grip texture.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: UK startup creates wearable air purifier
article: A UK-based startup has created a $89 pocket-sized wearable air purifier 'Breathe', which claims to eliminate air pollutants and provide clean air around the user within seconds. It can last for over 30 hours in single charge and doesn't require any filter replacement. The purifier also claims to eliminate smoke, odour and has a range of up to 20 metres.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm has enough funds for five years, says CEO
article: Alibaba-backed Paytm's CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma today said that the startup has enough funds to last for another five years if it keeps spending at the same rate as the last year. Sharma added that Paytm doesn’t plan to go for IPO for at least three years. Founded in 2010, Paytm's investors include SAIF Partners, Sapphire Ventures and Saama Capital.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart duped by a gang in Hyderabad
article: Online retailer Flipkart was duped by a four-member gang from Hyderabad's Warangal district, which ordered high-end smartphones, replaced them with the fake ones and demanded refunds. Police has arrested the gang and seized 21 handsets worth around ₹7.10 lakh, a laptop and ₹6.50 lakh in cash. The gang members have been identified as former Flipkart workers from Nellore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BedBathMore raises funding from Rocket Internet
article: Home furnishing platform BedBathMore on Monday raised undisclosed amount of funding from Rocket Internet, Swedish bank AB Kinnevik Group and some backers of FabFurnish. Earlier in January this year, reports said that FabFurnish was in advanced talks for merger with BedBathMore. Founded in 2012 by Amit Dalmia, the startup lets users discover, share and buy home furnishing solutions.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Alibaba Pictures raises $260 million in Series A
article: Alibaba Pictures, the film and TV subsidiary of China’s Alibaba Group, has raised $260 million in Series A funding for its online ticketing platform, Taobao Movie. The round, led by CDH Investments, Ant Financial Services and Sina, also included Chinese entertainment companies Hehe Pictures, BONA Film, and Huace Media. This reportedly gives Taobao Movie a post-money valuation of $2.1 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Baba Ramdev listed in most creative biz people
article: Baba Ramdev and Amit Agarwal, Amazon India Head, have been named in the list of ‘100 Most Creative People in Business’ by American magazine Fast Company.  Agarwal has been ranked 10th for "extending Amazon's reach, one vendor at a time". Further, Ramdev has been ranked 27th for "disrupting India's $49 billion consumer packaged goods market".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Apparel rental startup Klozee shuts down
article: Bengaluru-based premium apparel platform Klozee has shut down within seven months of raising its seed funding. “Demand was a lot slower than we expected. The idea would have taken a lot of money and investment to scale up. So we decided to shut down in January,” said Aman Haji, Klozee's Co-founder. Klozee's Co-founders have joined home decor marketplace Livspace.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Carpooling app Derbii raises angel funding
article: Carpooling app Derbii has raised an undisclosed amount of angel funding from Anurag Chauhan, MD, Accenture and Arvind Modi, Director and CEO, Komli Developers. Founded in 2015 by Gaurav Sinsinwar, Prasenjit Singh and Akash Chaudhary, the app lets users share AC cabs with door-to-door pickup and drop service. Derbii currently operates in Delhi, Gurgaon, Faridabad, Manesar, Noida and Ghaziabad.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Wearable device allows typing by tapping fingers
article: Israeli startup Tap Systems has developed 'Tap Strap', a foam strap that lets users type by tapping fingers. Controlled through an app, the bluetooth-connected strap translates 31 different kinds of finger tapping into various text inputs and claims 99% accuracy. While each finger is considered as a vowel, and combinations of fingers make up the other letters and symbols.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US man builds $199 personal portable boat
article: Dave Yonce from Oklahoma, US, has built 'GoBoat', a $199 portable personal boat that can be folded and stored in the trunk of a car. The boat, compatible with any trolling motor, weighs over six kilograms and assembles within minutes. Fit to ride for both kids and adults, GoBoat is designed to navigate through hard-to-reach or shallow areas and marshes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startups to set shop at Bengaluru metro stations
article: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation (BMRC) has decided to allow startups to open their shops at large metro stations of the city. The BMRC will soon be floating tenders for inviting and providing space to the startups at the metro stations. The startups may range from electronics to cosmetics or coffee shops, eating joints or mobile repair shops.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup makes language-translation earpieces
article: New York-based startup Waverly Labs has developed 'Pilot', a $129 set of smart earpieces that translate between different languages. Connected through an app, the earpieces need to be worn by two people who don’t speak the same language. It currently translates between English, Spanish, French, Italian and plans to include East Asian, Hindi, Semitic, Arabic, Slavic and African languages.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tiger Global cut stakes in Amazon, Apple
article: According to a regulatory filing on Monday, Tiger Global Management cut stakes in Amazon, Apple and China's second-biggest online retailer Jingdong Mall (JD) as on March 31, 2016. While it axed stake in Amazon by about two-thirds to  $619 million, it reduced its Apple holding by almost half to $617 million. Stake in Jingdong was reduced by about a quarter.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bengaluru woman alleges Ola driver of misconduct
article: A 31-year-old woman in Bengaluru alleged that an Ola driver misbehaved with her on Saturday during a ride and fled from the spot leaving his car and license behind. The woman has lodged a police complaint against the driver in the regard. While the police has seized the car and the license, the driver is still on the run.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Food pre-ordering app Zeppery shuts down
article: Restaurant food pre-ordering app Zeppery has shut down after six months of launching operations due to low response and higher customer retention costs. Founded in 2015, the app lets users browse food menus and pre-order their meals before visiting a restaurant. Zeppery owner Inweone Technologies is now working on a micro-delivery logistics business and building a new team.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: CouponDunia debuts last minute hotel booking app
article: Coupons and cashback platform CouponDunia has launched a last minute hotel booking app Sorted. The app lets users book a hotel up to 72 hours in advance in over 200 cities across the country including Delhi, Mumbai, Pune, Bengaluru, Chennai and Hyderabad. The app also integrates hotel reviews by American travel website company TripAdvisor.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tata invests in medical emergency app MUrgency
article: Ratan Tata, Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons, on Tuesday invested an undisclosed amount in San Francisco-based global medical emergency app MUrgency. Founded in 2014, the app alerts a user's family and friends during a medical emergency and connects them with ambulance, doctors and nurses with one tap. He has made over 25 investments in startups in the last two years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Silicon Valley mocks Trump on tech bubble alert
article: Donald Trump, the Republican US Presidential candidate, was on Tuesday mocked by the Silicon Valley over his warning of a dangerous financial bubble formed in the technology industry. "FINALLY someone calls it out," tweeted Marc Andreessen, Co-founder, Andreessen Horowitz. "He says things and does things that are made for entertainment," said Aaron Ginn, Co-founder, Lincoln Initiative.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Parenting social network Parentlane gets funding
article: Bengaluru-based social networking app for parents, Parentlane on Wednesday raised an undisclosed amount in angel funding led by Sujeet Kumar, former President of Operations, Flipkart. Aprameya Radhakrishna, Founder of TaxiForSure, Sumit Jain, Co-founder of CommonFloor and others also participated. The social platform guides parents on the overall development of their children aged 0-8 years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ultra-thin lense turns smartphone to microscope
article: Italian startup Smart Micro-Optics has developed 'Blips', a $23 portable set of ultra-thin adhesive micro and macro lenses, which turns any smartphone or tablet into a microscope. While the micro lense provides high resolution micro images up to 4 microns, the macro lense provides 10 times optical magnification. Microscopic images are visible through a dedicated Android or iOS app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MIT shows prototype of high-speed Hyperloop pod
article: A 30-member team from Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) on Saturday unveiled the prototype of a high-speed Hyperloop pod meant to carry passengers through vacuum tubes at 1280km/h. The pod, currently a third of the size of the actual pod, is propelled by magnets that will levitate it off tracks. However, the pod's current version can reach 402km/h.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MakeMyTrip allows users to buy foreign currency
article: Travel platform MakeMyTrip on Tuesday partnered with Gurgaon-based BookMyForex, an online platform for foreign exchange, to let users buy foreign currency through its website or app. Founded in 2012, BookMyForex lets users buy, sell or remit foreign currency instruments with door delivery or bank pickup options. MakeMyTrip users will also be able to access live forex rates.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Apple announces startup accelerator in Bengaluru
article: On Apple CEO Tim Cook's maiden visit to India, the company today announced to set up its first iOS app design and development accelerator in Bengaluru in early 2017. The accelerator will support developers to create mobile apps for the iOS platform. Apple experts will lead briefings at the centre and provide one-on-one app reviews for developers every week.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart tampon tells user when its time to change
article: A startup from the HAX Hardware Accelerator has developed 'my.Flow', a smart tampon that reminds the user when its time to change tampon during menstruation. Connected to a traditional tampon, it consists of a bluetooth sensor on a user's waist, which lights up when its time to change. User is also notified through an app, which also tracks the period.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App to avoid queues at food court raises funding
article: SmartQ, a Bengaluru-based app to let users avoid queues at food court on Wednesday raised an undisclosed amount in pre-Series A funding led by YourNest Angel Fund. Vijay Jumani, former CEO of BabyOye also participated in the funding. Founded in 2015, SmartQ lets employees at technology parks place order at food courts and receive an alert when food is ready.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart apparel directs cyclists to destination
article: A Los Angeles-based startup has developed 'Lumenus', a $250 smart apparel that gives users directions through LEDs on entering their destination on a dedicated app. The apparel also integrates washable colour-changing LEDs which provides safety to the cyclists by increasing their visibility to other riders on the road. The LEDs claim to last up to 24 hours in single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola launches outstation rides in Delhi, Jaipur
article: Ola has launched a cash-only outstation cab service 'Ola Outstation' in Delhi, NCR and Jaipur to let users book cabs and start their trip after two hours. Ola Mini cab will cost a base fare of ₹2,000 for 250 kilometres and ₹8/km for additional kilometres. Ola initially offered intercity rides but later discontinued the service.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Stayzilla raises $13 million in Series C funding
article: Stayzilla, an online aggregator of budget hotels and homestays, has raised over $13 million in Series C round of funding led by existing investors Matrix Partners and Nexus Ventures. In February last year, the company had raised $15 million in Series B funding led by Nexus and Matrix Partners. Stayzilla was founded by Yogendra Vasupal, Rupal Yogendra and Sachit Singhi in 2005.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: On-demand truck platform Moovo acquires GoGoods
article: Delhi based on-demand mini-truck aggregator Moovo on Monday acquired Patna-based logistics startup GoGoods for an undisclosed amount in an all stock deal. The five-member team of GoGoods will join Moovo. Launched in December 2014 by Nishant Kumar and Anurag Satyarth, GoGoods aggregates trucks in Patna and Ranchi for shifting homes, warehouse necessities, home deliveries and event management.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Swiggy raises $7 mn at $130 mn valuation
article: Food delivery platform Swiggy on Tuesday raised an additional $7 million in funding from existing investors including Norwest Venture Partners, DST Global and Accel Partners. The latest funding has valued the startup at around $130 million. Earlier in January, Swiggy had raised $35 million in Series C round of funding from New York-based Harmony Partners and Singapore-based RB Investments.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Weight loss app HealthifyMe raises $6 million
article: Bengaluru-based calorie counter and weight loss app HealthifyMe on Tuesday raised $6 million in Series A funding round led by IDG Ventures India, Inventus Capital and Blume Ventures. Founded in 2012, it combines cloud-powered software, wearable devices and fitness experts to let users achieve their fitness goals. HealthifyMe had raised an undisclosed amount of pre-Series A funding in June 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber launches wheelchair-friendly cabs in London
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber on Tuesday launched wheelchair-friendly cabs in London through a new service called 'UberWAV'. The service will let users book cabs equipped with a rear-entry ramp, winch and restraints, allowing one more passenger to accompany the user. It will be available at the same price as an UberX ride, however, with an average waiting time of 25-40 minutes.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Alibaba, SoftBank form cloud-computing venture
article: Chinese e-commerce company Alibaba has partnered Japanese telecom giant SoftBank to form a new cloud-computing joint venture, named SB Cloud Corporation or "SB Cloud", in Japan. The new venture, which will be 60% owned by SoftBank and the remaining by Alibaba, will open a data center in Japan and deliver Alibaba Cloud services and technology to SoftBank's corporate customers.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: India’s 1st startup hostel launched in Bengaluru
article: Entrepreneur platform Construkt Media has launched India’s first startup hostel in Bengaluru as a business-friendly accommodation for the travelling startup and creative community. Started with a budget of ₹22 lakh, the 3,500-square-feet hostel can host 20 people at a time at a cost of ₹850 per night. Its facilities include a self-catering kitchen, WiFi, lounge space, laundry and meeting space.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Quikr acquires on-demand beauty startup Salosa
article: Classifieds platform Quikr on Tuesday acquired web-based on-demand home beauty and styling startup Salosa for an undisclosed amount. Salosa has been a partner of QuikrServices,  Quikr's hyperlocal on-demand services marketplace. Founded in 2015 by former Procter & Gamble executives Piyush Dhanuka and Anurag Nair, Salosa currently operates in Gurgaon and some parts of Delhi.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Education platform Unacademy raises $500k
article: Online education platform Unacademy on Thursday raised $500,000 in latest funding led by Blume Ventures. Google's Rajan Anandan, CommonFloor Co-founder Sumit Jain, RedBus Co-founder Phanindra Sama and TaxiForSure Founder Aprameya Radhakrishna also participated. Founded in 2015, Unacademy makes educational videos by experts available free of cost to users through its platform.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hindi social network ShabdaNagari raises funding
article: Hindi social networking startup ShabdaNagari on Thursday raised an undisclosed amount in bridge funding from ah! Ventures. Launched by IIT Mumbai alumni in January this year, the Hindi platform lets users share their articles, pictures, videos as well as questions using the tools provided on the website. The startup had earlier raised $200,000 from Kanpur Angels and other investors.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Uber CEO responds to Apple funding Chinese rival
article: After Apple announced an investment of $1 billion in China's largest taxi-hailing app Didi Chuxing (formerly known as Didi Kuaidi), Uber CEO Travis Kalanick tweeted, "girlfriend owns @apple shares which makes her a didi investor...#ridesharewars #domesticissues #thanksALotTim." Didi is Uber's biggest rival in China and claims to hold 87% of the country's private ride-hailing market.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: On-demand driver startup DriversKart buys Driven
article: Chennai-based on-demand driver provider DriversKart on Wednesday acquired Mumbai-headquartered app-based driver hiring startup Driven for an undisclosed amount in an equity and cash deal. Launched in August 2015, Driven lets users hire temporary drivers for their personal cars. DriversKart was started in September 2015 and currently operates in Bengaluru, Mumbai, Pune, Delhi and Chennai.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Capital Float raises $25 mn at $100 mn valuation
article: Online lending platform Capital Float on Thursday raised $25 million in Series B funding round led by US-based Creation Investments and existing investors SAIF Partners, Sequoia Capital and Aspada Ventures. The latest funding has reportedly valued the startup at over $100 million. Founded in 2013, it has partnered with Snapdeal, Alibaba, Myntra and Paytm to provide working capital finance.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Apple invests $1 bn in China's largest taxi app
article: Apple on Friday announced that it has invested $1 billion in China's largest taxi-hailing app Didi Chuxing (formerly known as Didi Kuaidi). Didi Chuxing said that this is its single largest round of funding so far. The company’s other major investors include Tencent, Alibaba and SoftBank. Apple CEO Tim Cook said the investment will help Apple and Didi Chuxing collaborate in future.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Amazon launches its online video service
article: Amazon on Tuesday launched its online video service, called Amazon Video Direct, that lets users post videos to its website and earn through advertising, royalties and other sources. The service will make the content available to rent, own or view for free with ads. This move puts the company in direct competition with Google-owned YouTube.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes backpack with inbuilt e-skateboard
article: A US-based startup has created 'Movpak', a $1,200 backpack with an inbuilt remote-controlled electric skateboard that goes up to 20 mph. The backpack gets fully charged in two hours and allows 10 miles of skateboarding per charge. The skateboard, with tracking capability for security, comes with front lights for visibility in the night and supports Siri and Google Now.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyperloop achieves 187 km/h in 1.1s during test
article: Hyperloop One on Thursday successfully conducted the first public test of its high-speed transport system which achieved 187km/h speed in 1.1 seconds in Nevada, US. Brainchild of Tesla CEO Elon Musk, the system will help people travel in pods running through a vacuum tube. It claims to cover a 616-kilometre distance between San Francisco and Los Angeles in 30 minutes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup unveils self-driving truck concept
article: Nikola, an Utah-based startup in the US has unveiled 'Nikola One', a self-driving six-wheeled electric truck concept that claims to run for 1,280-1,930 kilometres on a single charge. It has a 2000 hp battery powered by natural gas. The truck also has a touchscreen cockpit, fridge, Wi-Fi and claims to pull a convoy of five driverless trucks behind it.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: India's e-commerce tripled from 2010 to 2014
article: India’s e-commerce sector more than tripled from $4.4 billion in 2010 to $13.6 billion in 2014, according to data contained in a reply given to the Lok Sabha in March 2016. Further, the country’s online retail sector is expected to be worth $1 trillion by 2020, according to a recent report by the Confederation of Indian Industry and Deloitte.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ed-tech startup Purple Squirrel shuts down
article: Matrix-backed Ed-tech platform Purple Squirrel has reportedly shut down its operations owing to dipping sales and increasing cash burn rate. Founded by Sahiba Dhandhania and Aditya Gandhi in September 2013 and incubated by IIT Bombay, the Mumbai-based startup has raised over ₹15 crore to date. Purple Squirrel facilitates industry visits, workshops and projects for students across all streams.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Home rental platform Zenify raises $900k
article: Bengaluru-based home rental platform Zenify on Wednesday raised $900,000 in its pre-Series A round of funding from a clutch of High Networth Individuals. Founded in 2012 by three IIT Madras graduates Sudarshan Purohit, Ankur Agarwal and Kailash Rath, Zenify lets users search, visit and rent apartments in Bengaluru. It competes with the likes of Nestaway, Homigo and Zocalo among others.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Startup creates object-recognizing smart device
article: Chinese startup Xiaoxi Technology has developed a smart device that uses a camera and an object recognition software to recognize any object placed in front of it. The company claims that the device will help children identify different objects in few seconds. The device, which also features video chat, allows parents to remotely monitor and manage it.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Reliance Jio launches wallet service JioMoney
article: Mukesh Ambani-owned Reliance Jio Infocomm on Wednesday launched its digital wallet service 'JioMoney Digital Wallet'. The wallet app is available on both the Android and iOS platforms. It will let users make bill payments, shop online and send and receive money. The Reserve Bank of India in 2015 granted license to the Reliance Industries to set up a payments bank.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Amazon clocks ₹72.84 cr sales via IRCTC website
article: E-commerce major Amazon has clocked transactions worth ₹72.84 crore through sales from railway portal IRCTC since the latter announced its alliance with Amazon in March 2015, an IRCTC official said. The 'Shop on Amazon' tab on the IRCTC website redirects users to the Amazon India homepage. Reportedly, IRCTC's contract with Amazon will expire in June.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Uber to offer luxury bike test rides in B'luru
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber has partnered with Bengaluru-based luxury motorcycle rentals company Wicked Ride to offer test rides to its users. The rides, called UberWICKED, will be offered on May 14 between 12 pm and 4 pm and will last for 15 minutes. To avail this, riders must be over the age of 21 and have a valid motorcycle license.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: US startup to route Uber to an unknown bar
article: US-based app Bar Roulette allows users to book an Uber to go to an unknown bar. Users need to input the location where they would like to go and the app picks the highest-rated bars from Yelp and Foursquare, without disclosing the name. Uber, then drops them to the chosen location revealing the bar name when they arrive.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Ford to invest $182 mn in EMC-VMware venture
article: American automobile manufacturer Ford will invest $182.2 million for a 6.6% stake in San Francisco-based Pivotal Software, the cloud-computing joint venture of EMC Corporation and VMware Inc. Microsoft will also invest in the round, which totals to $253 million, Pivotal said. With this round of funding, Pivotal's valuation will increase to around $2.5 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 'Rocket Internet investors must think long-term'
article: German e-commerce investor Rocket Internet's Founder Oliver Samwer said that Rocket's investors need to buy into its five to ten-year plans rather than focus on short term market fluctuations. He also admitted that business is tough in some countries including India. Rocket Internet is reportedly facing concerns from investors over its loss-making startups in fashion and food delivery segments.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Myntra to relaunch desktop site on June 1
article: Fashion e-retailer Myntra, which went app-only a year ago, will relaunch its desktop site on June 1. The company said that the main reason for the shift is feedback from consumers, especially women who want to have the option of shopping across channels. It expects 15-20% of its sales in the current financial year to come from the desktop website.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Startup makes smart buckle for watches
article: Canadian startup Wearatec has developed a smart buckle, Link, that can be attached to a watch to display notifications such as incoming calls, texts and e-mails from the users' smartphone. The device features standard fitness tracking device properties and allows controlling devices like computers and tablets. It also features an NFC chip which the company claims will allow contactless payment.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Snapdeal acquires TargetingMantra
article: E-commerce marketplace Snapdeal on Thursday acquired Gurgaon-based predictive marketing technology startup TargetingMantra for an undisclosed amount. Founded by Saurabh Nangia and Rahul Singh in March 2013, it helps manage customer life cycle through personalization, targeting and big data analytics. In 2014, TargetingMantra raised $1.1 million in seed funding led by 500 Startups, and others.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Paytm now allows payment for vehicle parking
article: Digital payment platform Paytm has tied up with several property owners and parking management companies across the country to allow its users pay for vehicle parking. Users would be able to pay through their Paytm wallets using QR code and Barcode scanners. Currently, Paytm lets users pay for utilities including electricity, water, telephone, gas bills and at petrol pumps.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: TinyOwl, Runnr to merge in an all-stock deal
article: Food ordering platform TinyOwl and hyperlocal on-demand delivery startup Runnr, previously known as Roadrunnr, are reportedly merging in an all-stock deal. The merged entity will launch a consumer food delivery platform 'Runnr', which will compete with the likes of Swiggy and Zomato. The new food delivery platform is said to launch in the next three weeks in Mumbai.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Investors say our valuation is justified: Zomato
article: After HSBC slashed Zomato's valuation by 50%, CEO Deepinder Goyal sent an email to employees addressing their concerns on the valuation markdown. He said that "nobody who knows our business has marked down our valuations" and the existing investors have stated that Zomato's valuations are justified. He added that several analysts, VCs have called Zomato “the only defensible Indian unicorn”.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Swiggy tests surge pricing for food delivery
article: Food delivery platform Swiggy is reportedly testing surge-pricing model for its services in Bengaluru and Hyderabad. The startup is charging an additional ₹20 for orders placed on days when fewer staff is available including national holidays, festivals and rainy days. Swiggy said that the practice will soon be extended to all the cities it operates in.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Uber delivers 15k printed emails via horse-cart
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber on Tuesday delivered 15,000 printed emails from supporters via a horse-cart to Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk in Australia. This comes after the Queensland Government passed changes to transport laws, increasing penalties for drivers and administrators of ride-sharing services. Uber claimed that emails to Premier's officer were blocked and not received.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: Oculus hires Fitbit's Hans Hartmann as new COO
article: Facebook-owned VR company Oculus has hired Fitbit's Chief Operating Officer (COO) Hans Hartmann as the company's new COO.  According to a tweet from Oculus CEO Brendan Iribe, Hartmann, who was with Fitbit since 2011, will be replacing founding COO Laird Malamed. Laird be taking on a new executive role in the company.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Jeff Bezos nets $670 mn by sale of Amazon shares
article: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos collected $671 million this week after selling 1 million shares in the company, according to a filing. This is $135 million more than his proceeds in August 2015, after he sold a block of a million shares. Bezos still owns 82 million shares in the company, a 17% stake valued at $54 billion, according to Bloomberg.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: App lets users get money back after price drop
article: US-based app Earny helps users get their money back on online purchases after prices drop. It connects with the email and Amazon accounts to track online purchases and checks the prices to see if a user got the best deal. If it finds a lower price, Earny requests a refund and the difference gets credited to the user's card.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: PayPal to end buyer protection on crowdfunding
article: PayPal on Monday announced to withdraw its purchase protection program from June 25, 2016, for payments made through its platform to back crowdfunding campaigns. The program lets users open disputes for items that don't arrive or are different than described. PayPal said the move is followed by risks involved in crowdfunding campaigns, which don't guarantee a return for the investment.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal app to provide UrbanClap services
article: Snapdeal on Monday tied-up with local services provider UrbanClap to provide over 80 personal and home services on the online retailer's Android app. The services include general fitness, yoga, beauty care and salon services at home among others. In April last year, Snapdeal Co-founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal had invested in UrbanClap in their individual capacities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twitter reacts to TinyOwl-Runnr merger
article: After reports suggested merger of TinyOwl and Runnr in an all-stock deal, people reacted with tweets like "After live-in relationship of six months @TinyOwl_App and @PickRoadRunnr finally tied the knot". "Last year investors were busy making investments in startups, this year busy saving those investments", read a tweet. A user tweeted, "Swiggy, Zomato, Foodpanda will have tough time in growth".

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: Siri creators demo new virtual assistant, Viv
article: Siri creator Dag Kittlaus gave the first public demo of Viv, an AI virtual system at TechCrunch Disrupt in New York. Viv works on “dynamic program generation,” which allows the AI-powered assistant to understand intent and generate a code to best answer the query. The company has raised $12.5 million and has been working on the product for four years.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: Swiggy delivers 1 million orders in April
article: Food delivery platform Swiggy delivered one million food orders across eight cities in April. Currently, the company is operational in Delhi, Bengaluru, Mumbai, Hyderabad, Gurgaon, Pune, Kolkata and Chennai. In January, Swiggy had raised its Series C funding of $35 million from RB investments and Harmony Partners, along with existing investors.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: Lenovo launches $500 million startup fund
article: Chinese technology giant Lenovo on Friday launched a $500 million fund to invest in startups. Lenovo will be investing in companies in the cloud computing, big data, artificial intelligence, robots and other Internet services spaces. Lenovo had created a $100 million fund in 2010 and has already invested in more than 40 companies globally.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Flipkart to launch its own map services
article: E-commerce firm Flipkart has partnered with MapUnity, a Bengaluru-based social technology company, to launch its map services. The network will cover 126 cities including those chosen in the 'Smart Cities' mission. The company said that the service will help it in handling logistics and supply chain. Notably, Flipkart had acquired 34% stake in Delhi-based digital mapping firm MapMyIndia last year.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: HSBC slashes Zomato’s valuation by 50%
article: HSBC's brokerage arm on Monday slashed Zomato's valuation from $1 billion to $500 million. HSBC cited concerns surrounding Zomato’s advertisement-heavy business model, growing competition in the food ordering space and money-losing international operations for the lower valuation. However, Zomato and its largest shareholder Info Edge disagreed, saying that it will become profitable “very soon”.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twitter reacts to Zomato's valuation markdown
article: After HSBC on Monday marked down the valuation on Zomato from $1 billion to $500 million, users reacted with tweets like "Everything is worth what its purchaser will pay for it". "Bubble burst due to scorching heat?", read another tweet. "Whatever the current status, lets not forget that startups like #flipkart, #zomato, #ola have changed our lives", tweeted a user.

author: Jamal Mohammad
abstract: Lenskart raises ₹400 crore from Ratan Tata, IFC
article: Online eyewear retailer Lenskart, on Wednesday, raised ₹400 crore in Series D round of funding from World Bank arm IFC, Ratan Tata, Infosys Co-founder Kris Gopalakrishnan and Adveq Management. IFC led the round with ₹171 crore of investment. Existing investor TPG Growth and IDG Ventures also participated in the funding. With this, the company has raised $95.9 million so far.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Bengaluru-based Unbxd raises Series B Funding
article: Bengaluru-based e-commerce product discovery platform Unbxd has raised an undisclosed amount of funding in its Series B round, led by Nirvana Venture Advisors. Existing investors including IDG Ventures, Inventus Capital and Indian Angel Network also participated in the round. Founded in 2011, Unbxd provides e-commerce firms with search, navigation, product recommendations and analytics solutions.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Test prep startup raises funding from Blume
article: Prepathon, a PaGaLGuY-owned learning app for competitive exams, has raised an undisclosed amount of funding in the pre-series A round from Blume Ventures. Launched in August 2015, Prepathon creates a virtual classroom for students and its ‘Coach' feature solves their queries and provides interactive learning sessions. It features courses in banking, government, management and engineering exams.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: On-demand driver provider Zuver raises $180,000
article: Mumbai-based on-demand driver service startup Zuver has raised $180,000 from IT consulting and infrastructure management group Shruth & Smith Holdings and retail assisted e-commerce network Hermes Group. Co-founded by Sidhanth Mally and Sovin Hegde in 2015, users can book a driver on Zuver, for local trips, outstation trips, and even avail them for an entire month.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Self-driving shuttle startup raises $2 million
article: Self-driving shuttle service Auro Robotics secured $2 million in funding led by Motus Ventures. The company currently operates a pilot service at Santa Clara University where it transports students and faculty members on campus. Founded by alumnus of IIT Kharagpur and Y-Combinator, Nalin Gupta, Jit Chowdhury and Srinivas Reddy, it was started in Robotics Research Group at IIT Kharagpur.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Tech accelerator programme launched for women
article: Mumbai-based Zone Startups India, a venture fund and accelerator housed at BSE, has launched a six-week tech accelerator programme, called empoWer, for women entrepreneurs. Under this, 15 women entrepreneurs will be shortlisted to get access to mentoring, workshops, case studies and investor connect opportunities. The initiative will be launched with roadshows across Mumbai, Bengaluru and NCR.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Yumist shuts down in Bengaluru, expands in NCR
article: Gurgaon-based startup Yumist, that serves home-style meals prepared in its own kitchens, has stopped its services in Bengaluru, and launched a 12,000-square-feet kitchen for NCR. Yumist cited not owning a kitchen and operating out of a rented facility as the reason for shutting down in Bengaluru. Founded by Alok Jain and Abhimanyu Maheshwari in 2014, Yumist had raised $2 million in December 2015.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Ex-Housing founder's beauty startup shuts down
article: Online beauty startup Amber Wellness, Co-founded by former Co-founder of Housing.com Abhimanyu Dhamija and fellow IIT-ian Saurabh Goel, has shut down. The startup ended its services in all the three cities it operated in, Bangalore, Delhi and Mumbai, due to low margins. Launched in August 2015, Amber Wellness had raised about $1 million risk capital from undisclosed angel investors.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: MobiKwik raises $50 mn led by MediaTek, others
article: Gurgaon-based mobile wallet company MobiKwik has raised $50 million in the Series C round of funding led by Japan’s GMO Payment Gateway and Taiwanese semiconductor company MediaTek. Existing investors Sequoia Capital and Tree Line Asia also participated in the round. Founded in 2009 by Bipin Preet Singh and Upasana Taku, MobiKwik has so far raised a total of around $86.8 million.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Uber lets Chinese users pay via Alipay globally
article: Uber on Tuesday expanded its partnership with Alipay, a Chinese payment app owned by Alibaba, to let Chinese travellers pay Uber fares via Alipay accounts across the world. This will allow users to pay for international rides in yuan, eliminating the need for dual currency credit cards, Uber said. User will also be able to book Uber rides directly from Alipay.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Housing's Advitiya Sharma launches new startup
article: Advitiya Sharma, who quit from the real estate portal Housing.com last month, on Thursday launched an education startup, Genius. Focussed on kindergarten to class eight students, it will offer tutors content and software that can customise itself for each child’s learning abilities. The startup will work with teachers and help them run 'Genius Micro Schools' from home.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Amazon goes from $57 mn loss to $513 mn profit
article: Amazon on Thursday reported a net income of $513 million for the quarter ended March, compared to a net loss of $57 million in the year-ago period. The e-commerce major’s revenue witnessed its highest growth since 2012, climbing 28.2% to $29.13 billion. Net sales in North America, its biggest market by revenue, rose 26.8% to $17 billion in the quarter.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos made $6 bn in 20 minutes
article: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos made $6 billion in 20 minutes on Friday after his company jumped from $600 a share to a high of $681.50 in early trading hours. Bezos became the fourth-richest person in the world as his net worth rose to $60 billion, surpassing Mexican business magnate Carlos Slim, whose fortune fell by $3.4 billion to $55 billion.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Practo hires former InMobi CFO Manish Dugar
article: Healthcare startup Practo has hired Manish Dugar, former CFO of mobile advertising network InMobi, as its new global CFO. According to a report from The Economic Times, Dugar will be responsible for scaling businesses across geographies at Practo. Founded in 2008 by Shashank ND and Abhinav Lal, Practo lets users find doctors, clinics and diagnostic labs and book instant appointments with them.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Berlin restricts room-sharing with rental firms
article: The Berlin city administration on Sunday approved a new law restricting house owners to rent out rooms only to rental sharing services like Airbnb, thereby preventing them from renting out entire flats or houses. The trend of renting entire flats is cutting into the city's limited property supply and driving up rents, Berlin’s head of urban development said.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: App developed that blocks phone while driving
article: London-based firm Romex has developed an application that can block a user's phone while driving, by monitoring the phone's GPS system. The application will flag work-related messages, but won't allow the users to read the messages until they've pulled over. The paid-for service will work along with an app called Guardian, which allows monitoring drivers' location and speeding information.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Flipkart to sue 20 companies over payment dues
article: Flipkart is looking to file a case against over 20 Indian and foreign companies for not paying for their ad space on the e-commerce website. Flipkart will reportedly recover dues over ₹90,000 from each company. Earlier, Flipkart filed a similar case in the Delhi High Court against a US-based data storage company Western Digital.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: 6% levy on ad firms to hurt tech startups: IAMAI
article: IAMAI on Thursday said that the proposed 6% equalisation levy on digital ad firms by the government will "severely raise the cost of doing business" for Indian tech startups. Claiming that this will substantially raise operation costs, IAMAI added, “Tech startups are already paying 14.5% service tax to use these ad platforms, which amounts to an estimated ₹906 crore of taxes”.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Paytm partners Wipro for payments bank
article: Mobile wallet company Paytm has partnered with IT services major Wipro for the implementation of technology solutions for the former's proposed payment bank, Paytm said. Reportedly, Paytm is expected to roll out the payments bank later this year. Payment banks can accept demand deposits and savings bank deposits from individuals and small businesses, up to ₹1 lakh per account.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Vehicle maintenance startup raises angel funding
article: Mumbai-based vehicle maintenance startup MotoMojo has raised an undisclosed amount of angel funding from the Co-founders of Ventes Avenues, Niloufer Dundh, Fauzan Rahim and Balamurugan Mani. Founded in 2015 by Uttam Arjun, the startup connects car owners to local garages and vendors using an on-demand hyperlocal model. It is currently operational in Mumbai, Navi Mumbai and Thane.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Parking technology startup raises ₹2.5 crore
article: Delhi-based parking technology startup Agile Parking Solutions has raised ₹2.5 crore from Chennai Angels. Founded by Chirag Jain and Rasik Pansare, the startup uses cloud-based mobile parking technology to make real-time parking information accessible. User can get a bird’s eye view of all legal parking spaces with location maps, availability, pricing, and book spots via cashless payments.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Google buys training service startup Synergyse
article: Google on Monday acquired Synergyse, a Toronto-based startup founded by Indian-origin ex-Googler Varun Malhotra, that offers training services for Google Apps. Google will make Synergyse’s training services available for free to all customer of Google Apps, a product suite that includes Gmail, Calendar, Drive and Docs. Google added it will integrate Synergyse into Google Apps "later this year".

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Startup makes wheel that turns bicycles electric
article: Boston-based startup GeoOrbital has created an electric wheel that can be attached to a bicycle to turn it electric. It features a USB and a lithium-ion battery that can boost the bike to up to 32 kmph for around 80 km. The company also claims that the 26-inch wheel, which can be recharged while pedalling​, won't get flat when punctured.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Startup for renting out private cars grabs $35mn
article: French startup Drivy, that allows people to rent out their own cars, has raised $35 million from Cathay Innovation, Nokia Growth Partners and existing investors Bpifrance, Via-ID and Index Ventures. Founded in 2010 and operational in France, Germany and Spain, Drivy has recently launched Drivy Open, a technology which enables people to unlock cars with their smartphones.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Startup makes solar & wind powered mobile home
article: A Slovakia-based startup has created Ecocapsule, a 70-square-foot mobile home powered by wind and solar energy. Priced over $90,000, it can generate as much as 1.35 kilowatts of power via a wind turbine and solar panels on the roof. Fitted with smart home sensors and a rechargeable battery, the mobile home also stores rainwater and filters it for use.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: BookMyShow to let users book tickets on credit
article: According to BookMyShow Co-founder Ashish Hemrajani, the online ticketing portal will allow users to book tickets on credit and pay back the amount within 30 days. Further, users won’t be able to purchase more tickets than a pre-specified number without clearing their outstanding amount. The feature will be introduced in 30 to 60 days, he added.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Gujarat University rewards ₹40k to 12 startups
article: At an event organised by the Gujarat University Startup and Entrepreneurship Council, the institution rewarded a seed capital of ₹40,000 to 12 startups including Planet Earthlings, Chaaipani, San Burn, Aatap Energy and Xitiz. Besides this, the startups will also be provided with mentorship and mapping support. Further, the university plans to build creation centers for student entrepreneurs.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: DriveU buys on-demand driver provider CallAtHome
article: Bengaluru-based DriveU, a startup that aggregates on-demand drivers for private car owners, has acquired Gurgaon-based CallAtHome for an undisclosed amount. Founded by Alok Inamdar, Satyendra Singh and Anubhav Sood, CallAtHome provides users on-demand driver services. DriveU, already operational in Bengaluru, Chennai, Mumbai and Delhi, has introduced its service in Gurgaon through the acquisition.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: PayPal Co-founder invests in ClearTax
article: Bengaluru-based ClearTax, that facilitates online filing of taxes, has raised $1.3 million in seed funding from Silicon Valley investors including PayPal Co-founder Max Levchin. Other investors include WhatsApp business head Neeraj Arora, Uber investor Scott Banister and Dropbox VP Ruchi Sanghvi. The startup was founded in 2011 by Archit Gupta, Raja Ram Gupta, Srivatsan Chari, and Ankit Solanki.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sirin Labs gets $72 mn to launch phone over $10k
article: British-Israeli startup Sirin Labs on Monday raised $72 million in seed funding to launch 'Solarin', a smartphone to be priced over $10,000-15,000. The funding was raised from  Singulariteam Founder Moshe Hogeg, Kazakh businessman Kenges Rakishev and Chinese social networking platform Renren. A combination of a military phone and a usual phone, the smartphone will launch on May 17 in London.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: On-demand beverage startup DropKaffe gets $550k
article: On-demand ready to drink beverage startup DropKaffe on Monday raised $550,000 in a funding round led by Kanwaljit Singh of Fireside Ventures. Founded in 2015, the startup delivers flavoured cold coffees, milkshakes and smoothies through online and offline retail channels across Bengaluru. The startup had earlier raised $300,000 in a funding round in August 2015.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Nandan Nilekani invests in RailYatri
article: Nandan Nilekani, Co-founder of Infosys and former Chairman of UIDAI on Wednesday invested an undisclosed amount in train enquiry app RailYatri. Existing investors Helion Ventures, Omidyar and Blume Ventures have also participated. RailYatri uses a traveller's mobile GPS to predict a train's delay, in addition to platform number, coach position and if the waitlisted ticket will get confirmed.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: DocsApp raises $1.2 mn from Rebright Partners
article: Bengaluru-based online medical consultation platform DocsApp has raised $1.2 million in seed funding from Japanese venture capital firm Rebright Partners and Facebook’s angel investors Anand Rajaraman and Venky Harinarayan. Founded in 2015 by IIT Madras Alumni Satish Kannan and Enbasekar D, DocsApp allows patients to chat with doctors and share reports of their ailments in real-time.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App rewards users on completing fitness goals
article: Android app 'Fitard' rewards users on completing fitness activities and challenges that include walking and running. Founded in 2015, the app also lets users track their steps and compete over fitness activities with other app users. It rewards the users with 'Fitcoins', which can be redeemed for certain deals available on various brands registered on the app.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Raghuram Rajan bats for easier startup norms
article: Batting for easier startup norms, RBI governor Raghuram Rajan on Monday said that startups are key to creating fresh jobs in the economy, and that they need to grow into bigger businesses to keep creating employment. Noting that regulations should be reduced to the bare minimum for startups, Rajan added, “We need a cheap and quick exit policy for businesses”.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Smart Shower to track presence and save water
article: A California-based startup has created OaSense, a smart shower head that helps save water with a presence-detecting sensor. It can detect when a user is under the shower and pauses the water flow when the user steps away. OaSense has a button for switching between 'sense' and 'standard' modes and its power lasts over one year with four replaceable batteries.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Craftsvilla acqui-hires clothes rental startup
article: Mumbai-based online ethnic fashion retailer Craftsvilla has acqui-hired F2SO4, that offers branded and high-end designer clothes on rent, for an undisclosed amount. Chandigarh-based F2SO4 was founded in 2015 by Amrit Singh, Sachin Goel and Partik Bhuchar. Earlier in February, Craftsvilla had acquired shipping service provider startup Sendd and online gourmet food marketplace PlaceofOrigin.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Wedding planner startup raises $600k from Blume
article: The Wedding Brigade, a Mumbai-based online wedding planner portal, has raised $600,000 in pre-series A round of funding from Blume Ventures and four other undisclosed angel investors. The portal, launched in 2014 by Sanna Vohra and currently operational in Mumbai and Delhi, facilitates venue and service bookings, and allows users to purchase wedding apparel, jewellery, gifts and other essentials.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Snapdeal lets users order food, book bus tickets
article: Snapdeal has announced strategic partnerships with Cleartrip, Redbus and Zomato to let users order food and book bus and flight tickets directly from its platform. The three firms have shared their application programme interfaces (APIs) with Snapdeal, which will charge a small commission on bookings made through its app. Separate icons for the new services have been introduced on Snapdeal's app.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Microsoft experiments with storing data in DNA
article: Microsoft has partnered with San Francisco-based startup Twist Bioscience to experiment with using synthetic DNA as a means to store digital data. For this, Microsoft is buying 10 million strands of laboratory-made DNA molecules from the startup. According to Harvard scientists, about 700 terabytes can be stored on one gram of DNA, that can reportedly stay readable till 10,000 years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm-backed startup LogiNext acquires YourGuy
article: Paytm-backed logistics analytics startup LogiNext on Monday acquired logistics and supply chain firm YourGuy in a mixed cash and equity deal. YourGuy’s 200 delivery personnel and its 20-member team including the founders will join Sprintr, the on-demand delivery arm of LogiNext. Founded in 2014 by Alay Jhaveri, YourGuy delivers food, medicines, important documents, clothes and gifts across Mumbai.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: We have made mistakes: Oyo Rooms Founder
article: In an interview to YourStory, Ritesh Agarwal, Founder of budget hotel aggregator OYO Rooms admitted making mistakes in past. He said, “In hospitality, there are some very tough and subjective issues... We are working to ensure that the customers get the best experience.” In the past few months, OYO has reportedly faced criticism on social media for its services.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Housefull sues Mebelkart for selling imitations
article: Online furniture store Housefull International has reportedly sent a legal notice to AskMe Group backed online furniture marketplace MebelKart for allegedly defaulting on payments and selling imitations. Housefull had stopped selling its furniture on MebelKart since February, after it failed to clear dues of up to ₹28 lakh. It has demanded ₹150 crore as compensation from MebelKart for damages.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Startup raises $3.9 mn for smart breast pump
article: US-based startup Naya Health raised $3.9 million in seed funding to make smart breast pumps for working moms. Claimed to have softer cups, it works using a water-based hydraulic system eliminating noise. Connected through an app, the device senses how much milk a mom is producing, automatically records the pump sessions and gives personalized advice to moms.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Jaguar partners with Tile to locate keys, wallet
article: Automaker Jaguar has partnered with Silicon Valley startup Tile to allow drivers to locate missing items like phones, keys and wallets. Tile makes small, waterproof tags that are affixed to objects and they beep after an accompanying app detects them within a 100-feet range. Jaguar will feature Tile as an in-car app on its 2017 Land Rover Discovery Sport.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Digital payments startup TranServ raises $15 mn
article: Mumbai-based digital payments company TranServ has raised $15 million in Series C round of funding led by IDFC SPICE Fund and Micromax. Existing investors Nirvana and Faering Capital India Evolving Fund also participated in the round. Started in 2011 by Anish Williams, TranServ has recently entered into a strategic partnership with Micromax and Visa.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Startup builds foldable drone that follows users
article: Beijing-based startup Zero Zero Robotics has developed Hover Camera, a foldable drone that automatically follows its owner via face tracking technology. The drone features a 13 MP main camera that can capture 4K videos, and another downward-facing 3 MP camera. Its four propellers are fully enclosed by a carbon fiber frame, reportedly making it a safer drone.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Arianna Huffington joins Uber's board
article: Uber on Wednesday announced that Arianna Huffington, the Founder and editor-in-chief of The Huffington Post, will join the company’s board of directors. Uber CEO Travis Kalanick said that Arianna's ability to tell stories is "invaluable" for an engineer like him, whose natural tendency is to rely on data. Earlier this month, Huffington partnered with Uber to campaign against drowsy driving.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Unitus to back 50 startups with $50 million fund
article: Unitus Seed Fund will launch its second India-focused fund worth $50 million to invest in 50 startups in segments like education, healthcare, fintech and agriculture. The fund plans to invest a maximum of ₹3 crore in each startup. Unitus had launched its first fund worth $23 million in 2012, which included investors like Bill Gates Foundation, Mohandas Pai and others.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ant Financial raises $4.5 bn in largest funding
article: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba's affiliate Ant Financial Services on Tuesday closed a $4.5 billion funding round, making it the world’s largest private fundraising round by an Internet company. Investors participating in the round include China Investment Corp Capital and CCB Trust, a subsidiary of China Construction Bank. The firm is reportedly valued at $60 billion after the funding.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Bezos inducts Amazon India chief into core team
article: Amazon India chief Amit Agarwal has been inducted into CEO Jeff Bezos’ S-team (senior team). The core team reportedly comprises 12 people who play a crucial role in Amazon's global operations and have a direct line to Bezos. Amazon India said, “We are confident if we execute well, India should be Amazon’s largest geography outside the US in the coming years”.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: 5 firms form coalition on self-driving cars
article: Tech firm Google, automaker Ford Motors, taxi-hailing service Uber, Sweden's Volvo Cars and US-based ride-sharing service Lyft have said they are forming a coalition to push for federal action to help speed self-driving cars' entry into the market. The group will "work with lawmakers, regulators and the public to realise the safety and societal benefits of self-driving vehicles", they said.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Infosys Co-founders fund emergency response app
article: Silicon Valley-based emergency response startup MUrgency has raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding from Axilor Ventures, set up by Infosys Co-founders Kris Gopalakrishnan and S D Shibulal. Founded in February 2016 by Shaffi Mather, MUrgency has partnered with 36 emergency rooms and 40 ambulances to connect people requiring emergency services with healthcare professionals.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Fashion discovery startup Roposo raises $5 mn
article: Gurgaon-based fashion discovery platform Roposo has raised $5 million in the second leg of its Series B round of funding from Bertelsmann India Investments. The startup has so far raised a total of $21 million from investors including Tiger Global, India Quotient and Flipkart’s CEO Binny Bansal. It was founded in 2014 by IIT Delhi alumnus Mayank Bhangadia, Avinash Saxena and Kaushal Shubhank.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Talkshow app allows anyone to host shows
article: Former Twitter VP Michael Sippey has launched an iOS app called Talkshow that lets anyone create a show which can be viewed by others in real time. Users can find friends on the app, choose a topic for the show and invite friends as co-hosts. Audiences can also discover shows from the home screen, like individual messages and share reactions.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: French startup makes autonomous underwater drone
article: A France-based startup has developed 'iBubble', a $1299 autonomous camera-enabled drone that lets users shoot underwater footage. Controlled through a connected bracelet, the drone combines two 1,000 lumen lights, image stabilisation system and professional grade camera movements and angles. It also comes with manual mode and lasts for one hour in single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: UCWeb floats $20 mn fund for Indian gaming firms
article: Alibaba-backed UCWeb, the creator of UC Browser, on Thursday announced a $20 million fund under its accelerator 9Apps for Indian gaming startups. The accelerator plans to invest $500,000 in 100 startups through the fund. It would also mentor these startups to monetise and popularise their product, without having any share in their revenue.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Twitter reacts to Ola Cabs new girlfriend ad
article: After taxi-hailing app Ola released a YouTube ad titled 'Too expensive to take GF out on a date?', users criticised the ad terming it as "sexist". A user tweeted, "2016 and Olacabs still makes ads where women depend on men to buy things. Not to miss subtle objectification by comparing them with cars." However, the ad has been pulled out.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Google to open startup incubator: Reports
article: According to media reports, Google is preparing to start its own in-house startup incubator dubbed ‘Area 120’. Employees can pitch their entrepreneurial ideas to the incubator, and if accepted, begin working on them full-time. Executives Don Harrison and Bradley Horowitz will reportedly manage the incubator. Reports also said that Google will provide funding to the teams.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Govt launches Twitter Seva to address grievances
article: The Commerce and Industry Ministry on Thursday launched its ‘Twitter Seva’ service to address issues and grievances of startups, exporters and importers and other stakeholders. People can tweet with #mociseva to raise a query, that will reportedly be responded within 48-72 working hours. Issues related to Make in India, Startup India, FDI and intellectual property rights will be addressed.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber China to use selfies to detect fake drivers
article: Starting next month, Uber China will launch a new feature on the driver's app that will use selfies to make sure only registered drivers are driving the cars.
