Uber has tied up with Face-Plus-Plus, a software that will run facial recognition checks on drivers at random times. The move is aimed to prevent drivers from faking accounts and rides.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: PepperTap to shut down operations
article: On-demand grocery delivery startup PepperTap is reportedly shutting down its operations by the end of this month. Navneet Singh, CEO, PepperTap said to YourStory that the startup is pivoting to a full stack e-commerce logistics company. Founded in 2014, PepperTap had raised around $51.2 million in four rounds from investors including Sequoia Capital, SAIF Partners and Snapdeal.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: New device that can diagnose diseases in minutes
article: UK-based technology firm QuantuMDx has developed a handheld device called 'Q-Poc', which it claims can accurately diagnose infectious diseases in minutes. The device, which runs on a solar-powered battery, is designed to analyze DNA samples submitted through a credit card-size cartridge. According to the Co-founder, the device was able to perform a tuberculosis diagnosis in under 20 minutes.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Fashion firm Yufta raises pre-series A funding
article: Jaipur-based hyperlocal fashion retail startup Yufta has raised an undisclosed amount in its pre-series A round of funding from the founder members of the Rajasthan Angel Investor Network, Data Infosys CEO Ajay Data and other HNIs. With this, Ajay Data will join the board at Yufta, which was founded in 2014 by Ritesh Khandelwal, Ravi Khandelwal and Tarun Sharma.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup makes interactive smart ball for pets
article: A US-based startup has created 'PlayDate', a $149 smart interactive ball that lets owners play with their pets remotely. Controlled through an app, the ball has an in-built camera and microphone to let owners watch their pets, click photos, record videos and talk to their pets from anywhere. The app also allows users to control the movement of the ball.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Contacts manager InTouchApp raises seed funding
article: Contacts manager for professionals, InTouchApp has raised an undisclosed amount of seed funding from Blume Ventures. Founded in 2012 by Sarang Lakare, the app lets professionals automatically backup, sync and transfer their smartphone contacts. It also enables users to share a list of contacts with anyone over SMS, WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger, WeChat and other platforms.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SIDBI clears ₹1,000 cr for early-stage startups
article: The Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) on Thursday sanctioned ₹1,000 crore to 30 venture funds through the government-financed India Aspiration Fund for funding early-stage startups. The proposals which were sanctioned include IvyCap Ventures, Blume Ventures and Exfinity Venture Partners. SIDBI will provide these funds about 15-20% of their total investment in startups.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Delhi HC asks Unicommerce to not use Paytm data
article: The Delhi High Court on Thursday ordered the Snapdeal-owned e-commerce management company Unicommerce not to use any data which it accessed from the sellers of Paytm. The court has also asked Unicommerce to pull down its YouTube advertisement or remove Paytm’s logo from it. Paytm has accused Unicommerce of accessing its confidential business data.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twitter Co-founder led Medium raises $50 million
article: Medium, the online publishing platform founded by Twitter Co-founder Evan Williams, on Thursday raised $50 million in Series C funding led by Spark Capital, which had also invested in Twitter. Medium had raised $57 million in Series B funding last year. It also announced that Andreessen Horowitz’s Ben Horowitz and JLabs CEO Judy Estrin will join its board of directors.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: SoftBank investors seek internal probe of Arora
article: A group of investors in SoftBank Group has reportedly sought an internal probe into Nikesh Arora, President and COO of SoftBank Group, for alleged conflict of interest and poor business decisions. The request letter also questioned his track record and qualifications as President and heir apparent to founder Masayoshi Son. However, SoftBank denied these allegations.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup makes hand-controlled robotics kit
article: A US-based startup has made 'Ziro', a $149 hand gesture-controlled robotics kit which includes a smart glove, a smartphone app and motorized modules. The kit lets users build their robots and control them with hand gestures including lifting a finger or flicking the wrist. The modules last for seven hours on a single charge.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Analytics firm m.Paani raises funding from Blume
article: Mumbai-based marketing and data analytics startup m.Paani Solutions, founded in 2014 by Akanksha Hazari, has raised an undisclosed amount in pre-series A round of funding led by Blume Ventures. The round also saw participation from angel investors including Adil Allana of The Allana Group, TaxiForSure Co-founder Aprameya Radhakrishna, Meradoctor Co-founder Gautam Ivatury and Signal Point Partners.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Three more Co-founders of Housing quit
article: Three Co-founders including Abhishek Anand, Ravish Naresh and Sanat Ghosh of SoftBank-backed real estate portal Housing have reportedly quit the company. This comes a month after Co-founder Advitiya Sharma left to start his venture. With the exit of five Co-founders since July 2015, Housing now has three Co-founders left in the company including Snehil Buxy, Jaspreet Saluja and Amrit Raj.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Meat delivery startup Licious raises $3 million
article: Fresh meat delivery startup Licious on Thursday raised $3 million in Series A round of funding from Mayfield India. The startup in September last year raised $1 million in angel funding from former Infosys Director TV Mohandas Pai and Kanwaljit Singh. Founded in 2015, Licious delivers fresh meat including chicken, lamb chops and fish across Bengaluru.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber to pay $100 mn to settle driver lawsuits
article: Uber on Thursday agreed to pay up to $100 million in concession to its 3,85,000 drivers in California and Massachusetts to settle two driver lawsuits. Both lawsuits contested that Uber should classify its drivers as employees instead of independent contractors. However, the court allowed Uber to keep categorising its drivers as independent contractors.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup makes hoodie with bluetooth, speakers
article: US-based startup Wer-tek has created 'Hiody', a bluetooth-enabled hoodie with in-built speakers and microphone, priced at $69. A button on the hoodie's pocket lets users control music, receive or ignore calls. It also has an integrated universal MiniJack compatible with all kinds of music devices. The hoodie becomes completely machine washable after removing the integrated technology.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Transport provider app Commut raises $200,000
article: Hyderabad-based transport app Commut on Saturday raised $200,000 from 50K Ventures. Also, Sudhakar Pasupunuri, Founder of bus ticketing platform Redbus has joined the board of Commut. Founded in 2015, Commut aggregates air conditioned cabs and mini buses in Hyderabad. The startup had acquired app-based cab service H2O Cabs for an undisclosed amount in March.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: GST will resolve tax issues in e-commerce: Study
article: Implementation of a uniform Goods and Service Tax (GST) will help resolve issues concerning taxation and logistics with regard to e-commerce companies, according to a study by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) and consulting firm PwC. Further, the tax structure needs to consider the actual nature of transaction of the e-commerce vendors to determine their tax liability, it recommended.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Man creates electric bicycle-car prototype
article: Mikael Kjellman, a Swedish design engineer, has made 'PodRide', a four-wheeled electric bicycle-car prototype. Covered in full fabric and a waterproof body, the vehicle has a top speed of 25 kmph and can run 60 km in a single charge. Equipped with indicators, headlight and a wiper, it also has space for baggage in the rear.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Paytm sues Snapdeal-owned firm over data theft
article: Online payments and m-commerce platform Paytm has filed a lawsuit against Snapdeal-owned e-commerce management company Unicommerce. Paytm has accused Unicommerce of accessing confidential business data via the sellers who use Unicommerce’s platform for managing orders and inventory. The hearing of the case is expected to take place on Thursday in the Delhi High Court.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Bansals in TIME's 100 most influential people
article: Flipkart's Co-founders Sachin and Binny Bansal have been featured in the list of TIME's 100 most influential people released on Thursday. The Bansals started Flipkart in 2007 as an online bookstore by pooling in around $10,000. The e-commerce company is reportedly worth $13 billion today. In a testimony to TIME, Lev Grossman described them as hardheaded realists who dream big.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App to let couples crowdfund their honeymoon
article: US-based startup Honeyfund has launched an app that lets couples crowdfund their honeymoon. Couples register their honeymoon by answering the app's style quiz and share their honeymoon destination expectations with their wedding guests. Once registered, friends and family help the couples pay for a honeymoon, savings goals, gifts including meals, hotels, airfare and even down payment for a house.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: YouWeCan-backed Vyomo raises $15 million
article: Cricketer Yuvraj Singh's YouWeCan Ventures-backed beauty and wellness app Vyomo has raised $15 million in Series A round of funding led by salon chain Naturals. The chain has taken a controlling stake in Vyomo and rebranded it as Naturals@Home. Founded in 2014 by Abhinav Khare, Vyomo lets women discover and book beauty services in Bengaluru, Mumbai, Delhi, Gurgaon and Noida.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Consumer health platform 1mg raises $15 million
article: Online and app-based health platform 1mg has raised $15 million in Series B funding round led by Maverick Capital Ventures. Existing investors Sequoia India and Omidyar Network also participated in the round. Founded in 2015 by Prashant Tandon, Gaurav Agarwal and Vikas Chauhan, the platform lets users order medicines, search doctors and book lab tests with sample pickup from home.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Freshdesk buys customer support startup Airwoot
article: In its fifth acquisition, cloud-based customer support software Freshdesk has acquired social customer support startup Airwoot for an undisclosed amount. However, Airwoot will continue to support its existing customers and function as a standalone product. Founded in 2012 by Achal Aggarwal, Prabhat Saraswat and Saurabh Arora, Airwoot helps brands enhance their customer engagement on social media.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Business learning platform EdCast raises $16 mn
article: Online and mobile-based business learning platform EdCast has raised $16 million in Series B round of funding led by GE Asset Management. SoftBank Capital, Cervin Ventures, Stanford StartX Fund and Penta Global also participated in the funding. Founded in 2013 by Karl Mehta, EdCast provides business education with daily curated and contextual bite-size insights.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in eyewear retailer Lenskart
article: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata has invested an undisclosed amount in the latest funding round of eyewear retailer Lenskart. The startup is reportedly looking to raise about ₹400 crore, which would value it at around ₹1,600 crore. Founded in 2008 by Peyush Bansal, the startup provides prescription eyewear, branded contact lenses and sunglasses both online as well as offline.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Magic Leap demonstrates its augmented reality
article: Google-backed American startup Magic Leap has released a video showcasing its head-mounted augmented reality technology. The video, which was shot directly through its headset, features a wearer opening up several notifications in a floating graphic in his room. Notably, the startup had raised over $1 billion in funding without giving a public demo of its technology.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes plant pot that charges phones
article: A Spanish startup has developed 'Bioo', a plant pot that charges mobile phones and tablets with the power generated from photosynthesis. The pot generates power throughout the day and night and uses a normal phone charging cable to deliver two to three charges per day. It allows users to choose between any kind of plant, soil or irrigation method.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App lets users try tattoos before getting inked
article: A Ukraine-based startup has developed 'Ink Hunter', an app that lets users try tattoos before getting it permanently inked on their skin. The app places a tattoo design from its collection or one uploaded by the user on the desired area of the body. It also delivers temporary tattoo stickers to its users.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup lets couples sell their wedding tickets
article: Australian startup 'Join My Wedding' is an online platform that lets couples sell tickets to their wedding across the world to let users experience various cultures. Couples share their love story, fix a ticket price and mention the facilities included in the ticket. An Indian couple has also posted an invite to their wedding for $200 a ticket.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart mirror scans body to track user's fitness
article: San Francisco-based startup Naked Labs has developed a $499 fitness tracker which uses a smart full-length mirror and a wireless scale for 3D scanning of body in 20 seconds. Connected through an app, the device lets users set physical fitness goals and measure their progress. The app also shows improvement or decline in fitness levels of various body areas.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Comedian Kanan Gill releases startup-based video
article: Stand-up comedians Kanan Gill and Abish Mathew have released a video named 'How Insensitive! - The Startup', where they act as two friends who start their own company. The video parodies an idea that turns into a billion-dollar startup. It also features comedians Biswa Kalyan Rath and Tanmay Bhat in the roles of an investor and a lawyer respectively.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart ring lets users unlock doors, share data
article: A Chinese startup has developed 'Jackom R3 Smart Ring', which acts as a smart ID card to unlock doors, smartphones, make payments and transfer data at 106 kbps. Connected through an app, the $19 ring also saves private information including accounts, schedule and memos. The waterproof and dust-proof ring is available in different sizes and does not require charging.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup develops smart bed for good sleep
article: A US-based startup has developed 'Balluga', a $1,199 smart bed that lets users have a good sleep by setting ideal temperature, adjusting firmness and providing a massage. Controlled through an app, the bed uses movement sensors to automatically light up during the night to provide visibility to the user. It also comes with anti-snoring system and 10 years of warranty.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ixigo to let users book cabs without internet
article: Travel search app Ixigo has launched '1-Tap Cab Booking' feature that lets users book cabs without a stable internet connection or GPS. Currently available for Android, it will allow users to book the nearest cab in three seconds by tapping and holding a button on their home screen. The confirmation of the booking will be sent via a text message.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes motion-activated light for toilet
article: A US-based startup has made IllumiBowl, a $15 motion-activated colour-changing night light that can be clipped on toilet seats. The light automatically turns on when a user enters the washroom and turns off when the user leaves. The LEDs in the device are said to have a life of 100,000 hours of constant use.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola, Uber suspend surge pricing in Delhi
article: Ola and Uber on Monday suspended surge pricing in Delhi after the State government warned of taking action against taxi-hailing companies for charging more than the government prescribed rates. The surge pricing has been pulled back by these taxi providers with immediate effect. Notably, taxi service providers charge higher prices during increased demand by riders.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Facebook VP Mike Vernal joins Sequoia
article: Mike Vernal, Facebook Vice President for over eight years, has resigned from his post to join Sequoia Capital as a venture capitalist. Before joining Facebook, Vernal, a Harvard University graduate, had spent nearly six years at Microsoft. Vernal will join ten other partners at Sequoia’s Menlo Park office in California.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Band to wake up users with electric shock
article: A US-based startup Pavlok has launched 'Shock Clock', a $79 band that uses electric shock to wake up users on the set time. Controlled through an app, the band vibrates, beeps and later zaps the user on not waking up at the set alarm time. The band also lets users enable their friends with an option to zap them awake.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: NestAway raises $30 million led by Tiger Global
article: Home rental platform NestAway has reportedly raised $30 million in a funding round led by Tiger Global. Founded in 2015 by four NIT Surathkal alumni, the Bengaluru-based startup turns unfurnished houses into fully furnished and maintained apartments to provide them on rent. NestAway has earlier received funding from Ratan Tata, Flipkart, InMobi Founder Naveen Tewari and IDG Ventures.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Startup develops digital guitar without strings
article: California-based startup Magic Instruments has developed 'Rhythm Guitar', a digital guitar that does not have any strings along its fretboard. Instead, each fret has been replaced by a button, which represents an entire chord, rather than a single note. The device comes with a mobile application, featuring instructions on how to play some of the most popular songs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Greek startup develops smart pet collar
article: A Greece-based startup has developed 'Kyon', a smart pet collar that tracks pets' emotions, location and calls the owner in case the pet is lost. The collar also pacifies pets from entering into fights with the other pets. With battery life of a month in a single charge, it also alerts owners if their pet is drowning or feeling sick.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bike-taxi app Rapido raises pre-Series A funding
article: Bike-taxi app Rapido has raised an undisclosed amount of funding in pre-Series A round led by Pawan Munjal, Hero MotoCorp Chairman, MD and CEO. Ankit Nagori, former Flipkart Chief Business Officer, Rajan Anandan, MD Google India and South East Asia and others also participated. Founded in 2015, Rapido lets users book bikes for commuting in Bengaluru, Gurgaon and Delhi.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Startup creates electric motor for boats
article: Seattle-based startup Pure Watercraft has created an eco-friendly electric vehicle motor for boats to replace gas-powered motors. It can push a lightweight 27-foot boat at about 34 kmph and can run up to 40 hours on a single charge, the Co-founder said. It also comes with a cooling system that uses the water around it to keep the electronics cool.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola denies reports of Uber buying stake
article: Ola on Friday denied reports of rival Uber buying a controlling stake in the company. Reports suggested that except for investor SoftBank, shareholders in Ola including founders Bhavish Aggarwal and Ankit Bhati would exit the company. "Planted malicious stories are sign of others desperation!", tweeted Aggarwal. Ola said it will initiate legal action against the media house for misreporting.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart suitcase handle lets users make calls
article: A US-based startup has created 'Floatti', a $250 smart suitcase with touch-control and notification-enabled handle that lets users make phone calls. It has detachable mobile and laptop chargers and a strap to place additional baggage. The suitcase also features an in-built weighing scale and comes with anti-theft mechanism and tracking options.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola founders fund e-motorcycle startup Tork
article: Ola founders Bhavish Aggarwal, Ankit Bhati and a clutch of angel investors have invested an undisclosed amount in electric motorcycles startup Tork Motorcycles. Founded in 2010 by Kapil Shelke, the startup has built five electric motorcycle prototypes. Tork Motorcycles claims to build India's first electric motorcycle, which it plans to launch this year.

author: Anupama K
abstract: Action on Ola, Uber for high fares: Kejriwal
article: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said “strict action” will be taken against app-based taxis, including cancellation of permits and seizure of vehicles, for charging fares above the prescribed rates. This comes after complaints were received against app-based taxis Ola and Uber for increasing fares during rush hours and on the first full working day of the odd-even scheme.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Video production firm 90 seconds raises $7.5 mn
article: 90 Seconds, a cloud video production platform, has raised $7.5 million in Series A round of funding led by Sequoia India. Other investors include SKY TV NZ, Airtree Ventures, Beenext, and Fotolia.com founder Oleg Tscheltzoff. Launched in 2010 by Tim Norton, 90 Seconds gives brands access to a marketplace of creative professionals, and an automated, end-to-end suite of workflow tools.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Jaguar Land Rover launches startup firm InMotion
article: British carmaker Jaguar Land Rover has launched a startup studio, InMotion, to build mobility apps and on-demand services. The spin-out business will begin by developing services that leverage smartphones and “other connected devices.” Jaguar Land Rover, a Tata Motors subsidiary, said it will soon start testing car-sharing and car-ownership services in Europe, North America and Asia.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Flipkart Chief Product Officer Punit Soni quits
article: Flipkart's Chief Product Officer Punit Soni, who joined in March last year, has quit the e-commerce company. Officials confirmed that Friday will be the former Google executive's last day with the company. The exit of Soni comes after Flipkart's commerce platform head Mukesh Bansal and Chief Business Officer Ankit Nagori quit the firm earlier this year.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Startup makes app-connected gym equipment
article: A Hong Kong-based startup has created Move It, an app-connected personal gym equipment for fitness training. The device has four parts and a set of Bluetooth-enabled handles that connects to each of the four parts for different workouts. The workout information is displayed on the app, and the training progress can also be shared with friends.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Startup gets funds for tables that play music
article: Japanese startup Kamarq Holdings on Thursday raised $3.2 million from a group of investors and also announced the launch of its first product named Sound Table. Controlled through an app, the wooden Internet of Things (IoT) table can play music or environmental sounds in accordance with the weather. It has started accepting pre-orders on the Japanese crowdfunding site, Makuake.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: App for Apple Watch judges emotions via voices
article: Tokyo-based Smartmedical has launched an app for the Apple Watch that identifies and tracks users’ emotions through their voices. Called EmoWatch, the app analyses pitch, volume and speed of users’ voices to understand their energy levels and judge emotions like anger, calmness, joy or sorrow. EmoWatch works with any language as it only detects vocal characteristics, not meanings.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Defence Ministry to promote startups: Parrikar
article: Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar has said that his ministry was in the process of formulating a special programme to promote startups. Addressing a gathering at the inauguration of a business incubation centre in Delhi, he said, "The ministry has never done something like this before but is going out of the way into (doing) something different".

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: On-demand beauty services startup raises $6 mn
article: Mumbai-based on-demand beauty services startup MyGlamm has reportedly raised $6 million in a funding round led by French cosmetics maker L’Occitane. The round also saw participation from existing investors Tano Capital and Times Group-led Brand Capital. Founded in 2015 by Darpan Sanghvi, the startup is a marketplace for stylists, beauticians, nail and spa aestheticians.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Flipkart sues MP-based firm over copyright issue
article: Flipkart has reportedly filed a case against Madhya Pradesh-based FlipkartDiscounts, accusing the latter of copyright and trademark infringement. It provides discounted listings on its website, and also directs users to other portals like Flipkart and Amazon. A Flipkart spokesperson said the Delhi High Court has granted an injunction against the firm from operating under the current name.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Alibaba buys controlling stake in Lazada at $1bn
article: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba has agreed to buy a controlling stake in Southeast Asian online retailer Lazada for $1 billion. Alibaba will buy $500 million of newly issued Lazada shares and the rest will be bought from current shareholders. This is Alibaba’s biggest overseas deal. Notably, the Singapore-headquartered company was founded by Germany's Rocket Internet in 2012.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Wildcraft launches GPS tracking wearable
article: Bangalore-based gear, apparel and footwear company Wildcraft has launched a GPS tracking wearable device called Spot. The device, which can monitor location with an accuracy of up to 10 meters, functions through a SIM card and features an SOS button to send alerts in case of an emergency. The device is available on the company website for ₹5,995.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Uber to pay up to $25 mn for misleading US users
article: Uber has agreed to pay up to $25 million to California-based prosecutors, after being accused of false background checks of drivers in Los Angeles and San Francisco. Uber claims its service to be the “safest ride on the road”, however, at least 25 instances were reportedly uncovered where an Uber driver had serious criminal convictions including child sex offenses.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: VC firm IvyCap raises ₹300 cr for second fund
article: Venture capital firm IvyCap Ventures has raised about ₹300 crore for the first close of its second fund of ₹600 crore. Sponsor investor IIT Alumni Trust led the round with ₹120 crore. Founded in 2011 by Vikram Gupta, Norbert Fernandes and Vishal Gauri, the company focuses on startups founded by alumni of institutions like IITs and IIMs.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Tech developed to help men decide what to wear
article:
US-based mens clothing startup, Lewk has created an algorithm to help men decide which clothes to wear. After signing up, users have to tell the preferred fit, colours, styles and the startup delivers the items of clothing monthly to the user for a subscription fee. 
It also sources and manufactures its own clothing and works with designers.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: CarDekho's GirnarSoft acquires Help On Wheels
article: GirnarSoft, the parent company of auto portals CarDekho, Gaadi, and Zigwheels, has acquired roadside assistance company Help On Wheels in an all-cash deal. Founded in 2014 by Lalit Parmar and Nirmal Mitra, Help On Wheels claims to provide round-the-clock roadside assistance services within a duration of 30 minutes. Notably, GirnarSoft has acquired five startups in the last two years.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Karnataka govt bans surge pricing by Ola, Uber
article: The Karnataka government has prohibited taxi-hailing apps like Ola and Uber to apply peak-hour charges. Customers now do not have to pay anything extra to these companies above their fixed base fares. During peak hours, taxi aggregators levy extra charges, two to three times the base fares, to compensate for the low number of available drivers.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: OYO Rooms raises $100 mn led by SoftBank
article: Online hotel aggregator OYO Rooms has raised $100 million in its fifth round of funding led by existing investor Softbank. Other investors include Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Greenoaks Capital, DSG Consumer Partners and Venture Nursery. Founded in 2013 by Ritesh Agarwal, it has raised a total of $225.65 million in funding. Further, the startup recently acquired rival Zo Rooms.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Twitter acquires employee feedback startup Peer
article: Twitter on Thursday acquired Peer, an employee and manager feedback tool launched by former Salesforce COO George Hu in 2015. Peer allows employees to monitor their performance continuously and send real-time comments and performance reviews directly to one another. The company has been reportedly shut down following the Twitter deal.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Uber cuts fares by up to 22% in 10 Indian cities
article: Uber has cut its UberGO fares by up to 22% in 10 cities including Pune, Ahmedabad, Indore, Nagpur, Jodhpur, Udaipur, Vizag, Ajmer, Mangalore and Thiruvananthapuram. Uber will now charge a base fare of ₹25 instead of ₹40 in Udaipur and Jodhpur. Further, the fare cut would bring the cost down to ₹5/km in cities like Vizag, Nagpur, Indore and Ahmedabad.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Startup creates belt to control body temperature
article: Based on a US Navy technology, a startup has created an adjustable belt strap called MiClimate which can be worn around the waist to control body temperature. The small vents within the belt direct heated or cooled air to the user's body. With a four-hour battery life, the device can cool down 10°C and heat up 20°C from ambient temperature.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: US startup creates water out of light and air
article: A US-based startup has created Fontus, a self-filling bottle which creates water out of light and air. It can capture the moisture from the air, condense it and store it as drinking water. It has created two products- Fontus Airo, which draws air through a small fan and Fontus Ryde, which itself captures the air stream while riding a bicycle.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Startup creates device to ease menstrual pain
article: An Israel-based startup has created a wearable called Livia to ease menstrual pain through electrical stimulation. It closes the pain gates by stimulating the nerves and blocking the pain from passing to the brain. The device can be clipped onto the waistband or pocket and has two electrodes and sticky pads that can be pasted on the stomach or back.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Telemedicine-focused startup raises $40,000
article: Delhi-based telemedicine-focused startup Imedilane has raised $40,000 in a funding round from angel investors Mahendra Patel, an ex-army officer, and businessman Nilender Chauhan. Founded by Shakti Anand, along with his wife Khushboo Anand, the healthcare startup allows patients to speak with the right doctors via video calls, e-mail consultations and tele calling (with or without internet).

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Anil Kapoor invests in video platform Indi.com
article: Bollywood actor Anil Kapoor has invested an undisclosed sum in video social network Indi.com. Started in 2012 by Neel Grover and Greg Giraudi, the US-based platform will be launched in India on April 28. It allows individuals and companies to create and monetise content by sharing videos and also serves as a talent discovery platform for production houses and studios.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: App wants users to spend less time on phones
article: England-based developers have built an iOS app named Glued which rewards users for spending less time on their smartphones. It maintains a leaderboard tracking how much time a user spends on the phone and shares it with families and friends. Nick, Nicole and their son Finn developed the app seeing the need for it in their own family.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Flipkart’s EKart to deliver Paytm orders
article: Flipkart's logistics arm Ekart has partnered with Paytm to deliver the latter's orders. This is in line with Ekart’s plans to open up its services to third-party merchants, as it has already signed a similar deal with online fashion store Jabong and is in advanced talks with ShopClues. The Paytm delivery service will reportedly start in the next two weeks.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: FB enters hyperlocal services market in India
article: Facebook has entered the hyperlocal services market in India, listing over 80 local service providers and their respective phone numbers and work timings. Available at facebook.com/services, the platform lists services including plumbing, pet care, beauty and spa, medical, financial and automotive. This puts Facebook in direct competition with the likes of Housejoy, QuikrServices and UrbanClap.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Snapdeal launches donation program 'Sunshine'
article: Delhi-based online marketplace Snapdeal has launched Snapdeal Sunshine, a program that allows users to donate to the nine associated NGOs, who are in need of products. The nine associated NGOs include HelpAge India, Teach For India and Care India. After the donations get accepted, the donors would be able to track their donations which will be coming from Snapdeal's inventory.

author: Jamal Mohammad
abstract: Online marketplace for photography grabs funding
article: Delhi-based online marketplace for photography, Picsdream on Friday raised angel funding from a group of investors led by Raman Roy, CMD of Quatrro and Co-founder of Indian Angel Network. Other investors include Ankit Nagori, ex-CBO Flipkart and Harish Natarajan, former CEO of Bausch & Lomb India. Founded in November 2015 by Manoj Nair, the platform also connects photographers with buyers.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: PM Modi to launch Ola's e-rickshaw service
article: Transportation aggregator app Ola has introduced the booking of e-rickshaws on its platform. PM Narendra Modi will launch the service by booking the first e-rickshaw on the Ola app, later on Tuesday. Currently, Ola will run a total of 5,100 e-rickshaws across Delhi, Gurgaon, Noida, Faridabad, and Ghaziabad, out of which nearly 151 rickshaws will be given to women drivers.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Future Group acquires FabFurnish
article: Kishore Biyani-led Future Group on Wednesday acquired Rocket Internet-backed furniture startup FabFurnish. Future Group will reportedly pay ₹15-20 crore in cash to buy the company. This marks Future Group’s first acquisition of an e-commerce company and the first exit for Rocket Internet in India. Future Group will retain FabFurnish’s brand and will use it to take Home Town online.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: SoftBank invests in Indian balance checking app
article: SoftBank Ventures Korea has invested an undisclosed amount in India-based True Balance, an app that helps keep track of the balance available on prepaid accounts for Android smartphone users. Launched in 2014 by Korean entrepreneur Charlie Lee, the startup also provides call log, data pack assessment, prepaid recharge services and real-time information on plans and offers from telecom operators.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Ola launches free in-cab 'Auto-Connect Wi-Fi'
article: Indian ride-hailing startup Ola on Thursday launched 'Auto Connect WiFi' feature that allows cab riders to auto connect to Wi-Fi in an Ola cab without needing to enter credentials. A one-time authentication would be needed for the first-time users. The feature is currently available for free in three cities for Ola Prime and will soon be available across all categories.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Free Ola rides after Kolkata flyover collapse
article: Taxi aggregator Ola on Thursday provided free cabs to and from Kolkata's Girish Park, after an under-construction flyover collapsed the same day. Furthermore, taxi-hailing app Uber announced its decision to increase its supply of cabs, and discard surge pricing in the area. Meanwhile, the death toll from the collapse has risen to 24.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Slack raises $200 mn at $3.8 bn valuation
article: Business messaging startup Slack on Friday raised $200 million at a $3.8 billion post-money valuation. The round was led by Thrive Capital, with participation from GGV, Comcast Ventures and Slack’s existing investors, including Accel, Index Ventures and Social Capital. This brings the total funding for the three-year-old company to $540 million.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Drone startup to deliver medicines in Rwanda
article: California-based drone startup Zipline International, will begin delivering vital medical supplies and blood to remote clinics in the African nation of Rwanda. The drone can carry load of up to 1.58 kg and has a roundtrip range of 12 km. Monitored through a tablet, the drone will drop the cargo with the help of a parachute in the clinic premises.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: FreeCharge to enable payments for e-rickshaws
article: FreeCharge has announced a partnership with Bhartiya Micro Credit (BMC), an NGO that provides financial aid for e-rickshaws. FreeCharge's recently launched Chat-n-Pay service will enable customers to connect and pay via chat with e-rickshaw drivers in less than five seconds. Drivers can register themselves as merchants without any investment on Chat-n-Pay by adding their banking details.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Flipkart acquires mobile payment startup PhonePe
article: Flipkart has acquired Bangalore-based mobile payment startup PhonePe for an undisclosed amount. The startup is working on a digital payments app that will enable instant fund transfer and payment via a single identifier like the Aadhaar number. PhonePe, which will function as an independent business unit, is Flipkart’s third major acquisition in the payments space after NGPay and FX Mart.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Startup helps find best place to live and work
article: US-based Teleport helps people explore the best cities to live and work based on personal preferences. Users can compare living costs, salaries, life quality, startup scene, traffic, safety and other aspects in more than 150 places worldwide through the app. Further, Teleport gives an estimated budget amount that can be saved or spent after moving to the chosen cities.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: PM Modi launches 'Stand Up India' scheme
article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday launched the 'Stand Up India' scheme in Noida, under which banks will give loans of up to ₹1 crore to SC/ST and women entrepreneurs. A corpus of ₹10,000 crore has been allocated to the scheme. Speaking at the launch, Modi said that Dalits, if given an opportunity can bring in reforms in the country.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: George Hotz gets $3.1 mn for self-driving cars
article: George Hotz, the hacker-turned-engineer known for unlocking the first iPhone in 2007 and hacking the PS 3, has received $3.1 million in funding led by Andreessen Horowitz for his company, Comma.ai. The startup is working on bringing self-driving to the masses through an aftermarket semi-autonomous kit that will cost “under $1,000”. The product is expected to launch by year-end.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Housing raises funding from former 99Acres head
article: Mumbai-based real estate portal Housing.com on Monday raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Vineet Singh, former business head of realty portal 99Acres.com. As part of the deal, Singh will closely work with Housing’s management team in a senior advisory role. In January this year, Housing raised an additional ₹100 crore in funding from Japan’s SoftBank.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Startup focused on Indian highways raises funds
article: Bengaluru-based Highway Delite has raised an undisclosed amount of pre-seed funding from NS Raghavan Centre for Entrepreneurial Learning, the incubation unit of IIM Bangalore. Founded in 2015, it helps commuters in finding verified and reviewed restaurants and other services required while commuting on highways such as medical facilities, toilets, petrol pumps, repair shops and hotels.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Xiaomi makes 1st investment in India in Hungama
article: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi has made its first investment in India after leading a $25 million funding in Gurgaon-based Hungama Digital Media Entertainment. Existing investors Intel Capital, Bessemer Venture Partners and Rakesh Jhunjhunwala also participated in the round. Notably, Xiaomi had earlier invested in China's online video provider iQiyi and video streaming website Youku Tudou.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: Haptik raises funding from Times Internet
article: Chat-based personal assistant app, Haptik raised an undisclosed Series B round and formed a strategic alliance with Times Internet. Founded by Aakrit Vaish and Swapan Rajdev, Haptik had raised $1 million Series A round from Kalaari Capital in 2014. Kalaari has exited the company after the current fund-raise.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Amazon starts working on its Hyderabad campus
article: Amazon India has started working on building its largest campus outside of the US in Hyderabad, as Telangana IT minister KT Rama Rao laid the foundation stone for the new site. Spread over 10 acres of land, the campus is expected to be complete by 2019. The company has also announced to infuse fresh investments for the same.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: South Asian dating app Dil Mil raises $2.7 mn
article: South Asian dating app Dil Mil has raised $2.7 million in its pre-series A round of funding from a group of investors including Nelstone Ventures, Transmedia Capital, Maiden Lane Ventures, Naval Ravikant, Kunal Shah, Sameer Parwani and Vijay Ullal. Founded in 2014 by KJ Dhaliwal, Sukhmeet Toor and Jacob Ilin, the startup features multi-source verification and detailed partner preferences.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Startup makes device to turn window blinds smart
article: A US-based startup has created a solar-powered device called FlipFlic that adjusts window blinds based on sunlight, temperature, or schedule set in the app. It can be attached to the blinds magnetically and the temperature sensor triggers opening and closing if it gets too hot or cold. The light sensor detects indoor light levels and manages daylight and night automations.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Mukesh Bansal invests in fitness startup Cult
article: Myntra Co-Founder Mukesh Bansal on Tuesday invested an undisclosed sum in Bangalore-based Cult, a fitness startup focused on training programmes without using traditional gym equipment. Founded in 2015 by Rishabh Telang and Deepak Poduval, Cult doesn't provide treadmills or fitness machines to users, it instead offers boxing rings, jump ropes, boxing bags, tyres and speed chutes.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Snapchat adds stickers & audio, video notes
article: Snapchat on Tuesday rolled out an update adding more than 200 stickers and featuring audio and video calling and notes. The audio and video notes allow users to send short audio and video snippets of up to 10 seconds. The new release also allows sending multiple photos at a time and switching between audio and video calls during a conversation.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Airbnb to offer first ever underwater bedroom
article: Rental sharing service Airbnb has unveiled its first ever underwater bedroom, surrounded by 35 sharks, that will be offered for free to the winners of a competition. To win a stay in the Aquarium de Paris for one night on either April 11th, 12th or 13th, contestants must submit an essay describing why they deserve to sleep in the bedroom.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Sweden-based Spotify raises $1 billion in debt
article: Sweden-based music streaming startup Spotify has raised $1 billion in convertible bonds from TPG and Dragoneer among others. As per the deal, the investors will get to convert the debt to equity at 20% discount when Spotify files for IPO. However, if it doesn't file the IPO within the next year, the discount will increase by 2.5% every six months.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Govt launches ‘Startup India’ web portal, app
article: The Department of Industrial Promotion and Policy has launched a ‘Startup India’ web portal and mobile app. The platform will act as a single window for startups to register themselves within 24 hours, avail government incentives and receive information about incubation facilities and tax benefits. It will also let startups receive notifications from different departments and funding agencies.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Uber to invest $500 mn in India by June: Reports
article: According to media reports, taxi-hailing app Uber plans to invest $500 million (₹3,300 crore) in India by June this year to take on its Indian rival, Ola. Founder Travis Kalanick  believes that Uber's Indian market could surpass either the US or China. Notably, the company had already committed an investment of $1 billion in India in July 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Federal Bank to open startup incubation centres
article: The Federal Bank is set to launch a dedicated service for startups called 'Launchpad', to open incubation centres at its Bengaluru and Ernakulam branches. Special lounges at these branches will provide startups advice on capital, regulatory support and even disburse funds. The bank also has a dedicated startup fund worth $3.7 million to fund or lend to promising startups.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Uber launches bike-sharing pilot in Gurgaon
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber on Wednesday launched a pilot of its bike sharing product uberMOTO in Gurgaon, following its introduction in Bengaluru. The company has set minimum fare at ₹15, followed by ₹3 per km and ₹1 per minute of ride-time charges. Users can request for a ride through the Uber app between 7:30 am and 9:30 pm.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber to pay up to $10,000 on finding bugs
article: Uber on Tuesday announced a bug bounty of up to $10,000 to hackers who will find bugs in its system. Starting from May 1, it will last for 90 days and reward hackers who will find four issues accepted by Uber as genuine bugs. Uber last year held a private bug bounty program where 100 bugs were found and fixed.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart, Ola Co-founders invest in HashLearn
article: On-demand mobile tutoring app HashLearn has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal, Ola Co-founder Bhavish Aggarwal and Google India Head Rajan Anandan. Singapore Angel Network and a clutch of other investors also participated in the round. Founded in 2013 by Jayadev Gopalakrishnan and Gokul Janga, HashLearn connects students to tutors through its app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bike rental startup WheelStreet raises $500k
article: Bengaluru-based bike rental startup WheelStreet has raised $500,000 in a funding round led by early-stage venture firm Broadbean Capital. WheelStreet was founded in 2014 by Pranay Shrivastava, Moksha Srivastava and Mritunjay Kumar. The portal lets users rent two-wheelers including scooters, commuter bikes, sports bikes, super bikes and premium bikes in Delhi and Bengaluru.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber hiring engineers via in-built coding game
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber is reportedly recruiting engineers for its platform through an in-built coding game called 'Code on the Road', which pops-up during a ride. The game consists of three coding problems for the rider, each with a 60-second countdown. Uber is identifying geographical areas where tech jobs are concentrated to find potential candidates and let them play the game.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Voice-controlled app developed to track calories
article: MIT researchers have developed an app that lets users track calorie counts by verbally describing the contents of a meal. The speech-controlled nutrition-logging system automatically retrieves nutritional data of meal descriptions from an online database of the US Department of Agriculture. Users can also refine their descriptions, either verbally or by selecting precise information on the app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber's global profit offsets China loss: CEO
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber's Co-founder and CEO Travis Kalanick in an interview to Reuters said the company's global profit offsets $1 billion loss it suffers in China. "If you took our top 30 cities today, they're generating over $1 billion in profit a year," Kalanick said. Uber is facing losses in China due to subsidised fares to gain market share.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bike repair startup DrivoJoy raises $600k
article: Bengaluru-based on-demand bike repair startup DrivoJoy has raised around $600,000 in its pre-Series A round of funding led by Indian Angel Network, Tessellate Ventures, Equity Crest and Tracxn Labs. Shailesh Rao, VP of International Operations at Twitter and Kunal Shah, Freecharge Founder also participated in the round. Founded in 2015, DrivoJoy repairs and services bikes on demand.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup develops portable 'pop-up' desk, chair
article: A Chicago-based startup has developed a $499 portable 'pop-up' desk,chair and easel combo, called 'The Edge', which sets up in 10 seconds. The 20-pound desk features an aluminium frame and a padded, adjustable seat for various body types.It is also available with additional accessories like cup holder, speaker, LED light powered by USB and others.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Peter Thiel's Founders Fund nabs $1.3 bn funding
article: Founders Fund, a San Francisco-based VC firm, has raised $1.3 billion in its sixth round of funding. Peter Thiel, an investor in Facebook and SpaceX and Co-founder of PayPal, will remain at the helm, with partners Lauren Gross, Ken Howery, Geoff Lewis, Scott Nolan, Luke Nosek and Brian Singerman. With this, Founders Fund has raised over $3 billion.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: 100% FDI allowed in e-commerce marketplace model
article: The government on Tuesday approved 100% Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in marketplace model of e-commerce under the automatic route. However, FDI is still not permitted under the inventory model. Under the automatic route, FDI is allowed without the prior permission from government or RBI. The government has also come out with definition of e-commerce, inventory-based model and marketplace model.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Smart bottle keeps wine fresh for 30 days
article: Boston-based startup Kuvée has developed a smart wine bottle that keeps wine fresh for 30 days. The 750 ml bottle features a rechargeable touchscreen that displays the history of the wine, suggests food pairings, estimates how much wine is left and provides personalised wine recommendations. Priced between $15 and $50, Kuvée has also raised $6 million in funding.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Jugnoo accuses Ola of false bookings
article: Autorickshaw-booking app Jugnoo has accused Ola of creating fake accounts to book and later cancel autorickshaws on Jugnoo's app. Jugnoo alleges that over the last 10 days, about 20,000 cancellations have occurred through 800 fake accounts. This has lead to loss of revenue and has also affected drivers’ incomes. Earlier, Uber filed a complaint against Ola over similar false bookings.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat buys Bitstrips for $100 million: Report
article: Snapchat has reportedly bought instant comic maker Bitstrips for $100 million cash and stock deal. Founded in 2007, Bitstrips is best known for its Bitmoji app, which lets users create an avatar of themselves to share on social media and over text. Snapchat recently raised $175 million in fresh funding from Fidelity Investments, valuing the messaging app at $16 billion.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Online store for school products raises $300k
article: Delhi-based startup SchoolKart, an online marketplace for school products, has raised $300,000 from 12 angel investors. Founded in 2015 by ISB alumnus and former Amazon employee Nikhil Sareen, SchoolKart offers school uniforms, stationery, sporting goods and NCERT Books, among other things, on its platform. So far, SchoolKart has raised about $500,000 and comprises a team of 15 people.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart oven 'June' raises $22.5 million
article: A countertop smart oven designed by former Google, Apple and GoPro employees, 'June' on Friday raised $22.5 million in Series A funding led by early stage investor Eclipse. Priced at $1500, the app-controlled oven has an in-built camera and processor to identify and cook food at the recommended settings. It also live streams the cooking process on the app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes robot to inspect power plants
article: US-based startup Gecko Robotics has developed a robot which can replace humans for time-consuming and dangerous inspections at power plants. Supervised by a human, the robot can climb walls of power plants during inspection and collect 10% more data than a human. It inspects and evaluates a boiler in one day, which takes seven days for a human to inspect.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Wings Travels acquires taxi service Bookmycab
article: Pune-based transport service Wings Travel has acquired Mumbai-based taxi service Bookmycab for an undisclosed amount in a mix of cash and equity deal. In July 2015, on-demand auto-rickshaw service Jugnoo was reportedly acquiring Bookmycab, however, the deal did not work out. Founded in 2012 by IIT Bombay alumnus Avinash Gupta, Bookmycab lets users book taxis through its website and app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: StalkBuyLove gets funded by 500 Startups, others
article: Online fashion shopping platform StalkBuyLove has raised an undisclosed amount of funding led by 500 Startups and Germany-based venture fund Littlerock. India-based Singularity Ventures also participated in the funding round. Founded in 2013 by Rocket Internet alumni, StalkBuyLove lets women shop for fashion apparel through its website and mobile app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sachin Bansal, Kunal Bahl engage in Twitter spat
article: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal on Friday shared his opinion on Alibaba entering India on Twitter. "Alibaba deciding to start operations directly shows how badly their Indian investments have done so far", Bansal tweeted. Snapdeal Co-founder Kunal Bahl responded, "Didn't Morgan Stanley just flush 5bn worth market cap in Flipkart down the (toilet)? Focus on ur business not commentary :)".

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Sleep-improving tech startup raises $11 million
article: French startup Rythm, which makes a tech-infused headset claimed to improve sleep quality, announced on Tuesday that it has raised over $11 million from private investors and public grants. Founded in 2014, the startup's headset uses audio to stimulate the brain in a way that elongates deep sleep cycles to improve the quality of rest, memory and other cognitive functions.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Roadrunnr changes brand name to Runnr
article: According to media reports, hyper-local on-demand delivery startup Roadrunnr has changed its name to Runnr. This comes after the Bengaluru-based startup reportedly faced legal notice over copyright infringement and intellectual property rights (IPR) for its name from an unknown company. However, Co-founder Mohit Kumar ruled out any legal issue and said, “We are experimenting with the brand name".

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Govt to create 2.5L Dalit entrepreneurs
article: About 2.5 lakh SC/ST entrepreneurs would be created under the Centre's Stand Up India initiative, Union Minister for MSME (Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises) Kalraj Mishra said on Friday. "[B]ank branches would be encouraged to fund a SC/ST and woman entrepreneurs", he said at the inauguration of National Industrial & Trade Fair organised by Dalit Indian Chamber Commerce & Industry.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 3D printer uses smartphone's light to print
article: A San Francisco-based startup has created a smartphone-powered 3D printer 'OLO', which uses the light from a smartphone's screen to harden resin solution for printing 3D objects. Priced at $99, it is compatible with smartphones of any size or brand. It can print both soft and hard objects from designs stored in a smartphone or any other 3D printing software.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Cricketer Robin Uthappa invests in HealthEminds
article: Indian cricketer Robin Uthappa has invested an undisclosed amount in Bangalore-based healthcare startup HealthEminds. Founded in 2013 by Ankita Puri and Sunita Maheshwari, HealthEminds provides online psychiatry and counselling services through video counselling, thus keeping the anonymity of a person. Previously, Uthappa has invested in online tiffin service venture iTiffin.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BigBasket raises $150mn led by Abraaj Group
article: Hyperlocal grocery delivery startup BigBasket on Tuesday raised $150 million in a funding round led by UAE-based Abraaj Group. Existing investors Bessemer Venture Partners, Helion Advisors, Zodius Capital and Ascent Capital along with new investors International Finance Corp and Sands Capital also participated in the round. BigBasket had reportedly raised $92.8 million in three earlier rounds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola acquires mobile payments startup Qarth
article: Taxi-aggregator company Ola on Tuesday acquired Chennai-based startup Qarth, which runs mobile payments app X-Pay, to strengthen its mobile wallet business Ola Money. The Co-founders of Qarth will join Ola Money along with their present team. Founded in 2012 by Abhinav Srivastava and Prerit Srivastava, the X-Pay app facilitates mobile payment to anyone with IMPS enabled bank account across India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 11 American unicorn startups founded by Indians
article: According to a study by the National Foundation for American Policy, 11 out of America's 87 unicorn (billion-dollar) startups were founded or co-founded by an Indian entrepreneur. Among these Indian entrepreneurs, seven went to the US as international students. The study also enlists immigrants who founded American unicorns including SpaceX Founder Elon Musk and Slack Founder Stewart Butterfield.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Online shopping to grow 78% in '16: Assocham-PwC
article: Average spending on online purchases is expected to rise 78% in 2016 due to attractive deals and aggressive marketing of the expanding range of merchandise, according to a report by industry body Assocham and consulting firm PwC. About 5.5 crore customers made an online purchase in 2015 and the number is expected to hit 8 crore this year, it added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indo-Americans build on-demand tutor hiring app
article: Two Indian-Americans, Sultan Khan and Haasith Sanka from the University of California, have developed an on-demand tutor hiring app 'Scholarly'. The app lets users view tutor profiles and set meeting locations with them for tuitions. The tutors can be booked for full time or just a few hours a week for subjects ranging from class XII to graduation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sachin Tendulkar invests in IoT firm Smartron
article: Sachin Tendulkar has invested in Bengaluru-based Internet of Things (IoT) firm Smartron India and has become its brand ambassador. Founded in 2013 by Mahesh Lingareddy, it is focused in the areas of smart sensors, robotics, artificial intelligence, big data and crowd technologies for IoT-enabled products. Smartron is set to launch a slew of smart devices and IoT products this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm ties up with PVR for movie ticketing
article: Paytm has tied up with PVR Cinemas as a part of its ₹120 crore investment in the online movie ticketing business. Starting this month, PVR tickets will be available on all Paytm channels. "Customers today are asked to shell out more when they pay in advance digitally. We want to eradicate this practice," said Vijay Shekhar Sharma, Paytm CEO.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ed-tech startup Byju's raises $75 million
article: Bengaluru-based education platform Byju's has raised $75 million in funding from Sequoia Capital and Belgium-based investment firm Sofina, making it the largest fundraise by an ed-tech startup in India. Founded in 2011 by Byju Raveendran, the startup offers learning programmes through watch-and-learn videos. The company has now reportedly raised a total of $90 million in funding.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart umbrella made to alert user before rains
article: Paris-based startup Wezzoo has developed 'Oombrella', a smart umbrella which alerts the user before it rains. Connected through an app, it tracks hyperlocal weather data and alerts 15 minutes before it rains. It also tracks activity and sends a notification to users if it is left behind. A smart capsule is also available separately which can turn any umbrella smart.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber resumes its bike service in Bengaluru
article: Uber has resumed its on-demand pilot bike service 'uberMOTO' in Bengaluru, saying that the company essentially encourages “bikepooling”. Uber has also decided not to charge any service fee for the period. Launched on March 4 in Bengaluru this year, the service was banned by the Karnataka government, terming it as illegal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: OyeHelp app lets users search, consult doctors
article: A Gurgaon-based startup has made an app called 'OyeHelp' which lets users consult doctors across all specialities online through audio or video. Users can pay consultation fee and manage appointments through the app. It also lets users to filter doctors by consultation fee, languages spoken and ratings. OyeHelp also provides free health tips, advice and articles written by health experts.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google, Hillhouse Capital fund Girnar Software
article: Girnar Software, which owns auto portals like CarDekho, BikeDekho and Zigwheels, has received funding from Google Capital and existing investor Hillhouse Capital. Founded in 2007, Girnar Software has earlier received funding from Ratan Tata, Sequoia Capital and Times Internet. The IT company, run by IIT and IIM alumni, develops mobile apps and provides e-commerce solutions among others.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Foodpanda Co-founder's startup acquires Ruplee
article: Co-founder and former Managing Director of Foodpanda, Rohit Chadda-led offline payment platform Paylo has acquired restaurants payment app Ruplee for an undisclosed amount. Teams and products of both the startups will merge to let app-only Ruplee become an omni-channel payment platform. Founded in 2014 by Natasha Jain, Ruplee lets users pay at select restaurants through its app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Abhinav Bindra sets up VC fund for startups
article: Olympic gold medalist and Indian ace shooter Abhinav Bindra has set up a venture capital fund named 'Shooting Star LLP'. The fund is created in an equal partnership with consulting firm Franchise India, and an initial investment of $2 million. It will invest in emerging sports academies, sports injury, rehab, equipment and training, health apps, child development and organic foods.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bike-taxi app Baxi to work without internet
article: On demand bike-hailing service Baxi will let Android users book rides without using a data connection from the next week. The app will send a text message with the user's location to request a bike from the server, which will revert the user via text message. Baxi's bike-taxi service is currently operational in Gurgaon and Faridabad.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: VR headset that works without phone, PC made
article: Sulon Technologies, a Toronto-based startup, has developed 'Sulon Q', a headset which allows virtual reality, augmented reality and spatial computing without connecting to a smartphone or a computer. The headset has a 2,560 x 1,440 resolution OLED display, which is sharper than both Oculus Rift and HTC Vive headsets. It comes with spatial earbuds to create three-dimensional sound of space.

author: Anupama K
abstract: Ola to skill 1 lakh youth in Maharashtra
article: Taxi aggregator Ola has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Maharashtra government to create 1 lakh entrepreneurship opportunities for the youth in the state over the next five years. Ola will provide skill training to both men and women to be independent driver-entrepreneurs. The company also plans to expand its network of driver-owned cabs across Micro, Mini and Prime categories.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Shuttle service Commut acquires H2O Cabs
article: Hyderabad-based employee shuttle service startup Commut has acquired app-based cab service H2O Cabs for an undisclosed amount. Post acquisition, Tejasri Darsi, H2O Founder, will be handling sales and partnerships of Commut. Founded in August 2014, H2O Cabs lets users book a seat in air-conditioned and Wi-Fi enabled cabs on fixed routes in Hyderabad.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: UK startup lets users raise funds via selfies
article: Nelfie, a UK-based startup, lets users raise funds and awareness for a charitable cause by sharing their story with a 'nearly-naked' selfie on its platform. Founded in 2015 by Tom Wren, the platform initially keeps the selfie pixelated when a campaign starts. The selfie gets clearer as more funds are generated by the campaign.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: OneClickWash raises seed funding from Unitus
article: On-demand laundry startup OneClickWash has raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding from Unitus Seed Fund. The Gurgaon-based startup was founded in 2015 by Vivek Iyer and Srinivas Nudurupati. OneClickWash through its Android app or a phone call lets users get their clothes washed or dry-cleaned within 48 hours with doorstep pickup facility.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber drags Ola to court over false bookings
article: Uber has filed a complaint in the Delhi high Court against Ola alleging that Ola's employees have created over 93,000 fake accounts on Uber's platform to make false bookings which were later cancelled. It has claimed to have paid over ₹5 lakh as cancellation charges. The US-based company has also sought over ₹49 crore in damages from Ola.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mukesh Bansal, Nagori to launch health startup
article: Mukesh Bansal, Co-founder of Myntra and Ankit Nagori, former Chief Business Officer at Flipkart, who resigned from Flipkart earlier this February, are launching a startup focused on healthcare, sports and fitness. Bansal and Nagori will reportedly get their venture registered next month and launch an app by next year. Both are jointly pooling around $5 million to fund the venture.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Cisco to invest $100 million in India
article: US technology giant Cisco on Friday said that it will invest $100 million in India to fund startups and train 2.5 lakh students by 2020. The company will infuse $40 million in early-stage and growth-stage startups focused on Internet of Things, security and smart cities. Cisco has already funded about 25 companies in India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Karnataka to get 4 incubators for tech startups
article: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah while presenting the annual budget for 2016-17 on Friday, announced to open four incubators for technology startups in the state. "The incubators will be set up in the areas of Internet of Things (IoT), Electronics System Design and Manufacturing (ESDM) robotics, 3D printing, nanotechnology, medical devices, health technology and clean technology," Siddaramaiah said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tiger top crossover investor in tech startups
article: According to data from CB Insights, Tiger Global was the top crossover investor in tech startups in 2015 by investing in over 45 startups including Flipkart, Ola and Airbnb. Goldman Sachs was the second most active investor with investments in Uber and Spotify. Both Tiger and Goldman were the only crossover investors to fund over 30 tech startups in 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App tracks every balance deduction from SIM
article: Pune-based startup Smartbro Optinno has developed an Android app named 'Smartbro', which tracks and logs every single deduction of balance from a user's prepaid mobile SIM. It tracks both the main and data balance, shows current available balance on the phone's dialler and reminds about the expiry of the balance. The app does not require a data connection to work.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal to give 20% pay hike to top performers
article: Online retailer Snapdeal has announced an annual salary hike of 20% and above for its top performers along with ESOPs, effective from April 1, 2016. The hike, Snapdeal's move to become a meritocracy-led organisation, will benefit around 5-15% of the company's employee base. The startup had rolled out a hike of 16% for its top performers last year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber to beat Ola within next 30 days: Uber Prez
article: In an interview to Mint, Eric Alexander, President of Uber's Asia Business, said Uber will beat Ola in the next 30 days. Eric said, "If we can win you at home then we can win you abroad." On global alliance, he added, "You got four different brands... Lyft, Didi, Grab, Ola, whereas you have just one Uber across the world."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Magicbricks acquires Bengaluru-based Properji
article: In its first acquisition, real estate portal Magicbricks has acquired Invact Technologies, which runs Bengaluru-based property analysis platform Properji, for an undisclosed amount. Properji was founded in 2012 by Priya Maheshwari and Guruprasad Bangle. The platform gives users end-to-end services on property including personalised recommendation, analysis and assistance in property buying.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: School bus tracking app AppAlert raises ₹6 crore
article: Gurgaon-based AppAlert, a mobile app to track school buses in real-time has raised ₹6 crore in its seed funding round from an angel investor. Founded in 2015 by Ashuvinder Ahuja, it tracks school bus using GPS and roll-calls students from a list of children being ferried through the bus. It also notifies parents of boarding and de-boarding of their children.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Times Internet appoints Gautam Sinha as CEO
article: Times Internet, Times of India Group's digital wing on Thursday appointed former Chief Operating Officer, Gautam Sinha as its new Chief Executive Officer (CEO). Former CEO Satyan Gajwani has been promoted as the company's Managing Director. Both the new appointments will come into effect in the company in April this year.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Ola to invest ₹200 cr to adopt CNG cars in Delhi
article: Taxi-hailing app Ola will invest ₹200 crore to adopt 5,000 CNG vehicles in the Delhi-NCR region over the next six months. This comes after the Supreme Court of India asked Ola, Uber and the Association of Radio Taxis to phase out diesel cabs by March 31. The company already has a fleet of more than 20,000 CNG cars across India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sequoia VC Goguen quits over sex abuse lawsuit
article: Michael Goguen, a Venture Capitalist at Sequoia Capital for about 20 years has quit the firm following a lawsuit for "sexually, physically and emotionally" abusing a woman for over 13 years. Goguen had promised the woman $40 million in settlement, but only paid $10 million. Goguen later said he is being extorted after his relationship with the woman went "sour."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Pigeons with backpacks to check air quality
article: Paris-based air quality start-up Plume Labs on Monday released a flock of pigeons with backpacks equipped with air pollution checkers and GPS trackers in London. The backpacks carried by pigeons can monitor nitrogen dioxide, ozone and volatile compounds in air. On a three-day mission, the pigeons will monitor air quality and report back their findings.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Fashion app WithMe raises ₹1.7 cr in angel round
article: Personalised fashion app WithMe has raised ₹1.7 crore in an angel round of funding from a group of investors including Alex Kuruvilla, MD, CondeNast; Pradeep Guha, former head of Zee Group and TOI; and Saket Dhankar, head of Lakme Fashion Week. Founded in 2015, the app lets users style their look with advice from friends and fashion experts.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Clinical supplies startup raises ₹1.5 crore
article: Bengaluru-based clinical supplies startup PinkBlue has raised ₹1.5 crore in seed funding round from TermSheet, a fund-raising platform for startups to raise early-stage capital from investors. Angel investors including Ajay Modani of Capillary Technologies also participated in the round. Founded in 2014 by Valliappan Kumarappan and Varun Singh, PinkBlue is a B2B platform for clinical supplies.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Quikr fires over 150 CommonFloor employees
article: Online classifieds platform Quikr reportedly fired over 150 employees from CommonFloor, asking them “to look out for career opportunities outside the company”. CommonFloor’s Bengaluru office in Diamond District will be shut down in a month. Quikr in January this year acquired real estate portal CommonFloor, following which CommonFloor's staff joined Quikr and many employees resigned on their own.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tutor search platform FlipClass raises $1 mn
article: Bengaluru-based tutor search platform FlipClass on Monday raised $1 million in funding from textbook publisher S Chand and venture capital firm Blume Ventures. Founded in 2013 by Vineet Dwivedi, the startup lets users take home tuitions for school segment from verified tutors registered on its platform. FlipClass in 2014 had raised $2,50,000 from online fundraising platform LetsVenture.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: FreeCharge allows payments via chat in 5 seconds
article: FreeCharge has launched ‘Chat and Pay’, a first-of-its-kind service that authorises payments through chats under five seconds. The service allows users to directly transfer money to friends and family and also allows payments between customers and merchants through a secure network. The feature is currently available on Android, and will be launched on iOS and Windows in the coming weeks.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: App helps users create social shooting community
article: Houston-based Jonathan Rockett has developed ‘The Shooting Club’, an app that aims to create a “social shooting experience”. It allows users to talk to other gun owners, find the nearest shooting range and use one of the app’s targets to record their shots. Users can also scan their targets, upload it to the app and compare it with other shooters.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart headphones made to download, store songs
article: US-based startup Moor Industries has developed smart wireless bluetooth headphones which allow users to directly download and store media files to the headset. The Android-based headphones allow calling and feature in-built health tracker, camera, GPS, video playback, external speaker, apps including Radio and e-book reader. It allows 8 GB of storage and eight hours of playtime in single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rannvijay leads ₹72 lakh seed funding in Liftiee
article: Roadies presenter Rannvijay Singh has led ₹72 lakh seed funding round of Mumbai-based car and bike pooling app Liftiee. Television actor Anita Hassanandani Reddy also participated in the funding round. Founded in January 2016 by Rashid Khan and Ritvik Mathur, Liftiee app lets users pool privately owned cars and bikes in real-time.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Food discovery app raises pre-Series A funding
article: Food discovery and ordering app Jolly Food Fellow has raised an undisclosed amount in pre-Series A round of funding led by angel investor Janak Parikh, Managing Director of Malibu Group. Founded in 2015, the Ahmedabad-based startup lets users discover and order food from various vendors and restaurants. The startup also provides the vendors with analytical insights of their customers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm borrows ₹300 crore from ICICI Bank
article: Online payments and m-commerce platform Paytm has taken a loan of around ₹300 crore from ICICI Bank in two tranches. Vijay Shekhar Sharma, Paytm Founder, said "the loan is a treasury management move for working capital". The Noida-based startup last year had borrowed ₹15 crore from HDFC Bank for working capital requirements, which has been repaid.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup develops 400x microscope for smartphone
article: A US-based startup has developed a high resolution digital microscope named 'Nurugo Micro' with 400x magnification, which fixes to a smartphone with a clip. Controlled through an Android or iOS app, it does not require any power or charging and uses a smartphone's camera for magnification. Priced at $49, the microscope is 0.5 centimetre thick and weighs 3.89 grams.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup plans vacation based on user's budget
article: A California-based startup 'Wherefor' lets users discover places they can visit on the basis of their budget. Users need to provide their joint budget for flight and accommodation, dates to travel and the departing city. Based on this information, the startup provides a list of places to visit and options to book flight and hotel within the given budget.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Headphones that convert into display device made
article: US-based startup Avegant has developed a $699 wearable display headphone 'Glyph', which lets users to play games and watch movies in 3D. When flipped forward, Glyph comes in level with the user's eyes and turns into a VR display device with 1280x720p display. It can be connected to a Playstation, smartphone, laptop or desktop to view photos and videos.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart sues Uttarakhand govt for taxing buyers
