article: Flipkart has sued the Uttarakhand government for imposing a 10% entry tax for buyers on goods purchased through e-commerce. Flipkart has filed the case through its logistics arm Ekart and called the tax "discriminatory". The online retailer in February this year had filed a petition arguing the 10% entry tax for online retailers against standard entry tax of 5%.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Domino's Australia unveils pizza delivery robot
article: Domino's Australia with Australian startup Marathon Robotics has turned a military robot into a pizza delivery robot named 'DRU'. It can speed up to 20 kmph, identify obstacles and calculate the shortest path to reach its destination. DRU has a temperature-controlled box to keep pizzas hot and drinks cold, which lets customers collect their meal on providing a unique code.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart clothing developed for tracking workout
article: A US-based startup has developed machine-washable smart clothing 'Enflux' which tracks the user's workout in real-time using 10 embedded motion sensors. Connected through an app, the clothing tracks the user's workout in 3D including heart rate, efficiency and intensity. The clothing claims to be anti-odour and comes with a battery life of two weeks in a single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Android users can book Ola, Uber via Google Maps
article: Starting today, Google Maps users can directly get fare estimates and information on the nearest available cabs for ride-hailing services Ola and Uber. The ride information will be available within a new tab on the Maps app, alongside the existing car, public transport and walking options. Maps will further direct users to the Ola or Uber app to book cabs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: HDFC Bank launches banking solution for startups
article: HDFC Bank in partnership with Mumbai-based startup accelerator Zone Startups India  has launched a dedicated banking solution for startups called 'SmartUp'. The service includes payment and banking solutions for startups along with advisory and forex services. SmartUp will be available across India including tier-2 and tier-3 cities  that are emerging as startup hubs.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Startup develops eye-tracking for VR
article: San Francisco-based startup Fove has developed eye-tracking for virtual reality (VR) that  "allows users to go inside the world that's behind the display", according to the Co-founder Yuka Kojima. The technology can have various applications like playing video games or enabling disabled people to control devices using their eyes. It could also be helpful for training pilots and surgeons.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zuckerberg Education Ventures backs Volley app
article: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and his wife Priscilla Chan's venture fund Zuckerberg Education Ventures has invested in camera-based learning app Volley's $2.3 million seed funding round. Angel investors from Apple, Dropbox, Blackboard, and Udemy also participated in the round. Volley app scans a textbook page or piece of homework to provide key facts and related links of a topic.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Chicago startup develops smart oven 'Tovala'
article: A Chicago-based startup has developed 'Tovala', a smart oven that cooks ready-made meals provided by the startup in 10 to 30 minutes. Priced at $349, it is designed to read the barcode provided on the meals and cook them accordingly. Tovala uses an exact combination of cooking methods, timing and temperatures chosen by the chefs for each dish.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Skype Co-founder's app gets video messaging
article: Wire, a messaging app built by Skype Co-Founder Janus Friis with a group of former Skype technologists has introduced video calls and end-to-end message encryption. The privacy feature will keep the users' private conversations out of online data economy, usually used by advertisers to target online users. Launched in 2014, the app allows group chat with up to 128 people.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Ola shuts down 'Ola Cafe' and 'Ola Store'
article: Taxi-hailing app Ola on Thursday officially shut down its food delivery service ‘Ola Cafe’ and grocery delivery service ‘Ola Store’. The company said, “The Ola Store app and Ola Café category on the Ola app will not be available from this week onwards.” The services were launched as pilot projects in March 2015 and July 2015, respectively.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Amazon to start its own air delivery network
article: Amazon on Wednesday signed a deal to lease 20 Boeing 767 aircraft to ship more packages in the United States. Operating its own air cargo fleet, leased for five to seven years, can reportedly help Amazon avoid shipment delays and reduce shipping costs. Currently, Amazon depends on third-party logistics providers like FedEx and the UPS for completing its shipment requirements.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Mu Sigma accused of grossly misleading investors
article: Data analytics company Mu Sigma and its founder Dhiraj Rajaram were accused in a lawsuit of "grossly misleading" its investors Walworth Investments in order to buy back shares at a lower price. Walworth's Patrick G Ryan claimed that he was cheated when Mu Sigma downplayed its growth prospects to buy back his investment company's early stake in the analytics firm.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: VR solutions startup SmartVizX raises over $500k
article: Noida-based virtual reality solutions startup SmartVizX has raised over $500,000 from the Indian Angel Network (IAN) and Stanford Angels & Entrepreneurs India (SA&E India). Founded in February 2015 by Gautam Tewari and Tithi Tewari, SmartVizX aims at building ‘Immersive Technology’ solutions using virtual reality for various sectors including real estate.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: 5-fold hike in govt budget for funding startups
article: The government announced a five-fold increase in its budget for funding startups in the next fiscal, under the 'Start-Up India' initiative. In the 2016-17 financial year, it will provide seed capital to 50-80 new ventures with funding ranging from ₹50 lakh to ₹1 crore. The government has also increased the overall funding for startups from ₹40 crore to ₹200 crore.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Startup builds fully-automated smart homes
article: California-based startup Brain of Things has built fully-automated apartments called ‘robot homes’. The apartments learn the residents’ habits and accordingly execute functions like switching on the lights, lifting the blinds and feeding the pets. Featuring 20 sensors each, the smart houses can detect pipe leaks and beam a live video feed on the resident’s phone if someone’s at the door.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat building smart glasses: Report
article: A team from Snapchat is reportedly working on building a pair of smart glasses. Snapchat has also hired a clutch of people from major augmented reality groups including Microsoft’s HoloLens, PTC’s Vuforia and eye-tracking technology maker Eyefluence. It also acquired camera-embedded glasses maker Vergence Labs and QR code-scanning technology Scan.me for $15 million and $50 million respectively.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Karnataka seizes 62 Uber bike taxis
article: Karnataka Transport Department on Friday seized 62 Uber bike taxis from various parts of Bengaluru. The department said the action was taken after giving a press note, and warning operators to discontinue the services, terming them illegal. Launched a week ago, the services were said to have violated Motor Vehicles Act by not obtaining licence to run the bike taxis.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: LetsVenture makes Tinder-like app for investors
article: Online startup funding platform LetsVenture has launched a Tinder-like app on both Android and iOS platforms to let investors discover, co-invest and fund startups on its platform. The app allows investors to discover startups based on their preferences, right-swipe startups they like and directly connect with the founders. It also allows investors to co-invest in a startup with their friends.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart invests ₹338 crore in Myntra
article: Online retail giant Flipkart has invested ₹338 crore in online fashion retailer Myntra, according to documents filed with the Registrar of Companies. The funds were received by Myntra Designs in January this year from Singapore-based FK Myntra Holdings, a unit of Flipkart. Myntra was acquired by Flipkart in May 2014 for $330 million.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Govt to get 20% services, products from MSMEs
article: Starting from April this year, all PSUs, central ministries and departments will procure at least 20% of required goods and services from micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs). Government has relaxed the procurement norms related to prior experience and turnover for MSMEs. The relaxations will be allowed to MSMEs on delivering the goods as per prescribed technical and quality specifications.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: GM buys self-driving car kit startup Cruise
article: General Motors (GM) today announced it is acquiring US-based driverless car technology startup Cruise Automation for an undisclosed sum to develop the company's autonomous vehicle technology. Cruise will operate as an independent unit within GM’s recently formed Autonomous Vehicle Development Team. Founded in 2013, Cruise makes sensors to turn regular vehicles into ones that can drive themselves.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nasscom Foundation gets $4.78 mn from Gates
article: Technology non-profit organisation Nasscom Foundation has received $4.78 million in donation from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation to modernise public libraries with the help of technology. Nasscom Foundation has launched Indian Public Library Movement under which it will provide computers, training staff and supporting classes and programs at 300 district-level libraries across India.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: YouTube Co-founder unveils food-based video app
article: YouTube Co-founder Steve Chen recently unveiled Nom, a live-streaming service for food shows, that allows professional and amateur chefs and foodies to create their own food-related live-streaming channels. Till now, the company has raised $4.7 million in Series A funding from investors like Khosla Ventures and SV Angel, and also Gangnam Style’s PSY and Oscar-winning actor Jared Leto.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Tripoto launches AI-based assistance service
article: Delhi-based online travel discovery platform Tripoto has launched an AI-based interactive assistance service called Tripoto.Ai in beta version. The chat-based platform is enabled with advanced natural language processing and a machine learning algorithm that helps it self-learn from asked queries. Tripoto.Ai claims to have had conversations with over 5,000 travellers within two days of its launch.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Pre-owned fashion app StylFlip gets seed funding
article: App-based platform for pre-owned luxury fashion products, StylFlip, has raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding from real estate developers Raj Gala Shah and Zaheer Memon. The Mumbai-based startup was founded in November 2015 by Zarik Nabi. StylFlip lets users buy, sell and discover pre-owned fashion products including apparel, accessories, bags and shoes from luxury brands.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kerala drivers launch app to counter Ola, Uber
article: Ernakulam Car Drivers Welfare Society, a local body of taxi operators in Kerala, with support from Communist Party of India (CPI) has launched an app to book taxis to counter Ola and Uber. CPI's District Committee Secretary contributed to the creation and launch of the app. A dedicated website was also launched to directly book taxis from local drivers.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Uber opens Asia's first engineering hub in India
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber on Thursday launched its first engineering centre in Asia in Bengaluru to address consumer-facing issues like poor internet connectivity, accuracy in routing vehicles and supply projection. The centre, headed by former Google executive Jaikumar Ganesh, currently has about eight engineers. CTO Thuan Pham said the company will recruit hundreds of engineers in March itself.

author: Aman Raj
abstract: 68% prefer to work with a startup in 2016: Poll
article: According to the Inshorts Youth of the Nation Poll (YOTN), 68% of the 42,958 respondents who voted for the question, said that in 2016 they would prefer to work with a startup than a large corporation, while 11% disagreed. However, 21% voted they were not informed enough.  As per a NASSCOM study, 80,000 jobs were created by startups in 2014-15.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Quikr launches doorstep pickup, delivery service
article: Online classifieds platform Quikr today launched 'Quikr Doorstep' service to provide price negotiations, online payments, pickup and delivery on doorstep of pre-owned products. It is currently available for all products including mobile phones, electronics, appliances and household furniture. Doorstep is available on Quikr's app, mobile site, desktop site and real time messaging service Quikr NXT.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: People-rating app 'Peeple' launched in US
article: 'Peeple', an iOS app which lets users rate people in three ways including professionally, personally and romantically has been launched in the US. It lets a user create a profile and like, share and recommend other profiles over social media, text and email with control over privacy of recommendations. Peeple also comes with 'Nearby' option to discover people in proximity.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes portable printer for smartphone
article: An Australia-based startup has developed a portable printer 'droPrinter' which allows direct printing from a smartphone including messages, web pages and images in black and white. Controlled through an app, it can print anything that appears on a smartphone screen using thermal paper. The printer can run up to seven hours on continuous printing and also acts a power bank.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: BookMyShow acquires Fantain Sports
article: BigTree Entertainment, the company that owns online ticketing portal BookMyShow, has acquired Chennai-based fan relationship management and analytics startup Fantain Sports. Founded in 2013 by Anand Ramachandran, Vivek Venugopalan and Aravind Ramachandran, Fantain Sports offers companies ‘Fan Data’ to increase revenue and predictability. The size of the deal remains undisclosed.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Mahindra to start garage for in-house startups
article: In a first for a corporate entity, IT-services company Tech Mahindra will set up a 'startup garage' for its in-house entrepreneurs. The startups will be physically housed together in the garage and will be mentored, the company's chief strategy officer Jagdish Mitra said. Currently, 15 businesses have emerged from the over 1.05 lakh employee force, he added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grocery delivery startup Ninjacart raises $3 mn
article: Online grocery delivery startup Ninjacart has raised $3 million in a funding round led by Accel Partners. Qualcomm Ventures, ZopSmart and Singapore-based M&S Partners also participated in the round. Founded in 2015, Ninjacart enables farmers and producers to sell directly to retail stores by providing a selling platform and assisting in warehousing and fulfilment.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes eco-friendly shampoo balls
article: A US-based startup has developed an eco-friendly shampoo ball 'Nohbo', which claims to be 100% waste-free. The shampoo balls and its packaging are entirely made from plant-based materials, making it biodegradable. The single-use Nohbo balls once exposed to water, starts dissolving into a lathery shampoo to use on hair. It costs $10 for a 15-ball pack of Nohbo.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Online office supplies store Aahaa raises $1 mn
article: Online store for office supplies, Aahaa has raised $1 million in pre-Series A funding round from a group of investors led by YourNest Angel fund. Founded in 2013, the startup provides offices with services including stationery, warehouses, logistics, housekeeping, IT, electronics and logo merchandise. It has over 50 customers including Wipro, TCS, Ashok Leyland, Michelin and Titan.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes bracelet with power bank
article: A UK-based startup has created a bracelet 'NiftyX', which incorporates a charging cable and a power bank. Cable in the leather bracelet is compatible with both Android and iOS phones for charging and data transfer purposes. Meanwhile, power bank in the bracelet allows up to 50 minutes of talk time or 150 minutes of music playback in a single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Task management app dunzo raises $650k
article: Bengaluru-based task management app dunzo on Tuesday raised $650,000 in pre-Series A funding round led by Aspada Investments and Blume Ventures. Rajan Anandan, VP and MD of Google South East Asia and India and Sandipan Chattopadhyay, former JustDial CTO also participated in the round. Founded in 2015, dunzo lets users create to-do lists and have them done by the app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SoftBank to split into two companies
article: Japan's multinational corporation SoftBank Group today announced to split into two companies to separate its domestic and overseas business. The overseas unit would include SoftBank’s stakes in Sprint Corp and Alibaba Group and the domestic business would include its holdings in Yahoo Japan. SoftBank Founder and current CEO Masayoshi Son will continue to head the group's overall operations.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nikesh Arora to head SoftBank's global business
article: SoftBank Group today appointed Nikesh Arora to lead the company's overseas operations, after it announced splitting into two companies to separate its domestic and global operations. Arora is currently working as SoftBank’s President and Chief Operating Officer. Further, SoftBank appointed its current Director Ken Miyauchi to lead the company's business in Japan.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba's Ant Financial to raise $3.1 billion
article: Alibaba's affiliate Ant Financial is in talks with investors to raise $3.1 billion in funding, which would value the company at around $60 billion ahead of IPO. The funding round is expected to complete by mid-April this year with participation from existing and new investors. Ant Financial closed its Series A funding in 2015 at a valuation of $45-$50 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App to consult doctors through video launched
article: SeeDoc, an app that lets users consult doctors through video calls was launched in India on Tuesday. The Gurgaon-based app connects pre-screened doctors to patients, where doctors respond to requests within two days. The app also has partnerships with pharmacies, clinics and labs to let users get lab samples collected and medicines delivered at home.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: VanityCube raises $250k in angel funding
article: On demand beauty and wellness startup VanityCube has raised $250,000 in angel funding led by Unicorn India Ventures. Founded in 2014 by Renu Bisht and Pragya Upadhyay, the Delhi-based startup provides professional beauty, wellness and makeup services at customer's home and offices through corporate tie-ups. It currently operates as a B2B and B2C platform in Delhi, Noida, Gurgaon and Mumbai.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes portable smart water purifier
article: A US-based startup has developed a smart reverse osmosis water purifier 'WaterO', which displays purification levels and reminds the user to stay hydrated. Controlled through an app, the 3-litre capacity purifier does not need any plumbing for installation and lets the user select the amount of water to be dispensed. The app also alerts user for timely exchange of filters.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New York startup makes 'smart' pill dispenser
article: New York-based startup Hero has developed a smart pill dispenser that automatically alerts a user to take medication and dispenses the pills. Controlled through an app, the dispenser can hold 10 different pills at a time and alerts the user whenever a dose is taken or skipped. The device always asks for a user's approval before dispensing a dose.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bike taxi app NOW raises $500k in angel funding
article: Bike taxi app NOW has raised $500,000 in angel funding from Jaipuria Group’s Managing Director Ruchirans Jaipuria and Supreme Motors Director Anuj Sanghi. While $200,000 have already been infused in the startup, the remaining amount will flow in subject to attainment of certain performance milestones. Founded in 2015, it provides on demand two-wheeler rides for individuals and businesses in Noida.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mumbai Police, Uber tie-up to curb drunk driving
article: Mumbai Police has tied up with Uber to curb drunk driving by installing breathalyser kiosks at city's bars and pubs. Breathalyser will measure the alcohol content in a person's blood and flash a red light if it surpasses the legal limit, helping the individual to book a cab. A green light will flash if alcohol content is within the limit.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Andreessen Horowitz in talks to raise $1.5 bn
article: According to reports, venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz is in talks with investors to raise a fresh $1.5 billion fund. Andreessen Horowitz in 2014 had closed its fourth, multi-stage venture capital fund, Andreessen Horowitz Fund IV at $1.5 billion. Launched in June 2009, the venture capital fund has so far raised $4.35 billion, including three previous funds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup develops back display screen for iPhone
article: A US-based startup has developed 'popSLATE 2', a 0.16-inch thick back display screen for Apple iPhone which comes with integrated battery and works as an e-reader and a smartwatch. It runs on e-ink and allows real-time update of events and switching between apps without unlocking the phone. The screen is compatible with iPhone 6, 6s, 6 Plus and 6s Plus.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: InnerChef acquires EatonGo, Flavour Labs
article: Gurgaon-based food discovery and delivery platform InnerChef has acquired two food startups including Bengaluru-based EatonGo and Gurgaon-based Flavour Labs. While EatonGo is an online breakfast delivery service, Flavour Labs runs food trucks in Delhi and Gurgaon.  Founded in 2015, InnerChef offers meals in the ready-to-cook and ready-to-eat format for users.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Delhi launches incubation policy for startups
article: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday launched an incubation policy to promote entrepreneurship among the youths and distributed seed money of ₹1.5 crore to six higher educational institutions. "Money plays a pivotal role and the government will pitch in every time there is a good idea and a good plan", Sisodia said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tinder testing 'share' button for profiles
article: Dating app Tinder is testing 'share' button with a small group of users, which will let them share a profile link via text to recommend a potential match to another user. The link will be temporary and will expire in five clicks or 72 hours, whichever happens first. Users can change settings to opt out from having a shareable profile.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Karnataka govt seizes five Uber, Ola bike taxis
article: Karnataka government on Sunday seized five Uber and Ola bike taxis and cautioned all the users that these services are illegal. Government officials said that the companies have violated the Motor Vehicle Act by not seeking the government's permission before launching the services. Uber and Ola had launched bike taxi services in Bengaluru last week.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Period-tracking app LoveCycles raises ₹5 crore
article: Period tracking app for women, LoveCycles today raised ₹5 crore in seed funding from Bengaluru-based seed-stage investors Prime Venture Partners. Founded in 2012 by John Paul, the app lets women keep a track of their menstrual and physiological health. Available in 13 languages including Hindi, the app also records monthly cycles, associated symptoms and lets a user set vital reminders.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Housing Co-founder Advitiya Sharma quits
article: Advitiya Sharma, Co-founder of online real estate portal Housing, has resigned from the company to reportedly start his own venture. Sharma's resignation comes nine months after the company's board fired Co-founder and former CEO Rahul Yadav. Of the nine Co-founders, five including Sharma have now left the company. Notably, none of the founders hold a board position at Housing now.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App discovery platform Zappka raises $100k
article: App discovery platform Zappka has raised $100,000 in angel funding from former Line Corp India team Damandeep Singh Soni, Rajat Gupta and other high net worth individuals. Zappka lets users discover apps based on their profile, preferences, friends and social network. The platform was founded in 2015 by former Paytm executive Rajan Gupta and former HP executive Sumit Arora.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: InMobi, TaxiForSure founders invest in Wooplr
article: Mobile fashion discovery platform Wooplr has received an undisclosed amount of funding from InMobi and TaxiForSure founders. Rajiv Mehta, former Chief Executive Officer of Puma India also participated in the funding. The startup in February 2015 had raised $5 million in Series A funding round from Helion Ventures. Founded in 2013, Wooplr guides users with fashion and suggests buying options.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: File discovery app Reach raises $500k
article: File discovery app Reach has raised $500,000 in pre-Series A funding round led by Japanese venture capital firm Rebright Partners. Sol Primero, Nearbuy CEO Ankur Warikoo and Helpchat CEO Ankur Singla also participated in the funding. Founded in 2015, the Gurgaon-based app lets users discover music, apps and free games from their friends' network.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Uber inks pact to invest ₹120 cr in Haryana
article: Uber signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the Haryana government on Tuesday, wherein it will invest ₹120 crore in technology based ride-sharing services. It will collaborate with the government to develop cities, and invest in ride-sharing services, including peer-to-peer transportation using private vehicles. The latter will help form a real alternative to car ownership, said Uber.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Flipkart launches its own payment wallet
article: E-commerce major Flipkart on Thursday launched its own wallet and payment method called ‘Flipkart Money’. Currently available on Android devices, users can recharge the wallet with ₹10,000 at a time and a total of ₹25,000 can be added in a month. Notably, the development comes after Flipkart’s acquisition of payments services start-up FX Mart in 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nilekani funds robotics firm Systemantics
article: Bengaluru-based robotics firm Systemantics has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani and existing investor Accel Partners. This marks Nilekani's seventh investment in a startup so far. Systemantics was founded in 1995 by IIT-Madras alumnus Jagannath Raju. It develops robots and custom automation solutions for industries.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Evernote starts rupee payments for Indian users
article: Productivity app Evernote has started accepting payments in Indian National Rupee (INR)  for Evernote Plus and Premium services. Evernote will allow localised credit card payment on purchase of its premium services including the purchases on major app stores. The company is also giving introductory discounts on all Evernote subscriptions with localised payments.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jabong raises over $20 million from GFG
article: Online fashion retailer Jabong has reportedly raised additional funds of over $20 million from Global Fashion Group (GFG). Jabong is currently running in losses, however, it registered highest month-on-month growth of 35% in its net revenue for January 2016. Jabong investor Rocket Internet has reportedly been in talks with Amazon, Paytm and Snapdeal to sell Xerion Retailits, that operates Jabong.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Ola, Uber launch bike taxi services in Bengaluru
article: On-demand taxi hailing service companies Ola and Uber launched bike taxi services in Bengaluru on Thursday. Uber's bike taxi service 'UberMOTO' will have a base fare of ₹15 and will charge ₹3 per km and ₹1 per minute, while the Ola bike taxi service will charge ₹2 per km and ₹1 per minute with a minimum fare of ₹30.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: DriveU raises seed funding from Unitus, others
article: DriveU, a startup that aggregates on-demand drivers for private car owners, has raised about $1 million in seed funding from Unitus Seed Fund and other angel investors. Founded in June 2015 by Ramprasad Shastry, Ashok Shastry and Amulmeet Singh Chadh, the Bengaluru-based firm is owned and operated by Humble Mobile Solutions. Currently, it is operational across Bangalore, Chennai, Mumbai and Delhi.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Micromax CEO Vineet Taneja quits
article: Vineet Taneja, Chief Executive Officer of domestic handset maker Micromax has resigned from his position. Taneja had joined Micromax in July 2014 after heading the cellphone business at Samsung India and Bharti Airtel. Reports suggest that Taneja had clashes with Micromax promoters including Rahul Sharma, Rajesh Agarwal, Vikas Jai and Sumeet Kumar for non-compliance on implementing his ideas.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zopper acquires EasyPOS for $5 million
article: Tiger Global-backed hyperlocal marketplace for electronics, Zopper has acquired retail software startup EasyPOS for $5 million in a cash and equity deal. As a part of the deal, EasyPOS Co-founders will join Zopper's senior management team. Founded in 2009, EasyPOS provides cloud-based software solutions for Small and Medium Enterprises to discover new efficiency and revenue opportunities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart starts advertising platform for brands
article: Flipkart has launched its own advertising platform 'Brand Story Ads' for brands to launch their advertising campaigns. Over 50 brands have already signed up for the service including Yes Bank, L’Oréal, Micromax, Intel, Gillette, Datsun and Sony. The platform will enable advertising in an interactive story format with content images and product guides.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola to shut down grocery delivery app Ola Store
article: According to reports, Ola is set to shut down its hyperlocal grocery delivery app Ola Store in less than a month. Launched in June 2015, Ola Store let users order daily needs and grocery products with flexible payment and delivery options in Bengaluru, Hyderabad and Gurgaon. Ola has cited "lack of synergy" behind the proposed shut down of the app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fitness discovery platform Gympik raises funding
article: Bengaluru-based fitness discovery platform Gympik has raised an undisclosed sum in pre-Series A round of funding from RoundGlass Partners. Founded in 2012, Gympik is an online platform to discover fitness centres including gyms, dance classes, yoga centres in around 20 cities. It also offers cloud-based software and a personalised mobile app for fitness centres and consumers to track performance.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup Mercari becomes Japan's first unicorn
article: Peer-to-peer marketplace app Mercari has become Japan’s first pre-IPO startup unicorn after raising 8.4 billion yen (about $75 million) at a valuation of over $1 billion. This Series D funding round brings Mercari's total funding to 12.6 billion yen (about $111 million). Launched in 2013, Mercari lets users buy and sell products including fashion, electronics and handmade items.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Blippar raises $54 million in Series D funding
article: Augmented reality search engine Blippar on Wednesday raised $54 million in Series D funding round led by  Malaysian Government strategic investment arm Khazanah Nasional Berhad. Founded in 2011, Blippar's augmented reality and image-recognition technology helps brands to generate interactive digital content which customers can see on scanning the product. It had raised $45 million in March 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola to file for IPO, says report
article: Indian unicorn and taxi aggregator Ola is reportedly planning to file for an Initial Public Offering (IPO). Ola's CFO Rajiv Bansal said that the company will have world class processes in 6-8 months and wants to be ready for an IPO as early as possible. Ola was last valued at $5 billion when it raised $500 million in November 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat raises $175 million from Fidelity
article: Video messaging app Snapchat has reportedly raised $175 million in funding from Fidelity Investments and others. The funding is an extension to Snapchat's Series F round which it started raising in 2015. However, Snapchat raised the financing at the same $16 billion valuation it had a year ago. Snapchat is the sixth most valued venture-backed company in the world.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes portable personal air conditioner
article: A Russian startup has developed 'Evapolar', a $179 portable personal air conditioner that cools, humidifies and purifies air. It contains a removable water tank of 710 ml capacity which lasts for 6-8 hours. Evapolar claims to be 12 times more energy efficient than traditional split systems. The air conditioner can reach a maximum cooling temperature of 17°C.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm ties up with Delhi Metro for card recharge
article: Online payments and m-commerce platform Paytm has tied up with Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to enable commuters to recharge their metro cards through its app or DMRC's website. Commuters will have to tap their cards at Automatic Vending Machines, available at all metro stations, to validate their recharge. Notably, 2.3 million commuters use Metro service on a daily basis.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Startup builds business card that displays pulse
article: Hungarian open source electrocardiography startup MobilECG has built a business card that displays a user's pulse and beats per minute on a built-in screen. Users need to place their thumbs on two touch pads for the screen to show the pulse. The device which will cost around $29, uses a button cell which lasts for an hour of continuous use.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Chinese startup creates pocket-sized laptop
article: Chinese startup GPD has created a $299 pocket-sized gaming laptop 'Win', which integrates a joystick, mouse and keyboard. The 15.5 centimetre long laptop runs on Windows 10 and features a 5.5-inch display with multi-touch support, 64 GB in-built memory, 4 GB RAM and runs 6-8 hours on single charge. It also becomes a gaming console when connected to a television.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes smart headband for quality sleep
article: French startup Rhythm on Thursday launched a smart $350 headband 'Dreem', which enhances the sleep quality of the user. It recognises the user's sleep pattern by measuring brain waves and stimulates 'ocean-like' sound to keep the user in deep sleep for an extended period. The device also records and analyses user's sleep patterns on a dedicated Android or iOS app.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Budget 2016: Profit deduction for startups
article: Presenting the Union Budget 2016, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley today announced 100% deduction on profits for three out of five years for startups set up between April 2016 and March 2019. The government also allocated ₹500 crore for SC, ST and women entrepreneurs under the 'Start Up India' scheme, and enabled registration of new companies in one day.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Times Internet acquires US-based Willow TV
article: In its first international acquisition, Times Internet has acquired US-based cricket broadcaster Willow TV International for $100 million. Founded in 2010 by Vijay Srinivasan, Willow is a sports network which features popular cricket matches and events. Notably, Times Internet division CricBuzz had recently bagged the digital video clip rights for US and Canada for all ICC events between 2016-19.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber, Ola bike service illegal: Karnataka govt
article: A day after Uber and Ola launched bike-taxi services in Bengaluru, Karnataka government termed the services illegal and asked the commuters not to use the services. The state transport department said the companies have not secured the licence to operate the services. It added that insurance cannot be claimed by people for damage in accidents involving these vehicles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hopscotch gets $13 mn led by Facebook Co-founder
article: Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin has led $13 million Series C funding in Hopscotch, an online retailer of baby care, kids and maternity products. Hopscotch has reportedly raised $28 million till date, including the latest funding. Founded in 2012 by Rahul Anand and Lisa Kennedy, Hopscotch is an online store for baby, kids and maternity products including apparel and shoes.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Tauro Wealth raises seed funding from TracxnLabs
article: Bangalore-based stock market investments platform, Tauro Wealth, has raised an undisclosed amount of seed funding from TracxnLabs and a few other angel investors. Founded in 2015 by IIT Kanpur alumni Harsh Vardhan Singh and Anand Vivek Srivastava, Tauro Wealth provides investors with portfolio ideas at low costs for the Indian stock markets.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SIDBI to raise ₹10k crore 'Stand Up India' fund
article: The Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) will be raising ₹10,000 crore corpus for ‘Stand Up India' fund from the Reserve Bank of India. The fund will be used to refinance the loans extended by the banks to the Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and women entrepreneurs. The 'Stand Up India' scheme was announced by the Centre earlier in January.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon launches 'women only' delivery centres
article: Amazon on Thursday launched 'women only' delivery centres, which will be completely run and managed by women. The company has currently opened a centre in Kerala's Trivandrum, and plans to open more such centres in Kochi and Chennai. Women will also deliver packages in a 2-3 kilometre radius from these centres.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in home rental startup
article: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata has invested an undisclosed amount in home rental startup NestAway. This marks his ninth investment in a startup in 2016 so far. Founded in 2015, the startup turns unfurnished houses into fully furnished apartments and provides them on rent in cities including Bengaluru, Delhi, Gurgaon, Noida, Ghaziabad, Hyderabad and Pune.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Activision Blizzard acquires Candy Crush maker
article: American video games publishing company Activision Blizzard today announced that it has closed its acquisition of Candy Crush game maker King Digital for $5.9 billion. However, King Digital will continue to be led by its CEO Riccardo Zacconi. Activision Blizzard is known for its games including Call of Duty and World of Warcraft.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Juspay raises ₹40 crore in series A funding
article: Bangalore-based mobile payments startup Juspay has raised ₹40 crore in series A round of funding from venture capital firm Accel Partners. BookMyShow founders Ashish Hemrajani, Parikshit Dar and Rajesh Balpande also participated in the round. Founded in 2012 by Vimal Kumar and Ramanathan RV, Juspay had earlier raised an undisclosed amount in angel funding from former Network18 CEO Haresh Chawla.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google invites startups for accelerator program
article: Google has opened applications for startups from India, Brazil and Indonesia to register for its two-week accelerator program 'Launchpad' till March 31 this year. The program, to be held in June, includes all expenses paid trip to Google's campus in Mountain View, six months of support and resources from Google. It also includes $50,000 equity-free funding to selected startups.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jabong appoints former eBay India head as COO
article: Online fashion retailer Jabong on Thursday appointed former eBay India Country Manager B Muralikrishnan as its Chief Operating Officer (COO). Muralikrishnan will work closely with Jabong's largest shareholder Global Fashion Group (GFG) and will be responsible for the company's technology, product and digital marketing functions. This is Jabong's fourth top-level hiring in three months.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Craftsvilla acquires food retailer PlaceofOrigin
article: Online ethnic products retailer Craftsvilla has acquired Bengaluru-based PlaceofOrigin, an online ethnic food retailer in an all equity deal at an undisclosed valuation. Founded in 2014 by Ashish Nichani and Sudarsan Metla Srihari, PlaceofOrigin delivers sweets, snacks and staples across 20 states. Earlier this month, Craftsvilla had acquired Mumbai-based  logistics startup Sendd.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: B2B marketplace OfBusiness raises $5 mn
article: Gurgaon-based B2B e-commerce marketplace OfBusiness has raised $5 million in Series A funding led by Matrix Partners India. Ola Co-founder Bhavish Aggarwal, Quikr Co-founder Pranay Chulet and a clutch of other investors also participated in the round. Founded in 2015, OfBusiness is a business-to-business marketplace for products including manufacturing and construction.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola to create 50,000 jobs in Uttar Pradesh
article: Ola today signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Uttar Pradesh government to create 50,000 jobs in the state in the next five years. Under the MoU, Ola will skill and create entrepreneurial opportunities for both women and men in the state. Ola will also launch its Ola Auto, Ola Share and Ola Shuttle services across the state.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart value marked 27% down by Morgan Stanley
article: Morgan Stanley has marked down its stake in Indian e-commerce giant Flipkart by 27% to  $103.97 per share from $142.24 per share. This brings Flipkart's recently claimed valuation of $15.2 billion reportedly down to $11 billion. Morgan Stanley in 2013 had picked up shares in Flipkart during its Series D funding and currently holds around 2% stake in the startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bengaluru startup makes 'smart' electric scooter
article: Flipkart founders-backed Bengaluru startup Ather Energy today launched a smart electric scooter 'S340', which comes with a touchscreen dashboard. Connected through an app, the dashboard lets driver sync navigation. It has a top speed of 72 kmph and charges up to 80% within 50 minutes. Ather Energy was founded in 2013 by IIT-Madras alumni Tarun Mehta and Swapnil Jain.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SBI launches new branch for e-commerce loans
article: State Bank of India in partnership with Snapdeal has launched a new branch 'SBI e-Smart SME' to provide working capital loans to sellers on e-commerce platforms. Sellers can apply for the loan online on Snapdeal or through the dedicated branch. The bank will use proprietary platform data and information from public domain to assess seller’s creditworthiness for sanctioning of loans.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: IRCTC ties up with OYO Rooms for accomodation
article: Indian Railways subsidiary IRCTC has tied up with online hotel aggregator OYO Rooms under which the hotel inventory of OYO will be displayed on the hotel-booking page of IRCTC. IRCTC and OYO will collectively offer nearly 45,000 rooms, media reports said. Notably, the IRCTC portal witnesses an average 5 to 5.5 lakh bookings a day.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart to shut grocery delivery app 'Nearby'
article: E-commerce giant Flipkart is reportedly shutting down its grocery delivery app 'Nearby' this month, less than five months after the company launched it as a pilot project. The app was launched in October 2015 in Bengaluru to deliver groceries, personal care, health and wellness products. Flipkart is discontinuing the service due to poor customer demand and lack of profit margins.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 500 Startups launches $25 mn fund for South Asia
article: Venture capital seed fund and startup accelerator 500 Startups has launched a $25-million fund '500 Kulfi' for early stage startups in India, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh. It will focus on startups in financial technology, education technology, content, data analytics, SaaS, health and wellness space. 500 Startups funded around 20 Indian startups in 2015 including ZipDial, Instamojo and KartRocket.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Printer that prints videos developed
article: A US startup has developed a $130 printer 'LifePrint', which lets users print videos, Apple Live Photos, Vines and GIFs in 30 seconds. Connected through an app, the printer prints normal photos as well as Augmented Reality photos from both Android and iOS smartphones. The printed pictures come alive when placed in front of the smartphone's camera.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Voonik acquihires men's fashion startup Getsty
article: Online women's fashion retailer Voonik has acquihired men's fashion and apparel platform Getsty. Founded in 2015 by IIT-Kanpur graduates Saurabh Acharya and Ashish Khandelwal, Bengaluru-based Getsty provides personalised shopping experience for men by connecting them to fashion stylists. Notably, Voonik is planning to launch a shopping app for men's fashion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ibibo to raise $250 million from Naspers
article: Online travel company Ibibo Group today announced to raise $250 million from existing investor Naspers, a multinational internet and media group. “Our objective is to solve problems for the transportation and accommodation providers and to connect them to the travellers", said Ashish Kashyap, Founder and CEO of Ibibo Group. Founded in 2007, Ibibio provides travel-related services.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Freedom Smart Labs raises ₹1 cr in seed funding
article: Delhi-based retail solutions provider Freedom Smart Labs has raised around ₹1 crore in seed funding from Kapil Goel, the managing director of retail chain DCS Group. Founded by entrepreneur Yogesh Huja, the company aims at providing IoT solutions in retail through its WiFi-based product Freedom.desi. The solution is currently deployed at 21 malls in and around Delhi-NCR.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Rail Budget 2016: ₹50 cr innovation fund set up
article: Presenting the Railway Budget 2016-17 in the Parliament on Thursday, Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu announced an innovation fund of ₹50 crore for startups and small firms working on technologies to benefit the Indian Railways. Prabhu also said drones will be used for remote monitoring of on-going projects and GPS-based digital displays will be installed in coaches for showing upcoming stations.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart, Amazon penalised for selling medicines
article: Online retailers including Snapdeal, Amazon and Flipkart were penalised by the Maharashtra government for selling medicines online without valid licences. Union Health Minister JP Nadda said that Food and Drug Administration, Maharashtra found the e-tailers "selling or distributing medicines to consumers through internet without valid sales bill and requisite licenses".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zenefits lays off 17% of workforce
article: Cloud-based human resources platform and unicorn startup Zenefits has announced to reduce 17% of its workforce, about 250 employees. The layoffs are largely from the sales division along with a dozen of employees from the recruiting division. “This reduction enables us to refocus our strategy and rebuild in line with our new company values", said David Sacks, Zenefits CEO.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Xiaomi unveils Mi 4s smartphone at MWC
article: China-based startup Xiaomi on Wednesday unveiled a new mid-range smartphone 'Mi 4s' at the Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona. The dual-sim handset is a new version of Mi 4 and runs on Android 6.0 Marshmallow. Priced around ₹17,800, it features a fingerprint sensor, a 5-inch display, 13 MP rear camera, 5 MP front camera and 64 GB in-built memory.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber opens Centre of Excellence in Hyderabad
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber today opened its first Asian Centre of Excellence (CoE) in Hyderabad. The centre will support both riders and drivers of the service through 24-hour support via e-mail, phone and social media. The CoE is a part of an agreement signed between Uber and Telangana government in 2015, where Uber committed to invest $50 million in the state.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber to launch its own digital wallet in India
article: According to reports, Taxi-hailing app Uber is planning to launch its own digital wallet, starting with India. The digital wallet will initially be a closed wallet that will let users pay only for rides hailed through Uber. The wallet would serve as an alternative option to currently available payment options including debit cards, cash, Paytm or Airtel Money.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber launches bike-taxi service in Bangkok
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber on Wednesday launched a motorbike on-demand taxi service 'UberMOTO' in Thailand's capital Bangkok. The service will be available for short trips at the existing Uber app, wherein a motorcycle driver will bring a helmet for the rider. The service is being launched as a pilot in Bangkok, and will be expanded to more locations, the company said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Xiaomi unveils Mi 5 smartphone at MWC
article: China-based startup Xiaomi on Wednesday unveiled its new flagship smartphone Mi 5 in three variants at the Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona. All variants run on Android 6.0 Marshmallow and feature a fingerprint scanner. The lowest variant, priced around ₹21,000, comes with a 5.15-inch display, 16 MP rear camera, 3 GB of RAM and 32 GB of in-built memory.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Home rental platform NoBroker raises $10 million
article: Bengaluru-based home rental platform NoBroker has raised $10 million in Series B funding round led by Beenext and Digital Garage. Other investors like Beenos, Qualgro and existing investor SAIF Partners also participated in the round. Founded by Amit Agarwal and Akhil Gupta in 2014, NoBroker eliminates brokers in residential rental transactions by directly connecting owners with tenants.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flexible LCD screen unveiled at MWC
article: UK-based startup FlexEnable on Monday unveiled a flexible LCD screen that wraps around the wrist, at the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona. The startup uses plastic transistors to create Organic Liquid Crystal Display (OLCD) to achieve a flexible screen. The startup is in talks with hardware partners to launch the fully-fledged wristbands in the next eighteen months.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: ASAP Dash claims to be fastest portable charger
article: An Australia-based startup claims to have developed the world’s fastest phone charger, ASAP Dash, that can recharge a battery of 5,000 mAh in 15 minutes. Sixteen times faster than market standards, the high-capacity, pocket-sized portable charger can reportedly store charge equivalent to a full iPhone 5 charge in 5 minutes. It features a long-lasting battery that allows 1,200 charge cycles.

author: Anupama K
abstract: Telecom Min says Freedom 251 would cost ₹2,300
article: With questions being raised over the ₹251-price of 'Freedom 251', the world's cheapest smartphone, the Telecom Ministry has said that the phone's manufacturing cost would be around ₹2,300. The Indian Cellular Association has worked out the retail price of such a smartphone as ₹4,100. Ringing Bells, the phone's manufacturer, said that the manufacturing cost of the phone is around ₹2,500.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fresh juice startup Raw Pressery raises $4.5 mn
article: Mumbai-based fresh juice startup Raw Pressery has raised $4.5 million in Series B funding round from Sequoia Capital, Saama Capital and DSG Partners. Founded in 2013, Raw Pressery delivers cold-pressed fruit juices and natural health products to home. The startup in February 2015 had raised $1.8 million from Sequoia Capital.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm appoints Shinjini as its payments bank CEO
article: Paytm on Thursday appointed Shinjini Kumar as its payments bank Chief Executive Officer. Currently serving as Director at PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), Kumar is also a former Reserve Bank of India executive. Expected to join the bank in March this year, Kumar will be responsible for all the aspects of the business including revenue and regulatory issues.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Virgin Galactic unveils its new spaceship
article: Richard Branson-owned commercial spaceflight company Virgin Galactic on Friday unveiled its new spaceship 'VSS Unity'. The two-pilot, winged spaceship with a capacity of six passengers will take its passengers on five-minute voyages into the suborbital space at $250,000 a ticket. VSS Unity is a new version of the company's SpaceShipTwo, which crashed during a test flight in 2014.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Govt notifies uniform norms for startups
article: The government has come up with a uniform definition of 'startups', under which an entity   would be considered a startup for up to five years from the date of its registration. Further, its turnover should not exceed ₹25 crore for any of the financial years. Also, entities formed by splitting or reconstructing existing businesses will not be considered as startups.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber losing over $1 billion every year in China
article: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick has said that the taxi-hailing app is facing loss of over $1 billion a year in China due to price war against rival Didi Kuaidi. "We have a fierce competitor that's unprofitable in every city, but they're buying up market share," said Kalanick. Uber and Didi Kuaidi have heavily subsidised fares to gain China's market share.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart mug with adjustable temperature developed
article: A US startup has developed a $129 smart mug 'Ember', which lets users adjust its temperature. While Ember's temperature can be controlled manually or through an app, its contents remain at the set temperature for two hours on the go or all day with its charging coaster. It features a stainless steel inner vessel and til-lit display on the outside.

author: Anupama K
abstract: Freedom 251 maker under Income Tax Dept scanner
article: The Income Tax Department is reportedly looking into the financial structure of Ringing Bells, the manufacturer of 'Freedom 251', the world's cheapest smartphone. Further, the Telecom Ministry has sought clarification from the company for marketing the phone without a Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) certification and has also asked the Uttar Pradesh government to get the firm's credentials.

author: Vishal Singh
abstract: Taskbob raises $4.5 mn in series A funding
article: Mumbai-based home services provider Taskbob has raised $4.5 million in Series A funding round led by IvyCap Ventures. Existing investors Orios and Mayfield also participated in the round. Founded in 2014, Taskbob lets users book and schedule services including driver, cleaning and home repairs. It claims transparency and safety of its services through background check of servicemen.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 'Smart' glove turns hand into musical instrument
article: US-based startup Remidi has developed a smart glove 'T8', which makes music through fingertips, palm and motion of the user's hand. Connected through an app, the glove comes with eight pressure-sensitive sensors that use hand gestures to create and control sound effects. It tracks the intensity of pressure and speed of hand movement to control the tempo of music created.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: UK startup makes smartwatch with modular strap
article: A UK-based startup has developed a smartwatch 'Blocks' with modular strap, which comes with different modules for various functions. The modules perform functions including heart rate tracking, camera, GPS, gesture control, finger identification and flash memory. A user can choose the modules with desired functions to build their own customised smartwatch.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Electric bike that folds in a second developed
article: A US-based startup has developed an electric bike 'Gi FlyBike' priced at $2290, that folds itself within a second. The bike can ride 60 kilometres on a single charge and comes with two full-size 26-inch anti-puncture tyres, USB phone charger, automatic lock and rear lights. Also, all features of the bike can be controlled through a dedicated app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Salesforce acquires machine learning startup
article: One of the most highly valued American cloud computing company, Salesforce on Saturday acquired PredictionIO, a machine learning startup based out of Palo Alto. While PredictionIO's team including its Co-founders will join Salesforce, the company's technology will remain open source and free to use. Salesforce provides cloud technologies to help companies with customer relationship management.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: New Truecaller SDK lets apps verify new users
article: Online telephone directory Truecaller has released a new software development kit (SDK), called TrueSDK, that lets third-party apps sign up new users with their existing Truecaller profile and associated verified phone number. Early access to TrueSDK, released only for Android platform, has been given to 12 Indian apps including Quikr, MobiKwik, redBus and OYO Rooms.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indonesian Go-Jek buys India's C42, CodeIgnition
article: Sequoia Capital-funded Indonesian bike-taxi service Go-Jek today acquired two Indian startups including Bengaluru-based C42 Engineering and Noida-based CodeIgnition for an undisclosed amount. The founding members of both the startups will join Go-Jek's technology leadership. Founded in 2010 by Nadiem Makarim, Go-Jek is a bike-taxi service that also delivers food, courier and grocery in Indonesia.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Startup unveils car that runs on hydrogen
article: British startup Riversimple has unveiled a zero-emission car that runs on hydrogen. Named Rasa, the car functions by passing hydrogen through a small fuel cell, which then forms water and electricity driving four motors inside the vehicle. Rasa has only 18 moving parts and can run for 300 miles on 85 ounces of hydrogen. It is expected to launch in 2018.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: App lets users view Instagram as another person
article: New York-based startup Pressto has launched 'Being', a mobile app that allows users to view Instagram from another person’s eyes. Users can browse the photo-sharing service as it would be seen by a friend or any celebrity given that they have public accounts. The app offers several categories including celebrities, artists, athletes and techies, and lets users track which accounts are trending.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: App that automatically detects car crash made
article: Two Chile-based entrepreneurs, Anibal Madrid and Manuel Ramirez, have created an app 'SOSmart', that automatically detects a car crash. The app uses the smartphone's internal sensors to detect crash and sends exact location of the car to set of contacts. It also includes a panic button for emergencies, a list of nearby hospitals and monitors the car's speed and acceleration.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart pacifier to check baby's temperature made
article: UK-based startup Blue Maestro has developed a smart pacifier named 'Pacif-i' which can measure and monitor a baby's temperature from a range of 30 feet. Connected through an app, it can also record medication during baby's illness and sends alert on the smartphone about its location. Claimed to be medium-sized, the pacifier can be used by babies of all ages.

author: Anupama K
abstract: Railways to tie-up with start-ups for services
article: The Indian Railways is considering introducing online food ordering services, catalogue-based retailing and gaming in trains by partnering with various start-up ventures. This comes as a part of the government's ‘Startup India’ initiative that focuses on the promotion of start-ups. The initiatives are expected to be presented during the upcoming Budget session by Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Flipkart founders, others invest in SigTuple
article: Flipkart founders Sachin and Binny Bansal, Accel Partners and other angel investors have invested an undisclosed amount of seed funding in Bengaluru-based medical technology startup SigTuple. The startup builds products for automated analysis of medical images and data for accurate and efficient diagnosis. SigTuple was founded in 2015 by Tathagato Rai Dastidar, Rohit Kumar Pandey and Apurv Anand.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Freshdesk acquires Pune-based Framebench
article: In its fourth acquisition, cloud-based customer support software Freshdesk has bought Pune-based real time communication startup Framebench for an undisclosed amount. Followed by acquisition, Framebench’s entire team will join Freshdesk. Founded in 2013 by Rohit Agarwal and Vineet Markan, Blume Ventures-backed Framebench lets users share, review and discuss files in real time.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rocket Internet leads $11 mn funds in CupoNation
article: Deals and discounts platform CupoNation has raised $11 million in Series B funding round led by Rocket Internet. Holtzbrinck Ventures, New Enterprise Associates, Silicon Valley Bank and Columbia Lake Partners also participated in the funding round. Founded in 2012, Germany-headquartered CoupoNation lets users get deals and discounts on online shopping in over 20 countries including India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Lenskart to raise $25 mn from World Bank's IFC
article: Eyewear retailer Lenskart is set to raise $25 million from World Bank's private lending arm International Finance Corporation (IFC). The lending arm would also acquire a minority stake in the Delhi-based startup. The online and offline eyewear retailer in November 2015 had raised around $10 million from existing investor TPG Growth.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Buddy raises $500k in pre-Series A funding
article: Student micro-lending platform Buddy today raised $500,000 in a pre-Series A funding round from Blume Ventures, TracxnLabs and other angel investors. Founded in October 2015, Buddy's platform provides short and long term payment plans to college students for buying e-commerce products. Buddy currently has partnerships with Indian e-commerce websites like Flipkart, Amazon, and Snapdeal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes LED t-shirt with customised design
article: Hyderabad-based entrepreneur Ayyappa Nagubandi has made 'Broadcast', a t-shirt that displays customised text and design through LEDs fixed on it. Controlled through an app, the users can customise the design or text on the t-shirt for as many times as they want. Also, the LEDs on the shirt are waterproof, making it easy for the users to wash the t-shirt.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: RentSher raises $300k in seed funding
article: Online rental marketplace RentSher today raised over $300,000 in seed funding from former McKinsey investor Vaibhav Doshi and a clutch of other investors. Founded in 2014, RentSher's platform lets users put their costumes, electronics, books, tools, sport equipment and other products on rent. The startup also provides doorstep pickup and delivery service to the customers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber to create 75,000 jobs in Maharashtra
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber today signed an agreement with the Maharashtra government to generate 75,000 jobs in the state over the next five years. Under the agreement, Uber will train women and people from the marginalised sectors of the society to become micro-entrepreneurs. The move is a part of the government's Make in India initiative.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: iCustomMadeIt raises $4 mn in pre-Series A
article: Customised merchandise startup iCustomMadeIt on Tuesday raised $4 million in pre-Series A funding from Times Group’s Brand Capital, Siddhivinayak Skyscrapers and Dinesh R Challa. Founded in 2013, the Pune-based startup lets users order custom-made products like jewellery, clothes, shoes, bags and other accessories. iCustomMadeIt has so far raised $4.65 million from various funding rounds.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Gaming app Gamezop raises $350k in seed funding
article: Delhi-based gaming app Gamezop on Tuesday raised $350,000 in seed funding led by talent management firm Kwan. Snapdeal’s CPO Anand Chandrasekaran, redBus co-founder Phanindra Sama, Powerhouse Ventures, TracxnLabs also participated in the round. Founded in 2015, Gamezop making playing and sharing games easy by aggregating various games on a single Android app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup develops smart home sensor 'Sense'
article: Silk Labs, a startup co-founded by a former Mozilla CTO has developed a smart home sensor 'Sense', that can learn a user's behaviour and pattern. It uses facial recognition to identify who’s entering the house, then turn on lights, set the thermostat to the desired temperature and play music. Sense can distinguish between people and keeps a tab on pets.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Housejoy acquires fitness app Orobind
article: On-demand home services platform Housejoy has acquired personal fitness app Orobind for an undisclosed amount. As part of the deal, entire Orobind team will join Housejoy. Launched in December 2014, the app lets users order for the services of a personal fitness trainer, wellness or a grooming expert at home. Earlier in February, Housejoy acquired on-demand laundry startup MyWash.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Cross Roads India Assistance acquires MeriCAR
article: New Delhi-based Cross Roads India Assistance (CRIA) has acquired MeriCAR.com for an undisclosed amount. The startup secured funding in two rounds from My First Cheque and Google India's chief Rajan Anandan, respectively. Founded in 2008 by Rakesh Sidana, the startup helps car owners search for car servicing and repair centres within a radius of 20 kilometres.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Amazon to enable sellers set shop in 1 hour
article: Amazon has launched ‘Amazon Tatkal’, a service that will enable small and medium businesses (SMBs) to sell on Amazon.in, in less than 60 minutes. Under this, specially trained Amazon representatives will educate Indian sellers on the benefits of selling online, and help them establish businesses on its platform in real-time. The service will first launch in New Delhi.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AasaanJobs raises $5 million in Series A funding
article: Online recruitment platform AasaanJobs today raised $5 million in a Series A funding round led by Aspada Advisors. Existing investors Inventus Capital Partners and IDG Ventures also participated in the round. Founded in 2013, AasaanJobs provides end-to-end solutions for entry level jobs like data-entry operators and telemarketers. The startup raised $1.5 million in seed funding in January 2015.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Vidooly buys video discovery startup iCouchApp
article: Indian video analytics platform Vidooly today acquired Noida-based video content engagement and discovery startup iCouchApp for an undisclosed sum. As part of the deal, Vidooly will get all the assets and the intellectual property of iCouchApp. Founded in 2014, Vidooly is a YouTube big data marketing and analytics product for content creators, brands & multi channel networks.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Tracxn raises funding from Mohandas Pai, others
article: Analytics firm Tracxn has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from a group of angel investors including Nandan Nilekani, Mohandas Pai, WhatsApp VP Neeraj Arora and Freshdesk CEO Girish Mathrubootham. Founded in 2013, by Abhishek Goyal and Neha Singh, it tracks startups across sectors spanning enterprise infrastructure, edtech, fintech and more. Recently, Tracxn raised funding from Ratan Tata.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: The Viral Fever raises $10 mn from Tiger Global
article: Online entertainment channel The Viral Fever (TVF) has raised $10 million (₹65.6 crore) from Tiger Global Management. The investment was made in TVF owner Contagious Online Media Network, where Tiger Global picked up 25% stake, valuing the company at around ₹270 crore. Founded by Arunabh Kumar, TVF is popular for producing online comedy videos targeting the youth.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Quikr launches app to check condition of mobiles
article: Quikr on Monday launched a new app 'QuikrScanner', that lets users check the condition and quality of pre-owned mobile phones listed on its platform. The app runs up to 20 tests to evaluate an Android phone, including its battery, cameras and network. QuikrScanner also comes embedded with Quikr's mobile app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Myntra re-launches its mobile website
article: Online fashion and lifestyle products retailer Myntra today re-launched its mobile website that lets users buy products from its platform. Last year, Myntra shut down its mobile and desktop sites and switched to the app-only model. However, the platform has decided to stick to its mobile-only approach, and is not considering to re-launch its desktop version.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tata invests in eco-friendly Bollant Industries
article: Ratan Tata has invested an undisclosed amount in Bollant Industries, a Hyderabad-based eco-friendly disposable consumer products manufacturer. This marks Tata's third investment in a non-tech startup including Grameen Capital India and Swasth India. Founded in 2012 by visually impaired Srikanth Bolla, the startup employs over 400 people and more than 60% are differently-abled.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Giphy raises $55 million in Series C funding
article: Search engine for GIF images, Giphy has raised $55 million in Series C funding round led by Lightspeed Venture Partners. Existing investors General Catalyst Partners, RRE, Betaworks, Lerer Hippeau Ventures, CAA and others also participated in the round. The latest funding has reportedly valued Giphy at $300 million. Launched in 2013, Giphy lets users search, discover, and share GIFs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm to end merchant fees for offline merchants
article: Online payments and m-commerce platform, Paytm will remove merchant fees for all wallet transactions that happen offline. When a customer pays a merchant digitally, a charge is levied on the merchant by banks that the merchants usually derive from customers by charging them extra. Paytm users can now scan pre-printed QR codes for making secure payments.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup lets people design their own shoes
article: Tamara Shoes, an Indian startup founded by Anurag Anand and Bhargav P, lets users design their own shoes. Through Tamara's platform, users can choose the type, heel, size, colour, and material of the shoes and place an order. While the shoes take 7-10 days to be made, they reach customers within 2-3 weeks.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Android smart cube with touchscreens developed
article: A Greek startup has developed an Android 6.1 Marshmallow based smart cube 'SmartCubo' with touchscreens, that lets users browse internet, social media, play media files and control apps. Controlled through a dedicated app, it will come with five 3.9-inch touchscreens, 16 MP camera and 16 GB in-built storage. It will allow operation of up to five apps simultaneously.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Home services startup Zimmber acquires FindYahan
article: On demand services marketplace Zimmber today acquired Gurgaon-based 'FindYahan' for an undisclosed amount in a cash and stock deal. FindYahan's five-member core team and two founders, Rachit Mathur and Snehil Khanor will join Zimmber. Founded in 2013, FindYahan is a hyperlocal service that connects users with professionals in lifestyle services like sports, hobbies, food and wellness.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Off-road vehicle that moves on ice developed
article: A Russian startup has made an off-road all-terrain vehicle 'Sherp', priced at $50,000, that moves easily on land, ice and water. The diesel-run vehicle with a 44 horsepower engine achieves speeds of 28 mph on land and 3.7 mph in water. The vehicle can climb obstacles up to 27.5 inches, turns like a tank and comes with self-inflating tyres.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon buys Indian payments startup Emvantage
article: Amazon today acquired Noida-based online payments solution startup Emvantage Payments for an undisclosed sum. As part of the acquisition, the startup's employees will join Amazon's India unit. The deal will reportedly close by the first quarter of 2016. Founded in 2012, Emvantage has developed payment solutions including a payment gateway, mobile wallet and prepaid card solutions, among others.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup develops caffeinated bracelet for energy
article: A Canadian startup has developed a caffeinated bracelet 'Joule', that energises users by  delivering caffeine into their bloodstream. Priced at $29, the bracelet contains a slot where a caffeine patch is inserted. The bracelet works like a substitute to caffeinated beverages like coffee and energy drinks. Provided by the startup, each caffeine patch lasts for about four hours.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup creates wearable fitness device for dogs
article: A US-based startup has created a wearable fitness tracker 'AniFit' for dogs, that tracks the calories, weight and diet. Controlled through a dedicated Android or iOS app, the tracker is tied to the dog's collar. It lets owners set calories loss and weight goals for their dogs. The app also lets the owner maintain a photo-record of the dog's progress.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: YouTube acquires BandPage for $8 million
article: YouTube on Friday acquired BandPage, a startup that lets artists sell concert tickets, merchandise, and exclusive fan experiences, for $8 million. Notably, it had raised a total of $27.6 million. BandPage began as an app to let musicians create a Music tab on their Facebook Page but it lost 90% of its traffic after Facebook shut down these Page apps.

author: Vishal Singh
abstract: Bonhomia raises $1 million in angel funding
article: Delhi-based Indulge Beverages, maker of premium tea and coffee capsules under brand Bonhomia, today raised $1 million in angel funding from high net worth individuals. Existing investors Neeta Mirchandani & Kanwaljit Singh also participated in the round. Founded in 2012 by Kunal Bhagat and Tuhin Jain, Bonhomia makes coffee and tea pods.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: 'Party With a Local 2.0' mobile app launched
article: Amsterdam-based mobile app 'Party With a Local' which connects travellers and locals that want to party launched its new version on Thursday. The app finds locals, travellers and expats nearby and allows them to chat real-time to arrange a meetup or exchange nightlife tips. The company raised $215,000 in its seed round last year.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Paytm gave away ₹588 crore of cashback in 2015
article: During the recently concluded India Digital Summit conducted by IAMAI (Internet and Mobile Association of India), founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma shared that Paytm gave away ₹588 crore of cashback to its customers in 2015. Notably, the company reported a revenue of ₹337 crore in FY 2014-15 with a loss of ₹372 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes nutrition-tracking smart pan
article: A brother-sister duo Rahul Baxi and Prachi Baxi have developed a smart cooking pan 'SmartyPans', that tracks nutrition in real-time and also gives step-by-step cooking instructions. Controlled through a dedicated app, the pan has in-built temperature and weight sensors. It also calculates the calories as the user cooks, and syncs with fitness trackers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber raises $200 million from LetterOne
article: Uber on Friday raised $200 million from LetterOne, a fund headed by Russian billionaire Mikhail Fridman. The recent funding would reportedly help the taxi-hailing app to push further into the emerging markets. Uber in December 2015 was valued more than $60 billion, making it the world's most valuable startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes home guarding smart robot at $7
article: A Chinese startup has developed a $7 home guarding smart robot 'AiJia Pro', that is capable of real-time 360° monitoring of home. The app-controlled 26-inch robot that walks and rotates head, comes with colourful facial expressions, voice recognition, camera, telemonitoring and infrared sensors. On detecting unusual activity at home, the robot raises an alarm and sends alert to the owner.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Snapdeal raises $200 million in funding
article: Online marketplace Snapdeal on Sunday raised $200 million in a fresh round led by Canada's Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan and Singapore-based Brother Fortune Apparel. This round reportedly values Snapdeal between $6.5-$7 billion, up from around $5 billion in August last year after raising $500 million from Alibaba, SoftBank and Foxconn. Till now, Snapdeal has raised around $2 billion in funding.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup creates wireless earbuds for music
article: A Canadian startup has developed wireless earbuds 'Phazon' for listening to music. Controlled through a dedicated mobile app, the earbuds lets users listen to music and receive calls by tapping on them. The earbuds are also compatible with smartwatches and can be located through the mobile app. The startup also claims that a single size earbud fits all.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Startup develops bionic knee brace
article: Canadian startup Spring Loaded Technology has launched a bionic knee brace called Levitation. Claimed to be the world’s first knee brace, it stores kinetic energy when a user bends their knee to give them extra support when they straighten their leg.
