Powered by a mechanical hinge, it is constructed from lightweight carbon fiber, and can also be worn under clothing.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Toppr acquires education startup Manch
article: E-learning platform Toppr on Thursday acquired Manch, a knowledge delivery platform that lets users  obtain competence using the platforms’ in-built analytics and recommendations. This is Toppr's second acquisition in less than a year after acquiring Jodhpur-based EasyPrep. Founded in 2013 by IIT Bombay alumni, Manch offers online adaptive assessments through its training platform.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber to pay $28.5 mn to settle lawsuit by riders
article: Uber on Thursday agreed to pay $28.5 million to settle two lawsuits by its riders alleging the company's $1 "Safe Ride Fee" constitutes false advertising. The complainants argued that the fee's name is misleading and Uber's claim of "industry leading" driver background checks are false. The payout will be divided among 25 million US riders who paid the $1 fee.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes bullet-sized LED flashlight
article: San Francisco-based startup Slughaus has developed a bullet-sized 30 mm long LED flashlight 'Bullet', which is claimed to be the world's smallest LED light ever. Inspired by the 9 mm round, the flashlight is weatherproof and weighs 6 grams. It comes attached with a loop that makes it fit to be carried along with a bunch of keys.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smart dashcam app to prevent accidents created
article: An Israel-based startup has developed a smart dashcam app 'Nexar', which records and documents the road and attempts to prevent accidents through smart warnings. Powered by artificial intelligence, the iOS app helps in collecting all the data and evidence in case of an accident. It also allows detailed reconstruction of an accident based on the iPhone’s sensor readings.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Online brokerage platform RKSV raises $4 million
article: Online stock and share trading platform RKSV today raised $4 million in fresh funding from Kalaari Capital. Kalaari's Managing Director, Vani Kola, has joined the board of the company. The round also saw participation from GVK Davix Technologies and other investors. Founded in 2009, RKSV lets users trade their securities and commodities online.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup launches $39 3D-printing pen for kids
article: Startup 3Doodler has launched a $39 3D-printing pen '3Doodler Start', that lets kids make three-dimensional creations. The pen is designed in a way that makes it safe to touch and bears no hot-points. 3Doodler Start pen is made with eco-friendly plastic material and comes with a set of little stencils called 'DoodleBlocks'.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Govt open to tweaking start-up policy: Sinha
article: The government is open to tweaking its start-up policy for encouraging entrepreneurs to start new companies and provide employment to a larger number of people, Minister of State for Finance Jayant Sinha said on Wednesday. Sinha’s comments come in the backdrop of the new start-up policy unveiled last month being criticised for not having enough insights into the industry.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Next Education acquires education startup InOpen
article: Education technology startup InOpen Technologies was acquired by Hyderabad-based education solutions company Next Education in an all cash deal. Founded in 2009 by Sridhar Iyer and Rupesh Kumar Shah, InOpen serves educational content for students, in eight local languages and two international languages. InOpen will help Next Education augment its computer science portfolio.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber updates app for hearing impaired drivers
article: Uber has updated its app in India for drivers who are hearing impaired or are hard of hearing. It brings a special switch for such drivers, which informs the customer about the driver's hearing imparity. The customers in this situation need to send their pickup instructions through text and their destination through an additional screen popped up by the app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup launches app to find people to cuddle
article: A US-based startup has launched a mobile app 'Spoonr' that lets users find people who are ready to cuddle based on their location. On receiving a cuddle request, a user needs to start chatting within 60 minutes of receiving the request, else the request gets cancelled. The app also gives live updates of walking directions of users meeting to cuddle.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in Bengaluru-based SnapBizz
article: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata has invested an undisclosed amount in Bengaluru-based retail technology provider SnapBizz. This marks his eighth investment in a startup in 2016 so far. SnapBizz in January 2016 raised $7.2 million in Series A funding. Founded in 2013, SnapBizz provides technology solutions to address the business needs of FMCG brands, retailers, consumers and distributors.

author: Tanaya Singh
abstract: Duo turns used flowers to eco-friendly products
article: Ankit Agrawal and Karan Rastogi, two friends from Kanpur, have started a venture called 'Helpusgreen' which turns the disposed flowers in religious shrines into bio-fertilisers and lifestyle products. The duo picks up flowers from different places of worship every day. According to them approximately 80 lakh tons of waste flowers are dumped into Indian rivers every year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Cube26 partners Tinder for alerts on LED bulb
article: Technology startup Cube26 on Friday tied up with dating app Tinder for its notifications on smart LED bulb IOTA Lite. Controlled through a dedicated Android or iOS app, the bulb's user can choose a specific bulb colour to notify about matches on Tinder. The smart bulb connects into the existing light fixture without any extra hub or hardware.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: RailYatri to address health emergencies in train
article: Indian startup RailYatri on Thursday updated its app to help passengers in medical emergencies during train journeys. The latest update available on the Android app gives passengers a list of hospitals on their train route. It also provides directions of the hospitals from a station and contact numbers of hospitals and ambulance services.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: US startup launches app to rent a friend
article: A US-based startup has launched a mobile app 'Ameego' that allows users to rent friends (Ameegos) on an hourly basis. Ameegos are paid directly by their guests after booking is complete and the wage is negotiated between the Ameego and their guest before meeting. Currently, the app is live in San Francisco and New York.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Amazon sets up dedicated 'Make in India' stores
article: Multinational e-commerce major Amazon has set up exclusive 'Make in India' stores on its India and US websites, which will feature products made in the country, the company said on Saturday. The e-stores will showcase products sold by more than 6,000 retailers across the country. Notably, this comes in the backdrop of the 'Make in India' week starting today.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Govt plans capital goods sector 'startup centre'
article: The government has decided to set up a dedicated 'start-up centre' for the capital goods industry, the Ministry of Heavy Industries and Public Enterprises announced on Monday. The centre will reportedly provide technical and financial resources to promising startups in the manufacturing sector. The ministry will also launch a technology fund to ease technology acquisition and transfer.

author: Vishal Singh
abstract: GOQii raises funding from Edelweiss
article: Mumbai-based wearable tech startup GOQii has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from the venture capital arm of Edelweiss. The latest funding has reportedly valued the startup at ₹300-400 crore. Founded in February 2014 by Vishal Gondal, GOQii is a smart wearable that helps users in tracking steps, sleep and any physical activity.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Affimity raises $1.2 million in angel funding
article: Bengaluru-based social networking platform Affimity today raised $1.2 million in angel funding from Silicon Valley angel investors and founders. Affimity is a social platform that lets users join specific channels and connect to people with similar interests. The startup was founded in 2015 by Ramana Venkata, Amar Singh and Parveen Mittal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: FranklyMe shuts down its overall operations
article: Noida-based video micro-blogging platform FranklyMe has reportedly shut down its overall operations. The reason behind the shut down is speculated to be Matrix Partners-backed FranklyMe's inability to raise fresh funds from new investors. Founded in 2014 by  Nikunj Jain and Abhishek Gupta, FranklyMe has fired all employees and the founders are currently helping their employees to find new jobs.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in Invictus Oncology
article: Delhi-based biotechnology startup Invictus Oncology today raised an undisclosed amount from Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata in Series A funding round. This marks Tata's seventh investment in an Indian startup this year. Founded in 2013, the startup is focused on discovering cures for cancer and development of an anti-cancer drug.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rocket Internet backed Tripda may shut down
article: According to reports, Rocket Internet backed carpooling platform Tripda may shut down its overall operations. Tripda, which failed to secure Series B funding from an unnamed US-based VC, will issue an official statement in this regard later this week. Launched in 2014, Tripda offers carpooling services in 13 countries and started its India operations in November 2014.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 11 Kickstarter films got Oscars nomination
article: Kickstarter on Tuesday shared various facts related to its platform, including that 11 films crowdfunded on Kickstarter were nominated for the Oscars. While the 'Music' category amounted for the largest number of funding campaigns, four creators on Kickstarter won the Grammy award. Further, four music creations funded on Kickstarter have been nominated for the 58th Annual Grammy Awards this year.

author: Vishal Singh
abstract: Capzest raises $200k in seed funding
article: Peer-to-peer lending startup Capzest has raised $200,000 in seed funding from Lion Ventures and other individual investors. Capzest is a digital lending platform that partners with banks and non-banking financial companies to provide personal loans and business loans to small and medium-sized enterprises. Capzest was founded in 2015 by IIT Kharagpur graduates Sayantan Sarkar and Rohan Adlakha.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mukesh Bansal quits Flipkart
article: Mukesh Bansal, Flipkart's Head of Commerce and Advertising and Myntra's Co-founder, has quit Flipkart and will leave the company by April, 2016. Ankit Nagori, Flipkart's Chief Business Officer, has also resigned and is scheduled to leave the company by May, 2016. Both Bansal and Nagori have quit the company to start their own respective ventures.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: OYO Rooms buys rival Zostel's Zo Rooms
article: SoftBank-backed hotel aggregator OYO Rooms has reportedly acquired Tiger Global backed rival Zostel's Zo Rooms in an all-stock deal, as per SoftBank's earnings report. While the founders of Zo Rooms have quit the company, about 100 employees from Zo Rooms and Zostel have been outplaced in other firms. OYO Rooms was founded by Ritesh Agarwal in 2012.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup develops glowing plants
article: A US startup has developed glowing plants that provide natural light without electricity. The glowing plant uses DNA from luminous living organisms like fireflies and other bacteria. These DNAs are collected and imbibed into real plants which glow in the dark. These plants are made using synthetic biology and a special software called Genome Compiler.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Zomato breaks-even in India, key markets abroad
article: Gurgaon-based restaurant search service Zomato on Monday announced that it has achieved operational break-even in India and other key markets including the UAE and Indonesia. Reportedly, the company is set to start its funding round for $200 million in April. Zomato currently operates in 23 countries including the US and Britain and has raised $225 million from investors so far.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: IRCTC ties up with tea cafe chain 'Chaayos'
article: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) on Monday tied-up with tea cafe chain 'Chaayos' to deliver tea and snacks to train passengers at their seats. The facility will initially be available only for trains at the New Delhi station. The orders can be made either through the IRCTC app or catering website, or through a dedicated toll-free number.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AngelList raised $163 mn for startups in 2015
article: Online platform for startup fundraising and hiring, AngelList claimed to have raised $163 million for 441 startups in 2015, a 56% increase compared to the funds raised in 2014. About 40% of these deals were private rounds, amounting to $89 million. It also claimed doubling of the number of active candidates and jobs matched.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jabong's largest warehouse gutted in fire
article: Online fashion retailer Jabong's biggest warehouse outside Gurgaon in Pataudi, caught major fire on Monday night. The fire was reportedly caused by short-circuit of electric wires and took over 25 fire tenders to settle. While there were no human casualties, the fire caused severe damage to the goods and almost destroyed the warehouse.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Israeli startup makes smart pen 'Phree'
article: Israel-based startup OTM Technologies has developed a smart mobile input pen 'Phree', that makes any surface writable by securing the penned information. Controlled through a dedicated app, Phree connects to all devices including phone, tablet, laptop and lets users receive and send text messages through an integrated touchscreen. Phree comes with a special case that also acts as a charger.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Amazon ends its return policy for mobile phones
article: Amazon on Sunday ended its return policy for mobile phones in India. Further, buyers will now only be able to avail replacements if the product is defective, damaged or missing, within 10 days of delivery. This was reportedly done because buyers were abusing the return policy citing the “no longer needed” option and availing full refund for a product.

author: Vishal Singh
abstract: Weddingz raises funds from Sixth Sense Ventures
article: Online marketplace for wedding venues and vendors, Weddingz has reportedly raised an undisclosed amount in pre-Series A funding round from Sixth Sense Ventures. Founded in 2015 by Sandeep Lodha, Mumbai-based Weddingz connects customers with wedding service providers. The portal also runs an e-commerce portal that offers bridal dress, jewellery and footwear among others.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: PepperTap shuts down operations in six cities
article: On-demand grocery delivery startup PepperTap has reportedly shut down operations in six cities namely Ahmedabad, Chandigarh, Mumbai, Kolkata, Chennai and Jaipur. Also, the startup has laid off around 400 employees, which mainly include delivery men across these six cities. PepperTap in September 2015 had shut operations in Agra and Meerut due to non-acceptance in the markets.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Platform to meet new people created
article: Two Paris-based youth Sarah Marga and Yoann Lopez have made an online platform 'Happenstance', that lets users meet random new people around the world through exchange of e-mails. Happenstance users need to fill a 10-question form about their likes and interests. Based on this information, the platform every month connects users to a person from anywhere in the world.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Anti-colonialism failed in India: Andreessen
article: Venture Capitalist, Facebook board member Marc Andreessen stirred controversy today by tweeting "Anti-colonialism has been economically catastrophic for the Indian people for decades. Why stop now?". This was in reference to TRAI's decision barring Facebook's Free Basics. He later deleted the tweet saying, "I hereby withdraw from all future discussions of Indian economics or politics. Carry on".

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in B2B market Moglix
article: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata has invested an undisclosed sum in business-to-business (B2B) e-commerce company Moglix. Founded in 2015 by former Google employee Rahul Garg, Moglix aims at allowing procurement of industrial products across various countries. The marketplace for business and industrial supplies had previously raised $1.5 million from Accel Partners and Jungle Ventures.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Xpressbees raises $8 mn from SAIF, Vertex
article: E-commerce logistics firm Xpressbees today raised about $8 million from SAIF Partners and Vertex Ventures, the venture arm of Singapore government’s investment fund Temasek. Pune-based Xpressbees is also the logistics support provider for online babycare retailer FirstCry. It claims to deliver 60,000 shipments every day and also has other e-commerce players as its partners including Snapdeal.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Foodpanda partners McD for online food delivery
article: Online food delivery platform Foodpanda has partnered with Hardcastle Restaurants to deliver food from McDonald’s in west and south India. Hardcastle Restaurants owns and operates McDonald’s chain of restaurants in the regions. This is the first time that people will be available to access the chain's menu through an online food aggregator, Foodpanda India CEO Saurabh Kochhar said.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Inshorts wins IAMAI’s Best Innovative App award
article: Mobile news app Inshorts, which provides news summaries in 60 words, today won the IAMAI (Internet And Mobile Association of India) 'Best Innovative Mobile App of the year' award. The app, launched on September 4, 2013 by Azhar Iqubal, Anunay Arunav and Deepit Purkayastha, is currently the highest rated news app on Play Store.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rentomojo appoints Munjal Dhamecha as CTO
article: Bengaluru-based rental marketplace Rentomojo today appointed Munjal Dhamecha as its first Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Dhamecha was earlier working with house renting portal Grabhouse as its CTO and carries prior experience in companies like JustDial and Reliance Communications. Founded in 2014, Rentomojo lets users rent furniture, home appliances, bikes and kitchen utilities.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Paytm allocates ₹400 crore for its Payments Bank
article: Paytm has allocated ₹400 crore to speed up the launch of its Payments Bank, that was earlier supposed to launch in March 2016. Paytm also plans to hire 3,000 people to run the bank, and has roped in ex-Airtel executive Saurabh Sharma to join the company as VP. Payment Banks aim at providing services to labourers, low-income households and small businesses.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Stylofie raises funding from IDC's Jaideep Mehta
article: Beauty and wellness services marketplace Stylofie on Tuesday raised fresh funding from Jaideep Mehta, Managing Director, South Asia IDC. Mehta will also join the startup's board of directors. Founded in 2015, Stylofie's platform lets users discover and book beauty and wellness services. In January 2016, Stylofie acquired Hyve, a mobile-only salon and spa booking platform.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: Luxury brand for pet products gets seed funding
article: Delhi-based luxury brand for pet products, Heads Up For Tails (HUFT), has raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding led by individual investors from USA, Singapore and India. HUFT was started in 2008 by Rashi Sanon Narang, an alumna of London School of Economics.  Currently, HUFT is a 15-member team with over 1,000 products listed on the platform.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: Alibaba looks to buy stake in Flipkart: Report
article: China’s Alibaba Group (investor in Paytm and Snapdeal) is reportedly looking to acquire a stake in Flipkart. The deal will materialise if Flipkart offers a discount to Alibaba on its current valuation of $15 billion, as per sources cited by Mint. It is also in talks with Snapdeal to give a discount on its current valuation of $6.5 billion.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: BigBasket revenue at ₹178 crore in FY 14-15
article: Hyperlocal grocery delivery startup BigBasket reported a revenue of ₹178 crore against a loss of ₹61 crore in FY 14-15. The revenues increased by 2.5 times as compared to FY 13-14. Founded in 2011 by Hari Menon, VS Sudhakar, Vipul Parekh and Abhinay Choudhari, BigBasket has reportedly raised around ₹695 crore till date.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm ties up with Indian Oil for petrol payment
article: Online payments and m-commerce platform, Paytm today tied up with Indian Oil to let its users pay for petrol through its mobile wallet. The news was shared by Vijay Shekhar Sharma, Paytm Founder and CEO, on his Facebook timeline. Currently, the service is reportedly available at select Indian Oil outlets in Delhi.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zomato's Chief Product Officer quits
article: Restaurant search and discovery platform, Zomato's Chief Product Officer Tanmay Saksena has resigned from his post a year after he joined the company. Saksena earlier served as Zomato's Global Business Head and got promoted as the Chief Product Officer in January. “Tanmay was one of our best people, and we are sad to see him go", said Zomato's spokesperson.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kalaari Capital launches seed funding programme
article: Venture capital firm Kalaari Capital, which has stakes in unicorns like Flipkart and Snapdeal, recently launched a new seed funding and incubation initiative called 'Kstart'. Under the initiative, Kalaari Capital plans to release $20 million among 40 startups in the next two years. Kstart will also incubate about five startups every quarter.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup develops smart mattress cover 'Luna'
article: US-based startup Eight has created a smart mattress cover 'Luna', that manages bed's temperature and tracks the user's sleep. Controlled through a dedicated app, Luna learns the user's regular bedtime and sets the bed to a comfortable temperature that helps in falling asleep faster. It also records sleep, heart rate and breathing rate and comes with an in-built alarm.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Uber partners with Labour Ministry
article: Uber signed an agreement with Union Ministry of Labour and Employment on Thursday to boost entrepreneurial ecosystem. As a part of the agreement, drivers who want to join the Uber fleet will have to sign up via National Career Service (NCS). NCS is an online platform launched to connect career counsellors, placement agencies and employers with people looking for jobs.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Uber delists 60 drivers in Pune
article: Taxi-hailing service Uber has delisted at least 60 drivers in Pune for doing trips without passengers. The said drivers would start a ghost ride without any real passengers, drive their cabs anywhere between two and eight kilometers, and end the trip. They would reportedly do this to receive their full weekly incentives and reimbursements from Uber.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Nexus, Blume back insurance provider Turtlemint
article: Online insurance seller Turtlemint on Friday raised an undisclosed amount of funding led by Nexus Venture Partners and Blume Ventures. Turtlemint was founded in 2015 by Dhirendra Mahyavanshi, Anand Prabhudesai and Kunal Shah. The startup offers advising, renewal and comparison services for insurance policies relating to cars, two-wheelers and health.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Deals, funding to Asian startups slow in Q4 2015
article: According to CB Insights data, funding to Asia-based startups slowed down to $9.7 billion in Q4 of 2015 from $14.2 billion recorded in Q3 of 2015. Also, deals completed in Q4 of 2015 dipped to 346 against 398 completed deals in the previous quarter. Top investment rounds included funding raised by ride-sharing app Ola Cabs and delivery app Dada.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bill Gates, Pai invest in Capria Accelerator
article: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates and Aarin Capital's Ranjan Pai and TV Mohandas Pai have invested an undisclosed amount in Capria Accelerator. Crystal Springs Foundation, Lemelson Foundation and Unitus Labs also participated. Founded by Dave Richards and Will Poole, Capria is a US-based venture investment fund that invests in early-stage fund managers accepted into its accelerator program.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: IndianRoots launches fashion accelerator
article: NDTV’s ethnic e-commerce venture, IndianRoots has launched fashion business accelerator in partnership with 6Degree. Situated in Goa & Gurgaon, the centre has facilities including cutting tables, steam iron, machines, pattern master and tailors, among others. The stipulated duration of incubation at the centre is six months, and is extendable to one year on review.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Sistema JSFC to invest $50 mn in Indian startups
article: Russian conglomerate Sistema Joint Stock Financial Corporation (JSFC) has floated a proprietary $50 million Asia Fund to support Indian startups. The fund would be a Singapore-registered fund advised by Insitel Services, the wholly-owned Indian unit of Sistema JSFC. The potential ticket-size for investments in these startups is reportedly $1 million each.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Matchmaking app for differently-abled launched
article: Two Mumbai graduates, Kalyani Khona and Shankar Srinivasan have launched 'Inclov', an Android matchmaking app for the differently-abled. While the app is open to everyone, the app focuses on matching the differently-abled, dwarf community and divorcees. The app finds a match on the basis of age, location, lifestyle, disability type, medication and cure availability of the users.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kae Capital raises $30 million in second fund
article: Mumbai-based venture capital firm Kae Capital today raised $30 million as a part of its second fund from existing and new investors. The proceeds of the latest fundraising will be spent in the next three to five years. Also, Kae Capital will double the ticket size of investments to $1 million as compared to the previous amount of $500,000.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Teen creates smart ring for Parkinson's patients
article: US-based teen Utkarsh Tandon has made a 3D-printed smart ring called 'OneRing', that identifies and monitors Parkinson's motor symptoms. Available in three sizes, the ring generates daily patient reports and helps doctors to prescribe medications more accurately. The results of data collected by the ring can be viewed on a smartphone through a dedicated iOS app.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Snapdeal not to renew Aamir's contract: Reports
article: According to media reports, e-commerce company Snapdeal has decided not to renew Aamir Khan’s contract as the brand ambassador of the online marketplace. Under the one-year contract, that ends later in February, Khan endorsed Snapdeal’s recent ‘Dil ki Deal’ campaign. Notably, this is the second endorsement contract Khan has lost after the government’s Incredible India campaign.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Mohandas Pai leads seed funding in Magic Crate
article: Bengaluru-based early childhood learning startup Magic Crate has received an undisclosed amount of seed funding led by TV Mohandas Pai and Aarin Capital. The startup was founded in 2014 by Viswanathan Ramakrishnan and Karthik Lakshman. Magic Crate offers activity kits based on science, arts, games and role play for children aged between four to eight years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Been thinking about building electric jet: Musk
article: Elon Musk, the Founder of SpaceX, Tesla and PayPal might take up building an electric plane as his next project. “I have been thinking about the vertical takeoff and landing electric jet a bit more. I think I have something that might close”, Musk said. “I’m quite tempted to do something about it”, Musk added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: CarDekho raises $15 million from Google, others
article: Auto portal CarDekho reportedly raised $15 million on Friday  in a funding round led by Google Capital and some existing investors. Hillhouse Capital also participated in the funding round. Founded in 2008 by Amit Jain and Anurag Jain, CarDekho's platform helps users with car research, finance, insurance, used cars and other aspects of car buying and selling.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: AR startup hires former SpaceX, Qualcomm execs
article: An augmented reality (AR) smart helmet startup Daqri today hired former SpaceX, Virgin Group and Qualcomm executives. Qualcomm's Roy Ashok will be appointed as the Chief Product Officer, Virgin Group's Patrick Alo as the Chief Marketing Officer and SpaceX's Mike Lynch as the Chief Human Potential Officer. The startup's AR helmet provides important information of the users' surroundings.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: 1 bn users yet no 'Crunchie': WhatsApp Founder
article: After achieving one billion users on WhatsApp, Founder Jan Koum on Tuesday tweeted about not getting any Crunchie award till date. Comparing his situation to Leonardo DiCaprio who hasn't won an Oscar till now, Koum tweeted "one billion users and not a single Crunchie award. Leo, I feel your pain brother...". TechCrunch awards Crunchies to recognise startups and technology innovations.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Gingercrush raises $1 million in pre-Series A
article: On-demand retail platform Gingercrush on Friday raised $1 million in pre-Series A funding round led by Saha Fund. Zia Mody (AZB Partners), Mumbai Angels, Ananda Kallugadde of NeoAngels, Rakesh Desai and Rakesh Malhotra (SAR Group) also participated in the round. Founded in 2015, Gingercrush lets users instantly shop, create and customise products.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Ratan Tata ties up with University of California
article: Ratan Tata’s investment firm, RNT Associates has partnered with the University of California  (UC Investments) to jointly fund startups over the next 10 years in India. “The joint view is to encourage entrepreneurship," said Tata. "We haven’t pre-judged what we are going to do, or the size of investments but we are looking to invest in young entrepreneurs", he added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes smartphone with 464 GB of storage
article: US-based startup Saygus has developed a $650 smartphone 'V Squared' with 400 GB of expandable storage space and 64 GB in-built memory. The dual-sim, waterproof handset runs on Android 5.1.1 Lollipop and features a 5-inch full HD display, 3 GB RAM, 21 MP rear and 13 MP front camera. It comes with Qualcomm's 2.5 Ghz Quad Core Snapdragon processor.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Delhi-based LiveNutriFit raises seed funding
article: Delhi-based weight loss coaching platform LiveNutriFit has raised an undisclosed amount of seed funding from Omaxe CEO Mohit Goel, Magppie Retail MD Vinod Jain and other angel investors. Founded in 2015 by Gaurav Jalote and Anjali Hooda Sangwan, the platform through its website and Android app gives users personalised meal plans. It also provides phone and e-mail consultation facility.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon launches grocery service in Bengaluru
article: Amazon has launched its grocery service with the name 'Amazon Now' in select areas of Bengaluru. Currently available through an Android app, the service lets users order everyday essentials from their nearby stores and delivers them within two hours. Users can also opt for scheduled delivery of their orders through the app between 10am to 10pm.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Perfumery raises $30k in seed funding
article: Perfumery, an e-commerce platform that sells fragrances, has raised $30,000 in its seed round of funding led by Delhi-based Oranda Global and other angel investors. Founded in August 2015 by Mohit Khatri, Tushar Patel and Shaurya Kiran, it provides specialised sampling services for high end luxury fragrances. The company launched its website in January 2016.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Craftsvilla acquires Sendd for $4.5 million
article: Ethnic e-tailer Craftsvilla reportedly acquired Kae Capital-backed Sendd for about $4.5 million on Monday. The core team, along with the founders, will join Craftsvilla. As part of the deal, Kae will get a small stake in Craftsvilla. Founded by Nav Agrawal, Sumeet Wadhwa & Sargun Singh in April 2015, Sendd is an on-demand shipping services startup.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Mazkara raises $1 million in seed funding
article: Salon and spa discovery platform Mazkara raised $1 million in seed funding from Dubai-based Dunamis Ventures on Monday. Launched in 2015 by Prasanjeet Roy and Mohammad Ali Akmal, Mazkara lets users discover and book salons and spas in Dubai and Pune. Prior to this funding round, the startup secured $500,000 in angel funding from Dubai-based PE investors.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Ohlala launches its paid dating service in NYC
article: On-demand escort dating service Ohlala launched its app in the New York City on Wednesday. The working of the app requires details and requirements from the male customers following which the female users in that area gets 21 minutes to accept. This service has been running in Germany since August last year and has facilitated over 25,000 customers.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Uber unveils redesigned logo, branding
article: Uber on Tuesday unveiled a complete redesign of its logo and branding to focus on 'The Bit', a square at the center of the logo, to highlight their technology. The app will now have region-specific colours to replace the old stark black-on-white appearance. This redesign is aimed at improving brand recognition across Uber's varied services after its expansion.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Mu Sigma appoints Ambiga Dhiraj as new CEO
article: Data analytics company Mu Sigma, on Wednesday appointed Ambiga Dhiraj as its CEO, making her the first woman CEO of an Indian Unicorn. Ambiga, who was the former COO in the company has replaced her husband and founder-chairman Dhiraj Rajaram. Rajaram will be relocating to the US but will continue in full-time capacity with the company and remain as chairman.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Canadian startup develops smart robot dog 'CHiP'
article: A Canadian startup has developed a smart robot dog 'CHiP', that is trainable, playable and recognises its owner. Controlled through a dedicated app, the robot comes with a smart ball for playing and a smart band that helps it identify its owner. User can personalise the robot's behaviour and teach new tricks that makes one robot different from others.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Oust Labs raises seed funding from Mohandas Pai
article: Education technology startup Oust Labs raised an undisclosed amount of seed funding on Monday from TV Mohandas Pai. Founded by Shrikant Latkar in 2015, the startup is currently in trials at select locations in India including Bangalore, Belagavi and Pune. It allows students to practice and learn Math, Science and Social Sciences through mobile app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: RBI eases cross-border transactions for startups
article: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Tuesday announced a slew of regulatory changes to ease cross-border transactions relating to startups. The rules enable startups to receive foreign venture capital investment irrespective of their sector. RBI further said that it is considering issuance of innovative FDI instruments like convertible notes by startups.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Microsoft acquires SwiftKey for $250 million
article: Microsoft on Wednesday acquired London-based startup SwiftKey in a reported $250 million all-cash deal. Founded in 2008, SwiftKey's Android and iOS app uses artificial intelligence to predict text and learn user's writing style. As reported by Financial Times, SwiftKey founders Jon Reynolds and Ben Medlock will each make upwards of $30 million from the buyout.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Urban Ladder appoints Sanjay Gupta as CMO
article: Online furniture and home decor startup Urban Ladder on Tuesday roped in former Marico executive Sanjay Gupta as its Chief Marketing Officer (CMO). A company statement said that Gupta will lead marketing, branding and content operations among others. Gupta has earlier worked with Accenture Plc and consulting firm Purple Squirrel Consulting LLP.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Housejoy acquires online laundry startup MyWash
article: Bangalore-based Housejoy acquired online laundry services startup MyWash on Wednesday for an undisclosed amount. This is Housejoy's first acquisition after it raised about $22.5 million led by Amazon. Launched in January 2015 by Arjun Kumar & Sunil Goel, Housejoy provides on-demand home services in Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru, Hyderabad & Chennai.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: YouWeCan to launch startup incubator
article: Cricketer Yuvraj Singh’s YouWeCan Ventures, is planning to start an incubator in Gurgaon and Bengaluru. The fund will start with providing office space, internet connections and mentors. The mentor network will reportedly include Vijay Shekhar Sharma of Paytm and Rahul Yadav, Co-founder and former CEO of Housing. It has funded startups including Moovo, Edukart, Cartisan, Vyomo and JetSetGo.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Some startup valuations are pricey: Ratan Tata
article: In an interview to Tata Review, Tata's internal publication, Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata said that some startup valuations are pricey. Tata added that his startup investments are aimed at enabling goods and services to reach a large section of the population. In the past two years, Tata has backed more than 25 Indian startups.

author: Amritanshu Anand
abstract: Cisco acquires Jasper Technologies for $1.4 bn
article: Cisco on Thursday announced the acquisition of Jasper Technologies, developers of an Internet of Things (IoT) cloud platform for $1.4 billion. Founded in 2004, Jasper serves over 3500 enterprises across 100 countries. It had previously raised $205 million in six rounds from investors including Sequoia Capital, Temasek Holdings and Benchmark.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup creates backpack with WiFi, USB ports
article: A US startup has created a smart bulletproof backpack with Wi-Fi connectivity, six USB ports and inbuilt speakers. Connected through a dedicated Android and iOS app, the bag also contains an anti-theft system. With hidden and secret compartments, the backpack has over 50 compartments including specific pockets for notebook, phone and camera.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Magic Leap raises $793.5 million led by Alibaba
article: US-based virtual reality technology company Magic Leap on Tuesday raised $793.5 million in Series C funding round led by Alibaba. Existing investors Google and Qualcomm Ventures also participated in the round. Jack Ma, Founder of the Alibaba Group, has joined the board of Magic Leap. The recent funding has reportedly valued Magic Leap at $4.5 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapchat's valuation cut by 2% by Fidelity
article: Snapchat's valuation was cut by 2% in December 2015 by Fidelity Investments, one of the biggest investors in the company. According to a public filing, Fidelity wrote down its $17.4 million share in Snapchat to $17 million. This marked the second write down by Fidelity in Snapchat in three months.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes hand-sized washing device 'Dolfi'
article: A German startup has created a hand-sized washing device 'Dolfi', that cleans clothes by using ultrasonic technology. The electricity-run device needs to be dropped in a sink filled with water between dirty clothes soaked in detergent and water. Priced at $109, the device cleans the clothes in 30-40 minutes and claims to consume 80% less energy than a washing machine.

author: Aparna Mishra
abstract: Sequoia Capital raises $920 million fund
article: Sequoia Capital raised $920 million fund on Tuesday to invest majorly in Indian startups along with South East Asian companies. This is the biggest fundraising by a VC fund for India-specific investments. With this, Sequoia's asset value has gone over $3 billion. Sequoia has invested in over 90 Indian startups including OYO Rooms, Practo, FreeCharge, Craftsvilla and Zomato.

author: Vishal Singh
abstract: Snapdeal pilots home-services in 4 cities
article: Snapdeal has been running a pilot for the past 40 days in its home-services category across four cities - Delhi, Gurgaon, Mumbai and Pune. The move is aimed at expanding its home-services category which currently has vendors across carpentry, plumbing, pest control and installation services. As of now, Snapdeal's service providers include Jack On Block, EasyFix, Hicare and Terminix SIS.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart invests ₹666 cr in logistics arm EKart
article: Flipkart has invested ₹666 crore in its logistics arm EKart, which was bought back from WS Retail in September 2015. This is Flipkart's second investment in seven months into the logistics business created with the name 'Instakart Services'. In July 2015, Flipkart's Instakart Services received ₹127 crore from Singapore-based Klick2Shop Logistics Services International.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters raises seed funding
article: Online coffee retailer Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters on Monday raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding led by Snow Leopard Ventures. Bold Ventures also participated in the round. Founded in 2012 by Matt Chitharanjan and Namrata Asthana, the Delhi-based startup through its online platform takes orders for roasted coffee and delivers it the next day to its consumers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Wipro leads $4 mn Series A funding in Altizon
article: Pune-based Internet of Things startup Altizon Systems on Monday raised $4 million in Series A funding round led by Wipro Ventures. By investing $1.4 million, Wipro Ventures picked up a minority stake in Altizon. Lumis Partners and existing investors The Hive and Infuse Ventures also participated in the round. Founded in 2013, Altizon lets companies build their own IoT product.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup creates app-controlled LED shoes
article: US startup Violettas has created app-controlled LED shoes 'Sync Footwear', that changes colours and syncs the lights to live music. It consists of a circuit board, lights and rechargeable batteries hidden in the sole. Through the app, users can customise the colour of their shoes and sync the music playlist in their phones with the shoes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fruit-flavoured cup for drinking water developed
article: A US startup has developed a fruit-flavoured cup 'The Right Cup' that tricks the user's brain to think that the plain water is flavoured. The Right Cup’s natural fruit aroma combined with a patented sweet taste technology, gives the brain a perception that the user is drinking fruit-flavoured water. It is available in five flavours including orange, apple and peach.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Hyderabad-based 50K Ventures backs CodingLabs
article: CodingLabs has reportedly raised an undisclosed sum from Hyderabad-based 50K Ventures on Thursday. The investment was led by Vineel Nalla, CEO of NBOS Technologies & Co-founder of 50K Ventures. Founded in 2015, CodingLabs is a portal for aspiring technologists to showcase coding skills by solving coding challenges on the portal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup develops gravity defying shoe
article: US startup Moonshine Crea has developed a unisex shoe 'MoonWalker' that defies gravity and gives the user a feeling of walking on the Moon's surface. The moon-walking sensation comes from within the two layers of the shoe which consists of magnets placed with opposite poles that are repulsive. The repulsion makes the person wearing the shoe feel light.

author: Sandeep Banga
abstract: Enterprise Storage raised $1.1 bn in '15: Tracxn
article: According to analytics firm Tracxn's report on the Enterprise Storage space, the sector raised a total funding of $1.1 billion, as the market continues to see a steady flow of investments. 2013 witnessed the sector's highest funding total at $1.39 billion. Lightspeed Venture Partners, Intel Capital and New Enterprise Associates are among the active investors in the space.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Alibaba to sell Meituan-Dianping stake at $900mn
article: Alibaba has announced to sell its stake in on-demand service provider Meituan-Dianping for around $900 million, as reported by The Wall Street Journal. Alibaba decided to sell its stake after the merger of Meituan and Dianping, that brought in its rival Tencent Holdings as a shareholder. Notably, the merged entity had raised $3.3 billion in the largest funding round ever.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: App builder Appy Pie launched in India
article: California-based do-it-yourself app-building application Appy Pie was launched in India on Thursday. Appy Pie lets users design professional-looking apps using themes and media elements from its gallery, without writing any code. Users can integrate GPS, m-commerce and push notification features in their apps, and can then publish the apps on the iOS and Android app stores.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Truebil raises ₹35 crore in Series A funding
article: Online marketplace for used cars, Truebil on Friday raised ₹35 crore in Series A funding from Kalaari Capital, Inventus Capital, Tekton Ventures and existing investor Kae Capital. Founded in 2015, Truebil lets users buy and sell used cars in Mumbai and Delhi. Truebil also provides a 'Quick Sell' service where it guarantees the sale of a car within 15 days.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup creates charger that auto-shuts charging
article: Australian startup UsBidi has developed a charger that auto-shuts charging when a phone's battery gets fully charged. Compatible with both Android and iOS phones, the charger comes with colourful LED charging indicator and magnetic ends. Further, the company claims that it charges two times faster when connected to a USB port.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in online tea startup TeaBox
article: Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons, Ratan Tata on Wednesday invested an undisclosed sum in premium tea selling platform TeaBox. This is Tata's fifth investment in a startup since the beginning of this year. Founded in 2012 by Kaushal Dugar, TeaBox through its online platform sells teas from Darjeeling, Assam and Nilgiri.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Crowdfunding platform BitGiving raises funding
article: Delhi-based crowdfunding platform, BitGiving on Thursday raised an undisclosed sum from a group of angel investors including Harminder Sahni, Krishna Mehra & Sanjay Bakshi. Founded in 2013 by Ishita Anand and Fahad Moti Khan, BitGiving is an online crowdfunding platform that helps individuals and organisations raise funds for entrepreneurial, creative and social projects.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart launches exchange programme for gadgets
article: Flipkart has announced a monthly exchange programme 'Big Exchange Days' under which it will let users exchange and upgrade their devices on the first two days of every month. Starting from February 1 this year, Flipkart will let users exchange their smartphones, tablets, laptops, televisions, refrigerators and washing machines. The company is also providing doorstep exchange and upgrade facility.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: French startup develops smart beauty mask 'MAPO'
article: French startup Wired Beauty has developed a smart skin-moisturising beauty mask 'MAPO'. Controlled through a dedicated app, the mask measures and manages the moisture of the skin within a minute through sensors placed at key face positions. The app also lets users connect to a community where people can share and discuss beauty solutions.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: AutoRaja shuts down its services
article: Chennai-based auto-rickshaw aggregator, AutoRaja, has shut down due to lack of funds and strong competition. With the shutdown, the top officials and the remaining fleet have reportedly joined Ola. AutoRaja is an auto-rickshaw aggregator that operated only in Chennai, with a fleet of over 2000 autos. It was founded in 2013 by Anubhav Agarwal, Aishwarya Raman & Vineet Agrawal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup develops solar-powered smart jacket
article: US startup ThermalTech has developed a solar-powered smart jacket that instantly converts the Sun's energy into heat. The jacket created with smart energy absorbing fabric technology is designed for both men and women. It is waterproof and light and prevents overheating by maintaining the temperature once the user reaches the optimal body temperature.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Qriyo Infolabs raises $160K in seed funding
article: Courses discovery platform, Qriyo Infolabs on Friday raised $160,000 in its seed funding round from UAE-based Idein Ventures. Founded in 2015 by Rishabh Jain and Mudit Jain, Qriyo's platform lets users discover and learn various courses in extracurricular, academics, co-curriculars and fitness areas at their home. These courses are made available to the users through freelance instructors.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Apple acquires educational startup LearnSprout
article: Apple on Friday acquired San Francisco-based education-analytics startup LearnSprout for an undisclosed sum. Founded in 2012, LearnSprout analyses and tracks attendance, course grades and assessment results of students to be used by teachers. Apple is reportedly developing educational tools, to be introduced on iPad to compete with market leader Google’s Chromebook.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: FindUrClass raises second round of funding
article: Mumbai-based FindUrClass has raised an undisclosed sum from a set of investors, including VentureNursery's members on Friday. Key angel investors who backed this round are Amit Patni, Anirudh Damani & Samir Shah. Launched in 2015 by Rina Nathani, FindURClass is an extracurricular activity and hobby class curation startup. This is the second time VentureNursery's members have backed this startup.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup makes cloud-ready microwavable notebook
article: US startup Rocket Innovations has developed a smart cloud-ready notebook 'Rocketbook Wave', that digitises all the notes penned by the user. A dedicated app for the notebook sends all the notes written by the user on the cloud. Interestingly, the 80-page notebook gets ready for reuse on microwaving it for three-five minutes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: UK startup creates stringless digital guitar
article: UK startup Kurv Music has created a pocket-sized stringless digital guitar 'Kurv Guitar' that can be played using touch, motion and gestures. It consists of an eight-key touchpad that produces and manipulates sounds of three guitars namely acoustic, electric and bass, depending on the pressure applied by the fingers. The output can be heard on a dedicated iOS app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: FreshMenu raises $17 million in Series B funding
article: Online food ordering platform FreshMenu on Friday raised $17 million in Series B funding round led by Zodius Technology Fund. Existing investor Lightspeed Venture Partners also participated in the round. Founded in 2014, Bengaluru-based FreshMenu lets users order meals prepared by its in-house chefs and delivers them within 45 minutes.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Apple acquires AR startup Flyby Media
article: Apple on Friday acquired augmented reality (AR) startup Flyby Media for an undisclosed sum. Founded in 2010, the New York-based startup developed a technology that enables smartphones to scan real life objects. Flyby holds experience in indoor navigation, image recognition and 3D tracking technologies. The acquisition comes after Apple hired Virtual Reality expert Doug Bowman on January 24.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Uber using smartphones to check speeding drivers
article: Ride-hailing service Uber on Tuesday announced that they've been running a pilot program where, using users' smartphone gyrometer data, they are detecting if any driver is speeding or braking too hard. The company said that if a rider complains about a driver accelerating or braking too hard, they would review the trip to check if it was true.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Practo app to let users buy medicines
article: Doctor discovery platform Practo on Tuesday launched a new feature 'Practo Order' which will allow users to buy medicines from the app. Practo Order will compete with the likes of existing online pharmacies NetMeds and Mera Pharmacy. Founded in 2008, Practo lets users find doctors, clinics, spas, gyms and diagnostic labs and book instant appointments with them.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm, BSES tie up for electricity bill payments
article: Online mobile and m-commerce platform, Paytm on Wednesday tied up with BSES Delhi for electricity bill payments. Under the agreement, users of both BSES Rajdhani Power Limited (BRPL) and BSES Yamuna Power Limited (BYPL) will be able to make bill payments through Paytm's platform. Paytm will also offer cashback on the electricity bill payments before the due date.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: JustDoc raises funding from Mohandas Pai, others
article: Video consultation startup JustDoc on Thursday raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding from T V Mohandas Pai, TracxnLabs, Mohit Saxena of InMobi, Raghunandan G of TaxiForSure, Singapore Angel Network & others. Founded in August 2015 by Jugal Anchalia, Abhishek Kumar & Vikash Singh, JustDoc connects patients & doctors over a video call for 24x7 medical consultation.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Flipkart makes hiring "interview-less"
article: Flipkart, on Thursday, announced its partnership with Udacity, an online learning company to hire graduates, based on capabilities it has built through Udacity’s Nanodegree programs. Flipkart will select candidates based on its Nanodegree projects and Udacity profiles. The process will not include interviews or group discussions. The company has over 4 million students in 168 countries.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup develops smart luggage 'G-RO'
article: US-based startup Shalgi Design Studio has developed a smart luggage 'G-RO', that features all-terrain wheels, inbuilt tablet stand and a charging station with two USB ports. G-RO comes with 360° revolvable wheels and a luggage location tracker. The 23,000 mAh battery in the luggage capable of charging tablets, laptops and smartphones lasts long enough to charge a smartphone 10 times.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm to invest around $3 mn in Madhya Pradesh
article: Online payments and m-commerce platform Paytm on Saturday signed an agreement with the Madhya Pradesh government to invest around $3 million in Jabalpur to set up a back-end center. Expected to start functioning in a year, the center will provide jobs to around 2,000 people. MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that the center will boost investment in IT sector.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: VC firm Saama Capital raises $100 million
article: India-focused VC firm Saama Capital, which has backed startups like Paytm and Snapdeal, raised $100 million from three funds on Monday. Saama Capital has invested in startups LendingKart, EazyDiner, Veeba Foods and Jifflenow from its latest funding. The VC firm was founded in 2012 by Ash Nilani and Suresh Shanmugham.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Adult products e-store raises $4 mn in Series A
article: Adult products e-store IMbesharam.com has raised $4 million in a Series A funding round led by two unnamed US-based angel investors. Founded in 2011, the company is owned by Salim Rajan and Raj Armani and is now valued at $20 million. It currently gets maximum traffic from Delhi, followed by Bangalore and Mumbai. The company had also roped in Sunny Leone as its brand ambassador.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Big data startup Qubole raises $30 million
article: Big data analytics startup Qubole on Friday raised $30 million in Series C funding round led by Institutional Venture Partners. Existing investors CRV, Lightspeed Venture Partners and Norwest Venture Partners also participated in the round. Founded in 2011 by two former Facebook data service team members, Qubole simplifies and analyses big data of client companies for better insights.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kickstarter launches official Android app
article: Global crowdfunding platform Kickstarter on Thursday launched its official Android app. The app lets users explore, pledge, back and track innovative projects on the crowdfunding platform. Kickstarter is a global platform that lets people with ideas ranging from art to technology raise required funds for their execution.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: RBL launches banking platform for entrepreneurs
article: Maharashtra-based RBL Bank has launched a new platform called 'India Startup Club' (ISC) to provide all-around banking services to emerging entrepreneurs. Through this platform, entrepreneurs can avail personalised banking services, planning solutions and financial tools, the bank said. Enterprise registration, office space and social media marketing are among the non-banking solutions provided.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Photography website creator Siftr raises $150k
article: A startup that creates photography website for its users, Siftr on Monday raised $150,000 in seed funding from Venture Catalysts. Founded in 2015 by Romil Mittal and Mayank Bhagya, Siftr uses artificial intelligence to collect best photos clicked by its users and puts them in a presentable layout. The startup also keeps updating the user's website.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Ola launches ride sharing in Chennai, Kolkata
article: Cab aggregator Ola on Saturday announced the launch of its social ride sharing feature Ola Share in the cities of Chennai and Kolkata. Using this feature, a ride can be shared by up to three people at any point of time, the company said. Ola had earlier launched this feature in Bengaluru, Delhi-NCR and Mumbai.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup creates smart baby stroller 'Smartbe'
article: US-based startup Smartbe has developed an intelligent baby stroller that can be controlled through a dedicated inbuilt panel on the stroller's handle or mobile app. It features motion sensors for hands-free strolling, wireless speakers, anti-theft alarm, bottle warmer, rocker and temperature-controlled cradle. Priced at $3,199, Smartbe is currently in the crowdfunding stage on IndieGogo.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nilekani, Accel, Kalaari invest in Power2SME
article: Gurgaon-based Power2SME on Monday raised an undisclosed sum from Nandan Nilekani and existing investors Accel Partners, Kalaari Capital and Inventus Capital. However, the raised amount is reportedly being estimated around $20 million. Founded in 2012 by R Narayan, Power2SME directly buys raw materials from suppliers required by SMEs, eliminating the middle-men.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm signs ₹120 crore agreement with Alibaba
article: Online payments and m-commerce platform Paytm on Monday signed a ₹120 crore agreement with its lead investor Alibaba's cloud computing arm AliCloud. Under the agreement, Paytm users will be allowed to access Alibaba's online payment platform Alipay for shopping in US, China, Japan and the UK. In return, Alipay's users can shop in India through Paytm.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Labour Min relaxes startups from key inspections
article: A week after PM Narendra Modi launched the Start-up India initiative, the Labour Ministry on Sunday exempted Indian startups from key labour laws-related inspections. These laws include the Industrial Disputes Act, the Contract Labour Act, the Employees State Insurance Act, the Trade Union Act and the Employees Provident Fund and Miscellaneous Provisions Act.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rocket to shut FabFurnish, PrintVenue: Reports
article: German internet company and startup investor Rocket Internet has reportedly decided to exit from India and has made multiple attempts to sell unprofitable FabFurnish and PrintVenue. Rocket Internet-backed Jabong, Foodpanda and FabFurnish witnessed several senior level exits over the last six months. Rocket Internet entered the Indian market in 2012 by incubating half a dozen companies.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Gurgaon gets women-only two-wheeler taxi service
article: A two-wheeler taxi service, 'Bikxie Pink', for women has been launched in Gurgaon that is completely run by women. Started by a couple Divya Kalia and Mohit Sharma, the service includes a fleet of pink two-wheelers to ferry women between 8 am to 6 pm. The app-only service keeps a pepper spray and disposable shower cap handy for commuters.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Deals discovery app Little gets funding from GIC
article: Online to offline deals discovery app Little on Friday raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Singapore-based investment firm GIC. It's an extension to the funding round in July 2015 where the app raised $50 million. Founded in 2015 by Manish Chopra and Satish Mani, Little lets users find deals on nearby restaurants, movies, hotels and other service providers.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: IBM acquires streaming service provider Ustream
article: US-based International Business Machines Corporation (IBM) has acquired a San Francisco-based cloud-based live video streaming service provider called Ustream. Founded in 2007, the startup provides live and on-demand video streaming service to around 80 million viewers a month. Ustream will now join IBM's newly-formed Cloud Video Services unit, that aims to deliver a portfolio of video services.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Amazon, Walmart to invest over ₹2k cr in India
article: Retail giants Amazon and Walmart Stores are planning to invest over ₹2,000 crore in the Indian retail market. While Amazon has invested ₹1,696 crore in its Indian e-commerce arm Amazon Seller Services, Walmart will invest ₹360 crore to open around 50 stores in India. Eyeing expansion in India, Walmart plans to open 70 new stores in the next five years.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Instant messaging app n-gage launched in India
article: Instant messaging app n-gage has launched its service in India to compete with other chat platforms like WhatsApp, Hike, LINE and Viber. In addition to having standard chat app features, n-gage allows users to send encrypted messages to each other that are password protected and are automatically deleted after a pre-set duration. The app also has a desktop version.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Chinese startup develops smart bottle 'Seed'
article: Chinese startup Moikit has developed a smart bottle 'Seed' priced between $130-$150, that tracks the user's water consumption, compiles health data and gives water intake reminders. Seed comes with an LED touchscreen cap that displays reminders, temperature and stale water warnings. Compatible with other health apps and devices, the bottle can be controlled through a dedicated Android and iOS app.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Jugnoo closes $5.5 mn Series B funding
article: Chandigarh-based autorickshaw hailing service Jugnoo has raised $2.5 million to close its series B round of funding at $5.5 million. The round was led by existing investor Paytm, along with Snow Leopard. Started by Samar Singla in November 2014, the company had raised $5 million in Series A round of funding last year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup develops smart wallet 'Walli'
article: A US-based startup has developed a smart wallet 'Walli' priced under $100, that notifies the user of its location and contents. Walli is operated through a dedicated mobile app available on both Android and iOS platforms. It also tracks wallet activities and notifies the user when a credit or identity card is missing from the wallet for too long.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Koovs Co-founder Rajesh Kamra joins Wooplr
article: Online fashion retailer Koovs Co-founder Rajesh Kamra on Monday joined fashion discovery app Wooplr as the Head of Commerce. Wooplr also roped in fabric manufacturer Arvind Lifestyle's CEO Rajiv Mehta for a senior advisory post. Founded in 2013, Wooplr is a mobile-based fashion discovery platform that guides users with fashion and suggests buying options based on their interest and location.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Sony acquires Altair Semiconductor for $212 mn
article: Sony Corporation announced on Tuesday that it will acquire Altair Semiconductor for $212 million, with an aim to boost their Internet of Things business. Founded in 2005, the Israel-based startup makes chips that connect devices to LTE. Sony said in a statement that it will continue to expand Altair's business and will combine its technologies with Altair's modem chips.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Skycandle raises undisclosed Series A funding
article: Online retailer of home decor products, Skycandle on Friday raised an undisclosed amount in Series A funding round led by GPA Group. The Group's Chairman, Vivek Aggarwal will join Skycandle's Board of Directors. Founded in 2013, Skycandle's online store lets users buy candles, sky lanterns, wall decor, aroma products, lights and gift packs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: E-tailers to deliver at 10 Delhi Metro stations
article: According to the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation, online retailers will be able to deliver products at 10 stations from February 2016. These stations include MG Road, HUDA City Centre, Noida Sector 18, Laxmi Nagar, Vaishali, Nehru Place, Dwarka Sector 9, Kashmere Gate, Rajiv Chowk and GTB Nagar. 'Automated Parcel Delivery Terminals' are being set up for the purpose at stations.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: 528 startups ask Modi to support net neutrality
article: A letter, urging Prime Minister Narendra Modi to issue a statement supporting net neutrality, was signed by 528 Indian startups. Written at SaveTheInternet.in, the letter has 1,046 signatories including startups like Paytm and Zomato, and investors like Rebright Partners and TLabs. This comes a few days after TRAI held an Open House discussion on the issue of differential data pricing.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Fisdom raises $500K in seed funding
article: Bengaluru-based personal finance startup Fisdom has raised $500,000 in seed funding from angel investors including Co-founders of TaxiForSure and the Co-founder of CommonFloor Sumit Jain. Founded in 2015, Fisdom is an automated investment service provider that manages personalised online investment account for its customers. It also provides personal investment recommendations.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Startup raises $3.3 bn in largest pre-IPO round
article: Chinese Internet company Meituan-Dianping on Tuesday raised over $3.3 billion in its latest round of funding, making it the largest funding round globally for a venture-backed startup. The company is now valued at $18 billion, making it the world's fifth-most valuable pre-IPO tech company. The startup offers online restaurant bookings, movie ticketing and other online-to-offline services in China.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: FreeCharge launches virtual card for e-payments
article: Digital payments platform FreeCharge, in association with YES Bank and MasterCard, has launched a new virtual card called ‘FreeCharge Go’. Customers can now pay across all major e-commerce portals and use the card on-the-go for online transactions including paying for movie tickets, cab rides and groceries. The virtual card will be linked to the users’ FreeCharge wallet.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Flipkart holds 47% of m-commerce traffic: Report
article: E-commerce company Flipkart accounts for 47% of the mobile e-commerce traffic in India, according to UK-based IT analytics company SimilarWeb. Lifestyle e-tailer Myntra, a subsidiary of Flipkart, is second in the list with a 16% share followed by Amazon (15.86%) and Snapdeal (13.84%). Further, Flipkart also registered the highest Android app installs in India with a share of 37%.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Tech firm CREO raises $3 mn to build its own OS
article: Bangalore-based consumer technology company CREO has secured $3 million funding from Sequoia India, Beenext Ventures and India Quotient. It will use the funds to build its own Android-based operating system and launch its flagship smartphone later this year. Founded in 2013 by Sai Srinivas Kiran G and Shubh Malhotra, the company had raised $1.75 million in seed funding in March 2015.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: India Post opens counters for eBay sellers
article: India's government-operated postal system, India Post has opened up exclusive counters in Gurgaon and Faridabad exclusively for eBay India sellers, as reported by the Economic Times. Through these counters, over 65,000 eBay India sellers would be able to ship their international as well as domestic parcels. India Post had previously partnered with Amazon India, Snapdeal, ShopClues and Paytm.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Hindi social networking website raises $200,000
article: UP-based Hindi social networking portal ShabdaNagari has raised about $200,000 in an angel funding round from Kanpur Angels and a cluster of other investors. ShabdaNagari was started in 2015 by Amitesh Misra, Nikhil Tiwari, Kalpnesh Gupta, Gopal Sutwala and Amaresh Chandra Misra. Kanpur Angels have set aside a corpus of ₹10 crore for promising startups, and ShabdaNagari is its first investment.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Flipkart invests in parenting platform Tinystep
article: Bangalore-based parenting-focused social network Tinystep has raised an undisclosed amount in seed round of funding from e-commerce company Flipkart. Founded in 2015, Tinystep provides parents a free platform to connect with doctors, child service providers and other parents globally. It has recently launched a vaccination and growth chart feature that helps users measure the growth of their kids.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in Pune-based firm FirstCry
article: Pune-based baby and maternity product retailer FirstCry has received an undisclosed amount of investment from Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons, Ratan Tata. This is Ratan Tata’s fourth startup investment of 2016. FirstCry had raised funding from New Enterprise Associates and San Francisco-based Valiant Capital in April last year. Launched in 2010, the startup is owned by BrainBees Solutions.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: UrbanClap acquires services platform HandyHome
article: Local services marketplace UrbanClap on Friday acquired home and kitchen appliances services booking platform HandyHome in an equity swap deal. Founded in 2015 by a group of IIT Bombay graduates, HandyHome lets users book services from authorised service centres of the desired brand. HandyHome's Android app also lets users schedule these services, store copy of the bill and device details.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Easypolicy gets ₹15 cr funding led by Unilazer
article: Insurance policy comparison platform Easypolicy has raised ₹15 crore in fresh funding led by Ronnie Screwvala’s Unilazer Ventures. Founder of Refex Energy, Anil Jain also participated in the funding. Founded in 2011 by Alok Bhatnagar, Divyanshu Tripathi and Neeraj Aggarwala, Easypolicy lets users get quotes from various insurance companies to make price-based comparisons among insurance policies.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Retail technology firm SnapBizz raises $7.2 mn
article: Bangalore-based retail technology firm SnapBizz has raised $7.2 million in funding led by Jungle Ventures, Taurus Value Creation, Konly Venture and Blume Ventures. Founded by Prem Kumar in 2013, it had earlier raised $1.7 million in seed funding. SnapBizz is a platform that caters to 'kirana' stores, providing them with services such as stock management, easy billing, and product visibility.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: NASSCOM launches startup warehouse in Hyderabad
article: NASSCOM, in partnership with the Telangana government, inaugurated the 'T-Hub NASSCOM Startup Warehouse' in Hyderabad on Monday. A startup warehouse is an incubator and a co-working space for entrepreneurs, available for 6-12 months at a reasonable cost, during which startups can pitch to investors. NASSCOM already has startup warehouses in Bangalore, Kolkata, Navi Mumbai, Pune, Kochi and Gurgaon.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: VC funding in India down by $600 mn in Oct-Dec
article: Venture Capitalist (VC) investments in India from October-December last year saw a fall of $600 million to $1.51 billion against $2.12 billion in the year-ago period, according to a report by VC database CB Insights and consulting firm KPMG. Analysts attributed the drop to the cautious nature adopted by the VC firms before investing in Indian startups.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: India's first social mobile wallet launched
article: Mumbai-based TranServ on Wednesday launched India's first social mobile wallet called Udio. Apart from the usual wallet functions like phone recharge, bill payment and digital money transfer, Udio would also allow its users to split bills, send or request money and gift merchant vouchers. The users would also be provided with prepaid Visa card powered by Maharashtra-based Ratnakar Bank.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in cashback website CashKaro
article: Ratan Tata, the Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons, has invested an undisclosed sum in Gurgaon-based cashback and coupons website CashKaro.com. This is Ratan Tata's third investment of 2016. Founded in 2013 by Swati and Rohan Bhargava, the startup raised about $3.7 million in Series A funding led by Kalaari Capital in November last year.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: FreeCharge partners with McDonald's India owner
article: FreeCharge on Tuesday announced its partnership with McDonald's India owner Westlife Development to offer offline payments to its customers. The new feature has been rolled out for 216 McDonald’s restaurants in 26 Indian cities. Freecharge has also introduced 'On- the-Go PIN' which can generate a code on the app even when not connected to the internet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup launches smartphone for senior citizens
article: Indian startup SeniorWorld on Thursday launched 'Easyfone', a smartphone designed specifically for senior citizens, at ₹3,375. It features a 2.2-inch display screen, big font, raised well-spaced dialling keys and photo dialling option for making calls. Every Easyfone has a dedicated SOS button for emergency. It comes with a wireless cradle charger that charges the phone when slipped into it.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Mobikwik to help water bill payments in Delhi
article: Online payment startup Mobikwik on Wednesday announced a tie-up with the Delhi Jal Board that will facilitate people in Delhi to pay water bills using their mobiles through the Mobikwik interface. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal will officially launch the Delhi Jal Board app on Thursday after which the service will be functional. Mobikwik has also partnered with IRCTC recently.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Snapdeal FY15 losses widen 5 times to ₹1,319 cr
article: The operational losses of e-commerce company Snapdeal for the financial year ended March 31, 2015 have increased five times to ₹1,319.29 crore compared to ₹264.62 crore in FY14. With valuations of $5 billion each, Snapdeal and Ola are the second highest valued Indian startups behind Flipkart ($15 billion). The company has raised $500 million in its latest round of funding.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: General Motors acquires tech & assets of Sidecar
article: US-based automaker General Motors on Tuesday acquired the technology and most of the assets of defunct ride-hailing service Sidecar for an undisclosed sum. As part of the deal, GM will get co-founder and CTO Jahan Khanna along with 20 employees. Notably, GM also invested over $500 million in Lyft last year to prepare for future competition from companies like Uber.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Housing raises ₹100 cr in funding from SoftBank
article: Mumbai-based real estate portal Housing has raised ₹100 crore in a fresh round of funding from SoftBank. Founded in 2012, the valuation of Housing stood at ₹1,500 crore during its last round of funding which saw an investment of $90 million (₹611 crore) from SoftBank in 2014. Notably, there were speculations earlier in the month that Snapdeal was looking to acquire Housing.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Yatra acqui-hires travel company Travel-logs
article: Gurgaon-based travel firm Yatra.com has acqui-hired Mumbai-based Travel-logs in an undisclosed deal. Travel-logs organises customised city walks and private tours. As part of the deal, Travel-logs Founder Dhiresh Sharma will join Yatra as head of its new segment, Metro X, that will be launched in Mumbai by February end. Metro X will curate experiences around different themes across Indian cities.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Former Twitter CEO to co-found fitness startup
article: Former Twitter Chief, Dick Costolo on Tuesday revealed on Twitter that he’s cofounding a new fitness startup with Bryan Oki, former CEO and co-founder of another fitness-focused platform, called Fitify. He also announced that he is joining a venture capital firm called 'Index Ventures' as a partner. Costolo revealed this news six months after resigning as the CEO of Twitter.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Microsoft buys custom version of Minecraft game
article: Microsoft on Tuesday announced the acquisition of a modified third-party version of the building-block game Minecraft, called MinecraftEdu, which is designed for classrooms. With this acquisition, Microsoft plans to launch a classroom edition of Minecraft, called 'Minecraft: Education Edition'. Created in 2010, MinecraftEdu is currently used by over 7,000 classrooms in over 40 countries.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Smart sensor for allergy, asthma alerts unveiled
article: US-based company AlerSense on Tuesday unveiled a smart sensor that acts as an early warning system for asthma and allergy alerts. AlerSense said the product can take accurate readings of the surrounding environment and can tell the users to remove themselves from that area. The product can measure airborne contamination and toxins such as pollen, mold, dust among others.

author: Aditya Kashyap
