abstract: Silvan raises $500k in seed funding
article: Bengaluru-based home automation startup Silvan Innovation Labs on Thursday raised $500,000 in seed funding from angel network Chennai Angels. Founded in 2008, it provides technology enabled security and entertainment options at homes and commercial settings. Using integrated cameras, mic and speakers fitted at various devices, the Silvan interface allows users to control them using smartphones.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: India not ready for internet listings: Flipkart
article: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal on Saturday said that Indian markets are not ready for large internet company listings yet. Bansal added, “[I]t may not be a bad thing if foreign money comes into India by companies…listing abroad". However, Jayant Sinha, Minister of State for Finance, said that SEBI has eased listing norms and internet company listings will boost India's economy.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Flipkart ties up with Mahindra to sell KUV100
article: Flipkart has tied up with automaker Mahindra & Mahindra to exclusively sell the latter’s recently launched KUV100. Buyers can start booking the compact SUV on Flipkart’s website from January 18. The vehicle, starting at a price of ₹4.42 lakh, will be available in seven colour variants. Notably, Flipkart ventured into the automobile market space only last month.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Amazon announces 'Great Indian Sale' from Jan 21
article: Online marketplace Amazon India has announced its ‘Great Indian Sale’ from January 21 to January 23. The company said that it will offer discounts of up to 40% on over 40 international brands launched on its website in the last six months. Further, Amazon app users will have access to top deals 15 minutes earlier than website users.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Govt working to ease exit for startups: Nirmala
article: Speaking at the 'Startup India' conference on Saturday, Commerce Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that in addition to easing the process of starting a business, the government is also working on making exiting a startup easier. The Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code 2015, which seeks to provide an easy exit option for insolvent and 'sick' companies, has been referred for further scrutiny.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Tata Housing partners with Amazon to sell houses
article: Real estate company Tata Housing on Monday tied up with online marketplace Amazon to offer ready-to-move luxury apartments from its six projects across four Indian cities. The price of the said properties ranges from ₹75 lakh to ₹14 crore. The company is also offering furnishings and home improvement products of up to ₹27 lakh on Amazon.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Swiggy raises $35 million ​in Series C funding
article: Bengaluru-based food ordering app Swiggy has raised $35 million ​in Series C round of funding from New York-based investors Harmony Partners and Singapore-based RB Investments. Existing investors SAIF Partners also participated in this round. Founded in August 2014 by Rahul Jaimini, Sriharsha Majety and Nandan Reddy, the startup raised $16.5 million in Series B round in June last year.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Foursquare raises $45 mn, appoints new CEO
article: Search and discovery platform Foursquare has raised $45 million in a Series E round led by Union Square Ventures and Morgan Stanley. Existing investors DFJ Growth, A16z and Spark Capital also participated in the round. The Co-founder and CEO Dennis Crowley has also decided to move to an executive chairman position, appointing Jeff Glueck as the new CEO.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: US-based shared workspace service to enter India
article: WeWork, a US-based provider of shared office space, will soon launch its services in India, founder Adam Neumann said at a startup conference in Delhi on Saturday. The four-year-old company, currently operational in seven countries, provides its services mostly to startups and entrepreneurs. Neumann also met Prime Minister Narendra Modi ahead of the conference to discuss the same.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Reliance ties up with Snapdeal to fund vendors
article: Anil Ambani-led Reliance Commercial Finance (RCF) has tied up with e-tailer Snapdeal to offer financing to over 80,000 Snapdeal vendors across India. The company is also in talks for similar tie-ups with e-commerce players including Flipkart and Amazon India. The new e-commerce centric product will offer customised options to the vendors of e-commerce companies, RCF said.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: SBI launches India's 1st startup-focused branch
article: The State Bank of India (SBI) on Thursday launched the country’s first startup-focused bank branch, SBI InCube, in Bengaluru. The branch will give startups financial management advice, but will not provide them with loans. Further, SBI has launched its wealth management service, SBI Exclusif, aimed at taking care of all the banking needs of its fast-growing affluent customers.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: SurveyMonkey names its Chairman as new CEO
article: Online survey company SurveyMonkey named its Chairman and former GoPro executive Zander Lurie as the new Chief Executive Officer (CEO), according to reports by Re/code. He will follow Bill Veghte, who is leaving the company due to 'differences of opinion on strategy' with the investors. Zander held the position temporarily last year after the demise of then CEO David Goldberg.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Paytm to transfer money through sound waves
article: Online payment and m-commerce platform Paytm is testing a new feature, called ‘Sound Pay’, that will enable mobile payments through ultrasonic sound waves. After a user presses the 'Sound Pay' icon, a sound is emitted, carrying information regarding the amount to be paid and customer credentials. Once the information reaches a registered merchant, the amount is debited from the wallet.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: No tax for 3 years on profits of startups: PM
article: At the official launch of the 'Start up India' programme, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced that profits of startups set up after 1st April 2016, shall be exempted from income tax for a period of three years. He announced 80% rebate on filing of patents for startups. Modi also added that a dedicated fund of ₹10,000 crore will be created.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: SoftBank to raise Indian investments to $10 bn
article: During the Startup India event on Friday, Softbank group CEO Masayoshi Son announced that the company will increase their Indian investments from last year's $2 billion to $10 billion in the coming year. "In the next 10 years India will repeat the growth China saw in the last 10 years and in my opinion, India could be bigger", he added.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Jawbone raises $165 mn, valuation down by 50%
article: San Francisco-based wearable products maker, Jawbone reportedly raised $165 million in a new funding round led by Kuwait Investment Authority on Friday. After the financing round, the startup is now valued at $1.5 billion, nearly half of the company's valuation in 2014. Meanwhile, the company's President Sameer Samat is set to leave Jawbone and join Google, according to sources.

author: Sandeep Banga
abstract: Payment cards space raised $447mn in '15: Tracxn
article: According to analytics firm Tracxn's report on the payment cards space, the sector raised a total funding of $447 million globally in 2015, a drop from $541 million invested in 2014. The average deal size in 2015 stood at $9.5 million. Investors such as Greylock partners, Sequoia Capital, Intel Capital and Y Combinator have been actively investing in the sector.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Oxigen wallet launches virtual Visa debit cards
article: Payment solutions provider Oxigen wallet has launched virtual debit cards powered by Visa. To avail the service, users would be required to register with Visa from the Oxigen mobile application. A virtual card can be created for one account or for an individual transaction, which is  a Visa gateway compatible with various sites including Amazon, Flipkart, and Uber.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: 'Startup India' most googled term today
article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 'Startup India' campaign was held in Delhi on Saturday, following which it became the most trending search of the day, according to Google Trends. The term was most searched by the state of Haryana followed by Jharkhand and Uttarakhand, while Ghaziabad, Noida and Gurgaon were the top cities googling it.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: SBI to offer loans to e-commerce sellers
article: State Bank of India (SBI) on Friday announced the launch of ‘SBI e-Smart SME’ to provide easy working capital to e-commerce players. The bank has initially tied up with Snapdeal to offer loans of up to ₹25 lakh to its sellers, while it is also planning a similar partnership with Flipkart, Paytm and Amazon, according to SBI’s chairperson Arundhati Bhattacharya.

author: Smrithin Satishan
abstract: Easy funds, policies key for start-ups: Jaitley
article: Speaking at the inaugural session of Start-up India initiative on Saturday, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley said "easier availability of capital and friendly tax regime" will be key to encouraging entrepreneurship. Jaitley called the MUDRA scheme by Centre as a similar step to encourage small businesses. PM Narendra Modi will launch the initiative on Saturday and reportedly reserve ₹2000 crore.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: E-comm enabler KartRocket secures $6 mn funding
article: Delhi-based e-commerce platform enabler KartRocket raised $6 million from Bertelsmann India Investments and existing investors Nirvana Digital India Fund, Nirvana Digital Investment Holding. 500 Start-Ups and Singapore-based Beenext also participated in the round. Founded by Saahil Goel, Gautam Kapoor and Vishesh Khurana, KartRocket helps small retailers and SMEs start their own online store.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Fitness app FITSO raises $200K in angel funding
article: Fitness mobile app FITSO has raised $200,000 in angel funding round from Varun Khurana, ex-CTO of Grofers, Samar Singla, CEO of Jugnoo and Vinay Bansal, CFO of Wildcraft. Launched three months ago, FITSO is a social platform that aims at connecting people with similar fitness interests. Currently only in Delhi-NCR, it is reportedly launching its services in Mumbai this month.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Uber partners with Airbus for helicopter rides
article: Uber is partnering with aerospace firm Airbus to offer on-demand helicopter rides. Users will first be able to avail the service at the Sundance Film Festival 2016, to be held in Utah from January 21 to January 31, where Airbus will provide its H125 and H130 helicopters for a trial project. Uber will also send a car to pick passengers up for the chopper ride.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: #StartupIndia trending on Twitter today
article: On the day the Startup India campaign was launched, #StartupIndia was a top Twitter trend in India on Saturday. Officials including NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant and Commerce Minister Nirmala Sitharaman discussed the campaign on Twitter. Users also gave suggestions tweeting, "PM should ensure #StartupIndia should not become Stuck-up India through proper qualification process of entrepreneurs".

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Will make Mumbai capital of startups: Maha CM
article: At the launch of the Startup India mission on Saturday, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that the state government “will make Mumbai the capital of startups". Promising to build an ecosystem where “powerful ideas” can thrive, Fadnavis added, “[A]spiring Indian youth…just needs a little bit of hand-holding to transform their ideas into reality”.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Lava partners with ShopInSync mobile app
article: Indian tablet and mobile maker Lava on Wednesday partnered with ShopInSync, an Android app that lets users compare deals on online shopping websites. Under the partnership, Lava’s all 10 upcoming 4G smartphones will be preloaded with the ShopInSync app. Launched last November, ShopInSync sends users price comparisons and allows them to share products through an integrated messaging service.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Snapdeal launches real-estate shopping festival
article: Snapdeal on Thursday launched a week-long real-estate shopping festival called ‘Freedom from Rent’ that offers customers properties between ₹20 lakh and ₹5 crore. Buyers can “choose from over 100 pan-India real estate projects" across Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru, Chennai and Mumbai. The festival offers exclusive offers from several builders including Lavasa, Ajanara Homes and Mahagun India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in startups tracker Tracxn
article: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata on Wednesday invested an undisclosed amount in startups tracker and curator Tracxn. Founded in 2013 by Abhishek Goyal and Neha Singh, Tracxn globally tracks and analyses startups to connect them with venture capitalists. Tracxn had previously raised $3.7 million from Flipkart founders Sachin Bansal and Binny Bansal, SAIF Partners and others.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tinder opens its first overseas office in Delhi
article: The United States-based dating app Tinder on Wednesday picked Delhi to open its first overseas office. Tinder has appointed Taru Kapoor, a Harvard Business School alumnus to head its operations in India. Founded in 2012, Tinder app anonymously finds people nearby that like each other and connects them if they are interested.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: SavvyMob raises $1 million in seed funding
article: Bangalore-based app-only hotel booking startup SavvyMob has raised $1 million in seed funding from ex-Infosys Director TV Mohandas Pai and online fundraising platform LetsVenture. Started in 2013 by Bikram Sohal and Gappan, the startup is an online marketplace for hotels which connects hotel owners with customers and provides last-minute booking of rooms to users.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Digital health funding hits record $5.8bn in '15
article: As per data from CB Insights, the digital health industry received a record investment of over $5.8 billion in 2015, a slight increase from $5.7 billion raised in 2014. However, there was a significant jump in number of deals with a 20% year-on-year increase. Y Combinator was the most active investor in 2015 followed by DreamIt Ventures and Qualcomm Ventures.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Binny Bansal named Flipkart's new CEO
article: Flipkart on Monday announced that Binny Bansal, COO and Co-founder, will be the company's new CEO and Sachin Bansal, CEO and Co-founder, will now be the Executive Chairman of the company. Flipkart's blog suggested that while Sachin will provide strategic direction and look for new investment opportunities, Binny will be responsible for all the business areas and corporate functionalities.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Uber launches new feature 'Trip Experiences'
article: Ride-hailing service Uber on Tuesday announced the launch of a new feature called 'Trip Experiences' that connects the riders with their favorite applications at the start of a trip. With this, third party applications would be able to provide customized notifications, content, or ads to its users based on the location and the length of their trips.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: CarTrade secures ₹950 crore funding
article: Online automotive classifieds portal CarTrade raised ₹950 crore from Singapore-based investment company Temasek and global venture investment company March Capital. The round also saw participation from existing investor Warburg Pincus. CarTrade, in October 2014, had raised about ₹185 crore from Warburg Pincus, Tiger Global, and Canaan Partners. CarTrade and Carwale merged in November 2015.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Online jewellery startup Melorra raises $5 mn
article: Online jewellery startup Melorra raised $5 million in early stage funding from Lightbox Ventures. The app-only startup was founded by Saroja Yeramilli and R Krishnakumar, who had previously worked across the Titan Industries. With 40 employees and an in-house design team, Bengaluru-based Melorra started operations only less than a week ago.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Gay dating app Grindr sells 60% stake for $93 mn
article: Grindr, the social network app for gay men, on Tuesday sold 60% stake to Chinese gaming company Beijing Kunlun Tech for $93 million. This is the first time that the US-based company has taken investment from outside the country. Valued at $155 million, the app's Founder and CEO Joel Simkhai and its employees will retain the remaining shares.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Uber CEO to speak at IIT Bombay on 19th Jan
article: Co-founder and CEO of Uber, Travis Kalanick, along with 40 other CEOs and co-founders, will address students and offer startup tips at IIT Bombay on 19th January. In his maiden trip to India, he will also take part in government’s Startup India event on January 16. Notably, the company had launched a startup mentorship programme called 'uberEXCHANGE' last week.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: ShopClues raises funding at $1.1 bn valuation
article: Online retailer ShopClues has secured an undisclosed amount of investment led by Singapore's GIC with participation from existing investors Tiger Global and Nexus Venture Partners. The company has now joined the unicorn club with a valuation of more than $1.1 billion. Though it did not disclose the amount raised, however, people familiar with the deal estimate it at $110-140 million.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Travel search site Skyscanner raises $192 mn
article: Edinburgh-based travel search engine Skyscanner on Tuesday raised about $192 million from Malaysia’s Khazanah Nasional Berhad and Yahoo! Japan, among others. Vitruvian Partners, independent investment management firm Baillie Gifford and Artemis also participated in the round. The company is reportedly valued at $1.6 billion after the current funding and competes with Kayak and Expedia.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IAMAI appoints Kunal Shah as Chairman
article: The Internet & Mobile Association of India (IAMAI) on Tuesday appointed FreeCharge's Founder and CEO Kunal Shah as its new Chairman. Shah founded FreeCharge, an online recharge platform, in 2010 which was acquired by Snapdeal in 2015. Vinodh Bhat, Co-founder, President and Chief Strategy Officer at Saavn, will continue as the Vice-Chairman of IAMAI.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Mumbai cabs release app to take on Ola, Uber
article: Two biggest taxi unions, consisting of more than 35,000 cabs, in Mumbai have come together and launched an app called '9211' which will offer instant cab service at government approved rates. The application's functioning will be similar to other ride-hailing services, like Ola and Uber. It will also feature GPS tracking and SOS button services for safety purposes.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Uber starts programme to mentor Indian startups
article: US-based taxi-hailing company Uber on Wednesday announced a tie-up with Invest India, a central government initiative, to mentor startups in India. As part of the tie-up, Uber has launched UberExchange, a programme that will organise leadership talks over the next 12 months and will help entrepreneurs with fund raising, product design and other related activities.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Zomato shuts online orders in four cities
article: Restaurant discovery and food-ordering app Zomato announced it will close down its online ordering service in four cities- Lucknow, Coimbatore, Indore and Kochi. "The size of the market in these cities is small right now," said Zomato co-founder Pankaj Chaddah. The combined order volume from these four cities reportedly accounted for less than 2% of the total order volume.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Uber to launch carpool service in Kolkata
article: Taxi-aggregator Uber will launch its carpool service in Kolkata this year, offering commuters who share rides at around 30% lower fares. General Manager (east) of Uber India Systems, Ashwin Dias, said, “This is keeping in view of the high pollution levels which are choking the various metros of the country”. The carpool service is already operational in Bengaluru and Delhi.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Oculus opens pre-orders for VR headset Rift
article: Oculus on Wednesday started taking pre-orders for its virtual reality headset Rift on the Oculus Store website across 20 countries for $599. The headset allows its users a real-time experience of virtual reality-based games and movies. The company on August 1, 2012 started a Kickstarter campaign to seed fund Rift.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: China's Ctrip invests $180 mn in MakeMyTrip
article: Chinese online travel company Ctrip.com on Thursday agreed to invest $180 million in online travel major MakeMyTrip through convertible bonds. Ctrip has also got a permission from MakeMyTrip to acquire its shares in the open market. After the completion of the investment, Ctrip will be able to appoint a director to MakeMyTrip’s board of directors.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Quora CEO, WordPress co-founder invest in Hike
article: Indian app Hike Messenger on Tuesday said that multiple Silicon Valley veterans, including Quora CEO Adam D'Angelo, Dropbox VP Aditya Agarwal and WordPress co-founder Matt Mullenweg, have invested in the app. The veterans, who also serve as advisors in Hike, have each made an undisclosed amount of personal investment. Notably, Hike currently has a user base of 70 million.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Govt approves startup scheme for SC/ST and women
article: The Central government on Wednesday approved the proposed Stand up India scheme which intends to provide monetary help to at least 2.5 lakh Scheduled caste, Scheduled tribe and women entrepreneurs. Initially, ₹10,000 crore will be available for financing and the target of 2.5 lakh loan approvals is expected to be reached within 36 months of the launch of the scheme.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Quikr acquires real estate portal CommonFloor
article: Online classifieds platform Quikr on Thursday acquired real estate portal CommonFloor for an undisclosed sum. CommonFloor will be merged with the real estate vertical of Quikr known as QuikrHomes which was launched four months ago. Founded by Sumit Jain, Vikas Malpani and Lalit Mangal in 2007, CommonFloor has raised more than $60 million from Tiger Global, Accel and Google Capital.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: #QuikrCommonFloor trending on Twitter today
article: On the day Quikr acquired Common Floor, #QuikrCommonFloor was trending on Twitter in India on Thursday. Quikr tweeted, "Hey @Commonfloor, where are you?" and Common Floor responded "@Quikr just entered the building. How about you?". They announced the merger over a conversation, "2nd floor lounge, lets meet on the @Commonfloor?", "Getting there @Quikr!", and "Home is where you come together!".

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Food tech startup FreshMenu raises ₹110 crore
article: Bengaluru-based food tech startup FreshMenu on Friday raised a total of ₹110 crore in a funding round led by Zodius Capital and existing investor LightSpeed Ventures. FreshMenu is a food delivery startup with in-house kitchens operating at 17 locations in Bengaluru. The startup was founded in 2014 by IIM Ahmedabad alumni and former Ola cabs employee Rashmi Daga.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Baidu in talks to invest in Zomato, BookMyShow
article: Chinese internet giant Baidu is in talks to buy stakes in Indian e-commerce startups Zomato, BookMyShow and BigBasket. A spokesperson of the company said, "The Indian market represents an enormous opportunity for us to connect more people with services, and we plan to put more resources there in the future". However, Baidu did not comment on possible investment amounts.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Startups raise $38 mn in first 10 days of 2016
article: In the first 10 days of 2016, more than $38 million were invested in 29 Indian startups, with one series B and three series A fundraisers. The rest of the startups secured the investments in pre-series A deals. Notably, Delhi-NCR accounted for the maximum number of deals. Freshmenu, a food delivery startup, raised $16.5 million in series B funding.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Uber, Softbank founders to give tips to startups
article: Uber founder Travis Kalanick and SoftBank founder and CEO Masayoshi Son are among 40 business leaders who'll give inputs to the action plan for boosting India's startups, to be unveiled by PM Narendra Modi on January 16. Around 2,000 startups, angel investors, and venture capitalists are to participate in the day-long discussion on boosting growth and issues faced by startups.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: CCI dismisses Meru's allegations against Uber
article: The Competition Commission India (CCI) on Tuesday dismissed taxi aggregator Meru Cabs' allegations against rival Uber. Meru Cabs had alleged Uber of abusing its dominant position in Kolkata by way of predatory pricing of its services. However, CCI rejected Meru's allegations and ruled that Uber "does not hold a dominant position in the relevant market".

author: Smrithin Satishan
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in pet care portal DogSpot
article: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata on Monday invested an undisclosed amount in Gurgaon-based petcare portal DogSpot. Unilazer's Ronnie Screwvala also invested in this round along with Ashok Mittal, Rishi Parti, Dheeraj Jain and Abhijeet Pai. Started in 2007 by Rana Atheya, Shalesh Visen and Gaurav Malik, DogSpot has received funding from Unilazer, India Quotient and K Ganesh in 2014.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Food and drugs scanner to be unveiled in 2016
article: California-based technology startup Stratio Inc is set to unveil its first product called LinkSquare at the 2016 International CES in Las Vegas. LinkSquare is an infrared scanner that could determine the composition of food, pharmaceuticals, and physical objects and would communicate the data to the users' smartphone. The scanner could be used for verifying the authenticity of any such material.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bira91 raises $6 million in Series A funding
article: Craft beer startup Bira91 on Monday raised $6 million in Series A funding round led by Sequoia Capital. This is Sequoia's first ever investment in a local alcoholic beverage brand. Snapdeal founders Kunal Bahl, Rohit Bansal and Zomato Founder Deepinder Goyal and ChrysCapital Co-Founder Ashish Dhawan also participated. Founded in 2013 by Ankur Jain, Bira91 makes craft beer in India.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Travel app for kids crowdfunded on Kickstarter
article: A Kickstarter project by Bulbul Apps, 'Tuk-Tuk goes to Hyderabad', generated $2000 in crowdfunding to make a travel app that will help kids discover Hyderabad. The app will tell an interactive story of the city using rhymes and videos featuring an auto rickshaw for children aged 0-8 years. The app makers had recently launched a similar app for Mumbai.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Meru Cabs launches ride sharing feature in Delhi
article: Taxi aggregator Meru Cabs on Tuesday launched a new 'Ride Share' feature in Delhi. Available on its app, the feature will let users share their cab with another passenger travelling in the same direction. A discount of 30% on the estimated fare on every ride has been fixed by Meru for the feature.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grofers CTO Varun Khurana resigns
article: Gurgaon-based hyperlocal grocery delivery platform Grofers' Chief Technology Officer, Varun Khurana resigned on Thursday. The next move of Khurana, who was yet to complete a year in the company, could not be ascertained. The company has not decided on a replacement yet. Founded in 2013, Grofers is an on-demand grocery delivery platform that connects users with local merchants.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Poor VC-backed exits double since 2010
article: US-based CB Insights has released a report on the VC-backed companies that raised at least $50M in funding but were sold for a much lesser amount. Data highlights that the number of poor exits has doubled from 9 in 2010 to 18 in 2015. Some of the high-profile exits include LiveScribe raising $102M before being acquired by Anoto for $15M.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 360Ride raises ₹1 crore in seed funding
article: Bengaluru-based ride sharing platform 360Ride on Tuesday raised ₹1 crore in seed funding from a Delhi-based investor. Launched in 2015 by Lokesh Bevara and Varaprasad Moida, 360Ride lets users share rides with verified co-travellers heading towards common destinations. Services of 360Rides are currently available in Bengaluru, Delhi, Noida and Gurgaon.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Govt to seek inputs from VCs on startup plan
article: The government is seeking inputs from incubators and venture funds to launch an action plan for startups to be launched by PM Narendra Modi on January 16, 2016. It will include the definition of startups with related incentives and exemptions. An interactive portal and app are also being developed by the Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion for this purpose.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: E-commerce revenue may hit $38 bn in '16: Study
article: According to a study by Assocham, the revenue drawn by the E-commerce industry in 2016 is likely to hit $38 billion, as against a $23 billion revenue in 2015. The study, which revealed that Mumbai is ranked first in online shopping (followed by Delhi, Ahmedabad, Bengaluru and Kolkata), suggested 33% customers in Tier-1 and Tier-2 cities make transactions through mobiles.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Ola launches private car pooling in Delhi-NCR
article: Online cab aggregator Ola on Monday launched a feature on its app which will allow users in Delhi-NCR to share rides on their cars with other users. The 'Carpool' feature will help Delhi residents pool their cars during the odd-even scheme implementation from January 1, the company said. Notably, Uber had recently launched a similar feature for users in Delhi-NCR.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: CarDekho launches virtual car experience feature
article: Online auto classifieds platform CarDekho on Monday launched a new feature on its app that gives the users to virtually experience the car. Available on both Android and iOS platforms, the new feature 'Feel the Car' gives users a 360 degree view of interior and exterior of a car with text pop-ups of the features and recreated sounds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bumper app raises $500k in seed funding
article: Bengaluru-based car service and repair app Bumper on Monday raised $500,000 in a seed funding round led by SAIF Partners. Founded in 2015, Bumper lets users upload dent photos, pick a price quote sent by the service provider and track service status. It claims to facilitate appointments at over 100 car workshops in Bengaluru.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Yuvraj Singh invests in Rahul Yadav's startup
article: Yuvraj Singh's YouWeCan Ventures has invested an undisclosed amount in Rahul Yadav's new startup, Intelligent Interfaces. "Proud to back Rahul Yadav and Intelligent Interfaces (ii) in helping the Government govern 100x better with the help of technology. Get ready for the (r)evolution!," Singh said in a Facebook post. The startup will provide technology solutions to various government departments.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Firm issues shares on Nasdaq Blockchain Platform
article: Chain, the company which helped American stock exchange Nasdaq build blockchain technology (used by Bitcoin) powered securities platform Linq, issued shares to a private investor in the first-ever private share issuance using the technology. The move "marks a major advance in the global financial sector and.. could revolutionise the core of capital markets infrastructure systems", said Nasdaq CEO.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber launches uberCOMMUTE in Bengaluru
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber on Monday launched its new service uberCOMMUTE in Bengaluru. The service lets users with private cars share rides with other users headed in the same direction. The service will be available to Uber users across Bengaluru from 7am to 9pm. The service was first launched in Delhi in December 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grofers shuts down operations in nine cities
article: Hyperlocal grocery delivery startup Grofers has shut down its operations in nine cities after receiving low response for its services. The nine cities include Bhopal, Bhubaneswar, Coimbatore, Kochi, Ludhiana, Mysore, Nashik, Rajkot and Visakhapatnam. “The smaller cities are not ready for hyperlocal business yet, once they are, we will reconsider our strategy,” said Founder Albinder Dhindsa.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Startups write to TRAI supporting net neutrality
article: Founders of nine startups including Zomato and Paytm wrote a joint letter to TRAI showing their support to net neutrality. The letter called on TRAI to restrict telecom operators "from acting as gate-keepers offering restricted Internet services instead of the open internet”. The regulator had recently reopened the net neutrality debate by issuing a consultation paper on differential pricing.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Housing may sell stakes to Snapdeal, News Corp
article: Mumbai-based online real estate marketplace Housing is reportedly in talks with e-commerce portal Snapdeal and media company News Corp to sell its stakes. As per the report, the talks are in early stage and a deal could be struck at the end of the second quarter next year. Housing is selling stakes to recover its losses, the report added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm acquires Shifu app for $8 million
article: Online payments and m-commerce platform Paytm on Monday acquired app-based personal assistant Shifu for $8 million. Founded in 2012 by Prashant Singh, Deepansh Jain and Michael Massey, Shifu is an Android app that makes personalised recommendations to users on the basis of their smartphone usage pattern. Shifu's 20-member team including the founders will join Paytm.

author: Ankur Vyas
abstract: Uber completes 1 billion rides since launch
article: The cab-hailing startup, Uber, said that it has completed 1 billion rides since its launch in June 2010. The 1 billionth ride took place on Christmas Eve in London, and the billionth rider has been given one-year of free Uber services (upto £10,000). With presence in 68 countries, Uber is considered to be the most valued startup in the world.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kolkata has the slowest moving traffic: Ola Cabs
article: Data collected by Taxi aggregator Ola Cabs over the last six months revealed on Thursday that Kolkata city has the slowest moving traffic in India. The data also showed that 6:30 pm is the time when traffic across all Indian cities is at its peak. Timing between 3 am-4 am emerged as the best time to be on Indian roads.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Lyft raises $500 million from General Motors
article: American ride-sharing service Lyft on Monday raised $500 million from General Motors (GM). The motor company also announced a strategic alliance with Lyft to develop a self-driving car system. GM's $500 million investment is a part of Lyft's $1 billion fund raising round which also saw participation from ride-hailing service Didi Kuaidi and Alibaba Group.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: 'Foodpanda to shut its own delivery in 6 cities'
article: According to a Mint report, food delivery service Foodpanda will shut down its own delivery in six cities across India including Kolkata and Chennai starting January 2016. The company will outsource its delivery in these cities. While Foodpanda promised to honour all contracts with its employees, an official claimed that only those in Chennai will get three-month notice period pay.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bengaluru's GoZoomo lays off over 130 employees
article: According to a report by YourStory on Sunday, used car marketplace GoZoomo reduced 35% of its staff by laying off over 130 employees in December 2015. "We stopped some manual processes that won’t scale well," said SAIF Partners- backed GoZoomo. Founded in 2014, GoZoomo's platform lets users perform peer-to-peer transactions related to used cars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New York startup develops smart door latch
article: New York based startup, Latch has developed a keyless entry system or a smart latch, that lets users access doors through an app. The smart latch consists of a circular touchscreen and a camera that records every action at the front of the door. The app can also unlock the door automatically after sensing the phone in a user's pocket.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Helion VC sees exit of three partners
article: VC firm Helion Ventures on Wednesday announced the exit of three of its partners including Rahul Chowdhri, Ritesh Banglani and Alok Goyal. The trio is reportedly planning to launch their own fund to invest in startups. With over $600 million under management, Helion's Founders, Sanjeev Aggarwal, Ashish Gupta and Rahul Chandra will continue to lead the investments.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber launches services in four more cities
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber on Thursday launched its services in four more cities namely Ajmer, Jodhpur, Udaipur and Mangalore. With this launch, Uber has become operational in 26 cities across India. The company said the availability of cabs will be limited and the estimated time of arrival may be longer during the launch phase in the cities added on its map.

author: Shruti Nagpal
abstract: India's 1st artificial human liver tissue built
article: Bengaluru-based biotech startup Pandorum Technologies has used the 3D printing technology to make India’s first artificial human liver tissue. The tissue, which was made using glucose, protein and live human cells as printer ink, is capable of performing functions including detoxification, metabolism and biochemical secretion. The company claims the mini-liver can prove essential in drug research.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Domestic fund managers raise $4.3 bn in 2015
article: According to data from financial research platform VCCEdge, domestic fund managers have raised $4.3 billion from Indian and overseas investors in 2015, the highest in last four years. The rise was primarily attributed to an increase in exits from previous investments. Fund manager firms manage the investment of money from investors on their behalf.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Microsoft buys data analytics startup Metanautix
article: Microsoft has acquired Metanautix, a US-based data analytics startup that helps companies draw insights out of big data, in an undisclosed deal. Microsoft will integrate Metanautix into its “data platform, including SQL Server and the Cortana Analytics Suite.” Metanautix was founded in 2012 and reportedly had a backing of $7 million in capital.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: RBI launches forex helpline for startups
article: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Tuesday launched a dedicated email-based helpline for Indian startups to provide regulatory guidance for undertaking cross-border transactions. Cross-border transactions by Indian residents are eligible for regulatory regime under the Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999. RBI also urged the enterprises to provide complete information while posting a query.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Flipkart starts selling motorcycles, cars online
article: Flipkart has ventured into the automobile market space and started selling motorcycles and cars on its platform in Bangalore. The company has tied up with two local dealers, Khivraj Motors for Bajaj motorcycles and Kalyani Motors for Maruti Suzuki cars. Last month, Snapdeal started offering the same with the launch of Snapdeal Motors.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Two men arrested for duping Flipkart of ₹50,000
article: Atul Sharma and Naveen Kumar on Friday were arrested in Hyderabad for allegedly duping e-commerce platform Flipkart of ₹51,590. The accused complained to Flipkart about an ordered iPhone they didn't receive and asked for a refund. Later by tracking the IMEI number, the police identified the missing phone in Sharma's possession, who was then arrested along with Kumar.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sports startup KOOH raises $2 mn in Series D
article: Sports education, training  and technology startup KOOH on Friday raised $2 million in Series D funding from existing investors including TCS, HDFC and Faering Capital. Sports promotion service Elevate Sports also participated in the round. Founded in 2010 by Susir Kumar and Prabhu Srinivasan, the Mumbai-based startup delivers grass root level sports programme for children at schools.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: PepperTap acquires Bengaluru-based Jiffstore
article: On demand grocery delivery platform PepperTap on Monday acquired Bengaluru-based grocery delivery startup Jiffstore for an undisclosed amount. As a part of the acquisition, Jiffstore's team will join PepperTap offices in Bengaluru and Gurgaon. Founded in August 2013, Jiffstore through its online and mobile platform delivers groceries to its users from their nearby stores.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bengaluru-based Shotang raises ₹33 crore
article: Bengaluru-based online B2B marketplace, Shotang on Wednesday raised ₹33 crore in fresh funding from Exfinity Venture Partners and Unitus Impact. The startup was founded in 2013 by Anish Basu Roy and Anterpreet Singh. Shotang through its online platform connects retailers, distributors and manufacturers to fulfil their inventory requirements.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Uber to set up 1st engineering centre in India
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber is setting up its first engineering centre in Bengaluru in an effort to create customised solutions for the domestic market. The firm will be hiring engineers and products managers in India who will work closely with the San Francisco team. It has recently launched services in four more cities namely Ajmer, Jodhpur, Udaipur and Mangalore.

author: Prashanti Moktan
abstract: Action plan for 'Start up India' on Jan 16: PM
article: PM Narendra Modi in his 'Mann ki Baat' radio programme on Sunday said that the action plan for the 'Start up India, Stand up India' initiative will be launched on January 16. He added that NITs, IITs, IIMs will be connected 'live' to the launch programme. The initiative aims to boost entrepreneurship in India by promoting bank financing for start-ups.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Aspiring Minds acquires Delhi-based Letsintern
article: Talent assessment company Aspiring Minds on Monday acquired Delhi-based internship discovery platform Letsintern for an undisclosed amount. A 12-member team, Letsintern will continue to operate as an independent brand. Founded in 2010 by Rishabh Gupta and Pranay Swarup, the online and mobile platform of Letsintern connects students to organisations, career services and each other.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: SIDBI clears $140 mn from fund-of-funds
article: Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) has cleared $140 million from the $302 million fund-of-funds launched in August for supporting VC funds. India Aspiration Fund (IAF), under SIDBI has screened 30 VC funds since launch and has issued sanction letters to more than half of them. Funds supported through IAF include Blume, Orios, Yournest, Ivy cap and Infuse Ventures.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: India 3rd biggest startup hub globally
article: India is presently the third biggest startup hub globally with over 4,200 emerging companies set up in the country. The number of startups has increased by 40% from 2014 to 2015, with Bangalore, Mumbai and NCR continuing to be the top destinations for the companies. Net funding has reportedly gone up 125% to $4.9 billion in 2015 against 2014.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Shuttl raises $20 million in Series A funding
article: Bus aggregating platform Shuttl on Tuesday raised $20 million in Series A funding round from Lightspeed Venture Partners, Times Internet and Sequoia Capital. Founded in 2015 by Deepanshu Malviya and Amit Singh, Shuttl is a mobile-based minibus service that connects passengers to buses plying on specific routes. The services of Shuttl are currently available in Delhi NCR.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: PepperTap closes Series B funding at $40 million
article: On demand grocery delivery platform PepperTap on Monday raised additional $4 million from Innoven Capital to close its Series B round at $40 million. PepperTap in September raised $36 million in Series B funding led by Snapdeal and others. Founded in 2014 by Navneet Singh and Milind Sharma, PepperTap claims delivering groceries to users within two hours across 25 cities.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Mech Mocha raises funding from Flipkart & Blume
article: Mobile gaming startup Mech Mocha on Wednesday raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Blume Ventures and Flipkart. Launched in June 2013 by Arpita Kapoor and Mohit Rangaraju, Mech Mocha launched its first game 'Puppet Punch' in January. It had earlier raised funds from IIM Ahmedabad's incubator Centre for Innovation Incubation and Entrepreneurship (CIIE) and other angel investors.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart launches global brand licensing
article: Flipkart on Monday launched a new initiative of brand licensing to connect international brands with Indian sellers. Flipkart in tie up with Viacom 18 has partnered with Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Spongebob Squarepants and Peanuts to sell their merchandise through its platform. The company claims to eliminate any fake products in these sales through its analytics and control.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Startups bag $8.4 billion funding in 2015
article: As per data compiled by technology and startup blog trak.in, as many as 936 deals worth over $8.4 billion took place in 2015, up from 304 deals worth $5 billion in 2014. E-commerce majors like Flipkart and Snapdeal, and taxi-hailing app Ola, dominated the startup investments. Investors including SoftBank and Alibaba pumped huge sums into the Indian startup space.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Micromax unveils payments solution for users
article: In a first, domestic handset maker Micromax on Tuesday tied up with digital payments platform TranServ to launch smartphone-based payments solution for its users. Micromax will enable all its users to perform online banking and payments through an integrated software which will use the mobile as a platform to deliver these services.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Palantir raises $880 mn, becomes 4th most valued
article: Silicon Valley-based big data startup, Palantir has raised $880 million in its latest financing round, taking the total funds raised to $2.32 billion. It provides a data analytics tool used by government agencies and law enforcement for security purposes. Valued at $20.33 billion,  it's now the fourth most-valued startup behind Uber ($51 billion), Xiaomi ($46 billion) and Airbnb ($25.5 billion).

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyderabad-based SBricks acquires Melway
article: Hyderabad-based on-demand home services provider SBricks has acquired facility management startup Melway for an undisclosed amount. As a part of the acquisition, 200 professionals from Melway will join SBricks. Founded in 2015 by Nithin Reddy, SBricks through its online and mobile platform connects users with professionals that provide household services.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Uber launches chopper ride service on Christmas
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber has partnered with online vehicle marketplace 'Droom' to launch chopper rides exclusively on Christmas day through UberCHOPPER. Users from Pune, Delhi, Bengaluru and Mumbai can log into the app between 10 am-12 noon on Friday to avail the service while the rides will be available between 1 pm-3 pm. A single chopper ride will cost ₹4,999.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Info Edge invests ₹15 crore in Canvera
article: Info Edge, the parent company of Naukri and 99acres, on Thursday invested ₹15 crore into online photography startup Canvera Digital Technologies. This latest round takes Info Edge’s total investment in the Bengaluru-based startup to ₹90.1 crore. The company now owns a 49% stake in the startup, Info Edge said in a stock exchange filing.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: $1.2 bn invested in grocery tech in 2015: Tracxn
article: Analytics firm Tracxn on Wednesday released a report on Grocery tech, covering startups that provide an online platform for buying and selling grocery items. It highlights that 2015 witnessed the highest amount of investments till date with $1.2 billion invested through 45 deals. Majority of the late stage deals took place in the hyperlocal-horizontal and food-recipe box sub segments.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BlaBlaCar to launch rides as per odd-even scheme
article: Ride-sharing service BlaBlaCar on Sunday announced to launch a new feature from January 2016 to let users in Delhi avail rides on specific days in accordance with their number plates. The move comes in the wake of the Delhi government introducing odd-even formula to ply cars from January 1, 2016 in order to curb rising air pollution.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart's Bansals back Rahul Yadav's startup
article: Former Housing CEO Rahul Yadav on Friday announced that Flipkart Co-Founders Sachin and Binny Bansal have infused undisclosed seed funding in his new startup, Intelligent Interfaces. The startup with its various internet and technology tools will help government departments to save costs. “We will get our first business from a government department in two weeks,” Yadav said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal introduces regional languages on app
article: Online retail platform Snapdeal on Tuesday made its mobile app available in Hindi and Telugu languages to users. Snapdeal also announced to make its app available in nine more regional languages including Gujarati, Tamil, Marathi, Bengali, Kannada, Malayalam, Oriya, Assamese and Punjabi by January 26, 2016. Snapdeal's mobile app is currently available only in English language.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tata invests in services marketplace UrbanClap
article: Ratan Tata, Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons on Thursday invested an undisclosed amount in services marketplace UrbanClap. In November this year, UrbanClap raised $25 million in Series B funding round led by Bessemer Venture Partners. Founded in 2014 by Abhiraj Bhal, Raghav Chandra and Varun Khaitan, UrbanClap lets users discover and hire professionals for more than 80 services.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Weddingz raises ₹8.2 cr in pre-Series A funding
article: Mumbai-based wedding marketplace Weddingz on Tuesday raised ₹8.2 crore in pre-Series A funding round led by  Google's Rajan Anandan and others. Founded in 2015 by Sandeep Lodha, Weddingz through its platform lets users connect with the wedding services providers. The startup also runs an e-commerce portal featuring over 150 designers and brands for bridal ideas.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Housejoy raises ₹150 cr in Series B funding
article: Online home services provider Housejoy on Wednesday raised ₹150 crore in Series B funding led by Amazon India and existing investors Matrix Partners among others. Founded in January 2015, Housejoy allows customers to book the services of plumbers, technicians and electricians among others. The startup raised $4 million (around ₹26 crore) from Matrix Partners in June this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rivigo raises $30 million led by SAIF Partners
article: Gurgaon-based logistics startup Rivigo on Thursday raised $30 million in Series B funding round led by SAIF Partners. Founded in 2014 by Deepak Garg and Gazal Kalra, Rivigo provides and manages long haul logistics services. Rivigo also claims to deliver in difficult geographies including Eastern parts of India. The startup last raised $10 million in May from SAIF Partners.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Canadian startup selling fresh air to China
article: In the wake of China's severe smog problem and red-alert situation in Beijing, a Canadian startup named Vitality Air has been selling bottled fresh air from the Rocky mountains to the Chinese population. Firm's founder Moses Lam claimed that they have sold 500 bottles in under 10 days which costs around $25 per 150-shot air bottle.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Shuttl, Ola Shuttle services stopped in Gurgaon
article: Shuttle services provided by Ola Shuttle and Shuttl in Haryana's Gurgaon were suspended by the state government on Friday. Gurgaon's Regional Transport Office said the services do not fall under the range of Haryana Contract Carriage Permit Act 1988, 1993, 2001, 2004, and 2013. The state government has also seized 20 vehicles run by Ola Shuttle and Shuttl.

author: Shruti Nagpal
abstract: SeekSherpa to launch food tour bus in Delhi
article: Travel startup SeekSherpa has partnered with TV network VH1 for a food tour bus in Delhi which will take food enthusiasts on a tour of five city restaurants on December 19 and 25. The three-hour journey will begin at Hauz Khas metro station and will offer one complimentary dish at each restaurant. Travellers will have to book tickets before boarding.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: ShopClues launches online wedding store
article: Indian online marketplace ShopClues has launched an entire online wedding store on its platform. In addition to apparel, footwear and accessories, the store offers an assortment of wedding add-ons including travel and grooming essentials. Nitin Kochhar, VP-Categories, said, “[W]e are committed to introducing properties and sales formats that most appeal to our mass market consumers”.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: CapriCoast raises $3.5 mn in Series A funding
article: Bengaluru-based online modular furniture solutions provider CapriCoast on Monday raised $3.5 million in Series A funding round led by Accel Partners and Singapore-based RB Investments. Founded in January 2015 by Jawad Ayaz, the online-to-offline model of CapriCoast lets users pick modular kitchen and wardrobe designs. CapriCoast in April raised $1.25 million in seed funding from Accel Partners.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Google announces accelerator for mobile startups
article: Google on Wednesday announced a six-month equity-free accelerator program called 'Launchpad accelerator' focussed primarily on mobile-based startups from India, Brazil, and Indonesia. The program is set to commence from January 18 with the first wave of 24 selected startups who will be guided by industry experts. The members would be provided with $250,000 worth of assistance and seed fund.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Anand Mahindra invests in LocalCircles
article: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Thursday invested an undisclosed amount in citizen engagement platform LocalCircles. Mahindra will also join the advisory board of the firm. Founded in 2013, LocalCircles through its platform lets citizens connect with various causes and seek assistance from other citizens to resolve civic issues of urban daily lives.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Ola launches ride-sharing feature in Delhi-NCR
article: In the wake of Delhi's odd-even car ruling, taxi-hailing app Ola on Tuesday launched a ride-sharing feature, Ola Share, in Delhi-NCR. Through this feature, passengers travelling on the same route can share rides with other passengers of the same social group. The company will also reportedly offer a 50% discount on Ola Share fares over the next month.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Freshdesk acquires Chennai-based startup Konotor
article: Customer support software Freshdesk on Wednesday acquired Chennai-based user engagement platform Konotor. Founded in 2012 by Srikrishnan Ganesan, Vignesh Girishankar and Deepak Balasubramanyam, Konotor engages users on mobile apps by adding a two-way messaging option. Freshdesk also acquired live chat provider 1Click and social recommendation app Frilp earlier in 2015.

author: Jatan Desai
abstract: Flipkart most googled term in India in 2015
article: According to the Google Trends, Flipkart was the most googled term in India in 2015. IRCTC, SBI (State Bank of India), Amazon and Snapdeal completed the top five. The top three states or union territories that googled for Flipkart were Dadra and Nagar Haveli, Pondicherry and Goa. Visakhapatnam, Coimbatore and Vijayawada were the top three cities which googled Flipkart.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Chillr raises $7 mn in Series A led by Sequoia
article: Peer-to-peer mobile payment app Chillr on Thursday raised $7 million in Series A funding round led by Sequoia Capital. Blume Ventures and Uniqorn Ventures also participated in the funding round. Founded in 2014 by Sony Joy, Chillr app is available on Android, iOS and Windows platform and lets users transfer money directly between bank accounts using just the mobile number.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Farmville, HTC executives to seed fund VR firms
article: The co-creator of FarmVille, Amitt Mahajan has partnered with Paul Bragiel and HTC executive Phil Chen to create a new venture fund 'Presence Capital' to invest in Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality startups. Presence Capital will invest $10 million in AR and VR firms, who have reportedly raised a combined fund of $3.8 billion in the past five years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: PropheSee raises over $500k in angel funding
article: Digital marketing analytics firm PropheSee on Thursday raised $516,000 in angel funding round led by Indian Angel Network and Stanford Angels and Entrepreneurs India. Angel investor Ajay Lavakare will join PropheSee's Board. Founded in 2014 by Ishaan Sethi, Harshil Gurha and Jitesh Luthra, Delhi-based PropheSee helps brands strengthen their digital presence through data analytics.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Infosys invests $3 million in US-based WHOOP
article: United States-based wearable technology maker WHOOP on Monday announced to have raised $3 million from IT major Infosys. The transaction will be completed by December 16. Founded in 2012 by Will Ahmed, John Capodilupo and Aurelian Nicolae, WHOOP makes wearable devices for athletes to track their physiological activities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber to launch pvt car pooling service on Dec 16
article: In the wake of Delhi government adopting odd-even formula from January, Taxi-hailing app Uber on Monday announced to launch a platform for private car owners to share rides from December 16. Uber will let users avail the service through the uberGO option on its app. Fares for these rides will be 10-30% less expensive than the usual Uber rides.

author: Chhavi Tyagi
abstract: Uber gives free rides to Saudi women voters
article: Taxi aggregator Uber on Saturday offered free rides to women voters in Saudi Arabia as they headed to cast their vote in municipal elections for the first time in the history of the country. Notably, Saudi women are not allowed to drive. Several other restrictions on them include travelling, marrying and working without the consent of a male family member.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Holisol Logistics raises ₹67 crore from CLSA
article: Supply chain solutions provider Holisol Logistics on Friday raised around ₹67 crore ($10 million) in a funding round led by CLSA Capital Partners at a valuation of around ₹400-500 crore. Founded in June 2009, Delhi-based Holisol Logistics is a supply chain operations company that designs, implements & manages logistics solutions across various businesses.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Promote startup listings in India: SEBI to banks
article: At an investment bankers meet on Tuesday, SEBI Chairman UK Sinha asked merchant bankers to promote listing startups in India. He also asked them to come up with ideas to help list companies on exchanges at an early stage and generate capital. "If the review of regulations is needed, SEBI won’t hesitate to look at them," he said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Eatfresh raises fresh funding from Kalaari
article: Bengaluru-based on demand food startup Eatfresh on Thursday raised an undisclosed amount in funding from Kalaari Capital. The startup was founded in 2015 by Rajiv Subramanian. Eatfresh through its online platform and mobile app lets users order Indian, European, Mediterranean and Oriental cuisines prepared by top-rated chefs within 45 minutes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zomato pulls out from advertising on porn sites
article: Food discovery and review platform Zomato on Thursday pulled out from advertising on pornographic websites for its new ordering service Zomato Order. The move comes in the wake of criticism. "All porn is not legal, and by advertising on porn websites, we are financially supporting abuse - certainly something we don't want to do. Ever," said Deepinder Goyal, Zomato CEO.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Faasos raises $30 million in funding
article: On-demand food ordering and delivery mobile application Faasos on Monday raised $30 million in a funding round led by Russian firm ru-Net. Sequoia Capital, Lightbox Ventures  and other existing investors also participated in the round. Founded in 2010 by Jaydeep Barman and Kallol Banerjee, the Pune-based startup lets users order food through its mobile application in over 11 cities.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Device connecting cars to the internet unveiled
article: The CEO of Caruma Technologies Chris Carson unveiled a portable device called the 'The Caruma' to connect regular cars to the internet. It can monitor driver performance, mileage and record visual data from inside and outside the car in case of thefts or accidents. The $400 device is expected to be available in the market from June 2016.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: APUS Group launches ₹300 crore fund for startups
article: APUS Group, a China-based Android app developer, has set up an investment fund of ₹300 crore for Indian startups. The fund, centered around mobile internet innovation projects, will back early stage startups in terms of financial support, user resource, traffic support, and marketing promotion. According to a report, India has the world's second-highest number of internet users.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Quikr buys property analytics firm realtycompass
article: Cross-category classifieds platform Quikr on Thursday acquired realtycompass, a real-estate analytics service that provides customers with data regarding builder ratings. The service will be integrated into QuikrHomes, Quikr’s real-estate vertical launched in September. This is Quikr’s second real-estate acquisition after Indian Realty Exchange, a mobile-first real estate agent aggregator.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Delhi: UberASSIST launched for differently-abled
article: On the occasion of World Disability Day, Uber on Thursday launched uberASSIST in Delhi, a service aimed at aiding the differently-abled. Under this, Uber will send trained drivers who will assist commuters in their accessibility needs like storing wheelchairs. The service, to be soon rolled out in other cities across India, can be availed by entering the promo code 'ASSISTDEL'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: CustomFurnish raises ₹30 cr from Agnus Capital
article: Online platform for custom made furniture CustomFurnish on Monday raised ₹30 crore in a fresh funding round from Agnus Capital. Founded in 2014 by Madhukar Gangadi, CustomFurnish lets users design furniture, provides quotes on the cost and delivers the product once it is ready. With three manufacturing units in Hyderabad, CustomFurnish produces kitchen cabinets, wardrobes, sofas and curtains.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Govt launches 'Start-Up' programme in 14 states
article: The government on Monday launched a four-year Start-Up Village Entrepreneurship Programme (SVEP) to support and train 1.82 lakh rural entrepreneurs in 40 blocks across 14 states. At an estimated cost of ₹484 crore, the SVEP will help startup entrepreneurs to choose the right enterprise and run it. SVEP will also arrange for loans to start and run these enterprises.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber temporarily shuts UberAUTO in Delhi
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber on Tuesday temporarily shut its auto-rickshaw service UberAUTO in Delhi. "We are temporarily removing this product to solve specific problems that need to be resolved to help it scale,” said a press release by Uber. The company launched the cash-only auto-rickshaw service UberAUTO in April this year. India is reportedly Uber's biggest market after the United States.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: OnePlus X to be available on Ola app on Dec 8
article: Chinese smartphone manufacturer OnePlus on Saturday announced a partnership with taxi-hailing app Ola to let users buy smartphone OnePlus X from the Ola app on December 8. Without an invite, the smartphone will be delivered to customers in seven cities within 15 minutes from clicking the 'ONEPLUSX' icon on the Ola app between 10:00 am to 7:00 pm.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Inshorts featured in Google's Best Apps of 2015
article: News aggregator app Inshorts has featured in the Google Play Store's 'Best Apps of 2015' list. The list features Google's selection of 50 mobile applications across apps, games and entertainment categories in the Play Store. Available on both Android and iOS, Inshorts offers stories summarised in 60 words or less for quick consumption.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Yumist raises $2 million in pre-Series A funding
article: On demand food delivery company Yumist on Wednesday raised $2 million in pre-Series A funding led by Ronnie Screwvala’s fund Unilazer Ventures. Existing investors Orios Venture Partners and Steven Lurie also participated. Founded in 2014 by Alok Jain and Abhimanyu Maheshwari, the Gurgaon-based startup lets users order food through its website, Android and iOS platforms.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Uber launches its 1st desktop app on Windows 10
article: Uber has launched its first desktop app on Windows 10 and became a universal Windows app regardless of the device. The app is Cortana-enabled, allowing users to book cabs through voice commands. Also, if the app is pinned to the Start menu, “the Live Tile will display the estimated time” for a cab's arrival, eliminating the need to open the app repeatedly.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: EasyKhaana raises $100k in angel funding
article: Online food ordering website EasyKhaana on Thursday raised $100,000 in angel funding. Founded in 2015 by Aayush Anand and Vishrut Gawri, EasyKhaana through its online platform or a call lets users order meals from its centralised kitchen in New Delhi. Currently, EasyKhaana delivers meals in Gurgaon, West Delhi and Central Delhi.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: MobiKwik ties up with IRCTC for mobile payments
article: Mobile payment company MobiKwik on Tuesday announced a partnership with IRCTC to integrate its mobile wallet system for payments through IRCTC's Android app. Payment from MobiKwik wallet would directly be made from within the retailer's platform thus making transaction failure non-existent, Mobikwik CEO said. MobiKwik was founded in 2009 and reportedly claims a user base of 25 million users.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Flipkart hires ex-Tata Communications executive
article: Flipkart on Monday appointed former Tata Communications executive Sanjiv Saddy as the Senior Vice President of Corporate Affairs and Business Development. In his new role, Saddy will look after tax policy issues and building relations with stakeholders and the government. Previously, he was the SVP and Head of Business Support, Regulatory, Real Estate & Corporate Affairs at Tata Communications.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ShopClues invests in services app HeyBiz
article: Online shopping platform ShopClues on Tuesday invested an undisclosed amount in the seed funding round of real-time chat based hyperlocal services app HeyBiz. Founded by Bhartesh Chhibbar in 2014, HeyBiz is an app-only platform that lets users discover local products and services. ShopClues recently announced that it is planning to invest around $50 million in various startups.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Flipkart acquires minority stake in MapmyIndia
article: Flipkart has acquired a minority stake in digital maps provider MapmyIndia. The deal is aimed at strengthening Flipkart’s supply chain using MapmyIndia’s licensed map data and location technologies. With this strategic investment, the financial details of which were not disclosed, MapmyIndia's early investors, Nexus Venture Partners and Lightbox Ventures, will reportedly exit the company.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Airbnb tops Glassdoor's best places to work list
article: Short-term home rental company Airbnb has topped career website Glassdoor’s annual list of top 50 companies to work for, across all categories. Google, which ranked first last year, slipped to the eighth spot. Bain and Company, Guidewire, Hubspot and Facebook were the other names in the top-five behind Airbnb. The rankings are based on ratings submitted by companies’ employees.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Govt sets up new mechanism to help startups
article: The Lok Sabha was informed on Wednesday that a mechanism called Self-Employment and Talent Utilisation (SETU) has been set up by the government to support startups and self-employment activities. Union Minister for Skill Development Rajiv Pratap Rudy said the mechanism has been established under the NITI Aayog and will focus on technology-driven areas.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Practo to send medicine packages to Chennai
article: Doctor discovery platform Practo on Saturday announced to send over 8,000 packs of medicines and other relief materials to flood-hit Chennai. It is also inviting contributions from public in the form of medicines, food and blankets. Furthermore, Practo has tied up with taxi-service Uber Bangalore to collect aid-material that can be sent through UberAID option available on Uber app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber plans to raise $2.1 bn led by Tiger Global
article: Taxi-hailing service Uber is reportedly planning to raise $2.1 billion in a funding round led by Tiger Global and other investors that will value the company at $62.5 billion. Funds raised from this round will reportedly be invested primarily in India and China. Uber's next round of investment in India is likely to be announced early next year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Leaf Wearables raises $250k in seed funding
article: Wearable technology maker Leaf Wearables on Monday raised $250,000 in seed funding from a clutch of seasoned investors. Founded in February 2015 by Avinash Bansal, Ayush Banka, Chiraag Kapil, Manik Mehta and Paras Batra, the Delhi-based startup has made a smart safety wearable device for women named 'Safer', which sends notifications and signals to registered phone numbers in an emergency.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Airbnb raises $1.5 billion in series E funding
article: US-based apartment and home-sharing portal, Airbnb on Monday raised $1.5 billion  in series E funding, with participation from 115 investors including Tiger Global, General Atlantic and Hillhouse Capital. Airbnb has now raised a total of $2.4 billion, valuing the firm at $25 billion, the third highest behind Uber ($51 billion) and Xiaomi ($46 billion) on the basis of venture-backed valuation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MagicTiger acquihires rival app Instano
article: Chat-based delivery startup MagicTiger on Thursday acquihired Bengaluru-based rival on-demand delivery service app Instano in an equity deal. As per the deal, the core team of Instano will join MagicTiger. Founded in 2015 by IIM Calcutta alumnus Pratyush Prasanna, MagicTiger is a chat-based platform that lets users order food, groceries, beauty, home services, pay bills and book tickets.

author: Sai Santosh
abstract: BlackBuck raises $25 mn in Series B funding
article: Zinka Logistics Solutions, owner of the online freight services aggregator BlackBuck, has raised $25 million from Tiger Global, Russian billionaire Yuri Milner’s personal investment firm Apoletto, Accel Partners and Flipkart in Series B funding round. Founded in April 2015 by Rajesh Yabaji, and Chanakya Hridaya, the company connects companies with trucks for inter-city goods transport.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nexus Venture announces new $450 million fund
article: Nexus Venture Partners on Tuesday announced a new $450 million fund, taking the fund at over $1 billion-mark in capital under management, a first for an Indian VC firm to reach the milestone. Nexus said that the capital will be infused in seed and early-stage deals. In 2012, Nexus raised $270 million in its previous fund.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm acquires hyperlocal services app Near
article: Online payments and m-commerce firm Paytm on Monday acquired hyperlocal services provider app Near for a cash-and-stock deal estimated at around $1.5-$2 million. Founded in July 2014 by Sunil Goyal, Lomesh Dutta and Akshay Khanna, the Gurgaon-based startup lets users discover home, wellness, rental, events and other services through its mobile app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Baxi raises $1.5 million in seed funding
article: On demand bike-hailing service Baxi on Monday raised $1.5 million in seed funding from a clutch of high-profile investors including Ajay Trehan and Alok Mittal. Founded by IIT Delhi alumni Ashutosh Johri and Manu Rana, Baxi lets users book bikes from its Android app or dedicated stands for commuting. Baxi is launching its services in Gurgaon from December 1, 2015.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tiger Global raises new global fund of $2.5 bn
article: A filing by the US regulator Securities & Exchange Commission has revealed that hedge fund Tiger Global Management has raised a new global fund of $2.5 billion. The new fund, Tiger Global Private Investment Partners X is the tenth venture capital fund by Tiger Global. Lee Fixel, Head of Tiger Global’s private equity and VC investing, will head the fund.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in S'pore-based Crayon Data
article: Singapore-based startup, Crayon Data raised an undisclosed amount of funding from the Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons, Ratan Tata riding on their flagship product, 'Maya'. Featured in the top 5 at the Watson Mobile Developer Challenge, Maya is a personalization engine which extends the firm's global vision of ‘Simplifying the world's choices' in retail, banking, hospitality domains.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Tooler raises ₹70 lakh in pre-Series A funding
article: Delhi-based on-demand laundry service startup, Tooler raised ₹70 lakh in pre-Series A funding led by CASHurDRIVE CEO, Raghu Khanna and Ex-Paytm GM, Sameer Gupta on Wednesday. Tooler's services include washing, ironing, dry cleaning and folding at the customer's doorsteps. Tooler would now be initiating their intended offline outlet chain and expand its operations in the National Capital Region.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: KountMoney raises undisclosed seed funding
article: Bangalore-based online lending platform, KountMoney has raised an undisclosed amount in the seed funding round led by Suashish Diamonds chairman and MD Ashish Goenka on Thursday. Founded in October 2015 by Abhishek Periwal, Deepak Modak and Abhi Ranjan, the startup provides the borrowers an online platform to avail fast and easy funding from institutional lenders.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Foxconn buys 10% stake in MoMagic
article: FIH Mobile Limited of Taiwan-based Foxconn Technology group has invested in an NCR-based mobile internet company MoMagic acquiring 10% stake on Monday. Founded in 2011 by former MediaTek Director Arun Gupta, MoMagic is a mobile app and internet firm providing applications and services on all mobile platforms. Notably, MoMagic had raised an undisclosed amount of funding from MediaTek in 2011.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Times Internet acquires Get Me A Shop
article: Times Internet on Tuesday acquired Get Me A Shop, a platform to establish and manage online stores, for an undisclosed amount. Founded in June 2013 by IIT BHU alumnus Pushkal Srivastava, Get Me A Shop lets offline businesses and local retailers enhance their online presence with payment, logistics and customer acquisition solutions.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: RoomsTonite raises $1.5 million in angel funding
article: Bengaluru-based on demand hotel booking platform RoomsTonite on Wednesday raised $1.5 million in angel funding from a clutch of investors. Lashit Sanghvi, Nikhil Vora,Venkat Vardhan, Mohammed Bin Abdul Rehman Al Khalifa and Ralph Berezan participated in the round. Founded in 2014 by Suresh John, RoomsTonite is a mobile-only hotel booking app that lets users book rooms at the last minute.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Calling app 'Ringo' in trouble with TRAI
article: Ringo, the low-cost calling app launched last week, suspended all domestic calls indefinitely until it gets clearance from Telecom Regulation Authority of India (TRAI). Under TRAI regulations, Ringo's strategy of connecting calls using conference bridges after aggregating voice minutes in bulk is not allowed. Network providers have reportedly started blocking Ringo calls using back-end support.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grofers raises $120M in funding led by SoftBank
article: Hyperlocal online delivery platform Grofers on Wednesday raised $120 million in fresh funding led by SoftBank. Russian entrepreneur Yuri Milner and existing investors Tiger Global and Sequoia Capital also participated. Founded in 2013 by Saurabh Kumar and Albinder Dhindsa, Grofers connects consumers with local stores. Softbank is reportedly expected to acquire 20-30% stake in Grofers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: GOQii raises $13.4 million in Series A funding
article: Fitness technology venture, GOQii on Thursday raised $13.4 million in Series A funding round led by New Enterprise Associates. Cheetah Mobile, Great Wall Club, DSG Consumer Partners, Ilkka Paananen and Pravin Gandhi also participated in the round. Founded in 2014 by Vishal Gondal, GOQii combines wearable technology with one-on-one mobile coaching and fitness tracking for users.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Wingify acquires US-based Navilytics
article: Delhi-based website optimization tool making company Wingify on Monday acquired US-based analytical tools provider Navilytics. Founded in early 2009 by Paras Chopra, Wingify's Visual Website Optimizer website testing tool lets users track the behaviour of visitors on a website. Wingify had also acquired US-based website feedback provider startup Concept Feedback last year.

author: Prashanti Moktan
abstract: India's 1st diabetes app to launch device soon
