article: Claiming to be India's first and only diabetes app, Diabeto will reportedly launch its remote blood glucose monitoring device by 2015-end. The app, which enables patients to track their blood glucose data and save it on the cloud, was launched on World Diabetes Day. Diabeto's co-founder Shreekant Pawar said that the app is "a 360-degree management solution" for diabetes.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Airbus sets up business accelerator in B'luru
article: France-based aviation organization, Airbus inaugurated an aerospace business accelerator BizLab for startups in Bengaluru on Wednesday making it their third such setup of the year. Reportedly with this setup, Airbus has also started accepting project entries from early-staged startups for the screening process to be carried out by the Chief Innovation Officer and the Head of the Airbus BizLabs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: CCD ties up with Swiggy for home delivery
article: Coffee chain Café Coffee Day on Wednesday announced tie up with online food ordering and delivery service Swiggy for delivering its beverages and snacks at home. To be launched initially in Bengaluru, customers within 3-4km radius will be able to place orders through the Swiggy app. Swiggy was founded in August 2014 by Rahul Jaimini,  Sriharsha Majety and Nandan Reddy.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Pluss raises $1 mn in pre-Series A funding
article: Gurgaon-based hyperlocal medicine delivery startup, Pluss raised $1 million in pre-Series A funding from IDG Ventures India, m&s partners (Singapore) and Powerhouse Ventures (USA) on Thursday. Founded in 2015 by Atit Jain, Madhulika Pandey and Tarun Lawadia, Pluss provides on-demand medicine delivery service at customer's doorstep under 60 minutes.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: AAP to fund best pollution control startup
article: The Delhi government along with the University of Chicago on Tuesday announced seed funding worth ₹2 crore for the best startup idea for environment and pollution control. The news came after the pollution level in Delhi was declared as ‘hazardous’ with an air quality index of 372, which was said to be continuously rising.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: YatraGenie launches on demand auto service
article: Travel portal YatraGenie on Tuesday launched its on demand auto-rickshaw booking service 'YatraGenie Autos' in Karnataka, Telangana, and Andhra Pradesh's district headquarters. Customers can book auto-rickshaws on YatraGenie's mobile app and also avail cashless rides with YatraGenie wallet starting from ₹20. Founded in November 2013 by Renil Komitla, it lets users book bus tickets, hotels online.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Bite Club raises pre-series A funding from growX
article: Gurgaon-based food tech logistics startup, Bite Club raised an undisclosed amount in pre-series A funding led by 'growX ventures' on Tuesday. The Phoenix Fund and existing investors Powai Lake Ventures also participated in the round. Founded in 2014 by Aushim Krishan, Sidhharth Sharma and Prateek Agarwal, the startup provides home-style food at affordable prices by connecting chefs to consumers.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Paytm, ICICI to provide virtual prepaid cards
article: Indian e-commerce company, Paytm has partnered with the ICICI bank to offer virtual prepaid cards to its users. The service is being initiated focussing on the Paytm wallet users without net banking or credit/debit card facilities. The users, irrespective of their association with the bank, would be able to credit their Paytm wallets by depositing cash/cheque at any ICICI bank.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: ZipGo announces bus service for women in NCR
article: Bengaluru-based startup ZipGo on Friday announced the launch of their exclusive women-only bus service in Delhi-NCR. The project has been initially introduced in Gurgaon, Dwarka, and Manesar. Founded in 2015 by Jitender Sharma, Gaurav Agarwal, Neeraj Paliwal and Pritesh Gupta, ZipGo is an online platform that provides on-demand air-conditioned shuttle service to help daily commute.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bhupathi-backed Sports365 acquires Tennishub
article: Tennis player Mahesh Bhupathi-backed online sports store, Sports365 acquired online tennis store Tennishub in an all-stock deal on Friday. As per the deal, the 18-member team of Tennishub will join Sports365. Founded in 2013 by Afroze Khan and tennis player Vishnu Vardhan, Tennishub is an online store that claims to sell all equipment and gear required to play tennis.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: UrbanClap offers free pest control in Chennai
article: Services marketplace UrbanClap on Saturday announced to launch free pest control camps at three worst affected locations in flood-hit Chennai. A 15-member team from UrbanClap will launch the services at Chennai's Thiruvanmiyur Kuppam area. Severe rainfall that flooded Chennai over the past two weeks waterlogged various areas of the city, increasing the population of mosquitoes and other insects.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Planet SuperHeroes gets ₹3.6 cr in pre-Series A
article: Online store for superheroes and comic character merchandise Planet SuperHeroes on Monday raised ₹3.6 crore in pre-Series A funding round led by DSG Consumer Partners. Lead Angels and UK-based 'The Character Group' also participated. Founded in 2013 by Jaineel Aga, Sumit Shah and Karan Rai, Planet SuperHeroes is an e-commerce platform, forum and community about superheroes and comic characters.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: YourStory acquires e-book platform Papyrus
article: Media platform, YourStory on Monday announced the acquisition of Papyrus Editor for an undisclosed amount. Founded in 2012 by Gaurav Tiwari, Papyrus Editor is a self-publishing platform for editors which reportedly would be used to complement YourStory's upcoming technology for user generated content. Earlier this year, YourStory was backed by undisclosed series A funding led by Kalaari Capital.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Wigzo raises $500k in pre-Series A funding
article: Delhi-based personalisation and customer engaging startup Wigzo on Tuesday raised $500,000 in pre-Series A funding round led by Mohandas Pai through Aarin Capital Partners. Singapore Angel Network, advantEdge Partners, Sachin Bhatia, Akshay Garg and ah! Ventures also participated. Founded in 2013, Wigzo offers marketers a digital marketing platform based on personal preferences of customers.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Yuvraj's firm invests in Black White Orange
article: YouWeCan Ventures, backed by Yuvraj Singh, invested an undisclosed amount in a Mumbai-based brand licensing startup, Black White Orange Brands on Tuesday. Founded in October 2015 by Bhavik Vora along with Mitali Desai and Diksha Mehta, Black White Orange Brands provides merchandising solutions and is associated with the TV show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ScoopWhoop raises $4 mn from Kalaari Capital
article: Internet media company, ScoopWhoop on Wednesday raised $4 million in fresh funding from Kalaari Capital. Founded in December 2013, the startup plans to expand its video production unit, ScoopWhoop Talkies. In November 2014, ScoopWhoop by selling its 36.5% stake had raised $1.6 million from Ignite World, formerly known as Bharti SoftBank.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: UrbanClap raises $25 mn led by Bessemer, others
article: UrbanClap, a marketplace for home services on Thursday raised $25 million led by Bessemer Venture Partners. Existing investors Accel Partners and SAIF also participated in the round. The startup provides services ranging from dieticians, wedding photographers, make-up artists and electricians, among others. It has raised a total of about $37 million in funding till now.

author: Azhar Iqubal
abstract: Naaptol raises $51 mn at $328 mn valuation
article: E-commerce and TV shopping platform Naaptol has raised $51.7 million in funding from existing investor Mitsui & Co at a valuation of about $328 million. The startup, founded in 2008, had raised its Series C of $21.4 million in April this year from the same investor. Following this investment, the Japanese conglomerate now owns 20% stake in the company.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart sells stake in employee trust fund
article: Flipkart in the past few weeks has reportedly sold a marginal stake in its employee trust fund worth ₹180-240 crore to High Net Worth Individuals (HNIs). This will enable Flipkart employees to monetise their stocks even in the absence of a public listing. People aware of the transaction said that the move is aimed to retain employees.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: ClearTax launches app for e-filing returns
article: ClearTax, a website that helps in e-filing income tax returns, on Friday launched a mobile application called TaxCloud on Android. The app will help Chartered Accountants (CA) review clients' due tax amount and filing history, among others. The company recently launched the TaxCloud application for CA firms. It has also partnered with banks and corporate businesses to make filing easier.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Foodpanda, IRCTC tie-up for in-train service
article: Online food ordering and delivery platform Foodpanda has proposed a partnership with IRCTC on Tuesday to offer meals during train journeys. For availing the service, consumers would be required to order at least two hours before the journey. The partnership is set to pilot at the New Delhi railway station before it can be extended to other cities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Craftsvilla raises $34 mn in Series C funding
article: Online marketplace for ethnic products, Craftsvilla on Tuesday raised $34 million in Series C funding round led by Sequoia Capital India and Lightspeed Venture Partners. Russian billionaire Yuri Milner also participated in the round by infusing $5 million through his investment firm DST Global. The current round of funding has reportedly valued Craftsvilla at $200 million.

author: Shruti Nagpal
abstract: Man who duped Flipkart arrested in Bengaluru
article: The Bengaluru police have arrested a 33-year-old electronic goods vendor, Ramesh Kumar, for cheating e-commerce firm Flipkart of ₹1.5 lakh. Kumar, according to the complaint, used to place orders on Flipkart from fake addresses, pack low-quality​ goods and deliver them. When the packages returned from untraceable addresses, Kumar told Flipkart the original products had been replaced on the way.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: NYC sued by taxi owners, lenders over Uber
article: New York City and its Taxi & Limousine Commission are being sued by taxi owners and lenders for allowing Uber to operate in the city. They claim it violates yellow cab drivers' exclusive right to pick up passengers on the street. The complaint said Uber's rise helped bankrupt 22 taxi companies and threatened medallion loans worth over $2.4 billion.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Goodbox raises $2.5 mn in Series A funding
article: Bengaluru-based Goodbox on Wednesday raised $2.5 million in Series A funding from Nexus Venture Partners. Founded in 2014, the startup allows users to purchase directly from the merchants over a chat. Earlier this year, the company raised seed funding from the Manipal Group, Taxi-ForSure Co-founder Aprameya Radhakrishna and redBus Co-founder Charan Padmaraju.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: MakeMyTrip hires Goibibo Co-founder Deepak Tuli
article: Travel portal MakeMyTrip on Thursday appointed Goibibo Co-founder Deepak Tuli as senior Vice-President-growth business. Prior to launching Goibibo, Tuli was part of Yatra.com launch team, wherein he set up the non-air business. With more than 10 years of experience, Tuli will focus on expanding the accommodations segment of the Nasdaq-listed company.

author: Sai Santosh
abstract: Times Internet buys majority stake in Taskbucks
article: Times Internet on Monday acquired a majority stake in a Gurgaon-based startup, Taskbucks, for $15 million. Taskbucks is a mobile-only tasks marketplace where companies offer tasks to consumers, who are then rewarded with bucks for completing these tasks. These bucks can be used for services like free mobile recharge, postpaid bill payments or Paytm cash.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Styletag raises ₹50 crore in angel funding
article: Online shopping portal for fashion and lifestyle products, Styletag on Tuesday raised ₹50 crore in angel funding from Jitendra Virwani, Chairman and Managing Director of Embassy Group. Founded by Sanjay Shroff and Yashodhara Shroff, the Bengaluru-based startup curates luxury products like apparel, bags, shoes, home decor and accessories in the fashion and lifestyle segment.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: MindTickle raises $12.5 million in funding
article: Pune and US-based MindTickle on Friday raised $12.5 million in funding led by New Enterprise Associates. Qualcomm Ventures and existing investor Accel Partners also participated in this round. The startup claims to reduce the training time of sales professionals and also offers coaching. It had previously raised $1.8 million in seed funding from Accel Partners and Moneta Ventures.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Aadhaar number not mandatory to register new biz
article: The government on Wednesday announced that Aadhaar number is not compulsory to register a new business. Kalraj Mishra, MSME Minister said, “There were reports that Aadhaar number was mandatory for registration of new businesses. Today I want to clarify that Aadhaar number is not mandatory.” A single-page registration form called Udyog Aadhaar was also launched for MSMEs in September.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Thomas Cook India partners with OYO Rooms
article: Travel operator Thomas Cook India has entered into a strategic partnership with budget hotels aggregator company OYO Rooms. The partnership aims at enabling India’s leisure and business travellers to avail a standardised hotel experience. Notably, OYO Rooms is also reportedly piloting a food technology service under the brand name ‘Oyo Cafe’.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: LocalOye lays off 60 of its 200 employees
article: Bengaluru-based online home services provider LocalOye on Monday laid off 60 of its 200 employees, mostly from the call servicing unit. CEO Aditya Rao said the company is automating the entire process of hiring service professionals which will let customers connect to service partners in real time. Relieved employees will reportedly receive two months of salary and new placement opportunities.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Tiger Global raises stake in Amazon: Report
article: According to a report by Business Insider, Tiger Global Management, the largest investor in Flipkart, has increased its stake in Amazon.com Inc in the quarter ended September. Tiger Global bought an additional 2.44 million Amazon shares increasing its stake to 3.19 million shares. This increases its stock value in Amazon to $2.1 billion making it Tiger Global's second-largest stock position.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Swiggy announces plans for 'cloud kitchens'
article: Sriharsha Majety, Co-founder of the food ordering startup Swiggy, announced plans to set up 'cloud kitchens' in collaboration with restaurants. The mechanism and commercial details for the revenue-shared kitchens are being discussed, he added. The joint venture is expected to help restaurants reach customers in areas where they do not have a physical presence.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jugnoo raises $3 mn in Series B led by Paytm
article: On demand auto-rickshaw app and hyperlocal delivery platform, Jugnoo on Tuesday raised $3 million in Series B funding led by online payments and m-commerce firm Paytm. Kunal Shah, Founder and CEO of online recharge service Freecharge also participated in the round. Chandigarh-based Jugnoo was founded in November 2014 by IIT Delhi alumni Samar Singla and Chinmay Agarwal.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Smytten raises $200k in seed funding
article: Online discovery platform for premium products and services, Smytten on Tuesday raised $200,000 in seed funding from Rimpal Chawla, former MD of Credit Suisse Asset Management India and Anuj Srivastava, CEO of Livspace. Founded by Swagat Sarangi and Siddhartha Nangia in 2015, Smytten lets users discover products and services under premium brands, take free trials and buy them.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Absentia raises ₹1.2 crore in seed funding
article: Virtual Reality headset maker, Absentia on Monday raised ₹1.2 crore in seed funding from multiple investors including 50K Ventures and Astarc Ventures. Absentia was founded by BITS Pilani dropouts Shubham Mishra, Vrushali Prasade and Harikrishna Valiyath. Absentia's device agnostic technology converts visuals into virtual reality that can be experienced through its head mounting device Tesseract.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Ola raises $500 mn at $5 bn valuation
article: Ola on Wednesday raised $500 million in fresh funds from China’s taxi hailing service Didi Kuaidi, investment management firm Baillie Gifford and existing investors Tiger Global, SoftBank, DST Global and Falcon Edge Capital. The company is reportedly valued at $5 billion. Ola has raised around $1.3 billion in external funding till date, with $1.2 billion closed over the past year.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Google to give startups $20k worth cloud service
article: To support India's startup community, Google announced on Wednesday it is offering credits worth $20,000 in its cloud services to 1,000 startups, starting 2016. It will also cover Google Apps' fees for businesses locked in Enterprise Agreements with another provider till the contract expires. Google said its agreements could unlock approximately 70% savings for the businesses.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Domino's Pizza ties up with Zippr for delivery
article: Domino's Pizza on Friday tied up with Zippr, a startup that creates a unique eight-character code that replaces the usual four-line address. While placing an order, online consumers of Domino's can provide a Zippr code instead of the complete address. Founded in 2013 by Aditya Vuchi, Zippr simplifies address into a unique code accepted by delivery, emergency and cab services.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Ola ties up with MapMyIndia for location data
article: Taxi aggregator Ola said on Friday that it had entered into a licensing deal with MapMyIndia and would begin using its digital maps and location data. Ola said the partnership would provide it with consistent map updates and help improve 'estimated time' efficiency for drivers and prospective passengers. Ola will also continue to use Apple Inc and Google Inc maps.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Minister seeks VC meetings to fund kin's startup
article: Agriculture Minister for State Sanjeev Balyan's office sent emails to venture capitalist firms asking for meetings to fund his alleged niece Monika Balyan's app “A Start-up Company”. The  minister claimed he did not know about the emails and that Monika was not a relative. His office later apologised to the firms and asked them to ignore the previous email.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola launches mobile payments app 'Ola Money'
article: Taxi-hailing app Ola on Friday launched a dedicated mobile payments services app Ola Money that allows users to recharge phones and transfer money. Ola Money will directly compete with existing mobile wallets in India like MobiKwik, Alibaba-backed Paytm and Snapdeal-owned FreeCharge. Currently, the app is available for only Android users on the Google Play Store.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Switzerland to have driverless, automatic buses
article: Switzerland will soon have operational driverless public transport buses that can ferry nine passengers at a time. The buses will be launched in the canton of Valais and two more will be pressed into service in Sion early in 2016. The electric-powered autonomous buses were built by a collaboration of a public bus service PostBus and a Swiss startup BestMile.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AppVirality raises $500k from multiple investors
article: AppVirality on Monday raised $500,000 in funding from multiple investors including Google India MD Rajan Anandan, IndiaMart Founder Brijesh Kumar Agrawal, TradeIndia Founder Bikky Khosla and others. Founded by Laxman Papineni and Papineni RamakoteswarRao in October 2014, AppVirality provides growth hacking toolkit for mobile apps which helps developers in boosting app installs and user engagement.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Swipe launches phone for kids 'Junior' at ₹5,999
article: Pune-based smartphone and tablet maker, Swipe on Friday launched a new smartphone 'Junior', exclusively built for kids at ₹5,999. Suitable for kids aged between 5-15 years, the smartphone features a 4.5-inch display, 2MP rear camera, 0.3MP front camera with parental control system. Parents can mark 'safe' and 'danger' zones in the phone to limit the usage by the kids.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fossil buys fitness tracker Misfit for $260 mn
article: Fossil on Friday acquired Misfit, a US-based hardware company that designs and manufactures wearable products, for $260 million. According to the deal, Misfit Founder and CEO Sonny Vu will take over as the Head of Fossil's connected devices group. In a company statement, Fossil said that it will offer both traditional watches and fashionable wearable technology.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Karnataka's cabinet clears startup policy
article: Karnataka’s IT and Bio-Technology minister SR Patil said on Friday that Karnataka is the first Indian state to have a startup policy. The five-year policy, cleared by the cabinet on Thursday, will be led by the chief secretary. Under this, funding will be provided to early-stage startups and incubators will be set up in post graduate colleges, among other things.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ola acquires trip-planning startup Geotagg
article: Taxi-hailing app Ola on Thursday reportedly acquired Geotagg, a startup that provides intelligent transportation systems, for an undisclosed sum. This move is aimed at augmenting Ola’s new bus-shuttle service. Founded by IIT Madras graduates Akhilesh Koppineni and Krishna Chaitanya, it addresses issues specific to urban traffic such as peak-hour jams, vehicles overtaking and going detour.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Snapdeal launches Snap-Lite for mobile
article: Snapdeal on Thursday announced a 'lite version' of its website for mobile browsers, called Snap-Lite, which aims at providing an optimised user experience on slow internet connections. The company's chief product officer claims that the service, launched across all browsers, makes browsing 85% faster. Recently, Flipkart also re-launched its mobile website called Flipkart Lite.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: CashKaro secures ₹25 crore in Series A funding
article: Cashback and coupons website, CashKaro on Monday raised ₹25 crore in Series A funding from Kalaari Capital. Founded in 2013 by Rohan Bhargava and Swati Bhargava, CashKaro lets users compare prices of products on various e-commerce websites and gives coupons and cashback on purchases made through its platform. It also plans to launch its Android and iOS apps in 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Practo, Uber tie up to take patients to doctors
article: Healthcare booking platform, Practo and taxi-hailing service Uber on Monday entered into a global partnership to bridge the gap between patients and doctors. A new service will notify Practo app users in India,  Indonesia, Philippines and Singapore about the nearest available Uber vehicle. In the next phase, an Uber notification one hour prior to Practo appointment will be launched.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SparesHub raises ₹3 cr in pre-Series A funding
article: Online marketplace for car spare parts and accessories, SparesHub on Friday raised ₹3 crore in pre-Series A round of funding led by Hyderabad Angels with participation by M&S Partners. Founded by Tapas Gupta and Arijit Chakraborty in 2013, SparesHub is an automobile aftermarket e-commerce company that lets users buy replacement parts for cars.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Google X co-founder's Udacity valued at $1 bn
article: In its latest round of funding, Google X research lab co-founder Sebastian Thrun's online education service Udacity was valued at $1 billion. Led by German group Bertelsmann, Udacity raised $105 million in "Series D" funding and added Google Ventures and Emerson Collective among others to its list of investors. It offers Nanodegree courses in specialised softwares and other vocational courses.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: RSS slams Myntra over selling cow leather shoes
article: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) volunteers on Wednesday demanded legal action against Myntra for selling cow leather shoes, and "hurting religious sentiments of Hindus." Myntra tweeted, "[T]he product in question is an imported product and/or made from imported leather. The sale of leather products is not illegal in India. Please be assured that we function within legally permissible norms."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: iSTAR raises ₹10 crore led by Dell Foundation
article: Bengaluru-based skill development firm, iSTAR on Monday raised ₹10 crore in a funding round led by Michael & Susan Dell Foundation. Existing investor Unitus Seed Fund also participated in the round. Founded in January 2010 by IIM Ahmedabad alumni Surga Thilakan and Sreeraman Vaidyanathan, iSTAR provides skill development services to the youth and connects them to job opportunities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Quikr acquires Indian Realty Exchange
article: Cross-category classifieds platform, Quikr on Friday acquired mobile first real estate agents aggregator Indian Realty Exchange (IRX) for an undisclosed sum. Founded by Vikram Dhawan and Karan Jindal in 2015, IRX connects real estate agents with end users and other agents in real time. The move is in line with Quikr's attempt to strengthen its real estate focused portal QuikrHomes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Satvacart raises ₹12 crore in seed funding
article: Gurgaon-based online grocery store, Satvacart on Friday raised ₹12 crore in seed funding in its second angel round led by one senior executive each from insurance, telecom and investment banking sector. Existing investor Palaash Ventures and some new investors also participated. Founded by Rahul Hari in November 2014, Satvacart delivers users grocery within 90 minutes of placing an order.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm to appoint 3,000 to roll out payments bank
article: Online payments and m-commerce firm, Paytm is launching its payments bank services by the first quarter of next fiscal for which it reportedly plans to hire 3,000 people. The company that has already started hiring, will appoint 2,500 people before the launch and another 500 people once the services are live. Technology requirements are said to dominate these hirings.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Explara raises ₹3.2 cr in pre-Series A funding
article: Event marketing and ticketing platform, Explara on Friday raised ₹3.2 crore in pre-Series A funding round from Ness Wadia, Singapore Angels and Hyderabad Angels. Founded in January 2008 by Santosh Panda, the startup provides event solutions ranging from ticketing to management. Set to launch a movie ticketing service next month, Explara has also tied up with Ola and Paytm.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MakeMyTrip launches budget rooms brand Value+
article: Online travel company, MakeMyTrip on Friday launched Value+, its own brand of budget rooms ranging from ₹900 to ₹2000. The move comes after customers complained about room booking services provided by various startups on MakeMyTrip, Chairman and Group CEO Deep Kalra told ET. Notably, MakeMyTrip had blocked hotel-booking platforms OYO and ZO Rooms from its website in October this year.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Telangana govt may tax e-commerce companies
article: The Telangana government announced it is working on a policy to tax all e-commerce companies. "The proposal is to set up a common server and to see to it that no one is out of the tax purview," Telangana's commerce minister said. We need to amend the Value Added Tax (VAT) Act to widen the tax base, he added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zilingo raises ₹12 crore in seed funding
article: Mobile marketplace for shopping in Bangkok, Zilingo on Monday raised ₹12 crore in seed funding from a group of investors including Sequoia Capital and BEENEXT Ventures. Founded in April 2015 by Ankiti Bose and Dhruv Kapoor, the Thailand-based startup through its platform allows users to order products from Bangkok and ships them across Thailand, Malaysia & Singapore.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: CarTrade acquires CarWale from Axel Springer
article: Online auto classifieds platform CarTrade on Thursday reportedly acquired CarWale from Germany’s Axel Springer for about $80-90 million. After the acquisition, both platforms will operate independently. “CarWale will focus on being the new car brand, while CarTrade will be the used-car brand,” said Vinay Sanghi, Founder of CarTrade. As per the deal, BikeWale will also be a part of CarTrade.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: POPxo raises ₹13 crore in Series A funding
article: Lifestyle and fashion content portal for women, POPxo on Friday raised ₹13 crore in Series A funding from IDG Ventures, Kalaari Capital and 500 Startups. Founded by Priyanka Gill and Namrata Bostrom in 2013, POPxo's digital platform for women publishes content about fashion, beauty and lifestyle. The startup had raised $500,000 from a group of investors in November 2014.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Info Edge picks 25% stake in BigStylist
article: Online classifieds company, Info Edge on Saturday bought 25% stake in beauty services provider BigStylist for ₹6.4 crore. Founded in July 2015 by IIT-Kharagpur graduates Richa Singh, Anurag Srivastava and Chinamaya Sharma, BigStylist delivers styling and beauty services to users wherever they want. It is also in talks with investors to raise $5 million in a new round of funding.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Shadowfax acquires Gurgaon-based Pickingo
article: Delhi-based hyperlocal logistics service provider, Shadowfax on Monday acquired Gurgaon-based on-demand B2B delivery startup Pickingo for an undisclosed amount in a cash and stock deal. About 45 employees and a few hundred delivery boys from Pickingo will join Shadowfax. Pickingo in August raised $1.3 million in a funding round led by Orios Ventures.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Flipkart posts four-fold rise in revenue
article: Flipkart Internet has posted a four-fold jump in revenue and 12-fold rise in net worth in the fiscal 2015. In the year ended March 31, the company's revenue stood at ₹659 crore against last year's revenue of ₹179 crore, according to a recent filing with the Registrar of Companies. Flipkart also posted a loss of ₹316 crore in fiscal 2014.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Uber signs deal with navigation company TomTom
article: Uber signed a multi-year contract with Dutch navigation company TomTom to get digital maps and traffic data for its driver-used software. "What they (Uber) get from us is total control of their application," TomTom's CEO said. TomTom provides raw data and databases along with technology to run them so Uber doesn't need to "share sensitive information with other companies."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mumbai-based startup Taskbob acquires Zepper
article: Mumbai-based hyperlocal home services provider, Taskbob on Monday reportedly acquired household services booking platform Zepper in a 'merger of assets' deal. Founded in October 2014 by Aseem Khare, Taskbob lets users have drivers, cleaners and home repair specialists on demand. In April 2015, it raised $1.2 million in seed funding from Orios Venture Partners and Mayfield Fund.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twigly raises $200k from angel investors
article: Twigly, a Gurgaon-based food-tech startup on Monday raised $200,000 from angel investors including InMobi Co-Founder Amit Gupta, Delhivery Co-Founder Sahil Barua, Anzy Careers Founder Deepak Singh, SAIF Partners and Tracxn Labs. Founded by Sonal Minhas, Rohan Dayal and Naresh Kumar Kachhi in 2015, Twigly delivers food cooked at its central kitchen directly to customers on demand within 45 minutes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm to launch a separate app for mobile wallet
article: Online payments and m-commerce firm, Paytm on Wednesday announced to launch a separate app for mobile wallet services in January. Paytm is planning to shift the focus of the current app to only e-commerce. The mobile wallet services will continue on the current app for a while after which users will be directed to download the new wallet app.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Punjab: Startup fund of ₹100 crore announced
article: Punjab’s Deputy Chief Minister Sukhbir Singh Badal on Thursday announced a fund of ₹100 crore to be invested in startups. He also appealed to all Punjab-born industrialists to invest in their state. Badal was addressing the valedictory function of the Progressive Punjab Summit 2015 where 17 young entrepreneurs presented their ideas.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in Sabeer Bhatia's 'Sabse'
article: Chairman emeritus of Tata Sons, Ratan Tata on Tuesday made a strategic investment in Sabse Technologies. Founded by Sabeer Bhatia, Co-founder of Hotmail, Sabse uses WiFi networks to lower bills and eliminate roaming charges. When WiFi is not available, it connects to the fastest cellular network. It also operates Sabsebolo, the cloud communications platform for small and medium enterprises.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: HP to set up innovation hub for startups
article: Hewkett-Packard Enterprise (HPE), the IT and business services entity of HP, is reportedly in plans to open an innovation hub for startups in India by the end of November. "We will help startups with technology, expertise in architecting solutions, and application testing", Neelam Dhawan, country managing director, HPE said. The location of the hub was however not revealed.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: PayTunes raises undisclosed sum from CAN
article: PayTunes, a mobile advertising platform, on Wednesday raised an undisclosed amount from CIO Angel Network (CAN) in a funding round led by Sanjay Mehta and Anoop Mathur. Founded by Divya Pratap Singh, Rakesh Sehgal and Gaurav Tiwari in 2015,  the Delhi-based startup changes the ringtones of users with advertisement jingles, giving them redeemable points in return.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ZopHop raises ₹2.9 crore in seed funding
article: Public commute app, ZopHop on Thursday raised ₹2.9 crore in seed funding from Google Executive Amit Singhal, angel investor PK Gulati and others. Founded by Vinayak Bhavnani and Jiyoung Lee, the Mumbai-based startup provides information about timings and schedules for train, bus and metro in a city. It also tells about the cost, journey time and traffic movements.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: TinyOwl raises $7.6 mn led by Sequoia and Matrix
article: Food-tech startup TinyOwl on Friday raised $7.6 million from existing investors Sequoia Capital and Matrix Partners. Recently, the Mumbai-based company reportedly laid-off more than 100 employees as part of the restructuring process. Founded by IIT Mumbai graduates, TinyOwl raised roughly $15 million in February from Matrix Partners, Sequoia Capital and Nexus Venture Partners.

author: Shruti Nagpal
abstract: Benetton's Sanjeev Mohanty named CEO at Jabong
article: Fashion e-tailer Jabong has named Sanjeev Mohanty as its new Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Managing Director (MD). Mohanty was previously the Managing Director at the Indian unit of the Italian clothing brand, Benetton. This is reportedly the first time in the Indian e-commerce sector that an executive from a traditional dealer will head an online venture.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Snapdeal launches automobile portal
article: Online marketplace Snapdeal on Wednesday launched Snapdeal Motors, an exclusive automobile platform for booking vehicles online. Customers can check prices, avail test drives, get financing options and book vehicles by paying a nominal amount on the platform. Hero MotoCorp and Piaggio are currently available on the platform while Mahindra, Suzuki Motorcycles and Datsun will be available soon.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Housing.com appoints Jason Kothari as CEO
article: Real estate portal Housing.com on Thursday appointed Jason Kothari as the Chief Executive Officer, five months after its former CEO Rahul Yadav was fired from the company. Kothari, a Wharton School graduate, joined the company in August as the Chief Business Officer. He was previously the Co-founder and CEO of Valiant Entertainment.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Jugnoo raises fresh funding of $10 mn from Paytm
article: Chandigarh-based auto-rickshaw hailing company and hyperlocal delivery platform Jugnoo on Saturday received a fresh funding of $10 million from Paytm. The company raised $5 million in participation with Paytm in June. It is also in talks with Japanese major SoftBank for a bigger round of funding, people familiar with the matter told ET.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grofers to deliver Dunkin' Donuts
article: Hyperlocal online delivery platform, Grofers on Tuesday tied up with American doughnut company Dunkin' Donuts for delivering fresh doughnuts to consumers. Founded in December 2013 by Saurabh Kumar and Albinder Dhindsa, the Gurgaon-based startup is an e-commerce mobile platform connecting users with local stores. Grofers will deliver from 67 stores of Dunkin' Donuts, currently operational in India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mumbai-based startup Cityflo raises $750k
article: Mumbai-based bus service provider, Cityflo on Monday raised $750,000 in a funding round led by IDG Ventures. The startup was founded in 2015 by six IIT-Bombay alumni Ankit Agrawal, Jerin Venad, Subhash Sundaravadivelu, Rushabh Shah, Advaith Vishwanath and Sankalp Kelshikar. Cityflo lets users book buses on demand on its Android app by allowing payments through a digital wallet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Truecaller launches Hindi caller ID
article: An application to identify unknown numbers and block spam calls, Truecaller on Tuesday launched a new feature 'Transliteration' to let users have caller information in Hindi. According to the company, the new feature adds real-time Hindi transliteration to the caller ID. The feature is currently available on Truecaller's Android app version 6.10 and above.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Facebook selects Reverie for FbStart program
article: Bengaluru-based language-as-a-service platform, Reverie has been picked by Facebook under its FbStart program along with six other companies including Coursera, Dropbox, Animoto, Twilio, Twinprime and VerbalizeIt. Under this partnership, members will receive free services and developer tools to create and grow their apps. Launched in January 2014, the program also offers mentorship from Facebook.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: TinyOwl to layoff around 100 employees
article: Food-tech startup TinyOwl has reportedly decided to layoff more than 100 employees in marketing, sales and human resources teams in Delhi, Hyderabad, Chennai and Pune. This is the second round of layoffs after cutting jobs of about 200 employees in September. The employee count is expected to fall from around 1,000 earlier this year to 650.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Pokkt raises $5 mn from Segnel Ventures, others
article: Video advertising and app monetisation platform Pokkt on Tuesday raised close to $5 million from Singapore-based Segnel Ventures, Sundar Chanrai, Japanese angel investor Shinji Kimura and existing investors. Launched in 2012 by Rohit Sharma, Vaibhav Odhekar and Manish Tewari, the startup had raised $2.5 million from JAFCO Asia, SingTel Innov8, Jungle Ventures and K Ganesh last year.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: 'Microsoft eager to work with Indian startups'
article: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said Microsoft is prepared and eager to work with Indian e-commerce companies to help small businesses go global. Talking at Microsoft's FutureUnleashed event in Mumbai, he said, "Every time I come to India I'm captured by the entrepreneurial energy of India." He announced partnerships with Paytm, Snapdeal, and Justdial to help innovate with cloud and analytics.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Moglix raises funding from Accel and Jungle
article: Noida-based Moglix, a marketplace for business and industrial supplies, on Friday reportedly raised around $1.5 million from Accel Partners and Jungle Ventures. Launched in August 2015 by former Google executive Rahul Garg, the startup addresses the need of industrial tools including power tools, hand tools, adhesives, safety & security and electricals.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: TinyOwl's Co-founder held hostage by employees
article: Mumbai-based food tech startup TinyOwl’s Co-founder Gaurav Choudhary has reportedly been held hostage in the Pune office over settlement issues by employees who were laid-off this week. The startup was giving post dated cheques to these employees when the previously laid-off employees have not received the settlement claims. It has scaled down operations in Delhi, Chennai, Pune, and Hyderabad.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Commerce Min asks RBI, ED to probe e-tailers
article: The Enforcement Directorate and the RBI have been asked by the Commerce Ministry to examine whether any FDI rules have been violated by e-commerce majors Flipkart, Amazon and Snapdeal. The move came after Confederation of All India Traders filed a complaint alleging that they engaged in business-to-consumers activities by circumventing the law as 100% FDI is allowed only for business-to-business.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Snapchat gives clarification over privacy policy
article: Snapchat has issued a clarification following rumours that alleged that the company’s updated privacy policy gave it ownership over users' photos, videos and text messages. Snapchat said, “The Snaps and Chats you send your friends remain as private today as they were before the update”. It also reportedly does not have any control over screenshots or pictures.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: WS Retail's turnover triples to ₹10k crore
article: The largest seller on e-commerce platform Flipkart, WS Retail, nearly tripled its turnover to ₹10,163 crore this fiscal, after reporting sales of ₹3,135 crore last year. WS Retail's sales were reportedly more than the combined sales of Pantaloons, Shoppers Stop, Lifestyle and Trent. Notably, WS Retails' sales numbers last fiscal were higher than that of ₹2,846 crore revenue of Flipkart.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Housing.com to lay off another 200 employees
article: Online real estate portal Housing.com will reportedly lay off another 200 employees this month to meet cost targets. This comes three months after the startup fired nearly 600 employees. The layoffs will be across departments including product, marketing and operations. With around 1,960 employees, the Mumbai-based company is also planning to close a bridge round led by Softbank.

author: Sai Santosh
abstract: Edu startup Shirsa Labs raises $250k in funding
article: Shirsa Labs, a game based learning platform for kids, has raised $250,000 in angel capital funding led by ah! Ventures. Targeted at kids in the age group 6 to 13, it aims to stimulate the intellectual and learning skills of children through games, worksheets and videos. Founded in 2013, the company currently has 75,000 active users, including 50,000 paid customers.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Realty startups gather $250 mn in last 18 months
article: According to data from Venture Intelligence, the realty sector has raised nearly $250 million in funding in the last 18 months mainly from Helion Ventures, SoftBank, Nexus Venture Partners, Accel India, Qualcomm Ventures, Horizen Ventures and Nirvana Ventures. Startups like Housing.com, CommonFloor and PropTiger attracted major investments during the same period.

author: Sai Santosh
abstract: Parcelled raises $5 mn in Series A funding
article: Parcelled, a logistics service provider, has raised $5 million in Series A funding from Delhivery and Tracxn Labs. The company offers online courier services, where items are picked up from the customers' home and shipped to the desired destination. Founded in March 2015, the startup also raised undisclosed funding in July from the same investors.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: QiK Stay raises $250k in seed funding
article: Affordable premium hotel aggregator and branding chain, QiK Stay on Saturday raised $250,000 in seed funding from venture capital firm ID Enablers. Founded in July 2015 by Jasveer Singh, the Delhi-based startup claims to provide luxury hotel rooms at affordable prices in India and Nepal. Earlier known as ZOZO STAY, the firm was later rebranded as QiK Stay.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Roadrunnr raises $10 mn from Sequoia, Nexus
article: Hyperlocal on-demand delivery startup Roadrunnr on Tuesday reportedly raised $10 million from Sequoia Capital and Nexus Ventures. Founded in February 2015 by Mohit Kumar and Arpit Dave, Roadrunnr helps in booking, tracking and managing business-to-business deliveries. The startup is also in talks to raise the next round of funding of up to $40 million.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Razorpay raises $9 mn led by Tiger Global
article: Online payments startup Razorpay on Tuesday raised $9 million in series A funding led by Tiger Global with participation from Matrix Partners. Founded in 2014 by Shashank Kumar and Harshil Mathur and incubated at the Silicon-Valley based Y Combinator, the startup had earlier raised $2.5 million in seed funding from Matrix Partners and other angel investors.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MagicTiger acquires Bengaluru-based startup Zoyo
article: Chat-based on demand delivery startup, MagicTiger on Wednesday acquired Bengaluru-based startup Zoyo in a cash and stock deal. Founded in July 2015 by IIT-Delhi alumnus Shashank Singla and Carnegie Mellon University graduate Priyanka Prakash, Zoyo uses artificial intelligence to assist users in shopping over chat. MagicTiger also acquired rival startup GoDeliver in July, earlier this year.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Paytm users can now recharge wallet through ATMs
article: Online payments and m-commerce firm Paytm has tied up with Bank of Maharashtra to help users recharge their Paytm wallet through ATMs. The company said that it is in the process of partnering with many other banks and will be making an announcement soon. Paytm recently got an approval for a payment bank license from the Reserve Bank of India.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Ratan Tata, AmEx invest in Bitcoin startup
article: Abra, a Silicon Valley-based Bitcoin startup, on Thursday revealed that Ratan Tata and American Express had invested an undisclosed amount in its Series A funding of $12 million announced last month. This is Ratan Tata’s first investment in the field of digital currency. Abra enables users to store digital cash in any currency in their phones.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: India lacks enough angel investors: Nasscom
article: National Association of Software and Services Companies (NASSCOM) on Thursday said that India does not have enough number of angel investors as opposed to the West to help fuel the growth of the start-up ecosystem. Rajat Tandon from Nasscom added that investors are afraid because there is a high risk of failure and lack of policy for such investments.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Netmeds raises $50 mn from OrbiMed, others
article: Online pharmacy service provider, Netmeds on Monday raised $50 million in tranche funding led by healthcare-dedicated investment firm OrbiMed. Netmeds founder-led Pradeep Dadha Group and investment bank MAPE Advisory Group also participated in the round. Founded by Pradeep Dadha and Bruce Schwack in 2015, the online marketplace lets users buy medicines and other health products.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Grofers acqui-hires logistics startup Townrush
article: Hyperlocal online delivery platform, Grofers on Tuesday acqui-hired Bengaluru-based B2B logistics startup Townrush. Founded by former Flipkart executives Saurya Prakash Sinha and Ashutosh Banerjee and former Facebook Engineer Tushar Bisht, Townrush delivery platform connects merchants and vendors to local logistics players. Grofers also acqui-hired food ordering service SpoonJoy recently.

author: Shruti Nagpal
abstract: Paytm partners with insurance companies
article: Mobile wallet and e-tailer, Paytm, is tying up with three insurance companies, HDFC Ergo, Religare Health Insurance and ICICI Prudential to allow users to pay their premiums and renew policies cashlessly through the Paytm wallet. Paytm is targeting partnership with over 15 companies by the next quarter and premium collections of reportedly ₹1,000 crore this fiscal year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 'SoftBank to invest billions of dollars a year'
article: In a live broadcast on Thursday, SoftBank Founder and Chairman Masayoshi Son said that the company is planning to invest 'several billions' of dollars a year in promising startups. In a conversation with SoftBank's President Nikesh Arora, Son said that the company is particularly interested in India. SoftBank has already invested $627 million in Snapdeal and $210 million in Ola.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Bengaluru start-up offers 3D printed 'selfies'
article: A Bengaluru-based startup called CloneMe is offering customers miniaturised replicas of themselves, using 3D printing technology. The customer's body is scanned on a turntable and the process is similar to photography and completely safe, the company's co-founder said. This process takes about 30 seconds. Statuettes are then produced and delivered in four to seven days.

author: Shruti Nagpal
abstract: Twitter CEO to give 1/3rd of his stock to staff
article: Twitter’s Co-founder and CEO Jack Dorsey has announced that he will transfer one-third of his stock, or 1% of the company, to the employee equity pool to "reinvest directly into people". This is reportedly worth $197 million as of July 28. Dorsey tweeted, "I'd rather have a smaller part of something big than a bigger part of something small”.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: NITI Aayog: Give 1% profit to fund startups
article: A NITI Aayog panel has recommended that companies allocate 1% of their profits to fund startups and research by universities. The panel also said that funds from companies' social responsibility projects could be used for funding innovation. The panel also asked the government to hold an annual innovation challenge, where 12 winners could get funded to market their ideas.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Origa raises ₹7 crore from 500 Startups, others
article: Mumbai-based asset leasing startup, Origa on Wednesday raised ₹7 crore funding from 500 Startups, venture funding platform ah! Ventures and other angel investors. Founded in 2013 by Shrirang Tambe, Origa gives alternative financing solutions to companies by leasing assets. Currently, it operates across segments namely healthcare, sanitation, waste management, alternative energy and manufacturing.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Snapdeal in talks to raise $300 mn: Report
article: Jasper Infotech, the parent company of Snapdeal, is reportedly in talks to raise about $300 million for the online recharge platform FreeCharge, which the company acquired in April. However, Alibaba is not likely expected to participate in the funding round. This comes a few months after Snapdeal raised $500 million from Alibaba, Foxconn and SoftBank, among others.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Leaping Caravan raises $150k in angel funding
article: Food-tech startup Leaping Caravan on Friday raised $150,000 in funding from a group of undisclosed angel investors. Run by Megha Tuli, Leaping Caravan currently offers Indian cuisine to corporates across Gurgaon and South Delhi. The startup reportedly plans to raise a pre-series round of about $2 million for expansion to other cities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: OYO, ZO Rooms blocked by online travel portals
article: Budget hotel-booking platforms, OYO and ZO Rooms on Wednesday were blocked by online travel portals including MakeMyTrip, Goibibo and Yatra. OYO Rooms said that booking through travel portals contribute less than 10% of their total business in current scenario. Notably, Goibibo in September launched goStays, its own budget accommodation booking platform.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Healthcare startup Care24 raises ₹2.25 crore
article: Healthcare services provider, Care24 on Tuesday raised ₹2.25 crore from early stage investment fund India Quotient. Founded by IIT-Kanpur alumni Vipin Pathak, Garima Tripathi and Abhishek Tiwari in 2014, Care24 provides nurses, attendants and physiotherapists at the doorstep of the user. The funding will be used to train current staff and expand operations in Mumbai, the company said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Dell Services President invests in Instavans
article: Bengaluru-based small trucks aggregator, Instavans on Thursday received funding from the family office of Dell Services President Suresh Vaswani, who will join the startup's board. Founded in May 2014 by Vinay Goyal, Instavans aggregates truck operators to provide logistics services within Bengaluru. According to Instavans, the local trucking industry in India is worth around $15 billion.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Uber to raise another $1 billion: Report
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber is reportedly planning to raise another $1 billion in funding at a valuation of $60-70 billion. This round comes just a few months after it closed a funding of $1 billion. After this raise, it will become the most valuable private startup in the world. Uber recently said that it is not planning to go public soon.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: TVF Founder Arunabh Kumar sued by Prashant Raj
article: Founder of online entertainment network The Viral Fever (TVF), Arunabh Kumar has been reportedly sued by former Managing Partner and Director Prashant Raj in Bombay HC. Raj, who left TVF in 2014, is claiming a 4% equity stake verbally promised by Kumar. Lawyers of Kumar have said that claims of Raj are invalid in absence of no written agreement.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Vertex Ventures to focus on early-stage deals
article: Ben Mathias, Managing Director and India Head for Vertex Ventures, on Tuesday reportedly announced that the venture capital (VC) firm is planning to write Series A cheques in India. “It will be lots of early-stage ventures and early-growth Series A and Bs for most part,” Mathias told ET. Vertex Ventures is the VC arm of Singapore government's investment firm Temasek.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AlmaMapper raises ₹2.6 crore in seed funding
article: Online utility platform for students and campuses, AlmaMapper has raised ₹2.6 crore in seed funding from Oswal Techno Ventures. Launched by Pankaj Kaul and Chandra Mauli Sharma in 2014, the free online platform connects students, teachers and campuses worldwide to share information. With offices in Pune and Ahmedabad, the startup has been tying up with vendors offering student-oriented products.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ratan Tata, Mohandas Pai invest in LetsVenture
article: Online deal-making platform for startups, LetsVenture has brought on board Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata and former Infosys Director Mohandas Pai as investors and advisers. Founded by Shanti Mohan and Sanjay Jha, the portal helps startups meet investors for funding. The platform also received an undisclosed amount in Series A funding from Tata and Pai last week.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: AskMyGift raises $50k in funding
article: AskMyGift, an app that helps users to create customised wish-list for gifts, on Thursday raised $50,000 in a pre-seed round from Ashish Mittal, Chief Mentor of TurningIdeas incubator. The startup is in advanced talks to raise around $300,000 in seed funding also. It has tied up with various e-commerce players such as Flipkart, Amazon and other offline merchants.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: LinkedIn India's MD joins Freshdesk as COO
article: Enterprise software startup Freshdesk on Tuesday appointed LinkedIn India’s Managing Director (MD), Nishant Rao as Chief Operating Officer. Rao will join Freshdesk in November until then he will remain the MD of LinkedIn. He presides as the chairman of the Internet and Mobile Association of India and is on the Advisory Board for the National Committee on Skill Development.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Cisco acquires Bengaluru-based IT firm Pawaa
article: Cisco on Wednesday made its first acquisition in India, as it took over Bengaluru-based IT security startup Pawaa for an undisclosed amount. Founded in 2007 by Prakash Baskaran, Pawaa is a security software company which helps in safeguarding files. As part of the deal, Pawaa team will join the software segment of Cisco, led by Vice President Pankaj Srivastava.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Alibaba gets CCI nod to buy 4.14% in Snapdeal
article: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Thursday gave the approval to Chinese e-commerce major Alibaba for acquiring approximately 4.14% stake in Jasper Infotech, the owner of Snapdeal. The CCI’s nod is required for acquiring stakes above a certain limit. Alibaba Group, Taiwan-based Foxconn and other investors reportedly invested $500 million in Snapdeal in August.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ola appoints Infosys' Rajiv Bansal as CFO
article: Taxi-hailing app Ola on Saturday reportedly hired former Infosys' Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Rajiv Bansal as its new finance head. Bansal recently stepped down from the post of Infosys CFO. He joined the company in 1999, and was named as the CFO in 2012 following the shift of then CFO V Balakrishnan.

author: Sai Santosh
abstract: Aadhaar made compulsory to register new business
article: A new entrepreneur now has to compulsorily submit their Aadhaar number in order to register a new business, according to new rules framed by the government. Also, unless the Aadhaar credentials of the startups' promoters are validated online, they are not eligible to 'fill' the online form for registering new enterprises.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Top entrepreneurs likely to meet RBI Governor
article: To propose measures to simplify the procedure of doing business in India, top entrepreneurs and startup promoters are reportedly planning to meet RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan. Some expected proposals to be discussed include easier borrowing for startups under External Commercial Borrowing rules, simpler structure for forex transactions and no RBI approval for earn-out in merger and acquisition.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Qualcomm, Norwest invests $10 mn in Attune Tech
article: Chennai-based healthcare technology company, Attune Technologies on Tuesday raised $10 million in Series B funding led by Qualcomm Ventures and existing investor Norwest Venture Partners. This marks the first investment by Qualcomm from its $150 million strategic venture fund in India. Attune had earlier raised $6 million from Norwest and $1 million from Singapore-based angel investors.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Housing.com to raise ₹220 crore from SoftBank
article: Mumbai-based real-estate portal Housing.com plans to raise about ₹220 crore ($35 million) in a fresh round of funding from Japan's SoftBank, sources familiar with the matter told ET. This deal will reportedly value the company at about  ₹2,260 crore. The startup also has Nexus Venture Partners and Helion Ventures as early investors.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jiyo Natural raises undisclosed sum from IAN
article: Bengaluru-based health food startup, Jiyo Natural on Wednesday raised an undisclosed amount from Indian Angel Network (IAN). Rajiv Mehta and Sumit Dhingra of IAN led the investment and will join the board of the year-old startup. Founded by Sharan Hiremath and Jayas Damodaran, Jiyo Natural delivers 'personalised' healthy meals under two flagship products, Jiyo Health and Jiyo Manage.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Uber IPO not to happen soon: CEO Kalanick
article: During a conference, Uber Chief Executive Officer Travis Kalanick said that the company is not planning to go public soon. “Give us a few years, give us a little time and when the time is right, something like that will happen,” Kalanick remarked. Being more than five years old, he also added the company is “too young for the prom.”

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BigBasket to get $25 mn investment from IFC
article: World Bank's arm, International Finance Corporation (IFC) on Tuesday said that it will invest $25 million in online grocer BigBasket's owner SuperMarket Grocery Supplies, for an undisclosed minority stake. The investment belongs to an ongoing fundraising exercise, IFC said. BigBasket is reportedly trying to raise $150 million in a new round of funding, to value the firm at $1 billion.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Inshorts acquires Retention.ai
article: Content distributor app Inshorts recently completed its first acquisition and brought on-board BetaGlide Inc, the company behind Retention.ai which helps app developers track uninstalled users, draw insights on user experience and improve user retention. With the acquisition, Inshorts aims to move a step ahead in delivering the best content consumption experience.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: 2015: Indian startups to see funding worth $5 bn
article: The Indian startup ecosystem will witness funding worth $5 billion by the end of 2015, as per a report released by NASSCOM on Tuesday. This marks a 125% increase from $2.2 billion last year. The number of investors rose from 220 in 2014 to 490 in 2015. Beating Israel and China, India has also become the third largest startup hub.

author: Prashanti Moktan
abstract: Flipkart's Bansals to deliver goods personally
article: With the on-going Flipkart Big Billion Day sale, Co-founders Sachin and Binny Bansal on Friday personally delivered goods to customers. Sitting in a delivery van in Bangalore, Sachin Bansal tweeted, "Doing deliveries today in Bangalore. Feeling excited." He indicated that the top leadership will be making deliveries to learn more about the market and customer requirements.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Citrus Payment raises $25 mn in Series C funding
article: Mumbai-based Payments solution firm Citrus Payment has raised about $25 million in Series C round of funding from new and existing investors. Led by Sequoia Capital and Ascent Capital, this round also saw participation from existing investors, eContext Asia and Beenos Asia. The firm will reportedly be valued at around $90-100 million after the fresh infusion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Square Yards acquires Oryden TechLabs
article: Ahmedabad-based design and animation studio, Oryden TechLabs was reportedly acquired by realty aggregator Square Yards for an undisclosed amount on Monday. Founded by Keyur Bhalavat and Ravi Patel, Oryden combines 3D visualisation, 2D animation and virtual reality with architectural designs. Square Yards has also acquired realty search portal Realizing.in and advisory firm LUXE this year.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Digital ad network Fork Media acquires Spid Info
article: Online advertising network Fork Media on Wednesday bought Wi-Fi advertising platform Spid Info Media in a cash and stock deal. The deal is reportedly pegged between $3-5 million. This marks the second acquisition by Fork Media after ClickZoot in 2014. The company also plans to announce another acquisition over the next six to eight months.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Paytm app launches QR code payments option
article: Payments and m-commerce platform Paytm on Wednesday, launched Quick Response (QR) code-based digital payments option on its app. After scanning the merchant's QR code, a user can make payment by entering the amount and approving it. Paytm will soon reveal the names of merchants that will start accepting payments through QR codes.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Amazon to buy stake in Housejoy
article: E-commerce major Amazon is in advanced talks to buy a stake in Bengaluru-based on-demand home startup Housejoy by leading a funding round of $15-20 million. Incubated at GrowthStory run by Krishnan Ganesh and Meena Ganesh, the startup has raised up to $8 million in funding. It provides services including plumbing, electrical services, home cleaning and beauty services, among others.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyperlocal delivery startup Opinio raises $7 mn
article: Bengaluru-based B2B hyperlocal delivery application, Opinio has raised $7 million in Series A round of funding by Delhivery, Sands Capital and Accel Partners. In Delhivery's second strategic investment in less than a year, CEO Sahil Barua has joined Opinio's board. Founded in June 2015, the company helps small businesses to deliver their services within 5-7 km radius.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: MealHopper raises $100k in seed funding
article: Gurgaon-based food startup MealHopper on Wednesday raised $100k in seed funding from travel search engine ixigo's Co-Founders, Aloke Bajpai and Rajnish Kumar. Amit Dey, CEO of General Mobile Technologies, also participated in the round among others. Founded by Avinash Singh and Aatish Kumar, MealHopper connects users with local cooks to deliver home-made meals on demand.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Lookup raises $2.5 mn in Series A funding
article: Bengaluru-based messaging and chat startup, Lookup on Wednesday raised $2.5 million in Series A funding. This round was led by Vinod Khosla's Khosla Impact fund with participation from Twitter Co-founder Biz Stone, Narayana Murthy's Catamaran Ventures and Global Founders Capital, among others. Founded by Deepak Ravindran in 2014, the app allows consumers to chat with local businesses.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Agentdesks raises $2.95 million in seed funding
article: Customer relationship management application for real estate agents, Agentdesks has raised $2.95 million in seed funding from Sierra Ventures, Cota Capital, Vegas Tech Fund and others. Founded by Biju Asokan, Vijay Bharath and Sanya Gurnani, the mobile-first service provides tools for team management, appointments and performance analysis designed for real estate agents.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Citrus Payment acquires Bengaluru based Zwitch
article: In its first acquisition, payment solutions firm Citrus Payment has acquired Bengaluru-based payment company Zwitch for an undisclosed sum in an all-stock deal. As part of the deal Zwitch's 10-member team will relocate to Mumbai and join Citrus Payment. The startup, which recently raised $25 million in Series C round, is planning to acquire more companies in the coming months.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Zenify raises ₹4 crore in angel funding
article: Zenify, a Bengaluru-based rental platform on Wednesday raised ₹4.15 crore in angel funding from multiple investors including Srikanth and Bharath from K12 Techno Services and Atul Jalan of Manthan Software Services. Founded by Sudarshan Purohit, Ankur Agarwal and Kailash Rathi in 2012, online portal Zenify takes care of rental needs of owners and tenants.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ola launches ride-sharing feature 'Ola Share'
article: Taxi-hailing app Ola on Tuesday launched its ride-sharing service called 'Ola Share' in beta version for select users in Bengaluru. The service will be rolled across five cities over the next three months. A maximum of three people can share a cab together through the app at an introductory fare of ₹50 across Bengaluru.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Yuri Milner invests in Bengaluru's RoadRunnr
article: RoadRunnr, a Bengaluru-based delivery service on Tuesday said that DST Global's Founder, Yuri Milner is personally investing in the startup. Among other Indian startups, Milner has invested $2-5 million each in Practo, Grofers and Swiggy this year. Founded by ex-Flipkart employees, Mohit Kumar and Arpit Dave, it provides logistics services to merchants, restaurants and e-commerce companies.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Taxi apps to register as regular operators: Govt
article: The Transport Ministry on Monday ruled that app-based taxi aggregators like Ola and Uber will have to register with state transport departments like regular taxi operators. The Centre is issuing new guidelines regarding the same which will focus on passenger safety. It will reportedly ask the companies to include an option in their apps that lets users call the police.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Schoolguru raises Rs 20 cr from angel investors
article: In Series A round of funding, Schoolguru, a platform for Indian universities to launch their online courses, has raised Rs 20 crore from angel investors. Schoolguru's digital platform assists universities to design syllabus and curriculum, host content and manage online examination. The e-learning platform was founded by Shantanu Rooj, Ravi Rangan and Anil Bhat in 2012.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Cube26 gets funding from Tiger Global
article: Mobile technology startup Cube26 on Thursday raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Tiger Global. Founded in 2012 by Saurav Kumar, Aakash Jain and Abhilekh Agarwal, it has developed applications like ‘Blink to Capture’ and ‘QuickLook’ for firms like Panasonic and Micromax. The startup has six Indian smartphone Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) using its gesture control technology.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ola acquires minority stake in ZipCash
article: Taxi hailing service Ola's owner ANI Technologies and Co-Founder Bhavish Aggarwal on Friday acquired a minority stake in Zipcash, an online payments startup. As per documents filed with the Registrar of Companies, ANI Technologies bought 3.4% stake in ZipCash for Rs 3.2 crore in June, Aggarwal bought a 2.56% stake for Rs 1.2 crore in March.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ben Mathias joins as Vertex Venture India head
article: Vertex Venture Management, the VC arm of the Singapore Government-backed investment firm Temasek, announced Ben Mathias as Managing Director and head of India operations on Thursday. Mathias replaces Ajay Lakhotia, who left the firm to start his own investment company. Mathias had earlier worked at the India operations of New Enterprise Associates (NEA).

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Voodoo raises $1 million from SAIF Partners
article: Voodoo, a mobile app that provides price comparison services, raised $1 million in seed funding from SAIF Partners on Tuesday. Voodoo integrates with different service providing apps including shopping and taxi-hailing apps, to compare prices and give recommendations. Founded by Mohit Mittal and Vijaysimha Reddy, Voodoo's Android app was launched last week, while an iOS version is in process.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Voylla raises $15 mn from Peepul Capital
article: Online jewellery and accessories startup Voylla on Monday raised $15​ million in fresh funding from private equity firm Peepul Capital. Surya Mantha, the investment director of Peepul Capital, will join the board of the online brand. Founded in 2012, the startup had earlier raised funding from Pune-based Snow Leopard Technology Ventures and angel investors.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Grabhouse raises $10 million in Series B funding
article: Online rental startup Grabhouse on Friday raised $10 million in series B funding led by Sequoia Capital and Kalaari Capital. Co-founded by Prateek Shukla and Pankhuri Shrivastava in 2013, the property listing website helps users in finding houses without the involvement of brokers. Grabhouse had earlier raised $2.5 million from Kalaari and Sequoia Capital.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Curofy raises Rs 12 crore in pre-series A round
article: Delhi-based doctor networking app Curofy on Thursday raised Rs 12 crore in pre-series A round from US-based VC fund RoundGlass Partners. Through the app, doctors can find other doctors, call them with a single tap, and connect to collaborate on patient cases. It also allows healthcare professionals to showcase their profile and get access to various opportunities.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Mubble raises funding from Accel Partners
article: Bengaluru-based mobile tech startup Mubble on Monday raised an undisclosed amount in Series A funding from Accel Partners. The startup helps users track the telecom spending as well as mobile data usage, using an in-built self-learning analytics tool. This funding comes a few weeks after Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani invested in the startup.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Tripoto gets funding from 500 Startups, others
article: Online travel community Tripoto on Monday raised an undisclosed amount of funding from 500 Startups, IDG Ventures and Advantedge Fund. Angel investors including Neeraj Arora, the VP of WhatsApp and Stanhope Capital Chairman Leon Seynave also participated in this round. Founded by Anirudh Gupta and Michael Lyngdoh, the startup allows travellers to share crowdsourced travel stories.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Little acquires Trideal for undisclosed amount
article: In its first acquisition, hyper-local deals discovery app Little on Tuesday acquired Chandigarh-based deals portal Trideal for an undisclosed amount. Founded by Manish Chopra and Satish Mani in 2015, Little app provides real-time hyperlocal deals across various consumer segments. Trideal's Co-Founders and the core team will join Little as a part of the acquisition.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: SportzVillage raises Rs 65 cr from Gaja Capital
article: Sports and fitness education and management startup SportzVillage has reportedly raised Rs 65 crore in second round of funding, from a mid-market private equity fund, Gaja Capital. SportzVillage has three subsidiaries - SportzConsult, EduSports and MeraSport. The company had raised about $2 million from Bharati Jacob and Mahesh Murthy-led Seedfund in 2010.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: YouWeCan acquires 10-15% stake in SportyBeans
article: Cricketer Yuvraj Singh-backed fund YouWeCan Ventures reportedly acquired 10-15% stake for an undisclosed sum in SportyBeans, a startup that offers multi-sport programmes for children. This is YouWeCan's ninth startup investment in six months. YouWeCan, the venture fund started by Singh earlier in April this year, has also invested in Moovo, Vyomo, Healthians, EduKart, JetSetGo and Cartisan.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AntWorks buys Benchmark Systems for Rs 33 crore
article:
In its first acquisition, business solutions and technology startup AntWorks has bought US-based healthcare application service provider Benchmark Systems in an all-cash deal 
for Rs 33 crore. However, Benchmark will continue as a separate brand after the buyout. Co-founded by ex-Infosys executive Asheesh Mehra, AntWorks is planning a second acquisition by the end of the current fiscal.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Inayo gets $300k in seed funding
article: Mumbai-based on-demand healthcare marketplace, Inayo on Saturday raised $300,000 in seed funding from investors including Amit Ranjan, Founder of SlideShare and Zishaan Hayath, Co-founder of Toppr.com. Founded in July 2015 by Raunak Jain, Abhishek Sinha, Purna Chandra, the startup helps users in ordering prescription drugs by uploading a photograph of a prescription on the mobile app.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Bengaluru home to 5 of India's 8 'unicorns'
article: India’s technology capital Bengaluru is home to five of the eight unicorns from India namely Flipkart, Ola, InMobi, Quikr and MuSigma mainly due to the advanced IT services in the city. Three of the other unicorns Snapdeal, Zomato and Paytm are based in New Delhi. The term 'Unicorn' is used for startups valued at $1 billion or more.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Symphony raises $100 mn from Google, others
article: Cloud-based messaging startup Symphony on Monday raised over $100 million from Google, UBS Group, Lakestar and others. Backed by Goldman Sachs and other Wall Street banks, Symphony provides a common platform for all communications between financial firms, corporate customers and individuals. The new round of funding would reportedly value Symphony at $650 million.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: India world’s youngest start-up nation: Report
article: India is the world’s youngest start-up nation with 72% founders aged below 35, a Nasscom-Zinnov report said on Tuesday. The report titled ‘Start-up India’ said that India ranks third among global start-up ecosystems with 4,200 start-ups. It further reported the creation of 80,000 jobs in 2014-15 and a 125% growth in funding raised by start-ups in 2015 over 2014.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Welcome Cure raises $6 mn in funding
article: In its first round of funding, Mumbai-based homeopathy treatment portal Welcome Cure has raised $6 million with participation from two angel investors. Co-founded by Punit Desai and Jawahar Shah, the year-old portal provides online or telephonic consultation by homeopathy practitioners. The company is planning another fund-raising in the next three to six months.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal invests Rs 130 crore in GoJavas
article: In its second round of investment in GoJavas, online retailer Snapdeal on Wednesday announced that it has invested an additional $20 million (approximately Rs 130 crore) in the logistics firm. GoJavas had first received investment from Snapdeal earlier in March this year. Reports say that with the latest round of investment, Snapdeal's stake in GoJavas has raised to 42%.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: ZuperMeal raises $2 mn from chef Sanjeev, others
article: Online marketplace for home-cooked meals, ZuperMeal has raised $2 million in seed funding from chef Sanjeev Kapoor, Wonderchef appliances promoter Ravi Saxena and other angel investors. The Mumbai-based startup connects home chefs to consumers via its mobile application. An additional $30 million is being planned to be raised by ZuperMeal in its subsequent rounds of funding.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Logistics startup Quifers raises Rs 2 crore
article: Logistics startup Quifers on Thursday raised Rs 2 crore in a funding round led by Indian Angel Network (IAN) along with Smile Group. On behalf of IAN, investors Vikas Agarwal and Vishal Kharehave led the funding round. Founded in 2015, Quifers is an online portal that enables transfer of goods within Mumbai by aggregating light commercial vehicles.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: HUL to partner with tech startups in India
article: To encourage the spirit of innovation, Hindustan Unilever (HUL) on Monday announced that it is partnering with technology startups in India. It has already short-listed ten startups that can get access to a part of its business, mentors and other resources.
