HUL had partnered with cloud telephony startup Ozonetel for Kan Khajura Tesan, a mobile-based radio channel in the past.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Shopalyst raises $2 million from Kalaari Capital
article: Shopalyst, a startup which helps in creating digital storefronts on websites and mobile apps, has raised $2 million in Series A funding from Kalaari Capital. Founded by four former Infosys executives, the startup allows publishers and developers to add in-app buy buttons on chats, videos, images or news for making purchases directly through the application.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Google buys Jibe Mobile to bring RCS to Android
article: Google on Wednesday announced the acquisition of Jibe Mobile which will help deploy RCS (Rich Communication Services) for Android. RCS is a new standard for carrier messaging and brings many of the features which users expect from messaging such as group chats, high resolution photos and more. It has also joined hands with operators and device makers for the service.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Eywa Media raises Rs 6.57 crore in seed funding
article: Digital signal processing startup, Eywa Media raised a seed funding of Rs 6.57 crore from deal making platform ah! Ventures in participation with private equity fund Viktor Koenig and VC fund Mantra Ventures. Incubated at the Kyron Accelerator, it helps in audience interaction and engagement measurement for brands, broadcasters and others across connected devices using its cloud platform.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Multiples sells 10% stake in Delhivery
article: Private equity fund Multiples Alternate Asset Management, has sold about a 10% stake in logistics firm SSN Logistics, which operates Delhivery to Tiger Global. “We have done a partial exit by selling our stake to Tiger Global and have clocked returns of six times from our entry valuation,” said Prakash Nene, Managing Director of Multiples.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Govt signs 7 MoUs to boost Indian startups
article: In a bid to scale up the startup eco-system in the country, seven MoUs have been signed between various organisations of India and the US after Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s meeting at the India-US Start-up Konnect. National Association of Software and Service Companies (NASSCOM) and The Indus Entrepreneurs also signed a MoU to promote technology entrepreneurship among the two nations.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: PepperTap raises $36 mn led by Snapdeal
article: Gurgaon-based online grocery delivery startup PepperTap has raised $36 million in Series B funding led by Snapdeal in participation with existing investors Sequoia Capital and SAIF Partners. Investors like JAFCO, Ru-net and BeeNext also took part in this round. The company is in advanced talks to raise another $20 million within a few weeks.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Infosys invests in US-based Vertex Ventures
article: IT major Infosys has invested an undisclosed sum in Silicon Valley-based early stage VC firm Vertex Ventures through the Infosys Innovation Fund, which has corpus of $500 million. Vertex Ventures was set up earlier this year by former Facebook executive Jonathan Heiliger and former Accel Partners executive Sik Rhee. Infosys is also planning to partner with other VC firms.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: SoftBank leads $1 bn funding in US-based SoFi
article: US-based financial technology startup SoFi has secured $1 billion in Series E funding led by SoftBank Group. It is claimed to be the largest single financing round in the fintech space to date. Existing investors participating in the round include Third Point Ventures, Wellington Management Company, Institutional Venture Partners, RenRen, Baseline Ventures, DCM Ventures and others.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Snapdeal invest Rs 117 crore in GoJavas
article: Online retailer Snapdeal has reportedly pumped a fresh Rs 117 crore capital into logistics firm GoJavas, making Snapdeal the single largest stakeholder in the firm with 42% stake. Snapdeal, earlier in March, had secured a 20% stake in GoJavas for Rs 120 crore. The deal values the firm at Rs 600 crore.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Sequoia invests in Backwater Technologies
article: US-based Sequoia Capital will be investing Rs 40 crores in Mumbai-based Backwater Technologies, which owns the Chillr app. Chillr allows users to transfer money to contacts in their phonebook. The startup has partnered with HDFC Bank and Bank of Baroda and is planning to tie-up with 15 major banks by end of this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nykaa raises $9.5 mn in series B funding round
article: Beauty and wellness startup, Nykaa raised $9.5 million in series B round led by private equity firm TVS Capital. Marico Industries Chairman Harsh Mariwala and Hexaware Technologies Founder Atul Nishar also participated in the round. The firm has reportedly diluted 20% stake. Started in 2012 by Falguni Nayar, the online portal offers self-grooming products for both men and women.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: OnePlus to enter affordable segment in India
article: Chinese smartphone maker OnePlus is planning to enter the affordable category in India with the launch of a device in the range of Rs 12,000 and Rs 20,000. The company plans to launch the product by the end of this year. It is also aiming to introduce its own e-commerce website by 2016.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: B'lore: Police verification for new IT hires
article: To curb terrorist activities, the Karnataka police is planning to run a compulsory background verification for new recruits of startups and IT firms. The Intelligence Bureau has informed the Karnataka Police that some engineers with a terrorism link in the past have entered the Bengaluru's IT industry. Till now, such verification is only necessary for cab drivers and school staffers.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: VCs, AIFs can invest 25% of funds in foreign cos
article: SEBI on Thursday allowed Alternative Investment Funds (AIFs) and VCs to invest up to 25% of their funds in overseas companies having 'Indian connection'. Currently, India-based VC funds are allowed to invest up to 10% in Offshore VC Undertakings. SEBI also said that AIFs can invest in equity and equity-linked instruments subject to an overall limit of $500 million.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: One97 invests in AbhiBus and ClearTax: Report
article: One97 Communications, the parent company of Paytm which runs a mobile wallet and e-commerce platform, has invested in bus ticketing startup AbhiBus and income tax filing website ClearTax. However, the deal size remains undisclosed. The m-commerce player has also recently invested $10 million into logistics analytics firm LogiNext and auto aggregator and hyper-local delivery startup Jugnoo.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Alok Mittal to launch fin-tech startup
article: Alok Mittal, former India head of VC firm Canaan Partners, is launching a tech startup called Indifi Technologies which will help small businesses in India with better access to debt financing. The startup has already tied up with three entities, including, a travel and ticketing platform, an e-commerce company and a cab aggregator, according to Mittal.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Quickli gets funding from 500 Startups, others
article:
On-demand local delivery startup Quickli has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from 500 Startups, former Rocket Internet partner Mato Peric and other investors. Founded in April this year by Rohan Diwan and Sudhanshu Agarwal, the startup 
connects customers with local runners, who pickup and deliver goods from any restaurant or store in the city.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba, Ant Financial invest $680 mn in Paytm
article: Chinese e-commerce firm Alibaba Group and its finance arm Ant Financial have reportedly invested around $680 million in One97 Communications, Paytm's parent company. This move has increased Alibaba's stake in Paytm to 40% through two entities, making it the biggest stakeholder in the firm. The fresh investment has reportedly valued Paytm at around $4 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: QuikrJobs to target entry-level job seekers
article: Online platform for used goods, Quikr India on Tuesday launched a new recruitment platform named QuikrJobs to target entry-level job seekers. QuikrJobs will use Quikr's existing missed call service to connect job seekers with the recruiters. With more than 2.5 million active user profiles, it has over 1.6 million jobs listed on its platform, the company claimed.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: InMobi raises fresh $100 million in debt
article: Mobile ad-tech firm, InMobi reportedly raised fresh $100 million in debt from a cluster of lenders led by US-based Tennenbaum Capital Partners. It has got around $60 million out of which $40 million has been used to repay the debt raised from Hercules Technology Growth Capital last year, people familiar with the matter told ET.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Infoworks raises $5 million in Series A funding
article: Automated big data management firm Infoworks secured $5 million in Series A funding led by Nexus Venture Partners in participation with Knoll Ventures and others. Founded in 2014, it has developed a dynamic data warehousing platform on Hadoop. The company has expanded its management team and hired Ramesh Menon as product management head and Jitender Nankani customer success head.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: IAMAI, Google, Paytm to open app incubation hubs
article: Internet and Mobile Association of India (IAMAI) on Wednesday, partnered with Google India and Paytm to launch five app incubation centres in India under its programme Mobile10X. It will train 5,00,000 engineering students over five years to build Android and iOS apps. The move expects to boost revenue from mobile apps to Rs 10,000 crore from existing Rs 1,000 crore.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Freshdesk buys social recommendation app Frilp
article: Cloud-based customer support software Freshdesk has acquired Frilp for an undisclosed sum. The startup provides a social platform for exchanging trusted references and recommendations within one's network. As part of the acquisition, all 19 employees of Frilp will move to Freshdesk’s development centre in Chennai and the beta app of Frilp on Android will be closed soon.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Qualcomm to invest $150 mn in Indian startups
article: Silicon Valley-based chip maker Qualcomm on Sunday announced a $150 million fund to invest in Indian startups. The tech giant will also start ‘Design in India' initiative which will help boost the product design scenario in the country. A Qualcomm Innovation Lab will also be set up in Bangalore for technical and engineering assistance to companies in India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Financial tech startup IndiaLends raises ₹6.5 cr
article: Delhi-based financial technology startup, IndiaLends has raised ₹6.5 crore in bridge round from the existing investors, DSG Consumer Partners, Siddharth Parekh and other angel investors. Gautham Radhakrishnan, Partner at Tata Opportunities Fund also participated. Founded by Gaurav Chopra and Mayank Kachhwaha, IndiaLends is an online marketplace  connecting consumers with institutional lenders.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Apple acquires UK-based VocalIQ
article: In order to augment Siri, Apple acquired UK-based software startup VocalIQ at an undisclosed sum. The startup has built a self-learning dialogue API - putting real, natural conversation between people and their devices. Since Siri's launch in 2011, Apple has been trying to improve it by adding several features such as getting sports scores and setting reminders, among others.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: China's Didi Kuaidi to invest in Ola: Report
article: China's largest taxi-aggregator app, Didi Kuaidi may reportedly invest in Ola. The taxi-hailing app is finalizing the second tranche of $200 million of its $500 million financing round led by Singapore's GIC, Didi Kuaidi, and Baillie Gifford, a Scottish investment firm. GIC is expected to invest close to $100 million this time while Didi may put in around $30 million.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Bestdealfinance raises $3 mn in Series A funding
article: Mumbai-based fin-tech startup, Bestdealfinance has raised $3 million in Series A funding led by Kalaari Capital in participation with YourNest Angel Fund, Globvestor & Dexter Angel Circle. Launched in February 2015 by Manavjeet Singh and Sandeep Nambiar, it provides loans for retail customers and SMEs. The company is also looking to expand into cities like Bangalore, Chennai and Hyderabad.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ola introduces number masking for user's privacy
article: Enabling more privacy for users, taxi-hailing app Ola on Saturday introduced number masking on its platform so that the mobile numbers of customers remain undisclosed to drivers. It has integrated a cloud telephony solution, which will send an encrypted number to the driver after a user books a cab. This feature is active for driver-partners in all cities.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Federal Bank launches startup fund of Rs 25 cr
article: With the rise in startup activity in India, Federal Bank is launching a Rs 25-crore startup fund to invest in smaller projects which need funding of up to Rs 10 lakh. The bank will start with investing in states like Gujarat and Kerala. It is looking to capture diverse categories ranging from finance, agri-related technology, healthcare and logistics among others.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Bengaluru Uber drivers protest to demand perks
article: About 300 Uber Bengaluru drivers held a protest on Wednesday at the company's MG Road office demanding incentives promised by the taxi-hailing app. The Karnataka State Drivers' Association said that 20,000 Uber drivers in Bangalore will stop their services on Thursday. Drivers also said that they were unaware of being charged for internet connections on their mobile phones.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Quintype raises $3.25 mn led by Raghav Bahl
article: Quintype, a data driven publishing platform for digital media companies has raised $3.25 million funding led by founder of Quintillion Media and founder and ex-CEO of Network 18 Raghav Bahl. Founded in September 2014 by Amit Rathore, Quintype is a SaaS service to help create, distribute and monetise content and understand and grow the audience.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Flipkart founders invest $350k in PlaBro
article: Gurgaon-based online real-estate startup, PlaBro has raised $350,000 from Flipkart’s Co-founders Sachin Bansal and Binny Bansal, along with other investors. Launched in March this year by Pankaj Garg and Aaditya Jain, the app offers a platform for real estate brokerage firms and property dealers to connect and share information relating to real estate, housing and commercial properties.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Flipkart buys back logistics biz from WS Retail
article: In a bid to simplify the corporate structure ahead of a possible IPO, Flipkart has bought back its logistics business from WS Retail Services at an undisclosed sum. The acquisition has reportedly been made through a new entity called Instakart Services. After this deal, WS Retail, the largest seller on Flipkart’s platform will only be left with a trading business.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Innerchef raises Rs 11 crore from investors
article: Food-tech startup Innerchef has raised Rs 11 crore in a pre-series A funding from investors including Vijay Shekhar Sharma of Paytm, Phanindra Sama of redBus and Anupam Mittal of Shaadi.com among others. Launched in April 2015 by Rajesh Sawhney, Founder of GSF Accelerator and others, the startup offers meals in the ready-to-cook and  ready-to-eat format for users.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: China's Lead Eastern picks up 10% stake in Zapak
article: China's Lead Eastern Group has picked up 10% stake in Reliance Entertainment's mobile gaming unit Zapak for $15 million. Reliance Games is also planning to form a joint venture with Lead Eastern Investment and Creative Cultural in China for creating mobile games based on intellectual properties of Zapak. Post this investment, Zapak Mobile Games will be valued at $150 million.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: CureJoy raises $1.15 mn led by Accel Partners
article: Online health and wellness startup CureJoy has raised $1.15 million led by Accel Partners India. Founded by Dikshant Dave and Shrinivasa Sharma in October 2013, the startup provides curated content on health and wellness and connects the users with experts. It had earlier closed two rounds of funding from Accel Partners and angels based out of the US and India.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: WedMeGood raises Rs 2.7 crore led by IAN
article: Gurgaon-based wedding planner portal WedMeGood has raised Rs 2.7 crore in a seed funding round led by Hemant Kanakia and Alok Mittal of Indian Angel Network (IAN). Founded in February 2014 by husband and wife-duo of Anand and Mehak Shahani, the startup has a curated-vendor list to help couples find makeup artists, catering firms and photographers, among others.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Helpchat acquires Mumbai-based Niffler
article: Chat-based personal assistant app, Helpchat has acquired Mumbai-based Niffler for an undisclosed sum. Post this acquisition, the entire team of Niffler will join Helpchat. Founded by Edul Patel, Prince Arora and Viraj Shah in July 2014, Niffler helps users find deals and discount from offline merchants across various categories. The acquisition will help Helpchat in expanding to Pune and Mumbai.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Practo acquires healthcare startup Qikwell
article: Doctor discovery platform Practo on Thursday acquired Qikwell at an undisclosed sum, making it the fourth acquisition by the company in the past five months. Launched in 2011 by Krishna Prasad Chitrapura and Raghavendra Prasad TS, Qikwell facilitates appointments with doctors and other healthcare service providers. Qikwell founders will continue to lead the company post this acquisition.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: TravelKhana gets funding from Astarc Ventures
article: Online food ordering platform for train passengers, TravelKhana has raised an undisclosed amount of funding in a bridge round led by Astarc Ventures and others. It is also expected to close Series A round of about $10 million soon. Founded in 2012, the company will use the funds to expand to 400 stations from 150 by the end of 2016.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: India can be our 2nd largest market: Uber CEO
article: Uber CEO, Travis Kalanick, in an interview, has said that he sees India, presently behind  the US and China, soon becoming the company’s second largest market. Speaking of regulatory compliances, he said, "I don't feel India has been particularly frustrating compared to other places in the world." Uber, which entered India in 2013, is now present in 22 cities.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ola opens API to other mobile apps
article: Taxi-hailing app Ola on Saturday opened its application program interface (API) to mobile applications as well as individual developers. Apps such as Makemytrip, InMobi, Helpchat, Oyo rooms and others can now integrate Ola’s offering onto their platforms. The company is also planning to expand its user base by 100 million over the next two years with these initiatives.

author: Shipra Sharma
abstract: India fastest growing startup nation: Google CEO
article: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on Sunday said that India is the "fastest growing start-up nation in the world". Speaking at the Digital India event in the Silicon Valley (US) wherein PM Narendra Modi met CEOs of global tech companies, Pichai said, "I was in India last year... I met hungry entrepreneurs, similar to the ones I meet in Silicon Valley".

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: China's Didi Kuaidi confirms investment in Ola
article: Uber’s China rival Didi Kuaidi on Monday confirmed an undisclosed amount of investment into taxi-hailing app Ola as part of its latest funding round of $500 million. With this funding, Didi joins Ola’s existing investors, including SoftBank, Tiger Global, Falcon Edge and GIC. Didi has also recently invested in Southeast Asia’s GrabTaxi and US-based Lyft to take on Uber.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Toronto's Sysomos acquires gazeMetrix
article: Toronto-based social intelligence company Sysomos on Wednesday announced the acquisition of image recognition and machine learning platform, gazeMetrix for an undisclosed sum. This acquisition will enable Sysomos expand into image recognition. Founded in 2012 by Deobrat Singh, Saurab Paruthi and Debayan Banerjee, gazeMetrix was also a part of 500 Startups’ Fall 2012 batch.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: BlaBlaCar raises Series D round of $200 million
article: French ride-sharing platform BlaBlaCar has received Series D round of $200 million led by Insight Venture Partners and Lead Edge Capital. Vostok New Ventures also participated in this round. At $1.6 billion valuation, this startup joins the growing list of unicorns in the world. The funding will be used to expand across emerging markets including India and Brazil.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Facebook won't withdraw Internet.org from India
article: Social networking giant Facebook on Thursday said that it will not withdraw Internet.org from India despite facing backlash. The company is also planning to open up the platform to new telecom operators. Kevin Martin, Vice President for Facebook's Mobile and Global Access Policy, stressed that Internet.org "does not violate the principles of net neutrality.”

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: IDG Ventures to raise new fund of $200 million
article: Venture capital firm IDG Ventures is planning to raise its third India fund of about $200 million, people familiar with the matter told ET. The fund raising is expected to begin formally in October and will involve both overseas and domestic investors. The company had raised a fund of about $90 million in November 2014.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Capabiliti receives Rs 2.6 crore funding
article: SaaS-based training and recruitment platform Capabiliti has raised Rs 2.6 crore from 500 Startups, Smile Multimedia and investors like Snapdeal Co-founders Kunal Bahl & Rohit Bansal and Freshdesk Founder Girish Matrubootham. Other investors include Google's Rajan Anandan and Nasscom's Ravi Gururaj, among others. Founded in October 2014, the company plans to expand into international markets soon.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: B'luru-based health startup raises $37.5 million
article: Portea Medical, a Bengaluru-based startup founded by K Ganesh and Meena Ganesh, has received $37.5 million in funding. The Series-B round included venture capital firm Accel, World Bank's International Finance Corporation, Qualcomm Ventures and Ventureast as investors. Aiming at bringing healthcare to homes, the company currently claims to be handling 60,000 monthly home visits across 24 cities.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Paytm to launch entertainment ticket marketplace
article: Payments service provider and m-commerce platform Paytm is planning to venture into selling movie and entertainment tickets. "All the cinema chains can become sellers on the platform and can experiment with various pricing options and deals," Vijay Shekhar Sharma, Founder of Paytm said. The web-based beta version will be launched later this week and mobile apps will follow soon.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Paytm invests $10 mn in LogiNext
article: Mumbai-based data analytics firm LogiNext has received $10 million in funding from payments and m-commerce platform Paytm. Founded by Dhruvil Sanghvi and Manisha Raisinghani in 2014, the startup uses technology to provide real-time visibility and optimization solutions to logistics companies. It has received a funding of $500,000 from Indian Angel Network in April this year.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Ola to invest Rs 5,000 crore for cab leasing biz
article: Cab-hailing service Ola is set to infuse over Rs 5,000 crore in the coming year to expand its cab leasing business to 1 lakh drivers by December 2016. Under this scheme, drivers will have to pay an initial deposit of Rs 35,000 and further monthly lease payments (around Rs 15,000) with an option to own the vehicle after three years.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: ShadowFax secures $8.5 million in Series A round
article: Delhi-based hyperlocal startup ShadowFax has secured $8.5 million in Series A round from Eight Roads Ventures. The startup provides intra-city deliveries, serving the local delivery requirements of neighbourhood merchants. It had recently raised $350K in seed round from Snapdeal co-founders and others. As part of the deal, Kabir Narang from Eight Roads Ventures has joined ShadowFax's board.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Delhi govt rejects Uber's plea to run taxis
article: The Delhi government on Tuesday once again rejected taxi-hailing app Uber’s application for license to run cabs in the national capital. According to the government, Uber’s application was rejected for “not complying” with its existing ban order and “not filing” undertaking for following the laid-down rules. This comes immediately after the government rejected Ola’s application for license.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: NoBroker office attacked in Bangalore
article: More than 40 local brokers attacked the Bangalore office of online home rental platform NoBroker on Tuesday morning. The attackers tried to break into the office and assaulted a few employees, however no one was reportedly hurt. The startup which has about 90 people working in Bangalore, connects house-owners and tenants without the involvement of brokers.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ola to invest Rs 150 cr in Andhra Pradesh
article: Taxi-hailing firm Ola on Wednesday said that it has signed a pact with the Andhra Pradesh government to invest Rs 150 crore and add 40,000 vehicles over the next three years. Currently, Ola has over 10,000 vehicles on its platform in Andhra Pradesh. The company has recently introduced facilities like shuttle services and free in-cab Wi-Fi for users.

author: Sai Santosh
abstract: Amazon founder to spend $200mn on making rockets
article: Amazon founder, Jeff Bezos' space startup, Blue Origin is investing more than $200 million in building a rocket manufacturing plant and launch site in Florida, US, next to NASA's Kennedy Space Center. Blue Origin intends to fly tourists to suborbital and orbital space. He also announced that the new rocket would be ready by the end of this decade.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Yepme raises $75 mn led by Malaysia's Khazanah
article: Gurgaon-based online fashion retailer Yepme has raised $75 million led by Malaysian state fund Khazanah Nasional Berhad, people familiar with the matter told Reuters. Existing investor Helion also took part in the fundraising round. The funding will reportedly be used towards brand building and the launch of an ethnic wear line ahead of the festive season.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Facebook ties up with India's Tookitaki
article: Social-networking giant Facebook has tied up with Indian data intelligence startup Tookitaki to help brands in digital marketing and advertising. Tookitaki provides data analysis and forecasts about consumer behaviour, marketing, and product sales to companies. Facebook is also planning to tie up with more Indian companies to help e-commerce firms use social networking sites.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: B'lore police to start app for driver complaints
article: The Bangalore traffic police is launching an app to allow citizens to register complaints against drivers who refuse hire or charge excess fare. After boarding the auto-rickshaw, passengers can submit the details of the driver and the vehicle and it will start tracking the journey through GPS and alert the passenger if the driver is taking a longer route.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: MoEngage raises $4.25 mn from Helion, others
article: Analytics and engagement firm MoEngage has raised $4.25 million in Series A funding led by Helion Venture Partners. Exfinity Ventures, Snapdeal's founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal and TaxiForSure’s co-founder Raghunandan also participated in the funding round. The fresh funding will be used for expansion to the US and emerging markets.

author: Jatan Desai
abstract: Zomato to expand to 40 countries by 2016
article: Restaurant search platform and food ordering firm Zomato is aiming to increase its reach to 40 countries by 2016. Zomato Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal has said that the company will be adding 18 more countries by the end of next year. Zomato currently has presence in 22 countries and has in-depth information about 1.4 million restaurants worldwide.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Snapdeal to offer instant refunds within 1 hour
article: Online marketplace Snapdeal on Friday introduced instant refunds facility where customers will get refunds within an hour of receiving the returned product. This move comes immediately after Flipkart introduced 24-hour refunds facility. The instant refund will be completed using Immediate Payments Service (IMPS) transfers. It has also partnered with OnePlus to start offering the 64GB OnePlus One.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Practo acquires Insta Health for $12 million
article: Online doctor discovery platform Practo has acquired hospital information management company Insta Health for $12 million. This is Practo’s third acquisition after fitness solutions startup FitHo and product outsourcing firm Genii. As part of the cash and equity deal, 100 employees of Insta Health will join Practo. However, Insta Health will continue to operate as a separate entity.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: NASSCOM inaugurates startup warehouse in Kochi
article: The National Association of Software and Services Companies (NASSCOM) inaugurated its startup warehouse in Kochi on Saturday in collaboration with the State Government. The warehouse will be managed by the NASSCOM's 10,000 Startups Programme. Six shortlisted startups for the warehouse include CIED, Agrima Infotech, Janta Solutions, GeoSpice Location Intelligence, Quadproso, and Rabitech.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Shiv Nadar, Sanjay Kalra set up $500 mn fund
article: HCL’s Founder Shiv Nadar is setting up a $500 million fund along with former HCL executive Sanjay Kalra to buy out mature US healthcare technology firms and also invest in startups. The fund plans to spend $500 million over the next five years and target buyouts in the range of $50-200 million.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: India Quotient to close second fund at $20 mn
article: Mumbai-based early-stage VC firm, India Quotient is planning to close its second fund at $20 million from both institutional investors and high net-worth individuals. It will typically start with investments between Rs 30 lakh and Rs 3 crore, building a portfolio of not more than 20 companies. The VC firm has already backed seven startups from the new fund.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Chai Point raises $10 million
article: Tea retail chain Chai Point has raised $10 million led by Eight Roads Ventures in participation with Saama Capital and DSG Consumer Partners. The Bangalore-based company, founded by Harvard graduate Amuleek Singh Bijral, works on a hybrid model of service stores and delivery-only hubs across Delhi-NCR, Bangalore, Pune and Mumbai.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Moksh-Shil: Startup to organise funerals
article: Prompted by a personal tragedy, Ahmedabad-based Bilva Desai recently launched a funeral startup called Moksh-Shil. It offers various facilities such as providing a priest, booking a crematorium and organising asthi visarjan. "Managing funeral is a major challenge since the atmosphere is extremely stressful... At the same time, there's very little time to prepare for the funeral,” shares Desai.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: CredR raises $15 mn from Eight Roads Ventures
article: Online marketplace for used two-wheelers, CredR has raised Series A round of $15 million from Eight Roads Venture. Kabir Narang, Managing Director at Eight Roads Ventures, will join the company’s board. The funding will be used to expand to 20 cities in the coming months, besides boosting technology and marketing efforts.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: CanvasFlip raises $1.2 million from Bessemer
article: App prototyping and usability testing platform, CanvasFlip has raised $1.2 million in seed round from Bessemer Venture Partners. The startup allows user experience teams, product managers and non-tech entrepreneurs to validate their app ideas without writing codes. CanvasFlip plans to set up an office in California and also expand its product and marketing team in India.

author: Jatan Desai
abstract: Attrition at mid, junior level in startups soars
article: The average attrition rate at midlevel positions at startups is 30% while at junior positions is 25%, according to Human Resource (HR) executives and consultants. The attrition rate is much higher compared to that in established sectors like information technology, they added. Rapidly changing business models, more lucrative opportunities and restructuring have been cited as some of the reasons.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ratan Tata invests undisclosed amount in Zivame
article: Tata Sons Chairman emeritus Ratan Tata has invested an undisclosed amount in online lingerie retailer Zivame, people familiar with the matter told ET. Zivame has recently raised Rs 250 crore in Series C led by Zodius Technology Fund and Khazanah Nasional Berhad, the investment arm of the Malaysian Government. Tata has invested in several companies including Ola, Snapdeal and Paytm.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Snapdeal & Freecharge launch digital wallet
article: Online recharge and utility payments platform Freecharge has launched a digital wallet which will help consumers make payments on both Freecharge and Snapdeal. Freecharge has tied up with Yes Bank to launch the wallet and has also partnered with the payment bank licensee FINO. The Snapdeal-owned company claims to become India's most used wallet in the next 6 months.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Nandan Nilekani invests in Mubble
article: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani has invested an undisclosed sum in Bangalore-based mobile payments data startup Mubble. The startup helps users track the telecom spending as well as mobile data usage, using an in-built self-learning analytics tool. The app is available in multiple Indian languages and has also been designed to work offline.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: YatraGenie raises Series A funding
article: Bus ticketing and cab booking platform YatraGenie has raised an undisclosed amount in Series A funding round from entrepreneur and investor Ash Bhardwaj. The money raised will be used for expanding operations in Karnataka, and increase market base in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. As part of the funding, Bhardwaj will join YatraGenie as a board member.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Angel forum for startups launches B'luru chapter
article: World's largest angel investor network Keiretsu Forum launched a chapter in IT hub Bengaluru. The network set up a chapter in Chennai earlier this year, which has members from IIT Madras and Anna University. Keiretsu does not ask for equity from companies or charge them a percentage of money raised. It has a presence in 39 chapters across three continents.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ola raises $225 mn from Falcon Edge, others
article: Taxi-booking app Ola, has reportedly raised around $225 million as part of a new funding round of $500 million which is expected to be closed shortly. The latest funding is led by existing investor Falcon Edge Capital. Existing investors Tiger Global, Softbank and six other investors, also participated, according to documents filed by Ola with the Registrar of Companies.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: 500 Startups closes third global fund at $85 m
article: US-based venture capital firm, 500 Startups has closed its third global fund at $85 million. The number of limited partners is nearly 500 including Tokyo-based Dentsu, Yahoo Japan and Malaysia Venture Capital Management Berhad, a venture firm backed by the Malaysian government. Co-founded by Dave McClure, the company is already in the process of raising its fourth global fund.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Zivame raises Rs 250 crore in Series C funding
article: Online lingerie retailer Zivame has raised Rs 250 crore in Series C funding led by Zodius Technology Fund and Khazanah Nasional Berhad, the investment arm of the Malaysian Government. Existing investors Unilazer, IDG Ventures and Kalaari Capital also participated in the round. The company plans to utilise the funding to expand its product offerings and enhance technology.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Zomato launches digital platform for restaurants
article: Restaurant search app Zomato on Monday launched a platform for restaurants to boost their digital presence by running their business on the internet. The platform, called Whitelabel lets restaurants launch custom-branded native mobile apps to connect with customers. The platform is a plug-and-play platform, which offers targeted push notifications, menu management, and real time information.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Uber China raises $1.2bn; Didi Kuaidi gets $3bn
article: Taxi-hailing service Uber's Chinese arm reportedly raised $1.2 billion (about Rs 8,000 crore) as a part of ongoing fundraising, backed by China's largest search engine company, Baidu. Meanwhile, Didi Kuaidi, Uber’s biggest competitor in China, also reportedly closed $3 billion of financing (about Rs 20,000 crore) from Baidu's rivals Alibaba Group, Tencent Holdings Ltd among other investors.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Flipkart may exit e-books business
article: India’s largest e-tailer Flipkart is likely to exit the e-books business amid Amazon’s aggressive push for selling e-books in India. According to a statement from the company on Tuesday, it is evaluating its e-books strategy and working towards redefining its digital offerings to customers. Flipkart's tie up with self-publishing platform Smashwords also ended last month.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: AWS acquires video reformatter startup
article: Amazon Web Services has acquired Elemental Technologies, a video reformatter services startup, in a reported $500 million, all-cash deal. Elemental converts videos to become web and mobile-friendly and enables multi-screen content delivery. “This will allow us to provide media companies with a family of on-premise, hybrid, and cloud-based solutions for internet-based video delivery,” AWS said.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: E-comm firms must file transaction details: Govt
article: After identifying cases of tax evasion, the Delhi Government on Saturday made it mandatory for all e-commerce companies to file their transaction details on the website of the Department of Trade And Taxes while paying tax. Non-compliance of the notification will attract a penalty of Rs 50,000, under section 86(14) of Delhi Value Added Tax Act, 2004.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Quintillion Media invests in YouthKiAwaaz
article: Quintillion Media, founded by Raghav Bahl and Ritu Kapur, has invested Rs 4 crore in YouthKiAwaaz, an online platform for news and opinion. YouthKiAwaaz claims to be a fully crowdsourced media platform with a claimed monthly readership of over a million. Quintillion Media was founded in late 2014 and this is its third investment.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Flipkart in talks to buy stake in MapmyIndia
article: E-commerce major Flipkart is in talks to acquire a majority stake in digital mapping company, MapmyIndia for around $60 million. The acquisition can help Flipkart strengthen its logistics and customer analytics. “The deal would allow all investors in MapmyIndia to get an exit. The promoters could, however, retain some stake in the firm,” a person familiar to the development said.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: "We will build micro apps for Hike," says CEO
article: The Economic Times on Tuesday did a detailed interview titled “We will build micro apps for Hike” with Kavin Bharti Mittal, Founder and CEO of Hike. It talks about how the company is betting big on building micro-apps like coupons, calling, news among others. Mittal also shares the revenue model for Hike and plans for the next round of funding.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in food startup Holachef
article: Mumbai-based online marketplace for chefs, Holachef has received an undisclosed amount of investment from Ratan Tata. Launched in September 2014 by Saurabh Saxena and Anil Gelra, the startup allows users to order multi-cuisine food made by expert chefs. A user can pre-book meals and get them delivered at a preferred time slot through Holachef.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: HC allows Ola to run only CNG cabs in Delhi
article: The Delhi High Court on Thursday announced that taxi company Ola can run cabs only with CNG in the capital city. India's former Union Minister and senior advocate P Chidambaram, who appeared for ANI Technologies, the company that owns Ola, said that it will phase out all diesel taxis within two weeks. The firm has also tweaked its mobile application.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Baidu, Fosun to invest in Indian startups
article: After giants such as Alibaba and SoftBank, China’s search engine Baidu and one of the country’s biggest private conglomerates Fosun are looking to invest in Indian startups. The officials are in conversation with VCs and startups for potential deals. “Unlike Alibaba, which primarily looked at e-commerce, Baidu and Fosun are not averse to looking beyond consumer internet,” sources said TOI.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: AP govt plans to set up five startup incubators
article: The Andhra Pradesh government has announced its plans to create five incubators with Rs 750 crore investment over the next four years. Each incubator is being planned with a cost of Rs 150 crore and would be executed for a period of 15 years. It will involve a Public-Private Partnership model with infrastructure creation, incubator and seed funding of startups.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Kalaari Capital raises $290 mn India fund
article: Bangalore-based VC firm Kalaari Capital has announced a new $290 million (around Rs 2,000 crore) India fund for early-stage startups. According to Vani Kola, Founder of Kalaari, the VC firm plans to use the current fund in 3-4 years by investing $2-5 million each across 30 startups. It will also participate in new rounds of fundraising by portfolio companies.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ratan Tata joins IDG Ventures as Senior Advisor
article: After Kalaari Capital and Jungle Ventures, Tata Sons’ Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata has joined the advisory board of VC firm IDG Ventures India as a Senior Advisor. He will advise the portfolio companies on business growth, global expansion, team building and leadership. Tata will also be a special invitee, on selective basis, in portfolio company board meetings on strategic matters.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: MockBank raises $400k led by Blume Ventures
article: MockBank, an online test preparation website for government exams, has raised $400,000 in a seed funding round led by Blume Ventures. Singapore-based angel fund Mercatus Capital, Slideshare co-founder Amit Ranjan and Bain & Company India chairman Srivatsan Rajan also participated in this round. The company is targeting a revenue of Rs 5 crore by December 2016.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Zomato raises $60 million in funding
article: Restaurant search app Zomato, which launched a new platform for restaurants on Monday, raised $60 million in funding from Singapore-based Temasek Capital and existing investor Vy Capital. The funding will be used to invest in Zomato's new businesses such as online ordering and table reservations. Zomato is currently present in 22 countries and employs about 3000 people globally.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Sequoia planning to raise $800 mn India fund
article: Sequoia Capital, one of the largest VC firms, is reportedly planning to raise about $800 million for a new India focused fund. The process is expected to begin in 6-12 months and is likely to be closed soon. Sequoia has participated or led at least 80 deals worth over $1.7 billion since 2014, as per data from VCCEdge.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Home decor startup Livspace acquires YoFloor
article: Bangalore-based home design and decor startup Livspace has acquired YoFloor, a mobile platform that provides virtual trial room for home design decisions, at an undisclosed sum. This is the third acquisition by Livspace following design marketplaces DezignUp and Dwll.in. As part of the deal, the founders and core team of YoFloor will join Livspace.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: OnlineTyari raises $5 mn in funding
article: Test preparation platform, OnlineTyari has raised $5 million from investors including Tandem Capital, 500 Startups, Vikram Chachra of Eight Capital, Aloke Bajpai of IxIgo and Mohandas Pai. Founded in 2014, the startup helps in preparing for different competitive exams. It is currently available in Hindi and English however the company plans to make the platform available in other languages soon.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Vistaar Finance raises Rs 250 crore in funding
article: Bengaluru-based Vistaar Finance, an MSME-focused financing firm, has raised Rs 250 crore in funding from existing investors. WestBridge Capital led the round while Omidyar Network and Elevar Equity also participated, making the total funds raised till date to Rs 475 crore. The company will use the investment to increase its portfolio to Rs 2,500 crore in the next three years.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Industrybuying raises $9 mn led by Kalaari, SAIF
article: Industrybuying.com, an online store for industrial supplies, has raised $9 million in Series B round of funding led by Kalaari Capital and existing investor SAIF Partners. Singapore-based Beenext investment fund recently launched by Teruhide Sato also participated in the round. The startup plans to establish more fulfilment centres for processing orders for its vendors with the funding.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ola to launch shuttle service in B'lore, Gurgaon
article: Taxi-hailing app Ola is introducing a new shuttle service with rides costing under $1 (Rs 66). The service will be launched on 21 September, and will initially cover Bangalore and Gurgaon with 500 shuttles in 100 routes. The shuttles will have WiFi access, air conditioning and in-vehicle entertainment. Users can track shuttles, book the seats and pay through the app.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Snapdeal acquires US-based Reduce Data
article: Online marketplace Snapdeal acquired US-based advertising platform Reduce Data on Wednesday for an undisclosed amount. The 15-member team of Reduce Data will join Snapdeal after the acquisition. Founded in 2012 by Asif Ali, Reduce Data helps advertisers deliver advertising strategies for consumers across devices by leveraging artificial intelligence and real-time data, among others.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Commerce ministry to run PM's 'startup mission'
article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 'startup mission' will be run by the commerce ministry's Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion (DIPP) and not the ministry of skill development and entrepreneurship. According to government officials, DIPP was chosen as it could help manufacturing-focused startups by tying-up with 'Make in India'. Modi announced 'Start-up India, Stand up India' on August 15.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Apus to invest Rs 100 cr in Indian startups
article: Chinese app development firm, Apus Group is planning to invest Rs 100 crore in Indian startups in the mobility domain over the next three years. The startups will also get technical support to grow in the market. It will also set up a research and development wing, a technical support centre and an operations team in India.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Online food startup EazyDiner raises $3m funding
article: Delhi-based restaurant reservation platform EazyDiner raised $3 million funding from Saama Capital and existing investor DSG Consumer Partners. The funds raised will be used for geographical expansion to 12 cities by the end of 2016 as well as for technology upgradation. The startup is launching operations in Mumbai this week, followed by Bengaluru and Pune later in the year.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: 'ixigo' acquires cabs aggregator service Rutogo
article: Travel search firm ixigo has acquired Square Hoot Hikes, the parent company of intercity cabs aggregator, Rutogo for an undisclosed sum. As per the deal, Rutogo's team will join ixigo to strengthen the app. The company will be launching outstation taxis in the coming weeks, and will also be opening up the cabs marketplace besides partnering with other booking apps.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Capillary raises $45 mn led by Warburg Pincus
article: Bangalore-based Capillary Technologies, a SaaS-based CRM solutions provider has raised $45 million led by New York-based private equity firm Warburg Pincus. The company has already used the funding to acquire digital commerce solution firm MartJack and machine learning startup Ruaha Labs. It has also picked up a minority stake in customer satisfaction management firm, CloudCherry.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: App offers medical help for pets at doorstep
article: New York-based Elijah Kliger has launched a startup called InstaVet through which users can schedule a house call from a licensed veterinarian. The company also offers a Pet 911 service, with veterinary technicians reportedly available to transport pets to an animal medical centre. InstaVet charges $199 for an appointment. There are currently 10 active veterinarians on the service.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: BookMeIn raises Rs 2.5 crore in angel round
article: BookMeIn, an online marketplace for booking hyperlocal services, has raised Rs 2.5 crore in angel funding from Ajmera Group of Companies. Launched in 2014, the Mumbai-based startup plans to add 15 to 20 new categories in the next one month, including fitness and wellness. With the latest round of funding, the company will ramp up customer acquisition and technology.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Live-streaming game app reportedly raises $10 mn
article: Mobcrush, a mobile-first version of live-streaming game services, has reportedly raised $10 million in funding. Kleiner Perkins, a venture capital firm in Silicon Valley, led the round. Competing with Amazon’s Twitch, the application had raised $4.9 million in May this year after which it came out of beta. However, the company said, “Mobcrush does not comment on speculations about financing.”

author: Shipra Sharma
abstract: Meru Cabs launches carpool service
article: Taxi service provider Meru on Tuesday introduced a first-of-its-kind car pooling service which allows personal car-sharing option for people travelling in the same area. Called 'CarPool', the service has been included in the Meru Cabs mobile app and will be available across the country. "This is a pure customer to customer service", Siddhartha Pahwa, the company's chief executive, said.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: New app launched to vent out office frustration
article: Employees can now upload all the pent up frustrations from the workplace anonymously through a new smartphone app called Memo. Users are verified through LinkedIn or a corporate email address and data is immediately deleted after identifying about a person. The app permits users to post memos, comment on existing memos and links to websites.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Citigroup launches accelerator program in APAC
article: Banking giant Citigroup is launching a 8-10 week corporate accelerator program for the Asia-Pacific region to engage with startups. Known as the Citi Mobile Challenge, the program will combine a virtual hackathon with an incubator and the US-based bank is inviting developers from all across the region to participate in it.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Uber cab drivers protest in Hyderabad
article: More than 500 Uber drivers held protest in Hyderabad accusing the company of not fulfilling promises related to incentives. Telangana Cabs and Bus Operators Association President Syed Nizamuddin alleged Uber of luring drivers with a monthly income of about Rs 70,000 but they couldn’t earn more than Rs 15,000 due to decreasing incentives and number of trips.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Zomato buys minority stakes in Grab and Pickingo
article: Restaurant search and review platform Zomato has made strategic investments in hyperlocal delivery firms Pickingo and Grab to strengthen the food-ordering business. The company will be partnering with Pickingo and Grab to initially deliver food from different restaurants. Zomato is also launching online ordering service in Dubai, Australia and South Africa later this month.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: SVG acquires Komli Media’s India business
article: Gurgaon-based digital media network company SVG Media has bought ad-tech firm Komli Media’s India business. Following the deal, Komli will continue to operate as an independent unit along with SVG Media’s other units—Tyroo Technologies, DGM and SeventyNine. As per the acquisition, about 100 employees of Komli Media will join the SVG team.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ibibo Group acquires minority stake in Djubo
article: Online travel company Ibibo Group has picked up a minority stake in cloud-based hotel services startup Djubo for an undisclosed sum. Ashish Kashyap, CEO of Ibibo Group, will join Djubo’s board as a member. Djubo claims to be live with over 100 listed hotels, and this investment would enable it to upscale in the next 12 months, the company said.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: App to track your child's school bus launched
article: Pune Regional Transport Office has developed a ‘School Bus Safety Pune’ app which can help parents track the details of their child’s school bus, driver and attendant as well as the school committee, formed under the school's transport policy. It also includes contact numbers of the drivers, registration number of the vehicle and details of every member of the committee.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Qyk raises $1m in pre-series A funding
article: Qyk, a hyper-local professional services startup, has raised $1 million in pre-series A funding led by Growx ventures, along with existing investors Tracxn Labs, Powai Lake Ventures, and Sahil Barua (Co-founder, Delhivery). Launched in March 2015, the app uses algorithms to match demand and supply based on parameters like specific requirements, location, availability, budget, etc.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Uber China closes $1bn in funding: Report
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber’s China arm has reportedly closed $1 billion in a fundraising round after its arch rival Didi Kuaidi raised $2 billion in July. Investors include Internet giant Baidu, China CITIC Bank and China Life Insurance, among others. This round values Uber China at $7 billion, with the company planning to list on the mainland by 2020.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Dineout acquires Bangalore-based inResto
article: Online restaurant reservation platform Dineout has acquired Bangalore-based inResto, a plug and play restaurant management suite, for an undisclosed sum. The entire seven member team of inResto will be joining Dineout's team in Bangalore as per the deal. The acquisition will ensure that restaurants get one dashboard to manage different functions, the company said.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Japan’s electric vehicle startup GLM gets $14m
article: Kyoto-based electric vehicle startup GLM has raised $14 million in series B from undisclosed foreign funds, financial institutions and overseas firms to launch its two-seater across different markets. The electric coupe, known as the Tommykaira ZZ EV, is made in collaboration with the Japanese race car manufacturer, Tommykiara. The car reportedly takes 3.9 seconds to go from 0 to 100km/h.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Pune-based Coditas acquires SudoSaints
article: Software development and user experience consultancy Coditas has acquired SudoSaints, an android development and design firm for an undisclosed sum. According to the deal, the entire team of SudoSaints will join Coditas. Launched in November 2014, Coditas offers services pertaining to the entire software development life cycle, engaging clients from conceptualization to deployment and support.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ola drivers to get Rs1L benefits to move to CNG
article: Taxi-hailing company Ola announced on Wednesday that it will offer benefits worth up to Rs 1 lakh to enable drivers to move to CNG. This step will help the firm comply with a Supreme Court ruling which states that commercial vehicles cannot operate in the capital city unless converted to the single fuel mode of CNG.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Being a founder is a lonely task: Freshdesk CEO
article: Economic Times on Thursday did a detailed interview with Girish Mathrubootham, Co-founder of Freshdesk, a cloud-based helpdesk software firm, founded in October 2010. In the story titled “Being a founder is a very lonely task”, Mathrubootham talks about the stressful situations in a founder’s life, the role of family and how a VC funded company is like a rocket ship.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in Infinite Analytics
article: Infinite Analytics, a data analytics firm, has raised an undisclosed amount in bridge round of funding from Ratan Tata. Existing investor Nikhil Vora of Sixth Sense Ventures and new investors from Silicon Valley and India also participated in this round. This funding will be used to extend the predictive analytics technology to verticals beyond retail and e-commerce.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Google chairman Eric Schmidt invests in skyTran
article: Google Chairman Eric Schmidt has invested in skyTran, a NASA Space Act company co-founded by Indian engineer Ankur Bhatnagar. The company has developed an elevated Personal Rapid Transportation (PRT) system and expects it to be operational in India in the next two years. Bhatnagar said that users can travel from Gurgaon to Noida in less than 25 minutes with skyTran.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Ola begins online payment for merchants
article: Taxi hailing app Ola said on Monday that it will allow customers to use the balance of their mobile wallet 'Ola Money’, to make online payments across merchants like Oyo Rooms and select other partners. Ola Money users will also benefit from promotions in the form of cashbacks and discounts from merchants in the initial phase of the rollout.

author: Sai Santosh
abstract: Coursera raises funding of $49.5 million
article: Investors Kleiner Perkins Caufield and Byers, International Finance Corp and Times Internet Ltd, led by New Enterprise Associates, have invested $49.5 million in the open online education provider Coursera Inc. The funds will be used to source new content, expand global reach and improve the learning experience while Times Internet will provide support to “build awareness of Coursera in India”.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Reverie raises $4mn from Aspada and Qualcomm
article: Reverie Technologies, a Bangalore-based startup that creates local language solutions, has raised $4 million in Series A funding led by Aspada Investment Advisors. Existing investor Qualcomm Ventures also participated in this round. The company plans to engage with over 10,000 developers within the next 12 to 18 months to produce native language content.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: DropKaffe raises $300k in seed funding
article: Bangalore-based hyperlocal startup DropKaffe has raised $300,000 in seed funding led by angel investor Manish Singhal and Silicon Valley-based fund P39 Capital. Angel investors from US, India and Singapore also participated in this round. The funding will be used to hire more talent and expand across Bangalore. It plans to have 10 DropKaffe fulfilment centres by the end of October.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: 'Speed Hiring' gaining popularity with startups
article: 'Speed hiring', a hiring practise where suitable candidates are filtered out in 12 minutes is gaining popularity with companies such as Snapdeal, Ola, Quikr, Foodpanda. Offer letters are given to suitable candidates after they are tested for their cognitive abilities in under 12 minutes. The Cognitive Ability Speed Test developed by CoCubes Technologies carries 50 objective type questions.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Hyderabad to have India’s largest tech incubator
article: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus, Ratan Tata, will inaugurate the country’s largest technology incubator center ‘T-Hub’ in Hyderabad on September 7th 2015. The first phase of T-hub, spread over 60,000 square feet, can accommodate 800 start-ups. The second phase, with a built-up space of 300,000 sq ft, is expected to be ready by 2018 and will host 5,000 start-ups.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Timesaverz raises Rs 15 crore Series A funding
article: On-demand home services startup Timesaverz has raised Series A funding of Rs 15 crore from Ronnie Screwvala's Unilazer Ventures. Timesaverz, which helps users hire locally-verified and curated service providers through its platform, was founded two years back by Debadutta Upadhyaya and Lovnish Bhatia. The company currently operates in Mumbai, Delhi-NCR, Bangalore, Hyderabad and Pune.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Shadowfax raises USD 300K from Snapdeal founders
article:
Gurgaon-based on-demand delivery startup Shadowfax has secured angel funding of USD 300K from Snapdeal co-founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal, Zishaan Hayath of Powai Lake Ventures and Limeroad’s Prashant Malik.

The company plans to utilise the funding to strengthen the present team and expand into 10 more cities within the next one year.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Roposo raises $15 mn from Tiger Global
article: Fashion discovery startup Roposo has raised a Series B round of $15 million from existing investor Tiger Global just a few months after securing $5 million in series A from the New York-based investor. This round takes the total amount of funding to $21 million, including a seed round of $1 million from investors Binny Bansal and India Quotient.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: VR headset maker secures $24 million in funding
article: Avegant, a manufacturer of VR wearables, has secured $24 million in Series B round of funding. Chinese mobile Internet company Hangzhou Liaison Interactive Information Technology led the investment, showing faith in virtual reality consumer electronics. Avegant manufactures a media headset that supports 3D and virtual reality content, Glyph, and plans to begin shipping them by the end of 2015.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Messaging app Kik raises $50mn, valued at $1bn
article: Canadian messaging app Kik announced on Wednesday that it has raised $50M worth of funding from one of its partners, China’s Tencent (the biggest internet company in China and owner of the popular app WeChat). This funding puts Kik’s total funding at $120.5M and the deal reportedly brings the company valuation into unicorn territory (the $1 billion mark).

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Tata Opportunities Fund invests in Uber
article: San Francisco-based Uber Technologies announced on Wednesday that it has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Tata Opportunities Fund (TOF), the private equity fund advised by Tata Capital. This marks the company's first investment outside India however it will not be taking a board seat in the taxi-hailing app.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Freshdesk acquires video chat provider 1CLICK.io
article: Enterprise software startup Freshdesk has acquired live video chat and co-browsing platform 1CLICK.io for an undisclosed sum. This is the first acquisition for the Chennai-based company which will now be able to provide video chat-based customer support to its clients. Freshdesk has also launched Mobihelp, an in-app support for mobile apps.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Indian Angel Network invests $600k in Flatpebble
article: Indian Angel Network (IAN) on Thursday said it has invested $600,000 in Hyderabad-based Flatpebble.com, an online marketplace that helps people hire photographers, stylists and other service providers to meet the needs for an event or occasion. Sanjay Jesrani and Subram Kapoor have led this round on behalf of IAN and will join the board of the company.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Google invests $100 million into Carbon3D
article: Google Ventures has made an investment of $100 million into the 3D printing technology startup Carbon3D. Joining Google Ventures in the new funding round are Russian entrepreneur and venture capitalist Yuri Milner along with Reinet Investments S.C.A, F.I.S. With the new funding round, the company’s total funding now stands at $141 million in total funding.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Used luxury wear site Envoged gets seed funding
article: Online portal for used luxury wear Envoged.com has raised an undisclosed amount in seed funding from Nijhawan Group’s Ankush Nijhawan, Mediology Software director Manish Dhingra and AMG Investment’s Gaurav Bhatnagar. Former Canaan Partners’ MD Alok Mittal, Anant Goenka of Indian Express, Bollywood actor Jackky Bhagnani and Aspiring Minds CEO Himanshu Aggarwal also participated in the round.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: RedMart raises $26.7 mn for regional expansion
article: RedMart, a Singapore-based online grocery marketplace has raised $26.7 million in preparation for an upcoming Series C round which will be used to expand the company across Southeast Asia. Existing investors Garena, SoftBank Ventures Korea, Visionnaire Ventures, and Facebook co­-founder Eduardo Saverin also participated in this round.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: BuzzFeed gets $200 mn from NBCUniversal
article: Comcast Corp’s NBCUniversal announced on Tuesday that it has invested US$200 million in online publisher BuzzFeed. As part of the investment, the companies would also explore strategic partnerships in the coming months. According to Re/code, BuzzFeed’s valuation has reached $1.5 billion after the latest round of funding.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: IIFL to set up Rs 1k cr fund for startups
article: With the rapid rise of startup activity in India, financial services firm IIFL is raising a fund of Rs 1,000 crore to be invested in startups and VC funds. It also plans to set up an incubation centre and will invest Rs 25-50 crore in the fund which expects to make the first close by September.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Snapdeal raises USD500 mn, valued at $5bn
article: After much speculation, Snapdeal on Tuesday confirmed $500 million funding from investors including Alibaba, Foxconn and SoftBank, valuing the firm at $5 billion. Existing investors Temasek, BlackRock, Myriad and Premji Invest also participated in the round. The investment will help the company increase the number of merchants on its site to 1 million, from around 1.5 lakh today.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: PE, VCs get exits worth $6 bn between Jan-July
article: In a first, the private equity and VCs have managed to exit investments worth $6 billion in the first seven months of the year, a Venture Intelligence report said. Companies in the IT & ITES, BFSI, telecom, media and entertainment industries have led the list of exits in 2015 returning $2.4 billion, $1 billion, $770 million and $280 million respectively.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Cricketer Umesh Yadav invests in Fashionove
article: Following the trend of sportspersons turning investors, Indian cricketer Umesh Yadav who also plays for Kolkata Knight Riders in the Indian Premier League has invested an undisclosed sum in Kolkata-based hyperlocal fashion portal Fashionove. The startup which provides a platform for local boutiques to register and transact products will use the funds for data collection and streamlining its app.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Housing.com acquires HomeBuy360 for $2mn
article: Online portal Housing.com has acquired HomeBuy360, a cloud-based sales lifecycle management platform that connects developers, agents and buyers, for $2 million. This is the second acquisition made by the company in 2015, after it bought Indian Real Estate Forum (IREF). With this acquisition, Housing.com is now the only online real estate listing platform to own a developer CRM company.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: FM launches India Aspiration Fund for startups
article: Giving a boost to the startup ecosystem in the country, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley on Tuesday launched the India Aspiration Fund (IAF) to be set up as a fund of funds under the Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI). An initial corpus of Rs 400 crore has been already allocated to various venture funds under the program.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Nikesh Arora to buy Softbank shares worth $483mn
article: Japan’s SoftBank announced on Wednesday that President Nikesh Arora is buying $483 million (60 billion yen) worth of the company’s shares in the open market over the next six months. This purchase would be in a personal capacity and board members are fully supportive of the decision, SoftBank said in a statement.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Visual blogging platform Bluegape raises Rs 4cr
article: Gurgaon-based visual blogging platform Bluegape has raised Rs 4 crore from ah! Ventures, Rudy Gopalakrishnan of Fidelity, and Times Internet. The deal was closed on ah! Ventures' equity investment platform, CLUB ah.com. The company, which pivoted from a merchandise business to a visual blogging platform, will use the funding to expand its engineering team.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Uber expects IPO in 18-24 months
article: As per a recent presentation for potential investors seen by Reuters, ride-hailing service provider Uber forecasts an IPO within 18 to 24 months. Its global bookings are projected to rise nearly threefold to $10.84 billion this year and reach $26.12 billion the next. Based on the figures, revenues for 2015 would be roughly around $2 billion.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Skin cancer checker app receives $3.4m funding
article: Digital health startup SkinVision has received what it calls a late Series A/early Series B funding of $3.4 million led by European pharmaceutical firm LEO Pharma, that strongly focuses on dermatology. SkinVision uses smartphone tech and vision algorithms to allow consumers to track changes to the moles in their skin. This is aimed at identifying cancer growths such as melanoma.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Ratan Tata invests in YourStory.com
article: After 7 years of bootstrapping, startup media portal YourStory.com has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Tata Group Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata. The round also saw participation from Vani Kola (Kalaari Capital), Karthee Madasamy (Qualcomm Ventures) and T V Mohandas Pai, the company's Founder and Chief Editor Shradha Sharma announced on Monday.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: eBay sells partial stake in Snapdeal
article: American multinational corporation eBay, which is an early investor in Snapdeal, is selling a portion of its investment in the Indian e-commerce player. “This sale will enable us to earn a strong return on our invested capital and strategically redeploy it into other areas of our business,” the company said in a blogpost.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: IntelligenceNODE raises Rs 26 crore in funding
article: IntelligenceNODE, a Mumbai-based big data analytics startup, has secured Rs 26 crore in Series A funding led by New Enterprise Associates (NEA) and Orios Venture Partners. The company had raised Rs two crore in 2014 and plans to secure $15-20 million in a Series B round in the next three to four months.

author: Shruti Nagpal
abstract: Kerala to get billion-dollar startup campus
article: Kerala Chief Minister Oommen Chandy on Thursday announced that the state government was working on a master plan to create a billion dollar campus for startups. The announcement was made as Chandy inaugurated the distribution of Startup boxes to 50 young mobile application developers as part of the youth Entrepreneurs Scheme (YES) 2015, led by the Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM).

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: E-startups builder to raise $1.11 bn growth fund
article: Rocket Internet, the Germany-based but globally active internet startups builder, is reportedly raising €1 billion ($1.11 bn) to establish a growth fund for late-stage investments. According to a German business publication, co-founder Oliver Samwer, who recently made it to the top on Wired’s list of most influential people in the European tech industry, will be the fund’s sole general partner.

author: Shruti Nagpal
abstract: Tinder re-appoints Sean Rad as CEO
article: Online dating application Tinder on Wednesday night announced reappointing founder Sean Rad as the Chief Executive Officer of the company. Rad was replaced by eBay’s Chris Payne in March. The company further announced that it was appointing Greg Blatt as the Executive Chairman of Tinder. Blatt also serves as the Chairman of The Match Group.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Jessica Alba's startup gets $100 mn in funding
article: Hollywood actress Jessica Alba’s non-toxic household products startup, The Honest Company, received $100 million in series D funding on Friday. This values the company at upwards of $1.7 billion, and puts Alba among the 40 richest self-made women of America. She owns a 20% stake in the company, which started out with selling diapers and baby wipes online.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Online grocery etailer BigBasket raises $50 mn
article: Online food and grocery etailer, BigBasket, has reportedly raised $50 Mn (about INR 315 Cr) in its new round of funding led by its existing investor, Bessemer Venture Partners. With the new fundraise, the startup is valued at about $400 mn. BigBasket plans to use the funds to expand into 50 more Tier-II cities.

author: Trivedi Bhutnath
abstract: Alibaba to invest $200 mn in Snapchat: report
article: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd is all set to invest $200 million in photo-messaging app Snapchat, a media report said. After the investment, the four-year-old company will be valued at around $15 billion, according to Bloomberg. In 2013, Facebook had offered to buy the Los Angeles-based company for $3 billion.

author: Manish Kumar
abstract: Lightspeed raises $135M to fund Indian startups
article: Venture capital firm Lightspeed Venture Partners has secured an investment of $135 million for a fund dedicated to India, as per a report. Lightspeed will use the amount to fund about 20 to 25 early-stage startups. The company has already invested in several Indian startups, including Limeroad, Itzcash and OneAssist.

author: Chhavi Tyagi
abstract: Start-up India, Stand-up India: PM Modi
article: Addressing the nation on the 69th Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi on Saturday stressed the importance of encouraging the culture of entrepreneurship in the country. Chanting the slogan 'Start-up India, Stand-up India,' Modi said, "We have to give the youth opportunities to grow and be entrepreneurs." He added that loans would also be given to help people in their startups.

author: Trivedi Bhutnath
abstract: News in Shorts raises $20M from Tiger Global
article: Mobile news app News in Shorts, which started in Sept 2013, has raised $20 million from its existing investor Tiger Global in its Series B round of funding, the company announced on Wednesday. The other investors of the company include angels Ankush Nijhawan, Gaurav Bhatnagar, Manish Dhingra, Flipkart founders Sachin and Binny Bansal and Rebright Partners of Japan.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: VR startup enables virtual tour of outer space
article: A startup called SpaceVR has built its own virtual reality camera in an attempt to bring outer space to the masses. The camera, once on the International Space Station, can shoot a 4K video, stitch the footage together into a VR video sphere, and beam it back to Earth. This would mean 624 GB of data for every two-hour recording.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Robotics firm receives $30 mn in investment
article: New York-based investor Tiger Global has led a $30 million investment in GreyOrange, an Indian company that automates e-commerce processes through robotics. The Series B round for the company included participation from existing investor Blume Ventures. It uses robots to speed up order processing in warehouses. Tiger Global’s recent Indian investments include Saavn, Ola, and Limeroad.
